analyzed: p

translated: By Pandita Durvekamishra
The Eye on the Drop Commentary on the Drop of Reasons.

analyzed: namaḥ buddhāya
translated: B. To the Buddha.

analyzed: prahīṇa āvṛti saṃghātam praṇipatya tathāgatam
translated: Having bowed to the Tathāgata, who has destroyed the mass of obstructions,

analyzed: vivṛṇomi yathāśakti bhaṭṭa arcaṭa guroḥ giraḥ
translated: I will explain, to the best of my ability, the words of the teacher Bhaṭṭārcata.

original: abhimānadhanā ye ca ye ca buddhidhanā janāḥ /
analyzed: abhimāna dhanāḥ ye ca ye ca buddhi dhanāḥ janāḥ
translated: And for those who are rich in pride and those who are rich in intelligence,

original: na tadartham ayaṃ yatnas tasmān naiva nirarthakaḥ //
analyzed: na tad artham ayam yatnaḥ tasmāt nā eva nirarthakaḥ
translated: this effort is not for their sake, therefore it is not pointless.

original: sveṣṭadevatānamaskriyā hi puṇyaprasavabhūmir itaś cāntarāyarahitā īpsitaparisamāptir
analyzed: sva iṣṭadevatā namaskriyā hi puṇya prasava bhūmiḥ itas ca antarāya rahitā īpsita parisamāptiḥ
translated: Indeed, the salutation to one's own chosen deity is the ground for the production of merit, and from here, free from obstacles, the desired completion will be accomplished.

original: bhavatīty āgamād veditā śiṣṭācārānurakṣaṇadharmā dharmākaradatto hetubindutīkāṃ
analyzed: bhavati iti āgamāt veditā śiṣṭa ācāra anurakṣaṇa dharmā ca ayam dharmākaradattaḥ hetu bindu tīkām
translated: Knowing this from the scriptures, the virtuous one, who follows the conduct of the virtuous, Dharmakaradatta,

analyzed: cikīrṣuḥ āditas eva sva adhidaivatam stuti puraḥsaram namasyati
translated: desiring to compose the commentary on the Drop of Reasons, at the very beginning, salutes his own chosen deity, preceded by praise.

analyzed: namaskāra śloka karaṇe ca ākṣepa parihāra audharma uttara pradīpa ādita nīti diśā anugantavyau
translated: And in the composition of the salutation verse, the objection and reply should be understood according to the method of the Dharmotottara-pradīpa.

original: āśayaprayogabhedena hetvavasthām ubhayīṃ svārthaparārthaprakarṣabhedena phalāvasthāṃ dvayīṃ darśayiṣyate /
analyzed: āśaya prayoga bhedena hetu avasthām ubhayīm svārtha parārtha prakarṣa bhedena phala avasthām dvayīm darśayiṣyate
translated: He will show the two states of cause, the two states of effect, which are the states of one's own benefit and others' benefit, respectively, by the distinction of intention and application.

analyzed: asya hetu phala avasthā upadarśanam muni indrasya namasyā abhimatā
translated: This is the desired salutation of this lord of sages.

original: bodhisattvāvasthāyāṃ hi bhagavān anekajanmābhyāsayogāt kalyāṇamitrasaṃparkāc ca prathamam āśayaviśeṣasampadam udapīpadat /
analyzed: bodhisattva avasthāyām hi bhagavān aneka janma abhyāsa yogāt kalyāṇa mitra saṃparkāt ca prathamam āśaya viśeṣa sampadam udapīpadat
translated: For, in the state of a bodhisattva, the Blessed One first generated the special intention through the yoga of practice in many lives and through contact with spiritual friends.

analyzed: yām iha praṇidhi bodhi cittam ātiṣṭhante tattva vidaḥ
translated: Those who know reality take up the vow and the thought of awakening here.

original: tasya parastād āśaṃsitārthasaṃpādanāya prayogaviśeṣam aśeṣam akārṣīt /
analyzed: tasya parastāt āśaṃsita artha saṃpādanāya prayoga viśeṣam aśeṣam akārṣīt
translated: After that, he made all the special practices without exception in order to accomplish the intended goal.

original: yaṃ ācakṣate /🔽tasyopariṣṭāt prayogaviśeṣaprakarṣaprāpteḥ paramapuruṣārthaphalaṃ sakalam alabdha /
analyzed: yam ācakṣate  tasya upariṣṭāt prayoga viśeṣa prakarṣa prāpteḥ parama puruṣa artha phalam sakalam alabdha
translated: That is what they call.🔽After that, he attained the highest human goal through the perfection of special practice.

analyzed: atha atas sattva upakāram vividham a bādhitam vyadhita
translated: Then, he performed various unobstructed benefits for beings.

original: ata evāyaṃ yaḥ saṃjāte / / tyādinādau kaṇṭhoktām akṛta āśayāvasthām /
analyzed: atas eva ayam yaḥ saṃjāte ityādinā ādau kaṇṭha uktām akṛte āśaya avasthām
translated: Therefore, this one who was born... and so on, first mentions the intention stage that was stated in the throat.

analyzed: tadanu puṇya jñāne tyādinā prayoga avasthām
translated: After that, with merit and knowledge... and so on, he mentions the practice stage.

analyzed: tasya paścāt kṛtsne ityādinā phala avasthām
translated: After that, with all of that... and so on, he mentions the result stage.

original: tadanantaraṃ loka / / ityādinā ca sattvopakārāvasthām iti /
analyzed: tad anantaram lokaḥ ityādinā ca sattva upakāra avasthām iti
translated: After that, with the world... and so on, he mentions the stage of benefiting beings.

original: yatra ca evaṃvidho jinaraviḥ / / taṃ namasyāmi / / namaskāromīti sambandhaḥ /
analyzed: yatra ca evaṃvidhaḥ jina raviḥ tam namasyāmi namaskāromi iti sambandhaḥ
translated: And where there is such a sun of the Victorious Ones, I pay homage to him. The connection is: I pay homage.

original: upakāryopakāriṇoḥ samaṃ pravartamānā nirantaram udīyamānā ca mahattvayuktā mahatī ca sā duḥkhāt duḥkhahetor vā samuddharaṇakāmatā nāma yā karuṇā
analyzed: upakāryā upakāriṇoḥ samam pravartamānā nirantaram udīyamānā ca mahat tva yuktā mahatī ca sā duḥkhāt duḥkha hetoḥ vā samuddharaṇa kāma tā nāma yā karuṇā
translated: That which is called compassion is the desire to deliver from suffering or the cause of suffering, which is equal, continuously occurring, and constantly increasing, and is associated with greatness, and is great.

analyzed: tad ātmikā kṛpā ca iti tathā
translated: And that is of the nature of compassion, thus.

analyzed: saṃjātā mahā kṛpā yasya sa tathā uktaḥ
translated: He who has that is said to be so.

original: kiṃ kartuṃ sa tathāvidha ityākāṃkṣāyām āha trātum / / iti /
analyzed: kim kartum sa tathāvidhaḥ iti ākāṃkṣāyām āha trātum iti
translated: What does he do like that? In anticipation of this question, he says to deliver.

original: p /kiṃ trātum ityapekṣāyāṃ trāṇakriyākarma janam / / āha /
analyzed: trātum iti apekṣāyām trāṇa kriyā karma janam āha
translated: What is to be delivered? In anticipation of this question, he says people, the object of the act of delivering.

original: taṃ viśeṣayann āha samagram / / paripūrṇaṃ sakalam iti yāvat /
analyzed: tam viśeṣayan āha samagram paripūrṇam sakalam iti yāvat
translated: Specifying that, he says completely, that is, fully, entirely.

analyzed: punar api viśinaṣṭi vyasaninam iti
translated: Again, he specifies those who are afflicted.

analyzed: vyasanam duḥkham tadvantam
translated: Affliction is suffering. He has that.

analyzed: nitya yoge ca ayam iniḥ draṣṭvyaḥ
translated: And this suffix should be seen as having the meaning of constant connection.

original: kṛpāśabdapratyāsatteḥ duḥkhāt duḥkhahetor vā trātum ity artho 'vatiṣṭhate /
analyzed: kṛpā śabda pratyāsatteḥ sāmarthyāt duḥkhāt duḥkha hetoḥ vā trātum iti arthaḥ vatiṣṭhate
translated: Due to the proximity of the word compassion, the meaning to deliver from suffering or the cause of suffering remains.

analyzed: avivakṣita āpādanāt vā anapādāna tvam
translated: Or, because of the non-assertion of what is to be excluded, there is no exclusion.

original: duḥkhād duḥkhahetoś ca sarvasattvā mayā mocayitavyā ityāśayasaṃpadyoginy avasthā āśayāvasthety ucyate /
analyzed: duḥkhāt duḥkha hetoḥ ca sarva sattvāḥ mayā mocayitavyāḥ iti āśaya saṃpad yoginī avasthā āśaya avasthā iti ucyate
translated: I must deliver all beings from suffering and the cause of suffering - the union with the perfection of intention is called the stage of intention.

analyzed: hetuḥ nimittam
translated: Cause. Reason.

analyzed: sārvajña padasya iti vakṣyamāṇa svārtha prakarṣa prāpti sāmarthyāt avaseyam
translated: The word of omniscience should be supplied from the meaning to be stated later.

analyzed: citi kriyā abhisambandhāt dvitīyā
translated: The accusative case is used because of the connection with the action of thought.

original: kīdṛśam tadviśeṣṭum uktaṃ puṇyetyādi paścād yojyam /
analyzed: kīdṛśam tat viśeṣṭum uktam puṇya ityādi paścāt yojyam
translated: In order to specify what kind of merit, etc., is meant, the words merit and knowledge and so on are to be supplied later.

analyzed: puṇya jñānam ayam puṇya jñāna svabhāvam
translated: It has merit and knowledge as its nature.

original: anyathā viśinaṣṭi vipulaṃ / / vistīrṇaṃ mahāntaṃ yāvat /🔽puṇyajñānasaṃbhārāv eva hi sārvajñaṃ padam āvahataḥ /
analyzed: anyathā viśinaṣṭi vipulam vistīrṇam mahāntam yāvat  puṇya jñāna saṃbhārau eva hi sārvajñam padam āvahataḥ
translated: It is specified as vast in another way, meaning extensive, great, etc.🔽For the accumulations of merit and knowledge alone bring about the state of omniscience.

analyzed: puṇya jñāna saṃbhāra upārjanam eva sattva uddharaṇāya prayogaḥ
translated: The accumulation of merit and knowledge itself is the practice for the sake of liberating beings.

analyzed: tena tad pada prāptyā eva sattva uddharaṇa saṃbhavāt
translated: Because it is possible to liberate beings by attaining that state.

analyzed: anyathā tad pada abhāvāt
translated: Otherwise, that state would not exist.

analyzed: evaṃvidha prayoga sampad yoginī eva avasthā prayoga avasthā iti ucyate
translated: Thus, this state is called the stage of practice.

original: ayaṃ prayogaḥ prācīnaś cāśayo dvāv etau pāraṃparyeṇa paramapadaprāpteḥ kāraṇam iti tatpadaprāptihetutvamātravivakṣayā /
analyzed: ayam prayogaḥ prācīnaḥ ca āśayaḥ dvau etau pāraṃparyeṇa parama pada prāpteḥ kāraṇam iti tad pada prāpti hetutva mātra vivakṣayā
translated: This practice and the previous intention are, in succession, the cause for attaining the highest state. Therefore, it is said that they are the cause for attaining that state, merely wishing for it.

analyzed: avasthā mātra vivakṣayā ca hetvavasthā bhagavataḥ vyapadiśyate
translated: And the causal state of the Blessed One is indicated merely wishing for the state.

analyzed: bheda vivakṣayā punar āśaya prayoga avasthā iti
translated: But when distinction is intended, it is the state of intention and application.

analyzed: pracitya upacitya rāśīkṛtya iti yāvat
translated: Having accumulated, having heaped up, as far as that.

analyzed: samāśrayaṇa apekṣāyām paurvakālikaḥ pratyayaḥ
translated: When there is dependence on a common basis, a prior condition is [necessary].

analyzed: kim evaṃkāram cakāra iti āha
translated: What is it that he did in this way? He says in its entirety, etc.

analyzed: yad śabdaḥ trā api sambadhyate
translated: The word that is also connected here.

analyzed: uttaratra api abhisambhantsyate
translated: It will also be completed later.

original: kiṃ bhūtaḥ san yas tam āśrita ityāha vidhūte / /ti /
analyzed: kim bhūtaḥ san yaḥ tam āśritaḥ iti āha  /
translated: What kind of being is he who relies on him? He says having shaken off, etc.

original: sarvathā nirastaḥ sādaranirantaracirakālābhyāsāyāso yena sa tathā /
analyzed: sarvathā nirastaḥ sādara nirantara cira kāla abhyāsa āyāsaḥ yena sa tathā
translated: He by whom effort in the form of complete, respectful, uninterrupted, and long-lasting practice is completely removed is so.

original: sadāvyāpanena icchādhīnatvāt yogyatayā vā vyāpanena upayuktakārtsnye🔽kṛtsnaśabdaprayogāt sopāyaheyopādeyātmakakṛtsnajñeyavisarpiṇī cāsāvāvaraṇādilakṣaṇasya
analyzed: mata dvaya āśrayaṇena sadā vyāpanena icchā adhīna tvāt yogyatayā vā vyāpanena upayukta kārtsnye  kṛtsna śabda prayogāt sa upāya heya upādeya ātmaka kṛtsna jñeya visarpiṇī ca asau āvaraṇa ādi lakṣaṇasya
translated: By the constant pervasion, due to being dependent on desire or by pervasion through suitability, the completeness of what is to be used is

analyzed: malasya atiśayena prahāṇāt nirmala prajñā ca iti tathā
translated: implied by the use of the word entire. And it spreads over the entire knowable, which consists of what is to be abandoned and what is to be adopted along with the means. And it is stainless wisdom due to the extremely thorough abandonment of the stain characterized by obscuration, etc.

analyzed: sā eva parārtha udaya sthāna tvāt udayādriḥ iva tathā
translated: It is so, because it is like the rising mountain, being the abode of the arising of the benefit for others.

original: taṃ śritaḥ / / prāptaḥ tadyogī iti yāvat /
analyzed: tam śritaḥ prāptaḥ tad yogī jātaḥ iti yāvat
translated: Relying on him, having attained, being united with him, as far as that.

original: idam eva ca sarvajñasya padaṃ paramapuruṣārthaphalam /
analyzed: idam eva ca sarvajñasya padam parama puruṣa artha phalam
translated: And this alone is the stage of the Omniscient One, which is the fruit of the highest human goal.

analyzed: evaṃlakṣaṇa phala saṃpad yoginī avasthā phala avasthā iti ucyate
translated: Thus, the state endowed with the perfection of such characteristics and fruits is called the fruit state.

original: p /hṛdi bhavaṃ hārdam / / sadasatpathavivekavibandhakatvāt tama iva tamaḥ
analyzed: bhavam hārdam sat asat patha viveka vibandhaka tvāt tamaḥ iva tamaḥ
translated: The heart-born, i.e., born in the heart. Like darkness, it obstructs the discrimination between the good and bad paths.

original: ajñānam kayācid vyapekṣayā tu hṛdo manaso bhedavivakṣāyāṃ tadubhayatvam uktam /
analyzed: ajñānam kayācid vyapekṣayā tu hṛdaḥ manasaḥ bheda vivakṣāyām tad ubhaya tvam uktam
translated: Ignorance is said to be both of those two, i.e., born in the heart and born in the mind, when there is a desire to distinguish between the two.

analyzed: vā
translated: or🔽🔽

original: tadapahanti vidhvaṃsayati dharmadeśanādvāreṇa anyathā ceti tathā /
analyzed: tat apahanti vidhvaṃsayati dharma deśanā dvāreṇa anyathā ca iti tathā
translated: It removes that, i.e., destroys it, through the door of teaching the Dharma, and otherwise as well. Thus.

analyzed: jinaḥ māra jayanāt buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: The Victorious One, the Blessed One, is called the Buddha because he has conquered Mara.

original: kva hārdatamopaha iti apekṣayām āha loke / / iti /
analyzed: kva hārdatama upahaḥ iti apekṣayām āha loke iti
translated: Where does he remove the heart-born darkness? In order to show this, he says: in the world.

original: lokaviṣayaṃ yac caitasaṃ tamas tasya hantā /🔽lokasyaiva tathābhūtatamasopahanteti yāvat lupyakya
analyzed: loka viṣayam yat caitasam tamaḥ tasya hantā  lokasya eva tathābhūta tamasā upahantā iti yāvat
translated: He is the destroyer of that darkness which is mental in the world.🔽The meaning is that he removes the darkness of the world which is of that kind.

analyzed: te iti lokaḥ
translated: The world is that which is to be abandoned.

analyzed: hārdatamaḥ śabda pratyāsatteḥ prāṇī jñātavyaḥ
translated: The heart-born darkness should be understood as belonging to living beings.

analyzed: evaṃkāriṇī eva avasthā sattva upakāra avasthā iti ucyate
translated: A state that acts in this way is called the state of benefiting beings.

analyzed: saḥ eva vyasani jana trāṇa nimitta kṛpā dhāraṇa sādharmyāt
translated: It is so called because it has the same nature as compassion, which is maintained for the sake of protecting those who are afflicted.

analyzed: raveḥ api tad āgame tathā artha upvarṇanāt
translated: Even the sun is described as having that meaning when it rises.

analyzed: tadā tu vyasanam rogaḥ jñātavyam
translated: But at that time, affliction should be understood as disease.

analyzed: udayādri samāśrayaṇa sāmyāt loke tamaḥ upaha tva sādharmyāt ca
translated: Because of its similarity to the sun's reliance on the eastern mountain, and because of its similarity to the sun's removal of darkness in the world.

analyzed: tadā tat tamaḥ ndhakāram draṣṭavyam
translated: Then darkness should be seen.

analyzed: raviḥ iva raviḥ
translated: The sun is like the sun.

analyzed: rūpaka alaṅkāraḥ ca atra kāvya guṇaḥ darśitaḥ
translated: And here the figure of speech form is shown as a poetic quality.

original: mūrdhnā namasyāmi / / iti śiraḥ praṇamayata evaṃvidhaṃ vacanam avaseyam /
analyzed: mūrdhnā namasyāmi iti śiraḥ praṇamayataḥ evaṃvidham vacanam avaseyam
translated: I bow my head - this kind of statement should be understood by bowing the head.

original: tena kāyiko namaskāro darśitaḥ syān nānyathā /
analyzed: tena kāyikaḥ namaskāraḥ darśitaḥ syāt na anyathā
translated: By that, a bodily salutation would be shown, not otherwise.

analyzed: śabda ānupūrvī viśeṣa uccāraṇena tu vācikaḥ darśitaḥ
translated: But by uttering a particular sequence of words, a verbal [salutation] is shown.

original: kāyavyāpāravyāhārayoś ca tadutthāpakamanaḥpūrvakatvāt 'pi iti sarvam avadātam /
analyzed: kāya vyāpāra vyāhārayoḥ ca tad utthāpaka manaḥ pūrvaka tvāt iti sarvam avadātam
translated: And because bodily activity and speech are preceded by the mind that gives rise to them, everything is clear.

original: sopāyasvārthasampadākhyānadvāreṇeyaṃ namaskriyā iti tattvāvyākhyānam udghṛṣṭaṃ nātiśliṣṭañceti nodghaṭitam /
analyzed: sa upāya sva artha sampad ākhyāna dvāreṇa iyam namaskriyā iti tattva a vyākhyānam udghṛṣṭam na atiśliṣṭam ca iti na udghaṭitam
translated: This salutation is through the door of the narration of the wealth of one's own purpose along with the means, thus the commentary on the truth is not rubbed out and is not too closely connected, so it is not unfolded.

analyzed: athavā anyathā vyākhyāyate
translated: Or else, it is explained in another way.

analyzed: parārthaḥ khalu ayam ṭīkā lakṣaṇaḥ granthaḥ bhipretaḥ
translated: This treatise, which has the characteristic of a commentary, is indeed intended for the benefit of others.

analyzed: paraḥ ca viṣaya doṣa āśaṅkāyām śravaṇāya na avadhatte
translated: And others do not pay attention to listen because of doubt about the faults of the subject.

original: tataś cānavadhānaṃ viṣayadoṣāśaṅka b / vyāptaṃ tadviruddhopadarśanena anavadhānaniṣedhārthaṃ vyāpakaviruddhaviṣayaviśuddhim upadidarśayiṣur
analyzed: tatas ca anavadhānam viṣaya doṣa āśaṅka yā vyāptam tad viruddha upadarśanena anavadhāna niṣedha artham vyāpaka viruddha viṣaya viśuddhim upadidarśayiṣuḥ
translated: And then inattention, doubt about the faults of the object, is pervaded by the demonstration of its opposite. In order to negate inattention, wishing to point out the purification of the object which is pervaded by the opposite,

analyzed: āha yaḥ ityādi
translated: he says ya and so on.

analyzed: ṭīkā viṣayoḥ ca ā
translated: And the subject matter of the commentary

analyzed: ca ārya dharmakīrti granthaḥ
translated: is the text of Ārya Dharmakīrti.

analyzed: tad viṣuddhiḥ ca pravacana viśuddhyā
translated: And that purification is by the purification of the scriptures,

analyzed: pravacana artha samarthana para tayā ācārya śāstrasya tad eka viṣaya tvāt
translated: because the treatise of the master has that as its sole subject matter, being devoted to establishing the meaning of the scriptures.

analyzed: tatas ca ācārya śāstra viśuddhi nibandhana pravacana viśuddhim bodhayitum bhagavataḥ namaskāra apadeśena darśayati
translated: And in order to make known the purification of the scriptures based on the purification of the master's treatise, he shows it by the expression of salutation to the Blessed One.

analyzed: upāya upadarśana pūrvaka tathābhūta prajñā udaya adri samāśrayaṇa abhidhānena bhagavataḥ sarva ajñāna vigamaḥ darśitaḥ
translated: By the statement of the arising of such wisdom preceded by the demonstration of the means, the Blessed One's freedom from all ignorance is shown.

original: sarvājñānavaidhuryād astu nirdoṣaḥ /🔽sa tu svārthaprakarṣaprāptaḥ kasmāt parasmai sopāyaheyopādeyatattvam upadiśati yena
analyzed: sarva ajñāna vaidhuryāt astu nirdoṣaḥ  sa tu sva artha prakarṣa prāptaḥ kasmāt parasmai sa upāya heya upādeya tattvam upadiśati yena
translated: Let him be faultless due to the absence of all ignorance.🔽But he, having attained the highest state for himself, why does he teach the truth of what is to be abandoned and what is to be taken up along with the means to others, by which

original: tasya tathābhūtaṃ pravacanaṃ sambhaved ity yaḥ saṃjāte / /tyādinā
analyzed: tasya tathābhūtam pravacanam sambhavet iti yaḥ
translated: his scripture could be of that nature? Thus, he who has generated... and so on.

analyzed: mahā karuṇayā yogam upadarśayati
translated: He shows the union with great compassion.

original: tato mahākaruṇāyāgāt samīcīnam upadiśati prajñāprakarṣayogāc ca bhūtaṃ samādhāsasādha
analyzed: tatas mahā karuṇā yāgāt samīcīnam upadiśati prajñā prakarṣa yogāt ca bhūtam samādhā sasādha
translated: Then, because of the arrival of great compassion, he teaches correctly, and because of the union with the excellence of wisdom, he establishes the truth with its means of accomplishment.

analyzed: nam iti prakāśitam
translated: This is what is revealed.

analyzed: tena anupadeśaḥ nyathā upadeśaḥ ca vyudastaḥ yat āha
translated: Therefore, the teaching of others in a different way is rejected. As it is said:

original: p /dayayā śreya ācaṣṭe jñānād bhūtaṃ sasādhanam PV / iti /
analyzed: śreyaḥ ācaṣṭe jñānāt bhūtam sa sādhanam iti
translated: He teaches the good through compassion, the truth through knowledge, along with its means.

analyzed: tathā
translated: Thus,

analyzed: vaiphalyāt vakti na anṛtam
translated: because of futility, he speaks.

original: iti / ata evāviparītajñeyādyupadeśadvāreṇa hārdatamopahaḥ / / saṃvṛttaḥ ityarthād eva vacanaṃ viśuddhaṃ darśitam /🔽tadviṣayatayā cācāryagranthaviśuddhiḥ /
analyzed: iti atas eva aviparīta jñeya ādi upadeśa dvāreṇa hārdatama upahaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ iti arthāt eva vacanam viśuddham darśitam  tad viṣaya tayā ca ācārya grantha viśuddhiḥ
translated: Therefore, by the door of teaching the non-inverted knowable, etc., the destruction of the heart's darkness is shown. By the meaning itself, the purity of speech is shown.🔽And by the object of that, the purity of the master's text is shown.

original: tadviṣayatayā ca ṭīkāviśuddhiśca sāmarthyād ākhyātā bhavati /
analyzed: tad viṣaya tayā ca ṭīkā viśuddhiḥ ca sāmarthyāt ākhyātā bhavati
translated: And by the object of that, the purity of the commentary is also shown by implication.

analyzed: śeṣam samānam pūrveṇa iti
translated: The rest is the same as before.

analyzed: bhavatu bhagavataḥ nirdoṣa tayā pravacana viśuddhiḥ  tathā api ācāryasya
translated: Let the purity of the teaching be due to the Blessed One's being faultless.🔽But the treatise will not be pure due to the possibility of defects in speech and mind.

original: r vaiguṇyasambhavena tacchāstraṃ na viśotsyati ity āśaṅkyācāryasyāpi jagadatiśāyiprajñāyogapradarśanena vāṅmanasosayo
analyzed: R vaiguṇya sambhavena tat śāstram na viśotsyati iti āśaṅkya ācāryasya api jagat atiśāyi prajñā yoga pradarśanena
translated: Fearing this, by showing the master's union with wisdom surpassing the world, the purity of speech and mind is shown.

analyzed: rvaiguṇya abhāvaḥ darśayiṣyate
translated: The absence of defects in speech and mind will be shown by the statement beginning with in the path of reasoning.

original: vāṅmanasosayo🔽rvaiguṇyaṃ hi jāḍye sati bhavattena vyāptam /
analyzed: vāc manasā usayoḥ  rvaiguṇyam hi jāḍye sati bhavat tena vyāptam
translated: The defects of speech and mind🔽are indeed present when there is dullness, and are pervaded by that.

analyzed: tad viruddham ca atyanta prakṛṣṭa buddhi tvam
translated: And the opposite of that is extremely excellent intelligence.

original: tasmin sati katham bhaved ity abhiprāyāt /
analyzed: tasmin sati katham bhavet iti abhiprāyāt
translated: The idea is that how can it be when that is present?🔽Even so, your commentary will not be clear

original: api tavaiva vāṅmanasayor vaiguṇyāt ṭīkā avadātā na bhaviṣyati
analyzed: ācārya grantha viśuddhau api tava eva vāc manasayoḥ vaiguṇyāt ṭīkā avadātā na bhaviṣyati
translated: due to the defects of your own speech and mind.

original: iti cāśaṅkya auddhatyaparihārāpadeśena ācāryavacanāpekṣayā ātmano jaḍatvam abhyupetya🔽vaidarbhyaparayā vacanam aṅgyā tathāpi / / ityādinā svavāṅmanasosayo
analyzed: iti ca āśaṅkya auddhatya parihāra apadeśena ācārya vacana apekṣayā ātmanaḥ jaḍa tvam abhyupetya  vaidarbhī aparayā vacanam aṅgyā tathā api ityādinā
translated: Having anticipated this doubt, and having accepted your own dullness in relation to the words of the teacher under the pretext of avoiding agitation,

original: r vaiguṇyavaikalyam api prakāśaiṣyate /🔽ādau pārśvasthasya aśrutaitatpūrvapakṣavādivacanasya tatrānādṛtasya vā🔽vyākhyātagranthavyākhyānena carvitacarvaṇam anutiṣṭhatā tvayā kathaṃ tattvātiśayaprakāśanalakṣanaṃ
analyzed: R vaiguṇya vaikalyam api prakāśaiḥ iṣyate  ādau pārśva sthasya aśruta etad pūrvapakṣa vādi vacanasya tatra an ādṛtasya vā  vyākhyāta grantha vyākhyānena carvita carvaṇam anutiṣṭhatā tvayā katham tattva atiśaya prakāśana lakṣanam
translated: you will proclaim the absence of defects in your own speech and mind by the statement beginning with Even so, by the excellence of the Vaidarbha style...🔽The words of the one standing by the side, who has not heard this before and whose views have not been accepted,🔽or the chewing of what has already been chewed by the explanation of the explanatory text - how can you attain the sweetness characterized by the illumination of the highest truth

analyzed: mādhuryam antar tṛpti karam āsādayitavyaḥ
translated: which brings inner satisfaction by doing this?

original: tat kim evam ācaritam iti tvarayābhiprāyaṃ svayam udghāṭitaṃ vighaṭayitum āha varaṃ hi / / ityādi /
analyzed: tat kim evam ācaritam iti tvarayā abhiprāyam svayam udghāṭitam vighaṭayitum āha varam hi ityādi
translated: So why is this done? In order to quickly reveal and refute the intention, he says Better... and so on.

original: tvarāyogino 'sya pūrvapakṣaṃ tu te evāśaṅke nirākurvann āha nyāyamārge / /tyādi /
analyzed: tvarā yoginaḥ pūrvapakṣam tu te eva āśaṅke nirākurvan āha  /
translated: For one who is in a hurry, they themselves raise and refute the doubt in the prima facie view, saying On the path of reasoning... and so on.

original: pūrvavyākhyāne tu varam avyākhyāte 'nyatra kleśaḥ kriyatāṃ yatra rasaviśeṣāsvādaḥ sambhavī /
analyzed: pūrva vyākhyāne tu varam a vyākhyāte nyatra kleśaḥ kriyatām yatra rasa viśeṣa āsvādaḥ sambhavī
translated: But in the previous explanation, it is to be applied in the doubt, Better to leave unexplained elsewhere, where the experience of the specific rasa is possible.

original: na punar atra tadasambhavād iti āśaṅkāyām idaṃ yojyaṃ /
analyzed: na punar atra tad asambhavāt iti āśaṅkāyām idam yojyam
translated: Not here, because it is not possible there.

original: uttarābhyāṃ tu ślokābhyāṃ svakīyauddhatyaparihāraḥ kevalaḥ kṛta iti /
analyzed: uttarābhyām tu ślokābhyām svakīya auddhatya parihāraḥ kevalaḥ kṛtaḥ iti
translated: But with the next two verses, only the removal of his own agitation is done.

analyzed: dharmakīrteḥ imāni vacanāni teṣu
translated: These are Dharmakīrti's words in them.

analyzed: ākṛṣṭa rasam hi sanīyam carvitam ucyate
translated: For what has drawn out the rasa is said to be relished.

original: amīṣām api bahubhir vyākhyātatvena ākṛṣṭarasatvāt carvitam iva carviteṣu carvaṇaṃ / / rasāsvādārtho vyāpāraviśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: amīṣām api bahubhiḥ vyākhyāta tvena ākṛṣṭa rasa tvāt carvitam iva carviteṣu carvaṇam rasa āsvāda arthaḥ vyāpāra viśeṣaḥ
translated: Since these too have been explained by many, and because they have drawn out the rasa, the relishing is as if relished among the relished. The relishing is a particular operation for the sake of experiencing the rasa.

analyzed: a carvita carvaṇa rūpāt a vyākhyāta anya grantha vyākhyānāt iti prakaraṇa labhyam avadhim abhisambandhāya sandhāya
translated: From the form of relishing the unrelished, from the explanation of the unexplained text, the limit understood from the context is connected, and is related.

original: kiñcid iṣṭau varam / / ity avyayam āha /
analyzed: kiñcid iṣṭau varam iti avyayam āha
translated: And he says the indeclinable varam, 'better', in the sense of 'something desired'.

original: p / varam adya kapotaḥ śvo mayūrāt /
analyzed: adya kapotaḥ śvas mayūrāt
translated: Better the dove today than the peacock tomorrow.

original: mṛtād varaṃ durbalatetyādi yāvat /🔽na punar iti buddhisthīkṛtavarjanīyāṅgam eva caivam āha /
analyzed: mṛtāt varam durbala tā ityādi yāvat  na punar iti buddhi sthīkṛta varjanīya aṅgam eva ca evam āha
translated: Better the weak than the dead, and so on up to...🔽And he says 'ca' in this way, taking the part to be avoided as understood.

analyzed: sāmarthya gamya tvāt ca varjanīya tvena abhimatam na avādīt
translated: And because it is understood by implication, he did not say what is intended to be avoided.

analyzed: api nyāyataḥ sambhāvanām āha
translated: He says 'api' (even) to indicate the possibility according to logic.

original: anye punar anipātam eva śreṣṭhavacanaṃ carvaṇasamānādhikaraṇaṃ varaśabdaṃ varṇayanti /
analyzed: anye punar anipātam eva śreṣṭha vacanam carvaṇa samāna adhikaraṇam vara śabdam varṇayanti
translated: Others, however, explain the word 'varam' (better) as having the same case as 'chर्वण' (eating), without the negative.

original: na kevalam acarviteṣv iti cāpiśabdaṃ vyācakṣate /
analyzed: na kevalam a carviteṣu iti ca api śabdam vyācakṣate
translated: They explain the word 'api' (even) as 'na kevalam' (not only), in 'na kevalam acर्वितेषु'.

analyzed: mahataḥ pi mahīyāṃsam ācāryam
translated: To the teacher who is greater than the great.

original: viduṣaś sarvathaivābhidhānaṃ draṣṭavyam /🔽nanu ca vyākhyātatvād āntaratayā niṣpīḍitasya manāg api mādhuryābhāvād eva tadaprāptau
analyzed: viduṣaḥ sarvathā eva abhidhānam draṣṭavyam  nanu ca vyākhyāta tvāt āntara tayā niṣpīḍitasya manāk api mādhurya abhāvāt eva tad aprāptau
translated: The statement of the wise should be understood in every way.🔽But since it has been explained, and since there is no sweetness even slightly in what has been squeezed out internally, how is it that it is said to be 'varam' (better) when it is not obtained?

original: kathaṃ varam ity abhidhīyata iti āśaṅkya prativastūpamālaṅkāreṇa prativacanam āha
analyzed: katham varam iti abhidhīyate iti āśaṅkya prativastūpamā alaṅkāreṇa prativacanam āha
translated: Suspecting this, he replies with the figure of speech 'prativaktrupamâ',

analyzed: niṣpīḍitā api iti
translated: saying 'niṣpīḍitâpi'.

analyzed: mṛdvīkā drākṣā phalam
translated: Mṛdvîka is a grape fruit.

original: kimaḥ kṣepe prayogāt naiva jahātīty arthaḥ /
analyzed: kimaḥ kṣepe prayogāt na eva jahāti iti arthaḥ
translated: The particle kim is for censure, meaning 'never leaves'.

analyzed: anayā vacana vyaktyā asūyām api
translated: Even with this verbal expression.

original: gambhīrāṇām ācāryagirāṃ nūnaṃ na sarvam arthajātam yathāvat pūrve vyācakhyur atas tathāvidharasāsvādas tena bhaviṣyatīti nitarāṃ vācyam iti
analyzed: gambhīrāṇām ācārya girām nūnam na sarvam artha jātam yathāvat pūrve vyācakhyuḥ atas tathāvidha rasa āsvādaḥ tena bhaviṣyati iti nitarām vācyam iti
translated: It should be said that the meaning of the profound words of the teacher will be tasted in that way, because they did not explain all the meanings as they are.

analyzed: sūcayati
translated: He indicates this.🔽For the particle hi has the sense of prohibition of the prima facie view.

analyzed: pūrvapakṣa niṣedha abhiprāye yasmāt arthe
translated: In the sense of 'because'.

analyzed: vyaktam iti asmin arthe vā
translated: Or in the sense of 'clearly'.
The path of reasoning is the path of logic. The compound is a restrictive one, with the word 'tu' understood.

original: ekatra / / ity ayaṃ śabdaḥ ubhayor api pārśvayor vyāpriyate /
analyzed: ekatra iti ayam śabdaḥ ubhayoḥ api pārśvayoḥ vyāpriyate
translated: The word 'ekatra' is used on both sides.

original: tenāyam arthaḥ jagat karmabhūtam ekatra ekasmiṃstulāntarvartamānam ekatrāvasthitā yasya matir jayed adharīkuryāt /
analyzed: tena ayam arthaḥ jagat karma bhūtam ekatra ekasmin tulā antar vartamānam ekatra avasthitā yasya matiḥ jayet adharīkuryāt
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning: The world, which is the object of action, existing in one place, in one balance, if the mind of one who has such a view prevails, it would overpower it.

analyzed: jayet iti sambhāvanā padam etat
translated: The word 'jayet' is a word of possibility.

original: yanmater jagad abhibhavanaṃ sambhāvyate ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: yad mateḥ jagat abhibhavanam sambhāvyate iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: the world is considered to be overpowered by that mind.

analyzed: śakya artham vā
translated: Or it has the sense of what is possible.

analyzed: jagat jetum śaktā iti yāvat
translated: The meaning is: the world is capable of being conquered.🔽Of him, of one who has such a view, the words...

analyzed: tasya evaṃmateḥ giraḥ vāca
translated: Of him, of such an opinion, the words...🔽🔽
Having the nature of the meaning of what is not directly perceived and so on.

analyzed: ku iti vadan sva vyākhyeya tayā tān saṃbhāvayati
translated: Saying where he implies them as what he himself is to explain.

analyzed: duravagāha tayā gambhīrāḥ
translated: They are profound due to being difficult to fathom.

analyzed: atas eva kva iti āha
translated: For this very reason he says where.

original: ahaṃ jaḍadhīḥ kva cety anena tadavyākhyātṛtvenātmānam asaṃbhāvayan dūrīkaroti /
analyzed: aham jaḍa dhīḥ kva ca iti anena tad avyākhyātṛ tvena ātmānam a saṃbhāvayan dūrīkaroti
translated: I am dull-witted, where are they - by this he dismisses himself as not being their expounder, distancing himself.

original: tathāpi / / ity anena nipātasamudāyena prakṛtaṃ pratisamādhatte /
analyzed: tathā api iti anena nipāta samudāyena prakṛtam pratisamādhatte
translated: Nevertheless - by this collection of particles he responds to the topic.

original: yān uddiśya / / yān adhikṛtya iti yāvat /
analyzed: uddiśya yān adhikṛtya yad artham iti yāvat
translated: Those for whom - those with regard to whom.

analyzed: mayā
translated: By me also - by me who is like this.

original: vaktroktipakṣe tv ācāryaṃ prati jaḍadhīr iti bruvatā lokaṃ prati viparyayo 'ntarnihitaḥ /
analyzed: vaktra ukti pakṣe tu ācāryam prati jaḍa dhīḥ iti bruvatā lokam prati viparyayaḥ ntar nihitaḥ
translated: But in the case of the statement of the teacher, by saying I am dull-witted to the teacher, he implies the opposite to the world.

original: ṭibetanabhāṣāntaram āśritya teṣāṃ kṛte ity evaṃrūpaḥ pāṭho 'smābhiḥ kalpitaḥ mudritaś ca/
analyzed: ṭibetana bhāṣā antaram āśritya teṣām kṛte iti evaṃrūpaḥ pāṭhaḥ smābhiḥ kalpitaḥ mudritaḥ ca
translated: Relying on another Tibetan translation, we have imagined and printed the reading in the form for them and so on.

original: kintu imāṃ ṭīkām āśritya tatratyamūlapāṭhaḥ yān uddiśya ity evaṃ pūraṇīyaḥ /
analyzed: kintu imām ṭīkām āśritya tatratya mūla pāṭhaḥ yān uddiśya iti evam pūraṇīyaḥ
translated: But relying on this commentary, the root text there should be filled in as those for whom.

original: mandamatayaḥ santi mattopi kecana / / iti vidarbhavacanena durjanamanas toṣakareṇa
analyzed: manda matayaḥ santi mattaḥ api kecana iti vidarbha vacanena durjana manaḥ toṣa kareṇa
translated: There are some dull-witted people even from me - by this statement of Vidarbha, pleasing to the minds of the wicked,

original: yadi durjano mayi nāhatya yadā carati tadā bahubir evācāryābhiprāyo na samyagvyajñāyīti
analyzed: yadi durjanaḥ mayi na āhatya yadā carati tadā bahubiḥ eva ācārya abhiprāyaḥ na samyak vyajñāyi iti
translated: If a bad person does not strike me and acts then, many people will not understand the intention of the teacher correctly.

analyzed: bahu jana uddeśena eva mayā etat vibhajyate
translated: Therefore, it is divided only for the sake of many people.

original: anyathā tu sopi janaḥ p / pūrvādapavyākhyānagranthādācāryagranthārthaṃ jñāsyati /
analyzed: anyathā tu saḥ api janaḥ jñāsyati
translated: But even that person will know the meaning of the teacher's text from the other texts of bad explanations.

original: na hy ajño jñakṛtād eva kiñcid avagacchati nānyata iti niyamaḥ /
analyzed: na hi ajñaḥ jña kṛtāt eva kiñcid avagacchati na anyatas iti niyamaḥ
translated: For it is not a rule that an ignorant person understands something only from a teacher and not from others.

original: tataḥ katham aham asmin niṣphale mahīyasi prayāse pravarteyeti darśayati /
analyzed: tatas katham aham asmin niṣphale mahīyasi prayāse pravarteya iti darśayati
translated: Therefore, he shows how he should engage in this great fruitless effort.

original: pūrvavyākhyāne punar auddhatyaparihāramātraparaṃ vivakṣitam etan naitat paryavasānavyāpāram iti anavadyam /
analyzed: pūrva vyākhyāne punar auddhatya parihāra mātra param vivakṣitam etat na etat paryavasāna vyāpāram iti sarvam anavadyam
translated: But in the previous explanation, this is intended only to avoid agitation, not to engage in the final activity. Thus it is faultless.

original: avacchedyāvacchedakabhāvenāvasthitau viśiṣṭau vācyavācakarāśī prakaraṇam / / tasyārambha / / ārabhyata iti kṛtvā /
analyzed: avacchedya avacchedaka bhāvena avasthitau viśiṣṭau vācya vācaka rāśī prakaraṇam tasya ārambhaḥ ārabhyate iti kṛtvā
translated: The collection of words and meanings that exist in the relation of the defined and the defining, or the distinguished, is the topic. Its commencement is🔽because it is begun.

original: sāmarthyāt tadādis tatra prayojanaṃ / / phalaṃ prakaraṇasyety arthāt /
analyzed: sāmarthyāt tad ādiḥ tatra prayojanam phalam prakaraṇasya iti arthāt
translated: By implication, that beginning is the purpose there. The result is the topic, it is understood.

analyzed: idam ca śābdīṅgatim āśritya uktam draṣṭavyam
translated: And this should be seen as stated relying on the course of verbal expression.

original: ārthena tu nyāyena prakaraṇābhidheyasyānumānasya prayojanaṃ parokṣārthapratipattirūpaṃ vyākhyārthatayā jñātavyam /
analyzed: ārthena tu nyāyena prakaraṇa abhidheyasya anumānasya prayojanam parokṣa artha pratipatti rūpam vyākhyā artha tayā jñātavyam
translated: But the purpose of inference, which is the subject matter of the context, should be understood as the attainment of an obscure meaning, by the explanation of the word 'artha'.

analyzed: tathā hi eva anena kasmāt kriyate
translated: Why is the teaching of inference itself being done by this?
Because the understanding of an obscure meaning is based on that.

original: atas tatparaṃ vadan vākyam iti saiva vākyārthaḥ /
analyzed: atas tad param vadan vākyam iti sā eva vākya arthaḥ
translated: Therefore, speaking of that, the sentence is that itself, which is the meaning of the sentence.

original: etac ca parokṣārthapratipatter anumānāśrayatvāt ity anena tu / / ityādinā parastālleśato nirnerṇeṣyata iti /
analyzed: etat ca parokṣa artha pratipatteḥ anumāna āśraya tvāt iti anena tu ityādinā parastāt leśataḥ iti
translated: And this will be determined in part by the statement because the understanding of an obscure meaning is based on inference and so on, which comes later.

analyzed: tat prayojana abhidhānam
translated: That is the statement of purpose.

original: co / / avadhāraṇe pravṛttyarthamity asmāt paro draṣṭavyaḥ /
analyzed: caḥ avadhāraṇe pravṛtti artham iti asmāt paraḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: Cha (and) is for determination. For the sake of engagement should be seen after this.

analyzed: itiḥ evam arthe
translated: Iti (thus) is in the sense of artha (meaning).

original: kecidvyākhyātāro manyanta iti viśeṣaḥ iti śeṣaḥta eva tadanusahāyakam anyaṃ sākṣiṇam upakṣipanta ācakṣate tad uktam / / ityādi /
analyzed: kecid vyākhyātāraḥ manyante iti viśeṣaḥ iti śeṣaḥ te eva tad anusahāyakam anyam sākṣiṇam upakṣipantaḥ ācakṣate tat uktam ityādi
translated: Some commentators think - this is the remainder. They, introducing another witness as an assistant to that, say that is stated and so on.

original: kasyacid / / ity anena sarvaṃ saṃgṛhṇāti alpasyetarasyāpi vety arthaḥ /
analyzed: kasyacid iti anena sarvam saṃgṛhṇāti alpasya itarasya api vā iti arthaḥ
translated: Of someone - by this he includes everything. The meaning is of even a little of the other.

analyzed: atas eva pūrvasmāt
translated: For this very reason, the word va (or) is for the purpose of showing no difference from the previous.

analyzed: iti avyayam avadhau
translated: As long as... is an indeclinable indicating a limit.

original: noktam / / ity asmāt paro 'stir bhavantīparaḥ ḥ siddho draṣṭavyaḥ /
analyzed: na uktam iti asmāt paraḥ stiḥ bhavanti i paraḥ sāmānya prāyaḥ siddhaḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: It is not stated... After this, the word asti should be seen as having a feminine ending.

analyzed: tāvat iti parvavat avadhau
translated: As long as... is a limit like a mountain.

original: tacchāstraṃ tac ca karma kena gṛhyatām / / pravṛttiviṣayi kriyatām /
analyzed: tat śāstram tat ca karma kena gṛhyatām pravṛtti viṣayi kriyatām
translated: By whom should that scripture and that rite be grasped? By being made the object of engagement.

original: kimaḥ ksepe prayogāt na kenacid ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: kimaḥ k sepe prayogāt na kenacid iti arthaḥ
translated: What? In the sense of exclusion. The usage is by no one at all.

analyzed: tat śrotṛ pravṛtti artham prakaraṇa ādau prayojana abhidhānam ayuktam
translated: That... It is not proper to state the purpose at the beginning of the section for the sake of engaging the listeners.🔽But if the purpose is stated by them with that intention for the sake of engaging in that, then how is this being refuted? Anticipating this doubt, he...

original: nanu yenābhiprāyeṇa tais tatpravṛtyartham upavarṇyate sa evābhiprāyo bhavatā tat katham etat pratiṣidhyata ity āśaṅkya yata / /
analyzed: nanu yena abhiprāyeṇa taiḥ tad pravṛti artham upavarṇyate saḥ eva abhiprāyaḥ bhavatā tat katham etat pratiṣidhyate iti āśaṅkya yata
translated: ... thus, he reveals their intention.

analyzed: ityādinā tad abhiprāyam udbhinatti  itinā vacanasya akāram āha
translated: By iti, he states the form of the statement.

original: taṃ prati prakaraṇasyopāyatāṃ niścitya pravṛttiḥ syād yathā syād iti prakaraṇāt /
analyzed: tam prati prakaraṇasya upāya tām niścitya pravṛttiḥ syāt yathā syāt iti prakaraṇāt
translated: Engagement would be by determining the instrumentality of the section towards him, as if it were to be so from the section.

original: kimupāyaniścayena teṣām ity āha anupāya / / iti /
analyzed: kimupāya niścayena teṣām iti āha anupāya iti
translated: Why is there a determination of the means for them? He says without means...

analyzed: kāka akṣi nyāyena dvayoḥ api abhisambadhyate
translated: By the wise... is connected with both by the rule of the eyes of a crow.

original: upāyaniścayepi kasmāt pravṛttir ity āha tadarthitayā / / tasya phalasyābhilāṣeṇa /
analyzed: upāya niścaye api kasmāt pravṛttiḥ iti āha tad arthi tayā tasya phalasya abhilāṣeṇa
translated: Even in the ascertainment of the means, why is there engagement? He says: by the desire for that. By the desire for that result.

original: kva pravṛttir ity āha prakaraṇasya śravaṇaṃ / / ādigrahaṇāt cintādeḥ p / saṃgrahas tatra /
analyzed: kva pravṛttiḥ iti āha prakaraṇasya śravaṇam   ādi grahaṇāt cintā ādeḥ saṃgrahaḥ tatra
translated: Where is the engagement? He says: in the hearing of the topic. By the word etc. the inclusion of reflection and so on is meant there.

analyzed: iti hetau
translated: Thus. In the cause.

analyzed: tad abhidhānasya tasya prayojanasya ukteḥ
translated: Of that statement. Of that purpose being stated.

original: arthavattā / saphalatvam varṇyate / tair iti prakaraṇāt /
analyzed: arthavat tā saphala tvam varṇyate taiḥ iti prakaraṇāt
translated: The meaningfulness. The fruitfulness is described by them. Thus from the topic.

original: yadi etat tais tathopavarṇitam tarhi sundaram evety āha na caitad iti / /
analyzed: yadi etat taiḥ tathā upavarṇitam tarhi sundaram eva iti āha na ca etat iti
translated: If this is described by them in that way, then it is indeed beautiful. He says: And this is not so.

analyzed: caḥ va dhāraṇe
translated: The word ca is for specification.

original: etad anantaropanītopapattigarbhitaṃ tad abhidhānaṃ na yuktyā saṅgatam /🔽tad upāye / tasya prayojanasyopāye /
analyzed: tat upāye tasya prayojanasya upāye
translated: That statement containing the implication just mentioned is not connected with reasoning.🔽In the means to that. In the means to that purpose.

analyzed: tad bhāvaḥ tat upāya tvam
translated: That state. That being a means.

analyzed: tasya niścayāt
translated: From the ascertainment of that.
Engagement in the seed etc., which is the means to the crop.

analyzed: ṇij arthaḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: The meaning of the suffix ni should be seen as included in avadhṛta.

original: tena avadhrtaḥ avadhārito bhāvo yais teṣām /
analyzed: tena avadhrtaḥ avadhāritaḥ bhāvaḥ yaiḥ teṣām
translated: Therefore, of those who have the state ascertained, who have the state determined.

original: karṣakā api bījādiviṣaye buddhipūrvakāriṇa iti prekṣāvattvapuraskāreṇodāharaṇam /
analyzed: karṣakāḥ api bīja ādi viṣaye buddhi pūrva kāriṇaḥ iti prekṣāvat tva puraskāreṇa udāharaṇam
translated: Even farmers, who act with prior understanding regarding seeds and so on, are given as an example with the qualification of being rational.

original: nanu yathopeyārthinām upāyāniścayena pravṛttau prekṣāvattve kṣatis tathopeyāniścayepi pravṛttau kiṃ na tatkṣatir ity āha upeye tu / iti
analyzed: nanu yathā upeya arthinām upāya aniścayena pravṛttau prekṣāvat tve kṣatiḥ tathā upeya aniścaye api pravṛttau kim na tad kṣatiḥ iti āha upeye tu iti
translated: But just as there is a loss of rationality in the engagement of those who seek what is to be attained due to uncertainty about the means, why is there not that loss in the engagement due to uncertainty about what is to be attained? He says But in what is to be attained...

analyzed: tuḥ pūrvasmāt asya bhedam darśayati
translated: But shows its difference from the previous.

analyzed: iti hetu bhāvena viśeṣaṇam
translated: In the future is a qualification in the sense of cause.

analyzed: aniścaye pi iti yasya iti prakaraṇāt
translated: Even in uncertainty is from the context.

original: hetubinduṭīkāyāḥ prater atra truṭitatvāt bhāvini iti padaṃ pūrayitvā na mudritaṃ nirdiṣṭapṛṣṭhe /
analyzed: hetubindu ṭīkāyāḥ prateḥ atra truṭita tvāt bhāvini iti padam pūrayitvā na mudritam nirdiṣṭa pṛṣṭhe
translated: Since the beginning of the commentary on the Hetubindu is missing here, the word in the future is not printed after filling it in on the indicated page.

original: tathāpi upeye tu ity anantaraṃ tatpadaṃ tatra sthāpyam eva ālokānurodhena / he /
analyzed: tathā api upeye tu iti anantaram tat padam tatra sthāpyam eva āloka anurodhena
translated: Nevertheless, that word should be placed there after But in what is to be attained... in accordance with the light.

analyzed: itiḥ sambhāvanāyāḥ ākāram darśayati
translated: Thus shows the form of possibility.

original: etad uktaṃ bhavati śakyaniścayam aniścitya pravartamānāḥ svakartavyākaraṇād upālabhyāḥ /🔽na tv aśakyākya
analyzed: etat uktam bhavati śakya niścayam a niścitya pravartamānāḥ sva kartavya ākaraṇāt upālabhyāḥ  na tu aśakya ākya
translated: This is what is said: Those who engage without ascertaining what can be ascertained are to be reproached for not fulfilling their duty.

analyzed: niścayam iti
translated: But not for what is to be attained that cannot be ascertained.🔽Thus shows the form of possibility.🔽This is what is said: Those who engage without ascertaining what can be ascertained are to be reproached for not fulfilling their duty.

original: yady evaṃ prakaraṇasyāpi prayojanaviśeṣaṃ pratyupāyabhāvaṃ niścitya tadarthitayā pravartiṣyanta iti āha niścayaś ca / iti /
analyzed: yadi evam prakaraṇasya api prayojana viśeṣam prati upāya bhāvam niścitya tad arthi tayā pravartiṣyante iti āha niścayaḥ ca iti
translated: If it is so, then having ascertained that even the context has the nature of a means with regard to a particular purpose, they will engage in it with the desire for that purpose. He says: And the ascertainment.

analyzed: caḥ va dhāraṇe
translated: The word ca (and) is for emphasis.

original: kasmān nāsti ity āha śabdānām / iti /
analyzed: kasmāt na asti iti āha śabdānām iti
translated: Why is it not so? He says: Of the words.

analyzed: ca vācya vācaka bhāva lakṣaṇa pratibandha sadbhāvāt siddhaḥ
translated: Because the relation characterized by the relation of denoted and denoter exists, the absence of relation is not established.

original: tathāhi yadi śabdasya vācakaśaktir arthasya ca vācyaśaktir vastusatī na syāt tadā pauruṣeyī syāt/
analyzed: tathā hi yadi śabdasya vācaka śaktiḥ arthasya ca vācya śaktiḥ vastu satī na syāt tadā pauruṣeyī syāt
translated: Thus, if the power of denotation of the word and the power of being denoted of the meaning were not real, then they would be due to human effort.

original: puruṣādhīnatve ca śakteḥ yo 'yam śabda eva vācako 'rthasya /
analyzed: puruṣa adhīna tve ca śakteḥ yaḥ yam śabdaḥ eva vācakaḥ rthasya
translated: And if the power were dependent on human beings, then this very word would be the denoter of the meaning,

analyzed: arthaḥ eva vācyaḥ
translated: and this very meaning would be the denoted.

original: na tv arthaḥ śabdasya vācakaḥ iti dṛṣṭo niyamaḥ / sa na syāt /
analyzed: na tu arthaḥ śabdasya vācakaḥ iti dṛṣṭaḥ niyamaḥ sa na syāt
translated: But the rule that the meaning is not the denoter of the word would not be seen.

analyzed: puruṣa icchāyāḥ
translated: Because of the human desire.

analyzed: na ca niyama vilopaḥ sti
translated: And there is no violation of the rule.

original: na hīcchann api samayakāraḥ puruṣo 'rthe vācakaśaktim /
analyzed: na hi icchan api samayakāraḥ puruṣaḥ rthe vācaka śaktim
translated: For even desiring, a human author of a convention is not able to bestow the power of denotation on the meaning,

analyzed: śabde ca vācya śaktim arpayitum pārayati
translated: and the power of being denoted on the word.

original: tasmād yathā ghaṭapradīpayoḥ prakāśyaprakāśakaśaktir vaiparītyamananubhavantī niyamavatī vāstavī tathā śabdārthayor api vācyavācakaśaktir
analyzed: tasmāt yathā ghaṭa pradīpayoḥ prakāśya prakāśaka śaktiḥ vaiparītyam ananubhavantī niyamavatī vāstavī tathā śabda arthayoḥ api vācya vācaka śaktiḥ
translated: Therefore, just as the power of the pot and the lamp to be illuminated and to illuminate, which is not experienced as reversed, is real and regular, so also the power of denotation and denotedness of the word and meaning

analyzed: niyamavatī vāstavī eva iti
translated: is real and regular.

original: yady arthaśabdamātrāpekṣayā niyamaḥ pratipādyate tadāsāv asiddhaḥ /
analyzed: yadi artha śabda mātra apekṣayā niyamaḥ pratipādyate tadā asau asiddhaḥ
translated: If the rule is taught with reference to meaning and sound alone, then it is unestablished.

original: tathāhi saṅketavaśāt tṛṇajūṭādir artho yathārthāntarasya mamatvakriyāviśeṣavidhātādilakṣaṇasya prakāśako vācakas tathā samayasāmarthyād
analyzed: tathā hi saṅketa vaśāt tṛṇa jūṭa ādiḥ arthaḥ yathā artha antarasya mamatva kriyā viśeṣa vidhātā ādi lakṣaṇasya prakāśakaḥ vācakaḥ tathā samaya sāmarthyāt
translated: For example, by the power of convention, a bundle of grass etc. is the illuminator of another meaning, characterized by ownership, action, particularity, and so on, and is the denotator. In the same way, by the power of convention,

analyzed: eva arthaḥ śabdasya api vācakaḥ bhavati eva
translated: the meaning also becomes the denotator of the word.

original: tad yathā bhūtahastalakṣaṇāyāṃ kalāyāṃ aṅgulyaḥ kakārādīnāṃ tatparvarekhāś cākārādīnām /
analyzed: tat yathā bhūta hasta lakṣaṇāyām kalāyām kaniṣṭhā ādyāḥ aṅgulyaḥ kakāra ādīnām tad parva rekhāḥ ca ākāra ādīnām
translated: For example, in the art of reading the lines on the hand, the fingers are the denotators of the letters beginning with ka, and the lines on the joints are the denotators of the letters beginning with a.

original: na ca śabdasyāpi arthaprakāśanād arthapratītijananād anyadvācakatvaṃ nāma /
analyzed: na ca śabdasya api artha prakāśanāt artha pratīti jananāt anyat vācaka tvam nāma
translated: And the denotator-ness of a word is nothing but the manifestation of the meaning, the production of the cognition of the meaning.

original: atha ghaṭārtho ghaṭaśabdasya vācako na bhavatīty ucyate /
analyzed: atha ghaṭa arthaḥ ghaṭa śabdasya vācakaḥ na bhavati iti ucyate
translated: If it is said that the meaning of the pot is not the denotator of the word pot,

analyzed: hanta
translated: then, alas!

analyzed: tasya api saṅketa vaśāt tathābhāvaḥ kena nivāryate
translated: By whom is the fact of its being so by the power of convention prevented?

original: yadāhaṃ yuṣmabhyaṃ ghaṭam darśayāmi tadā ghaṭaśa damuccārayitavyam /
analyzed: yadā aham yuṣmabhyam ghaṭam darśayāmi tadā
translated: When I show you the pot, then the word 'pot' should be uttered.

original: anyathā vā jñāsyatheti tadā kiṃ tasya tathātvaṃ na bhavati / /
analyzed: anyathā vā jñāsyatha iti tadā kim tasya tathātvam na bhavati
translated: Otherwise, how can it not be so when you say 'we will know it in some other way'?

original: yadi satyavādī bhavān naivaṃ vaktum arhatīti yat kiñcid etat /
analyzed: yadi satya vādī bhavān na evam vaktum arhati iti yat kiñcid etat
translated: If you are a truthful speaker, you should not say this. This is something.

analyzed: tasmāt siddhaḥ pratibandha abhāvaḥ
translated: Therefore, the absence of restriction is established.

original: nanu śabdasya tāvad vaktukāmatāyāṃ asti pratibandhaḥ /
analyzed: nanu śabdasya tāvat vaktu kāma tāyām asti pratibandhaḥ
translated: But there is a restriction in the speaker's desire to speak about the word.

original: sā ca yathāvas tv eva vartata iti praṇālikayā bāhye śabdasya prāmāṇyaṃ ko 'pahastayed ity āśaṅkyāha vivakṣāyām / iti
analyzed: sā ca tu eva vartate iti praṇālikayā bāhye śabdasya prāmāṇyam iti āśaṅkya āha vivakṣāyām iti
translated: And that occurs only as it is. So who can refute the external word's validity through the analogy? Suspecting this, he says 'in the desire to speak'.

analyzed: apiḥ viśeṣa vivakṣāyāḥ abhyupagame
translated: The word 'api' (also) is used when the desire to speak about the particular is accepted.

analyzed: vastu anatikrameṇa api kvacid bhavati iti niyama grahaṇam
translated: The word 'niyama' (restriction) is used because it sometimes occurs without going beyond the object.

original: tataḥ / iti vivakṣāyāṃ pramāṇāt śabdāt /🔽syād etat ye yam arthaṃ yathā vivakṣayā viṣayīkurvanti vaktāras te tathaiva tam
analyzed: tatas iti vivakṣāyām pramāṇāt śabdāt  syāt etat ye yam artham yathā vivakṣayā viṣayīkurvanti vaktāraḥ te tathā eva tam
translated: 'Tataḥ' (from that) means from the word which is a means of valid knowledge, in the desire to speak.🔽This may be said: Those speakers who make a certain object the content of their desire to speak, they act in accordance with that object

original: artham anutiṣṭhanti ity atra apy evaṃ vivakṣitur evam bhaviṣyatīti
analyzed: artham anutiṣṭhanti iti atra api evam vivakṣituḥ evam eva anuṣṭhānam bhaviṣyati iti
translated: in the same way. So it will be like this for one who desires to speak in this way.

original: niścaye kuto niścayābhāvaḥ ity āśaṅkyāha na hi / iti / hiḥ yasmāt /
analyzed: niścaye kutas niścaya abhāvaḥ iti āśaṅkya āha na hi iti hiḥ yasmāt
translated: How can there be absence of certainty in a conclusion? With this doubt in mind, he says: not (na hi). Hi (iti) is because.

analyzed: katham tathā anuṣṭhāna niyama abhāvaḥ iti āha
translated: How is there absence of restriction on acting in that way? He says: in contradiction (visamvāde).

analyzed: saritaḥ tīre śarkarā śakaṭam paryastam āste
translated: On the bank of the river, a cart full of sand is overturned.

original: tadāgacchata bho gacchāmaḥ ity abhidhāyāpy anyathā pravṛttidarśanāt loke / vyavahartari jane /
analyzed: tat āgacchata bho gacchāmaḥ iti abhidhāya api anyathā pravṛtti darśanāt loke vyavahartari jane
translated: Having said this, and having gone in a different way, the people who engage in worldly transactions are seen.

original: sarvagranthakāravacane 'pi anāśvāsāt / āsthāyā abhāvāt /🔽prayojanā prakaraṇasya tadupāyabhāvaviṣayo 'rthasandehaḥ pravṛttyaṅgam upajāyate /
analyzed: sarva granthakāra vacane pi anāśvāsāt āsthāyāḥ abhāvāt  abhidhānāt prakaraṇasya tad upāya bhāva viṣayaḥ rtha sandehaḥ pravṛtti aṅgam upajāyate
translated: Even in the words of all the authors of treatises, there is no confidence, because of the absence of trust.🔽The doubt about the meaning of the subject matter, which is the means to that purpose, arises as a factor of engagement.

original: tataś ca prakaraṇe pravṛttir arthinām iti prakaraṇasya prayojanaviśeṣaṃ pratyupāyatvasaṃśayaṃ
analyzed: tatas ca prakaraṇe pravṛttiḥ arthinām iti prakaraṇasya prayojana viśeṣam prati upāya tva saṃśayam
translated: And from that, there is engagement in the subject matter by those who seek it. Thus, the introductory statement is said to be for the purpose of making the doubt about the subject matter being a means to a particular purpose

original: pravṛttyaṅgakartum ādivākyam uktam iti mataṃ paścātdharmottarādināpy arthāt darśitaṃ yeṣām /
analyzed: pravṛtti aṅga kartum ādi vākyam uktam iti matam paścāt dharma uttara ādinā api arthāt darśitam yeṣām
translated: a factor of engagement, according to those who have shown it by implication later on through Dharmasutras and others.

analyzed: tān kaṭākṣayan āha
translated: Indicating them obliquely, he says in the purpose (prayojane), etc.

analyzed: prakaraṇasya iti prathamatas
translated: of the subject matter (prakaraṇasya), thus at the beginning.

original: tasya tasmin vā upāyas tadbhāvastattā saivaviṣayo yasya sa tathā /
analyzed: tasya tasmin vā upāyaḥ tad bhāvaḥ tad tā yasya sa tathā
translated: That which has that as its means, that state, that nature, is so.

original: asmābhiḥ tadupāyatāviṣaye iti pāṭhaḥ kalpayitvā mudritaḥ kintu ālokam āśritya tadupāyatāviṣayaḥ iti pāṭhaḥ kalpanīyaḥ /
analyzed: asmābhiḥ tad upāya tā viṣaye iti pāṭhaḥ kalpayitvā mudritaḥ kintu ālokam āśritya tad upāya tā viṣayaḥ iti pāṭhaḥ kalpanīyaḥ
translated: We have imagined the reading tadupāyatāviṣaye and printed it, but relying on the light [of the original], the reading tadupāyatāviṣayaḥ should be imagined.

original: p / kasya tadupāyatety ekadeśākāṅkṣāyāṃ tu prakaraṇasya / iti śrutatvād draṣtavyam /
analyzed: kasya tad upāya tā iti eka deśa ākāṅkṣāyām tu prakaraṇasya iti śruta tvāt draṣtavyam
translated: When there is a desire for a part of whose that is a means, it should be seen thus, because of the statement of the context.

analyzed: janyate jāyate
translated: It is produced, it is born.

original: ata eva janiḥ kartuḥ prakṛtiḥ Pā / / / ity anena labdhāpādānasaṃjñakāt pūrvaṃ pañcamī /
analyzed: atas eva janiḥ kartuḥ prakṛtiḥ iti anena labdha apādāna saṃjñakāt pūrvam pañcamī
translated: For this very reason, the fifth case comes before the one that gets the designation of the source by this [rule]: janir kartur prakṛtiḥ pā.

analyzed: tatas sandeha udayāt
translated: From that, from the arising of doubt.

analyzed: tad bhāva nirdhāraṇāya tad upāya niścaya artham
translated: For determining that state, for ascertaining the means to that.

analyzed: kṛṣīvalaḥ hālikaḥ
translated: The farmer, the ploughman.

analyzed: tat itaraḥ
translated: From the word ādi, the other.

analyzed: aṅkura ādi janana yomyam bījam
translated: The seed is similar to the production of the sprout, etc.

analyzed: tad viparītam
translated: The opposite of that is the non-seed.

analyzed: tad avadhṛtaye tad niyama artham
translated: For determining that, for the purpose of ascertaining that.

original: atrālokasammataḥ ṭīkāpāṭhaḥ bījābījāvadhṛtaye na tu yathā mudrite labhyate bījādyavadhṛtaye iti /
analyzed: atra āloka sammataḥ ṭīkā pāṭhaḥ bīja abīja avadhṛtaye na tu yathā mudrite labhyate bīja ādi avadhṛtaye iti
translated: Here, the reading of the commentary approved by Āloka is for determining the seed and non-seed, but not as it is found in the printed [text] as for determining the seed, etc.

analyzed: ced iti para abhyupagame sarvatra
translated: If. In all cases, in the acceptance of others.

analyzed: na iti yuktatvena abhimatām pravṛttim pratiṣedhayati
translated: No - he denies the engagement that is considered to be proper.

analyzed: hetum āha
translated: He states the reason: for the purpose.

original: asati vacane kathaṃ sambhava ity āha tatsādhake /ti /
analyzed: asati vacane katham sambhavaḥ iti āha
translated: If there is no statement, how is it possible? He says: by that which establishes it.

analyzed: tasya saṃśayasya
translated: That - of the doubt.

original: anumānavyutpattiḥ prayojanam asya viśiṣṭaṃ prayojanaṃ prati prakaraṇasyopāyatvaṃ katham iha sandigdhe vidagdha ity āśaṅkyāha
analyzed: anumāna vyutpattiḥ prayojanam asya viśiṣṭam prayojanam prati prakaraṇasya upāya tvam katham iha sandigdhe vidagdhe iti āśaṅkya āha
translated: The purpose of this is the understanding of inference. How is the instrumentality of the treatise with respect to that special purpose? Fearing doubt here, he says:

analyzed: darśanāt iti upalambhāt
translated: from seeing. - from perception.

analyzed: sāmarthyāt teṣām śravaṇāt iti arthaḥ vasātavyaḥ
translated: The meaning from the capacity of those, from hearing should be understood.

analyzed: ayam atra bhaṭṭa ārcaṭasya abhiprāyaḥ yat vyutpattya yaḥ rthī śruta tad upāya grantha sambhavaḥ ca
translated: This is Bhattarakita's intention here: One who is desirous of understanding, and who is capable of the text that is the means to that,

original: sa kasyacid granthasya darśanāt tasya prati sādhakabādhakapramāṇāpratisaṃvedī🔽tathāvidhavacanam antareṇāpi arthitvamātracodito 'rthitvaviṣayopāyabhāvaṃ saṃśayāno
analyzed: sa kasyacid granthasya darśanāt tasya prati sādhaka bādhaka pramāṇa a pratisaṃvedī  tathāvidha vacanam antareṇa api arthi tva mātra coditaḥ rthi tva viṣaya upāya bhāvam saṃśayānaḥ
translated: having seen some text, without experiencing any establishing or refuting means with regard to that,🔽even without such a statement, impelled merely by desire, doubting the existence of the means to the object of desire,

original: jijñāsādita evānyatra ādivākyaviyukta iva granthe pravartiṣyatite
analyzed: jijñāsā āditaḥ eva anyatra ādi vākya viyuktaḥ iva granthe
translated: will engage in the text beginning with inquiry, as if it were devoid of the initial statement.

analyzed: tad pāṭha śravaṇa ādi lakṣaṇām pravṛttim ācariṣyati
translated: He will engage in the activity characterized by listening to that recitation.

original: anyathā ādivākyavikale bhūyasi śāstre na syāt /
analyzed: anyathā ādi vākya vikale bhūyasi śāstre na syāt
translated: Otherwise, in the extensive treatise lacking the introductory statement, it would not be.

original: tatra ca yad eva pravṛttinibandhanaṃ tad atrāpi bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tatra ca yat eva pravṛtti nibandhanam tat atra api bhaviṣyati
translated: And there also, whatever is the basis for engagement will be here too.

original: nāpi ādivākye saty apy āśvāso yujyate /
analyzed: nā api ādi vākye sati api āśvāsaḥ yujyate
translated: Nor is reassurance proper even with the introductory statement.

analyzed: anya pratijñātavatām api anya vyutpādana darśanāt
translated: Because even those who have promised something else are seen to explain something else.

analyzed: yathā atas yathā atha atas
translated: For example, Now, therefore and Now, therefore

original: dharmaṃ vyākhyāsyāmaḥ VS / / iti pratijñāya ṣaṭpadārthīpratipādanaṃkaṇādasya /
analyzed: dharmam vyākhyāsyāmaḥ iti pratijñāya
translated: we will explain Dharma - having promised this, Kaṇāda explains the six categories.

original: tato niṣphalaivādivākyakriyā syād yadi pravṛttyarthaṃ tad upavarṇyate /
analyzed: tatas niṣphalā evā ādi vākya kriyā syāt yadi pravṛtti artham tat upavarṇyate
translated: Therefore, the action of the introductory statement would be fruitless. If it is described for the purpose of engagement.

original: anyathā tv ādivākyepi katham iva pravarteta śroteti / /
analyzed: anyathā tu ādi vākye api katham iva pravarteta śrotā iti
translated: Otherwise, even with the introductory statement, how would the listener engage?

analyzed: anayā eva pratyavastheyam
translated: And by this very line of reasoning, one should respond to the views of Dharmarāja and others.

original: tathāhi yady arthasaṃśayaṃ prakaraṇe pravṛttyaṅgaṃ kartum abhidheyādīni abhidhīyanta ādivākyena /
analyzed: tathā hi yadi artha saṃśayam prakaraṇe pravṛtti aṅgam kartum abhidheya ādīni abhidhīyante ādi vākyena
translated: For example, if the subject matter and other topics are stated by the introductory statement to make the doubt about the meaning an accessory for engagement in the topic,

analyzed: tad karaṇāt eva ca upavarṇyate
translated: and the result of that is described just because it is done.

original: tarhi tatraivādivākye kathaṃ śrotṝṇām asati tasyādivākyasyābhidheyādyabhidhāyake vākyāntare' iti prṣṭodharmottarādirācaṣṭāṃ tāvat
analyzed: tarhi tatra eva ādi vākye katham pravṛttiḥ śrotṝṇām asati tasya ādi vākyasya abhidheya ādi abhidhāyake vākya antare iti prṣṭaḥ dharmottara ādiḥ ācaṣṭām tāvat
translated: Then, in that very introductory statement, how can the listeners, when there is no other statement expressing its subject matter, etc., explain the Dharma, Uttara, etc. in response to the question?

analyzed: kā pravṛttiḥ ādi vākye iti ced
translated: If it is asked what is the engagement in the introductory statement,

analyzed: tasya paṭhanam śravaṇam artha avagāhanam
translated: its recitation, hearing, and understanding of the meaning.

original: anyathā prakaraṇepi kā pravṛttir iti tulyacodyam /🔽vyākhyātṛvacanāt tatra pravṛttau prakaraṇe 'pi kā kṣatiḥ / /
analyzed: anyathā prakaraṇe api kā pravṛttiḥ iti tulya codyam  vyākhyātṛ vacanāt tatra pravṛttau prakaraṇe pi kā kṣatiḥ
translated: Otherwise, the same objection applies to the context as well - what is the engagement there?🔽If it is argued that there is no harm in the context even if the engagement is due to the statement of the commentator,

analyzed: tad vacanam krīḍā ādi artham anyathā api iti ced
translated: if it is argued that the statement is for the purpose of play, etc. even otherwise,

original: samānam idam anyatrāpi /🔽jijñāsayā pravṛttau cādivākyaṃ vaiyarthyam aśnuvīta /
analyzed: samānam idam anyatra api  jijñāsayā pravṛttau ca ādi vākyam vaiyarthyam aśnuvīta
translated: this is the same in other cases as well.🔽And if there is engagement due to inquiry, the introductory statement would be pointless.

analyzed: ādi vākya vikala śāstra pravṛttyā eva ca prayāsa alpīyaḥ tvāt
translated: And because the effort is less in engaging with the scripture lacking the introductory statement,

original: tatra tadantareṇāpi pravṛttir nānyatreti prativacanaṃ pratikṣiptam /
analyzed: tatra tad antareṇa api pravṛttiḥ na anyatra iti prativacanam pratikṣiptam
translated: the response that there is engagement there even without it, but not elsewhere, is rejected.

original: tasmād dūram api gatvā tenedam abhidhānīyaṃ yad evāsmadabhimatam iti kim atinirbandhena kṛtaṃ bahutithena doṣeṇa /
analyzed: tasmāt dūram api gatvā tena idam abhidhānīyam yat eva asmad abhimatam iti kim ati nirbandhena kṛtam bahutithena doṣeṇa
translated: Therefore, even after going far, it should be stated that which is accepted by us. What is the use of excessive insistence? What is the use of many faults?

original: saṃśayasya upadarśayann āha kim asya / iti /
analyzed: saṃśayasya svarūpam upadarśayan āha kim asya iti
translated: Showing the doubt, he says: What is this?

original: na vā kiñcidi /ty anena niścayenānyānusaraṇabījaṃ darśitam /🔽saṃprati prayojanaviśeṣaṃ prati prakaraṇasyopāyabhāvasaṃśayaṃ tadabhidhānāt prāṇ🔽nyāyaprāptaṃ pradarśya prayojanamātrāpekṣayāpi tasyopāyatvasandehas tadabhidhānasya
analyzed: na vā anena niścayena anya anusaraṇa bījam darśitam  saṃprati prayojana viśeṣam prati prakaraṇasya upāya bhāva saṃśayam tad abhidhānāt prāṇ  nyāya prāptam pradarśya prayojana mātra apekṣayā api tasya upāya tva sandehaḥ tad abhidhānasya
translated: By this, or nothing at all, he shows the seed of pursuing another [view] with certainty.🔽Now, having shown the doubt regarding the means of the topic with regard to a particular purpose, since that is stated before the statement of the purpose,

original: purastāt sambhavī tato 'pi prakaraṇe pravṛttir avyāhateti darśayan
analyzed: purastāt prakaraṇe pravṛttiḥ avyāhatā iti darśayan tatra eva abhyccaye
translated: the doubt regarding its being a means even with regard to the mere purpose is possible later, and therefore the engagement in the topic is unobstructed. Showing this,

analyzed: hetum āha api ca iti
translated: he states the reason: Moreover.

original: evaṃ jijñāsoḥ / ity etajjijñāsāta ity arthāt /
analyzed: evam jijñāsoḥ iti etad jijñāsātaḥ iti arthāt
translated: Thus, of one who desires to know - this is from desiring to know, implicitly.

analyzed: pravṛtti upayogi prayojana śūnyam niṣprayojanam tad viparītam prayojanavat
translated: Devoid of a purpose that is useful for engagement, it is purposeless. The opposite of that is purposeful.

analyzed: uta iti pakṣa antara avadyotane  anena prekṣā pūrva kāri tva prayukta tva ji prayukta ji
translated: Or - this indicates another view.

analyzed: jñāsā darśitā
translated: By this, he shows that the desire to know is employed by being employed by one who acts with foresight, and is employed by being employed by that.

original: saprayojanatvānusaraṇe kadācid asmadabhimatam api sambhāvyata iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: saprayojana tva anusaraṇe kadācid asmad abhimatam api sambhāvyate iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that if one pursues the fact of having a purpose, it may be possible even in what we accept.

original: ata eva vyanakti asmadabhimatena vā / iti /
analyzed: atas eva vyanakti asmad abhimatena vā iti
translated: For this very reason, he explains: Or with what we accept.

analyzed: itinā jijñāsāyāḥ svarūpam darśitam
translated: Thus. The nature of inquiry is shown.

original: vyarthaḥ / niṣphalaḥ prayojanapratipādako vākyasya prastāvādādivākyasyopanyāsaḥ / pradarśanam /
analyzed: vyarthaḥ niṣphalaḥ prayojana pratipādakaḥ vākyasya prastāvāt ādi vākyasya upanyāsaḥ pradarśanam
translated: Useless. Fruitless. The introduction of the sentence that states the purpose, the introductory sentence, is the demonstration.

original: yady evam artho vākyopanyāso vyarthas tarhi kim arthaṃvārtikakāreṇākārīty āśaṇkya tasmād / phalam asya darśayati
analyzed: yadi evam arthaḥ vākya upanyāsaḥ vyarthaḥ tarhi kim arthaṃvārtikakāreṇa akāri iti āśaṇkya tasmāt phalam asya darśayati
translated: If so, then the introduction of the sentence that has a purpose is useless. Why then did the author of the Vārtika not do it? Anticipating this doubt, he shows the purpose of it.

analyzed: yasmāt evam arthaḥ sambaddhaḥ tasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Because it is so, the purpose is connected. For that reason.

original: kartuṃ pratipādayituṃ vā nārabhyate / nānuṣṭhīyata iti yathāsaṃkhyaṃ sambandhaḥ /
analyzed: kartum pratipādayitum vā na ārabhyate na anuṣṭhīyate iti yathāsaṃkhyam sambandhaḥ
translated: It is not begun or stated. It is not performed. The connection is according to the number.

analyzed: tayoḥ sādhyayoḥ yathāsaṃkhyam eva udāharaṇe prāha
translated: In the examples, he states the two things to be accomplished according to the number.

original: p / itiḥ / pratiṣedhyasya tatkaraṇapratipādanānuṣṭhānalaksaṇasya ākāraṃ kathayati /
analyzed: itiḥ pratiṣedhyasya tad karaṇa pratipādana anuṣṭhāna laksaṇasya ākāram kathayati
translated: Thus. He states the form of what is to be refuted, which is characterized by the performance of that and the statement of it.

analyzed: tayā pratyavatiṣṭhamānasya pratyavasthānam kurvataḥ
translated: Of one who opposes with that, of one who makes a counter-argument.

original: tasyā asiddhatā /🔽yasyā udbhāvanaṃ pradarśanaṃ tad evārthaḥ prayojanam /
analyzed: tasyāḥ asiddha tā  yasyāḥ udbhāvanam pradarśanam tat eva arthaḥ prayojanam
translated: Its non-establishment.🔽The statement of which is the demonstration. That itself is the purpose.

original: tad yathā bhavatīty upanyasanakriyāyā viśeṣaṇam etat /
analyzed: tat yathā bhavati iti upanyasana kriyāyāḥ viśeṣaṇam etat
translated: That is how it happens. This is a qualification of the action of introduction.

analyzed: ādīyate asmāt iti ādiḥ tatra
translated: Ādi means that from which something is taken. There.

original: asmāt khalu arthā ādāya ādāya vyākhyāyanta iti /
analyzed: asmāt khalu arthāḥ ādāya ādāya vyākhyāyante iti
translated: From this, taking the meaning, it is explained.

original: syād etat bahir arthe prāmāṇyābhāvāt katham asau tadvacanāt tadasiddhatāṃ budhyate / /
analyzed: syāt etat bahis arthe prāmāṇya abhāvāt katham asau tad vacanāt tad asiddha tām budhyate
translated: This may be said: Since there is no validity in external objects, how is that non-establishment of it understood from its statement?

original: yadi parasmādasya tadviṣayo 'rthasaṃśayaḥ pravrttyaṅgaṃ jāyata iti tad eva matamāyātam iti kim anena masīmrakṣitakukkaṭanyāyenācariteneti /
analyzed: yadi parasmāt asya tad viṣayaḥ ṛtha saṃśayaḥ pravrtti aṅgam jāyate iti tat eva matam āyātam iti kim anena masī mrakṣita kukkaṭa nyāyena ācaritena iti
translated: If this doubt about the object in relation to it arises as a factor of engagement from another, then that very opinion has come. So what is the use of this conduct in the manner of a black-protected dog?

original: atrācaṣṭe kevalaṃ yaḥ pratipattā sati prayojanādau prekṣāpūrvakāriṇaṃ kartāraṃ
analyzed: atra ācaṣṭe kevalam yaḥ pratipattā sati prayojana ādau prekṣā pūrva kāriṇam kartāram
translated: Here it is said: Only that learner, when there is purpose etc., considers the agent to be one who acts with foresight,

original: ādau tadvādinaṃ manvānaḥ tadarthaṃ vacanam asyāpy apaśyann aprekṣāvatprayuktatvagarbhaprayojanādikam atrāpi jānīte /
analyzed: niyamena ādau tad vādinam manvānaḥ tad artham vacanam asya api apaśyan a prekṣāvat prayukta tva garbha prayojana ādikam atra api jānīte
translated: at first considering him to be a speaker, not seeing the purpose of his statement, knows that it is employed by one lacking foresight, with the implication of purpose etc.

analyzed: tam pratipattṛ viśeṣam prati idam akṛta ādi vākyaṃvārtikakṛt iti
translated: This statement about not being done etc. is for that particular learner, by the author of the commentary.

original: anyathā katham asau niṣprayojanaṃ cedidami🔽tyādi niḥsandigdham abhidadhyāt /
analyzed: anyathā katham asau niṣprayojanam ced idami  tyādi niḥsandigdham abhidadhyāt
translated: Otherwise, how would he unhesitatingly state This is useless etc.?

original: ādyasya tūktayā nītyā pravṛttir avyāhateti sarvam avadātam /
analyzed: ādyasya tu uktayā nītyā pravṛttiḥ avyāhatā iti sarvam avadātam
translated: By the stated method, the engagement of the first one is unobstructed. Therefore, everything is clear.

analyzed: atra sarvaiḥ eva dharmottara ādi mata anusāribhiḥ parākramyate
translated: In the opinion of Bhatta Arcata, it is undertaken by all those who follow the philosophy of Dharmaraja and others.

analyzed: ittham asmābhiḥ idam gamitam
translated: Thus, this has been presented by us.

original: etac ca sādhv asādhu vā madhyasthayā dhiyā sadbhir eva vijñāsyata iti /
analyzed: etat ca sādhu asādhu vā madhyasthayā dhiyā sadbhiḥ eva vijñāsyate iti
translated: And this, whether good or bad, will be known by the wise alone with a neutral mind.

original: pūrvaṃ sāmānyena prayojanābhidhānam ākhyātam idānīṃ viśeṣeṇāvacchindann āha tatreti / vākyopanyāse /
analyzed: pūrvam sāmānyena prayojana abhidhānam ākhyātam idānīm viśeṣeṇa avacchindan āha tatra iti vākya upanyāse
translated: The purpose has been stated generally before, now, distinguishing it specifically, he says tatra (in that), in the statement of the sentence.

original: etad arthātmanopi saṃbhavāt prakaraṇātmana ity āha /
analyzed: etat saṃbhavāt prakaraṇa ātmanaḥ iti āha
translated: Since the meaning of that word is also possible, he says of the context.

original: tad śabdārthau sahitau kāvyam kāvyā / / iti /
analyzed: tad śabda arthau sahitau kāvyam kāvyā iti
translated: The combination of the meaning of the word tat (that) and kāvya (poetry) is kāvya.

original: kathaṃ punar vyutpādanaṃ parokṣārthetyādiśabdarūpasya prakaraṇasya prayojanam ity🔽āśaṃkya sarvaśabdasādhāraṇaprayojanopanyāsapūrvakam asya tadyogaṃ darśayitum yathāsvam
analyzed: katham punar vyutpādanam parokṣa artha ityādi śabda rūpasya prakaraṇasya prayojanam iti  āśaṃkya sarva śabda sādhāraṇa prayojana upanyāsa pūrvakam asya tad yogam darśayitum yathāsvam
translated: How again is the purpose of the context, which is in the form of words that convey an indirect meaning, explained?

analyzed: ityādinā upakramate
translated: Suspecting this, in order to show its connection by first stating the purpose common to all words, he begins with yathāsvam (each one).

analyzed: yasya yadātmīyam iti asya arthaḥ
translated: The meaning of yasyāyam ātmabhūtaḥ (whose this is the essence) is:

original: vākyasya / ekasminn arthe prādhānyena pratipādye ' upakāryopakārakabhāvenāvasthitasya padasamūhasya /
analyzed: vākyasya ekasmin arthe prādhānyena pratipādye upakārya upakāraka bhāvena avasthitasya pada samūhasya
translated: Of a sentence, of a group of words that stand in the relation of the object to be helped and the helper, in the sense that is to be conveyed primarily as one.

analyzed: hiḥ yasmāt arthe
translated: Hi is for the reason.

analyzed: tat eva atra na asti iti āha
translated: That itself is not here, he says: That and so on.

analyzed: caḥ yasmāt arthe
translated: Cha is for the reason.

analyzed: padānām sup tiṅ ntānām śabdānām avāntaravākya antargatānām
translated: Of the words, which are in the nominative case, which are included in the intermediate sentences,

analyzed: hetu bindu saṃjñaka mahāvākya apekṣayā tad antarbhūtānām vākyānām
translated: in relation to the great sentence called the Drop of Reasons, which is included within it, of the sentences,

analyzed: tad tad artha dvāreṇa tena
translated: by the door of each meaning, the mutual connection is the dependence.

original: parasparasaṃsargāt' Sataḥ paraṃ sarvatra mudritahetubinduṭīkāyāḥS' iti saṃjñā bodhyā /
analyzed: paraspara saṃsargāt sataḥ param sarvatra mudrita hetu bindu ṭīkāyāḥ iti saṃjñā bodhyā
translated: By the mutual connection, the name of the commentary on the Drop of Reasons, which is sealed everywhere, should be understood.

original: p / nanv etāvatāpi na jñāyate kotra samudāyārtho yasmin pratipādye amīṣāṃ parasparasambandhena vyāpāra ity āha tathāhi / iti /
analyzed: nanu etāvatā api na jñāyate kaḥ utra samudāya arthaḥ yasmin pratipādye amīṣām paraspara sambandhena vyāpāraḥ iti āha tathā hi iti
translated: Now, even with this much, it is not known what is the collective meaning here, in which these operate by mutual connection, he says: Thus, and so on.

original: nipātasamudāyaścāyaṃ yasmād ity asminn arthe sarvatra /
analyzed: nipāta samudāyaḥ ca ayam yasmāt iti asmin arthe sarvatra
translated: And this collection of particles is everywhere in the sense of because.

analyzed: vyutpādyate vipratipatti nirākaraṇena pratipādyate itiḥ hetau
translated: It is explained, it is taught by the removal of disagreement. In the reason.
