original: sarvasya sarvaḥ svabhāvaḥ syād ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: sarvasya sarvaḥ svabhāvaḥ syāt iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the nature of everything should be everything.

original: digādivad ahetoḥ sato deśakālaniyamo neṣṭa eveti vādini tu deśakālagrahaṇaṃ dṛṣṭāntārthaṃ draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: diś ādi vat ahetoḥ sataḥ deśa kāla niyamaḥ na iṣṭaḥ eva iti vādini tu deśa kāla grahaṇam dṛṣṭānta artham draṣṭavyam
translated: But when the opponent maintains that there is no restriction of place and time for what is causeless, like space etc., the mention of place and time should be seen as for the sake of the example.

original: tena yathā deśakālaniyamo heturahitasya nāsti tathā dravyaniyamo 'pi na syād ityarthaḥ /
analyzed: tena yathā deśa kāla niyamaḥ hetu rahitasya na asti tathā dravya niyamaḥ na syāt iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that just as there is no restriction of place and time for what is devoid of cause, so too there would be no restriction of substance.

original: etad eva taddhi / ityādinā samarthayati /🔽yasmāt tadgamakaṃ vastu kartṛ kiñcid gamyaṃkañcidkvacid
analyzed: etat eva tat hi ityādinā samarthayati  hiḥ yasmāt tad gamakam vastu kartṛ kiñcid
translated: He supports this very point with That is indeed... etc.

original: dharmiṇyupanīyeta agnir vā na veti / tadviparītaṃ vā syāt /
analyzed: dharmiṇī upanīyeta agniḥ vā na vā iti tad viparītam vā syāt
translated: Because that which is the cause, some substance, would be presented somewhere in the subject, either as having fire or not, or as the opposite of that.

original: yasya / vastuno yatra / gamye kiñcid dravyam āyattaṃ /
analyzed: yasya vastunaḥ yatra gamye kiñcid dravyam āyattam
translated: For that substance, in that which is to be inferred, some substance is dependent,

original: na veti asya vivaraṇaṃ anāyattam iti /
analyzed: na vā iti asya vivaraṇam anāyattam iti
translated: or not. The explanation of this is not dependent.

original: kvacid iti mudrite saṃpūritaḥ pāṭhaḥ samyak
analyzed: kvacid iti mudrite saṃpūritaḥ pāṭhaḥ samyak
translated: In the printed text, the reading somewhere is filled in correctly.

analyzed: anvaya mukhena uktvā vyatireka mukheṇa api upapādayati anyathā iti
translated: Having stated it from the perspective of positive concomitance, he also establishes it from the perspective of negative concomitance with otherwise.

analyzed: ityādinā upasaṃharati
translated: He concludes with Therefore... etc.

analyzed: tatas iti mudrite saṃpūritaḥ pāṭhaḥ
translated: In the printed text, the reading from that is filled in.

analyzed: pāda prasārikā iti
translated: It is a foot-spread.

analyzed: sukha avasthāna upalakṣaṇam idam draṣṭavyam
translated: This should be seen as a mark for easy understanding.

analyzed: abhidhātavyam eva kāraṇam
translated: The cause itself is to be expressed.

original: na tu bhavadabhipretam ity āha tac ca / iti /
analyzed: na tu bhavat abhipretam iti āha tat ca iti
translated: But it is not as intended by you, he says: and that.

analyzed: itiḥ tasmāt
translated: Itiḥ means therefore.

analyzed: tad vikalāḥ avinābhāva rahitāḥ
translated: That is incomplete means lacking invariable concomitance.

original: etad evācāryavacanena saṃsyandayann āha tathā cāha / iti /
analyzed: etat eva ācārya vacanena saṃsyandayan āha tathā ca āha iti
translated: Connecting this very thing with the words of the teacher, he says: Thus it is said.

original: syād etat asaty api tatsvābhāvye tatkāryatve vā kiñcid arthāntaram avyabhicaradṛṣṭam eva yathā tarucchāyā /
analyzed: syāt etat asati api tad svābhāvye tad kāryatve vā kiñcid artha antaram avyabhicara dṛṣṭam eva yathā tape taru chāyā
translated: This may be the case: Even if there is no such nature or being the effect of that, some other thing is seen to be invariably concomitant, just like the shade of a tree.

analyzed: yathā tulāyāḥ arvāgbhāga unnāmau anāmau parabhāgau anāma unnāmau iti
translated: Just as the rising and falling of the lower part of a scale is the rising and falling of the upper part, so it is.

original: evam ādyasmābhirdharmottarapradīpe vistareṇa nirūpitam ity āstām tāvad iha /
analyzed: evam ādi asmābhiḥ dharmottara pradīpe vistareṇa nirūpitam iti āstām tāvat iha
translated: This has been investigated in detail by us in the Dīpa commentary on Dharmottara. Let that be for now here.

original: syād etad avinābhāvasya tādātmyatadutpattyor avyabhicāre nimittam na tāvat tādātmyatadutpattī
analyzed: syāt etat avinābhāvasya tādātmya tad utpattyoḥ avyabhicāre nimittam na tāvat tādātmya tad utpattī
translated: This may be the case: The cause of the invariable concomitance of identity and origination is not identity and origination,

original: sto yathā cāyaṃ tathā tadanyopi tadavyabhicārī ca na ca tasya tatsvabhāvatvaṃ tatkāryatvañ ceti /
analyzed: staḥ yathā ca ayam tathā tad anyaḥ api tad avyabhicārī ca  na ca tasya tad svabhāva tvam tad kārya tvam ca iti
translated: and just as this is, so is another that is invariably concomitant with that, and it is not the nature of that and being the effect of that.

analyzed: atra ucyate
translated: Here it is said:

analyzed: na avinābhāvaḥ nāma anyaḥ eva anvaya vyatirekavataḥ vinābhāvinaḥ rūpāt
translated: Invariable concomitance is not something else than the form of that which is invariably concomitant with positive and negative concomitance.

original: kevalaṃ kayācid vyapekṣayā tato bhinna iva kathyate / na tu tāvatā vastuto bhinna eva / avinābhāvi ca rūpaṃ kiñcid avyabhicaritavyād arthāntaraṃ
analyzed: kevalam kayācid vyapekṣayā tatas bhinnaḥ iva kathyate na tu tāvatā vastutas bhinnaḥ eva avinābhāvi ca rūpam kiñcid avyabhicaritavyāt arthāntaram
translated: It is merely said to be different from that by some dependence, but it is not really different to that extent. And some form that is invariably concomitant is not a different object from what is not deviating,

original: kiñcid anarthāntaram /🔽tasya tatkāryatayāiva pratibandho 'narthānta tu tādātmyena /
analyzed: kiñcid anartha antaram  tasya tad kārya tayā iva tu tādātmyena
translated: and some is not a different object.🔽Its relation is only by being the effect of that, but non-difference is by identity.

analyzed: atas eva avinābhāva bhāvāt tādātmya tad utpatti vyavahāraḥ sādhyate
translated: For this very reason, the usage of identity and origination is established from the existence of invariable concomitance.

original: tadabhāvaṃ tu tad api rūpaṃ nāstīti pratipādyata iti sarvam avadātam /
analyzed: tad abhāvam tu tat api rūpam na asti iti pratipādyate iti sarvam avadātam
translated: But it is taught that that form does not exist in the absence of that, so everything is clear.

original: atra / asminn arthe prayogo / dvyavayaṃ sādhanavākyam /
analyzed: atra asmin arthe prayogaḥ dvi avayam sādhana vākyam
translated: Here, in this matter, the syllogism is a statement of proof with two terms.

analyzed: tad utpatti pakṣe tu tad kāraṇena ca iti api
translated: But in the case of origination from that, it is also by the cause of that.

original: syād etat yathā tādātmyatadutpattyabhāvo 'py anupalabdhiḥ sādhyāvyabhicāriṇī tathānyad api kiṃ na bhaved ity svabhāve /ti
analyzed: syāt etat yathā anupalabdhiḥ sādhya avyabhicāriṇī tathā anyat api kim na bhavet iti
translated: This might be said: Just as non-apprehension, which is the absence of identity and origination, is the invariable probandum, why can't something else also be so? It is said to be the nature.

analyzed: abhāva vyavahāra yogya tāyāḥ sādhanāt iti abhiprāyaḥ
translated: The intention is that it is established as suitable for the usage of non-existence.

original: tādātmyaṃ / lakṣanaṃ nibandhanaṃ yasya sa tathā /
analyzed: tādātmyam lakṣanam nibandhanam yasya sa tathā
translated: That which has identity as its characteristic, its basis, is so.

original: tad apiācāryasyābhimatam iti darśayann āha taduktam / iti /
analyzed: tat api ācāryasya abhimatam iti darśayan āha tat uktam iti
translated: Showing that even that is accepted by the teacher, he says: That has been stated.

original: idānīm imam eva pakṣadharmaityādiślokaṃ anyathā vyācikhyāsuranena yāvanto 'rthā nirdiṣṭāḥ tāvataḥ parisaṃkhyātum āha tad evam / iti
analyzed: idānīm imam eva pakṣa dharma etyādi ślokam anyathā vyācikhyāsuḥ anena yāvantaḥ rthāḥ nirdiṣṭāḥ tāvataḥ parisaṃkhyātum āha tat evam iti
translated: Now, intending to explain this very verse beginning with the property of the subject in a different way, he says in order to enumerate as many meanings as have been indicated: Thus, that.

analyzed: yuktiḥ
translated: Its reasoning.

analyzed: tad upadarśakam ca pramāṇam
translated: And the means of valid knowledge that shows that.

analyzed: tad upapattiḥ ca iti āloka saṃmataḥ pāṭhaḥ
translated: And its justification. This is the accepted reading by Āloka.

original: etac chlokavyākhyānasyāparām api vidhāṃ darśayann āha athavā / iti /
analyzed: etat śloka vyākhyānasya aparām api vidhām darśayan āha athavā iti
translated: Showing another method of explaining this verse, he says: Or else.

analyzed: tu lakṣya anuvādena lakṣaṇa vidhāna param vivakṣitam
translated: But the previous one is intended to prescribe the definition by restating the definiendum.

original: na tv avadhāraṇacintākṛteti tato bhinnam idaṃ vyākhyānam /
analyzed: na tu avadhāraṇa cintā kṛtā iti tatas bhinnam idam vyākhyānam
translated: But this explanation is different because it is not intended for the purpose of determining.

original: katham idam uktam avadhāraṇam upapadyata ity abhipretya pṛcchati /
analyzed: katham idam uktam avadhāraṇam upapadyate iti abhipretya pṛcchati
translated: Intending to ask how this determination is possible, he says: What is the reason?

analyzed: kim kāraṇam atra iti prastāvāt
translated: Here, because of the context.

analyzed: kim iti sāmānyatas kāraṇam pṛcchati
translated: He asks the general reason with what.

original: bhāvād iti śliṣṭanirdeśam abhisandhāya trividhasya ca / ity uktam /
analyzed: iti śliṣṭa nirdeśam abhisandhāya trividhasya ca iti uktam
translated: Intending the connected indication with because of existence, he says of the threefold and so on.

original: tathā hy avinābhāve niyamān niyatatvād ity ukte kasyety āśaṃkāyāṃ trividhasya ca śrutatvāt trividhasyeti yujyate vaktum /
analyzed: tathā hi avinābhāve niyamāt niyata tvāt iti ukte kasya iti āśaṃkāyām trividhasya ca śruta tvāt trividhasya iti yujyate vaktum
translated: For thus, when it is said that there is invariable concomitance because of the restriction, if there is doubt as to what [is restricted], and since the threefold [nature of the reason] has been mentioned, it is appropriate to say 'of the threefold'.

analyzed: avinābhāva niyamāt s
translated: By the restriction of invariable concomitance,

analyzed: evam
translated: in this way, by the double specification,

original: vyākhyātena korthātiśayaḥ prakāśito bhavatīty āha tena / iti /
analyzed: vyākhyātena kortha atiśayaḥ prakāśitaḥ bhavati iti āha tena iti
translated: what additional meaning is made clear by the explanation? He says 'therefore'.

analyzed: dvau api iti śabdau hetu arthau
translated: Both the words 'api' have the meaning of reason.

analyzed: evam bhavati
translated: It becomes thus.

original: tataḥ / kāraṇāt trividhahetuvāhyeṣu hetuvyavahāraṃ kurvanto nirastā bhavanti /
analyzed: tatas kāraṇāt trividha hetu vāhyeṣu hetu vyavahāram kurvantaḥ nirastāḥ bhavanti
translated: From that, because of that reason, those who make the usage of reason in what is outside the three kinds of reasons are refuted.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why? Because of the absence of invariable concomitance.

original: trivedhe ca hetāv ahetutām ācakṣāṇā nirastā bhavanti /
analyzed: tri vedhe ca hetau ahetu tām ācakṣāṇāḥ nirastāḥ bhavanti
translated: And those who declare the non-reasonhood in the threefold reason are refuted.

analyzed: kutas bhāvāt
translated: Why? Because here invariable concomitance necessarily exists.

analyzed: āloka saṃmataḥ pāṭhaḥ samyak
translated: The reading approved by Ālok is correct.

analyzed: na tu yathā saṃpūritaḥ
translated: But not as it is filled in.

analyzed: ahetu tvam s
translated: Non-reasonhood.

original: p / asmin vyākhyāne hetvābhāsās tato 'pare iti vyākhyātuṃ pūrvapakṣaṃ racayann āhatathaitat / /
analyzed: asmin vyākhyāne hetvābhāsāḥ pare iti vyākhyātum pūrvapakṣam racayan iti
translated: In this explanation, the fallacious reasons are to be explained as 'different from those'. Setting forth the prima facie view, he says 'thus this'.

original: dvedhā hi tadaṃśavyāptiviraho viparyayavyāpteḥ viparyaye bādhakapramāṇābhāvād ity abhiprāyeṇāha viparyaye /tyādi /
analyzed: dvedhā hi tad aṃśa vyāpti virahaḥ viparyaya vyāpteḥ viparyaye bādhaka pramāṇa abhāvāt iti abhiprāyeṇa āha
translated: The absence of pervasion of the part of that [reason] in two ways is due to the non-pervasion of the opposite. The intention is that there is no evidence of contradiction in the opposite. With this intention, he says in the opposite and so on.

original: te / buddhiniviṣṭā asiddhaviruddhānaikāntikā heturūpavikalatayā hetvābhāsā gamyanta eva /
analyzed: te buddhi niviṣṭāḥ asiddha viruddha anaikāntikāḥ hetu rūpa vikala tayā hetvābhāsāḥ gamyante eva
translated: Those [fallacious reasons] that are fixed in the mind, being defective in the form of a reason due to being unestablished, contradictory, or inconclusive, are indeed understood as fallacious reasons.

analyzed: asiddha ityādi tu vāstava anuvādaḥ
translated: Unestablished and so on is a true statement.

original: na tu tatsaṃjñayā jñātais taiḥ prayojananaṃ
analyzed: na tu tad saṃjñayā jñātaiḥ taiḥ prayojananam
translated: But there is no purpose in knowing them by that name.

analyzed: caritārtha tvāt
translated: Because the purpose has been served.

original: evam api vā prajñāiḥ jñāyanta iti na kācit kṣatiḥ /
analyzed: evam api vā prajñāiḥ jñāyanta iti na kācid kṣatiḥ
translated: Even so, if they are known by the wise, there is no harm.

analyzed: tatra etat s
translated: In that [treatise], this is the case.

original: evadeva sāmānyanyāyopadarśanamukhena prasādhayann āha tathāhi / iti /
analyzed: eva deva sāmānya nyāya upadarśana mukhena prasādhayan āha tathā hi iti
translated: Establishing this very [point] by way of showing the general principle, he says thus.

original: atrāpi vyākhyāne aṅgāṅgibhāvena pratipāditānām arthānām avacchedaṃ kurvann āha tad atreti / /🔽tadubhayasya trividho hetur eva /
analyzed: atra api vyākhyāne aṅga aṅgi bhāvena pratipāditānām arthānām avacchedam kurvan āha tat atra iti  tad ubhayasya trividhaḥ hetuḥ eva
translated: In this explanation also, delimiting the meanings that are presented as components and sub-components, he says in that [treatise] and so on.🔽The cause of both of those is threefold, and only threefold.

original: trividha eva hetur ity asyāvadhāraṇadvayasya kāraṇam / upapattī dve arthatvāt /
analyzed: trividhaḥ eva hetuḥ iti asya avadhāraṇa dvayasya kāraṇam upapattī dve iti artha tvāt
translated: The reason for the two determinatives only threefold and only is because of the two proofs.

analyzed: śliṣṭasya ṣaṣṭhyā saptamyā ca saṃgatasya
translated: Of what is connected, by the sixth and seventh [cases], what is related.

analyzed: avinābhāva niyamāt iti asya nirdeśāt
translated: Because of the statement: “due to the restriction of invariable concomitance.”

original: anantaroktās trayo 'rthā imau ca dvikāraṇalakṣaṇau dvāv arthāpattayaś caka iti ṣaḍarthā bhavanti /
analyzed: anantara uktāḥ trayaḥ rthāḥ imau ca dvi kāraṇa lakṣaṇau dvau arthāpattayaḥ cakaḥ iti ṣaṣ arthāḥ bhavanti
translated: The two meanings of the two characteristics of the two causes, which were mentioned immediately before, and these two meanings of presumption, make six meanings.

original: asminn eva śloke pūrvavyākhyānāparityāgenāvṛttyaivāparam api vyākhyānam abhyuccinvann āha kiñceti / /
analyzed: asmin eva śloke pūrva vyākhyāna aparityāgena āvṛttyā eva aparam api vyākhyānam abhyuccinvan āha kiñca iti
translated: In this very verse, abandoning the previous explanation, he repeats it and brings up another explanation, saying “Moreover.”

analyzed: nanu prathame eva vyākhyāne
translated: But in the first explanation itself, presumption is of three kinds only.

original: sa prabhedasya vyutpādanam iti bruvatā sa hetus traidhā kāryasvabhāvānupalabdhibhedabhinna iti prakāśitam evaitat /
analyzed: iti prabhedasya vyutpādanam iti bruvatā sa hetuḥ traidhā kārya svabhāva anupalabdhi bheda bhinnaḥ iti prakāśitam eva etat
translated: By saying “the classification of that is explained,” it is shown that that reason is divided into three kinds: effect, nature, and non-apprehension.

analyzed: katham vyākhyāna antaram idam iti ced
translated: If it is asked how this is a different explanation,

analyzed: satyam etat
translated: it is true.

original: kevalaṃ tridhaiva sa ity atra vyākhyānāntaram idaṃ vidheyaṃ tac ca tadā sujñātaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: kevalam tridhā eva saḥ iti atra vyākhyāna antaram idam vidheyam tat ca tadā su jñātam bhavati
translated: This is only to be explained as a different explanation of “that is of three kinds only,” and that is well understood then.

original: yady asya prākpravṛttaṃ vyākhyānam upadarśya pradarśyata ity abhiprāyeṇa tad vyākhyānam anūditam /
analyzed: yadi asya prāc pravṛttam vyākhyānam upadarśya pradarśyate iti abhiprāyeṇa tat vyākhyānam anūditam
translated: With the intention that if the previous explanation is shown, it is shown, that explanation is repeated.

original: etad apekṣeṇa tu anena kiñcaśabdārtham ujjvalayatā yat pradarśyate tad eva vyākhyānāntaraṃ draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: etat apekṣeṇa tu anena kiñca śabda artham ujjvalayatā yat pradarśyate tat eva vyākhyāna antaram draṣṭavyam
translated: But the meaning of the word 'kvacit' (in some cases) should be understood as shown by the author of the Vartika, who has used it in the sense of 'in some cases' with reference to this (definition of the author of the Nyaya-mañjarī).

analyzed: ajahat kārya tva ādi prabhedaḥ eva ayam prabhedaḥ jñātavyaḥ
translated: This distinction should be understood as the same as that of 'not abandoning the effect' and so on.

original: tenāyam arthaḥ kāryādibhedabhinna eva pratyekaṃ pakṣadharmatvānvayavyatirekātmakas trirūpa eveti /
analyzed: tena ayam arthaḥ kārya ādi bheda bhinnaḥ eva pratyekam pakṣa dharma tva anvaya vyatireka ātmakaḥ trirūpaḥ eva iti
translated: The meaning is that each of these (three kinds of inference) has three aspects, consisting of being a property of the subject, positive and negative concomitance, and being different from the effect and so on.

original: etenaikadvipadaparyudāsena ṣaṭpakṣān pratikṣipya saptamapakṣaparigraheṇānumānalakṣaṇam vārtikakṛto darśayati /
analyzed: etena eka dvi pada paryudāsena ṣaṣ pakṣān pratikṣipya saptama pakṣa parigraheṇa anumāna lakṣaṇam vārtika kṛtaḥ darśayati
translated: Having thus refuted six theses by the exclusion of one and two terms, the author of the Vartika shows the definition of inference by accepting the seventh thesis.

analyzed: yatas eka pada parigraheṇa trayaḥ pakṣā
translated: For when one term is accepted, there are three theses.

analyzed: dvipada parigraheṇa api trayaḥ iti ṣaṭkam
translated: And when two terms are accepted, there are also three, making six.

analyzed: tad paryudāsena saptikā saptama  parigrahaḥ
translated: By excluding those, the seventh is accepted.

original: tathāhi pakṣadharmo hetur ity ucyamāne yasya sapakṣenanvayo vipakṣe ca pravṛttiḥ sopi hetuḥ syāt /
analyzed: tathā hi pakṣa dharmaḥ hetuḥ iti ucyamāne yasya sapakṣena anvayaḥ vipakṣe ca pravṛttiḥ saḥ api hetuḥ syāt
translated: For example, when it is said that the reason is a property of the subject, then even that which is concomitant with the similar instance and occurs in the dissimilar instance would be a reason.

analyzed: yathā nityaḥ śabdaḥ kṛtaka tvāt iti
translated: For example, 'Sound is eternal because it is produced,'

original: sapakṣe yasyānvaya ity vipakṣapravṛtter apakṣadharmasya hetutvaṃ syāt /
analyzed: sapakṣe yasya anvayaḥ iti vipakṣa pravṛtteḥ apakṣa dharmasya hetu tvam syāt
translated: when it is said that the reason is that which is concomitant with the similar instance, then even a property of the subject that occurs in the dissimilar instance would be a reason.

original: yathā nityaḥ śabdaś cākṣuṣatvāt sāmānyap / vad iti /
analyzed: yathā nityaḥ śabdaḥ cākṣuṣa tvāt sāmānyap iti
translated: For example, Sound is eternal because it is visible, like a universal.

original: yatathā sapakṣavyatireka ity ucyamāne yo 'pakṣadharmaḥ sapakṣe ca nāsti sa hetuḥ syāt /
analyzed: sapakṣa vyatirekaḥ iti ucyamāne pakṣa dharmaḥ sapakṣe ca na asti sa hetuḥ syāt
translated: If it were said that the reason is the presence of the property in similar instances and the absence of the property in dissimilar instances, then a reason that is a property of the subject and is absent in similar instances would be a reason.

original: yathā anityaḥ śabdo 'sattvād iti /🔽pakṣadharme sapakṣe ca yo 'sti sa hetur ity ucyamāne nityaḥ śabdaḥ prameyatvād vipakṣavṛttir hetuḥ syāt /
analyzed: yathā anityaḥ sattvāt iti  pakṣa dharme sapakṣe ca yaḥ sti sa hetuḥ iti ucyamāne nityaḥ śabdaḥ prameya tvāt iti vipakṣa vṛttiḥ hetuḥ syāt
translated: For example, Sound is non-eternal because it is non-existent.🔽If it were said that the reason is the property of the subject and the property that is present in similar instances, then Sound is eternal because it is cognizable would be a reason that occurs in dissimilar instances.

original: pakṣadharmaḥ sapakṣe nāstīty ucyamāne nityaḥ śabdo jātimattve sati śrāvaṇatvād ity ayaṃ sapakṣavṛttihīno hetuḥ syāt /
analyzed: pakṣa dharmaḥ sapakṣe na asti iti ucyamāne nityaḥ śabdaḥ jātimat tve sati śrāvaṇa tvāt iti ayam sapakṣa vṛtti hīnaḥ hetuḥ syāt
translated: If it were said that the reason is the property of the subject and the property that is absent in similar instances, then Sound is eternal because it is audible and possesses the quality of being a product would be a reason that lacks occurrence in similar instances.

original: sapakṣe 'sti vipakṣe ca nāstīty ucyamāne anityāḥ paramānavaḥ kṛtakatvād ity ayam apakṣadharmo hetuḥ syāt /🔽tad etat sarvam mā bhūd iti samudāyopādāne iti /
analyzed: sapakṣe sti vipakṣe ca na asti iti ucyamāne anityāḥ parama anavaḥ kṛtaka tvāt iti ayam apakṣa dharmaḥ hetuḥ syāt  tat etat sarvam mā bhūt iti samudāya upādāne iti
translated: If it were said that the reason is the property that is present in similar instances and absent in dissimilar instances, then The supreme atoms are non-eternal because they are produced would be a reason that is a property of neither.🔽In order to avoid all of these, the compound sādhya-dharma-viśiṣṭa-sapakṣa is used.

original: idam eva ca sarvaṃ buddhāvādhāyadharmottarapradīpe 'smābhir abhyadhāyi trirūpāl liṅgād iti ca ācakṣāṇena ityādi /
analyzed: idam eva ca sarvam buddhau ādhāya dharmottara pradīpe smābhiḥ abhyadhāyi trirūpāt liṅgāt iti ca ācakṣāṇena ityādi
translated: And all of this has been stated by us in the Buddhapālita-dharma-uttarapradīpa, saying from a reason with three characteristics and so on.

analyzed: nanu pakṣa dharma vacane pakṣa dharma tā uktā
translated: But when the property of the subject is stated, the property of the subject is stated.

original: anvayavyatirekātmakayos tu rūpayoḥ kenābhidhānaṃ yenaivaṃ vyākhyāyata ity āha tadaṃśe /ti /
analyzed: anvaya vyatireka ātmakayoḥ tu rūpayoḥ kena abhidhānam yena evam vyākhyāyate iti āha
translated: But by whom is the form consisting of positive and negative concomitance stated, by whom is it explained in this way? He says: in that part.

analyzed: atra eva sāmarthya avacchinnam avadarśayan āha
translated: Here itself, showing what is implied by the word only, he says: etc.

analyzed: pūrva prabheda aparityāgena asya bhedasya vivakṣita tvāt
translated: Because this distinction is intended without abandoning the previous distinction.

analyzed: ubhayam api tad śabdena parāmṛṣati
translated: Both are referred to by the word that.

analyzed: avinābhāva bhāvaḥ eva abādhita viṣaya tvasya bhāvāt na tad rūpa antaram
translated: The existence of invariable concomitance itself is the existence of unobstructed object, not a separate form of it.

original: vastūnāñ ca viruddhasvabhāvadvayābhāvāt tatraikasmiṃs tadavinābhāvini tadviruddharūpāvinābhāvino 'nyasyāsaṃbhavenāpipya
analyzed: vastūnām ca viruddha svabhāva dvaya abhāvāt tatra ekasmin tad avinābhāvini tad viruddha rūpa avinābhāvinaḥ nyasya asaṃbhavena āpipya
translated: And because things do not have two contradictory natures, in that one which is invariably concomitant with that, another which is invariably concomitant with a form contradictory to it is impossible.

analyzed: pratipakṣa tvam nāma tad antargatam eva
translated: Even the state of being the counter-correlate is included within that.

analyzed: yasya tu iṣṭam tad abhiprāyeṇa
translated: But for one who accepts it, the separate mention is for that purpose.
Of a separate form. Possibility. Existence.

analyzed: sa yasya asti tasmin
translated: That which has it.

analyzed: avinābhāva abhāvam eva nahi ityādinā samarthayati
translated: He supports it with The absence of invariable concomitance itself is not, etc.

original: rūpāntarayoginy apy avinābhāvāsambhavād asiddhas tadbhāva ity āha tadvati / pratibandhanibandhanāvinā bhāvavatīti /
analyzed: rūpa antara yogini api avinābhāva asambhavāt asiddhaḥ tad bhāvaḥ iti āha tadvati pratibandha nibandhana avinā bhāvavati iti
translated: Even if it has a different form, because invariable concomitance is not possible, that existence is unestablished. He says in that which exists [means] having invariable concomitance as its basis.

original: yadi tasminn api rūpāntaraṃ syāt kevalam apramāṇakam etad ucyata ity āha yathā ce /ti /
analyzed: yadi tasmin api rūpa antaram syāt kevalam apramāṇakam etat ucyate iti āha yathā
translated: If it were to have a different form even in that [case], it is merely said to be without a means of knowledge. He says and if [means] if it were to have a different form even in that [case].
It is specified by the reason.

analyzed: vakṣyati s
translated: He will say:

analyzed: pakṣaḥ dharma dharmi samudāyaḥ
translated: The subject is the totality of the property and the property-possessor.

original: tathābhūtasamudāyasādhakapramāṇābhāvena taddharmatayā sarvasyaiva grahītum aśakyatvād iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: tathābhūta samudāya sādhaka pramāṇa abhāvena tad dharmatayā sarvasya eva grahītum aśakya tvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that it cannot be grasped as having that property by the absence of a means of knowledge that establishes such a totality.

original: atha kathañcit taddharmasya siddhiḥ / niścayas tasyāṃ vā siddhaprayojanatvāt tasya hetor vaiyarthyam /
analyzed: atha kathañcid tad dharmasya siddhiḥ niścayaḥ tasyām vā siddha prayojana tvāt tasya hetoḥ vaiyarthyam
translated: If, in some way, there is the establishment of that property, then in that [case], because the purpose is already established, the reason is useless.

original: parasthānapatitatvāt para evāsāv ity abhiprāyeṇaīśvarasena eva paraḥ / abhipretaḥ /
analyzed: para sthāna patita tvāt paraḥ eva asau iti abhiprāyeṇa īśvara senaḥ eva paraḥ abhipretaḥ
translated: With the intention that because it falls under the domain of another, it is indeed another, Isvarasena himself is intended as another.

analyzed: adhi vi adhi
translated: superimposed

analyzed: karaṇa tvena sādhya adhikaraṇāt vibhinna adhikaraṇa tvena asiddham aniścitam
translated: It is unestablished, uncertain, due to being in a different locus than the locus of what is to be established.

original: tatra cirāspadībhūte dharmiṇi dvayor apy anyayor asiddhatvāt /
analyzed: tatra cira āspadībhūte dharmiṇi dvayoḥ api anyayoḥ asiddha tvāt
translated: There, in the property-possessor that has become distant, because both others are unestablished.

original: idam iha svarūpāsiddham idaṃ tu vyadhikaraṇāsiddham ity etad eva kuto vyavasthāpyam iti cet /
analyzed: idam iha svarūpa asiddham idam tu vyadhikaraṇa asiddham iti etat eva kutas vyavasthāpyam iti ced
translated: If it is asked how this is to be established: this is a non-establishment of one's own nature here, but that is a non-establishment of a different locus, how is this to be established?

analyzed: satyam etat
translated: This is true.

analyzed: kevalam tatra asiddhaḥ pi hetuḥ anya dharmi gata tvena upādīyate
translated: Only there, even an unestablished reason is taken as belonging to another substratum.

analyzed: sa vyadhikaraṇa asiddhaḥ boddhavyaḥ
translated: That should be understood as a non-establishment of a different locus.

original: p / kasmāt nāśaṅkanīyam ity āśaṃkāyāṃ tad abhidhānīyaṃ tadabhivyaktatvād anena noktam /
analyzed: kasmāt na āśaṅkanīyam iti āśaṃkāyām tat abhidhānīyam tad abhivyakta tvāt anena na uktam
translated: Why should it not be suspected? When there is doubt, that should be stated. It is not stated by this because of the manifestation of that.

original: dharmo hetus tadaṃśena vyāpta ityukte vā sakalopi hi jānāty eva /
analyzed: dharmaḥ hetuḥ tad aṃśena vyāptaḥ iti ukte vā sakalaḥ api hi jānāti eva
translated: Or when it is said that the property is pervaded by the reason in part, everyone knows.

analyzed: na tasya ātmanaḥ eva aṃśena vyāptaḥ iti abhiprāyāt
translated: Because the idea is that it is not pervaded by the whole of itself.

analyzed: ācāryeṇa iti
translated: By the teacher.

analyzed: ācārya diś nāgena
translated: By the teacher Dignāga.

original: paksasya dharmiṇo dharmasyānupapatteḥ na tāvat karmadhārayo ta ca na dviguḥ /
analyzed: dharmiṇaḥ dharmasya anupapatteḥ na tāvat ca na dviguḥ
translated: Because of the non-establishment of the property of the subject, the compound is not a karmadhāraya, nor is it a dvigu.

analyzed: an avyaya tvāt ca na avyayībhāvaḥ
translated: And because it is not an indeclinable, it is not an avyayībhāva.

analyzed: yat śabda vācya asaṃbhavāt
translated: Because the word yat does not occur.

original: na hi sa eva dharmī sa eva dharma ity arthavirodhāc ca samāsāntasyānicpratyayaprasakteś ca na bahuvrīhiḥ /
analyzed: na hi saḥ eva dharmī saḥ eva dharmaḥ iti artha virodhāt ca samāsa antasya an it pratyaya prasakteḥ ca na bahuvrīhiḥ
translated: And because of the contradiction in meaning that the same substratum is the same property, and because of the necessity of the affix -i for the ending of a compound, it is not a bahuvrīhi.

original: napusaṃkaliṅgāt dvivacanaprasaṅgāc ca cāarthāsaṃbhavāc ca na dvandvaḥ /
analyzed: napusaṃka liṅgāt dvivacana prasaṅgāt ca ca a artha asaṃbhavāt ca na dvandvaḥ
translated: And because of the impossibility of the dual number due to the neuter gender and the dual number, it is not a dvandva compound.

original: saptamīsamāsasūtre ca dharmaśabdasyāsaṃgrahād yogavibhāgena ṣaṣṭhīsaptamyor abhedād ity abhiprāyavān prāha ṣaṣthītatpuruṣād 🔽iti /
analyzed: saptamī samāsa sūtre ca dharma śabdasya asaṃgrahāt yogavibhāgena ṣaṣṭhī saptamyoḥ abhedāt iti abhiprāyavān prāha  / iti
translated: And because the word dharma is not included in the sūtra on the seventh case compound, and because of the difference between the sixth and seventh cases due to the division of the compound, with this intention he says from the sixth case tatpuruṣa compound.🔽From the sixth case compound.

original: ṣaṣṭhīsamāse ca rājapuruṣādau svāmyantaravyavacchedo dṛṣṭo rājñaḥ puruṣo vācyusyetiṣo nānyasyeti /
analyzed: ṣaṣṭhī samāse ca rāja puruṣa ādau svāmi antara vyavacchedaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ rājñaḥ puruṣaḥ na anyasya iti
translated: And in the sixth case compound like king's man, the exclusion of another master is seen, meaning the man of the king, not of another.

original: tadvad ihāpi pakṣasya dharmo nānyasyety anyayogavyavacchedaḥ syād ity abhisambandhaḥ /
analyzed: tadvat iha api pakṣasya dharmaḥ na anyasya iti anya yoga vyavacchedaḥ syāt iti abhisambandhaḥ
translated: Similarly here also, the property of the subject is not of another, there would be the exclusion of connection with another. This is the intended meaning.

analyzed: ṣaṣṭhī samāsāt ca s
translated: And from the sixth case compound,

original: nanu jvālā / vahniḥ /🔽ādiśabdād buddhyādi kṣaṇikatveneṣṭam iti tat aksaṇivādinaṃ taṃ prati pakṣasyasyā
analyzed: nanu jvālā vahniḥ  ādi śabdāt buddhi ādi kṣaṇika tvena iṣṭam iti tat aksaṇivādinam tam prati
translated: But the flame is not the fire.

analyzed: bhāvaḥ iti āha yat api iti
translated: From the word 'ādi,' the intellect and so on are accepted as momentary. Therefore, to him who does not accept momentariness, the property of the subject is not present. Thus he says Even what is said.

original: na pratyakṣataḥ / iti bruvatoyaṃ bhāvaḥ yadi pratyakṣeṇa kṣaṇasyopalakṣaṇaṃ syāt /
analyzed: na pratyakṣataḥ iti bruvataḥ iyam bhāvaḥ yadi pratyakṣeṇa kṣaṇasya upalakṣaṇam syāt
translated: Not by perception. The meaning of one who says this is: If the moment were to be perceived by perception,

analyzed: tadā dṛṣṭānta paryeṣaṇā paryavasānam gacchet
translated: then the search for an example would come to an end.

original: yadā tv anumānatas tadā tad api teṣām anumānam adṛṣṭāntakaṃ kathaṃ syād iti sādhanaṃ duḥkham iti /
analyzed: yadā tu anumānataḥ tadā tat api teṣām anumānam adṛṣṭāntakam katham syāt iti sādhanam duḥkham iti
translated: But when [the opponent] argues by inference, how can that inference of theirs be without an example? Thus the proof is difficult.

analyzed: etat ca kasyacid parasya abhyupagamya uktam
translated: And this is said by accepting the position of some other [opponent].

original: na tu sahetunāśavādibhir buddhyāder apy utpattikṣaṇa eva bhāvo na tu dvitīye kṣaṇa iti evaṃ lakṣaṇaṃ kṣaṇikatvam eṣṭavyam /
analyzed: na tu sa hetu nāśa vādibhiḥ buddhi ādeḥ api utpatti kṣaṇe eva bhāvaḥ na tu dvitīye kṣaṇe iti evam lakṣaṇam kṣaṇika tvam eṣṭavyam
translated: But by those who assert the destruction with a cause, momentariness should be accepted as having the characteristic that the existence of cognition, etc. is only at the moment of origination, not in the second moment.

original: āśutaravināśitvābhiprāyeṇa kṣaṇikaśabdapravṛtter iṣṭatvād iti draṣṭavyam iti /🔽tatra prati / / / / /ndhanasyāvinābhāvasya bādhakapramāṇataḥ siddhāv apy anyatve 'traiva vṛttir apekṣaṇīyeti paribhā / / / / /
analyzed: āśutara vināśi tva abhiprāyeṇa kṣaṇika śabda pravṛtteḥ iṣṭa tvāt iti draṣṭavyam iti  tatra pratindhanasya avinābhāvasya bādhaka pramāṇataḥ siddhau api anya tve vṛttiḥ apekṣaṇīyā iti paribhā kālpanika tvam
translated: It should be seen that [momentariness] is accepted as being due to the application of the word momentary with the intention of [referring to] very rapid destruction.

original: tasya pratipannaṃ syād ity āśayaḥ /🔽pratipannaṃ / svīkṛtam abhyupagatam iti yāvat /
analyzed: tasya pratipannam syāt iti āśayaḥ  pratipannam svīkṛtam abhyupagatam iti yāvat
translated: There, even if the non-apprehension of the invariable concomitance of the probandum is established by a contradictory means of knowledge, the occurrence [of the probandum] in another [similar instance] is to be expected. Thus the definition [of the invariable concomitance of the probandum] is to be modified.🔽The intention is that [the invariable concomitance of the probandum] should be accepted.🔽Accepted means admitted, agreed upon.

analyzed: iti sva sādhya pratibandhaḥ
translated: One's own means one's own probandum.

analyzed: anyatra
translated: In another place means in the Nyāyasiddhyāloka.

original: yad vastu dhūmādikaṃ kvacit parvatādau dṛṣṭaṃ niścitaṃ tasya dhūmādeḥ yatra vahnyādau
analyzed: yat vastu dhūma ādikam kvacid parvata ādau dṛṣṭam niścitam tasya dhūma ādeḥ yatra vahni ādau
translated: That object such as smoke which is seen and ascertained in some place such as a mountain, of that smoke, etc., where there is fire, etc.,

original: pratibandhaḥ pratibaddhatvam tadvidaḥ pratibandhavidaḥ puṃsas tasya pratibandhaviṣayasya
analyzed: pratibandhaḥ pratibaddha tvam tad vidaḥ pratibandha vidaḥ puṃsaḥ tasya pratibandha viṣayasya
translated: Bondage is being bound. Of that person who knows bondage, of that object of bondage,

original: vahnyādeḥ tad dhūmādi gamakam anumāpakaṃ tatra parvatādau itiḥ evam arthe /
analyzed: vahni ādeḥ tat kam gamakam anumāpakam tatra parvata ādau itiḥ evam arthe
translated: such as fire, etc., that is the cause, the inferrer, on that mountain, etc. This is the meaning.

analyzed: gatiḥ balam sāmarthyam iti yāvat
translated: Movement is power, capability - this is the meaning.

original: evaṃparam / evaṃpradhānam etad arthaṃ tattulye sadbhāvaḥ iti vacanam /
analyzed: evaṃparam evaṃpradhānam etat artham tad tulye sadbhāvaḥ iti vacanam
translated: This is the purport. This is the main point. The statement it exists in what is similar to that is like this.

analyzed: sa hetunā api tattvena hetuḥ kalpita tvena
translated: That is also a reason, by the truth of being a reason, by the nature of being imagined.

original: dharmo yasya sa taddharmā / sādhyadharmī tasya /
analyzed: dharmaḥ yasya sa tad dharmā sādhya dharmī tasya
translated: That which has that property is the subject to be proved.

analyzed: vastu balāt āgatam vāstavam
translated: Coming by the power of the real thing, it is real.

original: p / pakṣatvena tasya sapakṣatvaṃ nirākriyata ity āha sādhyatvene /ti /
analyzed: pakṣa tvena tasya sapakṣa tvam nirākriyate iti āha
translated: In order to deny that it is a similar instance by being the subject, he says by being the probandum.

analyzed: icchā vyavasthita lakṣaṇa tvena tasya avāstava tvam darśitam
translated: By having a definition that is established by desire, it is unreal.

analyzed: tena hīna bala tvam sādhya avinābhāvi tvasya avinābhāvāt iti saṃbandhaḥ
translated: By that, there is lack of strength. The connection is: because of the invariable concomitance with the probandum.

original: kasmāt tannibandhanaṃ tad ity apekṣāyām āha anyathā / iti /
analyzed: kasmāt tad nibandhanam tat iti apekṣāyām āha anyathā iti
translated: When there is expectation of why is it based on that?, he says otherwise.

analyzed: tasya avinābhāvi tvasya ayogāt ayujyamāna tvāt iti
translated: Because of the impossibility of that invariable concomitance, because of being incompatible.

analyzed: idam atra ananuvṛtteḥ iti
translated: Here, because of the non-occurrence of this,

analyzed: satyam pratividhatte
translated: He replies with True, etc.

analyzed: śiṃśapā tva ādeḥ vṛkṣa tva ādi vyavahāra sādhanasya
translated: Of something means of a reason such as being a tree for the usage of śiṃśapā etc.

original: yadāpi tathāvidhasya hetor anyatve ca prasiddhena kāryaṃ tadāpy anyatrāpy ananuvartamānaḥ kathaṃ duṣyed ity āha tadā hī /ti
analyzed: yadā api tathāvidhasya hetoḥ anyatve ca prasiddhena kāryam tadā api anyatra api ananuvartamānaḥ katham duṣyet iti āha tadā
translated: Even when the effect of such a reason is established by something else, how can it be faulty if it does not follow elsewhere? He says For then, etc.

original: viruddhopi viparyaye samyagdhetuneti ceti viparyayāniścitavṛttitvam uktam /
analyzed: viruddhaḥ api viparyaye samyak hetunā iti ca iti viparyaya aniścita vṛtti tvam uktam
translated: If it is argued that even a contradictory reason is a proper reason in the opposite case, then the uncertain pervasion in the opposite case is stated.

analyzed: tasmin dharmiṇi saṃśaya hetuḥ syāt
translated: It would be a reason for doubt in that subject.

analyzed: sādhya bhāva abhāvayoḥ iti arthāt
translated: Of the presence and absence of the probandum is understood.

analyzed: sādhya bhāva abhāva vimuktaḥ eva dharmī bhaviṣyati prakāra antara sadbhāvāt
translated: The subject would be devoid of the presence and absence of the probandum, because another mode exists.

original: tat katham asau tatra syād ity āśaṃkyāha tadubhayabahir bhāvāyogāt / sādhyavṛttivyavacchede vahnibhāvāyogāt /
analyzed: tat katham asau tatra syāt iti āśaṃkya āha tad ubhaya bahis bhāva ayogāt sādhya vṛtti vyavacchede vahni bhāva ayogāt
translated: How can it be there? Suspecting this, he says Because it is not possible to be outside of both, because it is not possible for the presence of fire to be excluded from the occurrence of the probandum.

original: kasyety āśaṃkāyām āha taddharmiṇaḥ / tasya hetor āśrayasyeti /🔽kasmāt punas tena sādhyadharmavatā /
analyzed: kasya iti āśaṃkāyām āha tad dharmiṇaḥ tasya hetoḥ āśrayasya iti  kasmāt punar tena sādhya dharmavatā
translated: When there is doubt about whose, he says of that subject, of the substratum of that reason.🔽But why must it be either with the presence of the probandum,

analyzed: tad abhāvavatā vā
translated: or with the absence of that?

analyzed: prakāra antarasya api sambhavāt iti āha
translated: He says: in the probandum.

analyzed: anyonya vyavaccheda rūpāṇām kutas prakāra antaram saṃbhavati iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is: how can there be another possibility for those which have the form of mutual exclusion?

original: syād etat antarvyāptiprasādhakād eva pramāṇādvivādādhyāsitasya dharmiṇas taddharmatvajñānān
analyzed: syāt etat antar vyāpti prasādhakāt eva pramāṇāt vivāda adhyāsitasya dharmiṇaḥ tad dharma tva jñānān
translated: This may be the case: from the very means of knowledge that establishes internal pervasion, from the knowledge of the nature of that property of the subject under dispute,

original: maulasya hetoh katham ativyaktam api vaiyarthyaṃbhadantadharmākaradattena na lakṣitam iti /
analyzed: maulasya katham ati vyaktam api vaiyarthya ambha danta dharma ākaradattena na lakṣitam iti
translated: how is it that the venerable Dharmakīrti did not notice the futility of the original reason, even though it is very clear?

analyzed: aho abhiprāya a parijñāna vilasitam
translated: Oh, the play of ignorance of intention!

original: evaṃ hi bruvato 'syāyam dṛṣṭāntadharmiṇīva sādhyadharmiṇy api sarvopasaṃhāreṇa dharmānavacchedena vyāptigrahe maulād eva sādhyasiddheḥ
analyzed: evam hi bruvataḥ syāyam   dṛṣṭānta dharmiṇī iva sādhya dharmiṇī api sarva upasaṃhāreṇa dharma anavacchedena vyāpti grahe maulāt eva sādhya siddheḥ  /
translated: For one who speaks thus, in the case of the subject of the example as well as the subject of the probandum, when the pervasion is grasped without the qualification of all properties by the original reason alone, the probandum is established.

analyzed: kutas vaiyarthyam
translated: How can there be futility?

original: itarathā dṛṣṭāntadharmiṇyapi viparyaye bādhakapramāṇavṛttāviṣyamāṇāyāṃ katham iva maulo hetur vaiyarthyaṃ nāśnuvīta /
analyzed: itarathā dṛṣṭānta dharmiṇi api viparyaye bādhaka pramāṇa vṛttau iṣyamāṇāyām katham iva maulaḥ hetuḥ vaiyarthyam na aśnuvīta
translated: Otherwise, even in the case of the subject of the example, when the operation of the means of knowledge that excludes the contrary is being stated, how could the original reason not attain futility?

original: tathāhi tatrāpi tatpravṛttaṃ dharmisāmānyopagraheṇa vyāptiṃ pratipadyate /
analyzed: tathā hi tatra api tat pravṛttam dharmi sāmānya upagraheṇa vyāptim pratipadyate
translated: For in that case also, when it operates, it grasps the pervasion by referring to the general nature of the subject.

original: ca pakṣīkṛtasyāpi jijñāsitadharmavattvaṃ tata eva siddham iti /
analyzed: tathā ca pakṣīkṛtasya api jijñāsita dharmavat tvam tatas eva siddham iti
translated: And the fact that the subject possesses the property to be inferred is established by that [reason] itself.

original: athocyate bādhakapramāṇamāhātmyāt sattvasya kṣaṇikatvasiddhāv api kiṃ na śaśaviṣāṇādes
analyzed: athā ucyate bādhaka pramāṇa māhātmyāt sattvasya kṣaṇika tva siddhau api kim na śaśaviṣāṇa ādeḥ
translated: If it is said that even if existence is established as momentary due to the greatness of the countering evidence, why is the reality of the horn of a rabbit not established?

original: tattvaṃ siddhaṃ tatas tadvyāvṛttirūpatāpratipādanārthaṃ dharmiṇo 'vaśyaṃ saṃścāyam
analyzed: tattvam siddham tatas tad vyāvṛtti rūpa tā pratipādana artham dharmiṇaḥ vaśyam san ca ayam
translated: Then, in order to teach the form of exclusion from that, the subject must necessarily be concluded as existing.

analyzed: śabda ādiḥ iti arthaḥ upasaṃhartavyaḥ
translated: The meaning is that sound and so on.

original: itaḥ sattvahetor evāsaṃhṛtāt śabdādeḥ kṣaṇikatvāvagatir nāsmanmate hetor vaiyarthyam /
analyzed: itas sattva hetoḥ eva asaṃhṛtāt śabda ādeḥ kṣaṇika tva avagatiḥ na asmad mate hetoḥ vaiyarthyam
translated: From this very unexcluded reason of existence, the momentariness of sound and so on is understood. In our view, the reason is not useless.

analyzed: nanu samānam idam asmākam api
translated: But this is the same for us too.

original: tathāhi vyāptigrāhakāt pramāṇāt tatra pravṛttād api dharmiviśeṣāparigraheṇa plavamānākārā pravṛttiḥ kṣaṇikatvasattvayos tādātmyagrāhiṇī jātā
analyzed: tathā hi vyāpti grāhakāt pramāṇāt tatra pravṛttāt api dharmi viśeṣa aparigraheṇa plavamāna ākārā pravṛttiḥ kṣaṇika tva sattvayoḥ tādātmya grāhiṇī jātā  /
translated: For thus, even from the evidence that grasps the pervasion, which operates there, the operation that arises without grasping a particular subject, which has the form of floating, has arisen as the grasper of the identity of momentariness and existence,

analyzed: na tu pravṛtti aṅgam
translated: but it is not a part of the operation.

original: yasaccedam iti tu darṣite sati idaṃ kṣaṇikaṃ śabdādi iti pravṛttyaṅgaṃ pratītir upajāyate /
analyzed: yasat ca idam iti tu darṣite sati idam kṣaṇikam śabda ādi iti pravṛtti aṅgam pratītiḥ upajāyate
translated: But when this is shown, the part of the operation, the understanding that this is momentary, sound and so on, arises.

analyzed: yatas viśiṣṭe deśa ādau pravarttate iti
translated: From which one operates in a particular place and so on.

original: katham asmanmate maula hetor vaiyarthyam p / amandamandākṣeṇocyata iti /
analyzed: katham asmad mate hetoḥ vaiyarthyam iti
translated: How is it that in our view the original reason is useless, and is said by one with unclear eyes?

original: dharmottarādibhirvigarhite 'py asminmate gatir iyaṃ asmābhir upavarṇitā /
analyzed: dharmottara ādibhiḥ vigarhite pi asmin mate gatiḥ iyam asmābhiḥ upavarṇitā
translated: Even though this view is condemned by Dharottara and others, this course of action is described by us.

original: atrāpi tu kiñcid vācyaṃ tad asmābhir evasvayūthyavicāre darśitam iha tu mā bhūd virasībhāva iti nocyata iti /
analyzed: atrā api tu kiñcid vācyam tat asmābhiḥ eva sva yūthya vicāre darśitam iha tu mā bhūt virasībhāvaḥ iti nā ucyate iti
translated: But here too something must be said. That has been shown by us ourselves in the consideration of our own group. But here, lest there be disgust, it is not stated.

analyzed: nanu viśeṣaṇena saha uditaḥ nipātaḥ yogam vyavacchinatti
translated: But doesn't the particle used along with the qualifier exclude non-connection?

original: viśeṣaṇaviśeṣyābhyām iti vacanāt /🔽atra ca pakṣa eva viśeṣaṇam iti tenaiva sahāvadhāraṇaṃ vācyam /
analyzed: viśeṣaṇa viśeṣyābhyām iti vacanāt  atra ca pakṣaḥ eva vyavacchedaka vat viśeṣaṇam iti tena eva saha avadhāraṇam vācyam
translated: Because of the statement by the qualifier and the qualified?🔽And here the qualifier is the subject itself. Therefore, the restriction should be stated with that itself.

original: tathā ca pakṣasyaive dharma ity uktau tadavastho doṣa iti cet /
analyzed: tathā ca dharmaḥ iti uktau tad avasthaḥ doṣaḥ iti ced
translated: And if it is said that the property of the subject alone is stated in that way, the fault remains as it was before. If so,

original: naitad asti /🔽viśeṣaṇaviśeṣyābhyām ity atra śābdīṃ gatim anāśrityāśritatvād viśeṣaṇam /
analyzed: na etat asti  viśeṣaṇa viśeṣyābhyām iti atra śābdīm gatim an āśritya āśrita tvāt viśeṣaṇam
translated: that is not so.🔽Here, without relying on the verbal method in by the qualifier and the qualified, the qualifier is based on the fact of being the substratum.

original: āśrayatvād viśeṣyam ity ārthena viśeṣaṇaviśeṣyayor abhipretatvāt /
analyzed: āśraya tvāt viśeṣyam iti ārthena viśeṣaṇa viśeṣyayoḥ abhipreta tvāt
translated: The qualified is based on the fact of being the support. Thus, the qualifier and the qualified are intended in the sense of being the substratum.

analyzed: sati ca evam pakṣaḥ na viśeṣaṇam
translated: And if that is so, the subject is not the qualifier.

analyzed: āśraya tvāt viśeṣyaḥ tu bhavati
translated: But it is the qualified because it is the substratum.

original: dharmas tv viśeṣaṇam eva na viśeṣya iti /
analyzed: dharmaḥ tu viśeṣaṇam eva na viśeṣyaḥ iti
translated: But Dharma is only a qualifier, not a qualified object.

original: tena sahoditanipāto 'yogam eva vyavacchinattīti sarvam avadātam /
analyzed: tena saha udita nipātaḥ yogam eva vyavacchinatti iti sarvam avadātam
translated: Therefore, the co-occurrence of that with the verb excludes impossibility. Thus everything is clear.

analyzed: caitraḥ nāma kaścid puruṣaḥ
translated: There is a certain man named Caitra.

analyzed: tena eva ākāreṇa jñātasya jñānāya praśna anupapattiḥ
translated: For the knowledge of what is known by that very form, a question is not appropriate.

analyzed: śabdāt prakaraṇa ādi saṃgrahaḥ
translated: By the word ādi (beginning with), the inclusion of context and so on is meant.

original: prakṛṣṭe ananyasādhāraṇe guṇe 'tiśaye vṛttir yasya sa / tathā /
analyzed: prakṛṣṭe an anya sādhāraṇe guṇe tiśaye vṛttiḥ yasya sa tathā
translated: He who has an operation in an excellent quality, a superiority not common to others, is so. Thus.

original: tad uktaṃ hi viśeṣasannidhir eva sāmānyaśabdānāṃ viśeṣāvasthitihetur api tu prakaraṇasāmarthyādikam arpayam api iti /
analyzed: tat uktam hi viśeṣa sannidhiḥ eva sāmānya śabdānām viśeṣa avasthiti hetuḥ api tu prakaraṇa sāmarthya ādikam arpayam api iti
translated: For it is said: The proximity of the particular is indeed the cause of the general terms remaining in the particular state, but it also depends on the power of the context and so on.

analyzed: pārthe eva samarthayate
translated: He supports this very [view] with Pārtha and so on.

analyzed: pārthaḥ pṛthāyāḥ kuntāyāḥ apatyam
translated: Pārtha is the child of Kuntī, the daughter of Pṛthā.

analyzed: yoga rūḍhiḥ ca eṣā tena arjunaḥ eva abhidhīyate
translated: And this is a figurative usage based on yoga. Therefore, Arjuna is indeed referred to.

analyzed: śrotuḥ arthāt praṣṭuḥ pratipādyasya iti yāvat
translated: Of the hearer. By implication, of the questioner, the one to be taught, is what is meant.

analyzed: tādṛśam sa atiśayam yaḥ
translated: Such, with that superiority, in archery.

analyzed: niṣidhyate
translated: Is prohibited.

analyzed: āloka sammataḥ sāmarthya ādinā iti samyak
translated: Agreed upon by the light [of reason], by the power and so on, thus correctly.

original: na tu yathā mudritaḥ prakaraṇa sāmarthyādinā iti /
analyzed: na tu yathā mudritaḥ prakaraṇa sāmarthyādinā iti
translated: But not as printed, due to the power of the context and so on.

original: kamāt tatra dhanurdharatvamātram ity āha pratipādye /ti /
analyzed: kamāt tatra dhanurdhara tva mātram iti āha
translated: Therefore, there it is said that the mere holding of a bow is to be conveyed.

analyzed: vācya tvena parigṛhyate
translated: It is referred to. It is taken as the denoted meaning.

analyzed: parāmṛśyate s
translated: It is referred to.

analyzed: anabhimatam pratiṣedhayati na dharmaḥ iti
translated: He rejects the unacceptable by saying not the property.

analyzed: kutas iti āha
translated: From where? He says of the property.

analyzed: nanu kā eṣā vācoyuktiḥ ddharmasya dharma asaṃbhavāt iti
translated: But what is this verbal trickery, because the property of the property is not possible for the property?

original: kiṃ dhūmādīnāṃ āśritatvena dharmāṇāṃ dhūmatvapārthivatvādayo dharmā na /
analyzed: kim dhūma ādīnām āśrita tvena dharmāṇām dhūma tva pārthiva tva ādayaḥ dharmāḥ na
translated: Are the properties of smoke and so on, such as smokeness and earthness, not properties of the property?

analyzed: yena evam ucyate iti
translated: By whom is it said in this way?

original: satyam etad vā kevalaṃ bodhe yatnaḥ karaṇīyaḥ /
analyzed: satyam etat vā kevalam bodhe yatnaḥ karaṇīyaḥ
translated: This is true, but effort should be made in understanding.

original: dharmaśabdeneha sādhyo vahnyādir abhipretaḥ sa ca tasya dharmo nāsty eveti kim avadyam /
analyzed: dharma śabdena iha sādhyaḥ vahni ādiḥ abhipretaḥ sa ca tasya dharmaḥ na asti eva iti kim avadyam
translated: Here, the property to be proved, such as fire, is intended by the word property, and that property does not exist for it. What is the fault?

original: athātra kena dharmo 'bhihito yena dharmasya dharmabhāvapratipādanaṃ yujyata ity āha p / aṃśaś ca / iti /
analyzed: atha atra kena dharmaḥ bhihitaḥ yena dharmasya dharma bhāva pratipādanam yujyate iti āha aṃśaḥ ca iti
translated: But here, by whom is the property stated, by whom is it proper to convey the nature of the property of the property? He says and the part.

analyzed: caḥ yasmāt arthe
translated: The word ca is for the reason.

original: aṃśa ivāṃśo yathāṃśo ' tathā dharmopi dharmiviśeṣaka ity abhiprāyaḥ /
analyzed: aṃśaḥ iva aṃśaḥ yathā aṃśo tathā dharmaḥ api dharmi viśeṣakaḥ iti abhiprāyaḥ
translated: The part is like a part, just as a part is not so. The intention is that the property is also a qualifier of the particular property.

original: pakṣaśabdena samudāyavacanāt tad ekadeśa evāṃśo vaktavya ity āha pakṣaśabdena / iti /
analyzed: pakṣa śabdena samudāya vacanāt tat eka deśaḥ eva aṃśaḥ vaktavyaḥ iti āha pakṣa śabdena iti
translated: Since the word 'part' denotes a whole, he says 'by the word part'.

original: tasyaivaikadeśaḥ kiṃ nocyata ity āha tasyaca / iti /
analyzed: tasya eva eka deśaḥ kim na ucyate iti āha   iti
translated: Why is not just a part of that [whole] mentioned? He says 'and of that'.

original: mudrite ca rahitaḥ pāṭhaḥ kaplitaḥ kintu ālokasammataḥ pāṭhaḥ tasya ca eka iti /
analyzed: mudrite ca rahitaḥ pāṭhaḥ kaplitaḥ kintu āloka sammataḥ pāṭhaḥ tasya ca ekaḥ iti
translated: In the printed text, the reading is omitted, but the reading approved by Āloka is 'and of that one'.

analyzed: dharmāṇām pūrvam boddhavyam
translated: It should be understood earlier that it is impossible for dharmas to be the substratum of dharmas, etc.

original: yato vyāpye sati vyāpakasya niyamenopasthāpanam eva vyāpakaniṣṭhā tatkaraṇāt /
translated: Because when there is the pervaded, the establishment of the pervader by rule is just the pervasion belonging to it, because it is produced by that.

original: vyāpyasyaiva / na tu vyāpakasya vyāptatāpratītir avinābhāvitāpratītiḥ /
analyzed: vyāpyasya eva na tu vyāpakasya vyāpta tā pratītiḥ avinābhāvi tā pratītiḥ
translated: It is just the pervaded, not the pervader, that is the cognition of pervasion, the cognition of invariable concomitance.

original: kim apekṣā sā tathā pratītir ity āhavyāpake /ti /
analyzed: kim apekṣā sā tathā pratītiḥ iti
translated: With what dependence is there such a cognition? He says 'with regard to the pervader'.

original: vyāpakabhāvam apekṣate īkṣikṣamibhyāṃñ ca Vā / iti karmopapade ṇaḥ /
analyzed: vyāpaka bhāvam apekṣate īkṣi kṣamibhyām ca vā iti karma upapade ṇaḥ
translated: It depends on the state of being a pervader, or on the two [words] 'īkṣa' and 'ikṣa'. The affix 'ṇa' is added according to the rule.

original: vyāpakasya bhāvaṃ niyamaviṣayaṃ rūpam apekṣya paryālocya tathā pratītir bhavatīty arthaḥ /
analyzed: vyāpakasya bhāvam niyama viṣayam rūpam apekṣya paryālocya tathā pratītiḥ bhavati iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that such a cognition arises by considering, by taking into account, the form of the state of being a pervader, which is the object of the rule.

original: ayam eva samyak pāṭhaḥ na tu yathā kalpito 'smābhih dharmāṇāṃ dharmāntaratvābhāvāt iti /
analyzed: ayam eva samyak pāṭhaḥ na tu yathā kalpitaḥ smābhiḥ dharmāṇām dharma antara tva abhāvāt iti
translated: This is the correct reading, not what we have imagined: because there is no difference between the properties.

analyzed: āloka sammataḥ vyāpaka bhāva apekṣā iti pāṭhaḥ samyak
translated: The reading in relation to the requirement of the pervader approved by Āloka is correct.

analyzed: na tu yathā asmābhiḥ kalpitaḥ
translated: Not what we have imagined.

original: tatra bhāvam evety abhimatam avadhāraṇaṃ pradarśyānabhimataṃ nirā āha na tv i /ti /
analyzed: tatra bhāvam eva iti abhimatam avadhāraṇam pradarśya anabhimatam kurvan āha na tu
translated: There, having shown the intended restriction only in that, he denies the unintended [restriction] by saying but not.

analyzed: na api
translated: Nor even only in that.

analyzed: avadhāryate iti vartate
translated: Is restricted is understood.

analyzed: sādhāraṇaḥ sapakṣa asapakṣa sādhāraṇaḥ  doṣa antara samuccaya arthaḥ cakāraḥ
translated: Common: common to similar and dissimilar instances.

analyzed: vyāpaka dharma apekṣayā pakṣa antaram avadyotayati
translated: The word or indicates an alternative, in relation to the requirement of a pervading property.

original: tatraive /ty avadhāraṇam abhimataṃ pratipādyānyathāvadhāraṇaṃ niṣedhayann āha atrāpīti / /
analyzed: avadhāraṇam abhimatam pratipādya anyathā avadhāraṇam niṣedhayan āha atra api iti
translated: Having presented the intended restriction only in that, he denies the restriction in another way by saying here also.

original: etad eva sūtrakāravacanena saṃsyandayann āha tad uktami /ti /
analyzed: etat eva sūtrakāra vacanena saṃsyandayan āha tat
translated: Connecting this very [argument] with the statement of the author of the aphorisms, he says That is said.

original: sādhane sati liṅgī sādhyaṃ bhavaty eva /
analyzed: liṅge sādhane sati liṅgī sādhyam bhavati eva
translated: When there is a proof, the inferential mark certainly becomes the probandum.

analyzed: anena vyāpaka dharma gatā vyāptiḥ darśitā
translated: By this, the pervasion that exists in the pervading property is shown.

original: itaralliṅgaṃ punarliṅginy eva sādhya eva bhavatīti /
analyzed: itarat liṅgam punar liṅgini eva sādhyaḥ eva bhavati iti
translated: The other mark, on the other hand, is only to be inferred in the marked thing itself.

analyzed: anena vyāpya dharma gatā vyāptiḥ uktā
translated: By this, pervasion belonging to the pervaded property is stated.

original: uktena prakāreṇa niyamasyāvadhāraṇasya viparyāse vaiparītyeviparyāsaś ca ekatrāyogavyavacchedena viśeṣaṇāṇama
analyzed: uktena prakāreṇa niyamasya avadhāraṇasya viparyāse ca ekatra ayoga vyavacchedena
translated: By the stated method, when there is a reversal of the restriction, the ascertainment, the contradiction, and the contradiction is by the exclusion of one in one place,

analyzed: paratra anya yoga vyavacchedena tasmin viparyāse sati liṅga liṅginoḥ asambandhaḥ
translated: by the exclusion of another in the other place, when there is that reversal, there is non-connection.

analyzed: vyāptiḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: pervasion.
By that, by showing the negation of the cognition of the same form in both cases, of pervasion.

original: ayañ ca doṣaācāryeṇaye dhūmaṃ saṃyoginaṃ hetum icchanti /
analyzed: ayam ca doṣa ācāryeṇaye dhūmam saṃyoginam hetum icchanti
translated: And this fault is stated by the teacher against those who desire smoke as a conjoined reason.

analyzed: tān pratyabhihitaḥ na tu naiyāyikān prati
translated: It is stated against them, but not against the Naiyāyikas.

analyzed: taiḥ dhūmasya eka artha samavāyi tvāt liṅga tvena upagata tvāt
translated: Because by them smoke is accepted as the mark by reason of its inherence in the same object.

original: te hi dhūmāp / vayavinaṃ pradeśaṃ vā dharmiṇam sāgnitvasiṣādhayiṣayā dhūmatvaṃ dhūmavattvaṃ vā sāmānyaṃ hetum upādadata iti /
analyzed: te hi pradeśam vā dharmiṇam ādhāya sa agni tva siṣādhayiṣayā dhūma tvam dhūmavat tvam vā sāmānyam hetum upādadate iti
translated: For they, desiring to prove the existence of fire in the smoky hill, take as the reason the universal smokeness or the universal possession of smoke.

analyzed: etena s
translated: By this,

analyzed: iha vyāptivat sat gamaka tve ākhyātam prakāśitam
translated: here, in the case of being a valid means of knowledge like pervasion, it is said, it is shown.

analyzed: eva samarthayate
translated: Thus, he supports this very [view] with Thus, etc.

original: etad api tadvacanena saṃsyandayann āha tathā ca / iti /
analyzed: etat api tad vacanena saṃsyandayan āha tathā ca iti
translated: Also, connecting this with his statement, he says And thus, etc.

original: dviṣṭhatvāt sambandhasya katham ubhayatraikākāratāvyāptir na syād ity āśaṃkya yady api ity anena dviṣṭhaṃ vāstavam abhyupagamyāpi
analyzed: dviṣṭha tvāt sambandhasya katham ubhayatra eka ākāra tā vyāptiḥ na syāt iti āśaṃkya yadi api iti anena dviṣṭham vāstavam abhyupagamya api
translated: Since the relation is between two [terms], how could there be pervasion by a single form in both [terms]? Suspecting this, he says with Although [verse 1], even accepting the real relation between two [terms],

analyzed: pratividhatte
translated: he replies.

original: kayor asāv ity āha aṅga / iti /🔽aṃgejñapaaṅger jñānapa
analyzed: kayoḥ asau iti āha aṅge iti  aṃge jñapa aṅgeḥ jñāna pa
translated: To which two [terms] does it belong? He says between the mark and the marked.

original: rasya grahaṇād aṃgyate liṅgyate pratīyate 'nena parokṣārtha ity aṅgaṃ liṅgam /
analyzed: rasya grahaṇāt aṃgyate liṅgyate pratīyate nena parokṣa arthaḥ iti aṅgam liṅgam
translated: The mark is that by which the hidden meaning is indicated, understood, or cognized.

analyzed: tena liṅga liṅginoḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: Therefore, the meaning is between the mark and the marked.

analyzed: kiṃbhūtaḥ saḥ iti āha
translated: What kind of relation is it? He says:

analyzed: tayoḥ eva yugapad bhāvi prakṛta tvāt
translated: because they are the subject matter occurring simultaneously.

analyzed: dviṣṭha tva abhyupagamāt eva ca āyātaḥ
translated: And because the relation is accepted as between two [terms], it is implied.

analyzed: yadi apiśabda sānnidhyāt tathā api iti arthataḥ draṣṭavyam
translated: Even though the word although is present, the meaning should be seen as nevertheless.

analyzed: tasya saṃbandhasya vṛttiḥ vartanam
translated: The occurrence of that relation is its existence.

analyzed: tayoḥ liṅga liṅginoḥ iti arthāt
translated: Of those two, the mark and the marked, is the meaning.

original: kayor iva sety āha ādhārādheyayor iveti saptamyantād vatiḥ /
analyzed: kayoḥ iva sā iti āha ādhāra ādheyayoḥ iva iti saptamī antāt vatiḥ
translated: To which two [terms] does it belong? He says like a container and its contents, with the suffix vati from the locative case ending.

original: yathā ādhārādheyabhāvalakṣaṇaḥ sambandho dviṣṭhopi naikarūpayā vṛttyā dvayor vartate
analyzed: yathā ādhāra ādheya bhāva lakṣaṇaḥ sambandhaḥ dviṣṭhaḥ api na ekarūpayā vṛttyā dvayoḥ vartate
translated: Just as the relation characterized by the relation of container and contained, though residing in two [terms], does not occur in two [terms] by a single mode of occurrence.

original: yata evaikasambandhayogepi ādheyasya vādhāratvaṃ tathā liṅgaliṅginor🔽vyāptir api dhūmatvādāv anyathā /
analyzed: yatas evā eka sambandha yoge api ādheyasya vā ādhāra tvam tathā liṅga liṅginoḥ
translated: For this very reason, even when connected with one relation, the contained does not become the container. Similarly, the pervasion of the inferential mark and the object to be inferred🔽is different in the case of smoke-ness, etc.,

analyzed: anyathā ca vahni tva ādau
translated: and different in the case of fire-ness, etc.

original: ata eva dhūmatvādir eva vyāpyatayā gamako na prameyatvādiḥ /
analyzed: atas eva dhūma tva ādiḥ eva vyāpya tayā gamakaḥ na prameya tva ādiḥ
translated: For this very reason, only smoke-ness, etc. are the probandum as pervasion, not the knowability, etc.

original: vahnitvādir eva vyāpakatayā gamyo na tu tārṇatvādir nāpi dhūmo gamyo vahnir gamaka iti /
analyzed: vahni tva ādiḥ eva vyāpaka tayā gamyaḥ na tu tārṇa tva ādiḥ nā api dhūmaḥ gamyaḥ vahniḥ gamakaḥ iti
translated: Only fire-ness, etc. are the probans as pervasion, but not the herbaceousness, etc. nor is smoke the probandum, fire is the probans.

original: yata evaṃ tasya vṛttiḥ tena / kāraṇena /
analyzed: yatas evam tasya vṛttiḥ tena kāraṇena
translated: Since this is so, its mode of occurrence is by that reason.

analyzed: prakaraṇa upasaṃhāraḥ
translated: With iti and so on, there is a conclusion to the topic.

analyzed: anyatra iti nyāyabindau  viniścaye tri rūpāt liṅgāt ityādinā uktaḥ
translated: Thus in the Nyāyabindu.🔽In the Viniscayasamgrahaṇī also, it is stated beginning with from a three-featured inferential mark.

analyzed: spardhayā avasthānam kakṣā
translated: A class is a state of rivalry.

analyzed: tulyā kakṣā yasya sa
translated: One who has a class is equal.

analyzed: tad bhāvaḥ tad tā
translated: That state is thatness.

original: tasyāḥ sūcakaṃ prakāśanaṃ tad eva arthaḥ prayojanaṃ yasya vāśabdasya /
analyzed: tasyāḥ sūcakam prakāśanam tat eva arthaḥ prayojanam yasya vā śabdasya
translated: The indication of that is the illumination. That itself is the purpose of the word vā.

original: paramārthatas tādātmyāt / iti bruvatā tadupapādayatā cānvayena vyatirekagatau vyatirekeṇa cānvayagatau svabhāvahetur adhikṛta iti darśitam
analyzed: paramārthataḥ tādātmyāt iti bruvatā tat upapādayatā ca anvayena vyatireka gatau vyatirekeṇa ca anvaya gatau svabhāva hetuḥ adhikṛtaḥ iti darśitam
translated: By saying this and establishing it, it is shown that when the pervasion is stated by the positive concomitance and the negative concomitance is stated by the negative concomitance, the reason based on identity is employed.

analyzed: tena yat nacid upakṣiptam
translated: Therefore, what some have suggested,

analyzed: sāmarthyam icchataḥ kīrteḥ naṣṭam dvi tva avadhāraṇam iti
translated: that the determination of duality is lost for the desire of the capable one,

original: tad apahastitam draṣṭavyam /🔽p / prasaṅgato niścayarūpāt prastāvāt /
analyzed: tat apahastitam draṣṭavyam  niścaya rūpāt prastāvāt
translated: that should be seen as refuted.🔽From the topic of ascertainment through implication.

original: pakṣadharmas tadaṃśena vyāpto hetuḥ iti vacanāt /
analyzed: pakṣa dharmaḥ tad aṃśena vyāptaḥ hetuḥ iti vacanāt
translated: Because it is said that the reason is the property of the subject, pervaded by that part.

analyzed: sūtrasya krameṇa paripāṭyā
translated: Of the aphorism, in sequence, in order.

analyzed: sarvasya iti sarvasya eva iti avadhāraṇīyam
translated: All should be understood as of all.

original: pratyakṣānumānābhyām iti sāmasty aniṣedho boddhavyo na tu kasyacit /
analyzed: pratyakṣa anumānābhyām iti sāmastī aniṣedhaḥ boddhavyaḥ na tu kasyacid
translated: It should be understood that the non-prohibition of totality is to be understood by through perception and inference, but not of any one.

analyzed: dvābhyām anyasya punar
translated: Of the other than the two.

original: atra S prater ekaṃ patraṃ naṣṭam /
analyzed: atra s prateḥ ekam patram naṣṭam
translated: Here, one leaf of the manuscript is lost.

original: avikalpanatvāt pratyakṣāsya kathaṃ tato niścayas tasya sambhavīty āśaṃkyāha pratyakṣeṇapratī /ti /
analyzed: avikalpana tvāt pratyakṣā asya katham tatas niścayaḥ tasya sambhavi iti āśaṃkya āha
translated: How can there be ascertainment of that from it, because it is non-conceptual? Suspecting this, he says by perception.

analyzed: caḥ yasmāt arthe
translated: The word ca is in the sense of because.

analyzed: sāmānya vikalpa jananāt dhūma ādi liṅga pratyakṣa abhiprāyeṇa uktam
translated: Because it generates a conceptual cognition of the universal. This is said with the intention of direct perception of the inferential mark such as smoke.

original: upacārata / iti pratyakṣato niścaya ity upacārataḥ ucyata iti /
analyzed: upacārataḥ iti pratyakṣataḥ niścayaḥ iti upacārataḥ ucyate iti
translated: By convention. By direct perception is said by convention.

analyzed: s pratau prati iti na asti
translated: There is no prati in pratīti.

original: nanu sāmānyaṃ liṅgaṃ kathaṃ tasyādhyakṣato niścaya ity āha yady apī /ti /
analyzed: nanu sāmānyam liṅgam katham tasya adhyakṣataḥ niścayaḥ iti āha yadi
translated: But how can the universal be ascertained by direct perception of it? He says Although....

analyzed: yaḥ tu āśaṃkyate
translated: But what is suspected.
It is related to fire. It has fire.

analyzed: sa pratyakṣaḥ tādrūpyāt iti āśayaḥ
translated: That place is not directly perceived, because of the similarity of the lower place. This is the intention.

analyzed: kim tathābhūtam nabhaḥ asti
translated: But is there such a sky?

original: sattve vā kiṃ tasya bhāgostīty āśaṃkyabauddhābhipretam eva darśayan para āha āloke /ti /
analyzed: sattve vā kim tasya bhāgaḥ asti iti āśaṃkya bauddha abhipretam eva darśayan paraḥ āha
translated: Or if it exists, what part of it exists? Suspecting this, the opponent shows what is intended by the Buddhists, saying In light..., etc.

analyzed: ādi rahaṇāt tamasaḥ grahaṇam
translated: Because of the initial grasping, darkness is grasped.

original: tad uktam ālokatamasī nabhaḥ ivāityāśayaḥ /🔽pradeśe vastutaḥ sādharmyāsādhyā
analyzed: tat uktam āloka tamasī nabhaḥ iva ā iti āśayaḥ  pradeśe vastutas sādharmyā asādhyā
translated: That is said. The intention is that light and darkness are like the sky.

analyzed: iti draṣṭavyam
translated: Or in a part, the similarity of the object is to be seen.

original: tarhy anumānotseda eva prāpta ity āśaṃkya puner eva vyavasthāṃ kurvann āha tasmād / iti /
analyzed: tarhi anumāna utsedaḥ eva prāptaḥ iti āśaṃkya puneḥ eva vyavasthām kurvan āha tasmāt iti
translated: Then the conclusion of inference is obtained. Suspecting this, he again makes a distinction, saying Therefore..., etc.

original: kathaṃ punaḥ sa eva dharmī sa eva hetur bhavitum arhatīty āha sāgniḥ / iti /
analyzed: katham punar saḥ eva dharmī saḥ eva hetuḥ bhavitum arhati iti āha sa agniḥ iti
translated: How can that very subject and that very reason be proper to exist? He says with fire.

original: anena dhūmaviśeṣasya dharmitvaṃ dhūmasāmānyasya hetutvaṃ darśayati /🔽samānacodyopadarśanamukhena tulyātasyā
analyzed: anena dhūma viśeṣasya dharmi tvam dhūma sāmānyasya hetu tvam darśayati  samāna codya upadarśana mukhena
translated: By this, he shows that the particular smoke is the subject and the general smoke is the reason.

analyzed: pi ityādinā siddhāntī upakramate
translated: By the method of showing the same objection, the proponent of the established view begins with that is also the same, etc.

analyzed: tasya evam mateḥ
translated: For one who has this view,

original: tāvata / iti dṛśyādṛśyavibhāgavataḥ dhūmepi dharmiṇi uktena prakāreṇa etat saṃgacchata iti sāmyābhimānaśaṣyaṃśasyaṃ
analyzed: tāvataḥ iti dṛśya adṛśya vibhāgavataḥ dhūme api dharmiṇi uktena prakāreṇa etat saṃgacchate iti sāmya abhimāna śaṣi aṃśasyam
translated: to that extent. Thus, this is consistent with the distinction between the visible and invisible in smoke as well, the subject, in the manner stated. The part of the opponent's statement that is based on the assumption of sameness,

analyzed: parasya sā āśā
translated: that is the hope of the other.

analyzed: tayan āha pradeśe eva
translated: Therefore, he says and if it is only a part.
The word and has the meaning of distinguishing from the opponent's view.

analyzed: anyatra upalabhyamānasya anya deśa apekṣayā gamaka tvam katham iti āha
translated: How can something that is perceived elsewhere be the reason based on the relation to another place? He says if it is only a part.

original: ācāryeṇāpy etad abhimatam ity upadarśayann āha yadācehe /ti /
analyzed: ācāryeṇa api etat abhimatam iti upadarśayan āha
translated: In order to show that this is also accepted by the teacher, he says when the teacher also says.

original: ataś caivam abhyupetavyam iti darśayann āha pathe /ti /
analyzed: atas ca evam abhyupetavyam iti darśayan āha
translated: And in order to show that this should be accepted in this way, he says therefore.

analyzed: anumāna hetu tvāt anumānam pratyaya bheda bhedi tva ādi
translated: Because it is the reason for inference, inference is distinguished by the distinction of the difference of cognition, etc.

original: dharmiṇo vā / svarūpagrahaṇam api tāvat kathaṃ yujyate ity eva yojyam /
analyzed: dharmiṇaḥ sva rūpa grahaṇam api tāvat katham yujyate iti eva yojyam
translated: Or of the subject. The expression even the apprehension of its own nature should be connected in the same way.

analyzed: tayoḥ sambandhasya ādhāra ādheya lakṣaṇasya
translated: Of the relation between those two, which is characterized by support and supported.

analyzed: itiḥ pratyavasthīyamānasya akāram darśayati
translated: Iti shows the form of the counter-argument.

original: p / evam asau pratyavatastha iti kathaṃ jñāyata ity āśaṃkyāha tena hī /ti /
analyzed: evam asau pratyavatasthe iti katham jñāyate iti āśaṃkya āha tena
translated: How is it known that he thus counter-argued? Suspecting this, he says tena hi.

analyzed: hiḥ yasmāt tenakumārilena
translated: Hi is because of that Kumārila.

analyzed: jyotiṣṭoma ādeḥ śreyaḥ sādhana tvam dharmaḥ boddhavyaḥ
translated: The means of attaining the highest good, such as the Jyotiṣṭoma sacrifice, should be understood as Dharma.

original: yad āhaśabarasvāmīko dharmmo yaḥ śreyaḥsādhanaḥ Śābarabhā / / / iti /
analyzed: yat āha śabarasvāmīkaḥ dharmmaḥ yaḥ śreyaḥ sādhanaḥ iti
translated: As Śabarasvāmin says: Dharma is that which is the means of attaining the highest good.

analyzed: ataeva kumārilopī āha
translated: For this very reason, Kumārila also says:

original: śreyaḥsādhanatāpy eṣāṃ vedāt pratīyate Ślokavā / / iti /
analyzed: śreyaḥ sādhana tā api eṣām vedāt pratīyate ślokavān iti
translated: And their being the means of attaining the highest good is understood from the Veda, as stated in the aphorism.

analyzed: jaimini sūtre śabarasvāmīyam etat bhāṣyam
translated: This is Śabarasvāmin's commentary on Jaimini's aphorisms.

analyzed: etat bhāṣyam iti ca artha dvāreṇa uktam
translated: And this commentary is stated by way of meaning.

analyzed: na tu īdṛśaḥ eva bhāṣya granthaḥ
translated: But the text of the commentary is not exactly like this.

analyzed: pramāṇasya iti vivakṣāyām anumāna ādinaḥ iti nirdeśaḥ
translated: When the intention is of the means of valid knowledge, the instruction is from inference and so on.

original: kadā tatpūrvakaṃ tad ity āha yadeti /
analyzed: kadā tad pūrvakam tat iti āha yadā iti
translated: When is it preceded by that? He says when that.

analyzed: nirvikalpā kalpanā śūnyā indriyasya dhīḥ
translated: The cognition of the sense faculty is non-conceptual, devoid of conceptualization.

analyzed: sā eva katham tathā iti āha
translated: How is that the same? He says: by memory.

analyzed: yasmāt arthe vā yadā śabdaḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: Or it should be seen in the sense of 'because'.

original: vikalpanam antareṇāpi kathaṃ na tathā grahaṇam ity āha nace /ti /
analyzed: vikalpanam antareṇa api katham na tathā grahaṇam iti āha
translated: How is there no such apprehension even without conceptualization? He says: and not.

analyzed: liṅga ādeḥ pratyāsanna tvāt liṅga ādikam eva a vikalpya iti draṣṭavyam
translated: It should be seen that even without conceptualizing the inferential mark etc., the inferential mark etc. are close.

analyzed: tathā sambaddha tvena gṛhītiḥ grahaṇam
translated: Apprehension is the grasping as connected in that way.

analyzed: itiḥ ākṣepasya akāram darśayati
translated: The word 'iti' shows the form of the objection.

original: pratyakṣeṇāgrahaṇaṃ kasyety apekṣāyām āha liṅgāde /r iti /
analyzed: pratyakṣeṇa agrahaṇam kasya iti apekṣāyām āha iti
translated: When there is expectation of whose non-apprehension by perception, he says: of the inferential mark etc.

analyzed: kutas iti āha avikalpanāt iti
translated: From what? He says: because of non-conceptualization.

analyzed: tat iti agrahaṇam
translated: 'That' is non-apprehension.

analyzed: na iti niṣedhayati
translated: 'Not' negates.

analyzed: pratyakṣeṇa iti prakaraṇāt
translated: 'By perception' is understood from the context.

original: kiṃ vikalpamātrasya tathotpattir ity āśaṃkyāha arthe /ti /
analyzed: kim vikalpa mātrasya tathā utpattiḥ iti āśaṃkya āha
translated: Is the arising of mere conceptualization like that? Suspecting this, he says: in the object.

analyzed: artha rūpam upakāri yasya
translated: That which has the form of the object as its benefactor.

analyzed: tasmāt vā upakāraḥ api asti iti tathā
translated: Therefore, there is also benefit, so it is like that.

original: nanu nirvikalpasavikalpabhedenārthavijñānasya dvaite satīdaṃ vaktuṃ yujyate /
analyzed: nanu nirvikalpa sa vikalpa bhedena artha vijñānasya dvaite sati idam vaktum yujyate
translated: But when there is duality of object-consciousness due to the distinction of non-conceptual and conceptual, this can be said.

analyzed: na ca etat saṃbhavi iti āha
translated: And that is not possible, he says: it exists.

analyzed: hiḥ yasmāt arthe
translated: 'Hi' has the sense of 'because'.

original: vikalpāt pūrvaṃ bhāvāt prathamam / ādyam bālādiṣu jñānaṃ dṛṣṭāntatayeṣṭam /
analyzed: vikalpāt pūrvam bhāvāt prathamam ādyam bāla ādiṣu jñānam dṛṣṭānta tayā iṣṭam
translated: Prior to conceptualization, first, at the beginning, the knowledge of children etc. is accepted as an example.

analyzed: śuddha vastu jam śabda smaraṇa rahita vastu jam iti arthaḥ
translated: Arisen from a pure object. The meaning is: arisen from an object devoid of verbal memory.

analyzed: tatas ālocanā ajñānāt param uttara kālam
translated: Then, after the perceptual knowledge, at a later time.

analyzed: punar a prathame
translated: Again, not at first.

original: jātyādibhir viśiṣṭaṃ yayā buddhyāvasīyate sāpi na kevalam ālocanājñānam iti apiśabdaḥ /
analyzed: jāti ādibhiḥ viśiṣṭam yayā buddhyā avasīyate sā api na kevalam ālocanā jñānam iti api śabdaḥ
translated: The word also indicates that the cognition by which something qualified by universals etc. is ascertained is not only perceptual knowledge.

original: evaṃ ca bruvato 'yaṃ bhāvaḥ yady api prathamaṃ nirvikalpakabodhena dvyātmakaṃ indriyasaṃbandhāt /
analyzed: evam ca bruvataḥ yam bhāvaḥ yadi api prathamam nirvikalpaka bodhena dvi ātmakam vastu gṛhītam indriya saṃbandhāt
translated: And the idea of one who speaks thus is this: Although at first the twofold [nature] is grasped by non-conceptual cognition through contact with the sense faculty,

original: tathāpi na viśeṣyaviśeṣaṇabhāvāpattyā gṛhītam /🔽ayaḥśalākākalpayor jātitadvatoḥ sākṣātkaraṇāt /
analyzed: tathā api na viśeṣya viśeṣaṇa bhāva āpattyā gṛhītam  ayaḥ śalākā kalpayoḥ jāti tadvatoḥ sākṣātkaraṇāt
translated: nevertheless it is not grasped by the relation of qualifier and qualified.🔽Because the universal and its possessor, which are like iron rods, are directly perceived.

analyzed: tathā gṛhṇattu idam pramāṇam eva iti
translated: And this [cognition] is a means of valid knowledge in grasping in that way.

analyzed: itinā ukteḥ ākāram darśayati
translated: By this shows the form of the statement.

analyzed: uktam sāmarthyāt etat uktam
translated: It is said. This is said by implication.

analyzed: na tu sākṣāt tena uktam etat
translated: But it is not directly stated by that [statement].

original: yasmāt tenaivaṃ bruvatā sāmarthyād etat prakāśitaṃ tataḥ / tasmāt /
