translated: There, it appears to us as that very thing. Suspecting this, with the intention that that also does not exist, he says even of the clear.

analyzed: anupalakṣaṇāt iti abhisambaddhyate
translated: Because of non-perception is to be supplied.

original: saṃprati dvitīyasya spaṣṭarūpasyopalakṣaṇam abhyupagamya tasyānugābhirūpatvaṃ pratiṣedhayann āha /
analyzed: saṃprati dvitīyasya spaṣṭa rūpasya upalakṣaṇam abhyupagamya tasya anuga abhirūpa tvam pratiṣedhayan āha
translated: Now, accepting the perception of the second clear form, he denies its continuous form, saying:

analyzed: tad bhāve
translated: And in its existence.

analyzed: viśeṣa artha abhidhāna abhyupagame
translated: Ca (and) is for expressing a special meaning and acceptance.

original: anena kiṃ tad dvitīyaṃ spaṣṭaṃ rūpaṃ sābaleyabāhuleyavyaktidvayāntarālaṃ na kiṃ vyāpnotīti vikalpayor buddhisthīkṛtayor madhye 'vyāpanapakṣe
analyzed: anena kim tat dvitīyam spaṣṭam rūpam sābaleya bāhuleya vyakti dvaya antarālam na vyāpnoti kim vyāpnoti iti vikalpayoḥ madhye vyāpana pakṣe
translated: What is the second clear form that is not pervading the space between the two individuals, Sābaleya and Bāhuleya? Among the two alternatives that have been brought to mind, in the case of non-pervading,

analyzed: doṣam darśayati
translated: he shows the fault.

analyzed: vyakti dvayasya antarālam avakāśam a vyāpnuvataḥ sva sattayān
translated: The space between the two individuals, not pervading, not connecting with its own existence,

original: kathaṃ tadanugamo / vyaktyantarānugamo vyaktyantaravyāpitvaṃ niṣkriyatvena gatvā vyāpārāsaṃbhavāt tathātvepi pūrvavyaktiviyogānuṣaṅgāt
analyzed: katham tad anugamaḥ vyakti antara anugamaḥ vyakti antara vyāpi tvam niṣkriya tvena gatvā vyāpāra asaṃbhavāt tathātve api pūrva vyakti viyoga anuṣaṅgāt
translated: how is there conformity with that? Conformity with another individual, pervading another individual, is not possible due to being inactive. Even if it were so, due to the consequence of separation from the previous individual,

original: na ca tatsāṅgam iti ca bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: na ca tat sa aṅgam iti ca bhāvaḥ
translated: and it is not associated with that. This is the meaning.

analyzed: āha vyāptau
translated: The second says if there is pervasion.

original: tatra / antarāle /🔽na tasya tatra vyaktaṃ rūpam asti vyañjakābhāvāt tenānupalakṣaṇam ity āha nahī /ti /
analyzed: tatra antarāle  na tasya tatra vyaktam rūpam asti vyañjaka abhāvāt tena anupalakṣaṇam iti āha
translated: There, in the space between.🔽He says that it is not perceived because there is no manifest form of it there due to the absence of a manifester. He says it is not so because

original: avaśyaṃ hi bhūtale tat kayācid vyaktam iti na tasyāvyaktarūpasaṃbhava iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: avaśyam hi bhū tale tat kayācid vyaktam iti na tasya avyakta rūpa saṃbhavaḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: it is necessary that it is manifest on the ground by something, so it is not possible for it to have an unmanifest form. This is the meaning.

original: vārtikakārasyāpy ayam artho 'bhipreta iti pratipādayann āha tathā ce /ti /
analyzed: vārtikakārasya api ayam arthaḥ bhipretaḥ iti pratipādayan āha tathā
translated: In order to demonstrate that this is the meaning intended by the author of the Vārttika, he says and so on.

original: prakṛtopayayogibhāga eva paṭhituṃ yujyata itivārtikasya evāyam apaṭhat /
analyzed: prakṛta upaya yogi bhāgaḥ eva paṭhitum yujyate iti vārtikasya eva ayam apaṭhat
translated: This is the meaning of the Vārttika (commentary) which has not been read.

analyzed: uktayā upapattyā vyakta eka rūpa saṃbhave ca idam anya dātrā
translated: And when the form of the manifest is possible by the reason stated, this is shown by the author

original: pīti nidarśayann āha ekatrāpīti / /🔽co vaktavyāntarasamuccaye /🔽sarvasarvagatavādinam adhikṛtyoktaṃ sakaleti / /
analyzed: pi iti nidarśayan āha ekatra api iti  caḥ vaktavya antara samuccaye  sarva sarvagata vādinam adhikṛtya uktam sakala iti
translated: saying even in one etc.🔽The word ca (and) is for the purpose of including another statement.🔽With reference to the one who maintains that the omnipresent is all-pervading, it is said in all etc.

analyzed: sva āśraya sarvagata vādinam tu prati
translated: But with reference to the one who maintains that the omnipresent is all-pervading in its own substratum, it is said in its own substratum etc.

analyzed: sambhāvanāyām
translated: The word na (not) is for the purpose of impossibility.

original: iha ekatraivāśraya ity aṃśenāyaṃ na dṛṣṭāntaḥ kintu yathā kṣaṇikatvasya
analyzed: iha ekatra eva āśrayaḥ iti aṃśena ayam na dṛṣṭāntaḥ kintu yathā kṣaṇika tvasya
translated: Here, this is not an example in the sense that the substratum is only one, but rather just as the cognition of momentariness

original: nirvikalpakabodhena dṛṣṭasyāpi na darśanāvasāyas tathā sakalasvāśrayarūpapratibhāsepi
analyzed: nirvikalpaka bodhena dṛṣṭasya api na darśana avasāyaḥ tathā sakala sva āśraya rūpa pratibhāse pi
translated: is not a determination of seeing even though seen by non-conceptual cognition, in the same way, even in the manifestation of all the forms of its own substratum,

analyzed: na darśana avasāye iti anena eva
translated: there is no determination of seeing. This is the meaning.

analyzed: astu tarhi sarva bhuvana varti rūpasya niścayaḥ
translated: Then let there be the determination of the form existing in all the worlds.

original: sarvasvāśrayavartino vā kā p / kṣatir ity āha tata / iti /
analyzed: sarva sva āśraya vartinaḥ vā kā kṣatiḥ iti āha tatas iti
translated: Or what harm is there in the form existing in all the substrata? It is said from that etc.

analyzed: tatas tādṛśa rūpa niścayāt
translated: From that determination of such a form,

analyzed: sāmānyam pratyavamṛṣyate
translated: that universal is contradicted.

analyzed: sahacāri śabdena ca saṃbaddham vivakṣitam
translated: And it is intended to be connected with the word co-occurring.

original: tenāyam arthas tatsahacāriṇaḥ sāmānyasaṃbaddhasya tatsamavāyaviṣayasyeti yāvad iti /
analyzed: tena ayam arthaḥ tad sahacāriṇaḥ sāmānya saṃbaddhasya tad samavāya viṣayasya iti yāvat iti
translated: Therefore, this meaning is: of that which is associated with it, which is related to the universal, which has the inherence in that as its object.

analyzed: etat ca naiyāyika ādīn pratyabhihitam
translated: And this has been stated in response to the Naiyāyikas and others.

analyzed: mīmāṃsakam pratyāha tad abhinna svabhāvasya
translated: In response to the Mīmāṃsakas, he says And of that which has an essence that is not different from that...

original: kim indriyabuddhau sāmānyasya pratibhāsa anumānātmikāyām iti vikalpayor antarnihitayor ekaṃ vikalpaṃ nirākṛtyāparaṃ
analyzed: kim indriya buddhau sāmānyasya anumāna ātmikāyām iti vikalpayoḥ antar nihitayoḥ ekam vikalpam nirākṛtya aparam
translated: Which is to say, is the universal manifested in the cognition of the sense organ, or in the cognition that is inference? Having refuted one of the two alternatives, he refutes the other.

analyzed: nirākartum āha
translated: He says Or...

analyzed: ādi śabdāt  parigrahaḥ
translated: The word etc. includes sound, non-sound, etc.

analyzed: prāktanam padam atra abhisaṃbadhyate
translated: The word that is to be connected here, referring to the previous [statement].

analyzed: tatas anumāna ādi buddhim iti dvitīyayā nirdeśaḥ
translated: Therefore, the statement in the cognition of inference, etc. is in the accusative case.

original: yathāspaṣṭo vyaktyākāro 'rthākāro vā lakṣyamāṇaḥ na tathā svalakṣaṇapratibhāso vyaktyākāro lakṣyamāṇostīti yojyam /
analyzed: yathā aspaṣṭaḥ vyakti ākāraḥ rtha ākāraḥ vā lakṣyamāṇaḥ na tathā sva lakṣaṇa pratibhāsaḥ vyakti ākāraḥ lakṣyamāṇaḥ asti iti yojyam
translated: As the form of the individual or the form of the object is clearly perceived, the appearance of the individual characteristic is not perceived in the same way. This is how it should be connected.

original: kasmād evam ity āha tadabhāva / iti tasya svalakṣaṇasyābhāve tāsāṃ / sāmānyabuddhīnām /
analyzed: kasmāt evam iti āha tad abhāve iti tasya sva lakṣaṇasya abhāve tāsām sāmānya buddhīnām
translated: Why is it so? He says because of the absence of that... In the absence of that individual characteristic, those cognitions of the universal...

analyzed: atra eva abhyuccaya hetum āha ākāra antareṇa
translated: Here he gives a reason for the superiority, saying And because of the difference in form...

analyzed: sva jñāne indriya janmani jñāne
translated: In one's own cognition, in the cognition born from the senses.

original: spaṣtāspaṣṭarūpadvayayogi svalakṣaṇaṃ spaṣṭena rūpeṇa pratibhāty anyatra punar aspaṣṭenety āha aneke /ti /
analyzed: spaṣta aspaṣṭa rūpa dvaya yogi sva lakṣaṇam spaṣṭena rūpeṇa pratibhāti anyatra punar aspaṣṭena iti āha
translated: The universal is endowed with both a clear and unclear form. It appears clearly in one's own cognition, but elsewhere it appears unclearly. Thus it is said to be manifold.

analyzed: ghaṭa pratibhāse pi paṭa pratibhāsa kalpanā syāt
translated: Because of over-extension, even in the appearance of a pot, there would be the superimposition of the appearance of a cloth.

original: yogitvāt paṭasyetyāder uttarasyātrāpi suvacatvād ity abhisandhiḥ /
analyzed: yogi tvāt paṭasya ityādeḥ uttarasya atra api suvaca tvāt iti abhisandhiḥ
translated: Because of being endowed with the two forms characterized by pot and cloth, like a cloth, etc., the reply is easily stated here as well. This is the intended meaning.

original: iyam abhinnābhāsā sāmānyākārā svalakṣaṇād udbhavo 'syā iti svalakṣaṇodbhavā satī bhinnārthagrāhiṇī vyāvṛttavastugrāhiṇī na pratibhāti /
analyzed: iyam abhinna ābhāsā sāmānya ākārā sva lakṣaṇāt syāḥ iti sva lakṣaṇa udbhavā satī bhinna artha grāhiṇī vyāvṛtta vastu grāhiṇī na pratibhāti
translated: This undifferentiated appearance, which is of the form of a universal, arising from the particular, being born from the particular, does not appear as apprehending different objects, as apprehending distinct things.

analyzed: kim tu
translated: Rather, it is beginningless.

original: dṛḍhatvāt sarvadā buddher iti bruvatā yadi buddher dārḍhyam abhihitaṃ tad api niṛupayann āha dṛḍḥatvañ ce /ti /
analyzed: dṛḍha tvāt sarvadā buddheḥ iti bruvatā yadi buddheḥ dārḍhyam abhihitam tat api āha
translated: By saying because of the firmness of cognition at all times, if the firmness of cognition is stated, that too is refuted by saying if firmness is...

original: sahetukavināśavādipakṣe kṣaṇikatvābhyupagamād i /ty āśutaravināśitvābhyupagamād iti veditavyam /🔽asyāḥ / sāmānyabuddheḥ /
analyzed: sa hetuka vināśa vādi pakṣe kṣaṇika tva abhyupagamāt āśutara vināśi tva abhyupagamāt iti veditavyam  asyāḥ sāmānya buddheḥ
translated: It should be understood that in the view of one who asserts destruction with a cause, because of the acceptance of momentariness, i.e., because of the acceptance of very rapid destruction.🔽Of this, of the cognition of the universal.

analyzed: tat a bādhyamāna tvam
translated: That, the non-contradicted state.

analyzed: syāt śabdaḥ na ekānta vacanaḥ niyataḥ asti tena yat vā
translated: The word syāt is restricted to the doctrine of non-absolutism, therefore it is the doctrine of syāt. Or,

original: syād akṣaṇikaḥ syāt kṣaṇika ityādi / syād iti vādaḥ syādvādas tasya bhaṃgo
analyzed: syāt akṣaṇikaḥ syāt kṣaṇikaḥ ityādi syāt iti vādaḥ syādvādaḥ tasya
translated: it may be non-momentary, it may be momentary, etc. The doctrine of syāt is the doctrine of syāt, its refutation,

original: nirākaraṇaṃ tasmād evāvadhāraṇīyo bādhaka iti prakṛtatvāt /
analyzed: nirākaraṇam tasmāt eva avadhāraṇīyaḥ bādhakaḥ iti prakṛta tvāt
translated: its refutation, therefore, the refutation should be ascertained, because it is the subject matter.

original: syādvādabhaṅgam adhītyeti karmaṇi lyablope ceyaṃ pañcamī draṣṭavyā /
analyzed: syādvāda bhaṅgam adhītya iti karmaṇi lyap lope ca iyam pañcamī draṣṭavyā
translated: Having studied the refutation of the doctrine of syāt, this fifth case should be seen in the elision of the lyap affix in the accusative.

original: evaṃ manyata / ityādinā yad upakrāntaṃ tad upasaṃharann āha i /tyādi /
analyzed: evam manyate ityādinā yat upakrāntam tat upasaṃharan āha tasmāt
translated: Thinking thus, he concludes what was begun with thus, etc.

analyzed: yaḥ tu iti sambandhaḥ
translated: But he who knows falsity as a fault, this is the connection.

original: p / uktaḥ / pareṇety arthāt /🔽kiṃ kṛtvāsāv ukta ityāha pūrvapakṣayitveti / /
analyzed: uktaḥ pareṇa iti arthāt  kim kṛtvā asau uktaḥ iti āha pūrvapakṣayitvā iti
translated: It is said, by the opponent, this is the meaning.🔽 Having taken a position, he says this.
The general, etc., up to will be, is the text of the prima facie view.

analyzed: asya eva pūrvapakṣasya ākāram darśayati
translated: The word of this very prima facie view shows the form.

analyzed: tasya sāmānyasya vartanasya
translated: Of that general, of its occurrence, of its existence,
The determiner is the distinguisher.

original: sābaleyādiṣu karkādisādhāraṇe parasparaṃ gotvam eva vartate nāśvatvam ity etan nimittam /
analyzed: sābaleya ādiṣu karka ādi sādhāraṇe parasparam go tvam eva vartate na aśva tvam iti etat nimittam
translated: In the sābaleya and other cows, the commonness of cow-ness with the donkey, etc., exists mutually, not horse-ness, this is the reason.

original: yathaikasmāt sābaleyāt karko bhinnas tathā bāhuleyopi tatas tulyepi bhinnatve /
analyzed: yathā ekasmāt sābaleyāt karkaḥ bhinnaḥ tathā bāhuleyaḥ api tatas tulye api bhinna tve
translated: Just as a Karka is different from a single Sabaleya, so is a Bahuleya. Thus, even though there is difference,

original: bhede keṣucit / sābaleyādiṣu vṛttir gotvasya avṛttitāvidyamānavṛttitvam avidyamānatvam
analyzed: bhede keṣucid sābaleya ādiṣu vṛttiḥ go tvasya avṛtti tā avidyamāna vṛtti tvam avidyamāna tvam
translated: in some cases, such as Sabaleya etc., there is the presence of cowness, and the absence of presence, i.e. non-existence,

analyzed: eva aśva tvasya ādi śabda saṃgṛhītasya
translated: of horseness etc. included by the word 'etc.'

original: kasya keṣucid vṛttyavṛttiteti apekṣāyām gotvāder i /ti /
analyzed: kasya keṣucid vṛtti avṛtti tā iti apekṣāyām uktam go tva ādeḥ
translated: When there is expectation of whose presence and absence in what, it is said 'of cowness etc.'

original: animitteti kākākṣinyāyenobhayatrāpi vṛttyavṛttitāyāṃ buddhāv api saṃbadhyate /
analyzed: kāka akṣi nyāyena ubhayatra api vṛtti avṛtti tāyām buddhau api saṃbadhyate
translated: 'Without a cause' is connected with both presence and absence in the cognition, according to the principle of the eyes of a crow.

original: tenāyam artho yathā gotvādeḥ keṣucid vṛttyāvṛttitānimittāpi niyāmakasāmānyarahitāpi🔽tathā / tadvadbuddhi /r abhinnābhāsā dhīranimittā janakagotvasāmānyaśūnyānāditathāvidhavāsanāsāmarthyāt
analyzed: tena ayam arthaḥ yathā go tva ādeḥ kaścitsu vṛtti āvṛtti tā nimittā api niyāmaka sāmānya rahitā api  tathā abhinna ābhāsāḥ dhīra nimittāḥ janaka go tva sāmānya śūnya anādi tathāvidha vāsanā sāmarthyāt
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning: Just as the presence and absence of cowness etc. in some cases is without a cause, and is also without a regulating universal,

analyzed: eva
translated: in the same way, that cognition, appearing undifferentiated, will arise from the power of beginningless such latent impressions alone, devoid of the productive universal cowness.

original: tena viṣayaṃ vinā kutotpavinā buddhyutpa🔽ttyabhāvena tat /sāmānyaṃ dhruvaṃ nityam icchaṃti /
analyzed: tena viṣayam vinā kutotpavinā buddhi utpa  dhruvam nityam icchaṃti
translated: Therefore, how can there be the arising of a cognition without an object?🔽Due to the absence of the arising of a cognition, they desire that universal to be eternal and permanent.

original: yad vā tena kāraṇena tatsāmānyam icchanti dhruvaṃ niścitam /
analyzed: yat vā tena kāraṇena tat sāmānyam icchanti dhruvam niścitam
translated: Or, by that reason, they desire that universal to be eternal and certain.

original: tenābhinnena viṣayeṇa vinā anugamātmikānāṃ buddhīnām utpāde ko doṣa ity āha /
analyzed: tena abhinnena viṣayeṇa vinā anugama ātmikānām buddhīnām utpāde kaḥ doṣaḥ iti āha
translated: What is the fault if the cognitions having the nature of ascertainment arise without that undifferentiated object? He says:

analyzed: tāḥ hi iti
translated: Those, indeed.

analyzed: tāḥ abhinna ābhāsā sāmānya buddhayaḥ
translated: Those undifferentiated cognitions of universals.

original: anena sāmānyābhāve tathābhūtabuddhyutpāde bādhakapramāṇam uktaṃ pareṇa /
analyzed: anena sāmānya abhāve tathābhūta buddhi utpāde bādhaka pramāṇam uktam pareṇa
translated: By this, the opponent has stated the proof that refutes the arising of such cognitions in the absence of universals.

original: asāv eva vandīkṛtam arthaṃ pratikurvann āha na tv iti / /
analyzed: asau eva vandīkṛtam artham pratikurvan āha na tu iti
translated: That very one, acting against the meaning that has been bowed to, says: But it is not so.

analyzed: vṛttiḥ niyatā iti prakaraṇāt
translated: The functioning is restricted, due to the context.

original: na duṣyatī /ti bruvato 'yaṃ bhāvas tadantareṇa tathāvidhabuddyutpāde mithyātvadoṣosti bādhakaḥ /
analyzed: na bruvataḥ yam bhāvaḥ tad antareṇa tathāvidha buddhi utpāde mithyātva doṣaḥ usti bādhakaḥ
translated: It is not faulty. The meaning of one who says this is: In the arising of such a cognition without that, there is the fault of falsity, which is a refutation.

analyzed: sāmānyasya
translated: Of the universal.

original: tu sāmānyāntareṇa keṣucid eva vṛttau kim asti bādhakaṃ yena abhyanujānāmīti /
analyzed: tu sāmānya antareṇa keṣucid eva vṛttau kim asti bādhakam yena abhyanujānāmi iti
translated: But in the functioning of some only by another universal, what is the refutation, by which I allow it?

original: asau / mithyātvaprasaktidoṣo na tathāgatasiddhāntatītipariśuddhabuddhīn a /smadādīn bādhate vyathayati /
analyzed: asau mithyātva prasakti doṣaḥ na tathāgata siddhānta tīti pariśuddha buddhīn bādhate vyathayati
translated: That fault of the consequence of falsity afflicts us, whose minds are purified by the true doctrine of the Tathāgata, and causes pain.

analyzed: kasmāt iti āha
translated: Why is it so? He says: In the universal.

original: yady api pūrvavat sāmānyabuddher mithyātvavyavasthānibandhanaṃ pramāṇaṃ mātrayā darśitaṃ
analyzed: yadi api pūrvavat sāmānya buddheḥ mithyātva vyavasthā nibandhanam pramāṇam mātrayā darśitam
translated: Even though the proof that is the basis for determining the falsity of the cognition of the universal has been shown by the opponent, as before,

original: tathāpi bahumukham evāsyā mithyātvavyavasthāpakaṃ pramāṇam astīti pratipādayituṃ
analyzed: tathā api bahu mukham evā asyāḥ mithyātva vyavasthāpakam pramāṇam asti iti pratipādayitum
translated: Nevertheless, in order to demonstrate that there is indeed much evidence that establishes its falsity,

analyzed: sāmnā galakambalaḥ
translated: [he says] in the throat, a blanket.

analyzed: ādi śabdāt kakud ādi parigrahaḥ
translated: From the word ādi [comes] the inclusion of the hump and so on.

analyzed: sāmānya rūpa tā hāni prasaṅgāt
translated: [It is] not [a universal] because of the consequence of the loss of the nature of the uncommon [particular].

analyzed: na udaya vyaya prasaṅga yogi nitya tva abhāva prasaṅga bhāvāt iti buddhi stham
translated: [It is] not [a universal] because of the consequence of the absence of permanence due to the connection with the consequence of arising and destruction. This is understood.

analyzed: itiḥ anantara uktam pratyavamṛṣati
translated: Iti [means] having reflected on what was just said.

original: kuto na yuktam ity āha viruddhe /ti /
analyzed: kutas na yuktam iti āha
translated: From where is it not proper? He says because of contradiction.

original: amum arthaṃ sātirekaṃ kārikābhir vaktuṃ para p / mukhenāha nekhenāha āhacetyādi /
analyzed: amum artham sa atirekam kārikābhiḥ vaktum mukhena āha nekhena āha āha ca ityādi
translated: In order to state this meaning with excess through verses, he says nekhena and so on, with the word āha [at the end].

analyzed: nāśaḥ iti r iti prakaraṇāt draṣṭavyam
translated: Destruction should be seen from the context as of the manifest.

analyzed: ajāta tā liṅga vipariṇāmena saṃbandhanīyam
translated: Unbornness should be connected with the change of gender [to ke neṣṭhā].

analyzed: kena kāraṇena
translated: By what [means] by what cause.

analyzed: tadvat vyakti vat
translated: Like that [means] like the manifest.
Non-concomitance [means] not following to another manifest.
The fault of the consequence of falsity

analyzed: animittā s
translated: without a cause

analyzed: na ca asā s
translated: and it is not that

original: nanu ca sāmānyāny api caitāni nāśīny āśrayanāśata Ślokavā / pṛ / iti vacanānmīmāṃsakairvyaktināśe nāśa iṣṭa eveti kim ucyate vyaktināśe
analyzed: nanu ca sāmānyāni api ca etāni iti vacanāt mīmāṃsakaiḥ vyakti nāśe nāśaḥ iṣṭaḥ eva iti kim ucyate vyakti nāśe
translated: But these [universals] are also general, and are not destroyed by the destruction of their substratum, as stated in the verse The universal is not destroyed by the destruction of the individual. Thus, the Mīmāṃsakas accept that destruction [of the universal] occurs only when there is destruction of the individual. What is being said?

analyzed: nāśaḥ
translated: [The universal] is not destroyed [when the individual is destroyed].

analyzed: kena iṣṭhā iṣṭe i
translated: By whom is it accepted that it is not destroyed?

analyzed: prakṛtam mīmāṃsaka matam iti
translated: The Mīmāṃsaka view is the subject at hand.

original: satyam /🔽kevalam evaṃvaktur ayam āśayaḥ yady ekaṃ sāmānyaṃ tato bhinnañcābhinnañ ca saṃgacchate
analyzed: satyam  kevalam evaṃvaktuḥ ayam āśayaḥ yadi ekam sāmānyam tatas bhinnam ca abhinnam ca saṃgacchate
translated: This is true.🔽However, the intention of one who speaks in this way is as follows: If a single universal can be both different and non-different,

original: tadā vyaktirūpeṇa vyayate tadvyatiriktena ca rūpeṇānuvartata iti syād api yadi paraṃ🔽manomodakopayogamātravad etad iti /
analyzed: tadā vyakti rūpeṇa vyayate tad vyatiriktena ca rūpeṇa anuvartate iti syāt api yadi param  manaḥ modaka upayoga mātra vat etat iti
translated: then it could be destroyed in the form of the individual, while continuing to exist in a form separate from that, like the enjoyment of a mental confection.

analyzed: etat ca adhastāt yathāvasaram iha eva pratipādayiṣyate
translated: This will be explained below, as appropriate, right here [in the text].

original: ata eva ca kaiścinnaiyāyikāir nāśīnīty upalabhyānīty etad vyākhyātam iti /🔽vyaktijanmani janmāniṣṭau sāmānyasya dūṣaṇam idam upasthitam iti darśayann āha vyaktī /tyādi /
analyzed: atas eva ca kaiścid naiyāyikāiḥ nāśīni iti upalabhyāni iti etat vyākhyātam iti  vyakti janmani janma aniṣṭau sāmānyasya dūṣaṇam idam upasthitam iti darśayan āha
translated: For this very reason, some Naiyāyikas have explained the word nāśinī [in the verse] as anīśvarī [meaning not under the control of God].🔽In order to show that this [argument] is a criticism of the undesirable consequence of the universal having birth when there is birth of the individual, he says vyaktyādivad [etc.].

analyzed: jātiḥ iti vakṣyamāṇa apekṣayā strī liṅgena nirdeśaḥ
translated: The feminine form is used in relation to what is to be said later as jātiḥ [meaning the universal].

original: niṣkriyatvāj jāter ity abhipretya nāgatety abhyupagamayati /
analyzed: niṣkriya tvāt jāteḥ iti abhipretya na āgatā iti abhyupagamayati
translated: Having understood that the universal does not exist in the future because it is without activity, he accepts it.

analyzed: prāk vyakti udayāt pūrvam
translated: Prior to the manifestation of the individual, before.

original: dṛśyāyā anupalabdhatvād ity abhiprāyeṇa ca nāsīd ity /pagamayati /
analyzed: dṛśyāyāḥ anupalabdha tvāt iti abhiprāyeṇa ca na āsīt iti
translated: With the intention that the visible is not perceived, he accepts that it did not exist.

analyzed: atra api saṃbadhyate
translated: The word if is also connected here.

original: tasyā vyakter utpadyamānāyā deśo diśyate 'sminn iti kṛtvādhāra uktaḥ /
analyzed: tasyāḥ vyakteḥ utpadyamānāyāḥ deśaḥ diśyate smin iti kṛtvā ādhāraḥ uktaḥ
translated: The place of that individual which is being produced is indicated as this, thus the substratum is said.

analyzed: anena etat darśayati
translated: This shows that.

analyzed: tat saṃbabdha ūru
translated: The universal is related to that individual.

original: bandhanena vā prakāreṇa bhavet sa caikopi na bhavatīti /🔽sā jātiḥ tayā vyaktyā saṅgatā saṃbaddhā kathaṃ / na kathañcit /
analyzed: bandhanena vā prakāreṇa bhavet sa ca ekaḥ api na bhavati iti  sā jātiḥ tayā vyaktyā saṅga tā saṃbaddhā katham na kathañcid
translated: Or it would be in some other way, but that also does not happen.🔽How is that universal, which is connected with that individual, related in any way? In no way.

original: tajjanyajanmani tādātmyaṃ tāvad atibhavān natāvad bhedān na yujyate /
analyzed: tad janya janmani sāmānyasya iṣyamāṇe tādātmyam tāvat atibhavāt na tāvat bhedāt na yujyate
translated: The identity with that which is produced by it is not possible, because there is no difference.

original: tatsambandhamātram api na saṃgacchata ity abhiprāyo 'syaivaṃ ca vaditur boddhavyo
analyzed: tad sambandha mātram api na saṃgacchate iti ca vadituḥ boddhavyaḥ
translated: The mere relation with that is also not appropriate. This is his intention in speaking thus. It should be understood in this way.

analyzed: nyathā mīmāṃsaka mata itādātmyāt anyasya sambandhasya aniṣṭeḥ āgata āśraya antarāt ityādi dvārā
translated: Otherwise, in the Mimamsa view, since a relation other than identity is not accepted, the argument beginning with from the previously accepted substratum and so on

original: sambandhamātraniṣedho 'nupayuktaḥ prasajyeta prastutañ ca tanmatam iti /🔽vyaktināśe ' ca sāmānyasyesyā
analyzed: sambandha mātra niṣedhaḥ n upayuktaḥ prasajyeta prastutam ca tat matam iti  vyakti nāśe vināśi tva iṣtau ca sāmānyasya isyā
translated: The mere negation of relation would be purposeless, and that view is the one under consideration.🔽And this fault would be in the destruction of the individual of the universal.

original: yaṃ doṣaḥ syād iti darśayann āha vyaktiktīti / /
analyzed: yam doṣaḥ syāt iti darśayan āha
translated: To show this, he says in the destruction of the individual.

analyzed: niṣkriya tvāt iti abhiprāyeṇa āha
translated: With the intention that it is inactive, he says not in the future.

original: tacchūnye / naṣtavyaktirahite dṛśyādarśanābhiprāyeṇa ca na sthitety āha /🔽kveti / kākākṣikākvā
analyzed: naṣta vyakti rahite dṛśya adarśana abhiprāyeṇa ca na sthitā iti āha  kva iti kāka akṣikā akvā
translated: In the empty, i.e., in the absence of the individual, with the intention that the visible is not seen, he says not in the present.🔽Where? In the manner of a crow's eyes.

analyzed: praśna yuktaḥ katham katha
translated: The question is connected.

analyzed: na aśakya tvam pratipādayati
translated: He demonstrates the impossibility.

analyzed: jāteḥ vyakti ātmaka tva upagame tad udaya vyayayoḥ na syātām
translated: If the universal were accepted as having the nature of the individual, its arising and ceasing would not occur.

original: satyāñ ca tadviṣtāv ayam ayañ ca doṣa iti pratipādya tattadiṣṭau ca jātes tādātmyopagama eva jaghanya iti pratipādayann āha vyakte /r
analyzed: satyām ca tad viṣtau ayam ayam ca doṣaḥ iti pratipādya tad tad iṣṭau ca jāteḥ tādātmya upagamaḥ eva jaghanyaḥ iti pratipādayan āha
translated: And if that existence were true, this and that fault would be. Having demonstrated this, he demonstrates that the acceptance of the universal as having that nature is inferior, saying in the individual.

original: sā vyaktir ātmā svabhāvo yasya tadbhāvaḥ /
analyzed: sā vyaktiḥ ātmā svabhāvaḥ yasya tad bhāvaḥ
translated: That individual is the self, the nature, of which it is, that state.

original: anupaplutaṃ / vādyādibhir aprāpitāsvāsthyaṃ ceto p / yeṣāṃ teṣām /🔽katham iṣṭam /
analyzed: anupaplutam vādya ādibhiḥ a prāpita asvāsthyam yeṣām teṣām  katham iṣṭam
translated: Those whose minds are not disturbed, i.e., not deprived of health by faults such as pride.🔽How is it accepted?

analyzed: kṣepe ca ayam kimaḥ prayogaḥ
translated: And this is the use of the particle kim in the optative.

analyzed: eva mīmāṃsakānām idam iṣṭam iti sāmarthyāt darśitam  pramāṇā asimā asi
translated: In this way, it is shown by implication that this is accepted by the Mīmāṃsakas.

original: ddhau prakṛṣṭaṃ kārakaṃ pramāṇam ucyate 'viśeṣādhāyitve ca sādhakatamatvābhāvāt katham asya tattvaṃ syād ity āśayaḥ /
analyzed: ucyate
translated: In the establishment of the limit of valid cognition, a preeminent cause is called a means of valid cognition. And if it does not bring about a non-distinct [cognition], how could it be real, since it is not the best means of establishing [the object]? This is the idea.

analyzed: vyācakṣāṇaḥ avadhāraṇe darśayati
translated: [The author] says not at all and shows the particle eva in the sense of restriction.

analyzed: liṅga grahaṇāt tara kāla bhāvinaḥ vikalpasya iti prakaraṇāt
translated: [The cognition] that arises later, which is an inference, is [shown] by the word inferential [in the verse]. The word or [in the verse] is understood.

original: tasmin vikalpe tasya sāmānyam iti prakāśitam /
analyzed: tasmin vikalpe pratibhāsanāt tasya sāmānyam iti prakāśitam
translated: In that [inferential] cognition, the universal [of cow] is manifested.

analyzed: saṃbaddha saṃbandhāt ityādi pūrvoktaḥ prakāraḥ
translated: The method stated earlier, beginning with from the connection of the connected, is [shown].

original: vyaktisvabhāvatve tasya kathaṃ tadakartṛtvam ity āha tasyeti / /
analyzed: vyakti svabhāva tve tasya katham tad akartṛ tvam iti āha tasya iti
translated: If it has the nature of an individual, how can it not be produced by that [individual]? He says of that [in the verse].

original: kalpitaṃ vikalpena ghaṭitaṃ rūpaṃ / svabhāvo yasya tasya /
analyzed: kalpitam vikalpena ghaṭitam rūpam svabhāvaḥ yasya tasya
translated: The form that is imagined, constructed by conceptualization, is the nature of that [universal].

analyzed: tad asaṃbhavāt rañjana ādi arthakriyā anupapatteḥ
translated: Because that [universal] is impossible, since the function of coloring, etc. is not possible.

analyzed: sarva nitya sādhāraṇa dūṣaṇam iha samuccinvan āha
translated: Including here the criticism that applies to all universals, he says:

analyzed: anyā
translated: And if it is different should be supplied.

original: iti /r evam artho manyate / cetasi nidhattevārttikakāra ity evaṃ bruvāṇa iti cārthād draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: evam arthaḥ manyate cetasi nidhattā iva ārttikakāraḥ iti evam bruvāṇaḥ iti ca arthāt draṣṭavyam
translated: Thus. The meaning is understood in this way. The author of the commentary is to be seen as saying this, as if placing it in the mind.

analyzed: vā iti s
translated: The word iti (thus).🔽The definition of a means of valid knowledge as that which has an unknown object has been shown by the opponent in the verse. Showing this, he says There, the means of valid knowledge is that which...

original: anadhigatārthaviṣayaṃ pramāṇam iti pramāṇalakṣaṇaṃ pareṇa kārikayā darśitam iti darśayann āha tatrāpūrveti / / aham ahamikayā kriyā āhopuruṣikā
analyzed: anadhigata artha viṣayam pramāṇam iti pramāṇa lakṣaṇam pareṇa kārikayā darśitam iti darśayan āha tatra apūrvā iti aham ahamikayā kriyā āhopuruṣikā
translated: I is the action of the ego, the boasting.

original: tayā / karaṇabhūtayā /🔽tatsvalakṣaṇam aspaṣṭarūpatayā anukarotīti vivakṣitam iti prakaṭyann āha /
analyzed: tayā karaṇa bhūtayā
translated: By that, which is the instrument.🔽It is intended that it imitates that particular characteristic in an unclear form. Revealing this, he says:

analyzed: aspaṣṭa nīla sva lakṣaṇa anukārī aspaṣṭa nīla sva lakṣaṇa ābhāsam iti arthaḥ
translated: Imitating the unclear particular characteristic of blue, the meaning is appearing as the unclear particular characteristic of blue.

analyzed: sarvaḥ eva hi vikalpaḥ spaṣṭa sva lakṣaṇa ābhaḥ
translated: For all conceptual thoughts have an unclear particular characteristic.

original: nīlādi paśyatas tu vikalpayato yaḥ spaṣṭārthapratibhāsābhimānaḥ /
analyzed: nīla ādi paśyataḥ tu vikalpayataḥ yaḥ spaṣṭa artha pratibhāsa abhimānaḥ
translated: But when one sees blue etc. and conceptualizes, the belief in the clear appearance of the object,

analyzed: sa tad vikalpa sama samaya janmanaḥ nirvikalpasya prasādāt
translated: that is due to the grace of the non-conceptual thought that arises simultaneously with that conceptual thought.

analyzed: yathā ca etat tathā ubhece
translated: And how this is so, that has been explained in the chapter on the two valid means of knowledge.

analyzed: samīcīnam ācāryaḥ viniścayam iti yaḥ iti
translated: The teacher has stated this correctly. This refers to

analyzed: tatas eva avagantavyam
translated: that very [chapter]. It should be understood from there itself.

original: kathaṃ punar aspaṣṭanīlasvalakṣaṇānukāri na tu nirvikalpavat spaṣṭasvalakṣaṇānukārīty āśaṃkya yojyam sākṣād / vyavadhānena anutpattes
analyzed: katham punar aspaṣṭa nīla sva lakṣaṇa anukāri na tu nirvikalpa vat spaṣṭa sva lakṣaṇa anukāri iti āśaṃkya yojyam sākṣāt vyavadhānena anutpatteḥ
translated: How then is it not a copy of the indistinctly perceived specific property, but rather like the non-conceptual [cognition], a copy of the distinctly perceived specific property? Fearing this doubt, it should be connected: directly. Because it does not arise through an intermediary.

analyzed: tatas sva lakṣaṇāt iti prakaraṇāt
translated: From that specific property, due to the context.

analyzed: yadi tatas tat na utpannam
translated: If it does not arise from that,

original: tarhi tasya niyatanīlādyākāraparigrahaḥ kutastya ity āśaṃkya yojyam darśane /ti /
analyzed: tarhi tasya niyata nīla ādi ākāra parigrahaḥ kutastyaḥ iti āśaṃkya yojyam  /
translated: then how can it have the definite form of blue, etc.? Fearing this doubt, it should be connected: in the perception.

original: hitaḥ saṃskāro / vāsanā tasyāvedha / ākṣepas tadvaśāt /
analyzed: hitaḥ saṃskāraḥ vāsanā
translated: Impression means a beneficial modification. Its impetus is its projection. Due to that,

original: co / vyaktam etad ity āsminn arthe /
analyzed: vyaktam etat iti ā asmin arthe
translated: the word ca (and) has the meaning of this is clear.

analyzed: ādheya s
translated: It is to be deposited.

analyzed: nanu yat tatra avabhāsate tat svalakṣaṇam
translated: But what appears there is the specific property.

original: yena spaṣṭanīlasvalakṣaṇānukārīty ucyata ity āha dṛśye /ti /🔽dṛśyavikalpyayor ekīkaraṇāt /
analyzed: yena spaṣṭa nīla sva lakṣaṇa anukārī iti ucyate iti āha  dṛśya vikalpyayoḥ ekīkaraṇāt
translated: By what it is said to be a copy of the distinctly perceived specific property, he says: in the visible.🔽Because the visible and the conceptualized are made one.

original: dṛśyavikalpyāv arthāv ekīkṛtyāsya pravṛtter ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: dṛśya vikalpyau arthau ekīkṛtya asya pravṛtteḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: because it operates by making the visible and the conceptualized objects one.

analyzed: dṛśya vikalpya ekīkaraṇam ca tasya tathā utpatteḥ eva draṣṭavyam
translated: And that should be seen as arising in that way.

analyzed: tad avabhāsinaḥ bāhya tvāt eva na param asau anukaroti iti āśayaḥ
translated: The idea is: because it appears as that, it does not really copy it, because it is not external.

analyzed: sa vikalpaḥ
translated: That is the conceptual cognition.

original: ta popānālambane kathaṃ gṛhītagrāhitvalakṣaṇaṃ smrtitvam ity āśaṃkyāha tathāhī /ti /
analyzed: katham gṛhīta grāhi tva lakṣaṇam smrti tvam iti āśaṃkya āha
translated: How can memory, characterized by apprehending what has been grasped, be [in the case of inference]? Anticipating this doubt, he says Thus, etc.

original: p / smṛtirūpatvam evānumānavikalpasya pratipādayan paraḥ prāha tathāhi /tyādi /
analyzed: smṛti rūpa tvam eva anumāna vikalpasya pratipādayan paraḥ prāha
translated: The opponent, in order to establish that the conceptual cognition of inference has the form of memory, says Thus, etc.

original: agnitvādinā anagnivyavṛttaṃ vastumātram ity āha mahānasas sūpakāraśālā /
analyzed: agni tva ādinā vastu mātram iti āha mahānasaḥ sūpa kāra śālā
translated: The mere thing that is excluded from non-fire by the property of being fiery, he says, is the kitchen, the cook's hall.

analyzed: kārakuṭī ādeḥ grahaṇam
translated: By the word etc. the inclusion of the carpenter's workshop and so on is indicated.

analyzed: prāk pūrvam vyāpti grahaṇa kālaḥ iti ākūtam
translated: Before means at the time of grasping the pervasion, previously, this is the intention.

analyzed: pradeśa viśeṣe parvata ādau
translated: In a particular place, such as a mountain, etc.

original: tadvas / anumānavikalpavat /🔽nanv adhigatāv adhigantur apy anumānavikalpasya prāmāṇyapradarśanenāsyāpi tathābhūtasya
analyzed: tat vai anumāna vikalpavat  nanu adhigatau adhigantuḥ api anumāna vikalpasya prāmāṇya pradarśanena asya api tathābhūtasya
translated: That refers to the conceptual cognition of inference.🔽But if the validity of the cognizer, the conceptual cognition of inference, is shown in the case of the known, then the validity of this kind of [cognition]

original: prāmāṇyam āveditam evati kim āśaṃkyāha evaṃ manyata / iti /
analyzed: prāmāṇyam āveditam eva iti kim āśaṃkya āha evam manyate iti
translated: has also been indicated. What is the doubt? He says Thus, etc.

original: pūrvapakṣiṇaitasminn uktepy evaṃ bruvāṇo niyatam evaṃ vakṣyamāṇakaṃ manyate / cetasi niveśayati /
analyzed: pūrvapakṣiṇā etasmin ukte api evam bruvāṇaḥ niyatam evam vakṣyamāṇakam manyate cetasi niveśayati
translated: Even when this has been stated by the opponent, one who speaks thus certainly thinks and places in the mind the following to be stated.

analyzed: yat mananīyam eva darśayati
translated: He shows just what is to be thought by What, etc.

analyzed: kālasya parigrahaḥ
translated: By the word etc. time is included.

analyzed: sādhya dharmi grāhi parvata ādi grāhi
translated: [The cognition] apprehending the subject to be established. [The cognition] apprehending the mountain, etc.
[The cognition] apprehending the subject in the example. [The cognition] apprehending the subject in the great mountain, etc.

original: tatra dṛṣṭāntadharmigrāhiṇā darśanena naiva parvatādiviśiṣṭam anagninā vyāvṛttaṃ vastu gṛhītam /🔽nāpi tadāha na parvanāpi parva
analyzed: tatra dṛṣṭānta dharmi grāhiṇā darśanena nā eva parvata ādi viśiṣṭam anagninā vyāvṛttam vastu gṛhītam  na api tat āha na parvanā api parva
translated: Among them, by the cognition apprehending the subject in the example, the thing distinguished by the mountain, etc. as excluded from non-fire is not apprehended.

analyzed: tad ādi sādhya dharmi grāhiṇā anvaya ādya vedinā na api
translated: Nor is it by the cognition apprehending the subject to be established in the mountain, etc. as excluded from non-fire.

original: tathātra vipatti tathātve 'vipratipatti🔽prasaṃgāt tadviśiṣṭam anagnivyāvṛttam vastu gṛhītam itidarśanānvayādarśanadvayā
analyzed: tathā atra  prasaṃgāt tad viśiṣṭam anagni vyāvṛttam vastu gṛhītam iti darśana anvaya adarśana dvayā
translated: In that case, if it were so, there would be no disagreement.

analyzed: na adhigatam uktam
translated: It is said that the thing distinguished by that as excluded from non-fire is not apprehended by the two cognitions of perception and non-perception of concomitance.
[It is said] by excluding non-connection. By distinguishing the relation, it is the opposite of that. Because it is the opposite of the conception of inference.

original: tena yadāthā🔽ḍṛ / /yatyaiva niścayanāt /🔽nanu vastvadhiṣṭhānatvād va /stvālambanatvād ity abhipretam /
analyzed: tena  ḍṛyatyā eva niścayanāt  nanu vastu adhiṣṭhāna tvāt iti abhipretam
translated: By that, when it is ascertained🔽by perception itself.🔽But is it intended that [inference] is based on things and has things as its object?

original: tathā cānumānāsaṃgrahaḥ ity āha vastvadhiṣṭhānatvaṃ ce /ti /
analyzed: tathā ca anumāna asaṃgrahaḥ iti āha vastu adhiṣṭhāna tvam
translated: And if so, it is not included in inference. Therefore he says If [inference] were based on things...

analyzed: cakāraḥ tuśabdasya arthe
translated: The word but has the meaning of only.

original: pramāṇasya vyāpāraḥ prāpaṇam tasya viṣayas tam abhipretyocyate /
analyzed: pramāṇasya vyāpāraḥ prāpaṇam tasya viṣayaḥ tam abhipretya ucyate
translated: The operation of a means of valid knowledge is the conveying [of an object], and its object is that [object] which is intended [by the operation].

analyzed: na ālambana lakṣaṇam viṣayam abhipretya ucyate iti sambandhanīyam
translated: [The means of valid knowledge] is said to have the characteristic of an object, [but] it is to be connected [with the statement] with reference to the object that is intended.

analyzed: ālambana lakṣaṇam grāhya rūpam
translated: The characteristic of an object is the form that is to be grasped.

analyzed: uktāt anyena prakāreṇa anyathāvyāpinī sarva pramāṇa asaṃgrāhikā
translated: [The means of valid knowledge] is said to be other than what has been stated, [that is,] it is said to be all-pervading, [that is,] it includes all means of valid knowledge.

original: viprakṛṣṭo vyavahito viṣayo yasyāḥ sā tathoktā /
analyzed: viprakṛṣṭaḥ vyavahitaḥ viṣayaḥ yasyāḥ sā tathā uktā
translated: [The means of valid knowledge] is said to have a distant or interrupted object.

analyzed: pratividhānam
translated: The answer to that [objection] is Even there, etc.

analyzed: vikalpa rūpasya eva vastunaḥ dharmi tvāt  tasya eva ca tad pradhāna tva ādi anupādāna tva sādhya tvāt
translated: Because only the form of a thing that is conceptualized is the subject.🔽And because only that [conceptualized form] is the primary [object], [the means of valid knowledge] is not accepted [as the subject], because it is to be established.

original: tatrāpi pramāṇavyavasthāyās tad eva vikalparūpaṃ vastvadhiṣṭhānam astīti samudāyārtha /
analyzed: tatra api pramāṇa vyavasthāyāḥ tat eva vikalpa rūpam vastu adhiṣṭhānam asti iti samudāya artha
translated: The general meaning is that even there, the determination of the means of valid knowledge has that same conceptualized form of a thing as its basis.

analyzed: darśana vidhi pratiṣedha vikalpānām darśanasya eva prāmāṇyam na itarayoḥ iti prakṛtam
translated: It is understood that [the determination of the means of valid knowledge] is only for perception, not for injunctions or prohibitions.

original: uktañ ca tatra tadādyam eva / ityādinā /
analyzed: uktam ca tatra tat ādyam ityādinā
translated: And it has been stated there [in the Nyāyasūtra] beginning with That is the first [means of valid knowledge].

analyzed: tat kutas vastu āśrayeṇa pramāṇa vyavasthā pratipādanasya
translated: Then, what is the purpose of this explanation of the determination of the means of valid knowledge based on a real thing?

original: danam ityāśaṃkya saṃgati darśayitum idaṃ ce /tyādinopakramate /
analyzed: danam iti āśaṃkya saṃgati darśayitum idam
translated: Having suspected that it is a gift, he begins with this in order to show the connection.

analyzed: tasya anadhigata vastu rūpa adhigantṛ tvasya asiddha tā
translated: The non-establishment of that, which is the cognition of the nature of an unknown object.

analyzed: tasyāḥ udbhāvanam prakāśanam tad artham
translated: The proclamation of that, the revelation of that, for that purpose.

analyzed: tasya eva sva lakṣaṇasya eva
translated: Of that itself. Of the particular itself.

analyzed: arth kriyā sasā
translated: The capacity for effective action.

original: marthyalakṣaṇatvāt tadviṣayopi vikalpaḥ prāmāṇyānnāpaitīti pūrvapakṣam utpaśyann evaṃ bruvāṇaḥ kiṃ manyata ity āha sāmānyasyeti / /
analyzed: marthya lakṣaṇa tvāt tad viṣayaḥ api vikalpaḥ prāmāṇyāt na apaiti iti pūrvapakṣam utpaśyan evam bruvāṇaḥ kim manyate iti āha sāmānyasya iti
translated: Because it is characterized by the capacity for effective action, even the conceptual cognition that has that as its object does not deviate from being valid cognition. Seeing this as the prima facie view, he says this, thinking What do you think?

analyzed: tad viparīta tvāt
translated: Because it is the opposite of that, because it is the opposite of the characteristic of the capacity for effective action.

original: yathā ca tasyārthakriyākāritvasaṃbhavi tathā purastād uktam iti /
analyzed: yathā ca tasya arthakriyā kāri tva saṃbhavi tathā purastāt uktam iti
translated: And how it is possible for that to perform effective action has been stated earlier.

analyzed: gūḍha abhisandhiḥ ca evam manyate iti
translated: And one whose intention is hidden thinks thus.

original: tatopi / vastuny eva / puruṣasya pravṛtter i /ti saṃbandhaḥ /
analyzed: vastuni eva puruṣasya pravṛtteḥ saṃbandhaḥ
translated: Therefore also, only in the real thing, because the person's engagement is thus - this is the connection.

original: tatsāmarthyajanmā vikalpo na pramāṇam i /ti sādhye ca hetupadam etat /
analyzed: tad sāmarthya janmā vikalpaḥ na pramāṇam sādhye ca hetu padam etat
translated: This is the reason statement in the proof that the conceptual cognition born from that capacity is not a valid means of knowledge.

analyzed: katham pravṛttiḥ iti āha
translated: How is there engagement? He says: by the ascertainment of that.

original: kasmāt tadadhyavasāyena pravṛttiḥ kalpyate ity anyathe /ti /
analyzed: kasmāt tad adhyavasāyena pravṛttiḥ kalpyate iti
translated: Why is activity imagined to be on account of the ascertainment of that? It is otherwise.

analyzed: tatra
translated: There.

original: svalakṣaṇe pūrvasyā upapatter asyāś ca tulyatvāt kim anena punar āha pūrvam i /ti /
analyzed: sva lakṣaṇe pūrvasyāḥ upapatteḥ asyāḥ ca tulya tvāt kim anena punar āha pūrvam
translated: Since the previous one is established in the case of the particular characteristic, and this one is similar, why is this said again? It is said that the previous one is for the sake of the subsequent one.

original: etañ ca śābdīṃ gatim āśritya bhedo darśito draṣṭavyaḥ /
analyzed: etam ca śābdīm gatim āśritya bhedaḥ darśitaḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: And this difference should be seen as shown on the basis of the verbal method.

original: athārthābhedāt kiṃ mukhabhedamātreṇa bhedenopadarśiteneti nirbandhas tad evocyata ity abhiprāyavān āha yad ve /ti /
analyzed: atha artha abhedāt kim mukha bheda mātreṇa bhedena upadarśitena iti nirbandhaḥ tat eva ucyate iti abhiprāyavān āha yat
translated: If, however, it is insisted that what is the use of showing the difference merely by the difference of the face due to the non-difference of the object, it is said that the intention is that the same is said.

original: kim itī /tinipātānipātasamudāyaḥ kasmād ity asyārthe vartate /
analyzed: kim kasmāt iti asya arthe vartate
translated: The compound 'kim iti' is used in the sense of 'kasmāt'.

original: syād etat svalakṣaṇe nirvikalpakaviṣaye pravartayann api tadanubhavāt san prāmāṇyaṃ prāpsyatīty āśaṃkyāha ayam asyābhiprāya
analyzed: syāt etat sva lakṣaṇe nirvikalpaka viṣaye pravartayan api tad anubhavāt san prāmāṇyam prāpsyati iti āśaṃkya āha ayam asya abhiprāya
translated: This may be said: Even engaging in the particular characteristic, which is the object of non-conceptual cognition, it would attain validity by being existent due to the experience of that. Suspecting this, it is said: This is his intention.

analyzed: iti
translated: There.

analyzed: tatra eva prameya antare
translated: It would engage in the same object, in another object of knowledge.

analyzed: sambhāvana padam etat
translated: This is a word of possibility.

analyzed: śakya artham vā
translated: Or it may be the object of possibility.

original: kiṃ kartuṃ pravartayed ity āha rūpaṃ tatsādhyam i /ti /
analyzed: kim kartum pravartayet iti āha rūpam
translated: What is to be done? It is said that it would engage in form, which is to be accomplished.

original: prameyāntaramātraṃ tadviṣayam abhipretya tatraiva pravarttayet tatsādhyām arthakriyām adhigantum i /ty uktam adhunā tu yadi sāmarthyasāmānya
analyzed: prameya antara mātram tad viṣayam abhipretya tatra eva pravarttayet tad sādhyām arthakriyām adhigantum uktam adhunā tu yadi
translated: If that is merely another object of knowledge, then he should engage in that very [object of knowledge] in order to attain the activity that is to be accomplished by that [object of knowledge]. Thus it was said. But now, if that is a general capacity

original: tatprameyāntaraṃ tadā naiva vā / ity uktam /
translated: or another object of knowledge, then it was said that he should not engage at all.

original: naiva vā pravartayet na svalakṣaṇe nāpi sāmānye na kvacid apīti pravṛttimātrapratiṣedhād ghriyate /🔽pravartayatu S /
analyzed: na eva vā pravartayet na sva lakṣaṇe na api sāmānye na kvacid api iti pravṛtti mātra pratiṣedhāt ghriyate  pravartayatu s
translated: Or he should not engage at all, in the particular nor in the universal, nor anywhere. Since the mere prohibition of engagement is understood, he should engage.

analyzed: tad sādhyām arthakriyām
translated: He should engage in that which is to be accomplished by that.

original: yad vā pūrvaṃ sāmānyasādhyām arthakriyāmanākalyyābhihitam tatraiva / ityādi /
analyzed: yat vā pūrvam sāmānya sādhyām arthakriyām anākalyya abhihitam tatra eva ityādi
translated: Or, as was said earlier without considering the activity to be accomplished by the universal, in that very [object of knowledge], etc.

original: idānīṃ tu tatsādhyām arthakriyāmākālyyoktam naiva ve /ti /
analyzed: idānīm tu tat sādhyām arthakriyām ākālyya uktam na eva
translated: But now, without considering the activity to be accomplished by that, it was said that he should not engage at all.

analyzed: kasmāt evām iti āha
translated: Why is it so? He says in that object.

analyzed: tad siddhaye eva pravartayiṣyati iti āha
translated: He will engage only for the sake of establishing that. He says in the conceptual cognition.

analyzed: abhinna jñāna lakṣaṇāyāḥ arthakriyāyāḥ niṣpatteḥ
translated: Because the activity characterized by the undifferentiated cognition is accomplished.

original: sāmārthyāc cābhinnābhidhānalakṣaṇāyāś cety ābhedam ś cety api vedyam /
analyzed: sāmārthyāt ca abhinna abhidhāna lakṣaṇāyāḥ ca iti ābhedam ca iti api vedyam
translated: And because of the undifferentiated designation characterized by capacity, the non-difference should also be understood.

original: nanu tataḥ prameyāntaraviṣayopi pratyayas tadviṣaye pravarttayanniṣpāditasvaviṣayārthakriyo vā kvacit pravarttayan prāmāṇyam api prāpsyatīty
analyzed: nanu tatas prameya antara viṣayaḥ api pratyayaḥ tad viṣaye pravarttayan niṣpādita sva viṣaya artha kriyaḥ vā kvacid pravarttayan prāmāṇyam api prāpsyati iti
translated: But then, even a cognition that has a different object, when causing engagement in that object, or when causing engagement in some object after accomplishing its own purpose, would attain validity.

analyzed: āha
translated: He says No and so on.

original: pratyayā / ity atra bahuvacanena sākalyaṃ darśayati /
analyzed: pratyayāḥ iti atra bahuvacanena sākalyam darśayati
translated: Here, by the plural in cognitions, totality is shown.

analyzed: sādhitā niṣpāditā arthakriyā
translated: The purpose is accomplished, completed.

analyzed: yeṣām ante tathā
translated: Those which are so.

original: teṣāṃ kvacid api / na pravartayantīti pūrvakeṇābhisambandhaḥ /
analyzed: teṣām kvacid api na pravartayanti iti pūrvakeṇa abhisambandhaḥ
translated: They do not cause engagement in any, this is connected with the previous.

original: viśeṣeṇa / viśeṣeṣyaiva yair mīmāṃsakair evaṃ vyākhyāyate / teṣāṃ mata iti sāmārthyāt /
analyzed: viśeṣeṇa yaiḥ mīmāṃsakaiḥ evam vyākhyāyate teṣām mataḥ iti sāmārthyāt
translated: In particular, by those Mimamsakas who explain it thus, their view is understood by implication.

analyzed: dvi ātmakasya sāmānya viśeṣa ātmakasya
translated: Of the twofold, having the nature of the universal and the particular.

original: vijñānābhinnahetutvād icchāder vijñānātmakaṃkatvaṃ🔽siddham abhipretya prāmāṇyānuṣaṅgaḥ kutokṛto
analyzed: vijñāna abhinna hetu tvāt icchā ādeḥ  siddham abhipretya prāmāṇya anuṣaṅgaḥ
translated: Because desire etc. have a cause that is not different from cognition, their having the nature of cognition

analyzed: veditavyaḥ
translated: is accepted as established, and the implication of validity should be understood as being made.

analyzed: pramāṇānām iyat tā
translated: The limit of valid cognitions is thus.

original: kumārilamatena pratyakṣānumānopamānārthāpattiśābdābhāvāḥ ṣaḍ eva pramāṇānīty evaṃrūpā viśīryeta / truṭyet /
analyzed: kumārila matena pratyakṣa anumāna upamāna arthāpatti śābda abhāvāḥ ṣaṭ eva pramāṇāni iti evaṃrūpā viśīryeta truṭyet
translated: According to Kumarila's view, the classification would be destroyed, would be broken, that there are only six valid cognitions, namely perception, inference, analogy, presumption, verbal testimony and non-existence.

analyzed: dhārayā pravāhena vahana śīlāni bhavana dharmāṇi
translated: Those that have the nature of flowing are those that have the habit of flowing with a current. Those that have the nature of existing.

analyzed: anekāntaḥ tad abhinna yogakṣema tva lakṣaṇaḥ hetuḥ iti prakaraṇāt
translated: The reason is non-contradiction, which is characterized by having the same fate as that [current], according to the context.

original: ekasminn arthe sajātīyāni sajātīyavijātīyāni pramāṇāni saṃplavante pravarttanta iti vādī / /
analyzed: ekasmin arthe sajātīyāni sajātīya vijātīyāni vā pramāṇāni saṃplavante pravarttante iti vādī  /
translated: In one object, the means of valid cognition of the same kind and of the different kind converge, i.e., operate, says the proponent.

analyzed: pratikṣaṇam bhidyate iti sambandhaḥ
translated: It is connected that [the current] is divided every moment.

analyzed: keṣām
translated: Of which particular moments?

analyzed: sādhye rthe vāñchā bhavati
translated: There is a desire for the object to be established.

original: yady asmadādīnāṃ tathārthādarśitvād eva na saṃbhavatīty āha yogināmi i /ti /
analyzed: yadi asmat ādīnām tathā artha adarśi tvāt eva na saṃbhavati iti āha
translated: If it is so for us and others, it is not possible just because the object is not seen, he says for the yogis.

original: yogaś cittaikāgratā sa yeṣām asti teṣām /
analyzed: yogaḥ citta ekāgra tā sa yeṣām asti teṣām
translated: Those who have yoga, i.e., one-pointedness of mind, are yogis.

analyzed: nitya yoge praśaṃsāyām vāyaminiḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: The suffix in is to be seen in the praise of constant yoga.

original: śamathavipaśyane vā yogas /🔽nanu teṣāṃ svārthāsaṃbhavāt kim abhipretyāsmin vāñchā bhavatīty āha pare /ti /
analyzed: śamatha vipaśyane vā yogaḥ  nanu teṣām svārtha asaṃbhavāt kim abhipretya asmin vāñchā bhavati iti āha
translated: Or yoga is tranquility and insight.🔽But what is intended by them, since their own purpose is not possible? He says for others.

original: atha paropakāriṇaḥ pareṣām evopakurvantu kasmāt punaḥ kṣaṇaviśeṣasādhyam arthaṃ prāptuṃ pariharttuṃ vābhilaṣantīty āha kasyacid i /ti
analyzed: atha para upakāriṇaḥ pareṣām eva upakurvantu kasmāt punar kṣaṇa viśeṣa sādhyam artham prāptum pariharttum vā abhilaṣanti iti āha kasyacid
translated: If they are benefactors of others, let them benefit others only. But why do they desire to attain or avoid an object to be established by particular moments? He says for someone.

original: kasyacit kṣaṇaviśeṣasādhyasyārthasya kathaṃ cit sākṣāt pāraṃparyeṇa vopayogād upa / /
analyzed: kasyacid kṣaṇa viśeṣa sādhyasya arthasya katham cit sākṣāt pāraṃparyeṇa vā upayogāt
translated: By some means, either directly or indirectly, it is helpful to some purpose that is to be accomplished in a particular moment.

analyzed: kvacid prāṇinī iti prakaraṇāt avaseyam
translated: In some cases, the word living being should be supplied from the context.

analyzed: anena para upakāra aṅga tvam tasya darśitam
translated: By this, its nature as a means of benefiting others is shown.

analyzed: tadā nānā yogakṣema tvam iti sambandhanīyam
translated: Then, it should be connected with having different goals and protections.

analyzed: tadā iti atracchedaḥ vyaktaḥ eva
translated: The break after that is clearly evident.

analyzed: etat eva nidarśayan āha
translated: Indicating just this, he says just as...

analyzed: sāmānya ucchedasya arthasya viṣaya upadarśane yathā etat darśitam
translated: In the demonstration of the object of the purpose of general destruction, this is shown.

analyzed: tathā anyat api draṣṭavyam iti yathāśabdasya arthaḥ
translated: Other [purposes] should be seen in the same way. This is the meaning of the word yathā (just as).

analyzed: iti
translated: By excluding the path of cultivation, [it is] the path of seeing.

analyzed: duḥkhe dharma jñāna kṣāṃtiḥ
translated: Patience for the knowledge of dharmas regarding suffering.

analyzed: duḥkhe dharma jñānam  duḥkhe nvaya jñāna kṣāṃtiḥ
translated: Knowledge of dharmas regarding suffering.🔽Patience for subsequent knowledge regarding suffering.

analyzed: duḥkhe anvaya jñānam  samudaye dharma jñāna kṣāntiḥ
translated: Subsequent knowledge regarding suffering.🔽Patience for the knowledge of dharmas regarding origination.

analyzed: samudaye dharma jñānam  samudaye nvaya jñāna kṣāntiḥ
translated: Knowledge of dharmas regarding origination.🔽Patience for subsequent knowledge regarding origination.

analyzed: samudaye nvaya jñānam  nirodhe dharma jñāna kṣāntiḥ
translated: Subsequent knowledge regarding origination.🔽Patience for the knowledge of dharmas regarding cessation.

analyzed: nirodhe dharma jñānam
translated: Knowledge of dharmas regarding cessation.

analyzed: nirodhe nvaya jñāna kṣāntiḥ
translated: Acceptance of the knowledge of the subsequent [truth] of cessation.

analyzed: nirodhe nvaya jñānam
translated: Knowledge of the subsequent [truth] of cessation.

analyzed: mārge dharma jñāna kṣāntiḥ
translated: Acceptance of the knowledge of the truth of the path.

analyzed: mārge dharma jñānam
translated: Knowledge of the truth of the path.

original: mā 'nvayajñānakṣāntir ity evaṃ pañcadaśaksaṇā darśanamārgaḥ taduktamabhidharmakośe adṛṣṭadṛṣṭer dṛṅmārgas tatra pañcadaśakṣaṇāḥ
analyzed: rge nvaya jñāna kṣāntiḥ iti evam pañcadaśa ksaṇāḥ darśana mārgaḥ tat uktam abhidharmakośe adṛṣṭa dṛṣṭeḥ dṛś mārgaḥ tatra pañcadaśa kṣaṇāḥ
translated: Acceptance of the subsequent knowledge. Thus the path of seeing has fifteen moments. As it is said in the Abhidharmakośa: The path of seeing is where there are fifteen moments, seeing what was not seen.

analyzed: ak iti
translated: Thus.

analyzed: tasmin darśana mārge phala bhūtāḥ pañca saṃkleśa skandhāḥ
translated: In that path of seeing, the five aggregates of defilement are the fruits.

original: duḥkhākhyaṃ satyam /🔽p / tasmin duḥkhe dharmajñānakṣāntiḥ / svarūpajñānayogyatā /
analyzed: duḥkha ākhyam satyam  tasmin duḥkhe dharma jñāna kṣāntiḥ svarūpa jñāna yogya tā
translated: The truth called suffering.🔽In that suffering, acceptance of the knowledge of the truth is the ability to know the nature.

analyzed: duḥkha sākṣātsaṃkākṣātkā  ri jñāna upajanana yogyaḥ kuśalaḥ iti yāvat
translated: The ability to produce the direct knowledge of suffering.

analyzed: atra viśeṣa arthinā visuddhi maggaḥ
translated: Up to the wholesome one who seeks the special. The path of purification should be followed.

analyzed: sa kṣaṇaḥ kim āha
translated: What is that moment? He says:

analyzed: rāga pratidhamāna avidyā vicikitsā pañca
translated: The five: attachment, hostility, ignorance, doubt,

original: satkāyadṛṣṭimithyādaṣṭiantahrāhadṛṣṭidṛṣṭiparāmarṣavrataparāmarṣalakṣaṇā dṛṣṭayaḥ daśānuśayāḥ eṣām vāsanāṃ nirodhayati / vināśayati
analyzed: satkāya dṛṣṭi mithyādaṣṭi anta hrāha dṛṣṭi dṛṣṭi parāmarṣa vrata parāmarṣa lakṣaṇāḥ dṛṣṭayaḥ daśa anuśayāḥ eṣām vāsanām nirodhayati vināśayati
translated: The ten latent tendencies of the views: the view of the transitory collection, wrong view, the view of holding a particular view as paramount, the view of holding ethical behavior and asceticism as paramount, and the characteristics of the views. He destroys, eliminates their latent tendencies.

analyzed: katham karoti iti āha
translated: How does he do it? He says:

analyzed: taiḥ anuśayaiḥ viruddhaḥ yam āśayaḥ
translated: This intention, which is a special state of the continuum of mind, is opposed by those latent tendencies.

original: duḥkhe dharmajñānakṣāntikṣaṇasyārthakriyām upadarśya duḥkhe dharmajñānakṣaṇasya tato bhinnām arthakriyāṃ darśayitum āha duḥkha / iti
analyzed: duḥkhe dharma jñāna kṣānti kṣaṇasya arthakriyām upadarśya duḥkhe dharma jñāna kṣaṇasya tatas bhinnām arthakriyām darśayitum āha duḥkhe iti
translated: Having shown the function of the moment of receptivity to the knowledge of dharmas with regard to suffering, in order to show the function that is different from that of the moment of knowledge of dharmas with regard to suffering, he says suffering and so on.
The knowledge of dharmas with regard to suffering is the direct realization of the nature of suffering.

analyzed: pravṛtta jñānam
translated: It is the knowledge that has arisen.

analyzed: nirvāṇam mokṣaḥ prāpyate anayā iti vyutpattyā
translated: Nirvana is liberation. It is attained by this, according to the derivation.

original: nirvāṇasya prāptir yasmād iti vyutpattyā vā tāvat kleśaviviktatā /
analyzed: nirvāṇasya prāptiḥ yasmāt iti vyutpattyā vā tāvat kleśa vivikta tā
translated: Or according to the derivation because of the attainment of nirvana, it is the state of being free from afflictions.

original: darśanamārgapraheyāṇāṃ dvātriṃśataḥ kleṣānāṃ madhye 'nena daśānāṃ eva kleṣānāṃ vini🔽rodhād dagdhad daśa
analyzed: darśana mārga praheyāṇām dvātriṃśataḥ kleṣānām madhye nena daśānām eva kleṣānām vini  rodhāt dagdhat daśa
translated: Out of the thirty-two afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing, only ten afflictions are abandoned by this [knowledge of dharmas with regard to suffering].
Because of the cessation of those ten afflictions, it is the state of being free from the ten burned afflictions.🔽It is so called because it is the state of being free from the ten afflictions.

analyzed: samudaya ādi jñāna ādi prahātavya kleśa prahāṇi pratirūpāḥ nirvāṇa bhāvasya
translated: The attainment of nirvana, which is the state of being free from the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the knowledge of origination and so on, is more distant.

analyzed: siddhi avasthānāt anyathā etat asamaṃjasam syāt iti
translated: This would be incoherent if it were otherwise, because of the state of accomplishment.

original: athavā nirvāṇaśabdena naivārcaṭaḥparamaniḥśrayasātmane yad evam ūce kiṃtvavāntaraniḥśreyasaṃ tathābhūtam iti na kiñcid avadyam /
analyzed: athavā nirvāṇa śabdena na eva arcaṭaḥ parama niḥśrayasa ātmane yat evam ūce kiṃtu avāntara niḥśreyasam tathābhūtam iti na kiñcid avadyam
translated: Or, if by the word nirvana he meant the highest refuge, the self, then he said it is like that, but it is not a fault to say that it is an intermediate refuge.

analyzed: katham tathā karoti iti āha
translated: How does he do it like that? He says: It remains.

original: sati tasmin manāgapi te punar notpadyante /
analyzed: sati tasmin manāk api te punar na utpadyante
translated: When that exists, even a little, they do not arise again.

original: api tu tadvivikta eva kṣaṇaprabandha iti tadā sudārḍḥyāpādanaṃ tasyādhīsayam / /
analyzed: api tu tad viviktaḥ eva kṣaṇa prabandhaḥ iti tadā
translated: But in a moment-series that is separate from that, then it is well-hardened. That is its remaining.

original: pūrvakena ca kṣaṇena kleśā niṣkleśitā uttareṇa tu yathā punar na praviśanti /
analyzed: pūrvakena ca kṣaṇena kleśāḥ niṣkleśitāḥ uttareṇa tu yathā te punar na praviśanti
translated: And by the previous moment, the afflictions are made free from afflictions. But by the subsequent one, it is acted upon so that they do not enter again.

analyzed: tathā ācaritam iti anayoḥ vyāpāra prayojanam
translated: This is the purpose of the operation of these two.

original: ataevābhidharmakoṣe cauraniṣkāśanapāṭapidhānavad iti AK / Bh darśitam /
analyzed: ataeva abhidharmakoṣe caura niṣkāśana pāṭa pidhāna vat iti a k darśitam
translated: For this very reason, in the Abhidharmakośa, it is shown as like expelling a thief and closing the door.

original: duḥkhe dharmajñānakṣāntidharmajñāne ca kāmāvacarakleśapratipakṣatayā jñātavye duḥkhe dharmajñānakṣāntidharmajñānayor udāharaṇāṇa
analyzed: duḥkhe dharma jñāna kṣānti dharma jñāne ca kāmāvacara kleśa pratipakṣa tayā jñātavye duḥkhe dharma jñāna kṣānti dharma jñānayoḥ
translated: In the example of the receptivity to the knowledge of dharmas with regard to suffering and the knowledge of dharmas, it should be known as the antidote to the afflictions of the desire realm. The receptivity to the knowledge of dharmas with regard to suffering and the knowledge of dharmas are

original: diṅmātratvena anyeṣām api tathā eṣām i /ti bahuvacanenāha grāhakāṇyālambakāni /
analyzed: diś mātra tvena anyeṣām api tathā eṣām bahuvacanena āha grāhakāṇi ālambakāni
translated: examples of the others also being like that, in just a general way. He says many in the plural. They are the apprehenders, the supports.

original: kāni punas tāni grāhakāṇīty āha pare /ti /
analyzed: kāni punar tāni grāhakāṇi iti āha
translated: What are those means of knowledge? The opponent says:

analyzed: para citta viṣayāṇi jñānāni para citta jñānāni
translated: The knowledges that have the minds of others as their objects are the knowledges of the minds of others.

analyzed: damānām s iti tu asamyak
translated: But the knowledges of the noble ones are not correct.

analyzed: etat uktam bhavati
translated: This is what is being said:

analyzed: darśana mārgam adhigacchataḥ duḥkhe
translated: For one who attains the path of seeing, the moments beginning with the receptivity to the knowledge of dharmas with regard to suffering,

original: kramabhāvinaḥ kramabhāvibhir jñānair yogyaṃtareṇa yad ālambyate parārthoddeśena tathā
analyzed: krama bhāvinaḥ krama bhāvibhiḥ jñānaiḥ yogi aṃtareṇa yat ālambyate parārtha uddeśena tathā
translated: which occur in sequence, are cognized by subsequent knowledges that occur in sequence, by a different cognition that takes them as its object, with the aim of benefiting others.

original: tadviṣayāṇi pṛthag eva / pūrvapūrvajñānād bhinnāny eva
analyzed: tad viṣayāṇi pṛthak eva pūrva pūrva jñānāt bhinnāni eva
translated: Those that have them as their objects are separate, different from the previous knowledges,

original: pramāṇānīti darśanamārgādhigantṛkṣaṇaviṣayāṇāṃ yogijñānānāṃ pṛthag eva prāmāṇyam🔽iti pratipādya saṃprati sāmānyenaiva yogijñānāni bhinnārthakriyāsāmarthyakṣaṇaviṣayāṇi
analyzed: pramāṇāni iti darśana mārga adhigantṛ kṣaṇa viṣayāṇām yogi jñānānām pṛthak eva prāmāṇyam  iti pratipādya saṃprati sāmānyena eva yogi jñānāni bhinna artha kriyā sāmarthya kṣaṇa viṣayāṇi
translated: means of knowledge. Thus the knowledges of yogins that have as their objects the moments cognized by one who attains the path of seeing have separate validity.🔽Having taught this, now in order to teach in general that all the knowledges of yogins that have as their objects moments with different causal efficacies

original: sarvāṇy eva pramāṇānīti pratipādayiṣyann āha parahite /tyādi /
analyzed: sarvāṇi eva pramāṇāni iti pratipādayiṣyan āha
translated: are valid means of knowledge, he says for the benefit of others and so on.

analyzed: bhagavatām adhyakṣa cetasām nānā yaḥ gakṣema tvāt
translated: Of the minds of the Blessed Ones, the Lords, there is diversity.

original: pṛthag eva prāmāṇyam iti śeṣaḥ prakaraṇalabhyaṃ vā /
analyzed: pṛthak eva prāmāṇyam iti śeṣaḥ prakaraṇa labhyam vā
translated: The rest is that they have separate validity, or it is understood from the context.

analyzed: adhikaraṇe ca iyam ṣaṣṭhī
translated: And this sixth case is in the locative.

original: tena bhagavat sambandhīni yāny adhyakṣacetāṃsi sākṣātkārapravṛttāni jñānāni teṣām ity ārthaḥ /
analyzed: tena bhagavat sambandhīni yāni adhyakṣa cetāṃsi sākṣātkāra pravṛttāni jñānāni teṣām iti ārthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: of those cognitions which are the Lord's, which are directly perceiving cognitions, which are engaged in perception.

analyzed: kiṃbhūtānām bhagavatām iti āha
translated: What are they like? The Lord says: all.

analyzed: sarva bhāvān bhāvanā bala jena jñānena paśyatām
translated: Who are always observing all things moment by moment with the knowledge born from the power of meditation, who are seeing.

original: kathaṃ teṣāṃ nānāyogakṣematvam ity āha tadviṣaye /ti /
analyzed: katham teṣām nānā yogakṣema tvam iti āha
translated: How is it that they have different goals and different safety? He says: in their objects.

original: teṣāṃ bhagavat / ye viṣayābhinnāḥ kṣaṇās taṣāṃ bhinnāsvarthakriyāsūpayogato / vyāpārāt /
analyzed: teṣām bhagavat    ye viṣaya abhinnāḥ kṣaṇāḥ taṣām bhinnāsu arthakriyāsu upayogataḥ vyāpārāt
translated: Those moments of the Lord's which are undifferentiated in their objects, from their engagement in different actions, from their operation.

original: anena viṣayasya tathātvād viṣayiṇas tathātvam uktam avaseyam /
analyzed: anena viṣayasya tathā tvāt viṣayiṇaḥ tathā tvam uktam avaseyam
translated: By this, the fact that the objects are thus, the fact that the subjects are thus should be understood.

original: kasmāt punas te pratikṣaṇaṃ bhāvān vīkṣanta ity āha kaścid eve /ti /
analyzed: kasmāt punar te pratikṣaṇam bhāvān vīkṣante iti āha kaścid
translated: Why do they observe things moment by moment? He says: some.

analyzed: itiḥ hetau
translated: The word iti is in the sense of cause.

original: anugrāhakavibandhakānurūpam ācaritum ity arthād eva sthitam /
analyzed: anugrāhaka vibandhaka anurūpam ācaritum iti arthāt eva sthitam
translated: To act in accordance with the benefactor and the obstructer is understood from the meaning itself.

analyzed: kṣaṇam vīkṣamāṇānām s
translated: For those observing moment by moment,

original: nanu tathāpi siddhārthā bhagavantaḥ apy apaśyantaḥ kasyacit kṣaṇasya
analyzed: nanu tathā api siddhārthāḥ bhagavantaḥ api a paśyantaḥ kasyacid kṣaṇasya
translated: But even so, the Lords have accomplished their purpose, and not seeing any moment of

original: kasyacit prāṇino 'nugrāhakatve vibandhakatvepi kasmād bhāvān pratikṣaṇaṃ vīkṣanta
analyzed: kasyacid prāṇinaḥ nugrāhaka tve vibandhaka tve pi kasmāt bhāvān pratikṣaṇam vīkṣanta
translated: Why do they look at things moment by moment, even when there is an obstruction to helping some living being?

analyzed: iti he
translated: This is suspected.

original: tu bhāvena bhagavad viśeṣaṇapadam āha parahite /ti /
analyzed: tu bhāvena bhagavat viśeṣaṇa padam āha
translated: The word special in the Blessed One is stated as the reason for that.

analyzed: parasmai hitam āyati pathyam tasya ādhānam karaṇam
translated: The benefit for another is the establishment of what is wholesome for the future.

original: tasya dīkṣā anuṣṭheyam evaitad iti niyamas tadvatām /
analyzed: tasya dīkṣā anuṣṭheyam eva etat iti niyamaḥ tadvatām
translated: The initiation of that is just this to be performed by those who possess it.

analyzed: nitya yoge ca ayam matup
translated: And this is in the eternal connection.

original: jñānam eva sadasadvivekakaraṇād āloka ivālokas tenāvabhāsita udyotito 'ntarātmā yeṣān teṣām / antarātmeti lokabhāvana
analyzed: jñānam eva sat asat viveka karaṇāt ālokaḥ iva ālokaḥ tena avabhāsitaḥ udyotitaḥ ntarātmā yeṣān teṣām antarātmā iti loka bhāvana
translated: Those whose inner self is illuminated, lit up by that knowledge which is like light because it is the instrument of discriminating the existent and non-existent, by that knowledge which is like light. The inner self is spoken of as the creator of the world.

analyzed: yoktam
translated: It is said to be so in reality.

original: s tu tathābhūtajñānāv alokavatām ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: tu tathābhūta jñānau alokavatām iti arthaḥ
translated: But the meaning is that for those who do not have knowledge which is like light.

original: aśabdaviṣaye prathane vācye veḥ parātstṛṇāterghaño 'bhāvād vastuvistara ity asādhur ayaṃ prayoga iti /
analyzed: a śabda viṣaye prathane vācye veḥ parāt stṛṇāteḥ ghañaḥ bhāvāt vastu vistaraḥ iti asādhuḥ ayam prayogaḥ iti ced
translated: When expansion in the domain of the word is to be stated, because of the absence of the ghuna ending after the root to spread, vastness of things is not a proper usage.

original: tat tu nātiśliṣṭam /🔽yataḥ sūtre prathanaṃ vistīrṇatvam abhipretam /
analyzed: tat tu na atiśliṣṭam  yatas sūtre prathanam vistīrṇa tvam abhipretam
translated: But that is not very closely connected.🔽Because in the sutra, expansion is intended to mean vastness.

analyzed: tat āha kāśikā ākāraḥ prathanam vistīrṇa tā iti
translated: The commentator on the Kasika says that expansion is vastness.

original: na cātra vistaraśabdena vastūnāṃ vistīrṇatvam abhipretam api tu bāhulyaṃ yathā tṛṇasya vistara ity atra /
analyzed: na ca atra vistara śabdena vastūnām vistīrṇa tvam abhipretam api tu bāhulyam yathā tṛṇasya vistaraḥ iti atra
translated: And here, by the word 'vistara', what is intended is not the extension of things, but rather abundance, as in 'vistara of grass'.

analyzed: ataeva prathane iti kim
translated: And for this very reason, what is the use of 'pra'?

analyzed: tṛṇa vistaraḥ iti pratyudāhṛtam
translated: 'Vistra of grass' is cited as a counter-example.

analyzed: asya ca arthaṃbhāga vṛtti kāraḥ api vyā
translated: And the author of the Arthambhavartika also explained this as

original: ñjīt tṛṇasya vistaro bāhulyam ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: tṛṇasya vistaraḥ bāhulyam iti arthaḥ
translated: 'The meaning is: abundance of grass.'

original: tat katham aprathane varttamānād asmād dhātor ghañ bhavitum arhatīti /
analyzed: tat katham a prathane varttamānāt asmāt dhātoḥ gham bhavitum arhati iti
translated: How then can this suffix 'ghañ' be appropriate from this verb 'pra-sthā' which means 'to spread'?

original: ataevaprajñākaraguptopivārtikālaṅkārasyādau prāyaḥ prastutavastuvistarabhṛto nakṣanta evoccakair vaktāraḥ ity avocad iti /
analyzed: ataeva prajñākaraguptā upi vārtika alaṅkārasya ādau prāyas prastuta vastu vistara bhṛtaḥ nakṣante evā uccakais vaktāraḥ iti avocat iti
translated: For this very reason, Prajñākaragupta also said at the beginning of the Vārtikālaṅkāra: 'Usually, speakers who are burdened with the extension of the subject matter just begin loudly.'

original: kiṃ sarvavedino 'dhikṛtya bhavatāyaṃ hetur anekānta ucyate /
analyzed: kim sarva vedinaḥ dhikṛtya bhavatā ayam hetuḥ anekāntaḥ ucyate
translated: Is this reason of non-apprehension stated by you with reference to one who knows everything?

original: iti vikalpayor buddhisthīkṛtayoḥ pūrvasmin vikalpe pratisamādhāyāparasminn api pratividhātukāmaḥ tad yadī /tyādinopasaṃhartum
analyzed: iti vikalpayoḥ buddhi sthīkṛtayoḥ pūrvasmin vikalpe pratisamādhāya aparasmin api pratividhātu kāmaḥ tat
translated: Having refuted the first alternative of these two alternatives, he wishes to refute the second one also. In order to conclude with 'tat yady',

analyzed: upakramate
translated: he begins.

original: kṣaṇānāṃ vivekaḥ pṛthak tvaṃ tad draṣṭuṃ śīlaṃ yeṣāṃ tān adhikṛtyo /ddiśya ucyate /
analyzed: kṣaṇānām vivekaḥ pṛthak tvam tat draṣṭum śīlam yeṣām tān ucyate
translated: With reference to those who have the habit of seeing the distinction of moments, it is said.

original: p / prakaraṇāt pūrveṇābhinnayogakṣematvād iti hetur anaikāntika ityākhyāyate /
analyzed: prakaraṇāt pūrveṇa abhinna yogakṣema tvāt iti hetuḥ anaikāntikaḥ iti ākhyāyate
translated: The reason because of having the same fate as what precedes it in the context is said to be inconclusive.

analyzed: tadā na anekāntaḥ sa hetuḥ iti prakaraṇāt
translated: Then that reason is not inconclusive.

analyzed: vipakṣa gamana abhāvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that there is no going to the opposite.

analyzed: pakṣa antaram upakṣipati
translated: Now, he introduces another view, saying or.

original: saṃvyavahāraḥ pravṛttinivṛttilakṣaṇam anuṣṭhānaṃ prayojanaṃ yeṣāṃ tān / /
analyzed: saṃvyavahāraḥ pravṛtti nivṛtti lakṣaṇam anuṣṭhānam prayojanam yeṣām tān
translated: Those for whom the purpose is the practice characterized by engagement and disengagement, that is, the conduct,

analyzed: paramārthataḥ bheda kāraṇam uktam
translated: The cause of difference in the ultimate sense is stated as being the cause of other things.

analyzed: tatra ādyaḥ eva pramāṇam
translated: Among them, the first one alone is the means of valid knowledge.

original: na samyañco 'pi parāñcaḥ pratyayā iti samarthayituṃ tathāhī /tyādinopakramate /
analyzed: na samyañcaḥ pi parāñcaḥ pratyayāḥ iti samarthayitum
translated: In order to establish that even the correct ones are not the means of valid knowledge, he begins with thus.

original: tatsādhana /m arthakriyāsādha tasya prāpaṇaṃ tatra samarthe /aklīvāvidyamānaviplavā
analyzed: tasya prāpaṇam tatra samarthe
translated: The means of attaining that which is capable of producing the cognition of an object which is capable of performing a function, which is not defective, and which is not deceptive,

original: dhī /r yeṣām te tathā teṣāṃ prekṣāpūrvakāriṇām ity arthaḥ arthasya kriyā niṣpattis
analyzed: yeṣām te tathā teṣām prekṣā pūrva kāriṇām iti arthaḥ arthasya kriyā niṣpattiḥ
translated: Of those who are such, who act with foresight, that is the meaning. The accomplishment of the object is the result.

analyzed: tasyāḥ sādhanam niṣpādakam tasya bhedaḥ bhinna tvāt
translated: The means of that, which brings it about, is different from it, because it is different.

original: saṃdhukṣaṇa / saṃdīpanamādiśabdāt pavanasvedanādiparigrahaḥ /🔽aklīvadhiyāṃ iti ālokasaṃmataḥ pāṭhaḥ /
analyzed: saṃdhukṣaṇa saṃdīpanam ādi śabdāt pavana svedana ādi parigrahaḥ  aklīva dhiyām iti āloka saṃmataḥ pāṭhaḥ
translated: The word etc. includes fanning, sweating, etc.🔽The reading of undiminished intellect is approved by Ālok.

analyzed: aviklava dhiyām iti s
translated: The reading of undiminished intellect is approved by Ālok.

analyzed: yadi evam yat codyam
translated: If it is so, etc. is the objection.

original: pratyakṣaṃ pramāṇam abhrāntam ity uktaṃ bhavatīti /
analyzed: pratyakṣam pramāṇam abhra antam iti uktam bhavati iti
translated: It is said that perception is a valid means of knowledge and non-erroneous.

analyzed: anantara uktāt eva kāraṇa kalāpāt
translated: And from the very set of causes just mentioned,

original: pratyakṣalakṣaṇānuktau ca pratyakṣasyaivānabhidhāne parokṣapratipatteḥ sarvasyā anumāne 'ntarbhāvapradarśanepi kathaṃ pramāṇadvaitamākhyātaṃ
analyzed: pratyakṣa lakṣaṇa anuktau ca pratyakṣasya eva anabhidhāne parokṣa pratipatteḥ sarvasyāḥ anumāne ntarbhāva pradarśane api katham pramāṇa dvaitam ākhyātam
