translated: And when the definition of perception is not stated, and when perception itself is not mentioned, and when it is shown that everything cognized through inference is included in inference, how is the duality of valid means of knowledge stated?

original: darśanam eva pramāṇam ityākhyānāc ca nājñānam indriyādi pramāṇam iti darśitaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: darśanam eva pramāṇam iti ākhyānāt ca na ajñānam indriya ādi pramāṇam iti darśitam bhavati
translated: And it is shown that the senses, etc. are not a valid means of knowledge, because it is said that perception alone is the valid means of knowledge.

analyzed: bhinnāyāḥ tu prathamāyāḥ katham
translated: But how is the first, which is different, [shown]?

original: kiṃ ca mukhyavṛttyā yad uddiśya śāstraṃ pravartate tad arthaṃ tad ucyate /
analyzed: kim ca mukhya vṛttyā yat uddiśya śāstram pravartate tad artham tat ucyate
translated: Moreover, that for which a treatise is undertaken primarily is said to be its purpose,

original: na tu sāmarthyānuṣaṃgato vā yad vyutpādayati tad arthaṃ tad ucyate /
analyzed: na tu sāmarthya anuṣaṃgataḥ vā yat vyutpādayati tat artham tat ucyate
translated: but not that which is implied by capability or that which it teaches is said to be its purpose.

original: na ca pratyakṣavyutpādanābhyupagamepi mukhyavṛttyā tadvyutpādane pravṛttam idam iti kathaṃ sāmānyena samyagjñānavyutpādanārtham ucyate /
analyzed: na ca pratyakṣa vyutpādana abhyupagame pi mukhya vṛttyā tad vyutpādane pravṛttam idam iti katham sāmānyena samyak jñāna vyutpādana artham ucyate
translated: And even if the production of perception is admitted, how can it be said that this (treatise) is written for the purpose of teaching right knowledge in general, when it is engaged in teaching it by its primary meaning?

original: anyathā anumānavyutpādanārthatvepi tasya sāmarthyād anuṣaṅgato vikalpasya dhārāvāhināñ ca parāñcāparācāṃ
analyzed: anyathā anumāna vyutpādana artha tve api tasya sāmarthyāt anuṣaṅgataḥ vikalpasya dhārā vāhinām ca parāñca aparācām
translated: Otherwise, even if it were for the purpose of teaching inference, it would follow from its capacity that the teaching of alternatives and the continuous series of other and non-other

original: vikalpajñānānāṃ pramāṇābhāsatvapratipādanam astīti anumānatadābhāsavyutpādanārtham iti pramāṇāpramāṇavyutpādanārtham iti vā kiṃ nocyate / yady
analyzed: vikalpa jñānānām pramāṇa ābhāsa tva pratipādanam asti iti anumāna tad ābhāsa vyutpādana artham iti pramāṇa apramāṇa vyutpādana artham iti vā kim nā ucyate yadi
translated: discriminating knowledges is the teaching of the semblance of a means of valid knowledge, so why is it not said that it is for the purpose of teaching inference and its semblance, or for the purpose of teaching the means of valid knowledge and its absence? If

analyzed: anyat samyak jñāna vyutpādana artham abhipretam  tatra api kalpanā pravṛbhṛ
translated: another (means of valid knowledge) is intended for the purpose of teaching right knowledge,

original: tor prasaṃgato vyutpādanam astīti tad api samyagjñānavyutpādanārtham iti kiṃ nocyata iti yat kiñcid etat /
analyzed: mithyājñānasya api prasaṃgataḥ vyutpādanam asti iti tat api samyak jñāna vyutpādana artham iti kim nā ucyate iti yat kiñcid etat
translated: there is also the teaching of imagination and the two kinds of activity by implication there, so why is it not said that that also is for the purpose of teaching right knowledge? This is just something.

original: tathā yady anumānatas tathābhūtasya niścayāt tasya prādhānyam ucyate /
analyzed: tathā yadi anumānataḥ tathābhūtasya niścayāt tasya prādhānyam ucyate
translated: Similarly, if the pre-eminence of that (means of valid knowledge) is said to be due to the ascertainment of such a (means of valid knowledge) by inference,

original: tadā pratyakṣato dharmigrahaṇaṃ vyāptigrahaṇañ cāntareṇa nānumāne pravṛttir astīti tasyāpi kiṃ na prādhānyam ucyate /
analyzed: tadā pratyakṣataḥ dharmi grahaṇam vyāpti grahaṇam ca antareṇa na anumāne pravṛttiḥ asti iti tasya api kim na prādhānyam ucyate
translated: Then, since there is no operation of inference without the direct perception of the subject and the apprehension of the pervasion, why is not that also said to be primary?

analyzed: na ca tasya apara bhāvāt prādhānya kalpanā jyāyasī
translated: And it is not proper to assume primacy for it because it is dependent on something else.

original: ca tad api tattve niścāyakam anumānaṃ samastatattvaniścāyakasākṣātkārapravṛttapratyakṣāṅgam upasarjanam /
analyzed: ca tat api tattve niścāyakam anumānam samasta tattva niścāyaka sākṣātkāra pravṛtta pratyakṣa aṅgam upasarjanam
translated: And that inference which ascertains the truth is also subordinate to the direct perception which operates to ascertain all the truth.

analyzed: tat eta bhūyeyam
translated: This is the majority.

original: pradhānaṃ bhavitum arhatīti kathaṃ viparyastās tattvavidaḥ /
analyzed: pradhānam bhavitum arhati iti katham viparyastāḥ tattva vidaḥ
translated: How can those who know the truth be so confused?

original: api ca svasaṃvedanaṃ pratyakṣām antareṇa sarvathā na kasyacit tattvavyavasthānam iti tasyāiva prādhānyaṃ kiṃ na kalpyata iti /
analyzed: api ca sva saṃvedanam pratyakṣām antareṇa sarvathā na kasyacid tattva vyavasthānam iti tasyāḥ iva prādhānyam kim na kalpyate iti
translated: Moreover, since the ascertainment of the truth of anyone in any way is not possible without direct perception which is self-cognized, why is not primacy itself assumed?

original: sa hi mithyājñānaṃ pratyakṣasya viṣayo tra
analyzed: sa hi mithyājñānam pratyakṣasya viṣayaḥ
translated: For that is the object of direct perception, which is false knowledge.

original: tenānurūpo niścayo janitaḥ na ca tatra vivādaḥ saṃbhavati yenānumānāt tanniścayaḥ pārthyate /
analyzed: tena anurūpaḥ niścayaḥ janitaḥ na ca tatra vivādaḥ saṃbhavati yena anumānāt tad niścayaḥ pārthyate
translated: A corresponding ascertainment is produced by it, and there can be no dispute about it by which the ascertainment of that is sought from inference.

original: p / athottarakālabhāvinaḥ saṃśayasyānumānato nirāsāt tasya tathātvam ucyate /
analyzed: atha uttara kāla bhāvinaḥ saṃśayasya anumānataḥ nirāsāt tasya tathātvam ucyate
translated: Or if it is said to be so because doubt which arises later is removed by inference,

analyzed: tarhi pratyakṣasya atiśayena tat vācyam  tat saṃśaya ūnoyā anu
translated: Then it should be said with even greater force of perception.

analyzed: tpādasya pratyakṣa nibandhanasya bahulam upalambhāt
translated: For the production of doubt about that is often observed to be based on perception.

original: atha tadā tatpratyakṣaṃ gṛhītagrāhitayā na pramāṇavyapadeśayogyaṃ satsaśayaṃ anumānam api tathaiveti kim anenoktena /
analyzed: atha tadā tat pratyakṣam gṛhīta grāhi tayā na pramāṇa vyapadeśa yogyam sat saśayam anumānam api tathā eva iti kim anena uktena
translated: But if at that time that perception, being incapable of being called a means of valid knowledge because it grasps what has been grasped, and doubt is also like that, what is the use of saying this?

original: na ca kṣaṇikatvādi pratyakṣasya viṣayo yenānumānatas tanniścayāt prādhānyaṃ tasya kalpyetety alaṃ bahunā /
analyzed: na ca kṣaṇika tva ādi pratyakṣasya viṣayaḥ yena anumānataḥ tad niścayāt prādhānyam tasya kalpyeta iti alam bahunā
translated: And momentariness, etc. are not the object of perception, by which its predominance is imagined from the ascertainment of that by inference. Enough of this much.

original: pratyakṣasyāpi paṭunaḥ pravartakatvāt kiṃ na prādhānyaṃ /
analyzed: pratyakṣasya api paṭunaḥ pravartaka tvāt kim na prādhānyam
translated: Why is not perception also predominant, since even a clear perception causes activity?

original: nahi yogyatā yogyād vastuno 'nyā yā parokṣā satī tena niścetum aśakyānyena niścīyeta tanniścāyakaṃ tajjñānam anyat pramāṇaṃ sad anumānaṃ syāt
analyzed: nahi yogyatā yogyāt vastunaḥ nyā yā parokṣā satī tena niścetum aśakyā anyena niścīyeta tad niścāyakam tat jñānam anyat pramāṇam sat anumānam syāt
translated: For what is called fitness is not different from the fit object, which is not directly perceived, and which cannot be ascertained by that [perception], but is ascertained by another [means of valid knowledge]. That knowledge which ascertains that [fitness] would be inference, being a means of valid knowledge.

analyzed: kintu yogyam eva vastu yogyatā
translated: But fitness is just the object itself.

original: yathā ca pratyakṣasyārthasyaikaprakārā pratipattis tathācāryeṇa svayam evānyatra darśitam /
analyzed: yathā ca pratyakṣasya arthasya eka prakārā pratipattiḥ tathā ācāryeṇa svayam evā anyatra darśitam
translated: And the master himself has shown elsewhere how the apprehension of an object by perception is of one kind [and by inference of another].

original: atha yady api yogyatā yogyavastusvabhāvā tathāpi parokṣaphalasavyapekṣā parokṣeti /
analyzed: atha yadi api yogyatā yogya vastu svabhāvā tathā api parokṣa phala sa vyapekṣā parokṣā iti
translated: Now, even if fitness is of the nature of a fit object, it still depends on a remote result, and is itself remote.

original: nanu phalasya parokṣatve sā kiṃ paramārthataḥ parokṣā kiṃ vā parokṣakalpā /
analyzed: nanu phalasya parokṣa tve sā kim paramārthataḥ parokṣā kim vā parokṣa kalpā
translated: But if the result is remote, is it really remote, or is it imagined to be remote?

analyzed: tatra yadi parokṣaṃmate
translated: If it is really remote,

analyzed: parokṣā eva tadā eka ātma tā anupapatteḥ bhinnā eva syāt
translated: then it would be different, since the identity of one thing is not possible.

analyzed: yathā amīmāṃsakānām kāryā arthāpatti sādhanā
translated: Like the result, presumption, and proof of the Mimamsakas.

analyzed: atha parokṣā eva
translated: But if it is imagined to be remote,

analyzed: katham punar pratyakṣa svabhāvā parokṣā eva
translated: how can something with a direct nature be imagined to be remote?

analyzed: tad niścayasya kartum aśakya tvāt iti ced
translated: If it is said that it is because its ascertainment cannot be made,

original: yadi nāmābhyāsāt pūrvaṃ niścetum aśakyā tathāpy abhyāsadaśāpannena paṭīyasā pratyakṣeṇa svato ' kiṃ na niścīyate /
analyzed: yadi nāma abhyāsāt pūrvam niścetum aśakyā tathā api abhyāsa daśā āpannena paṭīyasā pratyakṣeṇa svatas  kim na niścīyate
translated: even if it cannot be ascertained through practice, why is it not ascertained by oneself through the more powerful direct perception that has reached the stage of practice?

original: phalam api tasya dāhādi nātyantaparokṣam anyatra tatkṛtasya tasyānekaśo 'nubhavāt /
analyzed: phalam api tasya dāha ādi na atyanta parokṣam anyatra tad kṛtasya tasya anekaśas nubhavāt
translated: The result of that, such as burning, is not completely remote, since it is experienced many times by others.

analyzed: atas eva abhyāsena tat paṭutaram jātam
translated: For this very reason, it becomes clearer through practice.

analyzed: na tvam abhyuna tu abhyu
translated: But it is not that it is not ascertained at all.

original: dayādi dānacetanādikāryatvena niścitaṃ kenacid yena tatrāpy abhyāsāt tathāniścayaḥ syāt /
analyzed: dayā ādi dāna cetanā ādi kārya tvena niścitam kenacid yena tatra api abhyāsāt tathā niścayaḥ syāt
translated: For someone who has ascertained by some means that compassion etc. are the effects of the volition to give etc., that ascertainment would also arise from practice in that case.

analyzed: yāvat ātyanta parokṣam eva
translated: As long as it is absolutely imperceptible.

analyzed: atas tad apekṣayā aniścayaḥ yuktaḥ
translated: Therefore, uncertainty in relation to that is appropriate.

original: tad ayam artho yenāsakṛd vahnyāder dāhādyanubhūtaṃ sa tadā phalasya parokṣatvepi dāhādijananayogyam etad iti pratyakṣeṇa niścinoty eva /
analyzed: tat ayam arthaḥ yena asakṛt vahni ādeḥ dāha ādi anubhūtam sa tadā phalasya parokṣa tve pi dāha ādi janana yogyam etat iti pratyakṣeṇa niścinoti eva
translated: This is the meaning: One who has repeatedly experienced burning etc. by fire etc., even when the result is imperceptible at that time, ascertains by perception that this is capable of producing burning etc.

analyzed: yathā ca anabhyāsa avasthāyām
translated: And just as in the state of non-practice,

analyzed: pūṃsaḥ kṛttima akṛttima mukta ādi pratipatteḥ para upadeśa apekṣaṇāt svatas saṃbhave api sati
translated: due to the impossibility of understanding a skin, a garment, a pearl etc. by oneself, depending on the instruction of another,

original: apy abhyāse sa eva puruṣaḥ muktādeḥ kṛttimādirūpatāṃ svayam eva pratipadyate /
analyzed: api abhyāse saḥ eva puruṣaḥ mukta ādeḥ kṛttima ādi rūpa tām svayam eva pratipadyate
translated: even with practice, that very person understands by himself the nature of a pearl etc. as having a skin etc.

original: tathānabhyāsāvasthāyāṃ svatas tadyogyatāniścayepi abhyāsāditaḥ paṭimapratyakṣaṃ svayam eva tadyogyaṃ niścāyayiṣyatīti kiṃ nānumanyate /
analyzed: tathā anabhyāsa avasthāyām svatas tad yogya tā niścaye pi abhyāsāt itas paṭima pratyakṣam svayam eva tad yogyam niścāyayiṣyati iti kim nā anumanyate
translated: Similarly, in the state of non-practice, even if the ascertainment of its capability is by itself, from practice, the perception of the image will itself ascertain its capability. Why is this not accepted?

analyzed: āha ca atrabhartṛhariḥ maṇi rūpya ādi jñānam tad vidām na ānumānikam iti
translated: And here Bhartṛhari says: The knowledge of gems, silver etc. of those who know them is not inferential.

original: kiñ ca na vyāptismaraṇam antareṇānumānaṃ pravartate /
analyzed: kim ca na vyāpti smaraṇam antareṇa anumānam pravartate
translated: Moreover, inference does not proceed without the recollection of the pervasion.

original: na vastu dṛṣṭvā tatsādhyārthakriyāvāñchayā pravṛttau yad yad evam arthakriyākāri yathā mahānasādi dṛṣṭaṃ tadvastv iti pravṛttautteḥ
analyzed: na vastu dṛṣṭvā tad sādhya artha kriyā vāñchayā pravṛttau yat yat evam artha kriyā kāri yathā mahānasa ādi dṛṣṭam tat vastu iti pravṛtti autteḥ
translated: When one sees an object and engages in activity desiring to accomplish its purpose, the engagement occurs by thinking that object is like the kitchen, etc. that is known to be effective in that way.

original: prāgvyāptismaraṇaṃ saty avādinā vadituṃ śakyata iti kathaṃ tatrānumānasya pravartakatvakalpanā na sāhasam /
analyzed: prāk vyāpti smaraṇam satī avādinā vaditum śakyate iti katham tatra anumānasya pravartaka tva kalpanā na sāhasam
translated: Since the recollection of the pervasion can be stated by the proponent after the engagement, how can the operation of inference in that case be imagined without audacity?

original: ataś caivaṃ yatas tādrūpyāvasāye pratyakṣaṃ nānumānasāpekṣamanavasthāprasakteḥ /
analyzed: atas ca evam yatas tādrūpya avasāye pratyakṣam na anumāna sa apekṣam anavasthā prasakteḥ
translated: And for this reason, since perception does not depend on inference for the ascertainment of that form, due to the contingence of infinite regress,

original: yathā ca tasya pāṭavaṃ tādrupyaniścaye upavarṇanīyam /
analyzed: yathā ca tasya pāṭavam tādrupya niścaye caritārtham upavarṇanīyam
translated: and just as the sharpness of that [perception] in the ascertainment of that form is to be described,

original: tathā yogyatāniścaye kiṃ na varṇyata ity alam ativistareṇa /
analyzed: tathā yogyatā niścaye kim na varṇyate iti alam ati vistareṇa
translated: why is not the ascertainment of fitness described in the same way? Enough of this extensive [discussion].

original: yat tu tac cānumeyatāṃ nātipatati / tat svaparasaṃtānavartinīr buddhīr adhikṛtyoktam anyatrānubhūtaviṣayebhya iti vacanād iti /
analyzed: yat tu tat ca anumeya tām na atipatati tat sva para saṃtāna vartinīḥ buddhīḥ adhikṛtya uktam anyatra anubhūta viṣayebhyaḥ iti vacanāt iti
translated: But that [perception] which does not fall short of being inferable is stated with reference to cognitions occurring in one's own and others' continua, because of the statement from objects experienced elsewhere.

original: atra ca sarvatra samādhānaṃ dhīmadbhir eva vidheyam /
analyzed: atra ca sarvatra samādhānam dhīmadbhiḥ eva vidheyam
translated: And here, the wise ones should provide the solution everywhere.

analyzed: ātmā sādhya sādhana bhāvaḥ gamya gamaka bhāvaḥ
translated: The self. The relation of probandum and probans. The relation of the known and the means of knowing.

original: kṛtakatvādau pāramārthikaṃ / dharmiṇiścabhedaṃ / bhinnaṃ rūpaṃ nālambate nāśrayate /
analyzed: kṛtaka tva ādau pāramārthikam bhinnam rūpam na ālambate na āśrayate
translated: In the case of being produced, etc., it does not take as its object, i.e., does not rely on, the real difference, i.e., the different form, in the subject.

analyzed: kutas na ālambate iti āha
translated: Why does it not take as its object? He says: because of the relation.

analyzed: paramārtha bhinnānām akārya karaṇa bhūtānām sambandha abhāve tathātva abhāva prasaṃgāt
translated: Because if there were no relation between things that are really different and are not causally connected, there would be the undesirable consequence that they would not have that nature.

original: ekasminn arthe dvayoḥ samavāya ekārthasamavāyo /tra vivakṣitaḥ kṛtakatvānityatve / ādī yasya tasya /
analyzed: ekasmin arthe dvayoḥ samavāyaḥ eka artha samavāyaḥ vivakṣitaḥ kṛtaka tva anitya tve ādī yasya tasya
translated: The inherence of two in one object is the inherence of one thing in another. Inherence is intended here. Being produced and being non-eternal, etc.

analyzed: kṛtaka tvam ādiḥ yasya sāvayava tva ādeḥ sādhana dharmasya
translated: Being produced is the beginning of that which has parts, etc., the property to be proved.

analyzed: anitya tvam ādiḥ yasya sāvayava tva ādeḥ sādhya dharmasya
translated: Being non-eternal is the beginning of that which has parts, etc., the property to be established.

analyzed: samavāyasya
translated: Of that. Of inherence.

analyzed: atra eva apecaya hetum āha samavāyāt
translated: Here itself, he states the reason for the requirement: because of inherence.

analyzed: akāśa diś kāla manaḥ paramāṇūnām saṃgrahaḥ
translated: By the word etc., space, direction, time, mind and atoms are included.

original: kathaṃ punaḥ kṛtakatvādeḥ śabdādau vṛttāv ātmādivrttir āsaṃjyata ity āha /🔽ya eva hī /ti /
analyzed: katham punar kṛtaka tva ādeḥ śabda ādau vṛttau ātma ādi vrttiḥ āsaṃjyate iti āha  yaḥ eva
translated: How then is the occurrence of being produced, etc. in sound, etc. imagined to be the occurrence in the self, etc.? He says:🔽For that very reason.

analyzed: tasya samavāyasya
translated: Of that. Of inherence.

original: na ca saṃyogavannānātvaṃ bhāvavalliṅgāviśeṣāt ca tasmād bhāvavat sarvatraikaḥ samavāya Praśa /Bh / pr / iti vacanād
analyzed: na ca saṃyogavat nānātvam bhāvavat liṅga aviśeṣāt ca tasmāt bhāvavat sarvatra ekaḥ samavāya iti vacanāt
translated: And there is no plurality like conjunction, because of the non-distinction of gender like an existent thing. Therefore, like an existent thing, everywhere there is one inherence.

analyzed: ekatvena abhyupagamaḥ
translated: The acceptance is as one.

original: athāpi syāt na samavāyād vṛttir api tu samavāya eva vṛttir iti tad apy avadyam /
analyzed: atha api syāt na samavāyāt vṛttiḥ api tu samavāye eva vṛttiḥ iti tat api avadyam
translated: Now, if it were so, that the existence is not from inherence, but inherence itself is the existence, that also is a fault.

original: saṃbandhābhāvena bhāvoyaṃ vrttir iti kalpanāyā ayogāt /
analyzed: saṃbandha abhāvena bhāvaḥ iyam vrttiḥ iti kalpanāyāḥ ayogāt
translated: Because it is not possible to imagine that this existence is the existence due to the absence of relation.

analyzed: saṃbandha antara kalpanāyām ca anavasthā prasaṃgāt
translated: And because of the contingence of infinite regress in the imagination of another relation.

original: yadi ca samavāyas tasya vrttir ātmādiṣv api tasya kathaṃ na tasya vṛttir iti tadavastho doṣa iti /
analyzed: yadi ca samavāyaḥ tasya vrttiḥ ātma ādiṣu api tasya bhāvāt katham na tasya vṛttiḥ iti tad avasthaḥ doṣaḥ iti
translated: And if inherence is its existence in the self etc., how is it that it is not the existence of that? Thus the fault remains as it was.

analyzed: pakṣa antaram avadyotayati
translated: Now, the word 'atha' (but) indicates another view.

original: etasminn upagame gaḍḍapraveśe 'kṣitārānirgamvṛttānto jāta iti darśayann āha saiva tarhī /ti /
analyzed: etasmin upagame gaḍḍa praveśe kṣita arā nirgam vṛttāntaḥ jātaḥ iti darśayan āha sā eva
translated: In this acceptance, the story of the entry of the pot and the exit of the eye has happened. Showing this, he says 'then that itself'.

analyzed: purvatra śaṃkā cihnitam ātmā
translated: In the previous case, the word 'ātman' (self) is marked by doubt.

analyzed: iti padam atratyam sambhavati
translated: The word 'iti' (thus) is possible here.

original: abhūtvā yo na bhavati bhūtvā ca na vinaśyati sa tadviparītarūpas tasya yaḥ samāropas tasya vyavacchedaḥ sa viṣayo / yasyās tasyāḥ /
analyzed: a bhūtvā yaḥ na bhavati bhūtvā ca na vinaśyati sa tad viparīta rūpaḥ tasya yaḥ samāropaḥ tasya vyavacchedaḥ sa viṣayaḥ yasyāḥ tasyāḥ
translated: That which does not exist and does not become, and having become does not perish, that which is of a nature contrary to that, the superimposition of that, the exclusion of that, is the object of that.

original: sā kim yenānyasyopagamo niṣidhyata ity āha saiveti / /
analyzed: sā kim yena anyasya upagamaḥ niṣidhyate iti āha sā eva iti
translated: What is that? He says: that very [exclusion].

original: paramārthena bhedo dharmiṇā sahety arthāt tadvatoḥ paramārthabhedavattvañ ca parābhiprāyeṇoktaṃ draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: paramārthena bhedaḥ dharmiṇā saha iti arthāt tadvatoḥ paramārtha bhedavat tvam ca para abhiprāyeṇa uktam draṣṭavyam
translated: The difference in the ultimate sense is from the possessor of the property, and the possession of the property of difference in the ultimate sense should be seen as stated from the perspective of the opponent.

analyzed: dharmiṇi śabda ādau
translated: In the case of the property-possessor, such as sound, etc.

original: taddharmatānapekṣāyāntu nityābhimateṣv api tau varteyātām iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: tad dharmatā anapekṣāyām tu nitya abhimateṣu api tau varteyātām iti bhāvaḥ
translated: But if it does not depend on the nature of that property, then those two would apply even to what is considered eternal. This is the meaning.

original: utpattivināśadharmatāyāḥ kalpanābuddheś cāntarāle ghāṭāmastakāntarālavartimāṃsapiṇḍāparanāma gaḍur iva gaḍu /r niṣphalatvāt tena /
analyzed: utpatti vināśa dharma tāyāḥ kalpanā buddheḥ ca antarāle ghāṭā mastaka antarāla varti māṃsa piṇḍa apara nāma gaḍuḥ iva niṣphala tvāt tena
translated: The obstruction, which is like a lump of flesh located between the head and the top of the house, is like a lump, because it is fruitless.

analyzed: vyatirekaḥ bhedaḥ tadvatā
translated: The difference is the separation from that which possesses it.

analyzed: ayam abhisandhiḥ
translated: This is the intention.

original: yadi kṛtakatvādayo dharmā vyatirekiṇastava dharmiṇi pramāṇasiddhāḥ syus tadā satyām api tasya vastunas tathātāyāmajāgalastanavadanupayuktā
analyzed: yadi kṛtaka tva ādayaḥ dharmāḥ vyatirekiṇaḥ tava dharmiṇi pramāṇa siddhāḥ syuḥ tadā satyām api tasya vastunaḥ tathātāyām ajāgala stana vat anupayuktā
translated: If the properties such as being produced were different from the property-possessor and were established by valid cognition, then even if that object existed in that way, it would be useless like the barren woman's son.

analyzed: api kena nāma na abhyupagamyeran
translated: Even so, by whom are they not accepted?

analyzed: a paryanuyojya tvāt
translated: Because they are not to be questioned.

original: kevalaṃ tad eva pramāṇasiddhatvaṃ na saṃbhavati pratyakṣapramāṇavādhitatvam eva lakṣyata iti /🔽p / atha kiṃ kalpanāniveśinaḥ kṛtakatvādayo dharmāḥ sādhyadharmam avabodhayanti yenāvaśyābhyupagamanītyāyānīyāyā
analyzed: kevalam tat eva pramāṇa siddha tvam na saṃbhavati pratyakṣa pramāṇa vādhita tvam eva lakṣyate iti  atha kim kalpanā niveśinaḥ kṛtaka tva ādayaḥ dharmāḥ sādhya dharmam avabodhayanti
translated: Only that very establishment by means of a means of valid knowledge is not possible, it is only the contradiction by the means of valid knowledge of perception that is indicated.🔽Now, if it is said that the properties such as being produced, which are not included in imagination, make one understand the property to be proved, so that they must be accepted,

original: utpattivināśadharmatāyā eva tathāvidhabuddhinibandhanatvāt kim anyenety ucyata ity āśaṃkāyām abhyupagama vottara
analyzed: utpatti vināśa dharma tāyāḥ eva tathāvidha buddhi nibandhana tvāt kim anyena iti ucyate iti āśaṃkāyām abhyupagamaḥ eva utpattiḥ vā uttara
translated: because the nature of having origination and destruction is itself the basis for such cognition, what is the use of anything else? - in response to this doubt, the intention is to say acceptance or...

analyzed: iti abhiprāyavān āha
translated: and so on.

original: sattāmātreṇa / tanniścāyakajñānanirapekṣeṇa svarūpeṇa vastuna utpatteḥ prabhṛti sarvadeti veditavyam /
analyzed: sattā mātreṇa tad niścāyaka jñāna nirapekṣeṇa svarūpeṇa vastunaḥ utpatteḥ prabhṛti sarvadā iti veditavyam
translated: By mere existence. The entity should be known as always, from the time of its origination, by its own nature, independently of the knowledge that ascertains it.

original: anavarataṃ / satataṃ taddharmasya sādhyadharmasya pratītis tasyāḥ prasaṅgāt / /
analyzed: anavaratam satatam tad dharmasya sādhya dharmasya pratītiḥ tasyāḥ prasaṅgāt
translated: Without interruption. Continuously, the cognition of that property, the property to be proved, arises from that.

original: kathaṃ nāma te tatpratītinibandhanaṃ bhavatīty āha kiṃtv i /ti /
analyzed: katham nāma te tad pratīti nibandhanam bhavati iti āha kiṃtu
translated: How can they be the basis for the cognition of that? It is said: But... and so on.

original: nanu vastvasaṃsparśitve vikalpasya kathaṃ vastunaḥ ity āha sa ce /ti /
analyzed: nanu vastu asaṃsparśi tve vikalpasya katham vastunaḥ iti āha sa
translated: But if an option does not touch an entity, how can it be of an entity? He says: although.

analyzed: caḥ yasmāt arthe
translated: The word ca (although) is in the sense of since.

analyzed: tad rūpasya kṛtaka tva ādi rūpasya vastunaḥ saṃsparśe api agrahaṇe api
translated: Although there is no contact, no apprehension, of the form of an entity such as being produced, etc.,

original: tadagrāhiṇaḥ kathaṃ tadadhyavasāya ity āha paramparaye /ti /
analyzed: tad agrāhiṇaḥ katham tad adhyavasāyaḥ iti āha
translated: how can it be a determination of that? He says: by a series.

analyzed: tad upādāna tvāt kṛtaka tvāt kṛtaka tva ādi rūpa bāhya upādāna tvāt
translated: Because it is the material cause. Because being produced, etc. are the external material causes of the form of being produced, etc.

analyzed: tasya vikalpasya iti prakaraṇāt
translated: Of that option, from the context.

original: nanu ca na kṛtakatvādayo dharmās tathāvidhabuddhinibandhanatveneṣyante kintv /
analyzed: nanu ca na kṛtaka tva ādayaḥ dharmāḥ tathāvidha buddhi nibandhana tvena iṣyante kintu
translated: But being produced, etc. are not accepted as the basis for such a cognition, but rather

original: tat kathaṃ tathāvidhavikalpaḥ syād yataḥ prasavet vikalpasya tataḥ prasavaḥ /
analyzed: tat katham tathāvidha vikalpaḥ syāt yatas prasavet vikalpasya tatas prasavaḥ
translated: how can there be such an option from which it would arise? From which there is the production of the option.

original: tasya tasya dharmasya vaiyarthyam ity āha tadvyatiriktās tv i /ti /
analyzed: tasya tasya dharmasya vaiyarthyam iti āha tad vyatiriktāḥ tu
translated: The uselessness of each of those properties is stated: but those that are different from that.

analyzed: tu śabdaḥ yasmāt arthe
translated: The word tu (but) is in the sense of since.

original: tasmād abhūtvābhavanadharmaṇo bhūtvā cābhāvanadharmaṇo dharmiṇo vyatiriktā anye tasyāḥ kalpanābuddher utpattis tasyā nimittaṃ kevalaṃ nimittamātram
analyzed: tasmāt a bhūtvā bhavana dharmaṇaḥ bhūtvā ca a bhāvana dharmaṇaḥ dharmiṇaḥ vyatiriktāḥ anye tasyāḥ kalpanā buddheḥ utpattiḥ tasyāḥ nimittam kevalam nimitta mātram
translated: Therefore, those that are different from that imaginary cognition, which is the cause of the arising of that cognition, are merely the cause, the mere cause.

analyzed: tad bhāvaḥ tayā  etat uktam bhavati yadi kṛtaka tvāt idiḥ
translated: That state is by that.

original: dharmiṇo 'nyo na syāt tarhi kṛtakādibuddhir anubhavasiddhā nirnibandhanā syāt /
analyzed: dharmiṇaḥ nyaḥ na syāt tarhi kṛtaka ādi buddhiḥ anubhava siddhā nirnibandhanā syāt
translated: This is what happens: if the property-possessor were not different from impermanence etc., then the cognition of the impermanent etc. established by experience would be groundless.

original: na caivam ato 'sty etadbuddhikārī kṛtakatvād iti dir iti
analyzed: na ca evam atas sti etad buddhi kārī kṛtaka tvāt iti diḥ iti
translated: But it is not so. Therefore, impermanence etc. which causes this cognition exists.

analyzed: tad kalpanā
translated: That is the postulation.
And from that, the state of being the cause of that alone

analyzed: parikalpanīyam sādhīyaḥ
translated: is to be imagined as better.

original: tathāpi tathāvidhād bhāvād anye te tannibandhanaṃ kalpyaṃtām ity āha tadvaram i /tyādi /🔽yasmād evam anantaroktaṃ / tasmāt /
analyzed: tathā api tathāvidhāt bhāvāt anye te tad nibandhanam iti āha tat varam  yasmāt evam anantara uktam tat tasmāt
translated: Even so, let those which are different from that kind of entity be imagined as the basis for that. He says That is better etc.🔽Because it is as stated immediately before, therefore.

analyzed: tasya kṛtaka tva ādeḥ yā kalpanā
translated: The postulation of that impermanence etc.

original: atraivedaṃ kṛtakatvādi nātmādiṣu ity evaṃrūpā tasyā yannibandhanam abhūtvābhavanadharmatādi tad eva tathāvidhavikalpaprasavanimittaṃ🔽varam astu / / hetum asyāniṣṭer āha tasye /ti /
analyzed: atra eva idam kṛtaka tva ādi na ātma ādiṣu iti evaṃrūpā tasyāḥ yat nibandhanam a bhūtvā bhavana dharmatā ādi tat eva tathāvidha vikalpa prasava nimittam  varam astu hetum asya aniṣṭeḥ āha
translated: Here this impermanence etc. is, not in the self etc., in this form. The basis for that is the nature of non-existence becoming existent etc. That alone is the cause of the production of such a kind of conceptual differentiation.🔽Let it be better.🔽He states the reason for this undesirable consequence. Of that etc.🔽Let that be accepted. Even so, how is its futility? He says.

original: astu tadabhyupagamas tathāpi kathaṃ tasya vaiyarthyam ity āha /🔽tadabhyupagame ce /ti /
analyzed: astu tad abhyupagamaḥ tathā api katham tasya vaiyarthyam iti āha 🔽tad abhyupagame
translated: And in the acceptance of that etc.

original: caritārthā / anyena niṣpāditaprayojanā vyatirekavantaḥ / tadvyatiriktāḥ kalpanānirmitāstu te saṃtu /
analyzed: caritārthāḥ anyena niṣpādita prayojanāḥ vyatirekavantaḥ tad vyatiriktāḥ kalpanā nirmitāḥ tu te saṃtu
translated: (The reply is:) They are useful, (i.e., the non-different properties are useful). Those which have accomplished their purpose by another (i.e., by the substance itself) are different (from the substance). Let them be imagined by imagination (i.e., let them be imagined by the imagination of the logicians).

original: tatra na kācid bādheti cārthāt sūcitam /
analyzed: tatra na kācid bādhā iti ca arthāt sūcitam
translated: There is no contradiction in that (i.e., in the non-difference of properties from the substance). This is indicated by the word 'api' (even).

original: syād etat yadi vyatiriktānityatādidharmayogepi vastuna evāvasthāyitvādirūpaṃ vyavahartāraḥ pratipādayanti /
analyzed: syāt etat yadi vyatirikta anitya tā ādi dharma yoge pi vastunaḥ eva avasthāyi tva ādi rūpam vyavahartāraḥ pratipādayanti
translated: This may be the case: If the people convey the form of impermanence etc. even when the substance is connected with different properties like impermanence etc.,

original: tadā tasya bhūtvābhavanadharmatādyupagame tadupagame ca tasyaitadbuddhinibandhanatvasya yujyamānatvāc caritārthā vyatirekiṇo dharmā ta bhadharmā
analyzed: tadā tasya bhūtvā bhavana dharmatā ādi upagame tad upagame ca tasya etad buddhi nibandhana tvasya yujyamāna tvāt caritārthāḥ vyatirekiṇaḥ
translated: then, in accepting the nature of becoming non-existent after having existed etc. of that (substance), and in accepting that (impermanence etc.) as the basis of that cognition of the substance, the different properties would have accomplished their purpose.

original: veyur yāvatā vyatiriktānityatādibhāve tad eva vyavahartāraḥ pratipadyante /
analyzed: veyuḥ yāvatā vyatirikta anitya tā ādi bhāve tat eva vyavahartāraḥ pratipadyante
translated: But as a matter of fact, the people understand impermanence etc. as different from the substance.

original: tat kathaṃ yad eva tatkalpanānibandhanam ityādyucyamānaṃ parabhāgaṃ puṣṇātīty āśaṃkyāha avaśyañ ce /ti /🔽p / co yasmād arthe /
analyzed: tat katham yat eva tad kalpanā nibandhanam ityādi ucyamānam parabhāgam puṣṇāti iti āśaṃkya āha avaśyam  p caḥ yasmāt arthe
translated: How then is it said that it (i.e., the substance) is the basis of imagination etc.? Fearing that this would nourish the opponent's position, he says 'avāśyam ca' etc.🔽'ca' (and) is for the purpose of indicating a reason.

original: vyaktam etad ity asminn arthe vā /
analyzed: vyaktam etat iti asmin arthe vā
translated: Or in the sense of 'vyaktam etat' (this is clear).

original: anityatāgrahaṇaṃ copalakṣaṇaṃ tena kṛtakatvādāv api eva tatpratyayaṃ pratipadyante / niścinvanti /
analyzed: anitya tā grahaṇam ca upalakṣaṇam tena kṛtaka tva ādau api eva tad pratyayam pratipadyante niścinvanti
translated: And the mention of impermanence is a mere illustration, so they understand that very cause in the case of being produced etc. also. They ascertain it.

analyzed: kṛtaka tvāt anuminvanta
translated: From being produced they infer impermanence, the state of being dark.

analyzed: iti prakaraṇāt
translated: This is understood from the context.

original: kasmād avastvātmānaṃ te tathā pratīyantīty āha tasmād anavasthāyīsvabhāvasyānurūpā samīcīnocitā yā arthakriyā tadarthitayā pravṛtteḥ /
analyzed: kasmāt avastu ātmānam te tathā pratīyanti iti āha tasmāt anavasthāyīsvabhāvasya anurūpā samīcīna ucitā yā artha kriyā tad arthi tayā pravṛtteḥ  /
translated: Why do they conceive the self as a non-entity in that way? He says: Because of the desire for the appropriate, suitable, and proper effect of that non-lasting nature.

analyzed: pravartanāt
translated: Because of the instigation.

analyzed: teṣām anumātṝṇām iti arthāt
translated: Of those inferrers, this is understood.

analyzed: atra viparyaye bādhakam āha
translated: Here, he states the contradiction in the opposite case: otherwise.

original: vyatiri satyāṃ nityatvāt / sthiratvāt tasya śabdādivastunaḥ prastāvāt /
analyzed: kta anitya tāyām satyām nitya tvāt sthira tvāt tasya śabda ādi vastunaḥ prastāvāt
translated: If there were exclusion, because of eternality, because of stability, of that entity such as sound etc., from the context.

original: nityatvādi /ti bruvāṇasyāyam āśayo bhinnanityatāyogepi vastuno nānyathātvaṃ tasyās tatrākiñcit karatvāt /
analyzed: bruvāṇasya ayam āśayaḥ bhinna nitya tā yoge pi vastunaḥ na anyathātvam tasyāḥ tatra a kiñcid kara tvāt
translated: Saying because of eternality etc., this is the intention: Even when connected with a different eternality, there is no change in the entity, because that [different eternality] does nothing to it.

analyzed: kiñcid kriyāyām vā bheda abheda ādi doṣa anuṣaṅgāt
translated: Or, if it did something, there would be the undesirable consequence of the faults of difference, non-difference etc.

analyzed: bhede api tatas vyāvṛtta vyāvarta
translated: Even in difference, it is excluded from that, and it excludes that from itself.

original: mānasya tasyākāśāder iva nityatvavyavastheti vastuno nityatvāddhe /tos tasya nityatvasya yo 'vagamas tenārthitve nyāyaprāpte 🔽sati ayam anumātād itā ani
analyzed: mānasya tasya ākāśa ādeḥ iva nitya tva vyavasthā iti vastunaḥ tasya nitya tvasya vastunaḥ yaḥ nyāya prāpte  sati ayam itā ani
translated: The establishment of the eternality of that pride, like that of space etc., is due to the eternality of the object. Therefore, when the desire for that eternality is logically obtained through the knowledge of it,🔽the inferential cognizer, desiring the function of the object denoted by the word 'non-eternal' etc.,

original: tyśabdādipadārthasādhyārthakriyārthī /itis tasmāc chabdādikaṃ nityam āśaṃkamānaḥ / tad asaṃdehe 'numānāyogāt /
analyzed: tyū śabda ādi padārtha sādhyārtha kriyā arthī tasmāt śabda ādikam nityam āśaṃkamānaḥ tat asaṃdehe numāna ayogāt
translated: suspecting that the word etc. are eternal, because there can be no inference without doubt,

original: tathā sandihānaḥ kiṃ kasmād vastuno 'nityatāvicāraṃ pratyāhitāsthaḥ / kṛtatātparyārthaḥ /
analyzed: tathā sandihānaḥ kim kasmāt vastunaḥ nitya tā vicāram pratyāhita āsthaḥ kṛta tātparyārthaḥ
translated: thus doubting, why should one be averse to the consideration of non-eternality of an existent object, having a purpose?

original: anityatāyās tadvyatiriktatvād tasya sthirātmatāniścayād tatsaṃśayapūrvakānityatāvicārasyaivāyogād iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: anitya tāyāḥ tad vyatirikta tvāt tasya sthira ātma tā niścayāt eva tad saṃśaya pūrvaka anitya tā vicārasya eva ayogāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that because non-eternality is different from that, and because the stability of that is ascertained, the consideration of non-eternality preceded by doubt is itself impossible.

analyzed: avagama arthi tvena
translated: By the desire for knowledge.

analyzed: na asti s
translated: There is no desire for knowledge.

analyzed: vyatirikta anitya tayā iti kvacid pāṭhaḥ
translated: In some texts, the reading is 'due to the non-eternality that is different'.

original: tatra nityatve prayojye hetau tṛtīyā pratyeyā /
analyzed: tatra nitya tve prayojye hetau tṛtīyā pratyeyā
translated: There, in the reason that is to be employed for eternality, the instrumental case should be understood.

original: vyatiriktāyām anityatāyāṃ vastunas tathā vicāro na yujyata iti pratipādya doṣāntaram api tasyāṃ darśayann āha vyatiriktāyāṃ ce /ti /
analyzed: vyatiriktāyām anitya tāyām vastunaḥ tathā vicāraḥ na yujyate iti pratipādya doṣa antaram api tasyām darśayan āha vyatiriktāyām
translated: When separateness is established, the consideration of the thing as such is not proper. Having shown this, he points out another fault in that [separateness] by saying And when separateness is established...

original: tatraiva pratipannāyām anityatāyāṃ na vastuny apratipanna ity arthāt sūcitam /
analyzed: tatra eva pratipannāyām anitya tāyām na vastuni apratipanne iti arthāt sūcitam
translated: It is implied that when separateness of impermanence is accepted, it is not accepted in the thing itself.
By that means. By the means of separate impermanence.

analyzed: vastunaḥ tathātva jñānāt
translated: By the cognition. By the cognition of the thing as such.

analyzed: vyavadhīyate vastu anena anitya ādinā iti vyavadhiḥ tena
translated: It is obstructed by this impermanence, etc., therefore it is obstruction. By that.

analyzed: vyavadhānam vā vyavadhiḥ tena kim
translated: Or obstruction is obstruction, by that what?

analyzed: avyavahitasya eva bhinna anitya tā ādi vyavadhāna śūnyasya eva varam astu pratipattiḥ
translated: It is better to have the cognition of only the unobstructed, of only that which is devoid of the obstruction of separate impermanence, etc.

analyzed: āha
translated: He says By that very...

original: vyatiriktānityatāprapipattāv api vastunas tathātvapratītiḥ kathaṃ yujyata ityādidoṣaśatam utpaśyan sotprāsam āha tad etad i /ti /
analyzed: vyatirikta anitya tā prapipattau api vastunaḥ tathātva pratītiḥ katham yujyate ityādi doṣa śatam utpaśyan sa utprāsam āha tat etat
translated: Even when the establishment of separate impermanence is accepted, how can the cognition of the thing as such be proper? Seeing such a hundred faults, he says ironically This...

analyzed: eṣaḥ doṣaḥ na bhavati
translated: This fault mentioned just now does not occur.

analyzed: tad svabhāva tayā hetu bhūtayā
translated: By its nature. By the causal nature.

original: kathañci /t kenacid rūpeṇa yo bhedas tasyopagame kiñcitkalam utpaśyāmo / /
analyzed: kenacid rūpeṇa yaḥ bhedaḥ tasya upagame kiñcitkalam
translated: We see some fruit in the admission of difference in some way, by some form.

original: yadi kathaṃcid bhedo na syād bhedādhiṣṭhānaḥ sādhyasādhanabhāvaḥ katham upapadyetoyonudyetety āha sādhye /ti /
analyzed: yadi kathaṃcid bhedaḥ na syāt bheda adhiṣṭhānaḥ sādhya sādhana bhāvaḥ katham upapadyeta uyonudyeta iti āha
translated: If there were no difference in any way, how could the relation of probandum and probans based on difference be possible? To this he says: If the probandum...

original: api / nyāyabalāyātāṃ saṃbhāvanām āha /🔽p / sādhyadharmasya sādhanadharmarūpatopagame sati bhedopagame phalaṃ na kiñcid iti pratipādya saṃpratyekātmasādhyasādhanayor bheda eva
analyzed: api nyāya bala āyātām saṃbhāvanām āha  sādhya dharmasya sādhana dharma rūpa tā upagame sati bheda upagame phalam na kiñcid iti pratipādya saṃprati eka ātma sādhya sādhanayoḥ bhedaḥ eva
translated: He states the possibility that has come about by the force of reasoning.

analyzed: na saṃbhavati
translated: If the probandum property is admitted to have the form of the probans property, then there is no fruit in admitting difference. Having taught this, now he says that difference itself between the probandum and probans is not possible in the case of a single self.

analyzed: tat katham saḥ iti
translated: How then can it be cognized?

analyzed: pratipādayan āha na
translated: To explain this, he says: And if...

original: kathaṃcit kenāpi svabhāvena yo bhedaḥ / kṛtakatvānityatvayoḥ sa na yuktaḥ /
analyzed: kathaṃcid kena api svabhāvena yaḥ bhedaḥ kṛtaka tva anitya tvayoḥ sa na yuktaḥ
translated: The difference between the two, the produced and the impermanent, by some form, by any nature, is not proper.

analyzed: kasmāt iti āha ekasmāt
translated: Why? He says: From one...

original: yena dharmisvabhāvena tayor abheda iṣyate tasmād ekasmātsvabhāvabhedāt tayo /r dharmayor iti prastāvāt /
analyzed: yena dharmi svabhāvena tayoḥ abhedaḥ iṣyate tasmāt dharmayoḥ iti prastāvāt
translated: From that one nature by which their non-difference is accepted, from that one nature, of those two properties, due to the context.

original: yena svabhāvena tayor a /bhedas tenāpi na bheda eva yenāyaṃ doṣaḥ syāt /
analyzed: yena svabhāvena tayoḥ tena api na bhedaḥ eva yena ayam doṣaḥ syāt
translated: By that very nature by which they are non-different, there is no difference at all by which this fault would occur.

original: tatopi svabhāvāt tayoḥ kṛtakatvānityatvayoḥ kathaṃcid bhedābhedau na bheda evābheda eveeva veti /🔽yena svabhāvenābhinnāv iṣyete tadekasvabhāvād api bhedavato /r bhidyamānayoḥ /

translated: Therefore, from that very nature, of those two, the produced and the impermanent, there is somehow difference and non-difference, only difference, only non-difference.🔽By that very nature by which they are considered non-different, even from that single nature, of those two that are different, that are being differentiated,

original: tena bhedāvadhinā svabhāvena kathañcid abhedanimittam / iti /
analyzed: tena bheda avadhinā svabhāvena kathañcid abheda nimittam iti
translated: by that difference-defining nature, there is somehow a cause of non-difference.

original: yady abhedo neṣyate tadaikāntiko bheda eva syāt /
analyzed: yadi abhedaḥ na iṣyate tadā aikāntikaḥ bhedaḥ eva syāt
translated: If non-difference is not accepted, then there would be only absolute difference.

original: sati caivaṃ pūrvako doṣa iti prāyeṇo //
analyzed: sati ca evam pūrvakaḥ doṣaḥ iti ktam
translated: And if that is so, then the previous fault occurs. Thus, for the most part,

original: tenāpy a /bhedanimittenābhinnena svabhāvena kathaṃcid bhedanimittam iti prastāvād boddhavyam /🔽aparokṣo 'bhyuro 'bhyu
analyzed: tena api svabhāvena kathaṃcid bheda nimittam iti prastāvāt boddhavyam  aparokṣaḥ bhyuraḥ bhyu
translated: by that very cause of non-difference, by that non-different nature, somehow there is a cause of difference. This should be understood from the context.

analyzed: pagantavyaḥ
translated: It should be accepted.

original: atrāpi yadi tena svabhāvena tayor abheda eva bhavet tadaikāntiko 'bheda eva tadā
analyzed: atrā api yadi tena svabhāvena tayoḥ abhedaḥ eva bhavet tad aikāntikaḥ bhedaḥ eva tadā
translated: Here also, if by that very nature their non-difference would be absolute, then there would be only absolute non-difference.

original: ca kalpanāv abhāsibhedanibandhanaḥ sādhyasādhanabhāvaḥ syāt tathā cāsmanmatānupraveśaprasaṅga
analyzed: ca kalpanau abhāsi bheda nibandhanaḥ sādhya sādhana bhāvaḥ syāt tathā ca asmad mata anupraveśa prasaṅga
translated: And then, in the conception, the relation of probandum and probans based on difference would not be possible. And then there would be the undesirable consequence of entering into our view.

analyzed: iti āśayaḥ vaseyaḥ
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: bhedanimitte ca svbhāvāntare 'bhyupagate mābhūd aikāntiko 'bhedo bhedo veti punas tathābhūtasvabhāvāntarābhyupagamo nyāyaprāptaḥ
analyzed: bheda nimitte ca svbhāva antare bhyupagate mā abhūt aikāntikaḥ bhedaḥ bhedaḥ vā iti punar tathābhūta svabhāva antara abhyupagamaḥ nyāya prāptaḥ
translated: And when a different nature as the basis for difference is accepted, let there be no absolute non-difference or difference. Thus, the acceptance of such a different nature is logically implied.

original: punas tatrāpy evam ity abhiprāyavānitiśabdahetāv abhiprāyāha anantaive /ti prāyavān āha ity anantaiveti /
analyzed: punar tatra api evam iti abhiprāyavān iti śabda hetau abhiprāya āha prāyavān āha iti anantā eva iti
translated: Again, intending that it is so in that case as well, the word iti is used as the reason for the intention. He says it is endless.

analyzed: iti śabdaḥ hetau
translated: The word iti is in the sense of reason.

analyzed: na kevalam avikalpakāyām
translated: And not only in the non-conceptual cognition, the word atyāpa is used.

analyzed: paraṃparā parapāṭiḥ
translated: A series is a succession.

analyzed: tad kalpanayā bhinna abhinna svabhāva kalpanayā
translated: By imagining that, by imagining a different and non-different nature, they contradict.

analyzed: dūṣa antaram api atra upacinvan āha
translated: Enumerating another fault here, he says:

analyzed: kathaṃcid ca iti
translated: And if in some way...

original: bhedapakṣabhāvinā saṃbandhābhāvena sādhyasādhanabhāvāyogād ityādīnāṃ doṣāṇāṃ katham anavasaro
analyzed: bheda pakṣa bhāvinā saṃbandha abhāvena sādhya sādhana bhāva ayogāt ityādīnām doṣāṇām katham
