analyzed: vakāśaḥ eva iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that an opportunity is indeed an occasion.

original: itopi bhinnābhinnarūpobhayadharmāsaṃbhava iti saṃkṣepeṇāha yaś ce /ti /
analyzed: itas api bhinna abhinna rūpa ubhaya dharma asaṃbhavaḥ iti saṃkṣepeṇa āha yaḥ
translated: And also because of this, the impossibility of both the different and non-different forms is summarized by saying and that which...

original: purodhāya / puraskrtya vikalpabuddhyā ālambyeti kalpanāghaṭitasya pratiṣedhāt pāramārthika / ity āha /
analyzed: purodhāya puraskrtya vikalpa buddhyā ālambya iti yāvat kalpanā ghaṭitasya pratiṣedhāt pāramārthikaḥ iti āha
translated: Having placed at the forefront, having made primary, having taken as an object with the conceptual intellect, because the negation is of what is constructed by imagination, it is ultimate. Thus he says:

analyzed: itiḥ tritayasya akāram darśayati
translated: iti shows the form of the triad.

analyzed: trayaḥ vayavāḥ asya iti tritayam
translated: It is a triad because it has three parts.

analyzed: svabhāvāt abhedāt
translated: Because there is no difference from the nature,

original: nāsti S🔽prakaraṇam upasaṃharann āha tasmād i /tyādi /
analyzed: na asti s  prakaraṇam upasaṃharan āha tasmāt
translated: there is no🔽Concluding the section, he says tasmāt and so on.

analyzed: sa nvayaḥ
translated: And that is the forward order, which has been described.

analyzed: tasyāḥ virodhāt
translated: Because of the contradiction of that, it is not possible.

original: p / yathā cāyogas tathopariṣṭat sahakāriparvaṇi nirṇeṣyate /
analyzed: yathā ca ayogaḥ tathā upariṣṭat sahakāri parvaṇi nirṇeṣyate
translated: And how that is impossible will be determined later in the chapter on auxiliaries.

original: bhavato 'smād abhidhānapratyayāv iti bhāvaḥ / kāryatvam i /tyādinā tam evābhivyanakti /
analyzed: bhavataḥ smāt abhidhāna pratyayau iti bhāvaḥ kārya tvam tam eva abhivyanakti
translated: The meaning is that from that, there is the designation and understanding. He clarifies that very thing with kāryatvam and so on.

analyzed: tad bhada anuvidhānam eva sādhyayan āha
translated: Desiring to establish that very dependence on it, he says candana and so on.

analyzed: ūrṇā meṣa loma bhedaḥ viśeṣaḥ
translated: The difference in wool and sheep is a particular.

original: anenaitad āha yady adṛśyaṃ tasya karaṇaṃ syāt tat katham akaraṇasyendhanāder bhedam anuvidadhyād iti /
analyzed: anena etat āha yadi adṛśyam tasya karaṇam syāt tat katham akaraṇasya indhana ādeḥ bhedam anuvidadhyāt iti
translated: By this, he says this: If that instrument of the invisible were to exist, then how would it determine the difference of the fuel, etc. which is not an instrument?

original: indhanabhedānuvidhānaṃ dhūmasya pratipādya vahnibhedānuvidhānaṃ pratipādayann āha alpe /ti /
analyzed: indhana bheda anuvidhānam dhūmasya pratipādya vahni bheda anuvidhānam pratipādayan āha
translated: Having shown the conformity with the difference in fuel of smoke, he shows the conformity with the difference in fire, saying in small...

original: alpaś ca mahāṃś cālpamahāntau tau ca tāv indhanavikārau ca tatkāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: alpaḥ ca mahān ca alpa mahantau tau ca tau indhana vikārau ca tad kāriṇaḥ
translated: And small and great are the small and great, and those are the modifications of fuel, and those are the causes of that.

original: prātipadikagrahaṇe na hi tadantasya grahaṇam iti /
analyzed: prātipadika grahaṇe na hi tad antasya grahaṇam iti
translated: In the nominal stem, the ending is not taken,

analyzed: ā t mahataḥ samāna adhikaraṇa pā iti ā tvat na bhavati
translated: so by from mahat to the same case ending... the a is not.

original: tadanurūpasyā /lpamahato vā dhūmasya darśanād iti sambandhaḥ /
analyzed: vā dhūmasya darśanāt iti sambandhaḥ
translated: The connection is: because smoke that is similar to that, or small and great, is seen.

original: adṛśyātmano 'gnyādisāmagryāṃ niyataṃ upekṣyāgnyāder eva kāryaṃ dhūma iti /
analyzed: adṛśya ātmanaḥ gni ādi sāmagryām niyatam upekṣya agni ādeḥ eva kāryam dhūmaḥ iti
translated: The effect of fire, etc., which is necessarily in the unseen self in the collection of fire, etc., is smoke, which is to be disregarded.

original: etat sādhikām upapattim abhidhāyādhunā tanniyatasannidhānam eva tasya na yujyata iti darśayann āha na ce /ti /
analyzed: etat sādhikām upapattim abhidhāya adhunā tad niyata sannidhānam eva tasya na yujyate iti darśayan āha na
translated: Having stated this additional proof, now in order to show that its being necessarily present is not proper, he says and it is not...

original: co vaktavyāntarasamuccaye /🔽tasyāgnyādeḥ kāryaṃ tatkāraṇaṃ tadbhāvas tattā / /
analyzed: caḥ vaktavya antara samuccaye  tasya agni ādeḥ kāryam tat kāraṇam tad bhāvaḥ tad tā
translated: The word ca is for the purpose of including another statement.🔽The effect of that fire, etc., is the cause of that, its existence is that.

original: tasyaivādṛśyasya tadanantaraṃ bhāvān na dhūmaḥ syād iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: tasya eva adṛśyasya tad anantaram bhāvāt na dhūmaḥ syāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The point is that because of the existence of that unseen one immediately after that, there would be no smoke.

analyzed: samam dhūma ādi kāryasya tulya upāya tvam samuccinoti  tasya adṛśyasya sata asataḥ
translated: The word and includes the effect of smoke, etc. as being equally an effect that is seen.🔽Of that unseen existent,

analyzed: tad bhāva anuvidhānam
translated: there is conformity with its existence.

analyzed: caḥ va dhāraṇe iti asmāt parodraṣṭavyaḥ
translated: The word and is for determination, and should be seen after the same.

original: atrāpi vṛkṣendhanayor api tathābhāvakalpanāyāṃ tad evottara /m iti /
analyzed: vṛkṣa indhanayoḥ api tathā bhāva kalpanāyām tat iti
translated: Here also, in the imagination of that state of the tree and fuel, the same reply is given.

analyzed: tad upalambhe prak upalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāptam upalabdham upalabhyate iti
translated: When it is perceived, what was previously not perceived is perceived, and is perceived as such.

original: vṛkṣādibhāve niyatasannidher adṛśyātmanaḥ kutaścid indhanasya bhāva iti punar a /prathame codye evaeva vākyavṛkṣa
analyzed: vṛkṣa ādi bhāve niyata sannidheḥ adṛśya ātmanaḥ kutaścid indhanasya bhāvaḥ iti punar codye parakīya vākyavṛkṣa
translated: In the state of the tree, etc., the existence of some unseen self that is always present near is inferred from the fuel. Again, in the first objection, the sentence is the same as the tree.

analyzed: bheda anuvidhānāt indhanasya vṛkṣa ādi sannidhāne dṛśya ātmanaḥ niyata sannidhāna tā yuktā
translated: Because of conformity with the difference, the always present nearness of the unseen self of the fuel in the presence of the tree, etc. is proper.

analyzed: pratibandha abhāvāt pratibandhe
translated: Because there is no restriction, if there were restriction, etc.

original: vṛkṣādikāraṇatvaṃ tasya vṛkṣādeḥ svahetor eva / bījāder bhāvadarśanād i /ti parihāraḥ /
analyzed: vṛkṣa ādi kāraṇa tvam tasya vṛkṣa ādeḥ sva hetoḥ eva bīja ādeḥ bhāva darśanāt parihāraḥ
translated: The fact that it is the cause of the tree, etc. is due to the very cause of the tree, etc., because its existence is seen from the seed, etc. This is the reply.

original: tatrāpy adaśyātmano niyatasannidher ityādicodyaparihārayor ābhīkṣūnyenānavasthānāt paryavasānaṃ ca naṃ na syāt /
analyzed: tatra api a daśya ātmanaḥ niyata sannidheḥ ityādi codya parihārayoḥ ābhīkṣūnyena anavasthānāt paryavasānam ca na na syāt
translated: And there too, because of the endless regress of the objections and replies beginning with And even there, of the unseen self, whose presence is certain, there would be no conclusion.

analyzed: tatas
translated: From that,

analyzed: niyata kārya tvam na syāt iti ākūtam
translated: the intended meaning is that there would be no certainty of being the effect.

original: yadi va tasyāpy adṛśyasya bhāve niyatasannidhānanaparamadṛśyaṃ kāraṇaṃ kiṃ na kalpyate /
analyzed: yadi tasya api adṛśyasya bhāve niyata sannidhāna naparam adṛśyam kāraṇam kim na kalpyate
translated: Or, if even of that unseen thing, whose presence is certain when it exists, another unseen cause is not imagined,

analyzed: nyāyasya samāna tvāt
translated: because the reasoning is the same.

original: tathātrāpy evam ity anavasthā na vyavasthitaḥ kāryakāraṇabhavo bhaved ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: tathā atra api evam iti anavasthā na vyavasthitaḥ kārya kāraṇa bhavaḥ bhavet iti arthaḥ
translated: In the same way, here too, thus there would be an endless regress. The relation of cause and effect would not be well-established, this is the meaning.

original: athavā tatrāpi / vṛkṣādau tathābhāvakalpanāyām / dṛśyabhāvakalpanāyāṃ pareṇa kriyamāṇāyāṃ tad evottara indhanāder vṛkṣādibhedānuvidhānāt
analyzed: athavā tatra api vṛkṣa ādau tathābhāva kalpanāyām dṛśya bhāva kalpanāyām pareṇa kriyamāṇāyām tat indhana ādeḥ vṛkṣa ādi bheda anuvidhānāt
translated: Or, even there, in the imagination of that state in a tree etc., when the other imagines the state of being seen, that very [unseen self] is inferred from the conformity to the particulars of the tree etc. from the fuel etc.

analyzed: na ca vṛkṣa ādi sannidhāne niyata sannidhāna tā yuktā ityādi
translated: And it is not proper that there is certain presence in the presence of the tree etc., and so on.

original: nāpi vṛkṣādikāraṇatvam adṛśyātmano vṛkṣādeḥ svahetor eva bījāder bhāvadarśanad iti p / ca /
analyzed: nā api vṛkṣa ādi kāraṇa tvam adṛśya ātmanaḥ vṛkṣa ādeḥ sva hetoḥ eva bīja ādeḥ bhāva darśanat iti ca
translated: Nor is there the nature of being the cause of the tree etc. of the unseen self, because of the perception of the existence of the tree etc. from its own cause, the seed etc., thus it is.

analyzed: uttīryate niṣṭapakṣāt anena iti uttaram etat
translated: It is an answer because it is carried across from the undesirable position by this.

original: bījādibhāve niyatasannidher ityādau punaś codye / ca parasya sa eva ityādy anaṃtarokto 'smākaṃ parihārah /
analyzed: bīja ādi bhāve niyata sannidheḥ ityādau punar codye ca parasya saḥ eva ityādi smākam parihāraḥ
translated: And again, when the objection is stated in because of the definite presence in the state of seed, etc., our answer is the same as stated immediately before, that is the same for the other party.

analyzed: para codya pratividhānam
translated: Refutation of objections by the opponent.

analyzed: anavasthā ca anantaram vyākhyātā iti
translated: And the infinite regress is explained immediately after.

original: etene /ndhanādeḥ svahetor eva vṛkṣāder bhāvadarśanād ti vacanasāmarthyāt /
analyzed: sva hetoḥ eva vṛkṣa ādeḥ bhāva darśanāt vacana sāmarthyāt
translated: By this, because the existence of fuel, etc. is seen from its own cause, such as a tree, etc., by the force of the statement,

original: yasya yasmād bhāvo dṛśyate tasya tatkāraṇatvam iti pratipāditena /
analyzed: yasya yasmāt bhāvaḥ dṛśyate tasya tad kāraṇa tvam iti pratipāditena
translated: it is taught that whatever is seen to exist from something, that is the cause of it.

original: yasyā eva sāmagryā agnīndhanāder utpattis tasyā eva upajāyata iti /
analyzed: yasyāḥ eva sāmagryāḥ agni indhana ādeḥ utpattiḥ tasyāḥ eva upajāyate iti
translated: It is produced only from that very collection from which the fire, fuel, etc. originate.

original: ekasāmagryadhīnatā / tayor niyatasannidhānanimittaṃ sāpi pratyuktā pratyākhyātā kasyacid bhāve vijñāyamānasyaiva tatkāryatvavyavasthāsiddheḥ
analyzed: eka sāmagrī adhīna tā tayoḥ niyata sannidhāna nimittam sā api pratyuktā pratyākhyātā kasyacid bhāve vijñāyamānasya eva tad kārya tva vyavasthā siddheḥ
translated: The dependence on the same collection, the reason for the definite presence of those two, is also refuted, rejected, because the establishment of the causal nature of only that which is cognized as existing by someone is accomplished.

original: tadbhāve 'nupalabhyamānasya tu tatkāryatvakalpanāyām atiprasaṃgād iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: tad bhāve nupalabhyamānasya tu tad kārya tva kalpanāyām atiprasaṃgāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that if the causal nature of that which is not perceived in its existence is imagined, there is an excessive extension.

original: atraiva vaktavyāntaraṃ samuccivann āha tad i /ti /
analyzed: atrā eva vaktavya antaram āha tat
translated: Conjoining another statement on this very point, he says that and so on.

analyzed: tat
translated: That is not seen.

analyzed: tac
translated: And that is the conformity with positive and negative concomitance.

original: nimittābhāvam evāvedayann āha kāryeti / /🔽satsvanyeṣu kāraṇeṣu samartheṣu kāryam abhavatkastavatta
analyzed: nimitta abhāvam eva āvedayan āha kārya iti  satsu anyeṣu kāraṇeṣu samartheṣu kāryam abhavat kaḥ tavatta
translated: Pointing out the absence of a reason, he says 'the effect' etc.🔽When other capable causes are present, the effect does not occur. What other cause is to be expected for its production?

original: dutpattau kāraṇāntaram apekṣaṇīyaṃ pratipādayati /🔽na tu bhaveva
analyzed: t utpattau kāraṇa antaram apekṣaṇīyam pratipādayati  na tu bhava iva
translated: He shows that.

analyzed: t eva iti samudāya arthaḥ
translated: But not that it does not exist at all. This is the meaning of the compound.

analyzed: tatra api s
translated: Even there, that

analyzed: saḥ eva s
translated: That very

analyzed: bandhe vā s
translated: In bondage or

analyzed: saṃprati sata
translated: Now, the existence of that

original: tkāraṇatvam nāsmatpratijñātasya kācit kṣatir iti pratipādayitum āha rūpantv iti bhavatv iti / /
analyzed: upetya api na asmad pratijñātasya kācid kṣatiḥ iti pratipādayitum āha iti bhavatu iti
translated: The state of being a cause does not at all harm our proposition. To show this, he says 'form' etc. Let it be so.

original: yato / vahnyādeḥ kāraṇatvahāneḥ agnyāder anyasyāpibhāvaḥ bhāve dhūmaṃ prati kāraṇatvena kathaṃ na agnyādeḥ kāraṇatvahāniḥ /
translated: Because, due to the loss of being a cause of fire etc., the existence of something other than fire etc. is not a cause in relation to smoke. How can there be no loss of being a cause of fire etc.?

original: kathañ ca tanniṣcayena pravṛttau na visamvāda ity āśaṃkyāha tasya / /
analyzed: katham ca tad niṣcayena pravṛttau na visamvādaḥ iti āśaṃkya āha tasya
translated: And how is there no contradiction in engaging in that ascertainment? Suspecting this, he says 'of that'.

analyzed: abhyupagamanīya dṛṣṭānta dvāreṇa amum artham draḍhayan āha
translated: Firming up this meaning through the example that must be accepted, he says 'not' etc.

original: dṛṣṭasya kāraṇasya hānam abhāvo na hy akāraṇatvena pratītasya kāraṇatvahānir ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭasya kāraṇasya hānam abhāvaḥ na hi akāraṇa tvena pratītasya kāraṇa tva hāniḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: there is no loss of being a cause of what is seen as not being a cause, for what is perceived as not being a cause.

analyzed: tasya dṛṣṭa kāraṇasya kāryam tad darśanāt
translated: The effect of that seen cause is seen from that.

original: atatprāpti /r dṛṣṭakāraṇāprāptiḥ prasajyata āpadyate aneneti prasaṅgāpādanam atiśayitaḥ prasaṅgo 'tiprasaṃgas tenālaṃ / na kiñcit
analyzed: dṛṣṭa kāraṇa aprāptiḥ prasajyate āpadyate anena iti prasaṅga āpādanam atiśayitaḥ tena alam na kiñcid
translated: The non-attainment of that is the non-attainment of the seen cause. The reductio argument is the production of a contradiction by this. Excessive reductio is over-extension. Enough of that. Nothing is gained.

original: nanu ca tadbhāve bhāvas tadabhāve 'bhāvaś ca imau tat katham ayam eva kāryakāraṇabhāva uty ucyate /
analyzed: nanu ca tad bhāve bhāvaḥ tad abhāve bhāvaḥ ca kārya dharmau imau tat katham ayam eva kārya kāraṇa bhāvaḥ ucyate
translated: But if it exists when that exists and does not exist when that does not exist, how is this very relation of cause and effect stated? It is said:

original: kāryabhāva iti tu yuktaṃ vaktum iti /
analyzed: kārya bhāvaḥ iti tu yuktam vaktum iti
translated: The existence of the effect is proper to state.

original: satyam etat kevalam etasmin kāryadharme kathite kāraṇadharmopi svabhāve bhāvo bhāvanaṃ
analyzed: satyam etat kevalam etasmin kārya dharme kathite kāraṇa dharmaḥ api svabhāve bhāvaḥ bhāvanam
translated: This is true. Only when this property of the effect is stated, the property of the cause is also stated. The existence of the essential nature is the production of existence.

original: bhāvo bhāvayitṛtvaṃ sattayābhisambandhayitṛtvaṃ svābhāve cābhāvo 'bhāvanam abhāvayitṛtvam
analyzed: bhāvaḥ bhāvayitṛ tvam sattayā abhisambandhayitṛ tvam sva abhāve ca abhāvaḥ bhāvanam abhāvayitṛ tvam
translated: The existence is the state of being a producer. The state of being connected with existence. And the non-existence in the essential nature is the non-production of non-existence.

original: anutpādayitṛtvaṃ yat tallakṣaṇaḥ sujñāno bhavatīty uktam anenāpy evaṃ vyākhyātam /🔽p / tenāyam arthaḥ arthāntaratve sati yaḥ prāgbhāvī sosvā
analyzed: an utpādayitṛ tvam yat tad lakṣaṇaḥ su jñānaḥ bhavati iti uktam anena api evam vyākhyātam  tena ayam arthaḥ artha antara tve sati yaḥ prāc bhāvī
translated: The state of not producing. That characteristic is well known. It is said that this is also explained in the same way.

analyzed: nvaya vyatirekau anuvidhāpayati tat kāraṇam
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning. When there is difference in meaning, what precedes is the cause that conforms to the positive and negative concomitance.

analyzed: yaḥ ca paścādbhāvi anvaya vyatireka anuvidhāpana anvya vyatireka anuvidhāna lakṣaṇaḥ kārya kāraṇa bhāvaḥ iti
translated: And that which is the relation of cause and effect characterized by conformity to the presence and absence of what comes later, is the relation of cause and effect.

original: yad vā kāryakāraṇabhāvaniścayahetutvād ayam eva tathoktaḥ /🔽tathā hi kāryagatābhyām eva tada
analyzed: yat vā kārya kāraṇa bhāva niścaya hetu tvāt ayam eva tathā uktaḥ  tathā hi kārya gatābhyām eva
translated: Or, it is called thus because it is the cause for the ascertainment of the relation of cause and effect.

original: bhāvābhāvābhyāṃ tayoḥ kāryakāraṇabhāvo vibhāvyate /🔽asati kāraṇatve tadbhāvavā
analyzed: bhāva abhāvābhyām tayoḥ kārya kāraṇa bhāvaḥ vibhāvyate  asati kāraṇa tve tad bhāva vā
translated: For thus, the relation of cause and effect of those two is manifested only by the presence and absence of the effect.

original: bhāvayos tadbhāvābhāvāv eva na bhavetām iti /
analyzed: bhāvayoḥ tad bhāva abhāvau eva na bhavetām iti
translated: If there were no causal nature, the presence and absence of those two would not be the presence and absence of that.

original: nāyam evam ayam eva kāraṇabhāvo nāma anya eva dviṣṭhaḥ sambandho 'stīty āśaṃkyāha sa hīti / /
analyzed: na ayam evam ayam eva kāraṇa bhāvaḥ nāma anyaḥ eva dviṣṭhaḥ sambandhaḥ sti iti āśaṃkya āha sa hi iti
translated: This is not so. Suspecting that there is a different, reciprocal relation called causal nature, he says that (in the verse).

analyzed: hi yasmāt arthe
translated: Hi (in the verse) means because.

analyzed: tābhyām tad bhāva bhāva tad abhāva abhāvābhyām
translated: By those two means by the presence and absence of that and the absence of that.

analyzed: agni dhūmayoḥ dūṣaṇa antaram anvacinvan
translated: Finding another fault in the case of fire and smoke,

analyzed: āha svabhāvena
translated: he says If it were by nature... (in the verse).

analyzed: tasya apūrvasya rūpasya tena niṣpādyamānasya
translated: Of that means of that previously non-existent form being produced by that.

analyzed: tatas
translated: From that means from the forms of cause and effect.

analyzed: samarthanam
translated: For the establishment of a different thing is not possible without a cause.

analyzed: tatas tasya tatas
translated: Therefore, because it is different from that.

analyzed: pūrvake iti kārya kāraṇa bhāva sambandhena kriyamāṇa umāṇāt
translated: In the preceding. Thus, the fire that precedes the cognition produced by the relation of causal relation

analyzed: rūpāt prāc bhāvinī vahniḥ tasya dhūma rūpe
translated: is in the form of smoke of that.

original: tadbhāvaḥ / kāryakāraṇabhāvaḥ tayos tādrūpyepi kāraṇabuddhāv asyopayogān na vaiyarthyam ity āha karye /ti /
analyzed: tad bhāvaḥ kārya kāraṇa bhāvaḥ tayoḥ tādrūpye api kāraṇa buddhau asya upayogāt na vaiyarthyam iti āha  /
translated: That state is the relation of cause and effect. Even though they have that form, the cognition of the cause is not useless due to its usefulness, he says in the effect.

analyzed: api nyāyataḥ sambhāvanām darśayati
translated: Even shows the possibility according to logic.

original: katham avasīyate nārthāntaranimitte ity āha tasye /ti /🔽tasya tatsāmarthyātasya tābhyām arthā
analyzed: katham avasīyate na artha antara nimitte iti āha  tasya tad sāmarthyātasya tābhyām
translated: How is it ascertained that it is not due to a different object? He says of that.

analyzed: ntarasya tathāvidhasya
translated: By the power of that, of that by those two, of a different object of that kind.

original: api / vyaktim ity etad asminn arthe /
analyzed: api vyaktim iti etat asmin arthe
translated: Even this in this sense.

original: sarvaṃ sarvatra gṛhītam itīṣṭaṃ dharmam atikrāntaḥ prasaṅgo 'tiprasaṅgaḥ / /🔽tasyānupalabdhilakṣaṇaprāptatvād viśeṣeṣa
analyzed: sarvam sarvatra gṛhītam iti iṣṭam dharmam atikrāntaḥ  tasya anupalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāpta tvāt
translated: It is accepted that everything is grasped everywhere. The consequence that goes beyond the desired property is over-extension.

analyzed: ṇāsiddhaḥ yam hetuḥ iti āha
translated: Because it is not apprehended as having the characteristic of non-apprehension, this reason is not established. He says non-apprehension.

original: kim avaśyam upalabhyamānena tena tadbuddhihetunā bhāvyaṃ yenaivam ucyata ity āha na hī /ti /
analyzed: kim avaśyam upalabhyamānena tena tad buddhi hetunā bhāvyam yena evam ucyate iti āha na
translated: Is it necessary that when it is apprehended, it must be the cause of that cognition, by which it is said thus? He says not indeed.

analyzed: kārya kāraṇa buddhī
translated: The cognitions of cause and effect.

analyzed: asya artha antarasya tayoḥ kārya kāraṇa buddhyoḥ
translated: Of this other thing. Of those two, the notions of effect and cause.

original: na cānvayavyatirekānuvidhānam aviduṣas tadbuddhī bhavata iti buddhistham /
analyzed: na ca anvaya vyatireka anuvidhānam aviduṣaḥ tad buddhī bhavataḥ iti buddhi stham
translated: And it is well known that the notions of effect and cause do not occur in one who does not know concomitance and non-concomitance.

original: upapattyantaram atraiva samuccinvann āha na ce /ti /🔽svaviśiṣṭapratyayanibandhanaṃ / cosvo
analyzed: upapatti antaram atra eva samuccinvan āha na  sva viśiṣṭa pratyaya nibandhanam ca u svaḥ
translated: Adding another reason here, he says: Nor.🔽Based on the cognition of its own particular. And.
Based on the cognition of what is related to another.

analyzed: vikalpa ātmikayoḥ iti prakaraṇāt draṣṭavyam
translated: The notions of effect and cause, which are of the nature of alternatives, should be seen from the context.

original: tasya katham avaśyam upalakṣaṇam ity āha nahī /tyādi /
analyzed: tasya katham avaśyam upalakṣaṇam iti āha
translated: How is it necessarily an indication of that? He says: For.

analyzed: caḥ vaktavya antara samuccaye
translated: And. In the sense of adding another statement to be made.

analyzed: kārya kāraṇābhyām
translated: From effect and cause.

original: atra yato vahnyādeḥ kāraṇatvahāneḥ etāvān pāṭhaḥ agre visaṃvāda ity āśaṅkyāha etad anantaraṃ saṃgacchate /
analyzed: atra yatas vahni ādeḥ kāraṇatva hāneḥ etāvān pāṭhaḥ agre visaṃvādaḥ iti āśaṅkya āha etat anantaram saṃgacchate
translated: Here, because of the loss of being a cause from fire etc., this much text is in contradiction later. Fearing this, he says: This connects after that.

analyzed: pramādāt prāc āyātaḥ bhāti
translated: Out of carelessness, what came before shines.

analyzed: agretanam tasya
translated: The later is of that.

original: iti śaṃkā cihnitaṃ padaṃ atratyaṃ bhāti /
analyzed: iti śaṃkā cihnitam padam atratyam bhāti
translated: Thus, the marked word shines here.

original: tathā ca tasya bhāve iti tadbhāve / ity asya vivaraṇam /
analyzed: tathā ca tasya bhāve iti tad bhāve iti asya vivaraṇam
translated: And thus, in the presence of that, in the presence of that. This is the explanation of that.

analyzed: artha antarasya bhinnasya
translated: From fire and smoke, of a different thing, a different one.

original: kāryakāraṇabhāvarūpasya sattvasya sabandhāntarasadbhāvāt kathaṃ na ghaṭata ity āha /
analyzed: kārya kāraṇa bhāva rūpasya sattvasya sabandha antara sadbhāvāt katham na ghaṭate iti āha
translated: How is it not established, since there is another relation of existence in the form of cause and effect? He says:

original: tasmāt kāryakāraṇābhāvasaṃbandhād anyasya tenāpy arthāntareṇa sahāsya kathaṃ saṃbandha iti paryanuyoge saṃbandhāntaraṃ kalpanīyam
analyzed: tasmāt kārya kāraṇa abhāva saṃbandhāt anyasya tena api artha antareṇa sambandhena saha asya katham saṃbandhaḥ iti paryanuyoge saṃbandha antaram kalpanīyam
translated: Therefore, when questioned about how this [relation] can be related to that other object by a relation other than the relation of cause and effect, another relation must be imagined.

original: punaḥ paryanuyoge punas tatheti anavasthā /prasaktis tataḥ /
analyzed: punar paryanuyoge punar tathā iti tatas
translated: When questioned again, it would be the same again, so there would be the undesirable consequence of an infinite regress.

analyzed: na ca evam sambandha antaram parikalpyate
translated: But such another relation is not imagined.

original: kiṃ tarhi kāryakāraṇabhūtavastukāryakāraṇākhyasambandhayor p / akāryakāraṇabhāva eva sambandha ity āha kārye /ti /
analyzed: kim tarhi kārya kāraṇa bhūta vastu kārya kāraṇa ākhya sambandhayoḥ a kārya kāraṇa bhāvaḥ eva sambandhaḥ iti āha
translated: What then? The relation called cause and effect between the two objects that are cause and effect is the relation of non-cause and effect itself. He says effect and so on.

analyzed: kārya kāraṇa bhāvasya kalpitasya sahabhāvi tvāt
translated: Because that existence, i.e., the imagined relation of cause and effect, does not coexist with that [other relation].

analyzed: kārya kāraṇa kāle kārya kāraṇa bhūta vahni dhūma ādi vastu kāle
translated: At the time of cause and effect, i.e., at the time of the real objects fire and smoke that are cause and effect.

original: tayoś caikakālikatvaṃ kuto yenaikajanakatvaṃ syād iti /
analyzed: tayoḥ ca aikakālika tvam kutas yena eka janaka tvam syāt iti
translated: And how can those two be simultaneous, by which there would be a single cause?

analyzed: atra gaja nimīlikām kṛtvā etat uktam draṣṭavyam
translated: Here this should be seen as said with eyes closed.

analyzed: sa ca kārya kāraṇa adhyavasāyaḥ
translated: And that, i.e., the ascertainment of cause and effect,🔽is the relation of cause and effect.

original: bhavatv asau kalpitaviṣayas tathāpi bhinnasambhavaḥ kathaṃ na bhaved ity āha /ti /
analyzed: bhavatu asau kalpita viṣayaḥ tathā api bhinna sambhavaḥ katham na bhavet iti āha
translated: Let it be that this [cognition] has an imagined object. Even so, how could it not be possible that it is different? He says:

analyzed: tad vyavasāyasya kārya kāraṇa tā vyavasāyasya
translated: Of that ascertainment, of the ascertainment of the relation of cause and effect.

analyzed: bhinnasya kārya kāraṇa bhāvasya
translated: Of that difference, of the relation of cause and effect.

original: mābhūt kalpitaviṣayoyaṃ tadavasāya iti hi tasya kalpanā sa cet tathāvidha aiṣitavyaḥ kiṃ teneti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: mā abhūt kalpita viṣayaḥ iyam tad avasāyaḥ iti hi tasya kalpanā sa ced tathāvidha kim tena iti bhāvaḥ
translated: Let this ascertainment of that be one having an imagined object. For if that is to be accepted in that way, what is the use of it? This is the idea.

original: kiṃ kalpyamānosau tadbhāvaḥ kiṃ kāryakāraṇabhāvābhyāṃ sahitābhyāṃ janyate pakṣayor ādyaṃ pakṣaṃ kṣapayann āha kāryeti /
analyzed: kim kalpyamānaḥ asau tad bhāvaḥ kim kārya kāraṇa bhāvābhyām sahitābhyām janyate pakṣayoḥ ādyam pakṣam kṣapayan āha kārya iti
translated: What is imagined, is that state of being produced by the two together, by the relation of cause and effect? Refuting the first alternative, he says: The effect, etc.

analyzed: kāryeṇa janyamānaḥ kārya bhāvaḥ syāt
translated: The state of being an effect would be produced by the effect.

original: kāraṇena janyamānaś ca kāraṇabhāva ity abhipretya katham i /ty āha /🔽pratyekajanyamānatāyām api kāraṇam uddiśya nirūpayann āha yadā ce /ti /
analyzed: kāraṇena janyamānaḥ ca kāraṇa bhāvaḥ iti abhipretya katham āha  pratyeka janyamāna tāyām api kāraṇam uddiśya nirūpayan āha yadā
translated: And the state of being a cause would be produced by the cause. Having understood this, he says: How?🔽Even in the case of being produced individually, he says: When, etc., specifying with reference to the cause.

analyzed: tu sva kāryasya iti yojyam
translated: But with reference to the word after, it should be connected as of one's own effect.

analyzed: prāpteḥ
translated: Because the genitive is obtained by the addition of the suffix tasya.

analyzed: tat tasmāt ubhayoḥ kārya tad bhāvayoḥ
translated: That, therefore, of both, of the effect and its state,

analyzed: sadbhāvam s
translated: the existence, etc.

analyzed: tasyāḥ s  ṣaṣṭhī atas artha pratyayena pā
translated: Of that.🔽By the genitive case ending, the relation is

original: nanv ekasāmagryadhīnataivānayoḥ sambandha iti kathaṃ parasparāsambandha ucyata iti cet /
analyzed: nanu eka sāmagrī adhīna tā eva anayoḥ sambandhaḥ iti katham paraspara asambandhaḥ ucyate iti ced
translated: If it is asked how the mutual relation is stated when the relation of these two is only dependence on the same collection,

original: na / kāryeṇāpi samam asya kāryakāraṇabhāvasya saṃbandhasya prakṛtatvāt sūktam idam /
analyzed: na kāryeṇa api samam asya kārya kāraṇa bhāvasya saṃbandhasya prakṛta tvāt su uktam idam
translated: [No, because] this is appropriate since the relation of cause and effect is the topic, even though it is common with the effect.

original: ca tad utpatteḥ pūrvaṃ kāraṇaṃ na kāraṇaṃ syāt /
analyzed: ca tat utpatteḥ pūrvam kāraṇam na kāraṇam syāt
translated: And before the arising of that, the cause would not be a cause.

original: tvanmate tadyogāt tadavyavasthiter yoyam aprāptatvād iti doṣo draṣṭavyaḥ /
analyzed: tvad mate tad yogāt tad avyavasthiteḥ yaḥ uyam aprāpta tvāt iti doṣaḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: According to your view, because of the connection with that, that is not established. The fault that should be seen is that this [cause] is not a cause because it is not obtained.

analyzed: kāryasya dhūma ādeḥ kriyā karaṇam katham
translated: How is the effect, such as smoke, an action? It is an instrument. How?

analyzed: tad apekṣam tad dhūma ādi kriyā apekṣam
translated: It is dependent on that, dependent on the action of smoke, etc.

original: asya / vahnyādeḥ asattvān mā sma tajjanayata /
analyzed: asya vahni ādeḥ asattvāt mā sma tat janayata
translated: Of this, of fire, etc., let it not produce that because of non-existence.

original: kā no hānir ity āha tadbhāvaś ce / /
analyzed: kā naḥ hāniḥ iti āha tad bhāvaḥ
translated: What loss is ours? He says: And that existence...

analyzed: tad bhāvaḥ kārya kāraṇa bhāvaḥ saṃbandhaḥ  kāraṇa abhāvāt anutpannaḥ cannāśva
translated: That existence, the relation of cause and effect,

analyzed: śaśaviṣāṇā yathā naḥ na
translated: The unborn, because of the absence of a cause, is like our horn on a hare.

analyzed: katham tad bhāva sambandhaḥ bhavitum arhati iti āśayaḥ
translated: How can it be fit to have the relation of that existence? This is the intention.

analyzed: saṃprati akṣaṇika pakṣam abhyupagamya āha akṣaṇika tve pi iti
translated: Now, accepting the momentary theory, he says: Even in non-momentariness...

analyzed: pratyaya hetuḥ kārya kāraṇa buddhi hetuḥ vā na ativartate
translated: The cause of the cognition is either the cause of the effect or the cause of the cognition, and does not go beyond that.

original: yadi hi tadāśritaṃ syāt tadā tatra tathāvidhaṃ bodhaṃ vidadhyād viprakarṣābhāvāt sarvatra tadbuddhiṃ janayen no vā kvacid apīti
analyzed: yadi hi tad āśritam syāt tadā tatra tathāvidham bodham vidadhyāt viprakarṣa abhāvāt sarvatra tad buddhim janayet no vā kvacid api iti
translated: If it were dependent on that, then it would produce such a cognition there, because there is no remoteness, it would produce the cognition of that everywhere, or it would not produce it anywhere.

analyzed: bhāvaḥ
translated: This is the meaning.

analyzed: idam punar atra sādhu dṛśyate
translated: But this is seen to be good here.

original: ayaṃ khalu kāryakāraṇabhāvaḥ kāryakāraṇayor vastunor varttamāno nāṃśena vaṃśadaṇḍavad vartate akhaṇḍarūpatvāt /
analyzed: ayam khalu kārya kāraṇa bhāvaḥ kārya kāraṇayoḥ vastunoḥ varttamānaḥ na aṃśena vaṃśa daṇḍa vat vartate akhaṇḍa rūpa tvāt
translated: This relation of cause and effect, which exists between the two entities that are the cause and effect, does not exist partially like a bamboo, because it has an undivided form.

original: kāryābhāvaḥ kāraṇābhāva iti prāpter anekarūpatāpattiprasakteś ca /
analyzed: kārya abhāvaḥ iti prāpteḥ aneka rūpa tā āpatti prasakteḥ ca
translated: Because it is obtained that the absence of the effect is the absence of the cause, and because of the consequence of the occurrence of multiple forms.

original: pratyeka vartamānaś ca yathākāryakāraṇayoḥ kāryakāraṇabuddhī janayati tathā pratyekaṃ janayet /
analyzed: rūpa kārya tvena vartamānaḥ ca yathā kārya kāraṇayoḥ kārya kāraṇa buddhī janayati tathā pratyekam janayet
translated: And it would exist individually, and would produce the cognitions of cause and effect as they are between the cause and effect, it would produce them individually.

original: sati caivaṃ vahnāv eva dhūmāpekṣayaiva kāryakāraṇabuddhī prasajyeyātāṃ tathā dhūmepi tadvahnyapekṣayaiva kāryakāraṇabuddhī prasaṅgasajataḥ
analyzed: sati ca evam vahnau eva dhūma apekṣayā eva kārya kāraṇa buddhī prasajyeyātām tathā dhūme api tad vahni apekṣayā eva kārya kāraṇa buddhī prasaṅga sajataḥ
translated: And if this is so, the cognitions of cause and effect would be entailed only in relation to the fire and smoke, and similarly the cognitions of cause and effect would be entailed only in relation to the smoke and fire.

original: mā sma vā kāryakāraṇayor api p / bhūtām iti /
analyzed: mā sma vā kārya kāraṇayoḥ api bhūtām iti
translated: Or let us not have the relation of cause and effect even between the cause and effect.

analyzed: tad eka prakāhā
translated: That is the one manifestation.

original: ranihate 'pi sambandhe 'sminn imām īdṛśīṃ sūkṣmekṣikāṃ ayaṃ sthavīyān doṣo na darśita iti na pratīmaḥ /
analyzed: ra nihate pi sambandhe smin imām īdṛśīm sūkṣma īkṣikām ayam sthavīyān doṣaḥ na darśitaḥ iti na pratīmaḥ
translated: Even when this relation is destroyed, we do not understand why this great fault has not been shown in this subtle examination.

analyzed: kāraṇa bhāvaḥ iti api paṭhyate
translated: The reading causal nature is also found.

original: nanu yaḥ kila kāryakāraṇalakṣaṇasaṃbandhāntaravaśāt kayościd vastunoḥ kāryakāraṇarūpatām upaiti taṃ pratyetad ucyamānaṃ śobheta /🔽asmākaṃ tu kāryasamavāyaṃ kāraṇatvaṃ kāraṇasamavāyayi
analyzed: nanu yaḥ kila kārya kāraṇa lakṣaṇa saṃbandha antara vaśāt kayoḥ cit vastunoḥ kārya kāraṇa rūpa tām upaiti tam prati etat ucyamānam śobheta  asmākam tu kārya samavāyam kāraṇa tvam
translated: But surely this would be beautiful if it were said to him who, it is said, attains the nature of cause and effect of two things by the power of another relation characterized by cause and effect.

original: tvaṃ ca kāryatvam icchatām ity anantaroktād doṣān naktā doṣā na
analyzed: tvam ca kārya tvam icchatām iti anantara uktāt doṣāt naktāḥ doṣāḥ na
translated: But for us who desire that causality is the inherence of the effect and that effectuality is the inherence of the cause, the faults mentioned immediately before do not cause any harm.

original: kiṃcid upaghnantītinaiyāyikavacanam āśaṃkya apy unmūlayann āha samavayīti /
analyzed: kiṃcid upaghnanti iti naiyāyika vacanam āśaṃkya api unmūlayan āha
translated: Suspecting and overturning the Naiyāyika's statement, he says inherence and so on.

analyzed: samavāyi kāraṇasya eva kapāla ādeḥ
translated: Of the inhering cause alone, such as the potsherd.

analyzed: tatra eva ghaṭa ādi kāryasya samavāyāt
translated: Because the effect such as the pot inheres in that alone.

analyzed: caḥ yasmāt arthe  nimitta kāraṇam kulāla ādi
translated: The word ca (and) has the meaning of yasmāt (because).🔽The instrumental cause is the potter and so on.

analyzed: asamavāyi kāraṇam kapāla saṃyoga ādiḥ
translated: The non-inhering cause is the conjunction of the potsherd and so on.

original: tayor na kāryasamavāyostīti na kāraṇaṃ syāt tataś cāvyāpitvaṃ lakṣaṇadoṣa iti sāmarthyād darśitam /
analyzed: tayoḥ na kārya samavāyaḥ usti iti na kāraṇam syāt tatas ca avyāpi tvam lakṣaṇa doṣaḥ iti sāmarthyāt darśitam
translated: The meaning is: because the effect does not exist in the two, it would not be a cause. And from that, the fault of the definition is non-pervasion. This is shown by implication.

analyzed: akāryasya vā iti vāśabdaḥ piśabdasya arthe
translated: The word or has the meaning of also in or of the non-effect.

original: tatsamavāyaḥ kāraṇasamavāyaḥ /🔽samavāyikāraṇa eva kapālādau samavāyah kāryatvaṃ na nimittāsamavāyikāraṇayor iti saptamyantaṃ sapada
analyzed: tad samavāyaḥ kāraṇa samavāyaḥ  samavāyi kāraṇe eva kapāla ādau samavāyaḥ kārya tvam na nimitta asamavāyi kāraṇayoḥ iti saptamī antam sa pada
translated: The inherence of that is the inherence of the cause.

analyzed: dvayam iha sambandhavyam
translated: Inherence in the material cause alone, such as the potsherds, is the effect, not in the non-inherent and instrumental causes. The two words ending in the locative case are to be connected here.

analyzed: kapāla ādi samavāyinaḥ eva ghaṭa ādeḥ udaya upagamāt
translated: Because the production of the pot, etc. is only in the inherence in the potsherds, etc.

original: tataś ca nimittāsamavāyikāraṇāpekṣayā kāryaṃ na syād ity atrāpi avyāpitaiva darśitā /
analyzed: tatas ca nimitta asamavāyi kāraṇa apekṣayā kāryam na syāt iti atra api avyāpi tā eva darśitā
translated: And from that, the effect would not exist in relation to the non-inherent and instrumental causes. Even here, non-pervasion is shown.

original: idānīṃ sādhāraṇaṃ dūṣaṇam upadarśayann āha tasya ceti /
analyzed: idānīm sādhāraṇam dūṣaṇam upadarśayan āha tasya ca iti
translated: Now, showing a general criticism, he says and that and so on.

analyzed: tasya samavāyasya caḥ vaktavya antara samuccaye
translated: And that is for including another statement about that inherence.

analyzed: anyathātva vyākhyānam atra sāhasam iti na anūdyate api
translated: The explanation of otherwise here is rash. Therefore, it is not repeated.

analyzed: vyakti bheda vivakṣayā upayukta kārye vā sarvatra śabda prayogāt
translated: Because the word everywhere is used in all cases where an effect is useful when the difference of individuals is intended.

analyzed: sarvatra kārya kāraṇa bhūte vastuni
translated: Everywhere in the entity that is the cause and effect.

analyzed: aviśeṣāt
translated: Because there is no distinction.

original: parasparam anyonyaṃ vahner dhūmo dhūmasyāpi vahniḥ /
analyzed: parasparam anyonyam vahneḥ dhūmaḥ dhūmasya api vahniḥ
translated: Smoke is the effect of fire, and fire is the cause of smoke.

analyzed: kāryam kāraṇam ca syāt
translated: They would be effect and cause of each other.

original: samavāyasya kāryatvakāraṇatvalakṣaṇasya viśeṣād ubhayas tādrūpyamatād rūpyaṃ vā na samaṃ syād ity evaṃ vaditur abhiprāyaḥ /
analyzed: samavāyasya kārya tva kāraṇa tva lakṣaṇasya viśeṣāt ubhayaḥ tādrūpya matāt rūpyam vā na samam syāt iti evam vadituḥ abhiprāyaḥ
translated: The intention of one who speaks thus is that the nature of both would not be the same, because of the difference in the nature of inherence, which is characterized as effect and cause, or because of the similarity of form.

analyzed: athavā sarvatra kāle vastuni akārya kāraṇa bhūte api
translated: Or else, even in a thing that is not an effect or cause at all times,

original: sarvatra vā aṃtaśo mahāsāmānyasya samavāyabhāvān na samavāyabhāvo vibhāvitaḥ /
analyzed: sarvatra vai aṃtaśas mahā sāmānyasya sattāyāḥ samavāya bhāvāt na samavāya bhāvaḥ vibhāvitaḥ
translated: or everywhere, even in the ultimate universal, because of the existence of inherence, the existence of inherence is not manifested.

analyzed: kiṃtu aviśeṣaḥ eva anūditaḥ iti draṣṭavyam
translated: But it should be seen that only the non-difference is stated.

original: nanu nāviśiṣṭaḥ samavāyaḥ kāryatvakāraṇatvalakṣaṇatveneṣṭo 'smākaṃ kiṃtu pūrvottarabhāvābhāvaiśiṣṭa ity āśaṃkyāha pūrveti /
analyzed: nanu na aviśiṣṭaḥ samavāyaḥ kāryatva kāraṇa tva lakṣaṇa tvena iṣṭaḥ smākam kiṃtu pūrva uttara bhāva abhāvaiḥ śiṣṭaḥ iti āśaṃkya āha pūrva iti
translated: But inherence is not accepted by us as non-distinct by being characterized as effect and cause, but rather as distinguished by prior and posterior existence and non-existence.
The prior and posterior things are said to be prior and posterior, delimited by prior and posterior time.

analyzed: tayoḥ yau bhāva abhāvau
translated: The existence and non-existence of those two,

analyzed: pūrva bhāvaḥ eva yat uttarasya bhāvaḥ
translated: the existence of the posterior in the prior itself,

analyzed: eva yaḥ bhāvaḥ bhavitṛ tvam
translated: and the non-existence which is the state of not having existed,

original: purvasyāpi yaḥ svabhāva eva bhāvo bhāvanaṃ sattayābhisaṃbandhakatvaṃ svābhāva eva ca yo 'bhāvo 'bhāvanaṃ samaṃ /
analyzed: yaḥ svabhāvaḥ eva bhāvaḥ bhāvanam sattayā abhisaṃbandhaka tvam sva abhāvaḥ eva ca yaḥ bhāvaḥ bhāvanam samam
translated: The nature of the prior itself is the existence, which is the connection with existence. And the non-existence, which is the non-existence, is the same as the nature.

analyzed: abhāvayitṛ tvam tad viśeṣaṇaḥ samavāyaḥ kārya kāraṇa lakṣaṇam
translated: The inherence qualified by that is the characteristic of cause and effect.

original: etad uktaṃ bhavati yo 'rthāntaraṃ svānvayavyatirekāv anuvidhāpayati /
analyzed: etat uktam bhavati yaḥ ṛthāntaram sva anvaya vyatirekau anuvidhāpayati
translated: This is what is said: That which causes another to conform to its own presence and absence,

original: yaś cārthāntarasyānvayavyatirekāv anuvidhatte eva anvayavyatirekānuvidhāpanā vastunī viśeṣaṇe yasya samavāyasya
analyzed: yaḥ ca artha antarasya anvaya vyatirekau anuvidhatte eva anvaya vyatireka anuvidhāpanā nvaya vyatireka anuvidhāyinī vastunī viśeṣaṇe yasya samavāyasya
translated: and that which causes another to conform to its presence and absence, the conformity to presence and absence is the inherence which is the qualifier in the substance.

analyzed: sa tad viśeṣaṇaḥ
translated: It is qualified by that.

original: p / kāryakāraṇatvalakṣaṇatveneṣta iti na sarvatra tathābhāvaprasaṅga iti /
analyzed: kārya kāraṇa tva lakṣaṇa tvena iṣtaḥ iti na sarvatra tathābhāva prasaṅgaḥ iti
translated: It is accepted as having the characteristic of cause and effect. Therefore, it does not follow that it exists everywhere in that way.

original: anyathā vyākhyānaṃ tv abhāvaśabdasya duryojyatvāt sāhasamitī nānūdyatepi /
analyzed: anyathā vyākhyānam tu abhāva śabdasya duryojya tvāt sāhasamitī na anūdyatā ipi
translated: But the other explanation is not mentioned, because it is difficult to connect the word non-existence and it is rash.

analyzed: etat niṣedhayan āha
translated: Refuting this, he says:

analyzed: ayuktā iti
translated: It is not proper.

analyzed: hetum āha tat iti
translated: He gives the reason: That

analyzed: tena bhāva abhāvavatā pūrva uttara kālena vastunā asaṃbandhāt
translated: Because it is not related to the prior and subsequent entities that have existence and non-existence.

analyzed: ayam arthaḥ viśeṣaṇam vyavacchedakam bhavati
translated: This meaning is the qualifier, the distinguisher.

original: kena saṃbandhena tathābhūte ca vastuni samavāyam imam avacchinno cchinto
analyzed: tatra kena saṃbandhena tathābhūte ca vastuni samavāyam imam
translated: By what relation does this inherence, which is restricted in such a way,

analyzed: yena tat viśeṣaṇam syāt
translated: become the qualifier of that?

original: evam eva ca tathātve sarvaṃ sarvasya viśeṣaṇaṃ syād iti /🔽nanu viśeṣaṇaviśeṣyabhāva eva /
analyzed: evam eva ca tathātve sarvam sarvasya viśeṣaṇam syāt iti  nanu viśeṣaṇa viśeṣya bhāvaḥ eva sambandhaḥ
translated: And if it were so restricted in this way, everything would be the qualifier of everything.🔽But isn't it just the relation of qualifier and qualified?

original: na ca sambandhena sambandhāntarānusaraṇaṃ śreyaṃ ity āśaṃkyāha niratiśayasyeti /
analyzed: na ca sambandhena sambandha antara anusaraṇam śreyam iti āśaṃkya āha niratiśayasya iti
translated: And it is not better to follow another relation through a relation. Anticipating this doubt, he says of what is without excess.

original: niṣkrānto 'tiśayo vyavasthitarūpād viśeṣo yasmān niṣkrānto vātiśayāt /
analyzed: niṣkrāntaḥ atiśayaḥ vyavasthita rūpāt viśeṣaḥ yasmāt niṣkrāntaḥ vā atiśayāt
translated: That from which excess, which is a distinct form, has gone out, or which has gone out from excess.

analyzed: tasya kenacid atiśāyayitum aśakyasya iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is not possible for anyone to surpass it.

analyzed: nitya tvāt ca niratiśaya tvam iti buddhi stham
translated: And because of its eternality, it is understood to be without excess.

original: evaṃ brūvāṇaś caivam abhipraiti viśeṣaṇena tāvad nāvaśyabhāvyam anyathā sarvaṃ sarvasya viśeṣaṇam āpadyeta /🔽tatrānityasya kaścid atiśayam ādadhat kiñcid bhaved api viśeṣaṇam /
analyzed: evam brūvāṇaḥ ca evam abhipraiti viśeṣaṇena tāvat na avaśya bhāvyam anyathā sarvam sarvasya viśeṣaṇam āpadyeta  tatra anityasya kaścid atiśayam ādadhat kiñcid bhavet api viśeṣaṇam
translated: And one who speaks thus intends this: First, there is no necessity for a qualifier, otherwise everything would become the qualifier of everything.🔽There, something that imposes some excess on what is non-eternal might be a qualifier.

original: yadi tatrāpi so 'tiśayaḥ kiṃ tato bhinna utābhinnaḥ /
analyzed: yadi tatra api saḥ tiśayaḥ kim tatas bhinnaḥ uta abhinnaḥ
translated: But even in that case, is that excess different from it or non-different?

original: yadi bhinnas tasya kim āyātam athābhinnas tasyaiva tarhi karaṇam āpatitam iti kaścin na paryanuyuñjīta /
analyzed: yadi bhinnaḥ tasya kim āyātam atha abhinnaḥ tasya eva tarhi karaṇam āpatitam iti kaścid na paryanuyuñjīta
translated: If it is different, what has come to him? If it is non-different, then the instrument would belong to him alone. Therefore, someone would not ask.

analyzed: na tu pūrva apara kālayaḥ nityasya iti
translated: But not for the eternal in the earlier and later times.

original: saṃprati te yady avaśyaṃ viśeṣane asyaiṣṭavye iti nirbandhas tadaitat yuktarūpam ity upaga / / /arbham upadarśayann āha tayor eva veti /
analyzed: saṃprati te yadi avaśyam viśeṣane asya eṣṭavye iti nirbandhaḥ tadā etat yukta rūpam iti upaga arbham upadarśayan āha tayoḥ eva vā iti
translated: If you are insistent that this distinction must be accepted, then this is appropriate. Accepting this, he shows it by saying of those two alone.

original: vāśabdo 'bhyupagataṃ pakṣāntaraṃ darśayati /🔽tayor anvayavyatirekānuvidhāpanānvayavyatirekānuvidhāyinos tadviśeṣaṇayos tallakṣaṇatā kāryakāraṇalakṣaṇatāstu
analyzed: vā śabdaḥ bhyupagatam pakṣa antaram darśayati  tayoḥ anvaya vyatireka anuvidhāpana anvaya vyatireka anuvidhāyinoḥ tad viśeṣaṇayoḥ tad lakṣaṇa tā kārya kāraṇa lakṣaṇa tā astu
translated: The word or shows an accepted alternative view.🔽Of those two, which follow concomitance and non-concomitance, those two characteristics, which are the characteristics of cause and effect, should be.

original: tayor eva pramāṇopapannatvād itarasya ca tadbādhitatvād ity āśayaḥ /
analyzed: tayoḥ eva pramāṇa upapanna tvāt itarasya ca tad bādhita tvāt iti āśayaḥ
translated: Because those two are established by valid means of knowledge, and the other is contradicted by them. This is the idea.

analyzed: itiḥ anantara uktam pratyavamṛṣati
translated: Iti refers back to what was just said.

analyzed: evam abhiprāyavatā vārtika kṛtā iti prakaraṇāt
translated: By one who has this intention, by the author of the Vārtika is understood from the context.

original: agnīndhanādy eva sāmagrītyantarnītaniyamaḥ samāsaḥ kartavyo 'ta evāmūṃ niyamam asahamānasya matam āśaṃkya tannirākurvann
analyzed: agni indhana ādi eva sāmagrī iti antar nīta niyamaḥ samāsaḥ te eva amūm niyamam asahamānasya bhina sāmagrī vādinaḥ matam āśaṃkya tat nirākurvan
translated: The collection of fuel and so on alone - the restrictive compound should be understood as implied. Therefore, suspecting the view of one who cannot accept this restriction, refuting that,🔽he says the collection of fuel and so on alone is the cause.

analyzed: āha na ca iti
translated: He says: No.

analyzed: anyathā kutas sya pratyākhyāna granthasya utthānam syāt iti
translated: Otherwise, how could this text of rejection arise?

analyzed: svarūpataḥ eva apara sāmagrī nirapekṣeṇa eva rūpeṇa
translated: By its own nature alone, independently of other conditions.

analyzed: kārye janayitavye yatas śakti vyāghātāt
translated: In the effect to be produced, from which there is an obstruction of power.

analyzed: nipātaḥ tena anyat iti ārthaḥ
translated: The particle 'tu' (but) has the meaning of 'anyat' (another).

original: sāmagry api janayantī kiṃ sāmagryantarasavyapekṣā janayaty athānapekṣā /
analyzed: sāmagrī api janayantī kim sāmagrī antara sa vyapekṣā janayati atha anapekṣā
translated: Even though the collection produces, does it produce in dependence on another collection, or independently?

original: yadi tarhi saivānvayavyatirekābhyāṃ janikā syād ādyasāmagryāstu janakatvaṃ harītakiṃ prāpya devatā recayantīty
analyzed: yadi tarhi sā eva anvaya vyatirekābhyām janikā syāt ādya sāmagryāḥ tu janaka tvam harītakim prāpya devatāḥ recayanti iti
translated: If so, then by the method of agreement and difference, it would be the producer, but the first collection's status as a producer would be like the gods laughing after obtaining the haritaki fruit.

analyzed: anena tulyam syāt
translated: It would be like that.

original: ayadyanirapekṣā tadvadabhāvopi svahetulakṣaṇasāmarthyas tannirapekṣa eva kiṃ na janayatīty api dūṣaṇam iha draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: ayadi anirapekṣā tadvat abhāvaḥ api sva hetu lakṣaṇa sāmarthyaḥ tad nirapekṣaḥ eva kim na janayati iti api dūṣaṇam iha draṣṭavyam
translated: If it is independent, then why does non-existence, like it, not produce its effect independently of its own cause and characteristics? This fault should also be seen here.

analyzed: na ca sāmagrī tatas bhedena upalabhyate
translated: And the collection is not perceived as different from that.

analyzed: na ca asyāḥ anupalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāpta tā api pūrvavat draṣṭavyam
translated: And its non-apprehension should be seen as before.

original: p / anvayo 'nvetṛtvam anvīyamānatvaṃ ca vyatireko vyatirecayitṛtvaṃ vyatiricyamānatvaṃ ca tāvātmānau yasya tasya / /
analyzed: anvayaḥ nvetṛ tvam anvīyamāna tvam ca vyatirekaḥ vyatirecayitṛ tvam vyatiricyamāna tvam ca tau ātmānau yasya tasya
translated: The two natures of which it is the possessor are: positive concomitance, i.e., being the concomitant, and being that which is to be concomitantly known; and negative concomitance, i.e., being the distinguisher, and being that which is to be distinguished.

analyzed: ye mīmāṃsaka ādayaḥ
translated: Those who are Mīmāṃsakas and others.

analyzed: tam
translated: That ascertainment of positive concomitance.

original: tasya svakāraṇāvyabhicāradvāraka / ity ācakṣāṇo yasyārthāntarasya yenānvayaḥ

translated: Saying by means of the invariable relation with its own cause, he points out that the positive concomitance of a certain other object with a certain [object]

original: sakalalokasākṣikaḥ so 'vaśyaṃ tajjanyas tatkāraṇajanyo pratipādayati ataeva🔽kāryakāraṇabhāvād vā ity atrāpi tena samaṃ tatkāraṇena samaṃ vā kāryakāraṇabhāvād
analyzed: sakala loka sākṣikaḥ saḥ vaśyam tad janyaḥ tad kāraṇa janyaḥ pratipādayati ataeva  kārya kāraṇa bhāvāt vā iti atra api tena samam tad kāraṇena samam vā kārya kāraṇa bhāvāt
translated: which is witnessed by the entire world must necessarily be produced by that [object], i.e., it is produced by the cause of that [object]. For this very reason,

analyzed: iti veditavyam iti
translated: in or by the relation of cause and effect, it should be understood that [the relation of cause and effect] is the same as that [cause], i.e., it is the relation of cause and effect with that cause.

original: tatra svabhāvahetvādau viparyayeṇa bādhakapramāṇavṛttyādy eva darśitaṃ tat tu katham anvayaniścaya ukta / ucyata ity āśaṃkyāha svabhāve /ti
analyzed: tatra svabhāva hetu ādau viparyayeṇa bādhaka pramāṇa vṛtti ādi eva darśitam tat tu katham anvaya niścayaḥ uktaḥ ucyate iti āśaṃkya āha
translated: There, in the case of the reason based on nature and so on, the operation of the contradictory means of valid knowledge has been shown, but how is that said to be the ascertainment of positive concomitance? Anticipating this question, he says by nature and so on.

original: viparyaye / sādhyaviparyaye hetor viparītotthāpakaṃ yat pramāṇaṃ tasya vṛttyā / sādhyasādhanayoḥ tannibandhanatvāt /
analyzed: viparyaye sādhya viparyaye hetoḥ bādhakam viparīta utthāpakam yat pramāṇam tasya vṛttyā sādhya sādhanayoḥ tad nibandhana tvāt
translated: In the case of the contradictory of the probandum, the means of valid knowledge that produces the contradictory of the reason, by the operation of that [means of valid knowledge], because the probandum and the probans are based on that [means of valid knowledge].

analyzed: anvaya niścayasya iti prakaraṇāt
translated: [The means of valid knowledge] of the ascertainment of positive concomitance, from the context.

analyzed: uttaratra api evam draṣṭavyam
translated: This should be seen in the same way in the following [cases] as well.

original: tadbhāvasiddheḥ tanmātravṛttisiddhes taddhetukatvāt /🔽asadvyavahārasya hi dṛśyānupalabdhimātre vṛttau siddhāyāṃ deśakālānavacchedena yatra
analyzed: tad bhāva siddheḥ tad mātra vṛtti siddheḥ tad hetuka tvāt  asat vyavahārasya hi dṛśya anupalabdhi mātre vṛttau siddhāyām deśa kāla anavacchedena yatra
translated: Because of the establishment of its existence, because of the establishment of its occurrence only in that [non-existence], because of its being the cause of that [non-existence].

analyzed: yatra upalabdhi lakṣaṇa anupalabdhiḥ tatra tatra asat vyavahāra yogya tā iti anvaya niścaya pravṛtteḥ
translated: For when the occurrence of the mere non-apprehension of the visible in the convention of non-existence is established without restriction of place and time, wherever there is non-apprehension characterized by apprehension, there it is suitable for the convention of non-existence, and the ascertainment of the concomitance [of non-existence with non-apprehension] is the cause of the occurrence [of the convention of non-existence].
Because of the establishment of its existence as the cause, and because of the establishment of its being the cause of the proof that establishes the absence of another cause.

analyzed: te na kāraṇa vyāpaka anupalabdhī
translated: Those are not the non-apprehensions of the cause and the pervader.

analyzed: tad abhāva siddhi hetu tvāt ca
translated: The proof of existence🔽and because of being the cause of the establishment of its non-existence.

analyzed: sādhya abhāve hetu abhāvasya
translated: Of that. Of the absence of the reason in the absence of the probandum.

original: tadbhāvasiddhi /s tatsvabhāvatāsiddhis tataḥ tādātmyatad utpattilakṣaṇe nimitte yasya pratibaddhatvasya tasya niścayāt
analyzed: tad svabhāva tā siddhiḥ tatas tādātmya tat utpatti lakṣaṇe nimitte yasya pratibandhasya pratibaddha tvasya tasya niścayāt
translated: The establishment of its existence. The establishment of its nature. Because of the ascertainment of that which is restricted by the reason characterized by identity and origination.

original: tasmād utpattis tatkāraṇād votpattis tadutpattir abhipretā /
analyzed: tasmāt utpattiḥ tad kāraṇāt vā utpattiḥ tad utpattiḥ abhipretā
translated: Origination from that. Origination from that cause. Origination from that is intended.

analyzed: anupalabdhyoḥ kāraṇa vyāpaka anupalabdhyoḥ iti prakaraṇāt
translated: Of the two non-apprehensions. Of the non-apprehensions of the cause and the pervader. From the context.

original: kadā punas tadviśeṣaṇaṃ nopekṣituṃ śakyata ity āha yadeti / /
analyzed: kadā punar tat viśeṣaṇam na upekṣitum śakyate iti āha yadā iti
translated: When again can that qualification not be ignored? He says: when it is stated.

original: upādatte / nidarśanīyatvena svīkaroti pratipādaka iti prakaraṇāt /

analyzed: asiddha tvāt
translated: Because it is not established.

analyzed: saṃdigdha asiddha tvāt iti draṣtavyam
translated: It should be seen that it is doubtful whether it is not established.

analyzed: tat sādhya abhāve bhāva khyāpanam
translated: That is, the statement of the absence of the probandum in the absence of the probandum.

original: tādātmyatadutpattisiddhau hi plavamānākārāyāḥ sādhyābhāve sādhanābhāvapratipatter utpattir ity āśayaḥ /
analyzed: tādātmya tad utpatti siddhau hi plavamāna ākārāyāḥ sādhya abhāve sādhana abhāva pratipatteḥ utpattiḥ iti āśayaḥ
translated: The idea is that the cognition of the absence of the means of knowledge in the absence of the probandum arises from the floating form, when the identity and origination are established.

analyzed: amum eva artham tathā hītvā ādinā prasādhayati
translated: He proves this very meaning with the words tatha hi (for thus) and so on.

original: phalavacanasya kāryaśabdasya napūṃsakaliṅgatvād asati bahuvrīhāvajahalliṅgatvāc ca kārya /m iti /
analyzed: phala vacanasya kārya śabdasya napūṃsaka liṅga tvāt asati bahuvrīhau ajahat liṅga tvāt ca iti
translated: Because the word karam (effect) in the statement of the result is not of the neuter gender, and because of the absence of the bahuvrihi compound, it is an effect.

analyzed: tad bhāvatāḥ
translated: The state of that.
Not helpful, not doing anything.

analyzed: pratibandha virahitāt vipakṣe darśanāt kevalāt
translated: Mere non-perception, from that which is devoid of the relation, from mere non-perception in the contrary case.

analyzed: tad asaṃbhavam vyatireka asambhavam
translated: The impossibility of that, the impossibility of the negative concomitance.

analyzed: tam eva p
translated: He explains that very thing with tatha hi (for thus) and so on.

original: sādhyābhāvād anyasya tadanupalabdhikāraṇasyābhāvāt ekatra sthitasyāpi tadanupalabdhirastīty abhāva eva kiṃ na bhavatīty āśaṃkyāha
analyzed: sādhya abhāvāt anyasya tad anupalabdhi kāraṇasya abhāvāt ekatra sthitasya api tad anupalabdhiḥ asti iti abhāvaḥ eva kim na bhavati iti āśaṃkya āha deśa ityādi
translated: Because the object of negation is absent, and because there is no other cause of its non-apprehension, even when it is present in one place, there is non-apprehension of it, so why is it not just non-existence? Suspecting this, he says

translated: The word ādi includes time.

translated: There, even when the subject exists, even when the reason exists, mere non-apprehension, mere absence of apprehension,

original: na tathāvidho vyatireko 'bhipreta ity āha tathāvidhasyai /veti /
analyzed: na tathāvidhaḥ vyatirekaḥ bhipretaḥ iti āha
translated: such a vyatireka is not intended, so he says of just that kind.

original: nanv adarśanamātrād vyatirekam icchatām uktena nyāyena tadasaṃbhava eva darśitaḥ /🔽pratibandham antareṇa darśanamātrād anvayam icchatāṃ tu na tadabhāvo bhāvito '
analyzed: nanu adarśana mātrāt vyatirekam icchatām uktena nyāyena tad asaṃbhavaḥ eva darśitaḥ  pratibandham antareṇa darśana mātrāt anvayam icchatām tu na tad abhāvaḥ
translated: But for those who desire vyatireka from mere non-apprehension, the impossibility of that has been shown by the stated reasoning.🔽But for those who desire anvaya from mere perception without a restriction, the absence of that is not considered.

original: cāsau avinābhāvaniyamo 'darśanānna na darśanāt Pra /Vā / / ity atrābhidhānād
analyzed: ca asau avinābhāva niyamaḥ darśanāt na na darśanāt iti atra abhidhānāt
translated: And that restriction of non-existence has been stated in the expression not from non-perception, but from perception in the verse.

original: ity āśaṃkyānantarodita evāyam artha iti darśayitum āha anvayaniścayo /pīti /
analyzed: iti āśaṃkya anantara uditaḥ eva ayam arthaḥ iti darśayitum āha anvaya niścayaḥ
translated: Suspecting this, in order to show that this very meaning has been stated immediately before, he says certainty of anvaya, too.

analyzed: tena api pratibandha nibandhana anvaya niścaya vacanena api
translated: Even by that, even by the statement of the certainty of anvaya based on restriction,

translated: The basis of the perception is to be supplied from the context as the mere perception in a similar instance.

analyzed: asya api
translated: Of this, the positive concomitance also.

analyzed: na anvayam icchāmaḥ yena evam abhidhīyate
translated: We do not desire the positive concomitance by which this is stated.

original: kiṃtu bhūyodarśanād ity āśaṃkyāha na ceti / /
analyzed: kiṃtu bhūyas darśanāt iti āśaṃkya āha na ca iti
translated: But fearing that it might be suspected that it is due to repeated observation, he says: And if it is not so...

original: evam upalakṣaṇatvād asya nādarśanamātrād vyatirekam icchāmo 'pi tu bhūyodarśanād ity api draṣṭavyam eva /
analyzed: evam upalakṣaṇa tvāt asya na adarśana mātrāt vyatirekam tu bhūyas darśanāt iti api draṣṭavyam eva
translated: Thus, because it is a mere indication, we do not desire the negative concomitance merely from non-observation, but also from repeated observation, this should also be seen.

analyzed: bhūyas darśana gamyā hi ślovā
translated: For the negative concomitance is to be understood from repeated observation.

original: ity asya śeṣanirdeśenāpi gamayitum aśakyatvād vyāptir a /nvayātmiketi /
analyzed: iti asya śeṣa nirdeśena api gamayitum aśakya tvāt vyāptiḥ
translated: And because it cannot be understood even by the explanation of the remainder of this, the pervasion is of the nature of positive concomitance.

original: bhavatopi mahānasamahāhradādau bhuyodarśanādarśanābhyāṃ kim anyad vyāptinimittam astīty āha asatī /ti /
analyzed: bhavataḥ api mahānasa mahāhrada ādau bhuyaḥ darśana adarśanābhyām kim anyat vyāpti nimittam asti iti āha
translated: What other cause of pervasion is there for you, other than repeated observation and non-observation in a great river or a great lake? He says: If it is not...

original: pratibandhanibandhanābhyām eva tābhyāṃ sā siddhyati nānyathety anena darśitam /

original: kvacid deśe bahulaṃ / pracuraṃ yathā bhavati tathā dṛṣṭānāṃ / sāhacaryeṇopalabdhānām āmalakatvakaṣāyarasatvādīnāṃ /

translated: In some place, it is seen to be abundant, as much as it occurs, of those that are seen, that are perceived by association, such as the properties of the āmalaka fruit, astringent taste, and so on.
Because sweetness, etc. can also occur through the addition of milk, etc.

original: sambhāvanāyā avakāśaṃ darśayituṃ tad asaṃbhave / iti /
analyzed: sambhāvanāyāḥ avakāśam darśayitum tat asaṃbhave iti
translated: In order to show the possibility of supposition, he says in the absence of that.

analyzed: tasya anyathātvasya asaṃbhave bhāve

original: evam upalakṣaṇatvād asya sādhyabhāve bhūyodarśanepi na vyatirekātmikā vyāptiḥ siddhyati /

analyzed: bahulam sādhya abhāve bhāvinām upalambhe api saṃbhavāt
translated: Because it is possible to observe the absence of those which do not occur in the presence of the probandum in some cases.

analyzed: tad asambhava bādhaka pramāṇa abhāvāt iti api draṣṭavyam
translated: It should also be seen that there is no evidence that contradicts the impossibility of that.

original: tathāhi madhurarasatvābhāve 'mbhastvasya sādhanadharmasyābhāvaḥ sādhyadharmiṇaḥ sāmudrād ambhaso 'nyatra sarvatra dṛśyata iti bhūyodarśanepi
analyzed: tathā hi madhura rasa tva abhāve mbhaḥ tvasya sādhana dharmasya abhāvaḥ sādhya dharmiṇaḥ sāmudrāt ambhasaḥ nyatra sarvatra dṛśyate iti bhūyas darśane api
translated: For example, in the absence of sweetness, the absence of the proving property of being water is seen everywhere except in the water of the ocean, which is the subject of the probandum. Thus, even in frequent observation,

analyzed: lavaṇa udadhau eva anyathātvam dṛṣṭam iti

original: anyathāmbhastvam api mahārṇavāmbhaso samyagdhetur abhyavagantavyaḥ prasajyeta /
analyzed: anyathā ambhaḥ tvam api mahā arṇava ambhasaḥ samyak hetuḥ abhyavagantavyaḥ prasajyeta

analyzed: bādhaka abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no contradiction.

analyzed: kārya vyāpya abhāva vyatireke sati
translated: If there were the absence of the effect and the pervaded, it would be so.

analyzed: nibandha nāma s  tādātmya tad utpatti lakṣaṇa pratibandha dvaya niścayaḥ yaḥ eva sa ca upāyaḥ sā viparyaye
translated: The bond is

original: bādhakapramāṇavṛttiḥ iti vacanāt pratyakṣānupalambhasādhanaḥ p / iti ca darśitaḥ /
analyzed: bādhaka pramāṇa vṛttiḥ iti vacanāt pratyakṣa anupalambha sādhanaḥ iti ca darśitaḥ
translated: the ascertainment of the two kinds of relation characterized by identity and origination. That itself is the means. That is the operation of the sublating means of valid knowledge in the contrary case. Thus it has been shown that it is established by perception and non-apprehension.

original: iti /s tasmāt pṛthag noktaḥ / bhedenanokta ācāryeṇeti prakaraṇāt /
analyzed: tasmāt pṛthak na uktaḥ bhedena na uktaḥ ācāryeṇa iti prakaraṇāt
translated: Therefore, it is not stated separately. It is not stated separately by the teacher, due to the context.

original: pratibandhasiddhāv api kathaṃ kāraṇavyāpakānupalabdhyor anvayavyetirekau prasiddhyata ity āśaṃkya etad evopapādayann āha tathāhi /tyādi🔽kāryavyāpyābhāvavyatireke sati kiṃrūpe tasminn ity āhatallakṣaṇa iti /

translated: Even when the relation is established, how are the positive and negative concomitances of the non-apprehension of the cause and the pervader known? analyzed: vyatiricyate asaṃbhavati

analyzed: katham vyatiricyate iti āha

analyzed: yadi api darśayati
translated: If it is so, etc., he also shows another reason.

analyzed: kārya hetu prasaṅgāt kāryāt api anyat uktam
translated: It is said that because of the connection with the effect, it is different from the effect.

original: rohiṇyā rohiṇīnakṣatrasya āsattir udeṣyamāṇāyāḥ pratyāsannatā tasyāḥ klṛptiḥ / kalpanājñānam iti yāvat /
analyzed: rohiṇyāḥ rohiṇī nakṣatrasya āsattiḥ udeṣyamāṇāyāḥ pratyāsanna tā tasyāḥ klṛptiḥ kalpanā jñānam iti yāvat
translated: The proximity of Rohini, the constellation Rohini, of the rising one, the nearness, its determination, the conceptual cognition, is what is meant.

original: sāpi / tatkalpanā uktatvād i /ty etaj pratyuktatvenoktam arthād ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: sā api tad kalpanā uktatvāt etat jātīyam pratyuktatvena uktam arthāt iti arthaḥ
translated: That too, because it was stated as the determination of that, it is said that this was stated by implication, this is the meaning.

analyzed: kṛtaka tvā s
translated: The produced nature

original: kathaṃ punas tasyās tadudayānantaram udayo 'vaśyaṃbhāvī saṃgacchata ity āśaṃkyopasaṃhāravyājenāha tasmād i /ti /
analyzed: katham punar tasyāḥ tad udaya anantaram udayaḥ vaśyaṃbhāvī saṃgacchate iti āśaṃkya upasaṃhāra vyājena āha tasmāt
translated: How then is it proper that its arising after that is necessarily to be accepted? Suspecting this, he says therefore by way of a conclusion.

analyzed: kṛttikā ākhya sapta tārā vṛndasya iti prakaraṇāt avaseyam
translated: Of the circle of stars, of the group of seven stars called Krittika, is to be understood from the context.

original: saṃkrāntiḥ / pūrvāvasthānadeśāt saṃkramaṇam abhivyaktyavasthāprāptir vā tasyā🔽hetur kālavyavadhānene /ti kiyatkālakṣepeṇeti draṣṭavyam kalpayitavya /s
analyzed: saṃkrāntiḥ pūrva avasthāna deśāt saṃkramaṇam abhivyakti avasthā prāptiḥ vā tasyāḥ  hetuḥ kiyat kāla kṣepeṇa iti draṣṭavyam
translated: A saṃkrānti is a transition from a previous location, or the attainment of a state of manifestation. Its🔽cause is by temporal obstruction, that is, in how much time should it be considered.

analyzed: tad hetu tvena iti prakaraṇāt
translated: It is the cause of that, is to be understood from the context.

analyzed: anena tatra api pratibandha sadbhāvaḥ darśitaḥ
translated: By this, the existence of an invariable relation there is also shown.

original: nīḍānupaghāte satyanutrastānāṃ gṛhītāṇḍānāṃ pipīlikānām ekadigabhimukhānāṃ sañcaraṇaṃ
analyzed: nīḍa anupaghāte sati anutrastānām gṛhīta aṇḍānām pipīlikānām eka diś abhimukhānām sañcaraṇam
translated: When there is no harm to the nest, the movement in one direction of the ants that have taken up eggs and are not frightened,

original: dṛṣṭvā yad varṣānumānaṃ tad apy asati pratibandhe sa ghaṭate tasmāt tatrāpīyam eva
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā yat varṣa anumānam tat api asati pratibandhe sa ghaṭate tasmāt tatra api iyam eva
translated: when that is seen, the inference of rain from that also occurs when there is no invariable relation. Therefore, the same🔽method is shown here also.

analyzed: gatiḥ iti darśayitum darśayati
translated: In order to show this, he shows it with the words just as.

analyzed: itarathā vivāda adhyāsita sattvāt asya katham dṛṣṭānta rūpa tā upapadyeta
translated: Otherwise, how could this, being the subject of dispute, be established as an example?

analyzed: bhūtānām pṛthivī ādīnām saṃkṣobhaḥ
translated: The agitation of the elements, such as earth, is a particular state.

original: ya eva tathābhūtapīpilikāsaṃkṣobhahetuḥ sa eva katipayakālavyavadhānena paścātkālabhāvino varṣasya hetur ity 'rthād draṣṭavyaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ eva tathābhūta pīpilikā saṃkṣobha hetuḥ saḥ eva katipaya kāla vyavadhānena paścātkāla bhāvinaḥ varṣasya hetuḥ iti rthāt draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: The cause of the disturbance of the ant at that time is to be seen as the cause of the rain that will occur after some time has passed.

original: kāraṇakāraṇatayā ca hetur draṣṭavyo 'nyathā cirātītaṃ kāraṇam iṣṭaṃ p / syād eṣtavyam vā /
analyzed: kāraṇa kāraṇa tayā ca hetuḥ draṣṭavyaḥ nyathā cira atītam kāraṇam iṣṭam syāt eṣtavyam vā
translated: And the cause is to be seen as the cause of the cause, otherwise the desired cause that has passed a long time would have to be accepted or not accepted.

original: iti /s tasmāt hetoḥ kṛttikodayasya hetor yo dharmaḥ / katipayakālātyayena rohiṇyudayopādānakāraṇaśaktiprabodhādhānenānyathā vā yajjanakatvaṃ
analyzed: tasmāt hetoḥ kṛttikā udayasya hetoḥ yaḥ dharmaḥ katipaya kāla atyayena rohiṇī udaya upādāna kāraṇa śakti prabodha ādhānena anyathā vā yat janaka tvam
translated: Therefore, the property of the cause of the appearance of Kṛttikā, either by the manifestation of the power to produce the appearance of Rohiṇī after some time has passed, or in some other way,

analyzed: tad anumānena
translated: that is to be inferred as the cause.

analyzed: tṛtīyā
translated: The third.

original: kalpayitavyā / rohiṇyāsatti kalpanety abhisambandhāt strīliṅgena nirdeśaḥ /🔽dṛśyatvaviśeṣaṇānavacchinnānupalabdhir anupalabdhimātram / /
analyzed: kalpayitavyā rohiṇī āsatti kalpanā iti abhisambandhāt strī liṅgena nirdeśaḥ  dṛśya tva viśeṣaṇa anavacchinna anupalabdhiḥ anupalabdhi mātram
translated: The connection is to be imagined as the proximity of Rohiṇī. The feminine form is used because of the connection.🔽Non-apprehension not qualified by the qualification of visibility is mere non-apprehension.

original: abhāvāyogād i /ty abhāvaviṣayatvāyogād iti draṣṭavyaṃ taddvāreṇa / viruddhopalabdhimukhena /
analyzed: abhāva ayogāt abhāva viṣaya tva ayogāt iti draṣṭavyam tad dvāreṇa viruddha upalabdhi mukhena
translated: It should be seen as because of the impossibility of being related to non-existence, meaning because of the impossibility of having non-existence as its object, by that means, through the door of the apprehension of the contradictory.

original: evaṃ bruvāṇaḥ saiva virodhagrahaṇakālapravrttā dṛśyānupalabdhir idānīṃ /
analyzed: evam bruvāṇaḥ sā eva virodha grahaṇa kāla pravrttā dṛśya anupalabdhiḥ idānīm
translated: Saying this, the same non-apprehension of the visible that occurred at the time of grasping the contradiction is now.

original: tatsmārakatvena copalambhasyāsyaikajñānasaṃsargivastvantarānavacchinnasyānupalabdhirūpatā ata evoktaṃ prayogaḥ kevalaṃ bhinnaḥ sarvatrārtho
analyzed: tad smāraka tvena ca upalambhasya asya eka jñāna saṃsargi vastu antara anavacchinnasya anupalabdhi rūpa tā atas eva uktam prayogaḥ kevalam bhinnaḥ sarvatra arthaḥ
translated: And because it is a reminder of that, this perception, not delimited by another thing that is in conjunction with the same cognition, has the nature of non-perception. For this very reason, it is said that the argument is only different in every case, the meaning is not different.

analyzed: na bhidyate
translated: It is not different.

analyzed: iti abhipraiti
translated: This is the intention.

original: atra ca yathā prajñākaraguptena parākrāntaṃ tathāsmābhirdharmottarapradīpe
analyzed: atra ca yathā prajñākaraguptena parākrāntam tathā asmābhiḥ dharmottara pradīpe
translated: And here, just as it was undertaken by Prajñākaragupta, it is shown by us in the Dharṃoत्तरप्रदीप.

analyzed: darśitam iti na iha ucyate
translated: Therefore, it is not stated here.

original: anyathā / yadi taddvāre neṣyate /🔽aniṣiddhānyabhāve saty apratiṣiddhānivāritopalabdhir yasyānyabhāvepi sā tattvata ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: anyathā yadi na iṣyate  aniṣiddha anyabhāve sati apratiṣiddha anivārita upalabdhiḥ yasya anyabhāve pi sā tattvataḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: Otherwise, if it is not accepted through that,🔽when the other absence is not prohibited, the non-prohibited, unobstructed perception of which is so in reality even in the presence of another absence, this is the meaning.

analyzed: abhāva asiddheḥ abhāva ayogāt iti yāvat
translated: Because the absence is not established, because the absence is not ascertained, because the absence is not possible, this is the extent.

original: samudāyasya sādhyatvāt katham asau sādhya ity āha avayava / iti /
analyzed: samudāyasya sādhya tvāt katham asau sādhyaḥ iti āha avayavaḥ iti
translated: Because the collection is to be established, how is it to be established? He says: the part.

analyzed: sambandhi antarasya anupādānāt
translated: Because another related thing is not mentioned.

analyzed: kasya asau svabhāvaḥ vasātavyaḥ iti āha
translated: Whose nature is to be ascertained? He says:

analyzed: tad mātrāt anvayi tvam api tasya saṃbhāvyate
translated: From that alone, the nature of following is also possible for it.

original: tato viśiṣyata ity āha yo hīti / /
analyzed: tatas viśiṣyate iti āha yaḥ hi iti
translated: Therefore, it is distinguished. He says: He who...

original: yadi nāma na vyabhicāras tathāpi kasmād viśeṣaṇaṃ nopapadyate ity āha saṃbhava / iti /
analyzed: yadi nāma na vyabhicāraḥ tathā api kasmāt viśeṣaṇam na upapadyate iti āha saṃbhavaḥ iti
translated: Even if there is no contradiction, why is the qualification not established? He says: possible.

analyzed: para matam apekṣate iti para mata apekṣam īkṣi kṣamibhyām cepa avā
translated: It depends on the opinion of others, so it is dependent on the opinion of others. I and kṣa are the roots.

analyzed: ti karma upapade ṇaḥ
translated: Aṇ is added to the root.

original: parepi kim evam eṣitaro na bhavaṃti yena tanmatāpekṣam idam ucyate naiyāyike /ti /
analyzed: pare api kim evam na bhavanti yena tad mata apekṣam idam ucyate  /
translated: Do others not also seek in this way, by which this is said to be dependent on their opinion, not on the Naiyāyikas?

original: vegākhyasaṃskāravatā dravyeṇa mudgarādinā yaḥ saṃyogā /khyo guṇas tasmād avayaveṣu ghaṭādidravyārambhakeṣu kapālādiṣu /
analyzed: vega ākhya saṃskāravatā dravyeṇa mudgara ādinā yaḥ guṇaḥ tasmāt avayaveṣu ghaṭa ādi dravya ārambhakeṣu kapāla ādiṣu
translated: The quality called conjunction, which is produced by a substance having the impetus called momentum, such as a hammer, from that [conjunction], in the parts that produce the substance such as a pot, such as the potsherds,

original: karmāṇi kriyābahuvacanena vyāptim upadarśayati na tu bahutvasaṃkhyām eva /
analyzed: karmāṇi kriyā bahuvacanena vyāptim upadarśayati na tu bahu tva saṃkhyām eva
translated: he shows the pervasion by the plural of actions, not just the number of many.

analyzed: saṃyogasya aikye kriyāyāḥ api ekasyāḥ bhāvāt
translated: Because even if there is one conjunction, there is only one action.

original: yathā vegavat kuvalayadale āme vā ghaṭe /
analyzed: yathā vegavat kuvalaya dale āme vā ghaṭe
translated: Just as in a swift lotus leaf or an unbaked pot.

analyzed: tathā api kriyā praṇālikayā dravya nāśaḥ sti eva iti
translated: Nevertheless, there is indeed destruction of the substance by the channel of action.

analyzed: tebhyaḥ karmabhyah
translated: From those actions,

analyzed: tad dravya ārambhakāṇām dravya ārambhaka saṃyoga pratidvandvī vibhāga ākhyaḥ guṇaḥ utpadyate
translated: the quality called disjunction, which is the opposite of the conjunction that produces the substance, arises in the parts that produce that substance.

original: tato / vibhāgāt saṃyogavināśo dravyārambhakasya saṃyogasya vināśaḥ /
analyzed: tatas vibhāgāt saṃyoga vināśaḥ dravya ārambhakasya saṃyogasya vināśaḥ
translated: Then, from the separation, there is the destruction of conjunction, the destruction of the conjunction that is the cause of the substance.

analyzed: tatas
translated: Then,

original: tenāvayavasamyogenāsamavāyikāraṇena yad ārabdhaṃ dravyaṃ tad vinaśyati /
analyzed: tena avayava samyogena asamavāyi kāraṇena yat ārabdham dravyam tat vinaśyati
translated: the substance that is produced by that part-conjunction, which is the non-inherent cause, is destroyed.

original: dvedhā hi dravyasya nāśo vaiśeṣikādibhir abhyupeyate āśrayavināśād asamavāyikāraṇavināśāc ca /
analyzed: dvedhā hi dravyasya nāśaḥ vaiśeṣika ādibhiḥ abhyupeyate āśraya vināśāt asamavāyi kāraṇa vināśāt ca
translated: For the destruction of a substance is accepted by the Vaiśeṣika and others to be twofold: from the destruction of the substratum and from the destruction of the non-inherent cause.

analyzed: atra ca asamavāyi kāraṇasya asya saṃyogasya vināśāt
translated: And here, from the destruction of this conjunction, which is the non-inherent cause.

analyzed: kārya grahaṇena tu vāstavam rūpam
translated: But by mentioning the effect, the real form [is stated].

original: na tu tadārabdhaṃ cākāryañcāsti yad vyavacchidyate /
analyzed: na tu tad ārabdham ca akāryam ca asti yat vyavacchidyate
translated: And there is neither that which is produced nor that which is not produced, which is excluded.

analyzed: yadi kārya tvena eva tat naśyati
