analyzed: na api ṣaṇṇām kiñcid sāmānyam asti yasya api abhidhyāt abhidhānāt a
translated: There is some common property of the six, by the designation of which,

analyzed: yam api ubhaya pada vyabhicāraḥ varṇyate
translated: this deviation of both words is described.

original: na ca yācakaśabdena karmāpi tajjātir api vābhidhīyate /
analyzed: na ca yācaka śabdena karma api tad jātiḥ api vā abhidhīyate
translated: And the word beggar does not denote either the action or the class.

analyzed: atra ca upapattiḥ anyatra abhihitā iti nā ucyate
translated: And here, since the proof has been stated elsewhere, it is not mentioned.

analyzed: na ca ākāśa dravyam
translated: And it is not the substance of space.
It is a universal.

analyzed: yācaka puruṣaḥ ityādi karmadhārayaḥ samāsaḥ na dṛśyate
translated: The karmadhāraya compound is seen in expressions like the person who begs and so on.

original: kiñ ca yathā pṛthivīśabdena pṛthivī pṛthivītvañ cocyata ity ubhayapadavyabhicārāt pṛthivīdravyam iti yujyate vaktum /
analyzed: kim ca yathā pṛthivī śabdena pṛthivī pṛthivī tvam ca ucyate iti ubhaya pada vyabhicārāt pṛthivī dravyam iti yujyate vaktum
translated: Moreover, just as the word earth is used to refer to both the earth and earthness, since both terms are used, it is appropriate to say the substance earth.

analyzed: tathā nāntarīyaka tvam nāntarīuakaḥ ca
translated: Similarly, inseparability and the inseparable are used.

original: arthaśabdenāpy arthatvam arthaś cocyata ity ubhayapadavyabhicārādyuktārtha eva samāsaḥ /🔽atha tvanmate nārthatvādy asti /
analyzed: artha śabdena api artha tvam arthaḥ ca ucyate iti ubhaya pada vyabhicāra ādi ukta arthaḥ eva samāsaḥ  atha tvad mate na artha tva ādi asti
translated: By the word object, both objectness and the object are referred to. Since both terms are used, it is appropriate to compound only the object.🔽But if, according to your view, objectness and so on do not exist,

original: yadi nāma vāstavaṃ nāsti tathāpi kalpitaṃ tāvad asti /
analyzed: yadi nāma vāstavam nā asti tathā api kalpitam tāvat asti
translated: even if they do not exist in reality, they do exist as imagined.

original: tāvatāpi śabdasiddhyupapatter uktaprāyam etad iti kiṃ bahunā /
analyzed: tāvatā api śabda siddhi upapatteḥ ukta prāyam etat iti kim bahunā
translated: Since that alone is sufficient for the establishment of the word, this has been stated for the most part. What need is there for much?

analyzed: vastu vṛttyā abhāvāt nāntarīyaka arthaḥ dhūmaḥ bhavati
translated: Since it does not exist in reality, smoke is not the object that is inseparable.

analyzed: tasya darśanam nāntarīyaka artha darśanam api bhavati
translated: The seeing of that is the seeing of the object that is inseparable.

original: tatra yadi tadvida / iti nocyeta tadā nāliker advīpāyātasya dhūmadarśanam anumānam āpadyeta tatas tadvida iti vaktavyam eva /
analyzed: tatra yadi tad vidaḥ iti nā ucyeta tadā nālikeḥ a dvīpa āyātasya dhūma darśanam anumānam āpadyeta tatas tad vidaḥ iti vaktavyam eva
translated: If it were not said there that he knows that, then the seeing of smoke by one who has come from a place without water would be a case of inference. Therefore, it must be said that he knows that.

original: na ca nāntarīyako 'rtha iti jñānam nāntarīyakārthajñānam ity ucyate /
analyzed: na ca nāntarīyakaḥ rthaḥ iti jñānam nāntarīyaka artha jñānam iti ucyate
translated: And the knowledge that the object is invariably concomitant is not called the knowledge of the invariably concomitant object.

analyzed: yena evam ucyeta
translated: By whom is it said in this way?

original: kiṃtu vastuto 'nāntarīyako yo na bhavaty arthaḥ /
analyzed: kiṃtu vastutas nāntarīyakaḥ yaḥ na bhavati arthaḥ
translated: But in reality, the object which is not invariably concomitant,

analyzed: tasya yat darśanam
translated: the seeing of that

original: tad apīty alam atiśabdārthaparyavadātamatīnāṃ vacana vidhācāraṇayeti /
analyzed: tat api iti alam ati śabda artha paryavadāta matīnām vacana vidhā cāraṇayā iti
translated: is also. Enough of explaining the meaning of the word ati to those who are proficient in it.

analyzed: pratijñā vacanam na yuktam sambandhaḥ
translated: The statement of the proposition is not proper - this is the connection.

analyzed: katham ayuktam iti āśaṃkāyām
translated: How is it improper? In doubt, the statement of the reason begins with the property of the subject.

analyzed: pṛ paṃ
na asti s
translated: There is no

original: anityatvasya sādhanabhāvena kṛtakatvaṃ dharmaḥ / Nyāyavā / p /
analyzed: anitya tvasya sādhana bhāvena kṛtaka tvam dharmaḥ
translated: The property of being produced is the property of impermanence, which is done as the means of proof.

analyzed: iti jijñāsoḥ ca avabodhaḥ
translated: The understanding of one who is in doubt, etc. is the desire to know.

original: sāmānyanyāyasiddhām astikriyām apekṣya muktve /ti paurvakālikaḥ pratyayaḥ pratyeyaḥ /
analyzed: sāmānya nyāya siddhām astikriyām apekṣya paurvakālikaḥ pratyayaḥ pratyeyaḥ
translated: The prior suffix is to be understood in relation to and excluding the existence action established by general logic.

analyzed: iti atra ādi śabdāt prayojana ādi parigrahaḥ
translated: The word etc. in doubt, desire to know, etc. includes the purpose and so on.

analyzed: tathā amunā eva ādi grahaṇena pañcamī antasya api hetu prayogasya saṃgrahaḥ kāryaḥ
translated: Similarly, by this very word etc., the instrumental case ending should also be included in the usage of the reason.

original: asati hi sādhyābhidhāne kuta etad iti evābhāvāt /
analyzed: asati hi sādhya abhidhāne kutas etat iti eva abhāvāt
translated: For if the probandum is not stated, it is simply because it does not exist.

original: sādhyasiddhau hetor nimittatvaṃ kathayantīṃ paṃcamīm uccārayantaṃ katham iva vicakṣaṇā tayācaṇā na pratyāca🔽kṣīrann iti /🔽dṛṣṭānta eva vacanakarmatāṃ nīyamāna upasaṃharaṇaṃ tad apekṣaḥ upasaṃhāro / ḍhaukanaṃ sattvapradarśanam /
analyzed: sādhya siddhau hetoḥ nimitta tvam kathayantīm paṃcamīm uccārayantam katham iva vicakṣaṇā ta yācaṇā na pratyāca  kṣīran iti  dṛṣṭānte eva vacana karma tām nīyamānaḥ upasaṃharaṇam tat apekṣaḥ upasaṃhāraḥ ḍhaukanam sattva pradarśanam
translated: How could the wise not reject one who utters the instrumental case ending, which indicates the reason's role in establishing the probandum, as if it were a request?🔽The conclusion is dependent on the example, which is being made into the object of the statement. The demonstration is the presentation of existence.

original: dṛṣṭāntadṛṣṭasāmarthyasya hetor iti ca prakaraṇād draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: dṛṣṭānta dṛṣṭa sāmarthyasya hetoḥ iti ca prakaraṇāt draṣṭavyam
translated: And the reason whose power has been seen in the example should be understood from the context.

analyzed: sādhya śabdena upacārāt sādhya dharmī iṣṭaḥ
translated: By the word probandum, the probandum property-possessor is intended figuratively.

analyzed: paṣṭhī saptamyoḥ abhedāt ca sādhya dharmiṇī iti arthaḥ boddhavyaḥ
translated: And the meaning of probandum property-possessor should be understood as non-difference.

original: iti /r lakṣaṇasya svarūpam āha pratijñāyā / lakṣaṇam ity anuvartate /
analyzed: āha       iti anuvartate
translated: Thus, the definition of the thesis is stated. The definition continues.

analyzed: tasya pramāṇa vala āyātasya arthasya saṃpratyayaḥ
translated: It is the ascertainment of a meaning that has come through the power of a means of valid knowledge, not the mere statement of a meaning that is suspected to be otherwise.

analyzed: vacchedaḥ tad artham yathā bhavati
translated: The cutting off is for that purpose, as it occurs.

analyzed: yadi pramāṇānām vyāpāraḥ nigamanena upasaṃhriyate
translated: If the operation of the means of valid knowledge is concluded by the conclusion,

analyzed: tadā etat yujyate vaktum
translated: then this can be said.

original: na cāsya tathātvam ity āśaṃkyāha aśaṣe /ti co / yasmād /
analyzed: na ca asya tathātvam iti āśaṃkya āha yasmāt arthe
translated: And it does not have that nature, fearing this, he says without remainder. Because.

analyzed: vyāpāra śabdena vyāpāra phalam abhipretam
translated: By the word operation, the result of the operation is meant.

original: nanu kāni punar atra pramāṇāni santi yadbalāyātārthopasaṃharaṇam asya varṇyata ity
analyzed: nanu kāni punar atra pramāṇāni santi yat bala āyāta artha upasaṃharaṇam asya varṇyate iti
translated: But what are the means of valid knowledge here, by the power of which the conclusion of the meaning is described?

original: āśaṅkya parai eṣām avayavānām evaṃ pramāṇatvarūpam ākhyātam ity ākhyātuṃ tathāhī /tyādinopakramate /
analyzed: āśaṅkya paraiḥ eṣām avayavānām evam pramāṇa tva rūpam ākhyātam iti ākhyātum
translated: Fearing this, he begins with Thus indeed in order to explain that these parts have been thus declared to be the nature of the means of valid knowledge by others.

original: uparī /ti prakaraṇād anyakṛtasya nāmna iti draṣṭavyam /🔽tathāhi te kasyacid rājaputrasya mahāmātrasya yoginonā
analyzed: prakaraṇāt anya kṛtasya nāmnaḥ iti draṣṭavyam  tathā hi te kasyacid rāja putrasya mahāmātrasya vā
translated: Above should be seen as referring to the name made by someone else in the context.🔽For thus, having heard the name made by someone else of the same kind, of a prince, a minister, a yogin,

original: nyena sajātīyena kṛtaṃ nāma śrutvā ahopuruṣikayā dhanāśayā coditā anyathā cāvā
analyzed: nyena sajātīyena kṛtam nāma śrutvā ahopuruṣikayā dhana āśayā coditā anyathā
translated: they, being urged by wonder and the desire for wealth, and being impelled in another way,

original: tadutsāhavardhanaṃ nāma kṛtvā tallikhituṃ prayuñjate 'ta eva nāmalekhanam i /ti ṇicā nirdiṣṭam /
analyzed: tat utsāhavardhanam nāma kṛtvā tat likhitum prayuñjate te eva nāma lekhanam nirdiṣṭam
translated: having made it the name Encouraging His Enthusiasm, they set about writing it. For this very reason, the name-writing is indicated by the causative suffix.

original: ayuktatayā niṣphalam apī /ti vāstavānuvādo 'py eṣa prakṛtopayogī /
analyzed: ayukta tayā niṣphalam
translated: Even though it is fruitless due to being irrelevant, this is a true statement, and it is useful for the present context.

analyzed: bāla pratārakam ca tat tat upayoga varṇanam ca iti tathā tad lakṣaṇayā
translated: And that description of its usefulness in various contexts is like that by the definition of a child's deceiver.

original: vaiyarthyādi syād iti sambandhāt pratijñāvacanasye /ty uktam /
analyzed: vaiyarthya ādi syāt iti sambandhāt uktam
translated: It would be useless, etc., is connected with of the statement of the thesis that was said.

analyzed: nāma lekhane s
translated: Even in writing the name,

analyzed: api na asti s
translated: there is no

original: nanūdyotakaropavarṇitam asya prayojanam astīti kathaṃ vaiyarthyam ity āha yat tūktam i /ti /
analyzed: nanu udyota kara upavarṇitam asya prayojanam asti iti katham vaiyarthyam iti āha yat tu uktam
translated: Isn't there a purpose described by Uddyotakara? How can it be useless? He says what was said and so on.

analyzed: dattam uttaram
translated: An answer was given.

analyzed: tena eva tāvat uktam
translated: Because it was said by him with just that shown and so on.

original: yathokte ca svayam uttaram āha yaś ce /ti /
analyzed: yathā ukte ca svayam uttaram āha yaḥ
translated: And he himself gives an answer to what was said with and what was said and so on.

analyzed: tad abhāve prathamam
translated: In the absence of that, first.

original: svārthānumānadṛṣṭaś ce /tyādinā ca yadupanayasamarthanārthaṃ pareṇoktaṃ tatpratividhātukāma āha yaś cāgnī /tyādi /
analyzed: svārtha anumāna dṛṣṭaḥ ca yat upanaya samarthana artham pareṇa uktam tad pratividhātu kāmaḥ āha yaḥ
translated: And because it is seen in one's own inference, and so on, what was said by the opponent to support the conclusion, he, desiring to refute that, says and what was said about fire and so on.

analyzed: caḥ yasmāt arthe
translated: The word ca (and) is in the sense of since.

original: kadācid i /ti yadā dhūmaṃ dṛṣṭvā tasyāgninā vyāptim anusmṛtya taṃ tattvena pratyavamṛśya pratyetīti /
analyzed: kadācid yadā dhūmam dṛṣṭvā tasya agninā vyāptim anusmṛtya tam tattvena pratyavamṛśya pratyeti iti
translated: Sometimes means when one sees smoke, remembers its pervasion by fire, and ascertains it as such.

analyzed: asya pratyavamṛśya pratyaya arthasya
translated: Of this, of the object of cognition that is being examined.

original: atha tadantareṇāpi yat pakṣārthapratīter avidhānān na tena kiñcid iti brūyāt /
analyzed: atha tat antareṇa api yat pakṣa artha pratīteḥ avidhānāt na tena kiñcid iti brūyāt
translated: If one were to say that even without that, since the meaning of the proposition is understood, it is of no use,

original: samānam idaṃ prakṛte 'pīti ca buddhistham asyaivaṃ brūvato draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: samānam idam prakṛte ca buddhi stham asya evam brūvataḥ draṣṭavyam
translated: this is the same in the present case as well. And this should be seen as the thought of one who speaks thus.

analyzed: pramāṇa vyāpāra samarthana artham ca yat āha
translated: And with regard to what was said for the purpose of supporting the activity of the means of knowledge, he says there also:

analyzed: yat punar
translated: And what is said again...

original: na kvacid āgame paṭhyata / iti bruvatā cāgamapratijñayor ekaviṣayatvād āgamaḥ ucyata iti ye varṇayanti te nirastāḥ /
analyzed: na kvacid āgame paṭhyate iti bruvatā ca āgama pratijñayoḥ eka viṣaya tvāt āgamaḥ ucyate iti ye varṇayanti te nirastāḥ
translated: And by one who says it is not recited in any scripture, those who explain that since the proposition and the scripture have the same object, the scripture is being stated, are refuted.

original: yo hi pratijñayocyate 'rthaḥ sa eva cāgamepy ucyate tadaiva tat syāt /
analyzed: yaḥ hi pratijñayā ucyate rthaḥ saḥ eva ca āgame pi ucyate tadā eva tat syāt
translated: And if the meaning that is stated in the proposition is stated in the scripture, then that would be so.

analyzed: na ca evam atas nirāsaḥ
translated: But it is not so, therefore it is refuted.

analyzed: ro-0
translated: P and Pa.

analyzed: hetu śabdena gamaka vacanam vācyam
translated: The word reason should be taken to mean an indicator.

analyzed: gamakam ca trairūpya vat liṅgam
translated: And an indicator is a mark having three aspects.

original: na ca pañcamyantena tena śabdena liṅgasya trairūpyam abhidhīyate kintu pakṣadharmatvamātram / nimittabhāva eva cety evaṃ abhiprāyaḥ
analyzed: na ca pañcamī antena tena śabdena liṅgasya trairūpyam abhidhīyate kintu pakṣa dharma tva mātram nimitta bhāvaḥ eva ca iti evam abhiprāyaḥ
translated: And by that word ending in the fifth case, the three aspects of the mark are not stated, but only the property of the subject. The intention is that it is only the causal nature.

original: etena tad api vinikṣiptam yat kaiścin nipuṇaṇaṃ
analyzed: etena tat api vinikṣiptam yat kaiścid
translated: By this, that too is refuted which some clever

analyzed: manyaiḥ naiyāyikaiḥ ucyate
translated: Naiyāyikas say.

original: pratijñārthaṃ sādhayituṃ samarthaṃ pakṣadharmatvenopasaṃhartavyaṃ liṅgaṃ anumānaṃ🔽tadabhidhāyī śabdo hetuḥ so 'py abhidheyasya niyamahetutvāt bāhyāṅgaṃ sāmānādhikaraṇyaṃ
analyzed: pratijñā artham sādhayitum samartham pakṣa dharma tvena upasaṃhartavyam liṅgam anumānam  tad abhidhāyī śabdaḥ hetuḥ saḥ u pi abhidheyasya niyama hetu tvāt bāhya aṅgam sāmānādhikaraṇyam
translated: The inferential mark which is capable of establishing the meaning of the proposition should be stated as the property of the subject. Inference is🔽that. The word expressing that is the reason. That too is an external limb because it is the cause of the restriction of what is to be denoted. The co-reference of the denotative and denoted is

original: cābhidhānābhidheyayor abhedavivakṣayā sākṣāt pāraraṃparye caikaciṣayatvād iti /
analyzed: ca abhidhāna abhidheyayoḥ abheda vivakṣayā sākṣāt
translated: by the intention to express non-difference, and because of the unity of meaning directly and indirectly.

original: tāvaddhi dhūmādivastu na liṅgaṃ yāvad vahnyādināntarīyakatayā na niścīyate /
analyzed: tāvat hi dhūma ādi vastu na liṅgam yāvat vahni ādi nāntarīyakatayā na niścīyate
translated: For as long as the thing such as smoke is not ascertained as invariably concomitant with fire, it is not the inferential mark.

analyzed: dharmi viśeṣe ca kvacid na upalīyate
translated: And it does not rest on any particular subject.

original: tannāntarīyakatayā niścitaṃ kvacid upasaṃhṛtaṃ ca sādhyasādhanasāmarthyaṃ bhavati nānyathā /🔽na ca pacamyantena dhūmād ityādinā śabdena tasya tannāntarīyakatvaṃ pakṣe ca sattvaṃ kathyate /
analyzed: tat nāntarīyaka tayā niścitam kvacid upasaṃhṛtam ca sādhya sādhana sāmarthyam bhavati na anyathā  na ca pacamī antena dhūmāt ityādinā śabdena tasya tat nāntarīyaka tvam pakṣe ca sattvam kathyate
translated: That which is ascertained as invariably concomitant and stated somewhere as the property of the subject has the capacity to be the means of proof and the probandum, not otherwise.🔽And by the word from smoke etc. ending in pac, its invariable concomitance and existence in the subject are not stated.

analyzed: udāharaṇa upanayayoḥ vaiyarthyam prasaṅgāt
translated: Because it would follow that the example and application would be useless.

original: kathaṃ pratijñārthasādhanasamarthaliṅgābhidhāyitvaṃ tasya śabdasya yena tadabhidhāyī śabdo hetuḥ ity ucyate /
analyzed: tat katham pratijñā artha sādhana samartha liṅga abhidhāyi tvam tasya śabdasya yena tad abhidhāyī śabdaḥ hetuḥ iti ucyate
translated: How does it express an inferential mark that is capable of establishing the meaning of the thesis? By which it is said that the word that expresses that is the reason.

original: sa tathā bāhyāṅgam iti cocyate hetur anumānam iti sāmānādhikaraṇyaṃ tathā kalpeteti /
analyzed: sa tathā bāhya aṅgam iti ca ucyate hetuḥ anumānam iti sāmānādhikaraṇyam tathā kalpeta iti
translated: And it is said to be such an external limb. And the co-reference of reason and inference is conceived in that way.

original: pratyakṣeṇa sādhyasādhanayor vyāptis tatra gṛhyata iti dṛṣṭāntaḥ pratyakṣo 'bhipretaḥ /
analyzed: pratyakṣeṇa sādhya sādhanayoḥ vyāptiḥ tatra gṛhyate iti dṛṣṭāntaḥ pratyakṣaḥ bhipretaḥ
translated: The example is intended to be perceptible, in that the pervasion of the probandum and probans is grasped by perception there.

original: ata evāyaṃ na sarvaḥ pratyakṣa / iti /
analyzed: atas eva ayam na sarvaḥ pratyakṣaḥ iti
translated: For this very reason, this is not all perception.

original: naiva dṛṣṭānte pratykṣeṇa sādhyasādhanayor vyāptir gṛhyate /
analyzed: na eva dṛṣṭānte sādhya sādhanayoḥ vyāptiḥ gṛhyate
translated: In the example, the pervasion of the probandum and probans is not grasped by perception.

original: yathā bhavanmata eva nitya ātmā sattāsambandhitve satyanāśritatvāt /
analyzed: yathā bhavat mataḥ eva nityaḥ ātmā sattā sambandhi tve sati anāśrita tvāt
translated: Just as, according to your view, the self is eternal, because of being related to existence, because of being non-dependent,

original: paramāṇuvad ity atra dṛṣṭānte nityatvaṃ sattāsambandhitve satyanāśritatvaṃ yau dharmau tayor vyāptir anumānena gṛhyata ity abhisandhiḥ /
analyzed: paramāṇu vat iti atra dṛṣṭānte nitya tvam sattā sambandhi tve sati anāśrita tvam yau dharmau tayoḥ vyāptiḥ anumānena gṛhyate iti abhisandhiḥ
translated: like an atom. The intention is that in this example, the pervasion of the two properties, eternality and non-dependence, is grasped by inference.

original: anenaitad api pratyuktaṃ yat tair ucyate sādhyasādhanayor vyāptito viṣayo dṛṣṭāntaḥ /
analyzed: anena etat api pratyuktam yat taiḥ ucyate sādhya sādhanayoḥ vyāptitaḥ viṣayaḥ dṛṣṭāntaḥ
translated: By this, this is also answered, which is said by them: The example is the object of the pervasion of the probandum and probans.

original: tatra pratyakṣeṇa vyāptiṃ gṛhītvā paścād udāharati /
analyzed: tatra pratyakṣeṇa vyāptim gṛhītvā paścāt udāharati
translated: There, having grasped the pervasion by perception, he later gives an example.

analyzed: tena pratyakṣam niyāmakam asti iti
translated: Therefore, perception is the determiner.

original: udāharaṇam api vākyasya bhāgāntaram iti pratyakṣeṇa vyāptigrahaṇasyāsarvaviṣayatvāt kvacid bhāvāt tathābhidhāne ca tata eva dṛṣṭānto '
analyzed: udāharaṇam api vākyasya bhāga antaram iti pratyakṣeṇa vyāpti grahaṇasya a sarva viṣaya tvāt kvacid bhāvāt tathā abhidhāne ca tatas eva dṛṣṭāntaḥ
translated: Or an example is a part of a sentence. Since the grasping of pervasion by perception is not all-pervasive, it exists somewhere. And when it is stated like that, the example is

analyzed: iti abhidhīyeta iti
translated: stated from that alone.

original: tasya tadātiriktārthagrahaṇābhāvād ity abhiprāyeṇa upamānaṃ tu pramāṇam eva na bhavatī /ty āha /
analyzed: tasya tad atirikta artha grahaṇa abhāvāt iti abhiprāyeṇa upamānam tu pramāṇam eva na āha
translated: With the intention that it does not grasp any meaning other than that, he says that comparison is not a means of valid knowledge at all.

analyzed: etat ca bahu bādhya bahu vācya
translated: And this, which refutes much and asserts much,

analyzed: anyatra uktam iti na iha uktam
translated: is stated elsewhere, so it is not stated here.

analyzed: siddhaḥ tu arthaḥ nu uditaḥ
translated: But the established meaning is repeated.

original: anayaiva ca dvārā yad ucyate tair eva yathātatheti dṛṣṭāntadārṣṭāntikayoḥ sārūpyapratipattir upamānam /
analyzed: anayā eva ca dvārā yat ucyate taiḥ eva yathā tathā iti dṛṣṭānta dārṣṭāntikayoḥ sārūpya pratipattiḥ upamānam
translated: And by this very means, what is said by them as it is, the understanding of the similarity between the example and the exemplified is comparison.

analyzed: pakṣa dharma tva grāhi pramāṇa vacanam upanayaḥ
translated: The statement of the means of valid knowledge that grasps the property of the subject is the application.

analyzed: atra api upamānam niyama hetu tva tvam
translated: Here too, comparison is the cause of restriction.

original: dharmiṇi vā sādhanadharmasya saṃbhavaṃ bodhayadasaṃbhavaṃ nivartayati yatpramāṇaṃ
analyzed: dharmiṇi vā sādhana dharmasya saṃbhavam bodhayat asaṃbhavam nivartayati yat pramāṇam
translated: Or the means of valid knowledge that makes known the possibility of the property to be established in the subject, excludes the impossibility.

original: tanniyāmakam astīti upanayopi niyamahetumattvād bhāgāntaram iti tad api pratyākhyeyaṃ
analyzed: tad niyāmakam asti iti upanayaḥ api niyama hetumat tvāt bhāga antaram iti tat api pratyākhyeyam
translated: The conclusion is also a separate part because it has a cause for the rule. That too should be rejected.

original: dvividhasyāsya varṇitasyopamānasyāprāmāṇyād kathaṃ niyāmakam /🔽yenopanayanasya niyamahetukasiddhyā p / bhāgāntaratvaṃ siddhyet /🔽dharmiṇi ca sādhanadharmasya sambhavaṃ paricchedacchidya
analyzed: dvividhasya asya varṇitasya upamānasya aprāmāṇyāt eva katham niyāmakam  yena upanayanasya niyama hetuka siddhyā bhāga antara tvam siddhyet  dharmiṇi ca sādhana dharmasya sambhavam pariccheda chidya
translated: How can there be a determiner when this described analogy is of two kinds and is not a means of valid knowledge?🔽By which the conclusion of the cause for the rule of initiation would be established, and its being a separate part would be established.🔽And the possibility of the property to be proven in the subject is determined by perception or inference,

original: pratyakṣam anumānaṃ vāsaṃbhavaṃ nivartayatīti atrāpi pratyakṣaṃ niyāmakam astīti dṛṣṭāntavad upanayopi pratyakṣam iti vaktavyaḥ /
analyzed: pratyakṣam anumānam vā asaṃbhavam nivartayati iti atra api pratyakṣam niyāmakam asti iti dṛṣṭānta vat upanayaḥ api pratyakṣam iti vaktavyaḥ
translated: and the impossibility is excluded. So here too, perception is the determiner. Therefore, the conclusion should be stated to be like the example, i.e., perception.

original: kvacid anumānasyāpi tathātvād anumānam ity apīty alam /
analyzed: kvacid anumānasya api tathā tvāt anumānam iti api iti alam
translated: In some cases, it is also inference because of its being so. That is enough.

analyzed: tad vyāpāraḥ upamāna rūpa upanaya vyāpāraḥ
translated: That function. The function of analogy, which is the conclusion.

analyzed: saḥ eva
translated: That itself. The conclusion itself.

original: syād etad anityaḥ śabda ity ukte kuta etad iti śrotur apekṣopajāyate /
analyzed: syāt etat anityaḥ śabdaḥ iti ukte kutas etat iti śrotuḥ apekṣā upajāyate
translated: This might be said: When it is stated that sound is impermanent, a listener's expectation arises as to why this is so.

analyzed: na tu dharmiṇi liṅgasya
translated: But there is no expectation regarding the presence or absence of the reason in the subject.

original: tasmāt pratijñānantaraṃ parāpekṣitasādhyapratipattir api tu pratipattihetuprati
analyzed: tasmāt pratijñā anantaram para apekṣita sādhya pratipattiḥ api tu pratipatti hetu prati
translated: Therefore, even after the thesis, the understanding of the probandum expected by the opponent is also the purpose of the statement of the reason.

original: pipādayiṣayā pañcamyantasya tadabhidhāyinaḥ śabdasya prayogo na tu dha liṅgasya sattvapratipādanārthaḥ /
analyzed: pipādayiṣayā pañcamī antasya tad abhidhāyinaḥ śabdasya prayogaḥ na tu rmiṇi liṅgasya sattva pratipādana arthaḥ
translated: The use of the word ending in the fifth case, which expresses that, is for the desire to establish the means of understanding, not for the purpose of establishing the existence of the logical mark.

original: tato na tasya pakṣadharmatāpratipādanaṃ prayojanam iti kathaṃ pakṣadharmatvaṃ sa eva darśayiṣyatīti na kiñcit tenety ucyamānaṃ śobheteti /
analyzed: tatas na tasya pakṣa dharmatā pratipādanam prayojanam iti katham pakṣa dharma tvam saḥ eva darśayiṣyati iti na kiñcid tena iti ucyamānam śobheta iti
translated: Therefore, its purpose is not to establish the property of the subject. How then will it show the property of the subject? Thus, what is said by you does not shine.

analyzed: atra ucyate
translated: To this we reply:

original: anityaḥ śabda iti pratijñopādānepi tadanantaram eva yad yad kṛtakaṃ tat sarvam anityam /
analyzed: anityaḥ śabdaḥ iti pratijñā upādāne api tad anantaram eva yat yat kṛtakam tat sarvam anityam
translated: Even when the thesis sound is impermanent is stated, immediately after that, when it is said whatever is produced is all impermanent,

original: yathā ghaṭas tathā cāyaṃ kṛtaka ity ukte sādhyapratītau kiṃ nāsti /
analyzed: yathā ghaṭaḥ tathā ca ayam kṛtakaḥ iti ukte sādhya pratītau kim nā asti
translated: like a pot, and this is produced, what is there that is not understood of the probandum?

original: yena pañcamyantasya liṅgābhidhāyina eva tadupaśamaḥ prayojanaṃ varṇyeta /
analyzed: yena pañcamī antasya liṅga abhidhāyinaḥ eva tad upaśamaḥ prayojanam varṇyeta
translated: By what, the cessation of that would be the purpose of the word ending in the fifth case, which expresses only the logical mark?

original: yadi saty avādī bhavān naivaṃ vaktum arhatīti /
analyzed: yadi satī avādī bhavān na evam vaktum arhati iti
translated: If you say it is true, you should not speak thus.

original: kiñ ca yo yasmin kiñcid nimittabhāvam apekṣate na sa tatra śaśaviṣāṇāyamānasya tattvam apekṣate /
analyzed: kim ca yaḥ yasmin kiñcid nimitta bhāvam apekṣate na sa tatra śaśaviṣāṇāyamānasya tattvam apekṣate
translated: And further, that which requires something as a cause in a certain matter, does not require the reality of that which is like a hare's horn in that matter.

original: api tu tatra sata eveti kathaṃ śabdānityatvasiddhau kasyacin nimittāvamapekṣitavatā sattvaṃ nāpekṣitam /🔽yena sattvaṃ pratipādayituṃ na tannimittābhidhāyinaḥ śabdasya sāmānyam arthya
analyzed: api tu tatra sataḥ evā iti katham śabda anitya tva siddhau kasyacid sattvam na apekṣitam  yena para an apekṣitam sattvam pratipādayitum na tad nimitta abhidhāyinaḥ śabdasya sāmānyam
translated: But rather, it requires the existence of that which is there. So how, when the impermanence of sound is established, can the existence of anything that requires a cause not be required?

original: m astīty ucyeta tasmāc chabdādau dharmiṇi liṅgasya sādhyasiddhau nimittabhūtasattvapratipādanaṃ hetuprayogasya prayojanam avaśyaiṣitavyam /
analyzed: asti iti ucyeta tasmāt śabda ādau dharmiṇi liṅgasya sādhya siddhau nimitta bhūta sattva pratipādanam hetu prayogasya prayojanam avaśya eṣitavyam
translated: By whom it is said that the general meaning of the word expressing that cause does not exist in order to convey existence. Therefore, in the case of sound etc. as the subject, the conveying of existence which is the cause for the establishment of the probandum by the logical mark is necessarily to be desired as the purpose of the use of the reason.

original: yataccopanayenāpi śakyaṃ saṃpādayitum iti sādhūktaṃ kiṃtene /ti /
analyzed: yat ca upanayena api śakyam saṃpādayitum iti sādhu uktam
translated: And since that can be accomplished even by the conclusion, it is well said that it is of no use.

analyzed: na kiñcid tena
translated: By that, nothing is accomplished.

original: saṃprati nigamane yathāśruti āha yatrapratijñāyā / iti /
analyzed: saṃprati nigamane yathāśruti dūṣaṇam āha
translated: Now, in the conclusion, he says where there is a proposition etc., according to the literal meaning.

original: athāpi syān nāyaṃ punaḥ śabdaḥ aprathame kiṃ tarhi sādṛśye /
analyzed: atha api syāt na ayam punar śabdaḥ a prathame kim tarhi sādṛśye
translated: But it might be argued that this word is not used again in the first case, but rather in similarity.

original: yathā aciraprabhā punar niścarati ity atra /
analyzed: yathā acira prabhā punar niścarati iti atra
translated: As in the light shines again, here.

analyzed: sādṛśyam ca kiyat rūpeṇa asti eva
translated: And similarity exists in what form?

original: yad vā yady api siddhanirdeśo nigamanaṃ sādhyanirdeśaś ca pratijñā /
analyzed: yat vā yadi api siddha nirdeśaḥ nigamanam sādhya nirdeśaḥ ca pratijñā
translated: Or, even though a conclusion is a statement of what is established and a proposition is a statement of what is to be established,

original: tathāpi yasyaiva pratijñāyāṃ sādhyatvam āsīt tasyāiva nigamane siddhatvam ity
analyzed: tathā api yasya eva pratijñāyām sādhya tvam āsīt tasyāḥ iva nigamane siddha tvam iti
translated: nevertheless, since it is the same thing that was to be established in the proposition that is established in the conclusion,

original: ekam āśritya samānaviṣayatayā nigamanaṃ pratijñety upacaryate tathā ca punar vacanam apy upapannam iti /
analyzed: ekam āśritya samāna viṣaya tayā nigamanam pratijñā iti upacaryate tathā ca punar vacanam api upapannam iti
translated: the conclusion is figuratively called a proposition because it has the same content as the proposition, relying on just one of them. And thus the repetition is also justified.

analyzed: na ca etat nigamanam niṣprayojanam āśaṃkanīyam
translated: And this conclusion should not be suspected of being purposeless.

analyzed: sādhye viparīta prasaṅga pratiṣedha ārtha tvāt asya
translated: Because it serves to exclude the possibility of the opposite of what is to be established.

analyzed: tat uktam sādhya viparīta śaṃkā vyavaccheda artham nigamanam iti
translated: As it is said, The conclusion is for the purpose of excluding the doubt of the opposite of what is to be established.

original: yady api ca liṅgam āśrayavatsādhyāvinābhāvi pratijñādibhir avayavair ākhyātaṃ tathāpi nigamanam antareṇa vyāpakaviruddhaprasaṃgāśaṃkā syāt
analyzed: yadi api ca liṅgam āśrayavat sādhya avinābhāvi ca pratijñā ādibhiḥ avayavaiḥ ākhyātam tathā api nigamanam antareṇa vyāpaka viruddha prasaṃga āśaṃkā syāt
translated: And even though the reason, which is invariably concomitant with what is to be established like its basis, has been stated by the parts such as the proposition, still there would be a doubt about the possibility of a contradiction with the all-pervading [reason] without a conclusion.

original: p / anyad eva hi dṛṣṭāntadharmiṇi sādhyaṃ yatsādhanadharmasya vyāpakam āsīt /
analyzed: anyat eva hi dṛṣṭānta dharmiṇi sādhyam yat sādhana dharmasya vyāpakam āsīt
translated: For in the example-subject, what was to be established was just the pervasion of the property to be established by the property to be proven.

original: anyad eva ca dharmiṇy anityatvaṃ tac ca sādhanadharmasya vyāpakaṃ na bhavatīti avyāpakasya
analyzed: anyat eva ca dharmiṇi anitya tvam tat ca sādhana dharmasya vyāpakam na bhavati iti avyāpakasya
translated: And non-eternality is a different property of the subject, and that is not the pervasion of the property to be proved. Thus, considering non-pervasion

original: siddhiṃ manyamānaḥ sādhyaviruddham abyāpakatvena mūḍhamatir nityatvam
analyzed: siddhim manyamānaḥ sādhya viruddham abyāpaka tvena mūḍha matiḥ nitya tvam
translated: to be established, the deluded mind may superimpose eternality, which is contradictory to the probandum,

analyzed: api dharmiṇi prasañjayet
translated: on the subject, due to non-pervasion.

original: tathā ca sati sādhyaviparyaye hetor vṛttiśaṃkāyāṃ bādhakaṃ pramāṇaṃ tad eva vācyam yadudāharaṇasthayoḥ sādhyasādhanayoḥ pratibandhagrāhi /
analyzed: tathā ca sati sādhya viparyaye hetoḥ vṛtti śaṃkāyām bādhakam pramāṇam tat eva vācyam yat udāharaṇa sthayoḥ sādhya sādhanayoḥ pratibandha grāhi
translated: And if that were so, when there is a suspicion of the presence of the reason in the contrary of the probandum, the same means of valid knowledge that grasps the relation between the example and the probandum should be stated as the refuting evidence.

original: ataeva tasmād ity anena sarvanāmnā pratibaddhaṃ liṅgaṃ sādhyaviruddhaśaṃkāṃ nivartayituṃ prakṛtatvāt pratyavamṛṣyate /
analyzed: ataeva tasmāt iti anena sarvanāmnā pratibaddham liṅgam sādhya viruddha śaṃkām nivartayitum prakṛta tvāt pratyavamṛṣyate
translated: And for that very reason, by the pronoun 'tasmāt' (therefore), the inferential mark that is related is examined in the context in order to remove the suspicion of contradiction with the probandum.

analyzed: tasmāt nigamanam sādhye viparīta prasaṅga pratiṣedha artham bhavati iti
translated: Therefore, the conclusion is for the purpose of refuting the superimposition of the contrary of the probandum.

analyzed: tat etat naiyāyika pravarasya prakṛṣṭam prajñāḥ svalita vilasitam
translated: This is the excellent play of the brilliant mind of the foremost Naiyāyika.

original: tathā hi sādhye nirdiṣṭe hetau cābhihite ḍṛṣṭānte codāhṛte dṛṣṭāntadaṣṭasāmarthye
analyzed: tathā hi sādhye nirdiṣṭe hetau ca abhihite ḍṛṣṭānte ca udāhṛte dṛṣṭānta daṣṭa sāmarthye
translated: For when the probandum is indicated, the reason is stated, and the example is cited, and the capacity of the example is seen,

original: ca hetau sādhyadharmiṇy upanīte kaḥ sacetano yena vinā yo na bhavati dharmaḥ sa
analyzed: ca hetau sādhya dharmiṇi upanīte kaḥ sa cetanaḥ yena vinā yaḥ na bhavati dharmaḥ sa
translated: And when the reason is stated in regard to the subject to be proved, who would doubt or be uncertain,🔽thinking that the property which does not exist without a certain being

original: bhavaṃs tadabhāvam apy upasthāpayati iti niścīnvīta saṃśayīta vā yena
analyzed: bhavan tad abhāvam api upasthāpayati iti niścīnvīta saṃśayīta vā yena viruddha prasaṅga śaṃkā nirākaraṇāya
translated: establishes the absence of that [property] as well? By whom

original: nigamanam abhidhīyeta /🔽na cāyam anunmatto 'nityatve dve ṣasyatipaśyati
analyzed: nigamanam abhidhīyeta  na ca ayam an unmattaḥ nitya tve dve ṣasyati paśyati
translated: the conclusion would be stated.🔽And this [reason] is not accepted as the property of the subject in the example, nor is it accepted as the property of the subject to be proved.

original: yenānyad eva dṛṣṭāntadharmiṇi sādhyam anityatvam anyad eva ca sādyadharmiṇy anityatve tac ca sādhanadharmasya vyāpakaṃ na bhavatīti avyāpakasya
analyzed: yena anyat eva dṛṣṭānta dharmiṇi sādhyam anitya tvam anyat eva ca sādya dharmiṇi anitya tve tat ca sādhana dharmasya vyāpakam na bhavati iti avyāpakasya
translated: Nor does this [reason] establish the pervasion of the property to be proved by the property to be established.

analyzed: siddhim manyeta yatas
translated: For what reason?

original: vyāpakatvena viśeṣābhāvātt anityatvam api dharmiṇi prasañjayet /
analyzed: vyāpaka tvena viśeṣa abhāvāt anitya tvam api dharmiṇi prasañjayet
translated: Because of the absence of a specific pervasion, it would also imply the property of the subject, impermanence.

original: na ca viśeṣeṇa vyāptim asāv d iti /
analyzed: na ca viśeṣeṇa vyāptim asau iti
translated: And he does not perceive the pervasion in the specific [property].

analyzed: viśeṣeṇa vyāpteḥ ava asambhavāt
translated: Because the pervasion in the specific [property] is impossible.

analyzed: tathā ca uktam vyāptiḥ sāmānya dharmayoḥ iti
translated: And thus it is said: The pervasion is between two general properties.

original: anyathā saty api tasmiṃs tad āśaṃkekā
analyzed: anyathā sati api tasmin tat
translated: Otherwise, even if it exists, the doubt regarding it

analyzed: na apākriyeta
translated: would not be removed.

original: etena sapratipakṣatvaśaṃkānirākaraṇatvam tatprayojanam iti yat kaiścid upavarṇyate tad api parāstam avaseyam /
analyzed: etena sa pratipakṣa tva śaṃkā nirākaraṇa tvam tat prayojanam iti yat kaiścid upavarṇyate tat api parāstam avaseyam
translated: By this, it should be understood that the objection of having a counter-argument and the purpose of that [objection] are also refuted, as described by some.

original: atha mohamāhātmyād evam api saṃbhāvyata iti cet /
analyzed: atha moha māhātmyāt evam api saṃbhāvyate iti ced
translated: If it is said that even so, it is possible due to the greatness of delusion,

analyzed: apayātam tarhi pañca avayava tvam vākyasya
translated: then the five-membered nature of a sentence has been abandoned.

original: api kaścin mūḍhataramatir yaḥ pañcāvayave 'pi vākye prayukte nānityopīti vacanam antareṇa śabdasyānityatvaṃ niyataṃ na pratyeti
analyzed: sambhavati api kaścid mūḍhatara matiḥ yaḥ pañca avayave vākye prayukte na anityaḥ api iti vacanam antareṇa śabdasya anitya tvam niyatam na pratyeti
translated: For there is someone with an even more deluded mind who, even when a five-membered sentence is used, does not ascertain the impermanence of sound without the statement sound is impermanent.

original: asti ca digambarāṇāṃvipratipattiḥ syān nityaḥ śabdaḥ syād anitya iti /🔽tadbhāvavyudāsāya nānīni
analyzed: asti ca digambarāṇām vipratipattiḥ syāt nityaḥ śabdaḥ syāt anityaḥ iti  tad bhāva vyudāsāya nānīni
translated: And there is the disagreement of the Digambaras, who think that sound may be permanent or impermanent.🔽To exclude that possibility, not impermanent is not said.

original: tyopīty api kiṃ nocyata ity alam ativistareṇa niṣprayojanakatvena /
analyzed: api kim nā ucyate iti alam ati vistareṇa niṣprayojanaka tvena
translated: Why not say not impermanent? Enough of this excessive and purposeless elaboration.

original: nigamanasya niraste prathamam upadarśitaṃ yad ubhayeṣāṃ mataṃ tadaraṇyānīruditatulyaṃ jātam iti kiṃ tatrokteneti /
analyzed: nigamanasya vākya aṅga tve niraste prathamam upadarśitam yat ubhayeṣām matam tat araṇyānī rudita tulyam jātam iti kim tatra uktena iti
translated: When the conclusion has been refuted, what has been shown first, which is the opinion of both parties, has become like a cry in the wilderness. What is the use of saying that?

analyzed: jyāyān śreṣṭhataraḥ
translated: Superior. More excellent.

original: pratijñāhetūdāharaṇopanayanigamanāni pañcāvayavā yasya sa tathā tadātmakaḥ / sāmasty aniṣedhaś caiṣa draṣṭavyaḥ /
analyzed: pratijñā hetu udāharaṇa upanaya nigamanāni pañca avayavāḥ yasya sa tathā tad ātmakaḥ sāmastī aniṣedhaḥ ca eṣa draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: It has five parts: proposition, reason, example, application, and conclusion. It is that which has that as its nature. And this should be seen as not excluding completeness.

original: hetur i /ty abhidhānābhidheyayor abhedavivakṣayā sākṣāt pāramparyeṇa ekaviṣayatvād pakṣadharmatvābhidhāyī śabdo draṣṭavyaḥ /
analyzed: hetuḥ abhidhāna abhidheyayoḥ abheda vivakṣayā sākṣāt pāramparyeṇa eka viṣaya tvāt vā pakṣa dharma tva abhidhāyī śabdaḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: The reason is to be seen as a word that expresses the property of the subject, by the intention of non-difference between the name and the named, due to having the same object directly or indirectly.

original: hetuś caivānuvādyenātmanā pratipādyamāno vyāpyarūpaḥ pratipādino bhavatīti prathamāntena tadabhidhāyinā śabdena pratipādyate /
analyzed: hetuḥ ca eva anuvādyena ātmanā pratipādyamānaḥ vyāpya rūpaḥ pratipādinaḥ bhavati iti prathama antena tad abhidhāyinā śabdena pratipādyate
translated: And the reason, when being conveyed by the word to be repeated, becomes the pervader for the one who conveys it, so it is conveyed by the word ending in the first case that expresses that.

original: ataḥ prathamānta eva tadabhidhāyī śabdo nyāyyaḥ /
analyzed: atas prathama ante eva tad abhidhāyī śabdaḥ nyāyyaḥ
translated: Therefore, the word expressing that ending in the first case is proper.

analyzed: hetu abhidhāyi śabda mātra apekṣayā tu pūrva apara niyama khanḍanam ācāryasya
translated: But in relation to the word expressing the reason alone, the teacher's refutation of the restriction of sequence is [proper].

analyzed: yatra ca pratijñāyāḥ
translated: And where there is a proposition,

original: p / sādhanadharmasya sādhyasvabhāvatāyā eve /ti svabhāvahetvadhikāreṇa vivṛtam /
analyzed: sādhana dharmasya sādhya svabhāva tāyāḥ svabhāva hetu adhikāreṇa vivṛtam
translated: it is only the nature of the property to be established that is to be established. Thus, it is explained under the heading of reason by nature.

analyzed: kārya hetunā vyabhicāram āśaṃkya āha
translated: Suspecting fallacy by the reason of effect, he says of the effect.

analyzed: tena pratibandhena
translated: By that, by that connection.

analyzed: anvaya vyatirekayoḥ
translated: Of those, of the positive and negative concomitance.
The cognition of its absence is the knowledge of its absence.

analyzed: niyatam khyāpayataḥ ca ayam abhisandhiḥ
translated: And this is the intention of one who states the restriction:

original: tattulya evāstīty abhidhāne 'tattulye sarvatrānyasmin viruddhe 'sati ca
analyzed: tad tulyaḥ evā asti iti abhidhāne tad tulye sarvatra anyasmin viruddhe sati ca nāstitvam
translated: It exists only in that which is similar to it. When it is stated that it exists only in that which is similar to it, then in all other dissimilar things, in contradictory things, and in non-existent things,

original: lakṣaṇāntaram iti prasaṅge niyamārtham ity eva nāstitvaṃ rūpaṃ tṛtīyaṃ na punar viruddhe
analyzed: lakṣaṇa antaram iti prasaṅge niyama artham iti eva nāstitvam rūpam tṛtīyam na punar viruddhe

original: anyatra / ceti darśayitum asaty evety uktaṃ sūtrakāreṇeti /
analyzed: anyatra ca iti darśayitum asatī eva iti uktam sūtrakāreṇa iti
translated: In order to show this, the author of the treatise said only in non-existent things.

original: viruddhata / iti sahasthitalakṣaṇenaiva virodhena viruddhyata iti /
analyzed: viruddhataḥ iti sahasthita lakṣaṇena eva virodhena viruddhyate iti
translated: It is contradictory by the contradiction of the characteristic of co-existence itself.

original: kathaṃ nānuṣnāśītād apī /ty āha anyato / vipakṣād vyavacchedasyābhāvasya prasaṅgād i /ti /
analyzed: katham āha anyatas vipakṣāt vyavacchedasya abhāvasya prasaṅgāt
translated: How is it not also from the non-hot and non-cold? He says from another, because of the implication of the absence of the exclusion from the opposite.

analyzed: iti doṣasya akāram darśayati

analyzed: tasya

analyzed: anyam icchatām abhisambadhyate

original: abhidhātāgnisaṃyogād eva nāśapratyayau / tayoḥ sannidhiḥ / taṃ vinā vināśo na ghaṭādibhiḥ saṃsargatāṃ / yāti /
analyzed: abhidhātā agni saṃyogāt eva nāśa pratyayau tayoḥ sannidhiḥ tam vinā vināśaḥ na ghaṭa ādibhiḥ saṃsarga tām yāti

analyzed: prasaṅga mukhena para upagama siddha pakṣa dharmatā dvāreṇa

translated: In that existing.

original: anena dṛśyamānāṅgārādibhāvena sarvam indhanādi nivartata iti na sarvasya pradhvastatvaṃ nāpi gavādau satīndhanādi nivartata iti na gavādeḥ
analyzed: anena dṛśyamāna aṅgāra ādi bhāvena sarvam indhana ādi nivartate iti na sarvasya pradhvasta tvam na api gava ādau sati indhana ādi nivartate iti na gava ādeḥ
translated: By this, all fuel etc. ceases to exist in the state of seen embers etc., thus the destruction of all is not established. Nor does the existing fuel etc. cease to exist in the cow etc., thus the form of destruction of the cow etc.

analyzed: pradhvaṃsa rūpa tā iti pareṇa darśitam
translated: is not established, as shown by the opponent.

analyzed: asya aṅgāra ādeḥ
translated: Of this, of the embers etc.

analyzed: dhvaṃsante dhvaṃsam upayānti vinaśyanti iti yāvat
translated: They are destroyed. They perish, i.e. they are destroyed.

analyzed: dīpa apekṣayā avyakta tā
translated: The indistinctness in relation to the lamp is the non-apprehension of the substance.

analyzed: pekṣayā ātma bhāvaḥ
translated: The self-nature in relation to the non-apprehension is the existence.

original: bhāvarūpāvyaktatābhāva / iti bruvāṇas tathātmakābhāvarūpatā yāvad vyavasthāpyatām abhāvaikarasatvāt pratipatteḥ /
analyzed: bhāva rūpa avyakta tā bhāvaḥ iti bruvāṇaḥ tathā ātmaka abhāva rūpa tā yāvat vyavasthāpyatām abhāva eka rasa tvāt pratipatteḥ
translated: Saying the indistinctness in the form of existence, let it be established as having the form of non-existence up to that extent, because the understanding is of the single essence of non-existence.

original: na tu bhāvarūpāvyaktatāpattau pramāṇam astīti darśayati /
analyzed: na tu bhāva rūpa avyakta tā āpattau pramāṇam asti iti darśayati
translated: But there is no means of valid knowledge for the attainment of indistinctness in the form of existence, this is what is shown.

original: etad eva darśayann āha yadi hī /tyādi /
analyzed: etat eva darśayan āha yadi
translated: Showing just this, he says If indeed... etc.

analyzed: atra api
translated: Here also,

analyzed: asya vivaraṇam vivakṣitāt
translated: the explanation of by way of exclusion is from what is intended.

original: san bodhagocaraprāpto 'vadhijñānaviṣayatāpannaḥ tadbhāve / vahnyādibhāve naśyann iti /
analyzed: san bodha gocara prāptaḥ vadhi jñāna viṣaya tā āpannaḥ tad bhāve vahni ādi bhāve naśyan iti
translated: Existing, having come within the range of cognition, having become the object of determinate cognition, in the existence of that, i.e. in the existence of fire etc., it is destroyed.

analyzed: lakṣaṇa hetvoḥ kriyāyāḥ pā
translated: The characteristic and the cause are of the action.

analyzed: iti hetau śatu
translated: Thus, in the cause, there is the optative ending.

original: r vidhānāddhetupadam etat /🔽p / nanūktayā nītyā nāśasya tatkāryatopapatteḥ katham etad ācāryeṇoktam ity āśaṃkyāha ayam abhiprāya / iti /
analyzed: R vidhānāt hetu padam etat  nanu uktayā nītyā nāśasya tad kārya tā upapatteḥ katham etat ācāryeṇa uktam iti āśaṃkya āha ayam abhiprāyaḥ iti
translated: Because of the injunction, this is a causal statement.

original: syān matam pra na ca tatra pratītilakṣaṇārthakriyākārī /
analyzed: syāt matam tīti viṣayaḥ api na ca tatra pratīti lakṣaṇa artha kriyā kārī
translated: But, it may be argued, it is not the cause of the cognition of the object there.🔽If it is argued that it is not the cause of the cognition of the object there, because it is not apprehended as different from the object, then it is not so, because it is apprehended as different from the object.

original: yathā sādhyābhāve hetvabhāvarūpo vyatireko vikalpena pratīyamānaḥ na vikalpasya /
analyzed: yathā sādhya abhāve hetu abhāva rūpaḥ vyatirekaḥ vikalpena pratīyamānaḥ na vikalpasya
translated: As for the negative concomitance in the form of the absence of the reason in the absence of the probandum, which is cognized by conceptual cognition, it is not the cause of that conceptual cognition.

analyzed: kārakaḥ ca katham ucyate
translated: And how can it be said to be a cause?

original: na hy akāraṇaṃ viṣayo atiprasaṅgād iti /
analyzed: na hi akāraṇam viṣayaḥ atiprasaṅgāt iti
translated: For an object that is not a cause is an overextension.

original: naitad asti sākṣāt kārapravṛttajñānābhiprāyeṇa tad ukter na tatra vyabhicāro 'sti /
analyzed: na etat asti sākṣāt kāra pravṛtta jñāna abhiprāyeṇa tat ukteḥ na tatra vyabhicāraḥ u sti
translated: This is not so, because that was said with the intention of direct perception and cognition, so there is no fallacy there.

original: anenāpi ca tathāvidhajñānaviṣayeṇāvaśyabhāvyam anyathā🔽kāryakāraṇabhāvaḥ kathaṃ vyayasthāpyeta ata evāhatadviṣayasya / vā kathaṃ
analyzed: anena api ca tathāvidha jñāna viṣayeṇa avaśya bhāvyam anyathā pratyakṣa anupalambha nibandhanaḥ  kārya kāraṇa bhāvaḥ katham vyaya sthāpyeta atas vā katham
translated: And by this also, it must necessarily be an object of such cognition, otherwise🔽how could the relation of cause and effect be established? For this very reason, he says or how could

original: hetumattāvagatir iti vā sāmarthyasamaṃgitā sāmarthyayogitā bhāvatā / vastutā /
translated: the ascertainment of the presence of a reason be in the object of that? Or the fitness for capability, the fitness for connection, the existence, the reality,🔽of the extremely hidden,

analyzed: atyanta parokṣāṇam asarvajña apekṣayā sarvadā parokṣāṇām
translated: in relation to the non-omniscient.

analyzed: tarhi śabda arthaḥ ca atra prakaraṇāt draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: Then the meaning of the word tarhi should be seen here from the context.
It is intended that it is for the purpose of establishing inference.

original: jñātaheturūpatayā pratibhāsanaye cāmīṣāṃ pratiṣṭhitena rūpeṇa pratibhāsanam iti pareṇa darśitam /
analyzed: anena jñāta hetu rūpa tayā pratibhāsanaye ca amīṣām pratiṣṭhitena rūpeṇa pratibhāsanam iti pareṇa darśitam
translated: By the method of appearing as the form of the cause of the known, the appearance of these in their well-established form is shown by the opponent.

original: ne /ty anena abhāvasya pratiṣṭhitarūpāvabhāsanābhāvaṃ pareṇeṣṭaṃ nivartayati /
analyzed: anena abhāvasya pratiṣṭhita rūpa avabhāsana abhāvam pareṇa iṣṭam nivartayati
translated: By the word 'no' he sets aside the opponent's assertion that non-existence is the manifestation of an established form.

original: bhavitṛrūpatvena pratibhāsanam eva śaśaviṣāṇādyapekṣayāsyāpi / pratiṣṭhitarūpāvabhāsanam iti siddāntināpi darśitam /
analyzed: bhavitṛ rūpa tvena pratibhāsanam eva śaśaviṣāṇa ādi apekṣayā asya api pratiṣṭhita rūpa avabhāsanam iti siddāntinā api darśitam
translated: The manifestation as the form of an existent, even in the case of this [non-existence] in relation to the horn of a rabbit, etc., is the manifestation of an established form. This has been shown by the Siddhantin [i.e., Śāntarakṣita].

original: sarvasāmarthyśūnyatālakṣaṇenābhāve doṣāntaram anvācinvann āha sarvarūpavivekasya ceti / /
analyzed: sarva sāmarthya śūnyatā lakṣaṇena abhāve doṣa antaram anvācinvan āha sarva rūpa vivekasya ca iti
translated: Pointing out another fault in non-existence, which is characterized by the absence of all capacity, he says 'and the manifestation of the form of all things being distinguished, etc.'

analyzed: unmajjanam prakāśyam yat ca cakṣuḥ ādīnām pratiṣṭhita rūpa avabhāsana sadbhāva avabodha artham
translated: The manifestation, which is to be illuminated, is for the purpose of understanding the existence of the manifestation of an established form of the eye, etc.

original: teṣāṃ jñānaheturūpatayā pratibhāsanād iti pareṇeritaṃ tadabhāvepi vaktum
analyzed: teṣām jñāna hetu rūpa tayā pratibhāsanāt iti pareṇa īritam tad abhāve api śakyam vaktum
translated: In order to state that even in the absence of that [established form], it [the manifestation] manifests in the form of the cause of knowledge,

analyzed: iti darśayan āha jñāna viṣaya tayā iti
translated: showing this, he says 'as the object of knowledge,' etc.

original: pūrvaṃ tv atra gajanimīlikāṃ kṛtva anyad uktam /
analyzed: pūrvam tu atra gajanimīlikām kṛtvā anyat uktam
translated: But previously, having closed one's eyes here, something else was said.

analyzed: asya api tad hetu rūpa tayā avabhāsanasya tulya tvāt  cakṣuḥ ādi de
translated: Because this non-existence also equally manifests in the form of its cause.

analyzed: R iti prakaraṇāt
translated: 'Of the eye, etc.' is supplied from the context.

original: yadi nāmāsya jñānaviṣayatā tathāpi na taddhetutā tat kathaṃ taddheturūpatayāvabhāsanaṃ tulyam ucyata ity āha ahetoś ce /ti /
analyzed: yadi nāma asya jñāna viṣaya tā tathā api na tad hetu tā tat katham tad hetu rūpa tayā avabhāsanam tulyam ucyate iti āha ahetoḥ
translated: Even if it is an object of knowledge, it is not a cause of that. How then is the appearance as having the form of a cause said to be the same? He says: If it is not a cause...

analyzed: etat ca pūrva vat boddhavyam
translated: The word ca should be understood as before.

original: yady abhāvo nāma nāsty eva bhavanmate tarhi amūrabhāvabuddhayaḥ
analyzed: yadi abhāvaḥ nāma nā asti eva bhavat mate tarhi amūra bhāva buddhayaḥ
translated: If non-existence does not exist at all in your view, then the cognitions of non-existence

original: kamālamberann ity āha asmākaṃ tv i /ti svavāsanāparipākānvayā / iti hetubhāvena viśeṣaṇam /
analyzed: kam ālamberan iti āha asmākam tu sva vāsanā paripāka anvayāḥ iti hetu bhāvena viśeṣaṇam
translated: would have what as their object? He says: But for us... The word svavāsanāparipākanvaya is a qualification by way of cause.

original: tadvyatireki / tato nivṛttaṃ tadabhāvavad iti yāvat /
analyzed: tad vyatireki tatas nivṛttam tad abhāvavat iti yāvat
translated: Tadvya-tireki means different from that, i.e. having that as its absence, up to that extent.

original: saṃspṛśyeta / gṛhyeta tatparyudāsena / nivṛttyavadhivyudāsena /🔽sad iti na bhāvateti bruvatā yad asadātmakatvam asyopagataṃ tatra
analyzed: saṃspṛśyeta gṛhyeta tad paryudāsena nivṛtti avadhi vyudāsena  sat iti na bhāvatā iti bruvatā yat asat ātmaka tvam asya upagatam tatra
translated: Sansparśayet means would be grasped by the exclusion of that, by the exclusion of the determination of cessation.🔽By saying it exists and it is not an existent, what non-existent nature is admitted in this?

original: kiṃ svarūpeṇāsan kiṃ vā pararūpeṇeti pakṣayor ekaṃ bhāvaṃ dūṣayitum āha na cāsye /ti
analyzed: kim sva rūpeṇa asan kim vā para rūpeṇa iti pakṣayoḥ ekam bhāvam dūṣayitum āha na
translated: In order to refute one of the two possibilities, whether it is non-existent by its own nature or by another's nature, he says: And it is not...

analyzed: tuccha rūpeṇa api asataḥ rūpasya
translated: Asat means non-existent, tuccha-rūpeṇa means by the form of emptiness, i.e. not requiring the connection with another existent. Kincid rūpasya means of some form.

original: na ca p / bhāvābhāvayor yaugapadyam upapadyate kadācit /
analyzed: na ca bhāva abhāvayoḥ yaugapadyam upapadyate kadācid
translated: And the simultaneity of existence and non-existence is not possible at any time.

original: na hi jīvata eva maraṇam iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: na hi jīvataḥ eva maraṇam iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that death does not exist for one who is alive.

original: dhvaṃsena vināśaś ca kriyamāṇaḥ kiṃ tadātmā tato 'nyo mṛṣā bhāvāntararūpo vā tuccharūpo
analyzed: dhvaṃsena vināśaḥ ca kriyamāṇaḥ kim tad ātmā tatas nyaḥ mṛṣā bhāva antara rūpaḥ vā tuccha rūpaḥ
translated: And when destruction is being produced, is it the same as that [object], or is it something else, false, having the form of another existent, or having the form of emptiness?

original: veti tatra ye vikalpāḥ tatra tṛtīyasmin vikayyaṃ bhavatucāyaṃ / tatas
analyzed: vā iti tatra ye vikalpāḥ tatra tṛtīyasmin tatas
translated: Among those alternatives, let this be the third alternative. Then,

analyzed: tad bhāve pi nimittī isyādi kim iti ityādi
translated: even in the existence of that [object], it would be the cause. What is the use of this and so on?

analyzed: dūṣaṇa parihārayoḥ ābhīkṣaṇye ca anavasthau
translated: And in the mutual dependence of the refutation and the reply, there is an infinite regress.

analyzed: prāyavān āha tatas ca anavasthā iti
translated: And being inclined to brevity, he says And therefore there is an infinite regress.

analyzed: atas indhana ādeḥ nivṛtteḥ
translated: And because of the cessation of fuel and so on.

analyzed: katham iti siddhāntī
translated: How? says the one who upholds the established conclusion.
And the difference of that [object]...

original: dṛṣṭaṃ caitat sarvatra sahetuke 'nyatraiti darśayann āha śālī /tyādi /
analyzed: dṛṣṭam ca etat sarvatra sa hetuke nyatra eti darśayan āha
translated: And this is seen everywhere in what has a cause. To show this, he says shali and so on.

analyzed: bhāvasya
translated: Of an entity that is of one taste.

original: saṃkṣepeṇaitad atrānena vicāritam /🔽kṣaṇabhaṅgasiddhau tu vistareṇa tataś ca vistararucina tata evāvagantavyam /
analyzed: saṃkṣepeṇa etat atra anena vicāritam  kṣaṇabhaṅga siddhau tu vistareṇa tatas ca vistara rucina tatas evā avagantavyam
translated: This has been considered in brief here by him.🔽But in the proof of momentariness, it should be understood in detail from there itself by one who delights in detail.

original: sāpy asmadīyākṣaṇabhaṅgasiddhir apekṣitavyeti abhiprāyavān āha vistarataś ce /ti /
analyzed: sā api asmadīya akṣaṇa bhaṅga siddhiḥ apekṣitavyā iti abhiprāyavān āha vistarataḥ
translated: And that proof of momentariness by us should be accepted. With this intention, he says and in detail...

original: syād etat na bhavaty eva kevalam ity kim agnyādisaṃyogakāle tasya svarūpābhāvaḥ pratipādyate kim vā tadanuvṛttiḥ /
analyzed: syāt etat na bhavati eva kevalam iti anena kim agni ādi saṃyoga kāle tasya sva rūpa abhāvaḥ pratipādyate kim vā tad anuvṛttiḥ
translated: This may be said: If it does not exist at all, is it taught that at the time of conjunction with fire etc. there is an absence of its own nature, or is there a continuation of that?

original: na tāvat tadanuvṛttir akṣaṇikatvaprasaṅgād aśabdārthatvāc ca /
analyzed: na tāvat tad anuvṛttiḥ akṣaṇika tva prasaṅgāt aśabdārtha tvāt ca
translated: First, there is no continuation of that, because of the consequence of non-momentariness and because of the meaninglessness of the word.

original: abhāvapratipādane ca pūrvoktā doṣāḥ prasajyerann iti /
analyzed: abhāva pratipādane ca pūrva uktāḥ doṣāḥ prasajyeran iti
translated: And if absence is taught, the previously mentioned faults would ensue.

analyzed: na eṣa doṣaḥ
translated: This is not a fault.

original: anayā hi vacanabhaṅgyā parasaṃkucitakālasthāpyutpattikāla eva sa dvitīye kṣaṇe na kiñcid iti yadrūpaṃ bhāvasya /
analyzed: anayā hi vacana bhaṅgyā para saṃkucita kāla sthāpi utpatti kālaḥ eva sa dvitīye kṣaṇe na kiñcid iti yat rūpam bhāvasya tat pratipādyate
translated: For by this analysis of the statement, at the time of arising, which is established as the contracted time of another, in the second moment it is nothing at all, that is the nature of an existent.

analyzed: na tu kiñcid vidhīyate
translated: But nothing is enjoined.

original: ata evāha nāsyābhavanam anyad vā bhavatīti / /
analyzed: atas eva āha na asya abhavanam anyat vā bhavati iti
translated: For this very reason he says: Its non-existence or another does not occur.

original: mā bhūd agnisaṃyogādir nāśasya kartā kiṃ naścchinaṃ yadi parahetur asti ity āha akartur ahetutvam🔽i /ti / sa khalu tasya karttā vyayatepaṭhyate
analyzed: mā bhūt agni saṃyoga ādiḥ nāśasya kartā kim yadi para hetuḥ asti iti āha akartuḥ ahetu tvam  sa khalu tasya karttā
translated: Let there be no agent of destruction such as conjunction with fire etc., what is the harm if there is another cause? He says: An agent is not a cause.

original: yaḥ prāgbhāvī sannarthāntaraṃ svānvayavyatirekāv anuvidhāpayati yathā cakṣurādi vijñānasya /
analyzed: yaḥ prāc bhāvī san artha antaram sva anvaya vyatirekau anuvidhāpayati yathā cakṣuḥ ādi vijñānasya
translated: He is indeed declared to be the agent of that, who, existing before, brings about another entity and its own concomitance and non-concomitance, just as the eye etc. are of consciousness.

analyzed: eva hetu tvam
translated: In the same way, he is a cause.

analyzed: tad bhāve bhāvasya tad abhāve ca abhāvasya hetu lakṣaṇa tvāt
translated: Because the presence of the effect when the cause is present and the absence of the effect when the cause is absent are the characteristics of the cause.

original: agnyādibhāve ca bhavanadharmaṇaḥ kasyacid bhācid abhā
analyzed: agni ādi bhāve ca bhavana dharmaṇaḥ kasyacid bhā cit abhā
translated: And because something that exists when fire exists and does not exist when fire does not exist

original: vāt kartṛtvābhāve katham iva tallakṣaṇam hetutvam eva saṃgamyata iti caivāṃvaditur abhiprāyaḥ /
analyzed: vāt kartṛ tva abhāve katham iva tad lakṣaṇam hetu tvam eva saṃgamyate iti ca evāṃvadituḥ abhiprāyaḥ
translated: is not an agent, how can the characteristic of being a cause be applied to it? This is the intention of the speaker.

analyzed: tad aviṣayaḥ
translated: That is not its object.

analyzed: sambandhi tā  vā ayam s
translated: The relation.🔽This is the meaning.

analyzed: eka rūpasya s
translated: Of a single form.

original: sūcyagreṣu sthātum aśaktaḥ sarṣapa / iti yojyam /
analyzed: sthātum aśaktaḥ sarṣapaḥ iti yojyam
translated: It should be connected as unable to stand on the tip of a needle.

analyzed: yathāyogam sambandhaḥ hetu antara apekṣita tvam tad viruddham ca anapekṣi tvam
translated: The relation is according to the appropriate case. And the opposite is not requiring.

analyzed: tena ca prāptam vyāptam s
translated: And by that, it is obtained, pervaded, and

analyzed: tat svābhāvyam iti
translated: natural.

analyzed: sūbhyagresthā s  vacanam vivakṣitam
translated: Standing on the tip of a needle.🔽By the word opportunity, a statement that is an opportunity is intended.

analyzed: tena avasara prāptam vacanam āśaṅkya iti arthaḥ boddhavyaḥ
translated: Therefore, the meaning should be understood as suspecting a statement that has obtained an opportunity.

analyzed: evam anyatra api evaṃvidhe prayoge jñeyam
translated: In the same way, it should be known in other such usages.

analyzed: dṛṣṭāntāt
translated: The one who has come from the example is the one to whom the example applies.

analyzed: kuśūla śabdena ghaṭa ādi racitaḥ ādhāra viśeṣaḥ ucyate
translated: By the word granary, a particular container made of pot and so on is meant.

analyzed: tad ādau yasya sa tathā uktaḥ
translated: That which has the state of being in the beginning is said to be like that.

analyzed: kam s
translated: What is the case.

original: p / avasthānām iva / ātmanaḥ prātisvikarūpasya tadbhede /vasthābhede /
analyzed: avasthānām iva ātmanaḥ prātisvika rūpasya
translated: As of the states. Of the self, of the individual form, in its difference, in the difference of the states.

original: kathaṃcit / kenāpi prakāreṇābheda ity arthasya rakhaladgatipadam evaitat /
analyzed: kathaṃcid kena api prakāreṇa abhedaḥ iti arthasya rakhalat gati padam eva etat
translated: Somehow, by some means. The word going is used to indicate the meaning of non-difference.

analyzed: tanoḥ bhedāt eva bheda prasaṅgaḥ bhinna rūpa tā prasaṅgaḥ
translated: The consequence of difference is due to the difference of the body itself, the consequence of having a different form.

analyzed: tadvat
translated: Like that, like the one who has non-different states.

analyzed: abhedasya vā prasaṅge iti prakṛta tvāt yojyam
translated: Or of non-difference. This should be connected because it is the subject.

original: nanu yadi bhedābhedau caikāntikau syātāṃ syād anantarokto doṣaḥ /
analyzed: nanu yadi bheda abhedau ca aikāntikau syātām syāt anantara uktaḥ doṣaḥ
translated: But if difference and non-difference were absolute, there would be the fault stated just before.

original: yāvatā tayor api kenacid rūpeṇa bhedaḥ kenacid abheda ity āśaṃkamāna āha tayor apī /ti /
analyzed: yāvatā tayoḥ api kenacid rūpeṇa bhedaḥ kenacid abhedaḥ iti āśaṃkamānaḥ āha tayoḥ
translated: As long as there is difference of those two in some form and non-difference in some form, thinking this, he says of those two and so on.

analyzed: tayoḥ bheda abhedayoḥ
translated: Of those two, difference and non-difference.

original: avasthā ca tadvānavasthāvāṃś ca tayor ātmānau tayoś ca /
analyzed: avasthā ca tadvān avasthāvān ca tayoḥ ātmānau tayoḥ ca
translated: The states and the one who has the states, and of those two.

analyzed: tasya api rūpa antarasya
translated: Of that also, of the form that is accepted as the cause of non-difference, even though it is different.

analyzed: tābhyām
translated: By the states and by the one who has the states.

original: anyathā yadi tābhyāṃ tasyābhedanimittasya rūpāntarasya kathañcid bhedo na syād aikātmyaṃ yadi syād ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: anyathā yadi tābhyām tasya abheda nimittasya rūpa antarasya kathañcid bhedaḥ na syāt aikātmyam yadi syāt iti arthaḥ
translated: Otherwise, if by those two there were somehow no difference of that form which is the cause of non-difference, if there were identity, this is the meaning.

original: sa cāsāv abhedanimittaikasvabhāvaś ceti tathā tasmāt / /
analyzed: sa ca asau abheda nimitta eka svabhāvaḥ ca iti tathā tasmāt
translated: And that is the one nature which is the cause of non-difference. Thus it is so.

original: bhedābhedāv i /ti vadituś cāyam āśayaḥ ekātmyapakṣe abhedanimitte rūpāntare vā tābhyām avasthātadvadbhyām anupraveṣṭavyaṃ tayor vā
analyzed: bheda abhedau vadituḥ ca ayam āśayaḥ ekātmya pakṣe abheda nimitte rūpa antare vā tābhyām avasthā tadvadbhyām anupraveṣṭavyam tayoḥ vā
translated: And the intention of one who speaks of difference and non-difference is this: In the case of identity, either the states and the possessor of states should enter into that other nature which is the cause of non-difference, or

original: rūpāntareṇa /🔽tatra yadi tayor abhedanimitte rūpāntare anupraveśas tadābhinnarūpamātrasya bhāvād avasthātadvator abheda eveti bhedasya vārtāpi na syāt /
analyzed: tena a bheda nimittena rūpa antareṇa  tatra yadi tayoḥ abheda nimitte rūpa antare anupraveśaḥ tadā abhinna rūpa mātrasya bhāvāt avasthā tadvatoḥ abhedaḥ evā iti bhedasya vārtā api na syāt
translated: they should enter into another nature.🔽If they enter into that other nature which is the cause of non-difference, then due to the existence of only the undifferentiated nature, there would be non-difference between the states and the possessor of states, so there would not even be a mention of difference.

original: atha tasyābhedanimittasya rūpāntarasya tayor anupraveśas tadāvasthātadvantāv evāvasthitāv ity apagatam abhedeneti /
analyzed: atha tasya abheda nimittasya rūpa antarasya tayoḥ anupraveśaḥ tad avasthā tadvantau eva avasthitau iti apagatam abhedena iti
translated: But if that other nature which is the cause of non-difference enters into them, then the states and the possessor of states remain as they are, so non-difference is rejected.

original: evaṃ tarhi tasyāstu tābhyāṃ kathañcid bheda ity āha /ti /
analyzed: evam tarhi tasya astu tābhyām kathañcid bhedaḥ iti āha
translated: If so, then let there be some kind of difference between that and those two. He says:

original: kathañcit ta /d etābhyām iti tu prakaraṇāt /
analyzed: kathañcid etābhyām iti tu prakaraṇāt
translated: That is somehow different from these two is due to the context.

analyzed: rūpa antarasya tābhyām kiñcid bheda nibandhanam
translated: That is the basis. The other nature has some basis for difference from those two.

analyzed: yathā pūrvam tathā asya api
translated: Just as before, so also for this other nature.
That is different. The basis for some kind of difference.

original: ayam asya bhāvaḥ tasyāparasya rūpasya tebhyo 'vasthātadvadbhedanimittarūpāntarebhyaḥ
analyzed: ayam asya bhāvaḥ tasya aparasya rūpasya tebhyaḥ vasthā tadvat bheda nimitta rūpa antarebhyaḥ
translated: This is his meaning: That other form of it [i.e., the cognition] is somehow different from those other forms that are the basis for the distinction of states and their possessors.

analyzed: kathañcid bhedaḥ nyathā tad apara eka svabhāvāt abhedāt avasthā avasthātṛ abheda nimitta rūpa antarāṇām
translated: Otherwise, due to non-difference from that other single nature, the other forms that are the basis for the distinction of states and their possessors

analyzed: prāktanena nyāyena atyaṃtam bheda abhedau prasajyeyātām
translated: would absurdly entail absolute difference and non-difference by the previous reasoning.

original: atas tebhyas tasya kathañcidbhede 'vaśyaiṣitavye tannibandhanam aparasyāpi rūpasyāparaṃ rūpam upaitavyam iti /
analyzed: atas tebhyaḥ tasya kathañcid bhede vaśyā eṣitavye tat nibandhanam aparasya api rūpasya aparam rūpam upaitavyam iti
translated: Therefore, when its difference from them is necessarily to be accepted in some way, the basis for that must be accepted as another form of that other [form].

original: tathā tadanyatrāpy evam evety aparimitarūpataivaikasya / syāt /
analyzed: tathā tad anyatra api evam evā iti aparimita rūpa tā eva ekasya syāt
translated: Thus, it is only the possession of unlimited forms that would be [the basis for the difference].
With thus and so on, he concludes the topic.

analyzed: tad bādhām pratyakṣa bādhām
translated: Contradicted by that means contradicted by perception.

analyzed: anena etat darśayati
translated: This shows the following.

original: na pratyakṣā satī pratyabhijñā bādhyate kiṃtu bādhyamānā pratyakṣābhāsā seti /
analyzed: na pratyakṣā satī pratyabhijñā bādhyate kiṃtu bādhyamānā pratyakṣa ābhāsā sā iti
translated: The recognized [cognition] is not contradicted when it is perception, but when it is contradicted, it is a semblance of perception.

original: etac copariṣṭād abhidhāsyate /🔽anekānto 'niścayo bhavet🔽aniścayaphalatvaṃ saṃśayahetutvaṃ syād iti yāvat /
analyzed: etat ca upariṣṭāt abhidhāsyate  niścayaḥ bhavet          syāt
translated: And this will be explained later.🔽Inconclusiveness would be [the result].🔽Inconclusiveness would be the result, meaning it would be the cause of doubt.

analyzed: anaikāntika tā bhavet
translated: Inconclusiveness would be [the result].

analyzed: etat eva eva
translated: This is exactly the same.

analyzed: iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: of that which has the characteristic of an object.

analyzed: dharmi lakṣaṇasya s
translated: Of that which has the characteristic of an object.

original: p / na cāceyam avasthā kāryavijñānātiriktaṃ jñānaṃ janayati yena jñānalakṣaṇāyām
analyzed: na ca acā iyam avasthā kārya vijñāna atiriktam jñānam janayati yena jñāna lakṣaṇāyām
translated: And this [object] does not generate a cognition that is different from the cognition of the effect, by which [cognition] it would be useful in the characteristic of cognition.

original: arthakriyāyām asyopayogāt sāmarthyaṃ kalpyety abhiprāyeṇa sarvasāmarthyavirahalakṣaṇasye /ty avocad iti /
analyzed: arthakriyāyām asya upayogāt sāmarthyam kalpyā iti abhiprāyeṇa avocat iti
translated: With the intention that its capability is imagined due to its usefulness in the function of cognition, [he] said of that which has the characteristic of being devoid of all capability.

analyzed: anubhāvāt  hetau bādhā anubhavāt arthaḥ
translated: From experience.🔽The meaning is: from the experience of the absence of contradiction in the cause, from the non-existence of contradiction.

original: bādhāsadbhāvād bādhavarjitam iti sāmānyapramāṇalakṣaṇasyābhāvaṃ pratipādya viśeṣalakṣaṇasyāpy abhāvaṃ pratipādayituṃ tatpratibhāsiniś ce /tyādinopakramate
analyzed: bādhā sadbhāvāt bādha varjitam iti sāmānya pramāṇa lakṣaṇasya abhāvam pratipādya viśeṣa lakṣaṇasya api abhāvam pratipādayitum
translated: Having taught the absence of the general characteristic of valid cognition, in order to teach the absence of the specific characteristic as well, [he] begins with that which appears in it, etc.

original: ekarūpābhāve kathaṃ tattvādhyavasāyaḥ syāt sarveṣām ity āśaṅkyānyathaivāsyopapattim upasaṃhāravyājena āha tasmād i /tyādi
analyzed: eka rūpa abhāve katham tattva adhyavasāyaḥ syāt sarveṣām iti āśaṅkya anyathā eva asya upapattim upasaṃhāra vyājena darśayan āha tasmāt
translated: How could there be a determination of reality for all if there is no single form? Fearing this, [he] states the establishment of this in another way by way of a summary, saying therefore, etc.

analyzed: nirantara sadṛśam vivakṣitam
translated: By the word similar, uninterrupted similarity is intended.

original: tena nirantarasya sadṛśasyāparasya bhāva /s tannirantaranibandhanety arthaḥ /
analyzed: tena nirantarasya sadṛśasya aparasya tad nirantara nibandhanā iti arthaḥ
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that it is the cause of the continuous existence of a similar other.

analyzed: keśa ādiṣu lūna punar ārūḍheṣu iti arthāt avaseyam
translated: It should be understood that this refers to hair etc. that have been cut and grown again.

original: ākārasāmyamātreṇāpahṛtaṃ prakaraṇāt yathātvaniścayāyogyīkṛtaṃ hṛdayaṃ / ceto yeṣāṃ teṣām /
analyzed: ākāra sāmya mātreṇa apahṛtam prakaraṇāt yathātva niścaya ayogyīkṛtam hṛdayam cetaḥ yeṣām teṣām
translated: Those whose hearts have been carried away by mere similarity of form, made incapable of ascertainment by the context, are those whose minds are so.

original: nanu yadi ākārasya sādṛśyaṃ nāma tvanmate kiñcit syāt tanmātrāpahṛtahṛdayāḥ pratyabhijānīyuḥ /
analyzed: nanu yadi ākārasya sāmyam sādṛśyam nāma tvad mate kiñcid syāt tanmātra apahṛta hṛdayāḥ pratyabhijānīyuḥ
translated: If in your view there were something called similarity of form, they would recognize it merely by that.

analyzed: na ca etat asti
translated: But this is not so.

original: tat katham evam uktam ity āha na ce /ti /
analyzed: tat katham evam uktam iti āha na
translated: How is it that this has been said? He says: If not, etc.
In the establishment of a single object by the knowledge of a single idea,

analyzed: bhede pi niyatāḥ kecid svabhāvena indriya ādi vat
translated: some, though different, are restricted by nature, like the senses, etc.

analyzed: ityādinā vipañcita tvāt evam uktam
translated: This has been explained by the statement beginning with The means of valid knowledge, etc.

analyzed: teṣu bhāveṣu
translated: In those things.

original: trayāṇām api rūpāṇāṃ pramāṇasiddhatvāt iyaṃ vyāpakānupalabdhiḥ / /
analyzed: trayāṇām api rūpāṇām pramāṇa siddha tvāt svataṃtra hetuḥ iyam vyāpaka anupalabdhiḥ
translated: This is the non-apprehension of the pervader, because all three forms are established by means of valid knowledge.

analyzed: anena pratyabhijñānena pratyakṣa rūpeṇa pratividhānam
translated: This is the reply to the statement beginning with If not ascertained by this recognition which is of the nature of perception, etc.

original: tāvad asya bādhakatvaṃ na bhavati yāvat pratyabhijñānasyāprāmāṇyaṃ na siddhyati /
analyzed: tāvat asya bādhaka tvam na bhavati yāvat pratyabhijñānasya aprāmāṇyam na siddhyati
translated: As long as the unreality of recognition is not established, it cannot be a sublater of that.

original: anyathā anenaiva bādhyamānaviṣayatvād asya kathaṃ prāmāṇyaṃ yena bādhakatvaṃ syāt /🔽tāvac ca tasyāprāmāṇyaṃ nopapadyate yāvad anumānasyāsya prāmāṇyasiddhyābodhakatvaṃ na /
analyzed: anyathā anena eva bādhyamāna viṣaya tvāt asya katham prāmāṇyam yena bādhaka tvam syāt  tāvat ca tasya aprāmāṇyam nā upapadyate yāvat anumānasya asya prāmāṇya siddhyā bodhaka tvam na
translated: Otherwise, how can it be valid, since it has an object that is sublated by that very [recognition]? By what [means] could it be a sublater?🔽And as long as this [recognition] is not established as a means of valid knowledge, its unreality is not possible.

original: itarathā bādhavarjitatvādilakṣaṇasambhave prāmāṇyāpracyutir itītaretarāśrayatvaṃ doṣa ity āśaṅkyamānam āha nāpī /ti /
analyzed: itarathā bādha varjita tva ādi lakṣaṇa sambhave prāmāṇya apracyutiḥ iti itaretara āśraya tvam doṣaḥ iti āśaṅkyamānam āha
translated: Otherwise, if it were to be a means of valid knowledge, there would be a fault of mutual dependence, since it would be possible to have the characteristics of being free from sublation, etc. Anticipating this, he says Nor is it...

original: anumāna /śabdenopacārāl liṅgam abhipretya svasādhyapratibandhād i /tyādy uktam /
translated: By the word inference, the inferential mark is intended, and it is said because of the connection with its own probandum, etc.

original: yadi vā liṅgasyety adhyāhāryam avacane ca pramāṇalakṣaṇayukte bādhasambhave tallakṣaṇam eva dūṣitaṃ syād iti sarvatrānāśvāsa ity
analyzed: yadi vā liṅgasya iti adhyāhāryam avacane ca pramāṇa lakṣaṇa yukte bādha sambhave tad lakṣaṇam eva dūṣitam syāt iti sarvatra anāśvāsaḥ iti
translated: Or, of the inferential mark should be supplied. And if there could be sublation in the case of what is not stated as having the characteristics of a means of valid knowledge, then the very characteristic [of a means of valid knowledge] would be refuted, and there would be no confidence anywhere.

original: p / naivaṃ brūmahe / kintu pratyakṣābhāsā satī cārthād avatiṣṭhate /
analyzed: na evam brūmahe kintu pratyakṣa ābhāsā satī ca arthāt avatiṣṭhate
translated: We do not say this. Rather, it is a semblance of perception, but it is established from the object.

original: anumānasya virodho bādhas tam aśruvānā / vyāpnuvatī bhajamāneti yāvat /
analyzed: anumānasya virodhaḥ bādhaḥ tam aśruvānā vyāpnuvatī bhajamānā iti yāvat
translated: The contradiction of inference is sublation, which is not heard. It pervades, it is said.

original: ākārasya / rūpasya sāmānyād / ekatāṃ / tattvaṃpratīyatī / niścinvatī /
analyzed: ākārasya rūpasya ekatām
translated: Of the form, of the appearance, from the universal. It cognizes oneness, it ascertains reality.

analyzed: phalasya saṅgrahaḥ
translated: The word ādi includes the result.

analyzed: sūrya uparājita śabdena yasya rūḍhiḥ
translated: By the word surya-uparājita, which has a conventional meaning.

analyzed: etat anubhavati
translated: This is experienced.

analyzed: sāmyāt s
translated: From similarity.

analyzed: pratiyatī s
translated: It cognizes.

original: atha kiṃ na ca sa pakṣe kvacid vartata / ity asiddhatve kāraṇam idam uktam /
analyzed: atha kim na ca sa pakṣe kvacid vartate iti asiddha tve kāraṇam idam uktam
translated: Now, if it does not exist anywhere in the subject, this is stated as the reason for its being unestablished.

original: evañ cet na tarhīyantaṃ kālaṃ bhavān buddhavān asiddhalakṣaṇam /
analyzed: evam ced na tarhi iyantam kālam bhavān buddhavān asiddha lakṣaṇam
translated: If so, then you have not known the definition of the unestablished for so long.

analyzed: pakṣa vṛtti ādinā prakāreṇa hetoḥ tathābhāvāt iti
translated: Because the reason exists in that way by the mode of existing in the subject and so on.

original: yuktam avādīd idaṃ bhavān yadi paraṃ tadāyam asiddho hetur i /ti vaditur abhiprāyaṃ nājñāsīt /
analyzed: yuktam avādīt idam bhavān yadi param tadā ayam asiddhaḥ hetuḥ vadituḥ abhiprāyam na ajñāsīt
