translated: You would rightly say this if you said to the other: This reason is unestablished. If you did not understand the intention of the one who says this.

original: ayaṃ khalv asyābhiprāyaḥ nāma vikalpaviśeṣa eṣaḥ /
analyzed: ayam khalu asya abhiprāyaḥ pratyabhijñā nāma vikalpa viśeṣaḥ eṣaḥ
translated: This is the intention of this: a particular conceptualization.

original: sa ca vikalpasya viṣayo yaḥ śabdasya viṣayaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca vikalpasya viṣayaḥ yaḥ śabdasya viṣayaḥ
translated: And that is the object of conceptualization, which is the object of words.

analyzed: śabda saṃsṛṣṭa artha pratibhāsi tvāt vikalpasya
translated: Because the appearance of conceptualization is mixed with words.

original: sa ca śabdasya viṣayo yaḥ saṃketasya viṣayaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca śabdasya viṣayaḥ yaḥ saṃketasya viṣayaḥ
translated: And that is the object of the word, which is the object of the convention.

original: vācyavācakabhāvasambandhasya vāstavasya vyudastatvāt /🔽na cāsāmārthyavaiyarthyābhyāṃ svalakṣaṇātmani saṃketaḥ kartum śakyata iti kathaṃ bhāvāḥ kecid abhipi
analyzed: vācya vācaka bhāva sambandhasya vāstavasya vyudasta tvāt  na ca a sāmārthya vaiyarthyābhyām sva lakṣaṇa ātmani saṃketaḥ kartum śakyate iti katham bhāvāḥ kecid
translated: Because the real relation of denoted and denotative has been refuted.
And because it is not possible to make a convention regarding the nature of specific individuality, which is inexpressible and useless, how can some things be the objects of recognition?

analyzed: tatratat na
translated: They are not.

analyzed: pratyabhijñāpana tvam jñāyamāna tvam
translated: Recognition is the object of knowledge.

analyzed: siddhim adhyāsīta
translated: One should consider the establishment of that.

original: yad yat pratyabhijñāyate tat tat pūrvāparayoḥ kālayor ekasvabhāvaṃ yathedam ititathāgatān pratipādayitum aśakyatvāt vyāptyasiddhyānaikāntikaś 🔽cāyam iti /🔽prauḍhavāditayā siddhim abhyupagamyāpi dūṣaṇāntarābhidhitsayā siddhāntavādino na ce /tyādivākyam /
analyzed: yat yat pratyabhijñāyate tat tat pūrva aparayoḥ kālayoḥ eka svabhāvam yathā idam iti tathāgatān pratipādayitum aśakya tvāt vyāpti asiddhyā anaikāntikaḥ  ca ayam iti  prauḍha vādi tayā siddhim abhyupagamya api dūṣaṇa antara abhidhitsayā siddhāntavādinaḥ na
translated: Whatever is recognized, that is of one nature in the two times, like this. Because it is impossible to demonstrate that to the Tathāgatas, this is inconclusive due to the non-establishment of pervasion.🔽Even accepting establishment out of boldness, the proponent of the conclusion states the sentence na ca etc. out of a desire to state another fault.

original: yad vā dūṣaṇāntaram anvācinvann āha na ce /ti /
analyzed: yat vā dūṣaṇa antaram anvācinvan āha na
translated: Or, stating another fault, he says na ca etc.

analyzed: bruvatā ca idam darśitam
translated: By saying due to the absence of the nature of producing knowledge, this is shown.

original: yadi sarveṣāṃ janakasvabhāvatā tasyāṃ cānyāpekṣitā syāt syād adanaikāntikatvam /
analyzed: yadi sarveṣām janaka svabhāva tā tasyām ca anya apekṣi tā syāt syāt at anaikāntika tvam
translated: If the nature of producing all [causes] were dependent on another in that [nature of producing], there would be the fault of inconclusive [reason].

analyzed: na ca idam asti iti
translated: But this is not the case.

analyzed: viśeṣa vacanaḥ
translated: The word difference means distinction.

analyzed: jñāne iti padam na asti
translated: The word knowledge is missing.

original: prakṛte tava kim āyātam ity āha tadvad i /ti /
analyzed: prakṛte tava kim āyātam iti āha tadvat
translated: What is the relevance to your argument? He says in the same way.

original: taiḥ / bījādibhiḥ anekānta iti maulasya hetor iti draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: taiḥ bīja ādibhiḥ anekāntaḥ iti maulasya hetoḥ iti draṣṭavyam
translated: By those means by the seeds and so on. Inconclusive should be seen as referring to the original reason.

original: p / na saha /śabdo yugapadarthavṛttirācāryeṇeṣṭo 'pi tu sahodaravad ekārthavṛttiḥ /
analyzed: na yugapad artha vṛttiḥ ācāryeṇa iṣṭaḥ tu sahodara vat eka artha vṛttiḥ
translated: The word together is not accepted by the master to mean simultaneously, but rather to mean having the same object like siblings.

original: api tu ekārthakaraṇam api / yadvarṇam iti kiṃ sahakārilakṣaṇaparvaṇi pratipādayiṣyate /
analyzed: api tu eka artha karaṇam api yad varṇam iti kim sahakāri lakṣaṇa parvaṇi pratipādayiṣyate
translated: But also having the same object. What is called varṇa will be explained as the characteristic of a cooperating cause on the chapter on that.

original: na ca yugapatkāritvād eva bhāvānāṃ parasparasahakāritvaṃ ghaṭate /
analyzed: na ca yugapad kāri tvāt eva bhāvānām paraspara sahakāri tvam ghaṭate
translated: And the mutual cooperation of things is not possible just because of simultaneous action.

original: ghaṭapaṭādīnām api kadā svāṃ svā arthakriyāṃ kurvatām api tathābhāvaprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: ghaṭa paṭa ādīnām api kadā svām arthakriyām kurvatām api tathābhāva prasaṅgāt
translated: Because even for a pot, a cloth, and so on, when they are performing their own functions at the same time, there would be the fault of that being the case.

original: tat kathaṃ sahakāriṣu yugapatkaraṇaśīleṣu / ity etadbhaṭṭārcaṭo vyācaṣṭa iti cet /
analyzed: tat katham sahakāriṣu yugapad karaṇa śīleṣu iti etat bhaṭṭārcaṭaḥ vyācaṣṭe iti ced
translated: So how is it in the case of cooperating causes that act simultaneously? If you explain this as Bhattarakita did,

analyzed: na ayam doṣaḥ
translated: this is not a fault.

original: na hi sahaśabdasya etad vyākhyānaṃ yugapad ity api tu bhāvikāraṇānabhyupagame avaśyam ekārthakāriṇām ekadā karaṇam ity ekārthaṃ buddhāvāropya
analyzed: na hi saha śabdasya etat vyākhyānam yugapad iti api tu bhāvi kāraṇa anabhyupagame avaśyam ekārtha kāriṇām ekadā karaṇam iti ekārtham buddhau āropya
translated: For this is not an explanation of the word together: at the same time, but rather, when the real cause is not accepted, the performance at one time of those that perform the same function is superimposed on the cognition as one meaning,

analyzed: vāstavam rūpam idam anūditam
translated: and this real form is stated.

analyzed: tena yugapad eka artha karaṇa śīleṣu iti
translated: Therefore, [the verse says] those that have the nature of performing the same function at the same time.

original: ekārthakāritvam eva tu lakṣaṇaṃ na tu yugapatkaraṇam avaśyaṃbhāvyapi vyabhicārāt /
analyzed: ekārtha kāri tvam eva tu lakṣaṇam na tu yugapad karaṇam avaśyaṃbhāvi api vyabhicārāt
translated: But the definition is just performing the same function, not necessarily performing at the same time, because of deviation.

analyzed: prājñāḥ punar etat yathāśruti samarthayanti
translated: But the wise support this as it is heard.

analyzed: nanu lābhaḥ mahān ayam iti
translated: Is this not a great gain?

analyzed: na ca kācid akṣamā
translated: And there is no incapacity.

analyzed: vyācakṣāṇaḥ vaiśabdam avadhāraṇe darśayati
translated: Not so. The one who explains shows the word eva in the sense of determination.

original: kaḥ punas tatretareṣāṃ vyāpāra ity āha bhavaneti / /
analyzed: kaḥ punar tatra itareṣām vyāpāraḥ iti āha
translated: But what is the operation of the others there? He says in becoming.

analyzed: vyāpāra upayogasya asya pāramārthika tvam kāraka tvam
translated: This utility of operation is real, it is the nature of being a causal agent.

analyzed: ti saṃbandhanīyam
translated: should be connected.

analyzed: kutas etat iti apekṣāyām kārya ityādi yojyam
translated: When there is expectation of from where is this?, from the effect and so on should be added.

analyzed: upacārāt kāraka tvasya iti prakṛta tvāt
translated: Because of figurative usage. Since the nature of being a causal agent is the subject.

analyzed: tathā tadvat
translated: In the same way. Like that.

analyzed: tatas eva sva sannidhi mātratas eva
translated: From that itself. From mere proximity to itself.

analyzed: svatas eva kāraṇa vyāpāra nirapekṣāt rūpāt eva
translated: From itself. From form itself, without depending on the operation of a cause.

analyzed: ātmanaḥ iti kārya ātmanaḥ
translated: Of the effect. Of the effect that is the self.

analyzed: prāk api janmanaḥ pūrvam api
translated: Even before. Even before birth.

original: rūparūpiṇor ananyatvād ity abhipretya ity u /ktam /
analyzed: rūpa rūpiṇoḥ ananya tvāt iti abhipretya iti
translated: With the intention that form and the bearer of form are not different, it is said.

analyzed: tat kutas sattvāt
translated: How is that? Because of non-existence.

original: yatra sthitena kāryaṃ janayitavyaṃ sa kāryadeśo /bhipretaḥ /
analyzed: yatra sthitena kāryam janayitavyam sa kārya deśaḥ
translated: The place of the effect is intended as the place where the effect is to be produced by what is present.

original: yaś cāsāv abhiprāyaś ceti tathā tadvatā / /
analyzed: yaḥ ca asau abhiprāyaḥ ca iti tathā tadvatā
translated: And that which is the intention, and so on, is like that by the possessor of that.

original: nanu sarveṣāṃ aṅkurotpāde sāmarthyāpracyuteranekāṅkureṇa niyatam utpattavyam eveti yat pareṇa prakaṭitam tat katham evaṃbruvatāpahastitam ity
analyzed: nanu sarveṣām aṅkura utpāde sāmarthya apracyuteḥ aneka aṅkureṇa niyatam utpattavyam eva iti yat pareṇa prakaṭitam tat katham evaṃbruvatā apahastitam iti
translated: But since all have the ability to produce the sprout, it would certainly arise from many sprouts, as has been made clear by the opponent. How is that refuted by one who speaks thus?

analyzed: āśaṃkya āha ayam abhiprāyaḥ iti
translated: With this doubt in mind, he says: This is the intention.

analyzed: yugapad kartṛbhyaḥ iti pūrvavat boddhavyam
translated: Simultaneously. It should be understood as before.

original: ukte sati kim nāma pratīyatām iti tatsvabhāvasya jananād ity asyānaikāntikatve maulasyāpi tathātvamanivāryam iti parasyāśayaḥ /
analyzed: ukte sati kim nāma pratīyatām iti tad svabhāvasya jananāt iti asya anaikāntika tve maulasya api tathātvam anivāryam iti parasya āśayaḥ
translated: When this is said, what is understood? The opponent's intention is that if the reason is inconclusive in the production of that nature, then the original [reason] cannot be excluded as such.

original: na kāraṇabhedāt kāryabhedaḥ syād i /ti prasaṅge kāryābhedasya bādhake pareṇokte katham etat tadbādhakaṃ bhavatīty āśaṃkyāha evaṃ manyata
analyzed: na kāraṇa bhedāt kārya bhedaḥ syāt prasaṅge kārya abhedasya bādhake pareṇa ukte katham etat tat bādhakam bhavati iti āśaṃkya āha evam manyata
translated: Not that there should be a difference in the effect due to a difference in the cause. When the opponent has stated the refutation of the non-difference of the effect in this context, how can this be the refutation of that? Suspecting this, he says thus.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus he thinks.

analyzed: sāmagrī janya svabhāva tvāt tad avasthā prāpta aneka samartha janya svabhāva tvāt
translated: Because it has the nature of being produced by the totality, because it has the nature of being produced by many capable things that have attained that state.

analyzed: iti prakaraṇāt
translated: Of the effect, which has a different nature, from the context.

analyzed: nanu paraḥ
translated: The opponent says But this is not so, etc.

analyzed: yadi evam siddhāntī
translated: The proponent of the established view says If this is so, etc.

original: yad anekasmād bhavatānekena bhavitavyam i /ti ekajātīyāpekṣayoktam na tu kāryamātrāpekṣayā /
analyzed: yat anekasmāt bhavatā anekena bhavitavyam eka jātīya apekṣayā uktam na tu kārya mātra apekṣayā
translated: What is produced by many must be produced by one, this is said with reference to things of the same kind, not with reference to the effect alone.

analyzed: bhinna jātīyasya anekasya utpāda abhyupagamāt
translated: Because the production of things of different kinds is accepted.

analyzed: ekam abhinna rūpa kāryam
translated: One means an effect with an undifferentiated form.

analyzed: etat bhavanam
translated: This is the occurrence when that exists.

analyzed: bhavatām
translated: Yours - he says this with the Samkhyas in mind.

original: dharmavacanasya saṃkaraśabdasya bhāvād asaṃkarād a /sāṃkaryād ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: dharma vacanasya saṃkara śabdasya bhāvāt asaṃkarāt iti arthaḥ
translated: Because the word samkara (mixture) is used for dharma (property), the meaning is from the absence of mixture, from the absence of confusion.

analyzed: atas eva āha paraspara iti
translated: For this very reason he says mutually and so on.

analyzed: para udāhṛta kārya apekṣayā sāmagrī bhedāt bhedam pratipādayitum
translated: In order to teach difference by the difference of the collection in relation to the effect mentioned by another, he begins thus.

analyzed: sādguṇyam ābhimukhyam
translated: Excellence is the state of being directed towards.
By the word etc.

analyzed: timira ādi vikṛtam indriyam vivakṣitam anyatas bhrānti jñāna anudayāt
translated: By the word sense-faculty, a sense-faculty distorted by darkness etc. is intended, because otherwise there would be no arising of erroneous cognition.

analyzed: mātra grahaṇena ca ālambanasya eva nirāsaḥ vivakṣitaḥ
translated: And by the word mere, the mere object is intended to be denied.

analyzed: na tu āloka ādeḥ tad abhāve tad anutpatteḥ
translated: But not light etc., because it does not arise in its absence.

analyzed: atra api āloka ādi draṣṭavyam
translated: In that other, light etc. should also be seen.

original: upayogaviṣaya /s tad ekaṃ janyaṃ vijñānaṃ tathāvidhasyai /kātmatālakṣaṇasya /
analyzed: tat ekam janyam vijñānam
translated: That single effect-cognition is not different from that of the nature characterized by such a nature.

analyzed: na bhidyate nānātvam na
translated: It does not become manifold.

analyzed: kim nu pāta anipāta samudāyaḥ praśne
translated: What indeed? is a question.

original: yadi vā vitarke nuśabdaḥ kiṃśabdas tu praśne /
analyzed: yadi vā vitarke nuśabdaḥ kiṃśabdaḥ tu praśne
translated: Or the word nu is in doubt, and the word kim is in a question.

analyzed: nipātaḥ tra saṃbodhane
translated: The word vai is an exclamation here, in addressing.

analyzed: anekasya bhāve teṣām anenaka
translated: In the existence of many, their

original: janakatvam ity upagate hṛdayanihitaśaṅkarasvāmicodyaḥ kaścin nanv i /tyādinā codayati /
analyzed: janaka tvam iti upagate hṛdaya nihita śaṅkara svāmi codyaḥ kaścid nanu codayati
translated: It is accepted that they have the nature of producing. The objection hidden in the heart by Sankara Svamin is raised by someone with But what indeed? etc.

original: sa eva svātantryaparijihīrṣayānaiyāyikapravaravacanena saṃspandayann āha āha ce /ti /
analyzed: saḥ eva svātantrya parijihīrṣayā anaiyāyika pravara vacanena saṃspandayan āha āha
translated: He himself, wishing to avoid independence, connecting it with the words of the foremost Naiyāyika, says Āha ca (and it is said).

analyzed: buddhi stham asya
translated: And Śaṅkarasvāmin is in the mind.

analyzed: tat tasmāt kim kasmāt
translated: What is that? Why?

analyzed: vijñāna abhinna hetuka ja
translated: Which is produced from a cause that is not different from consciousness.

analyzed: hetu bhāvena viśeṣaṇam
translated: The qualification is by the causal relation.

original: teṣām avāntarasāmagrībhedād bheda iti pratipādayituṃ teṣām i /tyādinopakramate /
analyzed: teṣām avāntara sāmagrī bhedāt bhedaḥ iti pratipādayitum teṣām
translated: In order to demonstrate that their difference is due to the difference in the specific assemblage, he begins with teṣām (of those) and so on.

analyzed: vijñāna utpattau vijñānam upādāna kāraṇam
translated: In the production of consciousness, consciousness is the material cause.🔽The eye and other co-operating causes are the co-operating causes.

analyzed: cakṣuḥ kṣaṇa utpattau tu cakṣuḥ upādāna kāraṇam
translated: But in the production of the moment of the eye, the eye is the material cause.

original: vijñānādi sahakārikāraṇam evam anyatrāpīty upādānakāraṇam itarat sahakāri kāraṇaṃ kṛtvā sāmagrīṇāṃ vailakṣaṇyam īkṣitavyam /
analyzed: vijñāna ādi sahakāri kāraṇam evam anyatra api iti upādānakāraṇam itarat sahakāri kāraṇam kṛtvā sāmagrīṇām vailakṣaṇyam īkṣitavyam
translated: The consciousness and others are only the co-operating causes. Thus, considering the eye as the material cause and the other as the co-operating cause, the difference in the assemblages should be seen.

analyzed: kāryāṇām vijñāna cakṣuḥ kṣaṇa ādi rūpāṇām
translated: Of the effects, in the form of consciousness, eye-moments, and so on.

analyzed: bodha rūpa tā ādeḥ siddhāntī
translated: The proponent of the established view says bodharūpatādeḥ (of the nature of awareness, etc.).

analyzed: anukāraḥ iti karoteḥ ṇic antāt ha draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: Anukāra should be seen as formed from the root kṛ with the suffix ṇijanta (i.e., ṇin).
And anukāraṇa should be stated as the quality of being the agent of an effect that falls within one's own continuum.

analyzed: etat ca asya eva upasaṃhāre
translated: And this is included in his summary.

analyzed: tasya anukāraṇam eva anukartṛ mukhena darśayan āha
translated: Showing the cause of that very [mindfulness] through the face of the imitator, he says Thus, indeed.
Explaining the second characteristic, he says And necessarily...

original: samanantaraśabdaḥ samaś cāsau bodharūpatvenānantaraś cāvyavahiteneti vyutpattyāpi prakṛtatvānmanaskāra eva draṣṭavyo na tv āgamasiddhyāśrayaṇenopādānamātre /
analyzed: samanantara śabdaḥ samaḥ ca asau bodha rūpatvena anantaraḥ ca avyavahitena iti vyutpattyā api prakṛta tvāt manaskāraḥ eva draṣṭavyaḥ na tu āgama siddhi āśrayaṇena upādāna mātre
translated: The word samanantara [means] equal and immediate. By derivation, it is also to be seen as only the mental attention, not as mere appropriation by relying on the established meaning of the scriptures.

original: śakandhvādipāṭhāc ca dīrghatvābhāvovaseyaḥ /🔽na cakṣurāder niyamena vyāpāra / ity arthāt /
analyzed: śakandhu ādi pāṭhāt ca dīrgha tva abhāvaḥ uvaseyaḥ  na cakṣuḥ ādeḥ niyamena vyāpāraḥ iti arthāt
translated: And from the reading of śakandhu and so on, the absence of length should be understood.🔽And it is not the necessarily functioning of the eye and so on. This is the meaning.

analyzed: cakṣuṣaḥ niyamena vyāpāraḥ iti prakṛta tvāt
translated: Because the eye is necessarily functioning is the context.

original: janyatayā yat svavijñānaṃ tasya yogyatārthād utpattur yā yogyatā taddhetoh / /
analyzed: janya tayā yat sva vijñānam tasya yogyatā arthāt utpattuḥ yā yogyatā tad hetoḥ
translated: The fitness of that which is produced by its own consciousness, from the meaning of fitness, is the fitness of the producer.

analyzed: jñāna utpāda hetoḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: of the cause of the production of knowledge.

analyzed: cakṣuḥ viśeṣaṇa tve eva asya ayam eva arthaḥ  atra api
translated: This is the meaning only in the case of being a qualifier of the eye.

analyzed: skāraḥ bhipretaḥ
translated: Here also, in the word samanantara, mental attention is intended by the word mana.

original: uktayor lakṣaṇayor ādyaṃ lakṣaṇaṃ durbodhatvād upasaṃhāravyājena spaṣṭayann āha tasmād i /ti /
analyzed: uktayoḥ lakṣaṇayoḥ ādyam lakṣaṇam durbodha tvāt upasaṃhāra vyājena spaṣṭayan āha tasmāt
translated: In order to clarify the first definition, which is difficult to understand, he says therefore by way of a summary.

original: svasaṃtativyavasthaiva kuto yena tatpatitakāryaprasūtinimittaṃ / jñātavyam ity apekṣāyāṃ yojyam /
analyzed: sva saṃtati vyavasthā eva kutas yena tad patita kārya prasūti nimittam jñātavyam iti apekṣāyām yojyam
translated: How can the establishment of one's own continuum be known as the cause of the production of the fallen effect? This should be connected when there is expectation.

analyzed: yat
translated: That which has one form means:

analyzed: itiḥ hetau
translated: iti is in the sense of cause.
Because it is produced by a specific difference of that very [continuum] which has the stated definition, the meaning is because it is produced by a specific difference of that very [continuum].

analyzed: tasmāt prakṛtam upasaṃharati
translated: Therefore and so on, he concludes what was begun.

analyzed: vivakṣitam
translated: Of an effect of the same kind is intended.

analyzed: kārya mātra apekṣayā aneka tvasya iṣṭa tvāt prasaṅga anupapatteḥ
translated: Because multiplicity is accepted in relation to an effect in general, the consequence is not established.

analyzed: anye atha tad abhupagamāt siddham bhavatām
translated: If others accept that, it is established for you.

original: tato naivaṃ vaktum ucitam ity āśaṃkyāha na ce /ti /
analyzed: tatas nā evam vaktum ucitam iti āśaṃkya āha na
translated: Therefore, it is not proper to speak in this way. Suspecting this, he says but not and so on.

analyzed: evam tāvat bhaṭṭārcaṭena upādāna sahakāri lakṣaṇam praṇītam
translated: Thus far, the definition of material cause and cooperating cause has been presented by Bhattaraka Acarya.

analyzed: kecid punar atra evam bruvate
translated: However, some here speak thus:

analyzed: na eva idam lakṣaṇa dvayam upapadyate avyāpteḥ
translated: This pair of definitions is not tenable, because of incompleteness.

original: tathāhi yadi yad ekākāraparāmarṣapratyayanibandhanatayā svasantatipatitakāryapasūtinimittaṃ tadupādānakāraṇam ity ucyate /
analyzed: tathā hi yadi yat eka ākāra parāmarṣa pratyaya nibandhana tayā sva santati patita kārī apasūti nimittam tat upādānakāraṇam iti ucyate
translated: For, if it is said that that which is the cause of the production of an effect belonging to its own continuum by being the basis for a cognition that grasps a single form is the material cause,

original: tadā candrakāntādapāṃ prasave jyotsnā na syād upādānakāraṇam /
analyzed: tadā candrakāntāt apām prasave jyotsnā na syāt upādāna kāraṇam
translated: then moonlight would not be the material cause for the production of water from the moonstone.

original: yadi candrakāntaḥ candrikayā samam ekākāraparāmarśapratyayahetutvam🔽asti yena tathā tayā tāsāṃ tadekasāṃtānavyavasthāsiddhau svasantatipatitakāryajanakatvena
analyzed: yadi  asti yena tathā tayā tāsām tad eka sāṃtāna vyavasthā siddhau sva santati patita kārya janaka tvena
translated: If the moonstone has the same form as the moonlight, and is the cause of a cognition that grasps a single form,

analyzed: śaśāṅka vat upādānakāraṇam kalperan
translated: by which it could be imagined as the material cause like the moon, in the establishment of those as having a single continuum, by being the producer of an effect belonging to its own continuum,

analyzed: na ca tatra anyasya tad upādānakāraṇa tvam upapadyate
translated: and the material cause of that is not possible for anything else.

original: evam vanaspatibhyaḥ phalaprasūtau tvagbhāvāviśeṣasya na syāt tadupādānatvam /
analyzed: evam vanaspatibhyaḥ phala prasūtau na syāt tad upādāna tvam
translated: In the same way, the difference in the state of the fruit would not be the material cause for the production of the fruit from the tree,

original: vā śakyate nidarśayituṃ diṅmātraṃ tāvad upadarśitam /
analyzed: kiyat vā śakyate nidarśayitum diś mātram tāvat upadarśitam
translated: or it could not be shown. Just a direction has been shown.

analyzed: dvitīye pi lakṣaṇe nena eva avyāpti tvam unneyam
translated: In the second definition also, the fault of incompleteness should be pointed out by this itself.

original: na hi candrikāder avādimātrotpattau niyamena vyāpāraḥ śakreṇāṣi śakyate darśayitum /
analyzed: na hi candrikā ādeḥ ava ādi mātra utpattau niyamena vyāpāraḥ śakreṇa aṣi śakyate darśayitum
translated: For it is not possible to show by any means that the moonlight etc. definitely operate in the production of mere non-existence.

analyzed: tādṛśa utpādaḥ vidyate iti ced
translated: If it is said that such a production exists,

original: cakṣurāder api tādṛgvijñānotpāde niyamena vyāpāra iti tasyāpi tathātvaprasaktir iti yat kiñcid etat /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ ādeḥ api tādṛś vijñāna utpāde niyamena vyāpāraḥ iti tasya api tathātva prasaktiḥ iti yat kiñcid etat
translated: then since the eye, etc. also necessarily function in the production of such consciousness, it follows that they too would be like that. So this is nothing.

analyzed: sahakāri lakṣaṇam api avadyam
translated: Even so, it is faulty.

original: siddhasaṃtāna eva hi vastuni prāgavasthāpekṣaviśeṣahetutvaṃ kasyacit kalpyeta /
analyzed: siddha saṃtāne eva hi vastuni prāc avasthā apekṣa viśeṣa hetu tvam kasyacid kalpyeta
translated: For the causal efficacy of something with respect to a particular prior state could only be postulated in an already established continuum.

original: p / santānāpekṣakasya tu prathamakṣaṇasyotpāde katham evam abhidhānaṃ na sāhasam ity alaṃ bahuneti /🔽atra tu samādhānamatadbhinaṃ mahadbhi
analyzed: santāna apekṣakasya tu prathama kṣaṇasya utpāde katham evam abhidhānam na sāhasam iti alam bahunā iti  atra tu samādhānam a tad bhinam
translated: But how can there be such a statement about the production of the first moment, which depends on a continuum? It is mere audacity. Enough of this digression.

analyzed: R eva vidheyam
translated: Here, however, the great ones should prescribe a solution that is not different from that.

original: bhāvaviśeṣasya ity api dṛśyate /🔽ubhaya /m ity ekasāmagrīmadhyapraviṣṭakāraṇasya bhedād kāryasya ekajātīyasyābheda🔽ekatvaṃ kāraṇabhedā /t sāmagrīlakṣaṇasya kāraṇasya sāmagryantarāpekṣayā vailakṣāṇyāt /
analyzed: bhāva viśeṣasya iti api dṛśyate  iti eka sāmagrī madhya praviṣṭa kāraṇasya bhedāt kāryasya eka jātīyasya abheda  eka tvam sāmagrī lakṣaṇasya kāraṇasya sāmagrī antara apekṣayā vailakṣāṇyāt
translated: It is also seen that of an existent thing is used.🔽Both are different because the effect, which is of the same kind, is different due to the difference in the cause that is included in the same assemblage.

analyzed: kāryasya api bhedaḥ sāmagrī antara kāryāt vailakṣaṇyam iti
translated: The difference in the effect is due to the difference in the assemblage, which is characterized by the cause, in relation to another assemblage.

analyzed: krame
translated: The word only in only that much is in order.

original: kulālaḥ / kumbhakāraḥ vyagrasvabhāvāni / anyonyāsahitasvabhāvāni kāraṇāntarasahitāni / santi yāni kāryāṇīṣṭakādirūpāṇi /
analyzed: kulālaḥ kumbhakāraḥ vyagra svabhāvāni anyonya asahita svabhāvāni kāraṇa antara sahitāni santi yāni kāryāṇi iṣṭakā ādi rūpāṇi  /
translated: The potter: the potter. The things of a distracted nature: the things that have a nature of being mutually associated, that are accompanied by other causes, that are the effects in the form of bricks, etc.

analyzed: sādhayanti nirvartayanti  mṛd piṇḍasya carmakāra ādi kāraṇa pratilambhe sati iṣṭakā ādi kāryam
translated: They accomplish: they bring about.🔽And when the lump of clay obtains the causes such as the fletcher's, the effect in the form of bricks, etc.

analyzed: kulālasya dātṛ ādi pratyaya antara prāptau lavaṇana ādi kāryam  sūtrasya kuvinda ādi hetu antara sāhitye gha pa
translated: When the potter obtains other conditions such as the stick, the effect in the form of salt, etc.

analyzed: ṭādi kāryam
translated: When the thread obtains other causes such as the weaver, the effect in the form of cloth, etc.

original: tāny api kiṃ bhūtāni sādhayantīty āha tadanye /ti /🔽mṛtpiṇḍāpekṣayā bījādijanyebhyo 'kurādibhyo /
analyzed: tāni api kim bhūtāni sādhayanti iti āha  mṛd piṇḍa apekṣayā bīja ādi janyebhyaḥ kura ādibhyaḥ bhinna svabhāvāni
translated: What kind of things do they accomplish? He says: those other than that.

analyzed: tebhyaḥ vyagra avasthā prāpta kāraṇa antara sādhyebhyaḥ vilakṣaṇam eva ghaṭa ātmakam
translated: In relation to the lump of clay, the effect in the form of a pot, which is to be accomplished by other causes that have obtained a distracted state, is different from the sprouts, etc. that are produced from seeds, etc.

original: kāryaṃ samagrāṇi santi janayanti / mṛtpiṇḍakulālasūtrāṇīti sāmagryupalakṣaṇam
analyzed: kāryam samagrāṇi santi janayanti mṛd piṇḍa kulāla sūtrāṇi iti sāmagrī upalakṣaṇam
translated: The complete causes produce the effect in the form of a pot. The lump of clay, the potter, and the thread are merely examples.

original: uktaṃ na punar iyanti eva ghaṭasya kāraṇāni /🔽evaṃ vakṣyamāṇepy upadarśane draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: uktam na punar iyanti eva ghaṭasya kāraṇāni  evam vakṣyamāṇe ipi upadarśane draṣṭavyam
translated: It is said, but the causes of a pot are not just these many.🔽This should be seen even in the illustration that will be stated.

analyzed: upadarśitam eva upapādayan āha
translated: Explaining what has been illustrated, he says: Thus indeed.

original: nany kulālādisahito mṛtpiṇḍas tadanyasamāgrīmadhyapraviṣṭamṛtpiṇḍakāryād aviśiṣṭaṃ kāryaṃ janayanti /
analyzed: yadi kulāla ādi sahitaḥ mṛd piṇḍaḥ tad anya samāgrī madhya praviṣṭa mṛd piṇḍa kāryāt aviśiṣṭam kāryam janayanti
translated: [Objection:] But a lump of clay together with a potter, etc., produces an effect that is not distinguished from the effect of a lump of clay that is included in a collection of other things.

original: na tarhi sāmagrivailakṣaṇyāt kāryavailakṣaṇye nidarśanam idam upapadyata ity āśaṃkyāha kulālādīti / /
analyzed: na tarhi sāmagri vailakṣaṇyāt kārya vailakṣaṇye nidarśanam idam upapadyate iti āśaṃkya āha kulāla ādi iti
translated: [Reply:] Then, because of the difference in the collection, this example is not appropriate for the difference in effects. Anticipating this, he says potter, etc.

original: tadātmakam eva / mṛdātmakam eva ghaṭādilakṣaṇam eva karoti /
analyzed: tad ātmakam eva mṛd ātmakam eva ghaṭa ādi lakṣaṇam eva karoti
translated: It makes just that which has the nature of that, which has the nature of clay, just that which has the characteristic of a pot, etc.

analyzed: mṛd piṇḍaḥ iti prāk uktaḥ bhim sambadhyate kartā
translated: Lump of clay is connected to what was said before, the agent.

original: kuto vilakṣaṇaṃ āha tatkāryād apīṣṭakāder iti / /
analyzed: kutas vilakṣaṇam karoti iti āha tad kāryāt api iṣṭakā ādeḥ iti
translated: From where is it different? He says even from its effect, such as a brick.

analyzed: kena kāraṇeṇa iti āha
translated: By what reason? He says alone.

original: kevalamṛtpiṇḍād bhinnaḥ svabhāvo yasya mṛtpiṇḍasya sa tathā tasya bhāvas tattā tayā / /
analyzed: kevala mṛd piṇḍāt bhinnaḥ svabhāvaḥ yasya mṛd piṇḍasya sa tathā tasya bhāvaḥ tad tā tayā
translated: That lump of clay which has a nature different from just a lump of clay, it is so, that state of it is that, by that.

analyzed: kevala śabdena ca kulāla ādi rahita tā mātram vivakṣitam
translated: And by the word alone, mere freedom from a potter, etc., is intended.

original: na tu kāraṇāntarasāhityavyavacchedas tena tatkāryād i /ti kāraṇāntarasahitamṛtpiṇḍakāryād ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: na tu kāraṇa antara sāhitya vyavacchedaḥ tena tad kāryāt kāraṇa antara sahita mṛd piṇḍa kāryāt iti arthaḥ
translated: But the exclusion of association with another cause is not by that. Therefore, from its effect means from the effect of a lump of clay associated with another cause.

original: kutastyastasyā binnaḥ svabhāva ity āha tatkāreṇe /ti /
analyzed: kutastyaḥ tasyāḥ sau binnaḥ svabhāvaḥ iti āha
translated: From where does it have a different nature? He says from its effect.

original: tasya kulālasyārthāt kulālakṣaṇalakṣaṇasya pratyāsīdato yatkāraṇaṃ prāktanakṣaṇas tenāhita utpādito viśeṣo / viśiṣṭaṃ rūpaṃ yasya sa
analyzed: tasya kulālasya arthāt kulāla kṣaṇa lakṣaṇasya pratyāsīdataḥ yatkāraṇam prāktana kṣaṇaḥ tena āhitaḥ utpāditaḥ viśeṣaḥ viśiṣṭam rūpam yasya sa
translated: The difference that is produced, generated, by that cause, the previous moment, of that potter, who is characterized by the characteristics of a potter, as he proceeds,

analyzed: tathā uktaḥ
translated: is said to be so.

analyzed: anena eka sāmagrī adhīna aviśiṣta utpattiḥ sūcitā
translated: By this, the production of something distinguished by being dependent on the same assemblage is indicated.

analyzed: hetu bhāvena ca etat viśeṣaṇam
translated: And this distinction is by way of cause.

original: co / vyaktam etad ity asminn arthe /
analyzed: caḥ vyaktam etat iti asmin arthe
translated: And is clearly so in this sense.

analyzed: evam upādāna bhāve vyāpriyamāṇasya api mṛd piṇḍasya sahakāri ārya
translated: Thus, even when the material cause, the lump of clay, is engaged, due to the acquisition of another cooperating condition,

analyzed: ntara pratilambhāt ātmanaḥ api sataḥ kāryasya tad anya sahakāri sahita kāryāt vilakṣaṇasya eva
translated: even though it exists, the effect is produced only as distinguished from the effect accompanied by that other cooperating condition.

original: p / janakatvaṃ pratipādya sahakāraṇasyāpy ubhayatra sahakāribhāvenaiva vyāpriyamāṇasya
analyzed: janaka tvam pratipādya sahakāraṇasya api ubhayatra sahakāri bhāvena eva vyāpriyamāṇasya
translated: Having established the producer-ness of the cooperating condition also, which is engaged only as a cooperating condition in both cases,
indicating the producer-ness of the effect distinguished from the effect accompanied by that other [condition], when the other material cause is obtained,

original: āha evam /ti tadanyopādānasahitaṃ / mṛtpiṇḍalakṣaṇād upādānād yad
analyzed: āha evam tad anya upādāna sahitam mṛd piṇḍa lakṣaṇāt upādānāt yat
translated: he says thus and so on. Accompanied by that other material cause, from the material cause characterized by the lump of clay,

analyzed: anyat upādānam tena sahitam
translated: that which is different from that material cause, accompanied by that.

analyzed: mṛd piṇḍa sahitam tad vilakṣaṇam eva
translated: along with the lump of clay, is different from that.

original: tasmāt tadanyopādānasahitakāryād visadṛśam eva ghaṭādikaṃ kāryaṃ janayati / /
analyzed: tasmāt tad anya upādāna sahita kāryāt visadṛśam eva ghaṭa ādikam kāryam janayati
translated: Therefore, the effect such as a pot, which is different from the effect along with the other material cause, is produced.

original: iti /r yathā mṛtpiṇḍādītyāder ācāryīyavākyasya yaḥ samudāyārthas tasyākāraṃ /
analyzed: yathā mṛd piṇḍa ādi ityādeḥ ācāryīya vākyasya yaḥ samudāya arthaḥ tasya akāram darśayati
translated: Thus, the form of the collective meaning of the teacher's statement beginning with just as from a lump of clay, etc.

analyzed: avayava artham vyācaṣṭe
translated: There, beginning with in that, he now explains the individual meaning.

analyzed: mṛṣaya mṛṇmaya  pidhāna viśeṣa
translated: The word lid refers to a specific earthen or clay lid.

original: ucyate / tasya pṛthu /śabdena viśeṣaṇasamāsaṃ kṛtvā tasyodarā /dīti tatpuruṣaṃ vidhāya tad iva tasyeva vākāro / yasyeti bahuvṛīhiḥ
analyzed: ucyate tasya viśeṣaṇa samāsam kṛtvā tatpuruṣam vidhāya tat iva tasya iva vā ākāraḥ yasya iti bahuvṛīhiḥ
translated: By making a determinative compound with the word large, and then making a tatpurusa compound with belly, etc., the form of that, or like that, is a bahuvrihi compound of the form of which.

analyzed: kāryaḥ
translated: is to be made.

analyzed: ādi śabdāt tad avayava antara viśeṣasya bhinna jātīyasya vā saṃgrahaḥ
translated: By the word etc. is included a specific part of that, or something of a different class.

original: sūtrāt ta /syaiva ghaṭasya / cakrāder vibhaktaḥ svabhāvo bhvatīti / sambandhaḥ /
analyzed: sūtrāt ghaṭasya cakra ādeḥ vibhaktaḥ svabhāvaḥ sambandhaḥ
translated: From the aphorism, the nature of that very pot, such as the wheel, etc., becomes differentiated. This is the connection.

analyzed: mṛd saṃsthāna viśeṣa ātma tayā aivatā eva
translated: By the nature of a specific arrangement of clay alone.

analyzed: ghaṭasya kutastyā iti āha
translated: From where does the pot come? He says from the lump of clay.

analyzed: tad janana svabhāva tvāt mṛd saṃsthāna ātma tā janana svabhāva tvāt kāraṇāt
translated: Because of having the nature of producing that, because of having the nature of producing the form of clay.

analyzed: ghaṭasya tad rūpa yogāt mṛd saṃsthāna rūpa yogāt
translated: Because the pot has that form. Because of the combination of clay and shape.

original: anyad eva tayoḥ kathaṃ tajjananasvabhāvatvam ity āha tannirapekṣe /ti /
analyzed: anyat eva tayoḥ katham tad janana svabhāva tvam iti āha
translated: How can they have the nature of producing that, if they are different? He says independent of that.

analyzed: tad śabdena sūtram parāmṛṣyate
translated: The word that refers to the sūtra.

analyzed: vilakṣaṇa svabhāva tvāt tad nirapekṣa avasthātaḥ bhinna svabhāva tā eva
translated: Because of having a different nature, because of having a different characteristic nature, the very difference in nature from the state independent of that

original: tayoḥ katham ity apekṣāyāṃ sūtrakāraṇopahitaviśeṣayor i /ti hetubhāvena viśeṣaṇapadam idaṃ yojyam /
analyzed: tayoḥ katham iti apekṣāyām sūtra kāraṇa upahita viśeṣayoḥ hetu bhāvena viśeṣaṇa padam idam yojyam
translated: is how they are. When there is expectation of that, this qualifying word of the two should be connected as the reason for the two who are qualified by the cause mentioned in the sūtra.

original: kāraṇatraya /grahaṇaṃ na tu ghaṭasya trīṇy eva kāraṇāni /🔽tadupayogair bhinnasāmagrīvyāpāraiḥ kāryāpekṣasvaye sva
analyzed: na tu ghaṭasya trīṇi eva kāraṇāni  tad upayogaiḥ bhinna sāmagrī vyāpāraiḥ kārya apekṣa svaye sva
translated: The three causes are mentioned, but the pot does not have only three causes.🔽By means of the different collections of conditions that are useful to it, the specific natures of the effects, which are dependent on themselves,

original: bhāvaviśeṣāḥ kāryāṇāṃ viśiṣṭāḥ svabhāvās teṣām asaṃkaro ' /sāṅkaryam /
analyzed: bhāva viśeṣāḥ kāryāṇām viśiṣṭāḥ svabhāvāḥ teṣām
translated: are the specific natures of the effects. Their non-mixture is non-confusion.

original: tatra yadi te kulālādayah pratyekaṃ janakāḥ syus tadānukrāntakāraṇatrayajanya / ity ucyeta /
analyzed: tatra yadi te kulāla ādayaḥ pratyekam janakāḥ syuḥ tadā anukrānta kāraṇa traya janyaḥ iti ucyeta
translated: Regarding that, if those potters and so on were each producers, then it could be said that it is produced by the three causes mentioned in order.

original: tathāpi kathaṃ sarvataḥ kāryasyāyaṃ viśeṣo 'smād ayañ cāsmād iti vyavasthāpyata ity āśaṃkyāh tasya caikaike /tyādi
analyzed: tathā api katham sarvatas kāryasya ayam viśeṣaḥ smāt ayam ca asmāt iti vyavasthāpyate iti āśaṃkya āh tasya
translated: Still, how is this particular effect determined as coming from this and not from that? With this doubt in mind, he says and of that, each... etc.

original: ito 'stu kāryasya tatsāmagrībhūtasakalajanyatvaṃ tadgatasya tu tatadviśeṣasya kathaṃ
analyzed: itas stu kāryasya tad sāmagrī bhūta sakala janya tvam tad gatasya tu tad tad viśeṣasya katham
translated: Let the effect come from this collection of causes. But how is the particularity of that determined as being produced from that?

analyzed: tad janya tva vyavasthā iti āha tad ekaika sajāti iti mṛd piṇḍa ādi apekṣayā mṛd piṇḍa ādeḥ
translated: He says that of the same kind... etc. In relation to the lump of clay and so on, another of the same kind as the lump of clay and so on

analyzed: aparasya tad jātīya tvam pratyeyam
translated: should be understood.

original: anenaitad darśayati naikasyām eva sāmagryāṃ tasminn evākhaṇḍātmani kārye
analyzed: anena etat darśayati na ekasyām eva sāmagryām tasmin eva akhaṇḍa ātmani kārye
translated: By this he shows that in the very same collection, in that very indivisible self of the effect,

original: tattadviśeṣasya tattajjanyatvam avadhāryate api tu tattadupacaye tat tad upacayatya
analyzed: tad tad viśeṣasya tad tad janya tvam avadhāryate api tu tad tad upacaye tat tat
translated: the particularity of that is not determined as being produced from that, but rather that increase is increased by that increase,

analyzed: tad tad apodhāre tad tad uda
translated: and that decrease is decreased by that decrease.

analyzed: darśaṇāt eka tva adhyavasāyataḥ ca eka adhikaraṇa tvena vyavasthāpitāt
translated: And because of the ascertainment of oneness, it is determined as having the same substratum.

analyzed: iti vyavahartāraḥ ca evam na
translated: And the users of language do not analyze in this way.

analyzed: te iti iti uktam
translated: Therefore it is said by the thinkers of reality.

original: teṣām apy evaṃ kiṃ prayojanam ity āha yata / iti /
analyzed: teṣām api evam vivecanena kim prayojanam iti āha yatas iti
translated: What is the purpose of them also thinking in this way? He says because... etc.

analyzed: yatas nantara ukta vivecanāt
translated: Because of the discrimination stated immediately before.

original: anekam api kāraṇaṃ kasmāt svīkurvantīty āha paraspare /ti /
analyzed: anekam api kāraṇam kasmāt svīkurvanti iti āha
translated: Why do they accept even many causes? He says: by mutual.

analyzed: kṣepavatyām hi sāmagryām anyonya utpādita atiśaya kārya praṇālikayā vāñcchita aṅkura ādi kārya upajanana yogya kāraṇa sāmagrya sadbhāva artham
translated: For in a collection that excludes, in order to establish the existence of a collection of causes capable of producing the desired effect such as a sprout by the channel of an effect produced by mutual enhancement.

analyzed: etat ca upariṣtāt pradarśayiṣyate
translated: And this will be shown later.

analyzed: bhinna ātmaka tayā
translated: By the difference of having a different nature.

original: yatra yadyogyaṃ upapadyate sa tasya viṣaya iti tadviṣayasya / ghaṭasyety arthaḥ /
analyzed: yatra yat yogyam upapadyate sa tasya viṣayaḥ iti tad viṣayasya ghaṭasya iti arthaḥ
translated: Where what is suitable occurs, that is its object. The meaning is: of a pot.

analyzed: tad anya avasthā viṣayāt prāpta sahakāri antara avasthā kāryāt
translated: From that which has an object in a different state, from an effect in a state that has obtained other cooperating factors.

analyzed: kāryasya
translated: Of this. The meaning is: of the effect.

original: anena tajjanitaviśeṣabhedasyeti mūlasya kārya /padaviśeṣaṇasya bahuvrīhau kartavye vigraho darśitaḥ /
analyzed: anena tad janita viśeṣa bhedasya iti mūlasya bahuvrīhau kartavye vigrahaḥ darśitaḥ
translated: By this, the root that which is produced by it has a particular difference is shown to be a bahuvrīhi compound with the word effect as a qualifier.

analyzed: jñānam tad rūpam anukartum yuktam
translated: Knowledge. It is proper to imitate that form.

analyzed: anuvartate na yuktam na arhati iti ca arthaḥ
translated: No. It is not proper. The meaning is: it does not deserve.

original: hetau śānaco vidhānāt tadrūpavikalārthasāmarthyeno /tpādād iti tadrūpānukārīrā
analyzed: hetau śānacaḥ vidhānāt iti tad rūpa anukārī īrā
translated: Because the optative suffix is used for the cause, it is produced by the capability of an object that lacks that form. Therefore, it imitates that form.

analyzed: yukta tāyām hetuḥ uktaḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: The reason for the appropriateness should be seen as stated.

original: tathāpi kasmān na yuktam ity apekṣāyām āha bhrāntate /ti /
analyzed: tathā api kasmāt na yuktam iti apekṣāyām āha
translated: Nevertheless, why is it not appropriate? In expectation of this, he says because of error.

analyzed: aikāntikī yā pareṇa aikāntika tvena abhimatā sā na asti
translated: It is not absolute. The absolute that is intended by the opponent does not exist.

analyzed: eka tvāt eva pramāṇa siddhāt iti abhiprāyaḥ
translated: The idea is that it is due to oneness itself, which is established by valid cognition.

analyzed: yadi vā na aikāntikī na niścayavatī
translated: Or it is not absolute, not certain.

analyzed: athavā aneka ātma tā eva aikāntikī na iti pūrveṇa abhisaṃbadhyate
translated: Or else, the absolute is just the manifold nature itself. This is connected with the previous [statement].

original: atha vijñānopajanane kim indriyādīni svalakṣaṇāntarāntarāprasavadharmāṇyapetasaṃtānāny eva yenaikasyaiva kāryasya karaṇam eṣām upavarṇyate
analyzed: atha vijñāna upajanane kim indriya ādīni sva lakṣaṇa antara antara aprasava dharmāṇi apeta saṃtānāni eva yena ekasya eva kāryasya karaṇam eṣām upavarṇyate
translated: Now, in the production of consciousness, are the sense faculties, etc., which have the nature of producing different individual characteristics, and which are not related to a continuum, such that their function is described as the production of a single effect?

analyzed: iti āha etat
translated: To this he says this is not so.

original: nanu ekasāmagrī /śabdena yadi vijñānasya janakaḥ kāraṇakalāpo 'bhipretaḥ /
analyzed: nanu yadi vijñānasya janakaḥ kāraṇa kalāpaḥ bhipretaḥ
translated: If the collection of causes that produces consciousness is intended by the word collection,

analyzed: tadā uktam eva kim
translated: then what has been said is just that.

analyzed: saṃtāna tā teṣām iti
translated: The continuity of those [causes].

original: athaikam upādānam itaratsahakārikāraṇam abhisandhāya ekasāmagrīty uktaṃ na tad api caturasram /
analyzed: atha ekam upādānam itarat sahakāri kāraṇam abhisandhāya eka sāmagrī iti uktam na tat api caturasram
translated: Or if it is said collection with the intention that one is the material cause and the other is the cooperative cause, that also is not straightforward.

original: tasyā apy avāntarasāmagryāḥ kiṃ tadupādānopādeyasyāiva kṣaṇasya prasavaḥ /
analyzed: tasyāḥ api avāntara sāmagryāḥ kim tad upādāna upādeyasya iva kṣaṇasya prasavaḥ
translated: And does that intermediate collection also produce only the moment that is its material cause and product?

analyzed: atha upādeyam anekam na bhavati iti
translated: Or is the product not multiple?

original: haṃta tad api sarvaṃ svaṃ svam upādānam apekṣyopādeyam eveti tad avastho doṣa iti /🔽uttaraukta
analyzed: haṃta tat api sarvam svam svam upādānam apekṣya upādeyam eva iti tat avasthaḥ doṣaḥ iti  uttarā ukta
translated: Well then, all of that is only the product in dependence on its own material cause. So the fault remains as it was.

original: eva ekasāmagrīśabdārthaḥ kaivalaṃ bodhe yatraḥ karaṇīyaḥ /
analyzed: eva eka sāmagrī śabda arthaḥ kaivalam bodhe yatraḥ karaṇīyaḥ
translated: The meaning of the term single collection is stated in the following verse.

original: ekam upādānaṃ sad evetaratsahakārikāraṇasad eva vyāpriyate yadā tadā ekasyaiva vijñānasya🔽manaskāropādānasya cakṣurādisahakārikāraṇasyaiva sata na tu cakṣuḥkṣaṇasyaivaṃbhūtasya
analyzed: ekam upādānam sat eva itarat sahakāri kāraṇa sat eva vyāpriyate yadā tadā ekasya eva vijñānasya  manaskāra upādānasya cakṣuḥ ādi sahakāri kāraṇasya eva sata na tu cakṣuḥ kṣaṇasya evaṃbhūtasya
translated: When only the material cause exists and the other cooperative causes exist, then only a single consciousness🔽arises, of the mental attention and the eye, etc., which are the cooperative causes, existing but not the moment of eye, etc. in that way.

original: sata utpattir api tu cakṣur upādānasya manaskārādisahakārikāraṇasya sata iti /
analyzed: sataḥ utpattiḥ api tu cakṣuḥ upādānasya manaskāra ādi sahakāri kāraṇasya sataḥ iti
translated: But the arising is of the eye, etc., which are the material cause, and the mental attention, etc., which are the cooperative causes, existing.

analyzed: evam rūpa ādi kṣaṇasya api utpāde draṣṭavyam svayam
translated: In the same way, the arising of the moments of form, etc. should be seen as by itself.

original: atra samudāyārtho manaskāropādānakāraṇacakṣurādisahakārikāraṇātmikā satī sāmagryekam eva kāryaṃ janayati /
analyzed: atra samudāya arthaḥ manaskāra upādāna kāraṇa cakṣuḥ ādi sahakāri kāraṇa ātmikā satī sāmagrī ekam eva kāryam janayati
translated: Here, the collective meaning is that the collection, consisting of the material cause of mental attention and the cooperative causes of the eye, etc., existing, produces only one effect.

original: tadaivānyajjanayantī tu naivam ātmikā satī ja /
analyzed: tadā eva anyat janayantī tu nā evam ātmikā satī  nayati
translated: But when it produces another [effect], it is not of that nature.

analyzed: kim tarhi cakṣuḥ upādāna kāraṇa manaskāra ādi sahakāri kāraṇa ātmikā
translated: Rather, it is of the nature of the material cause, such as the eye, and the cooperative causes such as attention.

analyzed: evam
translated: In the same way, the momentary birth of form and so on

analyzed: ni api pratyeyam
translated: should be understood in the same way.

original: ata evaiṣām āntarasāmagrībhedaḥ kṛtaḥ parasparato bheda ity uktaṃ purastād iti sarvam avadātam /
analyzed: atas eva eṣām āntara sāmagrī bhedaḥ kṛtaḥ parasparataḥ bhedaḥ iti uktam purastāt iti sarvam avadātam
translated: For this very reason, the internal difference in the collection is made, the difference from each other is stated earlier, so everything is clear.

analyzed: kasmāt punar iṣṭa eka sāmagrī apekṣayā eva etat ucyate
translated: But why is this said only in dependence on the desired single collection,

original: na ca sāmagrīmātrāpekṣayāpīty āha paramārthatas tv i /ti /
analyzed: na ca sāmagrī mātra apekṣayā api iti āha paramārthataḥ tu
translated: and not even in dependence on the mere collection? He says: But in reality...

original: i /ti sā ca sā cakṣurādisahakārikāraṇātmikā sāmagrī
analyzed: ca
translated: And that, and that which is of the nature of the cooperative causes such as the eye, is the collection.

original: ceti tathā yatropādānabhāvenāntargatānām antarbhūtānāṃ yatra sāmagryāṃ sahakāritvena
analyzed: ca iti tathā yatra upādāna bhāvena antargatānām antarbhūtānām yatra sāmagryām sahakāri tvena
translated: Thus, where the internal ones included as the material cause are included in the collection, where there is the operation of those as cooperative causes,

analyzed: teṣām vyāpāraḥ tatra
translated: in that [collection].
That other collection is [included] as a part of it.

original: kāryāntarasye /ti sopādeyakṣaṇāpekṣayā tadvijñānaṃ cakṣuṣaḥ kāryāntaram evam anyasyāpy anyat tasya kāryāntarasyāpi prārambhād ity anuvartate
analyzed: sa upādeya kṣaṇa apekṣayā tat vijñānam cakṣuṣaḥ kārya antaram evam anyasya api anyat tasya kārya antarasya api prārambhāt iti anuvartate
translated: Of the other effect, in dependence on the moment to be taken up, that consciousness is indeed the other effect of the eye. In the same way, the other of that other effect also begins, this continues.

analyzed: aneka kārya kartṛ tvam iti raca
translated: Thus composed

original: śeṣaḥ kāryaḥ anyathā kasmin sādhye pañcamīyaṃ hetubhāvam abhidadhyāt /
analyzed: śeṣaḥ kāryaḥ anyathā kasmin sādhye pañcamīyam hetu bhāvam abhidadhyāt
translated: Thus, the rest should be constructed. Otherwise, in which probandum would he state the nature of the reason in the fifth case?

analyzed: asya eva arthasya dṛḍhīkaraṇa artham dṛṣṭāntayan āha
translated: In order to strengthen this very meaning, he gives an example, saying just as.

original: tadā / tadvad anekapratyayajanitam apī /ty ekam ity asyānuvṛttes tathānekapratyayajanitam ekam api nāstīty arthaḥ /
analyzed: tadā tadvat aneka pratyaya janitam ekam iti asya anuvṛtteḥ tathā aneka pratyaya janitam ekam api na asti iti arthaḥ
translated: Then, in the same way, even though produced by many conditions, it is not one. This is the meaning of the continuation of one.

analyzed: iti hetau
translated: In the instrumental case.

analyzed: api nyāyataḥ sambhāvanām
translated: Even though, according to reasoning, the possibility is

original: āha / vā paramārthataḥ kāraṇānekatvāt kāryānekatvopagame 'pi na kācit kṣatir i /ti sambandhaḥ kāryaḥ /
analyzed: āha yadi vā paramārthataḥ kāraṇa aneka tvāt kārya aneka tva upagame pi na kācid kṣatiḥ sambandhaḥ kāryaḥ
translated: stated. Or, in reality, even though the multiplicity of effects is accepted due to the multiplicity of causes, there is no harm at all. This is the connection that should be made.

original: kasmān na kṣatir ity āha tatsāmagryantargatānām i /ti /
analyzed: kasmāt na kṣatiḥ iti āha tad sāmagrī antargatānām
translated: Why is there no harm? He says because they are included within that assemblage.

original: yathetyādi ca pūrvavad vyākhyeyam /🔽itis tv anantaroktānyopādānakāraṇāni sahakārikāraṇāni pratyavamṛṣati /
analyzed: yathā ityādi ca pūrvavat vyākhyeyam  itiḥ tu anantara ukta anya upādānakāraṇāni sahakāri kāraṇāni pratyavamṛṣati
translated: And just as and so on should be explained as before.🔽But rejects the other causes that were just mentioned, the cooperative causes.

analyzed: tatas ayam arthaḥ ukta lakṣaṇa kāraṇa anekatvāt iti
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning stated: because of the multiplicity of causes with the characteristics just mentioned.

original: saṃprati prakṛtam upasaṃharann āha tata / iti /
analyzed: saṃprati prakṛtam upasaṃharan āha tatas iti
translated: Now, concluding the main point, he says therefore.

analyzed: sāmānyena kārya mātra āśrayaṇena
translated: In general, by relying on mere effects.

original: atha siddhasādhanatvaṃ hetoḥ ko doṣa iti cet /
analyzed: atha siddha sādhana tvam hetoḥ kaḥ doṣaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is asked, What is the fault of the reason being a tautology?,

original: tad etaddharmottarapradīpe 'smābhir vivecitaṃ vistarataś ca svayūthyavicāra ity āstāṃ tāvad iha /
analyzed: tat etat dharmottara pradīpe smābhiḥ vivecitam vistarataḥ ca sva yūthya vicāraḥ iti āstām tāvat iha
translated: this has been examined by us in detail in the Dīpa of Dharmottara, and it is the investigation of our own group, so let it rest here for now.

original: dravya /śabdena dravati paryāyān gacchatīti vyutpāttyā dharmo pariṇāminityo vivakṣitaḥ ca pari samantādetyeti dravyam
analyzed: dravati paryāyān gacchati iti vyutpāttyā pariṇāmi nityaḥ vivakṣitaḥ paryāya śabdena ca pari samantāt etya iti dravyam
translated: By the derivation it flows, it goes through the modes, the property-possessor is intended to be a property that evolves and is eternal. By the derivation it comes from all around, it is a substance.

analyzed: iti vyutpattyā dharmāḥ
translated: By the derivation it comes, it is a property.

analyzed: sparśa ādi saṃgrahaḥ
translated: By the word etc. the collection of touch and so on is included.

original: ghaṭo dravyaṃ rūpādayaḥ / paryāyā iti dravyaparyāyayor etad udāharaṇam itiḥ saṃkhyābheda /syākāraṃ darśayati dvitīyas tu saṃjñābhedasya
analyzed: ghaṭaḥ dravyam rūpa ādayaḥ paryāyāḥ iti dravya paryāyayoḥ etat udāharaṇam itiḥ darśayati dvitīyaḥ tu saṃjñā bhedasya
translated: A pot is a substance, and color etc. are modes. This is an example of substance and mode. The word iti shows the difference in number. But the second one shows the difference in name.

analyzed: lakṣaṇa bhedasya akāraḥ darśitaḥ
translated: Iti shows the difference in definition.

analyzed: vastu rāgaḥ iti upalakṣaṇam etat
translated: Vastu is a metaphor.

original: kāryabhedasya svarūpam āha itir a /nantaroktabhedābhedaṃ pratyavamṛṣati /
translated: He states the nature of the difference in effect. Iti refers to the difference in identity and difference just mentioned.

original: cakṣurādīnām abhinno ya ātmā ekakāryajanakaḥ sāmānyabhūtas tajjanyatā tasya / /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ ādīnām abhinnaḥ yaḥ ātmā eka kārya janakaḥ sāmānya bhūtaḥ tad janya tā tasya
translated: The self that is not different for the eye etc., which produces a single effect, which is a universal, its production is from that.

analyzed: etat eva dvayam ityādinā upasaṃharati paraḥ
translated: The opponent concludes this very duality, etc.

analyzed: sāmānyena para rūpāṇām ātma abhedasya
translated: The non-contradiction of the identity of the self with the forms of the supreme is stated in general.

original: dhakatvaṃ pratijñāya viśeṣeṇedānīṃ darśayitum āha saṃkhyābhedas tāvad i /ti /
analyzed: dhaka tvam pratijñāya viśeṣeṇa idānīm darśayitum āha saṃkhyā bhedaḥ tāvat
translated: Now, in order to show it in particular, he says the difference in number, etc.

analyzed: bahu tvena vyavahāraḥ bahuvacana antasya prayogaḥ
translated: Usage is the use of the plural ending.

original: bahuvacanaṃ ca yuṣmadi gurāv ekapām ity anena /
analyzed: bahuvacanam ca yuṣmadi gurau eka pām iti anena
translated: And the plural is by the rule yuṣmad, guru, eka, pā (Panini 5.3.100).

original: anena saṃkhyābhedādity asya p / sādhāraṇānaikāntikatvaṃ darśitam /🔽dharmadharmisamudāyātmakasya kārtsnyasyāpratītiḥ / prasajyeta /
analyzed: anena saṃkhyā bhedāt iti asya p sādhāraṇa anaikāntika tvam darśitam  dharma dharmi samudāya ātmakasya kārtsnyasya apratītiḥ prasajyeta
translated: By this, the general and inconclusive nature of the statement due to the difference in number is shown.🔽The non-apprehension of the totality consisting of the combination of the property and the possessor of the property would result.

analyzed: tad pratītau vā avasthātṛ avasthā viṣaya pūjya tā pratyaya gocara tvasya gauravasya apratītiḥ prasajyeta
translated: In the apprehension of that, the non-apprehension of the heaviness of being the object of the notion of worshipfulness which has the three states as its object would result.

original: atraiva vaktavyā uccinvann āha vrīhaya / iti cet yatra bahuvacanaṃ jātyākhyāyām ekasmin bahuvacanam anyatarasyām Pā / / /
analyzed: atra eva ntaram uccinvan āha vrīhayaḥ iti ced yatra bahuvacanam jāti ākhyāyām ekasmin bahuvacanam anyatarasyām  /
translated: Here, he says if it is argued that the rice grains in order to state this. In the case of a class, the plural is used for one, in the other case (Panini 5.3.100).

analyzed: iti anena
translated: By this.

original: na ca paryāyarūpeṇa bhidyanta / iti bruvatā ca yadi saṃkhyābhedo 'nekatvasya sādhakaḥ syāt tadā tadabhedopy ekatvasya sādhakaḥ syāt /
analyzed: na ca paryāya rūpeṇa bhidyante iti bruvatā ca yadi saṃkhyā bhedaḥ nekatvasya sādhakaḥ syāt tadā tad abhedaḥ upi ekatvasya sādhakaḥ syāt
translated: And they are not differentiated by being synonyms. And if the difference in number were the establisher of multiplicity, then the non-difference of that would be the establisher of unity.

analyzed: anyathā tasya ayogāt
translated: Otherwise, because that is not possible.

original: na caivaṃ tasmāt saṃkhyābhedo na samartho 'nekatvaṃ sādhayitum iti darśitaṃ draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: na ca evam tasmāt saṃkhyā bhedaḥ na samarthaḥ neka tvam sādhayitum iti darśitam draṣṭavyam
translated: And it should be seen that it is shown that the difference in number is not able to establish multiplicity.

analyzed: tatas saṃjñā bhedāt
translated: Because of the difference in names.

original: anena saṃjñābhedād ity asya saṃdigdhavipakṣavyāvṛttyānaikāntikatvaṃ darśitam /
analyzed: anena saṃjñā bhedāt iti asya saṃdigdha vipakṣa vyāvṛttyā anaikāntika tvam darśitam
translated: By this, the equivocation of the reason because of the difference in names is shown.

original: saṃprati sādhāraṇānaikāntikatvam api darśayann āha ekasminn api ceti / atra gajanimīlikayā pūrvadoṣo draṣṭavyaḥ /
analyzed: saṃprati sādhāraṇa anaikāntika tvam api darśayan āha ekasmin api atra gaja nimīlikayā pūrva doṣaḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: Now, showing the common equivocation, he says even in one etc. Here, the previous fault should be seen with the eyes closed.

analyzed: samastasya śakti śaktimat ātmakasya dharma dharmi samudāyasya
translated: Of the whole. Of the aggregate of properties and property-holders, which consists of the powerful and the powerless.

analyzed: tad vādhinām dharma vācinām
translated: Of those two. Of the property and property-holder, of those that are based on that, of the words denoting properties.

analyzed: mātrā leśaḥ
translated: A part. A small portion.

original: kūṭasthanityatā tayā / tattadavasthārūpeṇa pariṇamato 'vasthānaṃ pariṇāmanityatā tadupagamāt / sā ca
analyzed: sarvadā eka rūpeṇa avasthānam kūṭastha nityatā tayā tad tad avasthā rūpeṇa pariṇamataḥ pariṇāma nityatā tad upagamāt sā ca
translated: The immutability of the unchanging. The transformation of that which changes into various states is the mutability of transformation. And that

analyzed: pariṇāma nitya tā
translated: is the mutability of transformation.

original: asya / pariṇāmanityasya suvarṇāder dravyasya /🔽tadrūpeṇa / paryāyarūpeṇa cchedo vināśaḥ /
analyzed: asya pariṇāma nityasya suvarṇa ādeḥ dravyasya  tad rūpeṇa paryāya rūpeṇa chedaḥ vināśaḥ
translated: Of this. Of a substance like gold, which is subject to transformation.🔽By that form. By the form of the modes, there is cutting off, destruction.

analyzed: paryāyāṇām iva iti vaidharmya dṛṣṭāntaḥ
translated: As in the case of the modes, this is an example of dissimilarity.

analyzed: iyam pariṇāma nitya tā
translated: This is the impermanence of transformation.

analyzed: dravye paryāya atirikte na saṃbhavati
translated: It cannot occur in a substance other than the modes.

analyzed: kutas iti āha
translated: Why is it so? He says: By the modes.

original: atra kūṭasthanityatāvat iti pāṭhaḥ ṭibeṭanānusārī samyagbhāti /
analyzed: atra kūṭastha nitya tā vat iti pāṭhaḥ ṭibeṭana anusārī samyak bhāti
translated: Here, the reading like the immutable permanence seems correct according to the Tibetan.

original: vibhaktapariṇāmeṣv i /ti pāṭhe vibhaktaḥ pariṇāmo yeṣām iti vigrahaḥ /
analyzed: vibhakta pariṇāmeṣu pāṭhe vibhaktaḥ pariṇāmaḥ yeṣām iti vigrahaḥ
translated: In the reading in those with distinct transformations, the analysis is those that have distinct transformations.

original: vibhakto viśiṣtakāryakāritvena niyukta iti cārtha iti pūrve nibandhakṛto vyācakhyuḥ /
analyzed: vibhaktaḥ viśiṣta kārya kāri tvena niyuktaḥ iti ca arthaḥ iti pūrve nibandha kṛtaḥ vyācakhyuḥ
translated: The earlier commentators explained that the meaning is distinct in the sense of being engaged in producing a specific effect.

original: idānīm api kecit paṇḍitāṃmanyā anenaiva pāṭhena katham api vyācakṣate /
analyzed: idānīm api kecid paṇḍitāṃmanyāḥ anena eva pāṭhena katham api vyācakṣate
translated: Even now, some who consider themselves learned explain this very reading somehow.

analyzed: tat etat pāpīyaḥ vibhakti kta śabdasya anya artha tvāt
translated: This is the worst, because the word distinct has a different meaning.

original: na hy ayaṃ vibhaktaśabdo viśiṣṭakāryakāritvena niyuktaṃ vakti /
analyzed: na hi ayam vibhakta śabdaḥ viśiṣṭa kārya kāri tvena niyuktam vakti
translated: For this word distinct does not express what is engaged in producing a specific effect.

analyzed: api tu vibhāgena vyavasthāpitam
translated: But rather what is established by distinction.

original: kiñ ca kim asya śabdadāridyaṃ yena viśiṣṭakāryakāripariṇāmeṣv iti vaktavyaṃ vihāya idam īdṛśam avācakam ācakṣīta /
analyzed: kim ca kim asya śabda dāridyam yena viśiṣṭa kārya kāri pariṇāmeṣu iti vaktavyam vihāya idam īdṛśam avācakam ācakṣīta
translated: And what is the poverty of this word that one should speak thus, abandoning this and calling it such a non-denotative [word]?

original: sarva eva ca pariṇāmas tadanyakāryāpekṣayā viśiṣṭakāryakārīti ko 'nyasmād paṭādipariṇāmasya viśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: sarvaḥ eva ca pariṇāmaḥ tad anya kārya apekṣayā viśiṣṭa kārya kārī iti kaḥ nyasmāt paṭa ādi pariṇāmasya viśeṣaḥ
translated: And all transformation is the doer of a distinguished effect in relation to another effect. What is the difference of this from the transformation of cloth etc.?

analyzed: kaḥ ca asya niyoktā iti kim asthāna parākrameṇa
translated: And who is its employer? What is the point of this futile effort?

analyzed: tasmāt kvacid pustake pramāda pāṭhaḥ eṣaḥ
translated: Therefore, this is a careless reading in some book.

analyzed: vibhakta parimāṇeṣu iti tu pāṭhaḥ yukta rūpaḥ
translated: But the reading in those whose magnitude is distinguished is appropriate.

original: tatra pariṃāṇaṃ mānavyavahārakāraṇaṃ p / guṇaviśeṣaḥ /🔽paraprasiddhyā cedam ucyate tac ca dīrghatvākhyam utpādyam atra vivakṣitam /
analyzed: tatra pariṃāṇam māna vyavahāra kāraṇam guṇa viśeṣaḥ  para prasiddhyā ca idam ucyate tat ca dīrgha tva ākhyam utpādyam atra vivakṣitam
translated: There, magnitude is a special quality that is the cause of the notion of measure.🔽And this is said by the acknowledged [truth] of others, and that so-called length which is to be produced is intended here.

original: tatra vibhaktaṃ vyavasthāpitam parimāṇam yeṣāṃ paṭādīnāṃ teṣu vistāriteṣu dīrghīkṛteṣv iti yāvat /
analyzed: tatra vibhaktam vibhāgena vyavasthāpitam parimāṇam yeṣām paṭa ādīnām teṣu vistāriteṣu dīrghīkṛteṣu iti yāvat
translated: There, those cloths etc. which have their magnitude distinguished, i.e., extended, made long,

original: vibhaktāyām ādikarpaṭādayaḥ kiñcid āvṛṇvate kiñcic ca dhārayanti kiñcid upabadhnantīti /
analyzed: vibhaktāyām ādi karpaṭa ādayaḥ kiñcid āvṛṇvate kiñcid ca dhārayanti kiñcid upabadhnanti iti
translated: cover a part, support another part, and fasten another part.

analyzed: prāk a vidyamānam kasyacid
translated: What did not exist before belongs to someone.

analyzed: bhāve bhavat utpadyamānam kāryam
translated: In the case of an existent, the effect that is being produced.

original: hetau ca śaturvidhānāt pūrvam abhāvābhava🔽t kasyacid bhāve bhāvābhava
analyzed: hetau ca śatuḥ vidhānāt pūrvam abhāva abhava  t kasyacid bhāve
translated: And because the locative case is used for the cause, it is said that before the existence of something, there is non-existence.

analyzed: d iti arthaḥ
translated: When there is existence of something, there is existence. This is the meaning.

original: bhavet kāryam iti tu pāpīyān pāṭhaḥ /
analyzed: bhavet kāryam iti tu pāpīyān pāṭhaḥ
translated: The reading bhāva (existence) is worse.

original: parasparopādānāhitarūpaviśeṣas tatsāmagryantargataḥ sarva eva kṣaṇaḥ pratyekaṃ samartha utpadyate /
analyzed: yadi paraspara upādāna āhita rūpa viśeṣaḥ tad sāmagrī antargataḥ sarvaḥ eva kṣaṇaḥ pratyekam samarthaḥ utpadyate
translated: Every moment included in that collection, having a form produced by mutual dependence, arises individually with the capacity [to produce its effect].

original: yato vijñānādiprasūtis tena tāvad avaśyaṃ jñānajananasvabhāvenaiva bhāvyam /
analyzed: yatas vijñāna ādi prasūtiḥ tena tāvat avaśyam jñāna janana svabhāvena eva bhāvyam
translated: Since [the cause] produces consciousness and so on, it must necessarily have the nature of producing knowledge.

original: avijñānajananasvabhāvenaiva vā /🔽na tu parasparaviruddhatadatajjananasvabhāvena bhedaprasaṅgādity abhiprāyavān paraścodayann āha nanv i /tyādi /
analyzed: a vijñāna janana svabhāvena eva vā  na tu paraspara viruddha tad a tad janana svabhāvena bheda prasaṅgāt iti abhiprāyavān paraḥ codayan āha nanu
translated: Or it must have the nature of not producing consciousness.🔽But it cannot have the nature of producing both that and its opposite, because that would lead to contradiction. With this intention, the opponent raises the objection, saying But how can it be the effect of something else?

original: kathaṃ tadanyakārya / iti bruvataś cāyam abhiprāyaḥ
analyzed: katham iti bruvataḥ ca ayam abhiprāyaḥ
translated: And the intention of one who says this is as follows:

analyzed: tad a tad rūpiṇaḥ bhāvāḥ tad a tad rūpa hetu jāḥ
translated: Things that have the form of that and what is not that are born from causes that have the form of that and what is not that.

analyzed: tad rūpa ādi kim ajñānam vijñāna abhinna hetu jam
translated: How is that form, etc., which is not knowledge, born from a cause that is not different from consciousness?

analyzed: pramāṇavāḥ iti
translated: [This is] in the Pramāṇavārttika.

analyzed: aneka kārya kriyā svabhāva tvāt
translated: Because it has the nature of producing many effects, because it has the form of producing many effects that consist of consciousness.

analyzed: teṣām sajātīya itara kṣaṇānām
translated: Of those, of the moments of the same type and other types.

original: teṣāṃ cakṣurādīnāṃ sattā tadānantaryeṇa darśanaṃ / tasmāt /
analyzed: teṣām cakṣuḥ ādīnām sattā tad ānantaryeṇa darśanam tasmāt
translated: And the existence of those eye faculties, etc. is seen through their immediate succession. Therefore,

original: nanu tatsannidhau vijñānalakṣaṇakāryadarśanāt vijñānasyaiva ity avadhāraṇāt tadavasthe doṣa kasmād idam ucyata ity āha tatre /ti
analyzed: nanu tad sannidhau vijñāna lakṣaṇa kārya darśanāt vijñānasya eva janakaḥ iti avadhāraṇāt tad avasthe doṣa kasmāt idam ucyate iti āha
translated: Isn't the fault still the same, since it is said from that? He says there.

original: anainaitad āha dharmamātrasya saṃdehād ayogavyavaccheda evātra nyāyaprāpto nānyayogavyavaccheda iti /
analyzed: āha dharma mātrasya saṃdehāt ayoga vyavacchedaḥ eva atra nyāya prāptaḥ na anya yoga vyavacchedaḥ iti
translated: By this he says that here, due to doubt about mere dharmas, exclusion of non-connection is obtained through reasoning, not exclusion of connection with another.

original: nanu ca yena rūpeṇa vijñānaṃ vijñānaṃ janayati yadi tenaikarūpeṇaiva rūpaṃ janayati tadā tenāvaśyaṃ tadvijñānavadbodhātmanā bhāvyam /
analyzed: nanu ca yena rūpeṇa vijñānam vijñānam janayati yadi tena eka rūpeṇa eva rūpam janayati tadā tena avaśyam tat vijñānavat bodha ātmanā bhāvyam
translated: But if consciousness produces consciousness with one form, and if it produces form with that very same form, then it must necessarily have that form of consciousness, which is the nature of awareness.

original: atha tadanyena janayati tarhi viruddharūpadvayānuṣaṅga ity āśaṅkyāha na cāta / iti /
analyzed: atha tad anyena janayati tarhi viruddha rūpa dvaya anuṣaṅgaḥ iti āśaṅkya āha na ca atas iti
translated: If it produces with something else, then there is the consequence of two contradictory forms. Fearing this objection, he says not so.

analyzed: atas vijñāna a vijñāna janana svabhāva tvāt
translated: Therefore, because of the nature of producing consciousness and non-consciousness.

original: kasmān na syād ity āha ekasyaive /ti /
analyzed: kasmāt na syāt iti āha
translated: Why wouldn't it be? He says of the very same.

analyzed: ātma atiśayasya sva hetu pratyaya sāmarthya āyāta vijñāna avijñāna upajanana yogya svabhāva viśeṣasya
translated: Of the self-nature, of the special nature capable of producing consciousness and non-consciousness obtained through the power of its own causes and conditions.

original: anenaitad darśayati ekenaiva rūpeṇa tattajjanayati tad ekaṃ rūpamīdṛgvijñānāvijñānajananam iti /
analyzed: anena etat darśayati ekena eva rūpeṇa tat tat janayati kevalam tat ekam rūpam īdṛś vijñāna a vijñāna jananam iti
translated: By this he shows that it produces each [effect] with just that form, and that that one form is of the nature of producing consciousness and non-consciousness.

original: etad uktaṃ bhavati tatsāmagryantargatānāṃ sarveṣām eva kṣaṇānāṃ svahetubhir idaṃ rūpam upanītaṃ yaduta yūṣmatprāgbhāve 'nekenaiva bodhābodhātmakena
analyzed: etat uktam bhavati tad sāmagrī antargatānām sarveṣām eva kṣaṇānām sva hetubhiḥ idam rūpam upanītam yat uta yūṣmat prāgbhāve na ekena eva bodha abodha ātmakena  /
translated: This is what is said: All the moments included in that aggregate are brought by their own causes to this form, namely, that you should produce the effect in many ways, both as knowledge and as non-knowledge,

analyzed: kāryeṇa janitavyam iti
translated: when they exist before you.

original: evaṃ tarhi vijnānābhinnahetujatvena p / sukhādīnāṃ bodhātmakatvaṃ duḥkhasādhakatvapannam /🔽tatrāpi hīdaṃ śakyate vaktuṃ proṣitāgatapriyaputrādikṣaṇasya svahetusamūhād eva tathābhūtaṃ rūpam upada
analyzed: evam tarhi sukha ādīnām bodha ātmaka tvam  tatra api hi idam śakyate vaktum proṣita āgata priya putra ādi kṣaṇasya sva hetu samūhāt eva tathābhūtam rūpam
translated: If so, then pleasure, etc., because they are produced by causes that are not different from consciousness, would have the nature of knowledge, and would be subject to producing suffering.

original: pādi yena vijñānam avijñānātmakaṃ ca sukham anyac ca janayatīti śuddhād rūpe /
analyzed: pādi yena vijñānam a vijñāna ātmakam ca sukham anyat ca janayati iti śuddhāt rūpe
translated: For there also this can be said: The moment of the beloved son, etc., who has returned from a journey, is brought by the very group of its own causes in such a way that it produces consciousness and pleasure, which is not of the nature of consciousness, and something else.

analyzed: yat ime
translated: If these.

original: tadviśeṣavadviśeṣākhyāne 'smābhih parihṛtam iti tata evanugantavyam iti /
analyzed: tad viśeṣavat viśeṣa ākhyāne sma abhiḥ parihṛtam iti tatas eva anugantavyam iti
translated: The answer to the statement that the particular of that has a particular has been given by us, so it should be understood from there itself.

original: pūrvam uktam adhunā puraskṛtāvadhāraṇoktāv iti bhedo draṣṭavyaḥ /
analyzed: pūrvam uktam adhunā puraskṛta avadhāraṇa uktau iti bhedaḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: It should be seen that the difference is that it was stated before, now it is stated with the determination placed in front.

analyzed: idaṃtayā vyapadeśa yogyam sa nidarśanam  sva deśe
translated: That which is fit to be designated as this is perceptible.

analyzed: bandhakam sa pratigham
translated: That which obstructs the arising of another in its own place is obstructive.

analyzed: iyam ca āgama bhāṣā
translated: And this is the language of the scriptures.

original: bhinnapravṛttinimittayor ekasminn arthe vṛttiḥ sāmānādhikaraṇyam teṣāṃ tannimittānāṃ tadayogād ekatraiva vṛttyanupapatteḥ /
analyzed: bhinna pravṛtti nimittayoḥ ekasmin arthe vṛttiḥ sāmānādhikaraṇyam teṣām tad nimittānām tad ayogāt ekatra eva vṛtti anupapatteḥ
translated: The co-reference of two things with different causes of operation is when they occur in the same object, because those causes cannot occur in the same place.

analyzed: apekṣāyām tad eka upakāra apekṣāyām  upakārasya upakārya abhedāt nyāya prāptāt iti
translated: In dependence.🔽Because the benefit is not different from the beneficiary, it is implied by logic.

analyzed: uktam eva adhika abhidhāna artham avatārayan āha
translated: He introduces the repetition of what has already been said for the sake of stating more, saying nor is it by inference.

original: pratibandhābhāva eva kuta ity āha tadgrāhaketi tadabhāvam eva pratipādayitum āha pratyakṣata / iti /
analyzed: pratibandha abhāvaḥ eva kutas iti āha tad grāhaka iti tad abhāvam eva pratipādayitum āha pratyakṣataḥ iti
translated: How is there just the absence of obstruction? He says by the sense perception of that. He says by direct perception to demonstrate just that absence.

analyzed: eka ātma tayā eva jyotīḥ rūpa ādi ātma tayā eva
translated: By the nature of being one. By the nature of being light, form, etc.

original: pratyakṣeṇaivam upalambhān na tāvat pratyakṣaṃ tatpratibandhasādhakam ity arthād darśitam /
analyzed: pratyakṣeṇa evam upalambhāt na tāvat pratyakṣam tad pratibandha sādhakam iti arthāt darśitam
translated: Since it is perceived thus by direct perception, it is indirectly shown that direct perception is not a proof of that obstruction.

original: yenānumānena kāryabhedasya kāraṇānekatvapratibandhaḥ sādhyate tatrāpi / etac caikasāmagryantargataviśiṣṭaikaikakāraṇāpekṣayā
analyzed: yena anumānena kārya bhedasya kāraṇa aneka tva pratibandhaḥ sādhyate tatra api etat ca eka sāmagrī antargata viśiṣṭa ekaika kāraṇa apekṣayā
translated: Even in that inference by which the difference in effect is proved to be related to the plurality of causes, this is in relation to each specific cause included within the same assemblage.

original: draṣṭavyam na tu kāraṇamātrāpekṣayā kalāpāt kalāpotpatter iti /
analyzed: draṣṭavyam na tu kāraṇa mātra apekṣayā kalāpāt kalāpa utpatteḥ iti
translated: It should be seen that it is not just in dependence on the cause, because an aggregate arises from an aggregate.

analyzed: atra eva doṣa antaram samuccinvan āha
translated: Here, connecting with another fault, he says of one (verse 21).
If the acceptance of many actions is not accepted in the state of being a cooperative condition and material cause,

original: asmābhir abhyupetaṃ syāt pramāṇopapannaṃ tadā dharmisvabhāvatayaiva taducyetety abhiprāyeṇoktam
analyzed: asmābhiḥ abhyupetam syāt pramāṇa upapannam tadā dharmi svabhāva tayā eva tat ucyeta iti abhiprāyeṇa uktam
translated: if it were accepted by us and established by valid cognition, then it would be stated just as the nature of the subject. With this intention, it is said

original: ekasyānekasvabhāvatāyā eva cintyatvād i /ti /🔽anyatheti yadi yenānekenaivaka
analyzed: ekasya aneka svabhāva tāyāḥ eva cintya tvāt  anyathā iti yadi yena anekena
translated: that the nature of one as many is itself to be considered.

original: svabhāvatām anubhavati tad eva paraṃ bhidyate /
analyzed: svabhāva tām anubhavati tat eva param bhidyate
translated: Otherwise, if it experiences the nature of many by just one, then that very other is divided.

original: na tv asau dharmīti iti /r hetau /
analyzed: na tu asau dharmī iti hetau
translated: But that is not the subject. Thus, in the reason.

original: ekaṃ kāryaṃ yasyānekasya tad ekakāryaṃ tasya bhāvas tattā / na syād ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: ekam kāryam yasya anekasya tat eka kāryam tasya bhāvaḥ tad tā na syāt iti arthaḥ
translated: That which has many as one effect, that is one effect. The state of that is its nature. It would not exist. This is the meaning.

original: tasyaiva kāryasya yadātmapuraskāreṇa dharmiparyāyavyavasthā tena bhedād evaikarūpatvābhāvād iti samudāyārthaḥ /
analyzed: tasya eva kāryasya yad ātma puraskāreṇa dharmi paryāya vyavasthā tena bhedāt eva eka rūpa tva abhāvāt iti samudāya arthaḥ
translated: The establishment of the synonyms of the subject by the preeminence of that very effect, by that very difference, there is no single form. This is the meaning of the whole.

original: nanu naivāsmābhir ekam anekaṃ karotīty ucyate yena tvayaivam ucyeta /
analyzed: nanu na eva asmābhiḥ ekam anekam karoti iti ucyate yena tvayā evam ucyeta
translated: But we do not say that one makes many, by which this could be said by you.

original: kintu samagrāvasthāyāṃ tadekaikam eva tadekaikam upakalpayatīty āśaṃkya na caike /tyādi prathamato yojyam /
analyzed: kintu samagra avasthāyām tad ekaikam eva tat ekaikam upakalpayati iti āśaṃkya na prathamatas yojyam
translated: But when they are in a complete state, each one of them provides for each one of them. Suspecting this, one should first apply not one and so on.

analyzed: kasmāt na janayati iti apekṣāyām tu paścāt yojyam
translated: Why not? But when there is dependence, it should be applied later.

analyzed: eva
translated: Together, simultaneously.

original: etaddoṣabhayāt parasparopādānakṛtopakārāpekṣatve ceṣyamāṇe teṣām ekaikena bhāvatastāvataḥ kṣaṇasyopakārāt /
analyzed: etad doṣa bhayāt paraspara upādāna kṛta upakāra apekṣa tve ca iṣyamāṇe teṣām ekaikena bhāvataḥ tāvataḥ kṣaṇasya upakārāt
translated: When it is intended that they depend on the mutual benefit created by mutual acceptance, out of fear of this fault, each one of them benefits that many moments of existence.

original: katham ekam anekakāryakṛn n syād iti cānena darśitam /
analyzed: katham ekam aneka kārya kṛt syāt iti ca anena darśitam
translated: How could one not be the doer of many effects? This is shown by him.🔽And from that,

analyzed: tatas ced
translated: because it is impossible for one to do many effects,

original: gatārtham apy etat kaṇṭhoktaṃ kurvann āha /
analyzed: gatārtham api etat kaṇṭha uktam kurvan āha
translated: although this has already been stated, he repeats it emphatically.

analyzed: yathāyogam eka aneka śabdau sambandhavyau
