analyzed: svabhāvasya tābhyām dravya paryāyābhyām
translated: That of the different nature from those two, substance and succession.

original: ta / ity anenoktaṃ bahutvam evāha dharmī /tyādi /
analyzed: te iti anena uktam bahu tvam eva āha
translated: That refers to the plurality stated by that. The property-possessor, etc.

analyzed: tebhyaḥ draya paryāya tad anya svabhāvebhyaḥ nyaḥ bhinnaḥ svabhāvaḥ teṣām eva
translated: Different from those, substance, succession, and other natures, is the undifferentiated nature of those very

original: trayāṇām abhedasiddhyarthaṃ kalpyate yadi tatrāpi sa eva doṣa iti punaḥ svabhāvāntarakalpane
analyzed: trayāṇām abheda siddhi artham kalpyate yadi tatra api saḥ eva doṣaḥ iti punar svabhāva antara kalpane
translated: If it is imagined to establish the non-difference of the three, then that same fault would apply there as well, so another intrinsic nature would have to be imagined.

analyzed: ca pūrvaḥ iva prasaṅgaḥ syāt
translated: And then, as before, there would be the fault of infinite regress.

analyzed: atra eva doṣa antaram samuccinvan āha dharmī tvam
translated: Here, connecting with another fault, he says iti.

original: kuta evaṃ syād ity āha tattantratvād i /ti /
analyzed: kutas evam syāt iti āha tad tantra tvāt
translated: Why would it be so? He says tat-tantra-tvāt.

analyzed: tasmin pāratantryam tasmāt
translated: That dependence is on that.

original: kayos tattantratvam ity apekṣāyām p / āha tad anyayor i /ti /
analyzed: kayoḥ tad tantra tvam iti apekṣāyām āha tat anyayoḥ
translated: When there is expectation of whose dependence, he says tat-anyayoḥ.

original: tasmād ekasvabhāvād anyayor dravyaparyāyayor bhedasyābhedasya ca tanmūlatvāt tattantratvaṃ pratyeyam /
analyzed: tasmāt eka svabhāvāt anyayoḥ dravya paryāyayoḥ bhedasya abhedasya ca tad mūla tvāt tad tantra tvam pratyeyam
translated: From that one intrinsic nature, the difference and non-difference of the other two, substance and attribute, should be understood to be dependent on that as their root.

original: astu tarhi tasya tathātvam anekātmakatvaṃ ca vastunaḥ /
analyzed: astu tarhi tasya tathātvam aneka ātmaka tvam ca vastunaḥ
translated: Then let there be that suchness and manifold nature of the entity.

original: na ca dṛṣṭasyānavasthayā apalāpaḥ śakya ity āha na caivam i /ti /
analyzed: na ca dṛṣṭasya anavasthayā apalāpaḥ śakyaḥ iti āha na ca evam
translated: And the seen cannot be denied by infinite regress, he says na ca evaṃ.

analyzed: caḥ yasmāt na evam pramāṇena gamyate
translated: ca is because it is not thus cognized by valid cognition.

analyzed: prakaraṇam upasaṃharan āha
translated: Concluding the topic, he says tenā.

analyzed: tena anantara uktena kāraṇa kalāpena ayam anekāntavādaḥ jālma kalpitaḥ utpatha prasthita kalpitaḥ
translated: By that set of reasons just stated, this doctrine of non-absolutism, imagined by the deceitful, is set forth on a wrong path, imagined.

original: iti /r hetau / bahubhāṣitayā alaṃ / na kiñcit /
analyzed: hetau bahu bhāṣitayā alam na kiñcid
translated: Thus. In the sense of cause. Enough of much talk. Nothing at all.

original: etāvataiva sarvasya samāhitatvād iti bhāvaḥ /🔽avaśyamo āvaśyakam ity asya bhāvapratyayāntatvād apṛkkaraṇasyāvaśyakam iti
analyzed: etāvatā eva sarvasya samāhita tvāt iti bhāvaḥ  āvaśyakam iti asya bhāva pratyaya anta tvāt apṛk karaṇasya āvaśyakam iti
translated: The idea is that by this much alone, everything is concentrated.🔽Since the suffix tva (abstract noun suffix) is added to avasyaka (necessary), the necessity of not separating is obtained.

original: prāpte yoyam āvaśyakam apṛthakkaraṇam i /ti prayoge sāmānādhikaraṇyena nirdeśaḥ
analyzed: prāpte yaḥ yam āvaśyakam apṛthakkaraṇam prayoge sāmānādhikaraṇyena nirdeśaḥ
translated: When this usage the necessity of not separating is directed by co-reference,

original: saḥ katham iti tu na jāne mahānta eva praṣṭavyāḥ /🔽saṃyogavibhāgeṣu / kartavyeṣu anapekṣo / na kāraṇam iti tat kāraṇamātraṃ vivakṣitam /
analyzed: saḥ katham iti tu na jāne mahāntaḥ eva praṣṭavyāḥ  saṃyoga vibhāgeṣu kartavyeṣu anapekṣaḥ na kāraṇam iti tat kāraṇa mātram vivakṣitam
translated: I do not know how that is. The great ones themselves should be asked.🔽When conjunctions and disjunctions are to be done, it is independent, not a cause. Thus, only a cause is intended.

analyzed: na tu viśeṣa pratiṣedhāt sāpekṣasya kāraṇa tvam
translated: But not the causal nature of the dependent one due to the negation of a particular [cause].

analyzed: aguṇa tvena ca dravya karmaṇoḥ vyavacchedaḥ
translated: And by the quality of being without qualities, substance and action are excluded.

analyzed: sāmānyavat tvena ca sāmānya viśeṣa samavāyānām
translated: And by the quality of having universals, universals, particulars, and inherence are excluded.

original: saṃyogavibhāgāpekṣayā tv anapekṣo na kāraṇaṃ kintu sāpekṣa eva kāraṇam iti vivakṣitam /
analyzed: saṃyoga vibhāga apekṣayā tu anapekṣaḥ na kāraṇam kintu sāpekṣaḥ eva kāraṇam iti vivakṣitam
translated: But it is intended that in relation to conjunctions and disjunctions, an independent [cause] is not a cause, but only a dependent [cause] is a cause.

analyzed: sāpekṣa tvam na draṣṭavyam
translated: The dependent nature should not be seen.

original: na tu kasyacid anyānapekṣasyaiva kāraṇatvam asti yenānapekṣo 'kāraṇam ity ucyamānaṃ śobheta /
analyzed: na tu kasyacid anya anapekṣasya eva kāraṇa tvam asti yena anapekṣaḥ kāraṇam iti ucyamānam śobheta
translated: But no one is a cause independently of something else, so that it would be appropriate to say that what is independent is not a cause.

original: tadātvaguṇatvena dravyasya vyavacchedo draṣṭavyaḥ /🔽tad yathā tantuturīsaṃyogalakṣaṇo guṇaḥ paṭaturīsaṃyoge kartavye paṭaṃ paścādbhāvinam apekṣate /
analyzed: tadātva guṇa tvena dravyasya vyavacchedaḥ draṣṭavyaḥ  tat yathā tantu turī saṃyoga lakṣaṇaḥ guṇaḥ paṭa turī saṃyoge kartavye paṭam paścādbhāvinam apekṣate
translated: The exclusion of substance should be seen as being due to its being a quality at that time.🔽For example, a quality characterized by the conjunction of a thread and a loom, in the production of the conjunction of a cloth and a loom, depends on the cloth, which comes into existence later.

original: yathā ca vaṃśādau 'vayavāntarād vibhāgaḥ paścādbhāvinaṃ dravyavināśam apekṣya sakriyasyāvayavasyākāśādideśād vibhāgam
analyzed: yathā ca vaṃśa ādau vayava antarāt vibhāgaḥ paścāt bhāvinam dravya vināśam apekṣya sa kriyasya avayavasya ākāśa ādi deśāt vibhāgam
translated: And just as the disjunction from another part in a bamboo, etc., depending on the destruction of the substance, which comes into existence later, causes the disjunction of the active part from the space, etc.,

original: yathā cāsau na kriyājo vibhāgaḥ kintu vibhāgaja eveti vibhāgajaṃ vibhāgam abhyupagacchadbhirvaiśeṣikair iṣyate tathā nehāprakṛtatvād ucyate
analyzed: yathā ca asau na kriyā jaḥ vibhāgaḥ kintu vibhāga jaḥ eva iti vibhāga jam vibhāgam abhyupagacchadbhiḥ vaiśeṣikaiḥ iṣyate tathā na iha aprakṛta tvāt ucyate
translated: And just as the Vaisheshikas, who accept that the disjunction is produced by disjunction, not by action, accept that the disjunction is produced by disjunction, so it is not stated here because it is not the topic.

analyzed: guṇavat iti samavāyi kāraṇa tvasya saṃgrahaḥ
translated: In like a quality, etc., the inclusion of being a substantial cause is grasped by the word etc.

analyzed: prakaraṇāt bauddha kṛtam codyam draṣṭavyam
translated: The objection raised by the Buddhists should be seen from the context.

analyzed: tasya parihāraḥ iti vigrahaḥ
translated: The analysis is: this is the reply to that.

analyzed: asmākam ayam āsmākīnaḥ
translated: This is ours, belonging to us.

original: yuṣmad asmadbhyām anyatarasyām khañ ity anena khaña kartavyaḥ /
analyzed: asmadbhyām anyatarasyām khañ iti anena khaña kartavyaḥ
translated: The affix khya should be used in the sense of one of the two, namely you and I, by the word khya.

analyzed: prāc ukta saṃskāra pakṣe iva
translated: As before. As in the case of the previously mentioned purification.

analyzed: nirbandha grahaṇena ca iti ācaṣṭe iti sambandhaḥ
translated: By the word 'nirbandha' (in the commentary), he says 'ca' (and). The connection is this.

analyzed: pāṇinīyam sūtram tu bhinnam
translated: The sūtra of Pāṇini is different.

analyzed: sahakaraṇa śīlāḥ eka karaṇa śīlāḥ
translated: They have the nature of acting together. They have the nature of acting by one instrument.

analyzed: pratyaya antaram vāsanā prabodhakam rasa ādikam ca yathāyogyam vācyam
translated: Another suffix, which awakens the impressions and expresses rasa etc., should be mentioned.

analyzed: tad sāpekṣā
translated: They depend on that.

analyzed: tatas sāmagryāḥ tathābhūtāyāḥ
translated: From that, from such a collection.
Of the other, i.e. of the non-conceptual one which has rasa etc. as its object.

analyzed: tad upādeya tvena vijñāna lakṣaṇa upādāna upādeya tvena
translated: By the fact of its being to be accepted, by the fact of its being to be accepted as the cause of consciousness.

original: nanu ca manaskārādisamudāyajanyam idam ekam upadarśitam etatsāmagrīmadhyapraviṣṭaikajanyaṃ tu kiṃ na darśitam ity āha tadanyad i /ti
analyzed: nanu ca manaskāra ādi samudāya janyam idam ekam upadarśitam etad sāmagrī madhya praviṣṭa eka janyam tu kim na darśitam iti āha tad anyat
translated: But it is produced by the aggregate of mental activity etc. This has been shown. But why is it not shown to be produced by only one thing included in that aggregate? He says 'that other' etc.

analyzed: eka janyam iti tad sāmagrī antar patita kāraṇa anapekṣa eka janyam avaseyam
translated: It should be understood that what is produced by one thing is produced by only one thing not depending on the causes included in that aggregate.

original: na tv ekajanyaṃ nāma kiñcit saṃbhavati /
analyzed: na tu eka janyam nāma kiñcid saṃbhavati
translated: But nothing called 'produced by one thing' is possible.

analyzed: tatra cakṣuḥ ādi nirapekṣa manaskāra janyaḥ manaḥ rājya ādi vikalpaḥ
translated: And there, the mental conception such as a mind-born city, etc., is produced by attention independent of the eye, etc.

analyzed: viṣaya ādi nirapekṣa cakṣuḥ manaskāra ātmaka dvaya janyam dvi candra ādi vijñānam
translated: The consciousness of two moons, etc., is produced by the two, the eye and attention, independent of the object, etc.

analyzed: samanantara pratyayāt vijñānāt cakṣuḥ vijñānasya upalambhāmahe
translated: We observe the apprehension of eye-consciousness from consciousness, which is the immediately preceding condition.

original: tyādyabhidhānād evaitad ūhituṃ śakyam ity ahiprāyeṇa ca svayam ūhyam i /ty āha /
analyzed: tya ādi abhidhānāt eva etat ūhitum śakyam iti ahi prāyeṇa ca ūhyam āha
translated: Since this can be inferred just from the statement beginning with that, he says should be inferred by oneself, as if intending that it should be inferred by oneself.

original: nanu kiṃ bhāgato viśeṣavṛttir bahuvacanena nirdeśa ity āhatajjanyāpekṣayā ce /ti /
analyzed: nanu kim bhāgataḥ viśeṣa vṛttiḥ yena bahuvacanena nirdeśaḥ iti
translated: But how is it that there is a direction with the plural ending, indicating a partial specific occurrence? He says and also in relation to what is produced by that.

analyzed: sāmagrī antarasya svabhāva bhedavataḥ bhāvāt bhinna kārya prasūtiḥ
translated: Because of the existence of a different collection with a different nature, it produces a different effect.

analyzed: svayam abhyūhyam s  a tad janya apekṣayā s
translated: It should be inferred by oneself.🔽In relation to what is not produced by that.

original: kutaḥ svabhāvabhedavattvaṃ tasyety apekṣāyāṃ yojyam kāryāntare /tyādi /
analyzed: kutas svabhāva bhedavat tvam tasya iti apekṣāyām yojyam
translated: When there is an expectation of from where does it have a different nature?, it should be connected with in relation to a different effect, etc.

original: pṛthivyādīny upādāya vartanta ity upādāya rūpaṃ / parasparādi mayūravyaṃsakāditvāt samāsaḥ /
analyzed: pṛthivī ādīni upādāya vartante iti upādāya rūpam paraspara ādi mayūra vyaṃsaka ādi tvāt samāsaḥ
translated: Form derived from the elements such as earth is form that exists depending on the elements such as earth. The compound is based on mutual dependence, like peacock-feathered.

analyzed: āgama apekṣayā vaktum udyatena ca pareṇa āgama bhāṣā eva anūditā
translated: In relation to the scriptures, the opponent who is ready to speak has only repeated the scriptures.

analyzed: svabhāva sthitam tena āśrayaḥ sthiteḥ āśrayaḥ
translated: The support is the support of the natural state, because of the state of the support.

analyzed: svabhāva sthiti āśrayaḥ
translated: The support is the support of the natural state.

analyzed: avaśyam hi pratibandhakena kiñcitkareṇa bhāvyam
translated: For it is necessary that there be something that is produced by the obstructing cause.

analyzed: kiñcit śabda vācyena artha antareṇa iti abhiprāyeṇa āha svabhāva antara utpādane yāvat
translated: With the intention that the meaning of the word 'something' is a different thing, he says 'up to the production of a different nature'.

original: nanūpakāraka ādhāro na tu janakas tat katham evam ucyata ity āha nahī /ti /
analyzed: nanu upakārakaḥ ādhāraḥ na tu janakaḥ tat katham evam ucyate iti āha
translated: But the helper is the basis, not the producer. How is it said in this way? He says 'for it is not'.

analyzed: bhūtānām
translated: Of the elements.

analyzed: ucyate iti kathyate iti draṣṭavyam
translated: 'It is said' should be seen as 'it is said in the Vaibhāṣika view'.

analyzed: na tu sautrāntika naye bhūta bhautika vibhāgaḥ asti
translated: But in the Sautrāntika system, there is no division of elements and derivatives.

analyzed: kāla kṣepeṇa kāla vilaṃbane
translated: By the lapse of time, by the delay of time.

analyzed: anugrāhya sahacāriṇā iti avaseyam
translated: It should be understood as 'accompanying that which is to be favored'.

analyzed: anantaram tad utpādanāt
translated: Immediately after, because of its production.

analyzed: tasya viśeṣasya utpādanāt
translated: Because of the production of that particularity.

analyzed: tasya kriyamāṇa viśeṣasya
translated: Of that, of the particularity that is being produced.

original: kathaṃ tatrākiñcitkaratvaṃ tasya jñāpitaṃ bhavatīty āha śaktipratibandhakāpanayanene /ti /
analyzed: katham tatra akiñcitkara tvam tasya jñāpitam bhavati iti āha
translated: How is its non-doing of anything there made known? He says 'by the removal of the obstruction to potentiality'.

original: yasmād arthe 'yaṃ nipātaḥ na vainaiveti vyācakṣāṇo vai /śabdam avadhāraṇe darśayati /
analyzed: yasmāt arthe yam nipātaḥ na vyācakṣāṇaḥ avadhāraṇe darśayati
translated: Because this particle is used in the sense of 'not only', the commentator shows that the word 'va' (only) is used in the sense of restriction.

analyzed: saṃbhāvanāyām nyāya bala āyātāyām iti avaseyam
translated: In the sense of possibility, it should be understood that it is brought about by the force of logic.

analyzed: atas eva vyanakti
translated: For this very reason, he explains it as 'logic'.

original: p / anena sahakārīty atraikārthaḥ sahaśabdovārtikakāreṇa darśitaḥ /
analyzed: anena sahakārī iti atra ekārthaḥ saha śabdaḥ vārttikakāreṇa darśitaḥ
translated: By this, the commentator shows that the word 'saha' (together) in 'sahāyaka' (helper) has the same meaning as 'saha' (together).

original: kathaṃ tarhi saha yugapat kurvanta / ity ayaṃ vyācaṣṭeti cet /
analyzed: katham tarhi saha yugapad kurvantaḥ iti ayam vyācaṣṭa iti ced
translated: If it is asked how they perform together simultaneously, he explains it thus.

original: uktam atra pūrvam iti na punar ucyate /
analyzed: uktam atra pūrvam iti na punar ucyate
translated: It has been said before, so it is not stated again.

analyzed: evaṃvidhaḥ iti ekārtha kārī
translated: Such is the one who performs the same purpose.🔽The helper like fire etc. is grasped as diminished by the intention of the effect characterized by the moment of cold etc.

original: yāvate /ti tṛtīyāntapratirūpako 'yaṃ nipāto yasmād ity asminn arthe /
analyzed: tṛtīyā anta pratirūpakaḥ yam nipātaḥ yasmāt iti asmin arthe
translated: As much as this is a particle in the sense of 'because', similar to the accusative ending.

analyzed: kiṃtu etasmin arthe vai anuvartate
translated: But in this sense, 'tu' (but) is used.

original: sahitā anyena yuktāḥ / kṣaṇamātrasthāyinaḥ /🔽tadavasthāyā prāk pūrvaṃ paścād uttarakālaṃpṛthak tadvikalāvasthāyāṃ bhāvaḥ / sadbhāvaḥ /
analyzed: sahitāḥ anyena yuktāḥ kṣaṇa mātra sthāyinaḥ  tad avasthāyāḥ prāk pūrvam paścāt tad vikala avasthāyām bhāvaḥ sadbhāvaḥ
translated: Associated with another, united, lasting for a moment.🔽The existence, the presence, in the state prior to that, before, after, at a later time, separately, in a state deficient in that,

analyzed: pṛthaktva s
translated: separateness

original: nanu yadi svahetoḥ samarthasyotpattis tarhi katham anantaram uktam te samarthāḥ svabhāvataḥ / ity ata āha paramate /ti /
analyzed: nanu yadi sva hetoḥ samarthasya utpattiḥ tarhi katham anantaram uktam te samarthāḥ svabhāvataḥ iti atas āha
translated: But if the production of what is able from its own cause, then how is it said immediately after that they are able by their own nature? Therefore he says in the opinion of others.

original: bhavatyasmāt kāryam iti bhāvo hetus tasmād iti /
analyzed: bhavati asmāt kāryam iti bhāvaḥ hetuḥ tasmāt iti
translated: The cause is that from which an effect arises. From that means from that.

original: tad api tvayā kasmān na vyākhyātam iti cet /
analyzed: tat api tvayā kasmāt na vyākhyātam iti ced
translated: But why hasn't that also been explained by you?

original: na / sa kuta utpanna ity asya vyāghātaprasaṃgāt /
analyzed: na kutas utpannaḥ iti asya vyāghāta prasaṃgāt
translated: No, because of the consequence of contradiction in saying where does that arise from?,

original: sahakāribhyaḥ sāmarthyamicchantī /ti camīmāṃsakamatāśrayaṇenāha na tunaiyāyikāevam icchanti yena tanmatopagraheṇāpy etat saṃgaccheta /
analyzed: sahakāribhyaḥ ca mīmāṃsaka mata āśrayaṇena āha na tu naiyāyikāḥ evam icchanti yena tad mata upagraheṇa api etat saṃgaccheta
translated: Desiring ability from auxiliaries, he says but Naiyāyikas do not desire it in this way, referring to the Mīmāṃsaka opinion, by which this would be appropriate even by accepting that opinion.

analyzed: sahakāri sākalyasya eva taiḥ sāmarthya rūpa tvena iṣṭeḥ
translated: Because they consider the completeness of auxiliaries itself to be the form of ability.

original: tathā cāha jalpamahodaghiḥsahakārisākalyaṃ tadvataḥ sāmarthyaṃ vaikalyaṃ tv asāmarthyam iti /
analyzed: tathā ca āha jalpa mahodaghiḥ sahakāri sākalyam tadvataḥ sāmarthyam vaikalyam tu asāmarthyam iti
translated: And thus the great ocean of debate says: The completeness of auxiliaries is the ability of what possesses them, but incompleteness is the inability.

analyzed: micchati s
translated: Desires.

analyzed: samartham śaktam
translated: Able. Capable.

original: āvaśyakaṃjananam i /ty asya śabdasya tu siddhiḥpūrvaṃ na jāne /
analyzed: asya śabdasya tu na jāne
translated: But I do not know the derivation of the word necessary production.
The state of being necessarily productive.

original: draṣṭavyam pṛ / paṃ / avaśyamo bhāvaḥ ityādinā na jāne ityantena kṛtā /
analyzed: draṣṭavyam bhāvaḥ ityādinā na jāne iti antena kṛtā
translated: The view should be seen from the words pṛ. pa. avy. mo. bhāvaḥ up to the end na jānāmi.

analyzed: etad arthakaḥ pāṭhaḥ truṭitaḥ utra bhāti
translated: The reading that conveys this meaning seems to be missing here.

original: kuśūlañ ca tadapanetṛpuruṣaprayatnaś ca kṣetranayanaṃ ca prakiraṇaṃ / ca prakaraṇāt kṣetre prakiraṇaṃ ceti dvandvaṃ kṛtvā paścād ādiśabdena
analyzed: kuśūlam ca tad apanetṛ puruṣa prayatnaḥ ca kṣetra nayanam ca prakiraṇam ca prakaraṇāt kṣetre prakiraṇam ca iti dvandvam kṛtvā paścāt ādi śabdena
translated: The winnowing basket, the effort of the man who removes it, the bringing of the field, and the scattering - from the context, the scattering in the field - having made a dvandva compound, afterwards the word ādi

analyzed: bahuvrīhiḥ kāryaḥ
translated: should be made into a bahuvrīhi compound.

original: prakiraṇam ity ayam auṇādikaḥ śabdo na tu kiratirlyuḍanto draṣṭavyas tadā guṇasyāpratiṣedhena prakaraṇam iti prāpter /
analyzed: prakiraṇam iti ayam auṇādikaḥ śabdaḥ na tu kiratiḥ lyuṭ antaḥ draṣṭavyaḥ tadā guṇasya apratiṣedhena prakaraṇam iti prāpteḥ
translated: This word prakiraṇa should be seen as a nominal derivation, not as kiran with the lyu suffix, because then, due to the non-prohibition of the guna, the context would be obtained.

original: sametya / yogyadeśe sthitvā sambhūya ādyena saha militvā pratyayaiḥ sahakāryupādānarūpaiḥ /
analyzed: sametya yogya deśe sthitvā sambhūya ādyena saha militvā pratyayaiḥ sahakāri upādāna rūpaiḥ
translated: Having come together, having remained in a suitable place, having assembled together with the first, having united with the conditions in the form of cooperating causes and materials,

original: nanu ca ata eva tayor avasthayor ityādinā pratyabhijñāyāḥ prāmāṇyam apoditam eva tat kathaṃ na punar uktektam i
analyzed: nanu ca atas eva tayoḥ avasthayoḥ ityādinā pratyabhijñāyāḥ prāmāṇyam apoditam eva tat katham na punar ukta iktam iti
translated: But hasn't the validity of recognition been refuted by the statement for this very reason, regarding those two states and so on? How is it not stated again?

analyzed: ti āha pūrvam
translated: He says previously and so on.

analyzed: etat api sārūpya viṣaya pratyabhijñā prāmāṇya nirākaraṇam iti
translated: This is also the refutation of the validity of recognition that has the object of similarity.

analyzed: uktam eva sāmarthyāt eva
translated: It is stated by implication itself.

original: tarhi kim arthaṃ punar uktam ity āha vipañcanārthaṃ tv i /ti tuḥ pūrvasmād asya kathanasya viśeṣaṃ darśayati /
analyzed: tarhi kim artham punar uktam iti āha vipañcana artham tu    pūrvasmāt asya kathanasya viśeṣam darśayati
translated: Then why is it stated again? He says: But in order to elaborate. The word but shows the difference of this statement from the previous one.

analyzed: ādhyātmikeṣu āntareṣu
translated: In the internal, in the internal.

original: paścād bāhyepi darśayitavyatvāt krame tāvac śabdam āha /
analyzed: paścāt bāhye pi darśayitavya tvāt krame tāvat śabdam āha
translated: Since it should be shown later in the external as well, he first uses the word order.

original: śakyaparicchedaṃ / viśiṣṭakāryakāraṇatayā paricchettuṃ śakyam /🔽sākṣād avyavadhānena vijñānakāryakāriṇaḥ pratyayāddhetoḥ /
analyzed: śakya paricchedam viśiṣṭa kārya kāraṇatayā paricchettum śakyam  avyavadhānena vijñāna kārya kāriṇaḥ pratyayāt hetoḥ
translated: That which can be delimited, which can be delimited by the specific cause and effect.🔽From a cause, a condition that is the cause of consciousness without direct obstruction.

analyzed: tasya janane vyavadhāna ādi pratipattau vyavadhāna ādi svīkāre
translated: In the production, when understanding through obstruction, etc., accepting obstruction, etc.

original: kathaṃ tādṛśo na bhavatīty āha anyādṛśād iti /
analyzed: katham tādṛśaḥ na bhavati iti āha anyādṛśāt iti
translated: How is it not like that? He says: from a different kind.

original: anyādṛśāddhi bhavannanyādṛśasyāpi hetor hetuvyapadeśasaṃbhavāj jananahetur ity āha /
analyzed: anyādṛśāt hi bhavan anyādṛśasya api hetoḥ hetu vyapadeśa saṃbhavāt janana hetuḥ iti āha
translated: For what is produced from a different kind can also be called the cause of a different kind of cause, therefore he says: the cause of production.

original: kathaṃ taddhetur ity āha tad iti tatsahakāribhiḥ parasparopasarpaṇādyāśrayahetusahakāribhir indriyādibhiḥ /
analyzed: katham tad hetuḥ iti āha tat iti tad sahakāribhiḥ paraspara upasarpaṇa ādi āśraya hetu sahakāribhiḥ indriya ādibhiḥ
translated: How is it the cause of that? He says: that, by that, by those cooperating factors, by the causes of mutual approach, etc., which are the cooperating causes of the basis, by the sense faculties, etc.

original: ca tadvijñānajanane svasvakṣaṇāntaraṃ ceti tathā tasyārambhāt /
analyzed: samartham ca tat vijñāna janane sva sva kṣaṇa antaram ca iti tathā tasya ārambhāt
translated: And by that consciousness, and by its own next moment, because it is produced in that way.

analyzed: anena paraspara upasarpaṇa ādi āśraya pratyaya viśeṣa indriya ādi kalāpasya sākṣāt vijñāna hetoḥ hetu tvam darśitam
translated: By this, it shows that the collection of faculties, etc., which is the basis for mutual contact, etc., and is the special condition, is the direct cause of consciousness.

analyzed: etat ca anantaram eva spaṣṭayiṣyate
translated: And this will be clarified immediately after.

analyzed: idam ca ākṣepavatīm sāmagrīm abhipretya uktam draṣṭavyam
translated: And this should be seen as stated with reference to the collection that includes projection.

analyzed: katham iti āha paraspara iti
translated: How? He says mutual and so on.

original: vijñānanirmāṇasamarthāś ca te hetavaś ca te ca te indriyādayaś ca teṣām upādānaiḥ /
analyzed: vijñāna nirmāṇa samarthāḥ ca te hetavaḥ ca te ca te indriya ādayaḥ ca teṣām upādānaiḥ
translated: And those causes are capable of producing consciousness, and those are the faculties, etc., and their materials.

analyzed: samartha hetu indriya ādeḥ jananam tasmāt
translated: The production of the capable cause, faculties, etc., is from that.

analyzed: anantara ukta spaṣṭīkaraṇam ca etat draṣṭavyam
translated: And this should be seen as the clarification of what was just said.

original: S pratir atra truṭitā /🔽sukhasaṃvarditatvād iti vyācakṣāṇo mūle sukhaidhita ity asyānabhiyoganimittasyāpi sāmarthyāt krīḍana /śīla ity asya hetubhāvena
analyzed: s pratiḥ atra truṭitā  sukha saṃvardita tvāt iti vyācakṣāṇaḥ mūle sukha edhitaḥ iti asya anabhiyoga nimittasya api sāmarthyāt iti asya hetu bhāvena viśeṣaṇa tvam
translated: The particle is omitted here.

analyzed: darśayati
translated: Explaining because it is nourished by pleasure, he shows that fond of play is the cause of nourished by pleasure, because it is also capable of being the reason for non-exertion.

original: nanu kṛtaṃ niṣpāditam ucyate 'tra ca kimācāryeṇa niṣpāditam ity āśaṃkāṃ nirākurvann āha kṛtam i /ti /
analyzed: nanu kṛtam niṣpāditam ucyate ca kim ācāryeṇa niṣpāditam iti āśaṃkām nirākurvan āha kṛtam
translated: Doesn't done mean accomplished? And what has been accomplished by the teacher here? Dispelling this doubt, he says done.

original: na punar e /vam ācakṣāṇena dvir uktābhāvo darśita iti boddhavyam /
analyzed: na punar ācakṣāṇena dvis ukta abhāvaḥ darśitaḥ iti boddhavyam
translated: But it should not be understood that by saying this, the non-repetition is shown.

original: asyārthasyāsakṛduktatvāt ekavāraṃ prativihite punaḥ pratividhāpayitari avajñāsaṃbhavenopahāsāṃyogāc ca kṛtaṃ kṛtam iti nirdeśasya nyā
analyzed: asya arthasya asakṛt ukta tvāt eka vāram prativihite punar pratividhāpayitari avajñā saṃbhavena upahāsa aṃyogāt ca kṛtam kṛtam iti nirdeśasya
translated: Because this meaning has been stated many times, and when it has been refuted once, there is no possibility of refutation again, and because of the possibility of ridicule due to the occurrence of contempt, the statement done, done is not proper.

analyzed: ati prasiddha tvāt ca iti
translated: And because it is too well-known.

original: nanu kiṃ kurvantaṃ kartuṃ prayuṅkte punaḥ pūrvapakṣavādī yena punaḥ pūrvapakṣavādī kārayatīty ucyata ity āha punar ityādi /
analyzed: nanu kim kurvantam kartum prayuṅkte punar pūrvapakṣa vādī yena punar pūrvapakṣa vādī kārayati iti ucyate iti āha punar ityādi
translated: But what does the proponent of the prima facie view make the opponent do again, by which the proponent of the prima facie view is said to make the opponent do again? He says again and so on.

analyzed: nirloṭhitam nirūpitam nirṇītam iti yāvat
translated: It has been sifted, it has been examined, it has been determined, is what is meant.

original: pūrvavan mīmāṃsakābhiprāyeṇa sāmarthyaṃ sahakāribhyo jāyata / ity ācaṣṭe /
analyzed: pūrvavat mīmāṃsaka abhiprāyeṇa sāmarthyam sahakāribhyaḥ jāyate iti ācaṣṭe
translated: As before, according to the Mimamsa view, he states that potency arises from auxiliaries.

analyzed: tadvataḥ na utpattiḥ
translated: The arising of potency, the non-arising of that which possesses it.

original: p / samprati prakārāntareṇāpi pratyabhijñāyā aprāmāṇyaṃ paramabhyupagamayituṃ bhūmikāṃ racayann āha vyāvasthitasyaive /ti /
analyzed: samprati prakāra antareṇa api pratyabhijñāyāḥ aprāmāṇyam param abhyupagamayitum bhūmikām racayan āha  /
translated: Now, in order to establish the unreliability of recognition even by another method, he sets forth the basis, saying of the very thing that is ascertained.

original: ayaṃ cātrābhiprāyaḥ bhavatu yāvad bījādāvucchūnoccūnatarādiviśeṣasya darśanāt sāmarthyotpādādikalpanā na punar iha tathā adarśanād iti /
analyzed: ayam ca atra abhiprāyaḥ bhavatu yāvat bīja ādau ucchūna uccūnatara ādi viśeṣasya darśanāt sāmarthya utpāda ādi kalpanā na punar iha tathā adarśanāt iti
translated: And the intention here is this: Let it be that in the case of a seed, etc., the assumption of the production of potentiality is due to the observation of differences such as greater and lesser swelling, but not so in this case, because it is not observed.

analyzed: vyavasthitasya anya tvam an āpannasya
translated: The potentiality of what is established, which has not attained otherness,

analyzed: sāmarthyam vijñāna utpāda ādi sāmarthyam
translated: potentiality is the potentiality to produce consciousness, etc.

analyzed: apratibhāsamānaḥ vivekaḥ yasya sa tathā
translated: The distinction that does not appear, of which it is so.

original: yady api viveko 'sya pratyakṣato nāvagamyate tathāpy etasmāt pramāṇāt tatsvabhāvasya sāmarthyasyotpattiḥ kalpyata iti darśayann āha vijñānādī /ti
analyzed: yadi api pratyakṣataḥ na avagamyate tathā api etasmāt pramāṇāt tad svabhāvasya sāmarthyasya utpattiḥ kalpyate iti darśayan āha
translated: Although the distinction is not understood by direct perception, still it shows that the production of that nature, potentiality, is imagined from this means of knowledge, saying consciousness, etc.

original: anutpattiprasaṃgāt prāgasatsāmarthyaṃ cakṣurādisannidhāv utpadyata iti niścayaḥ /
analyzed: anutpatti prasaṃgāt prāk asat sāmarthyam cakṣuḥ ādi sannidhau utpadyate iti niścayaḥ
translated: Because of the consequence of non-production, the potentiality that did not exist before is produced in the presence of the eye, etc. This is certain.

original: kramiṇāṃ vijñānādikāryāṇāṃ yaugapadyodayaprasaṅgāt / /🔽ca kramavad iti niścayaḥ /
analyzed: kramiṇām vijñāna ādi kāryāṇām yaugapadya udaya prasaṅgāt  tat ca kramavat iti niścayaḥ
translated: Because of the consequence of the simultaneous arising of the successive effects such as consciousness, etc.🔽And the order is certain.

analyzed: yadi evam siddhāntī
translated: If so, says the proponent of the established view.

analyzed: a vikṛtam
translated: The unmodified form.

original: apūrvasāmarthyasya yaḥ pratibhāsa ākāras tena vivikto rahito ya upalādis tadgrāhi /
analyzed: apūrva sāmarthyasya yaḥ pratibhāsaḥ ākāraḥ tena viviktaḥ rahitaḥ yaḥ upala ādiḥ tat grāhi
translated: The one who is distinguished, separated, by the appearance, the aspect, of the unprecedented potentiality, is the one who perceives the stone, etc.

original: yata evaivaṃ tata evāvikṛtam iti ca draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: yatas eva evam tatas eva a vikṛtam iti ca draṣṭavyam
translated: And just because it is so, it should be seen that it is not modified.

analyzed: an avaklṛpti khyāpana arthaḥ
translated: Or the word is for the purpose of proclaiming non-restriction.

original: abhyupagamyatām evaṃ kā kṣatir ity āha tatheti tadvat /
analyzed: abhyupagamyatām evam kā kṣatiḥ iti āha tathā iti tadvat
translated: If it is accepted that it is so, what is the harm? He says: In that way, it is like that.

analyzed: sāmarthyam āgantukam sāmarthyam iti avasātavyam
translated: Thus, it should be concluded that the capacity is adventitious.

original: dvividhaṃ hi sāmarthyaṃ prātisvikam āgantukañ ca /
analyzed: dvividham hi sāmarthyam prātisvikam āgantukam ca
translated: For capacity is of two kinds: intrinsic and adventitious.

original: prātisvikī ca śaktir avaśyaiṣitavyā /🔽anyathā śilāśakalam api kṣityādisānnidhye bījavadaṃkuraṃ kasmān na nivarva
analyzed: prātisvikī ca śaktiḥ avaśyā eṣitavyā  anyathā śilā śakalam api kṣiti ādi sānnidhye bīja vat aṃkuram kasmāt na
translated: And intrinsic capacity must necessarily be accepted.

original: rtayatīti paryanuyoge kim uttaraṃ vācyam iti hi teṣāṃ matam /
analyzed: rtayati iti paryanuyoge kim uttaram vācyam iti hi teṣām matam
translated: Otherwise, when questioned why even a piece of stone does not produce a sprout like a seed in the presence of earth etc., what answer can be given? This is their opinion.

original: nanu sāmarthyam atiśayalakṣaṇaṃ sahakāryādheyaṃ tato 'nyad eva tat sahakāripratyayasānnidhyalakṣaṇasyety ucyata ity āha ataeve /ti
analyzed: nanu sāmarthyam atiśaya lakṣaṇam sahakāri ādheyam tatas eva tat sahakāri pratyaya sānnidhya lakṣaṇasya iti ucyate iti āha
translated: But it is said that capacity, which is characterized by excellence, is imparted by auxiliaries, and that it is something else than that, characterized by the presence of those auxiliary conditions. He says: For this very reason.

analyzed: pratyāsatti lakṣaṇasya sānnidhasya tebhyaḥ sannihitebhyaḥ nyasya anapapatteḥ
translated: Because the presence characterized by proximity cannot be anything other than those present.

original: sānnidhyaśabdaparityāgena sahakāripratyayalakṣaṇasyeti te evetyādy apy uktaṃ draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: sānnidhya śabda parityāgena sahakāri pratyaya lakṣaṇasya iti te eva ityādi api uktam draṣṭavyam
translated: It should be seen that even the words those very are said, abandoning the word presence and referring to the character of auxiliary conditions.

analyzed: atas eva abhyupagamāt upāgata abhyupagamāt pratyetavyam
translated: Therefore, because of the acceptance, it should be accepted from the accepted acceptance.

analyzed: evam
translated: Thus, by one who wishes, it should be connected with momentariness alone.

analyzed: tatas eva s
translated: From that very

analyzed: icchataḥ s
translated: for one who wishes

analyzed: yat śabdesya etat vyākhyānam yasmāt
translated: momentariness alone🔽This is the explanation of the word yat: because of this.

original: idaṃ śabdasya caitad iti etad darśanam / /
analyzed: idam śabdasya ca etat iti etat darśanam
translated: And this is the explanation of the word idam.

analyzed: anuttarasya eva uttarīkaraṇāt uttarīkṛtam uktam
translated: It is said that what is unsurpassed is made superior by making it superior.

original: evaṃ niyuñjānamaho mahāsāmarthyam astu kā tavākṣamety āśaṃkya yadi nāmety avatārayituṃ na cātre /tyādy āha /
analyzed: evam niyuñjāna mahaḥ mahā sāmarthyam astu kā tava akṣamā iti āśaṃkya yadi nāma iti avatārayitum naḥ āha
translated: Suspecting that one who engages in this way may have great power, what is your inability? He says na ca atra me kacid akṣamā in order to introduce yadi nāma and so on.

original: na cātra me kācid akṣamā / kiṃtv itīyam asmākaṃ cintā cittaṃ dunotī /ti /
analyzed: na ca atra me kācid akṣamā kiṃtu iti iyam asmākam cintā cittam
translated: And here I have no inability at all. But this thought of ours, ity amīṣām asmākam cintā cittaṃ dunotī (afflicts the mind).

original: na cātra me / ity anena ṭīkākāravacanenaikavākyīkaraṇapakṣety apya
analyzed: na ca atra me iti anena ṭīkākāra vacanena eka vākyīkaraṇa pakṣa iti api a
translated: And by this statement of the commentator, na ca atra me (and here I have no), it is seen that even in the case of making a single sentence,

original: smākaṃ iti asmado dvayoś ca Pā / 🔽p / ity anenaikasminn evārthe bahuvacanena draṣtavyam /
analyzed: smākam iti asmadaḥ dvayoḥ ca pā  iti anena ekasmin eva arthe bahuvacanena draṣtavyam
translated: asmākam (of us) and asmābhiḥ (by us) are the two forms.🔽Asmākam (of us) and asmābhiḥ (by us) are to be seen as the plural form in the same sense.

original: evam asaṃbaddhavādiny apūjya eva pūjāvacanam upasaṃhāraparaṃ draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: evam asaṃbaddha vādini a pūjye eva pūjā vacanam upasaṃhāra param draṣṭavyam
translated: Thus, one who speaks unconnectedly is indeed not worthy of worship. The statement of worship should be seen as concluding with ity amīṣām asmākam cintā cittaṃ dunotī (this thought of ours afflicts the mind).

original: dainyodbhāvanam i /ty arthāt saṃbodhyamānasya dainyaprakāśanam iti /
analyzed: dainya udbhāvanam arthāt saṃbodhyamānasya dainya prakāśanam iti
translated: The expression showing one's misery means making one's misery known to one who is being addressed.

analyzed: nikṛṣṭa sambodhane yam hantar śabdaḥ iti yāvat  tatas sa vadharmaka tvāt
translated: This ha is used in addressing someone inferior, meaning alas.

original: apeto 'pagataḥ saṃtānaḥ / prasūtiḥ paraṃparā yasya tathoktam /
analyzed: apeta u pagataḥ saṃtānaḥ prasūtiḥ paraṃparā yasya tathā uktam
translated: Then, apreta means gone away, and santāna means progeny, succession, so it is said to be gone away from the succession.

analyzed: itinā cintā rūpam upadarśitam
translated: The word iti shows the form of thought.

original: śiraḥkampe cāsya satyam idam astī /ty asya śabdasya prayogam ākalayya prayoktur abhiprāyaṃ varṇayan pṛcchatī /ty ācaṣṭe /
analyzed: śiraḥ kampe ca asya satyam idam asya śabdasya prayogam ākalayya prayoktuḥ abhiprāyam varṇayan ācaṣṭe
translated: And in shaking the head, having understood the use of the word satyam idam asti [in the question], describing the speaker's intention, he says he asks.

original: ata eva cedam āha kiṃ tvayāstitvena pṛcchyata iti pārśvasthaṃ praśnayann āha kiṃ tad i /ti /
analyzed: atas eva ca idam āha kim tvayā astitvena pṛcchyate iti pārśva stham praśnayan āha kim tat
translated: And for this very reason, he says Are you asking about existence? asking the one standing by the side, he says What is that?

analyzed: iti hetoḥ āhāryaḥ iti
translated: Therefore, he says it is to be supplied.

original: audāsīnyāpattir ity atreti śabdena idam āstitvenābhipretasya nyāyyavacana /syākāro darśitaḥ /
analyzed: audāsīnya āpattiḥ iti atra iti śabdena idam āstitvena abhipretasya darśitaḥ
translated: In falling into indifference, the word iti shows the form of the proper statement that is intended to be said about existence.

original: ata eva nyāyyavacanasyāstitvena darśyamānasya rūpaṃ darśayan satym idam apy astī /ti punar āha /
analyzed: atas eva nyāyya vacanasya astitvena darśyamānasya rūpam darśayan satyam idam api punar āha
translated: For this very reason, showing the form of the proper statement that is being shown as existing, he says again This is true and exists.

original: yady evam asya nyāyyavacanasya sadbhāvādanavadyam evāsmanmatam ity kiṃtv i /ti /
analyzed: yadi evam asya nyāyya vacanasya sadbhāvāt anavadyam eva asmad matam iti kiṃtu
translated: If this is so, then since this statement of ours is reasonable, our view is faultless. What then?

analyzed: kevalam idam vakṣamāṇam praṣṭavyā asi
translated: You should be asked this, which will be stated.

original: pracyutam ajanakaṃ rūpam utpannaṃ janakaṃ rūpaṃ dvandvaikavadbhāvam abhipretya pracyutotpannam ity āha apracyutotā
analyzed: pracyutam a janakam rūpam utpannam janakam rūpam dvandva eka vat bhāvam abhipretya pracyuta utpannam iti āha a pracyuta ūtā
translated: With the intention of the dvandva compound, he says fallen and arisen for the form that is not a producer is fallen, and the form that is a producer is arisen. The form that is not fallen and not arisen is the opposite of that.

analyzed: an utpanna tvena eva ca jñeyam
translated: And by the very fact of not being fallen and not arisen, it should be known as having a stable single nature.

analyzed: tad bhede pi janaka ajanaka bhede pi
translated: Even in the difference of that, even in the difference of being a producer and not being a producer,

analyzed: tasya bhāva bhedasya
translated: that difference of existence,

original: aparāpekṣasvabhāvabhedalakṣaṇatvād i /ti yaḥ svabhāvabhedo na bhavati svata eva yo bhāvabhedalakṣaṇatvād iti /
analyzed: apara apekṣa svabhāva bheda lakṣaṇa tvāt yaḥ svabhāva bhedaḥ na bhavati svatas eva yaḥ bhāva bheda lakṣaṇa tvāt iti
translated: because it has the characteristic of a difference in nature that does not depend on another. That difference in nature which does not exist by itself, which has the characteristic of a difference in existence that does not depend on another,

analyzed: bhavataḥ idam bhāvatkam
translated: this is yours, belonging to you.

analyzed: ādhīyate adhikriyate niyujyate vā
translated: It is imposed, it is acted upon, or it is employed.

original: svarūpeṇa kartṛtve vivakṣitasyāpi tādrūpya prasajyetety abhiprāyeṇāha eṣām api pararūpeṇa kartṛtva / iti /
analyzed: sva rūpeṇa kartṛ tve vivakṣitasya api tādrūpya prasajyeta iti abhiprāyeṇa āha api para rūpeṇa kartṛ tve iti
translated: With the intention that even what is intended to be the agent by its own nature would be subject to the same fault, he says Even for these, agency by another's nature.

original: pararūpeṇa kartṛtve iti para eva kartā syāt /
analyzed: para rūpeṇa kartṛ tve iti paraḥ eva kartā syāt
translated: If there is agency by another's nature, the other itself would be the agent.

original: tasya tu harītakīṃ prāpya devatā recayantīty anena tulyaṃ syād ity abhipretyāha pararūpeṇāpy akārakatvād i /ti /
analyzed: tasya tu tathātvam harītakīm prāpya devatāḥ recayanti iti anena tulyam syāt iti abhipretya āha para rūpeṇa api akāraka tvāt
translated: But if it were to obtain a myrobalan fruit, the gods would be expelled - with this in mind, he says, because it is not a cause even in its own form.

original: asyottarasya / sahitas tatsvabhāvo na kevala ity asya /
analyzed: asya uttarasya sahitaḥ tad svabhāvaḥ na kevalaḥ iti asya
translated: Of this answer. Associated with that nature, not alone, of this.

analyzed: prakṛtam upasaṃharan āha tasmāt
translated: Concluding the topic, he says therefore.

original: kathañcit ke /nāpi prakāreṇa na kāryakriyāyā virāmaḥ /
analyzed: kathañcid prakāreṇa na kārya kriyāyāḥ virāmaḥ
translated: In some way, in no way at all, there is no cessation of causal activity.

original: purastād api tasya svarūpasya bhāvād iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: purastāt api tasya sva rūpasya bhāvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The point is that even before, that form exists.

analyzed: teṣām apis
translated: Of those also,

original: etaj janakam asya rūpam avasthitaṃ janakañ ca tad ucyate yasmin saty eva kāryam asti na tu yasmin sati kāryaṃ bhavaty eva /🔽sati bhāvasyākakā
analyzed: syāt etat janakam asya rūpam avasthitam janakam ca tat ucyate yasmin sati eva kāryam asti na tu yasmin sati kāryam bhavati eva  sati bhāvasya akakā
translated: this is the form that produces it, and that which exists is said to be the producer, in the presence of which alone the effect exists, but not in the presence of which the effect necessarily comes into being.

analyzed: raṇa sādhāraṇṇa tvāt  kāryam api
translated: Even in the presence of the cause, the effect does not necessarily come into being, because the existence of the effect is common to both the cause and non-cause.🔽The effect also would not be possible in the absence of that,

original: ve p / nopapadyeta ity eva tasya kāryaṃ /🔽tadbhāve tu bhavaty avaśyam iti kokvopayogo 'sya /
analyzed: na upapadyeta iti eva tasya kāryam  tad bhāve tu bhavati avaśyam iti
translated: therefore it is just the effect of that.🔽But in the presence of that, it necessarily comes into being, so what use is it?

original: tasmāt kathaṃ tadrūpabhāvepi prasaṃjanaṃ jyāya iti /
analyzed: tasmāt katham tad rūpa bhāve pi kārya kriyā prasaṃjanam jyāyaḥ iti
translated: Therefore, how can there be more doubt even in the presence of that form?

original: atrocyate akṣaṇikatvenāpracyutānutpannarūpāntare sarvāvasthāsamāne 'pi kāraṇaṃ yadi kāryaṃ nopajāyate tarhi tatsvatantram āpadyeta /
analyzed: atrā ucyate akṣaṇika tvena apracyuta anutpanna rūpa antare sarva avasthā samāne kāraṇam yadi kāryam na upajāyate tarhi tat svatantram āpadyeta
translated: To this it is replied: If an effect does not arise from a cause even when the form of the cause is not lost and is not produced as something else, and is the same in all states, then the effect would become independent.

original: tathā ca na tat tasya kāryaṃ syāt /
analyzed: tathā ca na tat tasya kāryam syāt
translated: And in that case, it would not be the effect of that [cause].

analyzed: tat avādi vārtikālaṃkāre prajñākaraguptena
translated: This was said by Prajñākaragupta in the Vārtikālaṅkāra:

analyzed: sarva avasthā samāne kāraṇe yadi akārya tā
translated: Even if the cause is the same in all states, if the effect does not arise,

original: svatantraṃ kāryam eva syān na tatkāryaṃ tathā // iti /
analyzed: svatantram kāryam eva syāt na tat kāryam tathā sati iti
translated: the effect would be independent, and not the effect of that [cause].

original: kāraṇapāratantrye ca tatkāraṇaṃ tatkāryaṃ haṭhād eva janayet /
analyzed: kāraṇa pāratantrye ca tad kāraṇam tat kāryam haṭhāt eva janayet
translated: And if [the effect] depends on the cause, that cause would necessarily produce that effect.

original: tathāpy abhāve na tasya kāryaṃ syāt /
analyzed: tathā api abhāve na tasya kāryam syāt
translated: Even so, in the absence [of the cause], it would not be the effect of that [cause].

original: tasmād akāraṇāt kāraṇasya viśeṣaḥ kāryasyāvaśyaṃbhāva evāvaśyañ ca vaktavyaḥ /🔽nanu tadbhātadabhā🔽ve na bhavati kāryam ity akāraṇād asya viśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt akāraṇāt kāraṇasya viśeṣaḥ kāryasya avaśyaṃbhāvaḥ eva avaśyam ca vaktavyaḥ  nanu tad bhā tad abhā  ve na bhavati kāryam iti akāraṇāt asya viśeṣaḥ
translated: Therefore, the difference between a cause and a non-cause is necessarily the existence of the effect, and that must be stated.🔽But if the effect does not exist when that [cause] exists and does not exist when that [cause] does not exist, the difference of this [effect] is from a non-cause.

original: na hi tasyākāraṇasyābhāve tatkāryaṃ na bhavatīti /
analyzed: na hi tasya akāraṇasya abhāve tat kāryam na bhavati iti
translated: For it is not that the effect does not exist in the absence of that non-cause.

original: hanta kuta etad avagamyate tada 'syābhāva iti /
analyzed: hanta kutas etat avagamyate sya abhāvaḥ iti
translated: Well then, how is this understood: That is the absence of this?

analyzed: yadi hi
translated: For if the effect does not exist when that [cause] exists and does not exist when that [cause] does not exist,

original: vasyābhāve tadbhāvalakṣaṇe kāryābhāvasyābhāvaḥ kāryabhāvalakṣaṇaḥ syāt tadā tadabhāvaprayukto 'syābhāvaḥ siddhyed itarathākāraṇābhimatābhāvaprayukto 🔽'pi tadabhāvaḥ kiṃ na kalpyate /
analyzed: tad bhāva lakṣaṇe kārya abhāvasya abhāvaḥ kārya bhāva lakṣaṇaḥ syāt tadā tad abhāva prayuktaḥ sya abhāvaḥ siddhyet itarathā a kāraṇa abhimata abhāva prayuktaḥ  tad abhāvaḥ kim na kalpyate
translated: If, in the absence of the effect, the absence of the cause were characterized by the presence of the effect, then the absence of this [effect] would be established as produced by that absence [of the cause]. Otherwise, why not imagine that absence [of the effect] to be produced by the absence of what is considered the cause?

original: tadabhāvepi kāryābhāvasya bhāvān na tadabhāvaprayuktatāsyeti cet /
analyzed: kārya abhāvasya bhāvāt na tad abhāva prayukta tā asya iti ced
translated: If it is argued that even in the absence of that [cause], the effect is present, so it is not produced by the absence of that [cause],

analyzed: samānam idam kāraṇa abhimate pi
translated: this is the same even for what is considered the cause.

original: tasmād yathā eva kāraṇe svayam eva kāryaṃ na bhavati svātantryāt /
analyzed: tasmāt yathā tad avasthe eva kāraṇe svayam eva kāryam na bhavati svātantryāt
translated: Therefore, just as the effect does not itself occur in the cause due to its independence,

original: tathā tadabhāvo 'pi svayam eva na bhaviṣyatīti svātantryād eva /
analyzed: tathā tad abhāvaḥ pi svayam eva na bhaviṣyati iti svātantryāt eva
translated: in the same way, the absence of that [cause] will not occur by itself due to its independence.

original: yaś ca svayam eva na bhavati nāsau niyamyata tena paratantratve tasya kāraṇasya bhāve 'vaśyam eva bhavet /
analyzed: yaḥ ca svayam eva na bhavati na asau niyamyata tena paratantra tve tasya kāraṇasya bhāve vaśyam eva bhavet
translated: And that which does not occur by itself is not restricted by that. If it were dependent on another, it would necessarily occur when the cause is present.

analyzed: tat āha alaṅkāra kāraḥ
translated: The ornament-maker [Vasubandhu] says this:
The meaning is: even in the absence of what is considered the cause.

original: tadbhāvepi na bhāvaś ced abhāve bhāvitā kutaḥ /
analyzed: na bhāvaḥ ced abhāve bhāvi tā kutas
translated: If it does not occur even when that [cause] is present, how can it occur when absent?

analyzed: pramāṇavān
translated: The end of the chapter on valid cognition.

analyzed: tad abhāva prayuktaḥ sya saḥ bhāvaḥ iti tat kutas iti
translated: How can this absence be produced by the absence of that [cause]?

original: tasmāt tadbhāve bhāvas tadabhāve cābhāva iti viśeṣitaḥ kāryakāraṇabhāvo 'vaśyaṃ bhavatīti jñāpayati /
analyzed: tasmāt tad bhāve bhāvaḥ tad abhāve ca abhāvaḥ iti viśeṣitaḥ kārya kāraṇa bhāvaḥ vaśyam bhavati iti jñāpayati
translated: Therefore, when it exists, it exists; and when it does not exist, it does not exist. This specifies the relation of cause and effect, and it is meant to show that it must exist.

original: tathā ca kāraṇe saty avaśyaṃbhāvi kāryam āyātam iti kathaṃ kadācit kriyāvirāmaḥ /
analyzed: tathā ca kāraṇe sati avaśyaṃbhāvi kāryam āyātam iti katham kadācid kriyā virāmaḥ
translated: And thus, when the cause exists, the effect is necessarily present. How then can there be a temporary cessation of activity?

original: kiñ ca tathāvidho hi kāryābhāvo nirhetukatvāt svayam eva bhavatīti yuktam api /
analyzed: kim ca tathāvidhaḥ hi kārya abhāvaḥ nirhetuka tvāt svayam eva bhavati iti yuktam api
translated: Moreover, it is reasonable that such a non-existence of the effect should occur by itself, because it has no cause.

original: bhāvas tu hetuparatantratvāt hetau na bhavatīti na yuktam / tad uktam
analyzed: bhāvaḥ tu hetu paratantra tvāt hetau na bhavati iti na yuktam tat uktam
translated: But it is not reasonable that existence, being dependent on a cause, should not occur when the cause is present. This is stated:

original: abhāvo hi padārthānāṃ svayam eva bhaved api /
analyzed: abhāvaḥ hi padārthānām svayam eva bhavet api
translated: For the non-existence of things may occur by itself,

original: bhāvas tu paratantratvāt kathaṃ hetor bhaven na saḥ // iti /
analyzed: bhāvaḥ tu paratantra tvāt katham hetoḥ bhavet na saḥ iti
translated: but how can existence, being dependent on another, not occur from a cause?

original: p / nanu kāryābhāvasya svatantratvāt kāraṇe saty eva na bhavatīti yuktam evaitat /
analyzed: nanu kārya abhāvasya svatantra tvāt kāraṇe sati eva na bhavati iti yuktam eva etat
translated: P. But since the non-existence of the effect is independent, it is reasonable that it does not occur even when the cause exists.

original: evaṃ tarhi na kāraṇābhāva prayukto 'bhāva kathaṃ bhavet kāryasyakāryamasya
analyzed: evam tarhi na kāraṇa abhāva prayuktaḥ bhāva katham bhavet
translated: If so, then how can the non-existence of the effect be due to the non-existence of the cause? For it is not an effect.

analyzed: tatas svayam na bhavati
translated: Therefore, it does not occur by itself.

original: yaś ca svayam eva na bhavati nāsau tena niyantuṃ śakyaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ca svayam eva na bhavati na asau tena niyantum śakyaḥ
translated: And what does not occur by itself cannot be controlled by that.

original: tato yathā svayaṃ na bhavati tathā bhaved api /
analyzed: tatas yathā svayam na bhavati tathā bhavet api
translated: Then, even if it were to exist in such a way that it does not exist by itself,

analyzed: tatas na tasya kāryam
translated: then it would not have an effect.

original: yadā tu kāraṇe sati bhaved eva tadā svarasanirodhepy aparāparakṣaṇotpattes tadabhāva eva saṃtānocchedas tadabhāva eva ca saṃtānākṣepakṣaṇānārambho
analyzed: yadā tu kāraṇe sati bhavet eva tadā sva rasa nirodhe pi apara apara kṣaṇa utpatteḥ tad abhāve eva saṃtāna ucchedaḥ tad abhāve eva ca saṃtāna ākṣepa kṣaṇa anārambhaḥ
translated: But when it would exist only if the cause exists, then even in the cessation of its own nature, due to the arising of moment after moment, the cessation of the continuum is only due to the absence of that, and the non-commencement of the moment that projects the continuum is only due to the absence of that.

analyzed: vā
translated: Or it is not.

analyzed: iti kāraṇa pratibaddha tvam siddhi ati
translated: Thus, the dependence on the cause is established.

analyzed: kāryam asya pramāṇavāḥ
translated: This is the proof of its effect. Enough.

original: etena tad api nirastamyadāhur eke yathobhayādhīnanirūpaṇā vyāptir ayogavyavacchedena vyāpake nirūpyate vyāpye sati bhāva eva vyāpakasya nābhāva
analyzed: etena tat api nirastam yat āhuḥ eke yathā ubhaya adhīna nirūpaṇā vyāptiḥ ayoga vyavacchedena vyāpake nirūpyate vyāpye sati bhāvaḥ eva vyāpakasya na abhāva
translated: By this, that also is refuted which some say: Just as the pervasion, which is determined in dependence on both, is determined by the exclusion of non-connection in the pervader, the mere existence of the pervader when the pervaded exists,

original: vyāpyasya punar anyayogavyavacchedena vyāpaka eva bhāvo vyāpyasya nānyatreti /
analyzed: vyāpyasya punar anya yoga vyavacchedena vyāpakaḥ eva bhāvaḥ vyāpyasya na anyatra iti
translated: but the existence of the pervaded is by the exclusion of connection with another only in the pervader, not elsewhere.

analyzed: evam pi ubhaya adhīna nirūpaṇaḥ api kāraṇe yoga vyavacchedena nirūpyate
translated: Even so, the determination in dependence on both is also determined by the exclusion of non-connection in the cause.

original: kāryotpādasya purastād bhāva eva kāraṇasya nābhāva iti /
analyzed: kārya utpādasya purastāt bhāvaḥ eva kāraṇasya na abhāvaḥ iti
translated: The mere existence of the cause before the production of the effect, not the non-existence.

original: kārye punar anyayogavyavacchedena kāraṇa eva sati bhāvo nānyasminn ity anubhavānusārānniścīyata iti /
analyzed: kārye punar anya yoga vyavacchedena kāraṇe eva sati bhāvaḥ na anyasmin iti anubhava anusārāt niścīyate iti
translated: But in the case of an effect, it is ascertained by experience that the existence [of the cause] is only when the cause is present, excluding any other connection, and not in any other [cause].

analyzed: uktayā nītyā tad bhāve bhavataḥ tad kārya tāyāḥ eva abhāva prasaṅgāt svabhāve bhāvamata
translated: Because, according to the stated method, if it existed, it would follow that the effect would not exist, and that would be impossible.

original: ś cātata kāryaḥ kātatkāryakā🔽raṇatāyāḥ sa tu yā /🔽abhisaṃbandhayata eva cātra bhavataḥ /🔽kāraṇasya mukhyasyānubhavo 'nyas tu tādarthyād upacaritakāraṇabhāvasyānubhava iti svayam upacaritakāraṇānubhavarūpatva eveti /
analyzed: ś ca atata kāryaḥ kātatkāryakā  raṇa tāyāḥ sa tu yā  abhisaṃbandhayataḥ eva ca atra bhavataḥ  kāraṇasya mukhyasya anubhavaḥ nyaḥ tu tādarthyāt upacarita kāraṇa bhāvasya anubhavaḥ iti svayam upacarita kāraṇa anubhava rūpa tve eva iti
translated: And the effect is the effect of that cause which is the cause of that effect.🔽And that is the relation of the cause which is the primary [cause], while the experience of the other [cause] is figuratively as the cause due to its purpose. Thus, it is only in the form of the experience of the figurative cause.

original: api ca yathā kāraṇe saty avaśyaṃ bhāvam anicchatā kāryasya kādācit kādanvayāt tatkāra iṣyate /
analyzed: api ca yathā kāraṇe sati avaśyam bhāvam an icchatā kāryasya kādācid kāt anvayāt iṣyate
translated: Moreover, just as one who does not accept that the effect necessarily exists when the cause exists, accepts that it is the cause of the effect due to the occasional connection with it,

original: tathā kādācit kādavyatirekād api kin na kāraṇam iṣyate yujyate vā /
analyzed: tathā kādācid api kin na kāraṇam iṣyate yujyate vā
translated: in the same way, why is not the cause accepted, or why is it not proper, due to the occasional non-difference [from the cause]?

original: tasmāt kāryakāraṇabhāvaṃ niyatam icchatā yathā vyāptimān vyatireka eṣṭavyas tathā vyāptimānn anvamān anva
analyzed: tasmāt kārya kāraṇa bhāvam niyatam icchatā yathā vyāptimān vyatirekaḥ eṣṭavyaḥ tathā vyāptimān anvamān anvamān
translated: Therefore, one who desires the relation of cause and effect to be definite, should desire the pervasion in the case of difference just as he desires the pervasion in the case of concomitance.

analyzed: avaśya eṣitavyaḥ nyathā iti
translated: And it must be admitted, otherwise it would be impossible to indicate it.

original: kiṃ ca sahitāvasthāyāṃ tāvad asau bhāvaḥ kāryaṃ janayatītīṣyate /
analyzed: kim ca sahita avasthāyām tāvat asau bhāvaḥ kāryam janayati iti iṣyate
translated: Moreover, it is accepted that that entity generates an effect when it is in the state of being together with the conditions.

analyzed: janayati iti ca kaḥ rthaḥ
translated: And what is the meaning of 'generates'?

analyzed: kim kāryam sattayā abhisambadhyate kim vā abhisaṃtsyate
translated: Is it that it becomes connected with existence, or that it becomes existent?

analyzed: kiñca atas
translated: And what follows from that?

original: yady utaraḥ pakṣas tadā tasmiñ janayati na kadācit kāryaṃ satpratyayaviṣayaḥ syāt sattayā abhisambandhasya bhāvitatvāvitvāt /
analyzed: yadi utaraḥ pakṣaḥ tadā tasmin janayati na kadācid kāryam sat pratyaya viṣayaḥ syāt sattayā abhisambandhasya
translated: If the latter alternative, then the effect would never be an existent object of the conditions, because the connection with existence would have already taken place.

analyzed: atha anya dya
translated: If the former alternative is accepted,

analyzed: eva upagamaḥ tadā vikalpa dvayam
translated: then there are two options.

original: kim anenaiva svabhāvena pūrvam ayam avasthito 'thānyena /
analyzed: kim anena eva svabhāvena pūrvam ayam avasthitaḥ
translated: Does it exist previously with just this nature, or with another?

analyzed: na tāvat anyena
translated: Not with another, first of all.

original: ekasya rūpadvayāyogāt /🔽svabhāvenāvasthāne ca saṃpratīva tadāpi kāryaṃ sattayābhisambadhyata ity upetaṃ syāt /
analyzed: ekasya rūpa dvaya ayogāt  anena eva svabhāvena avasthāne ca saṃprati iva tadā api kāryam sattayā abhisambadhyate iti upetam syāt
translated: Because it is impossible for one thing to have two natures.🔽And if it exists with its own nature, then just as now, the effect would be connected with existence even then.

analyzed: tathā ca prakṛtakṛkṣa
translated: And thus the purpose of the argument would be defeated.

analyzed: tiḥ iti kim a sthāna abhiniveśena iti
translated: So what is the point of insisting on something that is not the case?

analyzed: atha bhavataḥ pi kim idam kāraṇa tvam
translated: Or what is this 'causal nature' of yours?

original: kiṃ prāgbhāva eva kiṃ vā prāg eva bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: kim prāc bhāvaḥ eva kim vā prāk eva bhāvaḥ
translated: Is it mere prior existence, or prior existence itself?

analyzed: yadi prāgbhāve eva
translated: If it is mere prior existence.

original: tadā sthirasyāpi evam eva kāraṇatve su nirākaraṇaṃ prasajyeta /
analyzed: tadā sthirasya api evam eva kāraṇa tve nirākaraṇam prasajyeta
translated: Then, even for a permanent thing, the refutation of causality in the same way would follow.

analyzed: atha prāk eva bhāvaḥ
translated: If it is prior existence.

analyzed: tat etat kṣaṇika tve siddhe siddhi ati
translated: That is established when momentariness is established.

original: tad eva tu na siddham iti p / katham idam ucyamānaṃ śobheteti /
analyzed: tat eva tu na siddham iti p katham idam ucyamānam śobheta iti
translated: But that itself is not established. So how does this statement shine?

original: āstāṃ prāgbhāva eva kāraṇatvaṃ ko bādhaḥ /
analyzed: āstām prāgbhāvaḥ eva kāraṇa tvam kaḥ bādhaḥ
translated: Let alone mere prior existence as causality. What is the obstruction?

original: nanūktam evākṣaṇikasyāpi kāraṇatve sādhayituṃ śakye tadanirākṛtir eva mahatī bādheti ceti /
analyzed: nanu uktam eva akṣaṇikasya api kāraṇa tve sādhayitum śakye tad anirākṛtiḥ eva mahatī bādhā iti ca iti
translated: But isn't it said that even for the non-momentary, if causality can be established, the mere non-refutation of that is a great obstruction?

original: hanta kiṃ lakṣaṇenākṣaṇikasya sattvaṃtathāgatair nirākriyate yenedam api vaktum adhyavasitās tarkavidaḥ kathaṃ nāmeti cet /
analyzed: hanta kim hetu rūpasya lakṣaṇena akṣaṇikasya sattvam tathāgataiḥ nirākriyate yena idam api vaktum adhyavasitāḥ tarka vidaḥ katham nāma iti ced
translated: Well, what characteristic of the non-momentary's existence is refuted by the Tathāgatas, that even those who are intent on speaking thus, the logicians, say how is this?

analyzed: ucyate
translated: It is said:

original: prāgbhāva evāsau sthirarūpāt kramākramākhyasya vyāpakasya nivṛttyā nivartate /
analyzed: prāc bhāvaḥ eva asau sthira rūpāt kramākrama ākhyasya vyāpakasya nivṛttyā nivartate
translated: That prior existence itself ceases due to the cessation of the all-pervading [factors] called gradual and non-gradual, which belong to the permanent form.

original: yathā ca tasya tābhyāṃ vyāptir yathā ca tatas tayor nivṛttis tathānyatra niṛṇītam iti hetulakṣaṇakāle 'prakṛtatvād ucyate /
analyzed: yathā ca tasya tābhyām vyāptiḥ yathā ca tatas tayoḥ nivṛttiḥ tathā anyatra iti hetu lakṣaṇa kāle prakṛta tvāt ucyate
translated: And how that is pervaded by those two, and how the cessation of those two [is due to that], has been determined elsewhere. Therefore, since it is not the subject matter at the time of stating the characteristic of the reason, it is said.

analyzed: atha tat eva na saṃgacchate
translated: But if that itself does not make sense,

analyzed: tarhi tat eva ucyatām
translated: Then let that very [reason] be stated.

original: na tu hetulakṣaṇena tasyā nirākṛtir iti /
analyzed: na tu hetu lakṣaṇena tasyāḥ nirākṛtiḥ iti
translated: But it is not refuted by the characteristic of the reason.

analyzed: alam a tārkika vacanena ati nirbandhena iti
translated: Enough of the words of the non-logicians, with excessive insistence.

analyzed: atra sva sādhitasya iti api dṛśyate
translated: Here, of what is accomplished by oneself is also seen.

analyzed: na hi sa sāmīhī
translated: For that [reason] is not a reason.🔽Having explained in one way, he begins with or rather to explain in another way.

original: tyaity e /kena prakāreṇa vyākhyāyāpareṇāpi prakāreṇa vyākhyātum athave /tyādinopakramate /🔽asya S
analyzed: prakāreṇa vyākhyāya apareṇa api prakāreṇa vyākhyātum  asya s
translated: Here, the word this refers to the effect.

original: nanūktam eva pratyayāntarāpekṣasvakāryajananasvabhāvo bhāvas tat kathaṃ pratyayāntarasāhityadaśāyāḥ pūrvaṃ kuryād ity āha pratyayāntare /ti
analyzed: nanu uktam eva pratyaya antara apekṣa sva kārya janana svabhāvaḥ bhāvaḥ tat katham pratyaya antara sāhitya daśāyāḥ pūrvam kuryāt iti āha
translated: But hasn't it been said that an entity has the nature of producing its own effect in dependence on other conditions? Then how could it act before the stage of being accompanied by other conditions? He says by other conditions and so on.

analyzed: tad a tad kālayoḥ sahakāri sāhitya asāhitya kālayoḥ
translated: At that time and not that time refers to the times of being accompanied and not accompanied by auxiliaries.

original: kecit punaḥ svahetubhir evāyaṃ pratyayāntarasāpekṣakāryajananasvabhāvo janita / ity atraiva vipañcyate /
analyzed: kecid punar sva hetubhiḥ eva ayam pratyaya antara sāpekṣa kārya janana svabhāvaḥ janitaḥ iti atra eva vipañcyate
translated: But some [say] that this [entity] is produced by its own causes with the nature of producing an effect dependent on other conditions. This is elaborated right here.

original: evaṃdharmo 'yaṃ svahetubhir eva janitaḥ syāt tadā na kadācij janayet /
analyzed: yadi evaṃdharmaḥ yam sva hetubhiḥ eva janitaḥ syāt tadā na kadācid janayet
translated: If this entity were produced by its own causes in this way, then it would never produce [its effect].

original: tathā hi yāvat sahakāripratyayasannidhikālas tāvad akaraṇadharmāsau bhāvo 'nyathāsyā pūrvam api kartṛtvaṃ prasajyeta /
analyzed: tathā hi yāvat sahakāri pratyaya sannidhi kālaḥ tāvat a karaṇa dharmā asau bhāvaḥ nyathā asyā pūrvam api kartṛ tvam prasajyeta
translated: For, as long as the time of the presence of the cooperating conditions, for that long the entity has the nature of non-action. Otherwise, its agency would follow even before.

original: pratyayāntarasannidhikāle ca sa eva kiyatkālākaraṇasvabhāvo yaḥ prathame kṣaṇa āsīt /
analyzed: pratyaya antara sannidhi kāle ca saḥ eva kiyat kāla akaraṇa svabhāvaḥ yaḥ prathame kṣaṇe āsīt
translated: And at the time of the presence of other conditions, that very nature of non-action for a certain time, which was in the first moment,

original: tato naiva kuryāt ki tasya kriyāyāt kriyāyāṃtu
analyzed: tatas na eva kuryāt tasya kriyāyāt kriyāyām tu
translated: it would not produce at all. What is the use of its action? But if it acts,

analyzed: saḥ eva svabhāvaḥ na bhavet
translated: that very nature would not be.

analyzed: yat vā tāvat kāla apekṣa janakasya svabhāvasya anuvṛtteḥ tādātmya ḥmye
translated: Or, because of the continuation of the nature of the producer that depends on that time, it has that very nature.

analyzed: tāvatkālam akriyaḥ eva
translated: It is not produced for that time.

original: punar ante tathaiveti katham ivākṣaṇikaḥ kadācid api janayet /
analyzed: punar ante tathā eva iti katham iva akṣaṇikaḥ kadācid api janayet
translated: Again, at the end, it is just the same. How then could the non-momentary ever produce anything?

original: tasmān na pratyayāntarāpekṣajanakasvabhāvo bhāvaḥ svahetubhir janyata iti / tathā cāha 🔽yadi hetubhiḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt na pratyaya antara apekṣa janaka svabhāvaḥ bhāvaḥ sva hetubhiḥ janyate iti tathā ca āha  yadi hetubhiḥ
translated: Therefore, an entity is not produced by its own causes with a nature that produces in dependence on other conditions. Thus he says:🔽If the entity were produced by causes,

original: bhāvaḥ syāj janito nāsau kiṃcij janayet tadā //
analyzed: bhāvaḥ syāt janitaḥ na asau kiṃcid janayet tadā
translated: then it would not produce anything at all.

analyzed: tathā hi sannidhīyante yāvat te sahakāriṇaḥ
translated: For, as long as those cooperating conditions are present,

original: tāvan nūnam akartāsau svabhāvas tasya vastunaḥ //
analyzed: tāvat nūnam akartā asau svabhāvaḥ tasya vastunaḥ
translated: for that long the nature of that entity is certainly non-action.

analyzed: eṣitavyaḥ nyathā pūrvam tad kartṛ tva prasaṅgataḥ
translated: Otherwise, it would have to be sought before, because of the consequence of its being the agent then.

analyzed: tad sannidhāna kāle ca svabhāvaḥ sya vartate
translated: And at the time of its presence, this is its nature.🔽It would not perform that, or its nature would not be in action.

original: tan na kuryāt kriyāyām vā svabhāvosya no bhavet / /
analyzed: tat na kuryāt kriyāyām vā svabhāvaḥ asya no bhavet
translated: If it does not do so, then it would not be the nature of the action.

original: yadvā🔽p / tāvat / / /ttataḥ //🔽svabhāvasya tathāpy eṣa tāvat kālam asatkriyaḥ /
analyzed: yat vā  p tāvat  svabhāvasya tathā api eṣa tāvat kālam asatkriyaḥ
translated: so far.🔽Even so, this is not performed for that time.

original: punar ante tathaiveti kuryād akṣaṇikaḥ katham / // iti /
analyzed: punar ante tathā evā iti kuryāt akṣaṇikaḥ katham iti
translated: Again, at the end, it is just the same. How could the non-momentary perform it?

analyzed: upagataḥ ntyaḥ yasya sa tathā uktaḥ
translated: The last one is admitted, of which it is said to be so.

analyzed: yasya nipātasya artha kathanam haṭhāt
translated: It would follow. Of which particle, the meaning is stated forcibly.

original: prasahya S /🔽santānam apy āśritya katham ucyata ity āha pūrvottareti / /
analyzed: prasahya s  santānam api āśritya katham ucyate iti āha pūrva uttara iti
translated: By force.🔽Also relying on the continuum, how is it said? He says previous and subsequent and so on.

original: kiṃ lakṣaṇaṃ nāma tatra sahakāritvam ity āha pūrvakṣaṇebhyas tv i /ti /
analyzed: kim lakṣaṇam nāma tatra sahakāri tvam iti āha
translated: What is the characteristic of the name there, the cooperation? He says but from the previous moments and so on.

analyzed: tasya viśeṣya
translated: Of that. The qualified.

analyzed: pūrva pūrva kṣaṇeḥ
translated: Of the previous moments.

original: ekatvenādhim uktasya / tad evedam iti niścitasya /
analyzed: eka tvena ādhim uktasya tat eva idam iti niścitasya
translated: Of what is said to be one, of what is ascertained as that is this.

analyzed: tad samāna kālaḥ s
translated: Simultaneous with that.

analyzed: pradāturaḥ iti api paṭhyate
translated: It is also read as of the giver.

original: upanipatantīti upanipātās te ca kṣaṇāḥ / tathā kṣaṇo yato 'nyo nāsti kālaḥ sovacchedakatvenaiṣāṃ vidyata arṣa ādity enad
analyzed: upanipatanti iti upanipātāḥ te ca kṣaṇāḥ tathā kṣaṇaḥ yatas nyaḥ na asti kālaḥ saḥ uvacchedaka tvena eṣām vidyate iti āt iti enat  /
translated: The 'upanipa-tas' are the moments, and they are falling upon. And thus, since there is no other time than a moment, it exists as the differentiator of them. The suffix 'aṇ' should be added.

analyzed: vidhātavyaḥ
translated: It should be added.

analyzed: tena eka kṣaṇika sthāyīni vastu rūpāṇi iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the forms of things last for one moment.

original: evam anyatrāpy evaṃvidhe prayoge jñeyam /🔽svarasataḥ / svānurāgānnāśon
analyzed: evam anyatra api evaṃvidhe prayoge jñeyam  svarasataḥ
translated: The same should be understood in other such usages.

analyzed: mukha tvāt iti yāvat
translated: Naturally, i.e., from their own inclination, up to the state of being ready to perish.

analyzed: prakaraṇāt kārya utpādam prati anuguṇa tvam pratyeyam
translated: From the context, the suitability with regard to the production of the effect should be understood.

analyzed: kṣepavatī kāla vilambavatī
translated: It has delay, i.e., it has a lapse of time.

analyzed: pāṇinīya sūtram tu arṣaḥ ādibhyaḥ c
translated: But the Pāṇinian sūtra is 'aṇ after arṣ and others'.

analyzed: iti vartate
translated: This is the rule.

original: kiṃtu durvekena anyad eva kiñcid uddhata bhāti /
analyzed: kiṃtu durvekena anyat eva kiñcid uddhata bhāti
translated: But something else, which is difficult to understand, appears to be different.

original: tathā ca atra arṣa ādibhyo 'dityanenād vidhātavyaḥ iti pāṭhaḥ samyak sambhāvyate /
analyzed: tathā ca atra arṣa ādibhyaḥ vidhātavyaḥ iti pāṭhaḥ samyak sambhāvyate
translated: And thus, here the reading 'aṇ should be added after arṣ and others' is rightly considered.

original: tadanāsādanam eva katham ity āha kṣaṇānām i / /
analyzed: tad anāsādanam eva katham iti āha kṣaṇānām
translated: How is it that they are not obtained? He says: of the moments.

original: ayaṃ niratiśayo 'yaṃ ca sātiśaya iti vivekasyābhāvāt /
analyzed: ayam niratiśayaḥ yam ca sa atiśayaḥ iti vivekasya abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no distinction between this one which is without any superior and that one which has a superior.

analyzed: iti arthāt
translated: The first one is suitable for the production of the effect, it is understood.

original: yad uktam akṣaṇike tatsarvaṃ kṣaṇikeṣv api mamaṃ yata / iti /
analyzed: yat uktam akṣaṇike tat sarvam kṣaṇikeṣu api mamam yatas iti
translated: What was said - All that is for me in the momentary, as in the non-momentary -

analyzed: teṣām kṣaṇikānām
translated: of those. Of the momentary.

original: yad vā kṣaṇānām i /tīdam ubhayatrāpi sambandhanīyam /
analyzed: yat vā kṣaṇānām ubhayatra api sambandhanīyam
translated: Or of the moments. This should be connected in both cases.

analyzed: pūrvam sva deśa sthityā tāte
translated: First, by remaining in their own place,

analyzed: eva parasparataḥ samutpanna viśeṣāḥ sannidhīyante pratyāsīdanti
translated: they come together, approach, having produced a difference from each other.

original: dūradeśavartināṃ kathaṃ hetuphalabhāvapratiniyama ity āśaṃkāyāṃ nyāyam upadarśayann
analyzed: dūra deśa vartinām katham hetu phala bhāva pratiniyamaḥ iti āśaṃkāyām nyāyam upadarśayan
translated: How can there be a restriction of cause and effect for those located in distant places? Showing the reasoning,

original: āha yena yasyābhī /ti yena dūrasthitasahakārikṛtena viśeṣeṇa saviśeṣā eva saṃnidhīyanta itīṣyate /
analyzed: āha yena yena dūra sthita sahakāri kṛtena viśeṣeṇa sa viśeṣāḥ eva saṃnidhīyante iti iṣyate
translated: he says by which etc. It is accepted that they come together with a difference due to the difference produced by the distant cooperating cause.

analyzed: tasya viśeṣasya utpattau api
translated: Even in the production of that difference,

translated: Previously, having accepted opposition due to being useless, it was said.

original: saṃprati tu virodhitve 'kiñcitkaratvam eva nāstīti darśayann āha kathañ ce /ti /
analyzed: saṃprati tu virodhi tve kiñcitkaratvam eva na asti iti darśayan āha katham
translated: But now, in order to show that there is no non-efficacy at all in the case of contradiction, he says: And how?

analyzed: saṃbhāvanāyām iha
translated: The word 'name' is used here in the sense of impossibility.

analyzed: samayaḥ siddhāntaḥ
translated: 'Time' means established conclusion.

analyzed: tad bhāvaḥ eva mudgara ādi bhāvaḥ eva
translated: That very existence, that very existence of the hammer etc.

analyzed: teṣām kapāla ādīnām bhāvāt utpādāt
translated: Because of the existence of those, because of the production of those, of the potsherds etc.

original: yathā tadbhāvabhāvitvaṃ teṣāṃ tathā darśayann āha vegavad i /ti /
analyzed: yathā tad bhāva bhāvi tvam teṣām tathā darśayan āha vegavat
translated: Showing how that is the nature of those, he says: 'having momentum' etc.

original: kasmāt saṃjātātiśaya ity apekṣāyāṃ yojyam paraspare /tyādi /
analyzed: kasmāt saṃjāta atiśayaḥ iti apekṣāyām yojyam
translated: When there is expectation of 'why is it produced with excess?', it should be connected with 'mutually' etc.

analyzed: kārya mukhena uktvā kāraṇa mukhena api āha tasya
translated: He also says by way of the cause: 'and that' etc.

analyzed: tasya vegavat mudgara ādi sahakāriṇaḥ ghaṭa kṣaṇasya
translated: Of that moment of the pot, which has momentum and the hammer etc. as cooperating factors.

analyzed: paraspara parihāra rūpa tvāt paraspara parihāra sthita rūpa tvāt
translated: Because of the form of mutual exclusion, because of the form of mutual exclusion existing.

original: vināśaḥ kathaṃ tasya svabhāvo bhavitum arhati yena evam ucyata ity āha vinaśyatī /ti /
analyzed: vināśaḥ katham tasya svabhāvaḥ bhavitum arhati yena evam ucyate iti āha
translated: How can destruction be its nature, by which it is said thus? He says: 'it is destroyed'.

analyzed: bhāve vihitaḥ gham a ku
translated: The affix 'ghञ्' is used in the sense of existence, but not

original: to vacanāt bhavatīty āśaṃkyāha bahulam i /ti /
analyzed: taḥ vacanāt bhavati iti āśaṃkya āha bahulam
translated: because of the statement. Fearing that it might be thought that it exists, he says 'often'.

analyzed: kutya lyuṭaḥ bahulam pā
translated: 'Kuty, lyu, and ut are often used.'

analyzed: iti asmāt vacanāt iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: because of this statement.

analyzed: vināśam prati anapekṣām yojyam
translated: The meaning is that it is to be connected with “independence with regard to destruction.”

analyzed: an apekṣām vinaṃṣṭuḥ iti arthāt
translated: The meaning is that it is to be connected with “independence with regard to destruction.”

analyzed: katham pratipādyā iti āha tat
translated: How is it to be connected? He says: “by the non-connection with its cause.”

analyzed: tad hetu ayogena vināśa hetu ayogena
translated: By the non-connection with the cause of destruction.

original: ayoga eva kuta ity āha asāmarthye /ti /
analyzed: ayogaḥ eva kutas iti āha
translated: How is there non-connection? He says: “in the absence of capability.”

analyzed: pūrva ācārya śabdena ācārya diś nāgaḥ bhipretaḥ
translated: By the word “former teachers,” the teacher Dignāga is meant.

original: syād etat tatra khalu viparyaye bādhakaṃ pramāṇam ucyate yat sādhyaviparyaye hetor vṛttittiṃ
analyzed: syāt etat tatra khalu viparyaye bādhakam pramāṇam ucyate yat sādhya viparyaye hetoḥ
translated: This may be said: Indeed, there is a countering means of valid knowledge stated in that [treatise], which, when it contradicts the occurrence of the reason in the absence of the probandum,

analyzed: bādhamānam sādhya sādhanayoḥ pratibandham sādhayati
translated: establishes the relation between the probandum and the means of knowledge.

original: na tu yat sākṣād eva sādhyaṃ sādhayati /
analyzed: na tu yat sākṣāt eva sādhyam sādhayati
translated: But it is not that which directly establishes the probandum.

original: iyaṃ cānapekṣā sākṣād eva kṣaṇakṣayitāṃ kṛtakānāṃ satāṃ sādhayituṃ śakteti /
analyzed: iyam ca anapekṣā sākṣāt eva kṣaṇa kṣayi tām kṛtakānām satām sādhayitum śaktā iti
translated: And this independence is able to directly establish the momentary destruction of created existents.

original: ye yadbhāvaṃ pratyanapekṣās te tadbhāvaniyatā yathāntyā kāraṇasāmagrī svakāryotpādane /
analyzed: tathā hi ye yad bhāvam pratyanapekṣāḥ te tad bhāva niyatā yathā antyā kāraṇa sāmagrī sva kārya utpādane
translated: Those that are independent with regard to the existence of something are restricted to that existence, like the final collection of causes in the production of its effect.

original: vināśaṃ pratyanapekṣāś codayān antaram ime kṛtakā bhāvā iti prayoge kṛte kṛtakānām eṣāṃ kṣaṇikatā kiṃ na pratīyate yena kṛtakatvāddhetos 🔽tatsiddhiḥ prārthyate /
analyzed: vināśam pratyanapekṣāḥ codayān antaram ime kṛtakāḥ bhāvāḥ iti prayoge kṛte kṛtakānām eṣām kṣaṇika tā kim na pratīyate yena kṛtaka tvāt hetoḥ  tad siddhiḥ prārthyate
translated: And when the argument is stated thus: These produced things are produced in dependence on causes and conditions, and are independent with regard to destruction, why is not the momentariness of these produced things understood from the reason of being produced, so that the establishment of that [momentariness] is sought?

original: tasmād ayaṃ maulo hetur vaiyarthyam ātmanaḥ paśyan naiśyan ne🔽vaṃ viparyaye bādhakaṃ pramāṇaṃ sādhyasiddhau sahāyam apekṣayituṃ kṣaṇam api na kṣamata iti /
analyzed: tasmāt ayam maulaḥ hetuḥ vaiyarthyam ātmanaḥ  viparyaye bādhakam pramāṇam sādhya siddhau sahāyam apekṣayitum kṣaṇam api na kṣamate iti
