translated: It is only on the basis of a very subtle, specific difference in species.

original: jātibhede katham ekasaṃtānavyavasthety āha p / sarve /ti /🔽yady ekākārapratyayanaivanunaivyapratyayanibandhanai
analyzed: jāti bhede katham eka saṃtāna vyavasthā iti āha  yadi
translated: How is there establishment of a single continuum in the case of a difference in species? He says: all.

analyzed: ka santāna vyavasthā tadā anyasya
translated: If the establishment of a single continuum is based solely on the production of a single cognition, then in the case of another, that [single continuum] would not be established.

original: pādānena sahaikasaṃtānavyavasthā na syāt sā cāvaśyavācyānyathā svasantatipatitakāryajanakatvena
analyzed: pādānena saha eka saṃtāna vyavasthā na syāt sā ca avaśya vācyā anyathā sva santati patita kārya janaka tvena
translated: If it is necessarily to be stated otherwise, then the establishment of a material cause would not be possible in terms of being the producer of an effect that falls within one's own continuum.

original: yā tasyopādanatvenābhimatasyopādānavyavasthā sā na syād ity paraś codayati ādyasye /ti /🔽jātyanuvidhānaṃ kutaciści
analyzed: yā tasya upādana tvena abhimatasya upādāna vyavasthā sā na syāt iti paraḥ codayati  jāti anuvidhānam
translated: The opponent raises the objection: In the case of the first [moment], etc.

analyzed: rūpāt kathañcid tena saha eka pratyavamarṣa jananam
translated: [The reply is:] The conformity with the universal and the production of a single cognition from a certain form in some way with that [universal].

analyzed: eva samarthayate
translated: Thus, he supports this [reply] with For example, etc.

analyzed: aguru jāti bheda anukaraṇam tat dhūmasya aguru gandha sahacāri tayā pratyavamarṣa janaka tvam
translated: The conformity with the universal of aguru [sandalwood] is the production of a single cognition by the smoke of aguru [sandalwood] due to its association with the smell of aguru [sandalwood].

analyzed: anukurvanti eva iti vartate tad dhūmāḥ tad vartiṃdhūmāḥ
translated: The smoke of that [aguru] conforms only. The smoke of that [aguru] is the smoke of its [aguru] fuel.

original: eṣāṃ kuto jñāyate ity āha tadrūpe /ti /
analyzed: tad bheda anukaraṇam eṣām kutas jñāyate iti āha
translated: How is this known? He says: In that form, etc.

original: yasmād indhanena saha dhūmasya kenacid rūpeṇa ekākāraparāmarśajanakatayaikasaṃtati vyavasthānād yena /
analyzed: yasmāt indhanena saha dhūmasya kenacid rūpeṇa eka ākāra parāmarśa janaka tayā eka saṃtati vyavasthānāt yena
translated: Because smoke is established as having the same continuum as fuel by generating a cognition of the same form with some aspect, by which.

original: tasmāt indhanam eveti sthūlenāyaṃ vyapadeśo vastutas tu tadgatārdrasantānaviśeṣas tasyopādānakāraṇaṃ jñeyaṃ tu tasyāṅgārādeḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt indhanam eva iti sthūlena ayam vyapadeśaḥ vastutas tu tad gata ārdra santāna viśeṣaḥ tasya upādāna kāraṇam jñeyam tu tasya aṅgāra ādeḥ
translated: Therefore, this designation is made with regard to fuel itself in a gross way. But in reality, the specific moist continuum in it should be known as the material cause of that charcoal and so on.

original: yathā caitat tathādharmottareṇa viniścayaṭīkāyāṃ nirṇītam iti tata evāpekṣitavyam /
analyzed: yathā ca etat tathā dharmottareṇa viniścaya ṭīkāyām nirṇītam iti tatas eva apekṣitavyam
translated: And just as this is so, it has been determined by Dharmottama in the Viniścaya commentary. Therefore, it should be sought from there.

original: prasajyate pratipādyata iti prasaṅgo 'tiśayitaḥ prasaṅgo 'tiprasaṅgas tenālam a /tivistareṇety artho 'tra draṣṭavyaḥ /
analyzed: prasajyate pratipādyate iti tena alam
translated: The meaning to be seen here is that prasajya, which means to be implied, is atiśayita, which means excessive, and atiprasanga, which means excessive implication, is to be had with that.

original: koṣṭhakagataḥ pāṭhaḥ pratyantare dṛśyate sa ca na samyag bhāti /
analyzed: koṣṭhaka gataḥ pāṭhaḥ pratyantare dṛśyate sa ca na samyak bhāti
translated: The text found in the brackets is seen in the Pratyantara [commentary], and it does not appear to be correct.

analyzed: durveka anurodhena tad rūpa rasa vīryaḥ ityādi pāṭhaḥ syāt
translated: The text should be rasa, veerya, and so on in accordance with the Durveka [commentary].

analyzed: tasya kārya bhedasya atādṛśa tva lakṣaṇasya abhāvāt
translated: Because that difference in effect does not have the characteristic of being of that kind.

original: tasyeti bhedasya tasmin ajāyamānasyāpi katham ahetutvam iti pārśvasthavacanam āśaṃkyāha nahī /ti /
analyzed: tasya iti bhedasya tasmin ajāyamānasya api katham ahetu tvam iti pārśva stha vacanam āśaṃkya āha
translated: The statement of the person standing by the side, How can it be without a cause, even though it is not being produced in that [effect]? is suspected, and [the author] says No.

original: asaty abhede / prakaraṇād asati sāmagryabheda ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: asati abhede prakaraṇāt asati sāmagrī abhede iti arthaḥ
translated: When there is no difference, the meaning is: when there is no difference in the collection, due to the context.

original: kutaḥ punar asaty abhede jāta ity apekṣāyāṃ yojyaṃ sāmagryor i /ti /
analyzed: kutas punar asati abhede jāte iti apekṣāyām yojyam sāmagryoḥ
translated: And when there is no difference, how can there be a difference? This is to be connected with of the two collections in the instrumental case.

original: hetau / sāmagryor bhede 'nyādṛśatvalakṣaṇe saty abhavato bhedasya tathā tadvat hetau / sāmagryabhedalakṣaṇe 'saty api bhavato
analyzed: hetau sāmagryoḥ bhede nyādṛśa tva lakṣaṇe sati abhavataḥ bhedasya tathā tadvat hetau sāmagrī abheda lakṣaṇe sati api bhavataḥ
translated: When there is a difference in the two collections, characterized by being of a different kind, the difference, which did not exist before, exists in that way, in the instrumental case. When there is no difference in the collection, characterized by being of the same kind, the difference, which exists even when there is no difference,

analyzed: bhedasya iti prakaraṇāt
translated: exists due to the context.

original: abhedas tādṛśatvam ekajātīyatvam iti yāvat tasya nibandhanatvāt / śālikodravādau bhedasya bhāvāt kathaṃ na kvacit padānubandha ity āha
analyzed: abhedaḥ tādṛśa tvam eka jātīya tvam iti yāvat tasya nibandhana tvāt śāli kodrava ādau bhedasya bhāvāt katham na kvacid pada anubandhaḥ iti āha
translated: The absence of difference is being of the same kind, being of the same class, to that extent. Because that is the basis. Since the difference exists in the case of śāli and kodrava, etc., how is it that there is no connection with the word in some cases? He says

original: taddhetvor abhedahatutvāt tayor apy abhedenaiva bhavitavyam iti tad api pakṣīkṛtam eveti bhāvaḥ /🔽hetubhede 'pi na tatkukṛ
analyzed: tad hetvoḥ abheda hatu tvāt tayoḥ api abhedena eva bhavitavyam iti tat api pakṣīkṛtam eva iti bhāvaḥ  hetu bhede pi śāli kodrava ādeḥ na tat kukṛ
translated: because those two are the cause of the absence of difference, they must exist only by the absence of difference. Therefore, that is also included in the hypothesis.

original: to bhedo 'nyādṛśatvam api tv evam evety āha nimittam antareṇe /ti /
analyzed: taḥ bhedaḥ nyādṛśatvam api tu evam evā iti āha nimittam
translated: Even when there is a difference in the cause, there is no difference in that. The difference is of a different kind, but it is just like this. He says without a reason.

original: kalpanāyāṃ bhedakalpanāyāṃ viśeṣābhāvān nirmittatvena viśeṣābhāvāt / śālyantare 'pi kiṃ na kalpyata iti śeṣaḥ prakaraṇa laṃbhyam vā
analyzed: kalpanāyām bheda kalpanāyām viśeṣa abhāvāt nirmitta tvena viśeṣa abhāvāt śāli antare pi kim na kalpyate iti śeṣaḥ prakaraṇa laṃbhyam vā
translated: In the case of conceptualization, i.e., in the case of the conceptualization of difference, there is no difference, i.e., there is no difference in the form of a reason. Why is it not conceptualized even in another rice? The rest is to be supplied from the context.

analyzed: yat vā na hetu abhedaḥ bhedasya nibandhanam
translated: Or, the non-difference of the reason is not the basis for non-difference.

original: nāpi hetubhedaḥ kitv evam evābhedo bhaviṣyatīty ā nimittam i /ti /
analyzed: na api hetu bhedaḥ kitu evam eva abhedaḥ bhaviṣyati iti nimittam
translated: Nor is the difference of the reason. Why? Non-difference will be just like this, up to the absence of a reason.

analyzed: kalpanāyām abheda kalpanāyām  viśeṣa abhāvāt śāli kodravayoḥ api bhe abhe
translated: In the case of conceptualization, i.e., in the case of the conceptualization of non-difference.

original: daḥ kiṃ na kalpyata iti pūrvavat /
analyzed: kim na kalpyate iti pūrvavat
translated: Due to the absence of a difference, why is the difference between rice and barley not conceptualized? As before.

original: syād etat pratibhāsaniyamanibandhanoyam abhedo nānyanibandhanas tat kim evam ucyate ity āha pratibhāse /ti /
analyzed: syāt etat pratibhāsa niyama nibandhanā uyam abhedaḥ na anya nibandhanaḥ tat kim evam ucyate iti āha
translated: This may be said: This non-difference is based on the restriction of appearance, not on anything else. Why is it said like this? He says: In the case of appearance.

analyzed: tasya sabhrā
translated: The difference of appearance is suchness.

original: ntinimittād p / ā /kārasāmyādeḥ paramārthato bhede 'py upalakṣaṇād darśanānaivam iti draṣtavyam /
analyzed: nti nimittāt p paramārthataḥ bhede pi upalakṣaṇāt iti draṣtavyam
translated: Of that, the cause of appearance is similarity of form, etc. Even in the case of difference in reality, it should be seen that it is not so due to the indication of perception alone.

original: evam upalakṣaṇatvād asya bhedavicārāvasare 'pi pratibhāsabhedād bheda iti pūrvapakṣe
analyzed: evam upalakṣaṇa tvāt asya bheda vicāra avasare pi pratibhāsa bhedāt bhedaḥ iti pūrvapakṣe
translated: Thus, even at the time of investigating difference, due to the difference of appearance, there is difference, in the prima facie view,

original: pratibhāsabhedasya ca kutaścid bhrāntinimittāt paramārthato 'bhedepy upalakṣaṇād iti vaktavyam /
analyzed: pratibhāsa bhedasya ca kutaścid bhrānti nimittāt paramārthataḥ bhede pi upalakṣaṇāt iti vaktavyam
translated: And it must be said that the difference of appearance is due to a cause of error, even though there is non-difference in the ultimate sense, due to the indication.

original: ubhayatrāpi tu yadi pratibhāsabhedābhedāv apy aparapratibhāsabhedābhedanibandhanau
analyzed: ubhayatra api tu yadi pratibhāsa bheda abhedau api apara pratibhāsa bheda abheda nibandhanau
translated: But in both cases, if the difference and non-difference of appearances are based on the difference and non-difference of another appearance,

original: tatrāpi tatpratyanavasthā tasmād api tathātvaṃ vyavasthāpayituṃ na śakyata
analyzed: tatra api tad pratyanavasthā tasmāt api tathātvam vyavasthāpayitum na śakyata
translated: then there would be an infinite regress there too, and therefore it cannot be established that it is so in that way.

analyzed: iti doṣaḥ darśayitavyaḥ tayoḥ bheda abhedayoḥ
translated: So the fault must be shown in those two, difference and non-difference.

analyzed: tasya svaṃbhāvasya
translated: Of that. Of its own nature.

analyzed: tābhyām bheda abhedābhyām
translated: By those two. By difference and non-difference.

original: tebhyāṃ bhāvasvabhāvabhedābhedebhyo 'nyaḥ sa cāsau sambandhaś ceti tathā tasya kalpanā / tasyām /
analyzed: tebhyām bhāva svabhāva bheda abhedebhyaḥ nyaḥ sa ca asau sambandhaḥ ca iti tathā tasya kalpanā tasyām
translated: Other than those, the differences of existence and nature, and that is the relation, so it is imagined in that way. In that.

original: sopi teṣāṃ kuta ity ākāṃkṣāyāṃ sambandhāṅgīkaraṇaṃ tatrāpi tatparyanuyoge tad ity anavasthā /
analyzed: saḥ api teṣām kutas iti ākāṃkṣāyām sambandha aṅgīkaraṇam tatra api tad paryanuyoge tat iti anavasthā
translated: When there is expectation of how is that for them?, the acceptance of the relation, even there when it is questioned, is that, so there is an infinite regress.

original: svātmany evāvasthānād i /ti bruvato 'yaṃ bhāvo yadi bhāvasvabhāve tayor anupraveśas tadā sa evāvatiṣṭheta na tu tau /
analyzed: sva ātmani eva avasthānāt bruvataḥ yam bhāvaḥ yadi bhāva svabhāve tayoḥ anupraveśaḥ tadā saḥ eva avatiṣṭheta na tu tau
translated: If, when it is said because it exists in its own nature, this is the idea - if the entry of those two into the nature of existence is, then that alone would remain, but not those two.

original: atha tayos tasyānupraveśas tarhi tāv avatiṣṭheyātāṃ na tv asāv iti /
analyzed: atha tayoḥ tasya anupraveśaḥ tarhi tau avatiṣṭheyātām na tu asau iti
translated: If, on the other hand, they enter into it, then they would remain, but not it.

original: punar bhedapakṣa eva doṣāntaraṃ samuccinvann āha anupakārāc ce /ti /
analyzed: punar bheda pakṣe eva doṣa antaram samuccinvan āha anupakārāt
translated: Again, bringing up another fault in the theory of difference, he says: And because there is no benefit.

original: yau bhedābhedau asau pratipadyate tāv api yadi bhinnau / tato vyatiriktau /
analyzed: yau bheda abhedau asau pratipadyate tau api yadi bhinnau tatas vyatiriktau
translated: If those two, difference and non-difference, which are apprehended, are also different, then they are separate from it.

analyzed: tādavasthā tad abasthaḥ
translated: In that state, in that condition.

original: na bhinnaṃ nāpy abhinnaṃ yat tadavastham /
analyzed: na bhinnam na api abhinnam yat tad avastham
translated: What is neither different nor non-different is in that state.

analyzed: yad avastham bheda abheda pratipatti kāle
translated: In the state in which it is at the time of apprehending difference and non-difference.

analyzed: tasya bhāva svabhāvasya
translated: Of that. Of the nature of an existent thing.

analyzed: tasya sva rūpa antareṇa kriyamāṇasya
translated: Of that. Of what is being made by a different form.

original: tata eva hetubalāyātāt kutaścid bhinnābhinnād rūpād viśeṣasāmānyātmano /r ity atra viśeṣaśabdena svalakṣaṇaṃ na vācyam /
analyzed: tatas eva hetu bala āyātāt kutaścid bhinna abhinnāt rūpāt iti atra viśeṣa śabdena sva lakṣaṇam na vācyam
translated: From that itself, which comes from the power of the cause, from some different or non-different form, which has the nature of particular and universal. Here, the word 'particular' should not denote its own characteristic.

original: tasya bhidyata iti vyutpattyā bhedarūpatvāpatter ayogāsiddhiprasaṅgān nāpi viśeṣpadārthas tasya vināśārambharahiteśve vāṇavākāśādiṣu pravṛtteḥ
analyzed: tasya bhidyate iti vyutpattyā bheda rūpa tva āpatteḥ ayoga asiddhi prasaṅgāt nā api viśeṣa padārthaḥ tasya vināśa ārambha rahita īśve vāṇava ākāśa ādiṣu pravṛtteḥ
translated: Because of the derivation of 'bhidyate' as 'is divided', it would follow that it is of the nature of difference, and that is not logically possible. Nor does it denote the meaning of 'viśeṣa', because it is used for things like God, which are devoid of destruction and origination, and space, etc.

analyzed: pareṇa bheda śabdena abhipreta tvāt
translated: Because the opponent intends the word 'bheda' to denote difference.

analyzed: kiṃtu eka sāmānya yoge pi avāntara sāmānya viśeṣaḥ
translated: But even when there is a single common property, there is a difference in the specific common property of those two.

original: bhedābhedayoḥ /🔽hī /ty atrasthasya hiśabdasya maulasya vyākhyānam etat yasmād i /ti /
analyzed: bheda abhedayoḥ  apekṣayā atra sthasya hi śabdasya maulasya vyākhyānam etat yasmāt
translated: Of difference and non-difference.🔽This is the explanation of the word hi occurring in the sentence hi (in the commentary), which means because.

analyzed: ṭīkā kṛtaḥ tu iti atra stha hi śabdaḥ va dhāraṇe
translated: But the author of the commentary (says) hi occurring in the sentence hi (in the commentary) is for the purpose of restriction.

original: yad vā hir yasmād apekṣayā tasyeti yojyam /
analyzed: yat vā hiḥ yasmāt apekṣayā tasya iti yojyam
translated: Or hi should be construed as because, for the purpose of that.

analyzed: dvau etau śatṛ pratyayau hetau draṣṭavyau
translated: These two nominal affixes should be seen as denoting the cause.

original: sādhanānāṃ kāraṇānāṃ sādhanāya / niṣpādanāya kathaṃ neṣyata ity āha /
analyzed: sādhanānām kāraṇānām sādhanāya niṣpādanāya katham na iṣyate iti āha
translated: For the purpose of accomplishing, for the purpose of producing, the means, the causes. How is it not accepted? He says:

analyzed: vilakṣaṇāt
translated: Even from a dissimilar one.

analyzed: yādṛśam dṛṣṭam yathā dṛṣṭam
translated: The effect is as it is seen, as it is seen.

original: kāryaṃ yathādṛṣṭād eva kāraṇād utpadyeteti vartate /
analyzed: yathādṛṣṭam kāryam yathādṛṣṭāt eva kāraṇāt utpadyeta iti vartate
translated: It continues: The effect arises only from a cause as it is seen.

original: vilakṣaṇayāpi vivakṣitasāmagryā anyādṛśāpi tallakṣaṇaṃ vivakṣitasāmagryā jāyamānakāryasarūpam /
analyzed: vilakṣaṇayā api vivakṣita sāmagryā anyādṛśā api tad lakṣaṇam vivakṣita sāmagryā jāyamāna kārya sarūpam
translated: Even from a dissimilar intended collection, an effect having a different nature is produced, which is similar to the effect having the intended nature produced by the intended collection.

original: tatsāmagrīvailakṣaṇyāviśeṣādyasyāḥ kasyāścit sāmagryā jāyamānaṃ kiṃ tallakṣaṇaṃ na bhavatīti /
analyzed: tad sāmagrī vailakṣaṇya aviśeṣāt yasyāḥ kasyāścid sāmagryāḥ jāyamānam kim tad lakṣaṇam na bhavati iti
translated: Because there is no difference in the dissimilarity of that collection, what effect produced by some collection does not have that nature?

original: tathā ca sa eva doṣa ity āśaṃkya para evāha kasyāścid eve /ti /
analyzed: tathā ca saḥ eva doṣaḥ iti āśaṃkya paraḥ evā āha kasyāścid
translated: And thus that same fault would arise. Suspecting this, the opponent says of some only.

original: atrāsmi pūrvapakṣe / yādṛśī śakti /r iti yojyam /
analyzed: pūrvapakṣe yādṛśī iti yojyam
translated: Here, in this prima facie view, it should be connected as what kind of power.

analyzed: nāma antareṇa saṃjñā antareṇa
translated: By another name, by another designation.

original: kathaṃ tad eva nāmāntareṇoktaṃ p / syād ity āha tadvilakṣaṇasye /ti /
analyzed: katham tat eva nāma antareṇa uktam syāt iti āha
translated: How could that very thing be stated by another name? He says of that which is different.

analyzed: tad vilakṣaṇasya agni ādi sāmagrī vilakṣaṇasya
translated: Of that which is different from the collection of fire and so on, which is different from the collection of fire and so on.

analyzed: yā agni ādi sāmagryā anyādṛśī sāmagrī sā tad śabdena pratyavamraṣṭavyā
translated: The collection that is different from the collection of fire and so on should be referred to by the word that.

original: tasyāvilakṣaṇasyāgnyādikāraṇakalāpasya ya ātmātiśayaḥ śaktiśabdavācyas tasyāsaṃbhavād a /yogāt /
analyzed: tasya avilakṣaṇasya agni ādi kāraṇa kalāpasya yaḥ ātma atiśayaḥ śakti śabda vācyaḥ tasya asaṃbhavāt
translated: Because of the impossibility, the non-existence, of the special nature of that, which is called the power, of the collection of causes such as fire and so on.

analyzed: anagni ādi rūpasya kāraṇa kalāpasya agni ādi sāmagrī śakti yoga asaṃbhavāt iti samudāya arthaḥ
translated: The collective meaning is: because of the impossibility of the collection of causes such as fire and so on being connected with the power of the collection of causes such as fire and so on.

original: tadātmātiśayayoge 'pi katham agnyādirūpatvaṃ tasyety āha sa eva hī /ti dhūmaṃ janayati sahakārikāraṇatvena /
analyzed: tad ātma atiśaya yoge pi katham agni ādi rūpatvam tasya iti āha saḥ eva dhūmam janayati sahakāri kāraṇa tvena
translated: Even if it is connected with that special nature, how can it have the form of fire and so on? He says that itself, because it produces smoke as an assisting cause.

analyzed: sva jātim anukārayati janayati iti arthaḥ
translated: It causes its own class to imitate, the meaning is that it produces as a material cause.

analyzed: yadi atra caśabdaḥ tuśabdasya arthe
translated: And in if it were, the word ca has the meaning of tu.

original: tāṃ sāmagrīm agnyādisaṃjñayā vyavaharāmo bhavantas tu śakramūrdhādisaṃjñayā vyavaharante ato nāgni saṃjñāyām eva vivādaḥ syāt /
analyzed: tām sāmagrīm agni ādi saṃjñayā vayam vyavaharāmaḥ bhavantaḥ tu śakramūrdha ādi saṃjñayā vyavaharante atas na agni saṃjñāyām eva vivādaḥ syāt
translated: You use the term 'fire' for that collection, but you use the term 'Indra's head' for something else. Therefore, there should be no dispute only about the term 'fire'.

original: kathaṃ punar nāgny eva vivādo nānyatrety āha arthābhedam i /ti /
analyzed: katham punar na agni eva vivādaḥ na anyatra iti āha artha abhedam
translated: How then is there no dispute about fire itself, not elsewhere? He says: because of the non-difference of the object.

original: arthābhedaṃ tathā dhūmajananaśaktilakṣaṇam abhyupagamya tathābhidhānāt / śakramūrdhādīty abhidhānāt /
analyzed: artha abhedam tathā dhūma janana śakti lakṣaṇam abhyupagamya tathā abhidhānāt śakramūrdha ādi iti abhidhānāt
translated: Accepting the non-difference of the object, which is characterized by the power to produce smoke, because of the expression 'Indra's head' and so on.

original: dhūmādikaṃ kāryaṃ kartṛ kathaṃ niścitam ity āha atadrūpe /ti /
analyzed: dhūma ādikam kāryam kartṛ katham niścitam iti āha
translated: How is the effect such as smoke ascertained as the agent? He says: in what is not of that form.

analyzed: indhana ādikam karma na vyabhicarati
translated: The action such as fuel does not deviate.

original: kṣaṇāpekṣāpakṣe tu kāraṇam indhanādi kṣaṇarūpam ity avaseyam /
analyzed: kṣaṇa apekṣā pakṣe tu kāraṇam indhana ādi kṣaṇa rūpam iti avaseyam
translated: But in the case of the moment-dependence, the cause such as fuel should be understood to be of the nature of a moment.

analyzed: avyabhicārasya ākāram darśayati tad vilakṣaṇāt iti
translated: He shows the form of non-deviation with 'from what is different from that'.

analyzed: itiḥ hetau siddhi ati niṣpadyate iti
translated: The particle 'iti' is for the purpose of indicating the cause, i.e. it is accomplished.

original: kāryaṃ hetuṃ vyākhyāyādhunānupalabdhiṃ vyācikhyāsuryatas tatas tadutthānaṃ tadupadarśayituṃ tad evam i /tyādinopakramate /
analyzed: kāryam hetum vyākhyāya adhunā anupalabdhim vyācikhyāsuḥ yatas tatas tad utthānam tat upadarśayitum tat evam
translated: Having explained the effect as the reason, he now wishes to explain non-apprehension. In order to show that arising from that, he begins with 'tad evam' and so on.

original: bhavad utpadyamānaṃ dṛṣṭaṃ niścitaṃ sakṛd i /ti sakṛd apīti jñeyam /
analyzed: bhavat utpadyamānam dṛṣṭam niścitam sakṛt sakṛt api iti jñeyam
translated: It is seen and ascertained that an existent thing arises only once. Therefore, it should be understood as only once.

analyzed: pratyakṣa anupalambhābhyām yathā vyākhyātābhyām
translated: By perception and non-apprehension, as explained above.

analyzed: tathāvidhāt avadhārayataḥ nantara uktā eva upapattiḥ buddhi sthā
translated: For one who ascertains it as only from such a kind, the same reasoning just stated remains in the mind.

original: avadhāraṇena pratīyamānam apy atathāvidhāj janmaniṣedhaṃ kaṇṭhoktaṃ kurvann āha ne /ti /
analyzed: avadhāraṇena pratīyamānam api atathāvidhāt janma niṣedham kaṇṭha uktam kurvan āha  /
translated: Even though the negation of arising from a dissimilar kind is understood by the specification, he states it explicitly, saying not from that.

analyzed: vyāptyā sarva deśa kāla parigraheṇa
translated: By pervasion, by including all places and times.

analyzed: tuḥ anupalabdhim bhedavatīm darśayati
translated: He shows non-apprehension to be of different kinds.

original: yādṛśyuktā yathoktā / tasyāṃ dṛśyatvaviśeṣaṇāyām ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: yādṛśī uktā yathā uktā tasyām dṛśya tva viśeṣaṇāyām iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: in that [non-apprehension] which has the qualification of being perceptible as stated.

analyzed: nimitta antara abhāva upadarśanam prāk uktam iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that the absence of another cause was stated earlier.

original: svarūpa /grahaṇam upalakṣaṇaṃ tena vyāpārepīty api pratyeyam /
analyzed: upalakṣaṇam tena api pratyeyam
translated: The word itself is a specification. Therefore, it should also be understood as even in the operation.

analyzed: atas eva vyāpārasya paścāt darśayitavya tvāt
translated: For that very reason, because the operation should be shown later.

original: krame tāvac chabdaṃ prayuñjāno 'nupalabdhisvarūpaṃ darśayatīti vakṣyati /
analyzed: krame tāvat śabdam prayuñjānaḥ nupalabdhi svarūpam tāvat darśayati iti vakṣyati
translated: First, using the word only, he will show the nature of non-apprehension.

analyzed: tu anvaya vyatireka viṣaya vipratipatti mātra nirāsa arthaḥ
translated: But the word only is for the purpose of refuting mere disagreement about the scope of positive and negative concomitance.

original: yathāśruti vyākhyāne tu tathetyādi vakṣyamāṇam asaṃgataṃ syāt /
analyzed: yathāśruti vyākhyāne tu tathā ityādi vakṣyamāṇam asaṃgatam syāt
translated: But if it is explained according to the literal meaning, then what is to be said later, beginning with thus, would be irrelevant.

analyzed: svarūpa viṣaya vipratipattim pratipādayati
translated: Thus, beginning with thus, he explains the disagreement regarding the nature of the self.

analyzed: tathā ca īśvara senaśvaraka vyākhyāne pramāṇa antara tvena imām babhūva
translated: And in this way, he showed this as a different means of knowledge in the explanation of the self by Īśvarasena and Īśvarakṛṣṇa.
It should be understood that the self's being the basis of the knowledge of that [self] leads to an infinite regress if it is the apprehender of that [self].

original: tajjñānādhāratvapratiṣedhamātravivakṣayā ca pakṣāntaram iti pramāṇāntaratvam eva tadanyavijñānāśrayeṇopapādayann p / āha nahī /ti
analyzed: tad jñāna ādhāra tva pratiṣedha mātra vivakṣayā ca pakṣa antaram iti pramāṇa antara tvam eva tad anya vijñāna āśrayeṇa upapādayan āha
translated: And with the intention of merely denying being the basis of the knowledge of that [self], he presents another view. Thus, establishing it as a different means of knowledge by means of being the basis of the knowledge of something else, he says not so.

analyzed: pratyakṣam ekam anumāna ātmakam yat vā
translated: Perception is one, or it is like inference.

analyzed: tasya pratyakṣasya anumānasya vā
translated: Of that. Of perception or inference.

original: tato bhāvāṃśāt /🔽kiṃ kurvat tarhi tadabhāvapramāṇa aśnuta ity āha bhāvāṃśa abhāvāṃśe
analyzed: tatas bhāva aṃśāt  kim kurvat tarhi aśnute iti āha bhāva aṃśa abhāva aṃśe
translated: From that part which is the existent.🔽Then what does it do? How does it apprehend the part which is the non-existent? He says: generating the part which is the non-existent in the part which is the existent.

analyzed: janayat iti hetau ayam śatṛ pratyayaḥ pratyeyaḥ
translated: This suffix tasi should be understood in the sense of the cause.

analyzed: tat iti anya viṣaya jñānam
translated: That refers to the knowledge of something else.

original: tadindriyajanmani jñāne yadavabhāsate sa tasya viṣayas tatpratipattijanakatvena labhata ity abhisaṃbandhād dvitīyā sādhana /padasaṃskāravelāyām
analyzed: tad indriya janmani jñāne yat avabhāsate sa tasya viṣayaḥ tad pratipatti janaka tvena labhate iti abhisaṃbandhāt dvitīyā
translated: At the time of the modification of the word,

analyzed: anupalabdhiḥ na apekṣitā iti tathā nirdeśaḥ
translated: non-apprehension is not required, hence it is directed thus.

original: kathaṃ tarhi sa sidhyatīty āśaṃkāyām varṇayann āha anupalabdher i /ti /
analyzed: katham tarhi sa sidhyati iti āśaṃkāyām varṇayan āha anupalabdheḥ
translated: How then is it established? In anticipation of this doubt, he explains: By non-apprehension.

original: yadi vimṛśyamānam aghaṭam etadbhūtalam iti pratītir nātiśete tadghaṭo nāsti iti🔽jñānam pratiyogismaraṇasahāyenendriyeṇa janyamānatvāt tajjñānānantarabhāvi saṃyuktaviśeṣabhāvalakṣaṇāt
analyzed: yadi vimṛśyamānam aghaṭam etat bhū talam iti pratītiḥ na atiśete tat ghaṭaḥ na asti iti  jñānam pratiyogi smaraṇa sahāyena indriyeṇa janyamāna tvāt tad jñāna anantara bhāvi saṃyukta viśeṣa bhāva lakṣaṇāt
translated: If the cognition This ground is not a pot does not go beyond the apprehension This ground is not a pot, then the cognition The pot does not exist🔽is produced by the sense organ assisted by the recollection of the counter-entity. Because it exists after that cognition, it is a valid means of knowledge characterized by the relation of inherence.

original: indriyārthasannikarṣāṭ jāyamānaṃ pratyakṣaṃ sad eva pramāṇāntaram anumānādeḥ pramāṇād anyat /
analyzed: indriya artha sannikarṣāt jāyamānam pratyakṣam sat eva pramāṇa antaram anumāna ādeḥ pramāṇāt anyat  /
translated: The perception that arises from the contact of the sense organ with the object is a real valid means of knowledge, different from inference and other means of knowledge.

analyzed: yat vā viśeṣa vacanaḥ yam antara śabdaḥ
translated: Or, this word antara has the meaning of viśeṣa (particular).

original: kiṃ bhūtaṃ sad etat pratyakṣaṃ pramāṇam ity āha abhāvasya / iti /
analyzed: kim bhūtam sat etat pratyakṣam pramāṇam iti āha abhāvasya iti
translated: What kind of valid means of knowledge is this perception? He says: Of non-existence.

original: tuccharūpasya / iti bhāvarūpaśūnyasyeti boddhavyam na tv avasthātv astv ā
analyzed: tuccha rūpasya iti bhāva rūpa śūnyasya iti boddhavyam na tu astu ā
translated: Of the empty form. Thus, it should be understood as of the form of emptiness, but not as having the nature of a state.

analyzed: tmanaḥ iti tad matena abhāvasya api vastu tvāt
translated: Of a void form. Thus it should be understood as referring to the emptiness of the form of existence, not that the state of the self should exist, because even non-existence is a real entity according to their view.

analyzed: nanu ca na idam pratyakṣam pramāṇam
translated: But this is not a means of valid knowledge.

original: api tu sannikarṣasya pratyakṣapramāṇasya pramāṇarūpaṃ phalam etat tat evam uktam iti cet /
analyzed: api tu sannikarṣasya pratyakṣa pramāṇasya pramāṇa rūpam phalam etat tat evam uktam iti ced
translated: Rather, this is the result in the form of a means of valid knowledge of perception, which is the contact, and it is said to be so. If this is said,

analyzed: satyam etat
translated: this is true.

original: kevalaṃ hānādibuddhirūpaṃ phalaṃ pradhānam idaṃ pramāṇam abhipretam /
analyzed: kevalam hāna ādi buddhi rūpam phalam pradhānam idam pramāṇam abhipretam
translated: Only the result in the form of the cognition of abandonment, etc. is intended as the principal means of valid knowledge here.

original: paricchedātmakam i /ti ca paricchidyate 'neneti paricchedas tadātmakam /🔽paricchittis tūpādānādidhīreveti /
analyzed: pariccheda ātmakam ca paricchidyate nena iti paricchedaḥ tad ātmakam  paricchittiḥ tu upādāna ādi dhīḥ eva iti
translated: And it is of the nature of determination. Determination is that by which this is determined. It is of that nature.🔽But determination is just the cognition of the cause, etc.

original: yadi vā pramāṇaśabdenopacārāt phalam evābhipretam iha evaṃbhūtaṃ pratyakṣapramāṇaphalāntaram
analyzed: yadi vā pramāṇa śabdena upacārāt phalam eva abhipretam iha evaṃbhūtam pratyakṣa pramāṇa phala antaram
translated: Or, if the result is intended here by the word means of valid knowledge figuratively, this is the result of perception, which is of such a nature.

original: ca sāmarthyāt yata etad bhavati tat pratyakṣaṃ pramāṇam iti darśitam
analyzed: ca sāmarthyāt yatas etat bhavati tat pratyakṣam pramāṇam iti darśitam
translated: And by implication, it is shown that perception is the means of valid knowledge from which this arises.

analyzed: iti sarvathā avadātam
translated: Thus, it is completely clear.

original: teṣām eva bauddhaṃ prati vakroktiṃ darśayann āha tad eva / iti tad eva pramāṇam anantaroktaṃ yat /
analyzed: teṣām eva bauddham prati vakroktim darśayan āha tat eva iti tat eva pramāṇam anantara uktam yat
translated: Showing the counter-argument to them, the Buddhists, he says: That very [means of valid cognition] that was just mentioned.

original: prativādināṃ tīrthakānām ācāryadeśīyānāṃ ca tannirāsārthaṃ / buddhibhedanirāsārthaṃ /
analyzed: prativādinām tīrthakānām ācārya deśīyānām ca tad nirāsa artham buddhi bheda nirāsa artham
translated: For the sake of refuting the opponents, the tīrthikas, and the followers of the teacher, for the sake of refuting the difference of opinions.

analyzed: vipratipatti nirāsa artham iti
translated: For the sake of refuting the disagreements.

analyzed: upalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāptiḥ yasya asti sa khalu upalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāptaḥ ucyate
translated: That which has the attainment of the characteristic of perception is indeed said to have the attainment of the characteristic of perception.

original: saiva tu kīdṛśī yatprāpto 'rthas tathokto vārtikakṛtety āśaṅkyopalabdhilakṣaṇaprāptim abhipretāṃ darśayann āha upalabdhī /ti /
analyzed: sā eva tu kīdṛśī yatprāptaḥ rthaḥ tathā uktaḥ vārtika kṛtā iti āśaṅkya upalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāptim abhipretām darśayan āha
translated: But what kind is that? The author of the Vārtika says that the object that is attained is so-called. Fearing this, showing the intended attainment of the characteristic of perception, he says: Perception.

original: upalabdhilakṣaṇaprāptir evaṃrūpā anyatra vyākhyātā / iti sambandhaḥ kāryaḥ /
analyzed: upalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāptiḥ evaṃrūpā śāstra kṛtā anyatra vyākhyātā iti sambandhaḥ kāryaḥ
translated: The attainment of the characteristic of perception is explained in this way elsewhere. This is the connection that should be made.

analyzed: pratyekam abhisambadhyate
translated: The word 'condition' is connected with each [of the four conditions].

analyzed: āloka ādiḥ
translated: The causal condition is light, etc.

analyzed: samananatara pratyayaḥ prāktanam vijñānam  adhipati pratyayaḥ ca cakṣuḥ ādiḥ
translated: The immediately preceding condition is the previous consciousness.🔽And the dominant condition is the eye, etc.

original: ālambyata iti kṛtvā ālambanapratyayo nīlādiḥ sa /
analyzed: ālambyate iti kṛtvā ālambana pratyayaḥ nīla ādiḥ sa
translated: The objective support condition is blue, etc., because it is what is to be perceived.

original: kim artham sā tathārūpā śāstrakṛtā / p / anyatra vyākhyātety āśaṅkāyām āha naiyāyika / iti /
analyzed: kim artham sā tathārūpā śāstra kṛtā anyatra vyākhyātā iti āśaṅkāyām āha naiyāyikaḥ iti
translated: Why was it made in that form by the author of the treatise? In case of doubt that it is explained elsewhere, the Naiyāyika says:

original: vipratipattim eva darśayann āha te hi / iti /
analyzed: vipratipattim eva darśayan āha te hi iti
translated: Showing the very disagreement, he says: They indeed.

original: dravyāṇām u /palambhakānīti vadatā ca yatraitāni santi tadupalambhe nimittaṃ dravya eva ca santīti dravyasyaivolambhe nimittam amūni
analyzed: vadatā ca yatra etāni santi tad upalambhe nimittam dravye eva ca santi iti dravyasya eva upalambhe nimittam amūni
translated: By saying that they are the apprehenders of substances, it is shown that where these exist, they are the cause of the apprehension of that, and that they exist only in substances, so they are the cause of the apprehension of substances alone.

analyzed: na upalambha mātre iti darśitam
translated: Not of mere apprehension.

analyzed: anyathā abhāva samavāyayoḥ upalabdhiḥ na syāt
translated: Otherwise, there would be no apprehension of non-existence and inherence.

original: na ca nāsti saṃyuktasamarthatayā viśeṣaṇabhāvena tayor upalambhasyanaiyāyikair iṣṭatvāt /
analyzed: na ca nā asti saṃyukta samartha tayā viśeṣaṇa bhāvena tayoḥ upalambhasya anaiyāyikaiḥ iṣṭa tvāt
translated: And it is not that there is no apprehension of them as qualifiers by the Naiyāyikas through the capacity of conjunction.

original: guṇādīnām api tathā tathopalabdher iṣṭatvād iti /
analyzed: guṇa ādīnām api tathā tathā upalabdheḥ iṣṭa tvāt iti
translated: Because the apprehension of qualities etc. in that way is accepted.

original: evam eṣāṃ abhidhānaṃ kuto jñāyata iti āha mahatī /ti /
analyzed: evam eṣām abhidhānam kutas jñāyate iti āha
translated: From where is this explanation of theirs known? He says: Great.

analyzed: etat ca prati tantra siddhānta āśrayaṇena evam
translated: And this should be seen as stated by them relying on the principles of their own school,

original: vacanādi /ty ācaṣṭa iti draṣṭavyam anyathā asaṃgatam uktaṃ syātvaiśeṣikasūtratvād asyeti /
analyzed: ācaṣṭe iti draṣṭavyam anyathā asaṃgatam uktam syāt vaiśeṣika sūtra tvāt asya iti
translated: and so on, otherwise it would be stated as irrelevant, because this is a Vaiśeṣika aphorism.

original: asyāyam artho mahattvayukte mahatyupalabdhir bhavati na dvayaṇukādau /
analyzed: asya ayam arthaḥ mahat tva yukte mahatī upalabdhiḥ bhavati na dvayaṇuka ādau
translated: The meaning of this is: Perception occurs in what is endowed with greatness, in what is great, not in a dyad and so on.🔽If perception is due to greatness, then why does it not occur in space, which is supremely great? Anticipating this objection, in order to exclude that, it is said:

original: yadi mahattvād upalabdhis tarhi paramamahattvepy avakāśādau sā kiṃ na bhavatīti paryanuyogāśaṃkāyāṃ tadvyavacchedārtham uktam anekadravyatvād 🔽iti /
analyzed: yadi mahā tvāt upalabdhiḥ tarhi parama mahā tve pi avakāśa ādau sā kim na bhavati iti paryanuyoga āśaṃkāyām tad vyavaccheda artham uktam aneka dravya tvāt  iti
translated: Because of being composed of many substances.

original: athavā anekadravyāvayavās tadvattvam avayavino mahata eva na dvayaṇukasyety utpattyānyanirapekṣatvaṃ mahattvānekadravyatvayor iti lakṣaṇavikalpa
analyzed: athavā aneka dravya avayavāḥ tadvat tvam avayavinaḥ mahataḥ eva na dvayaṇukasya iti utpattyā anya nirapekṣa tvam mahat tva aneka dravya tvayoḥ iti lakṣaṇa vikalpa
translated: Or else, the composition of many substances, the possession of parts, belongs only to the great whole, not to the dyad. Thus, greatness and being composed of many substances are independent of origination. This is the alternative definition.

analyzed: eva ayam vivakṣitam boddhavyam
translated: This should be understood as intended.

original: anekaṃ dravyam ārambhakatayā vidyate yasya tadbhāvas /
analyzed: anekam dravyam ārambhaka tayā vidyate yasya tad bhāvaḥ
translated: That which has the nature of being composed of many substances that are formative causes is said to have that nature.

original: anekadravyavattvād iti pāṭhe sarvadhanāder ākṛtigaṇatvena gaṇapāṭhād asya bahuvrīhipratiṣedhena śatur vidhe draṣṭavyaḥ matuvidhiḥ dṛṣṭaḥ
analyzed: aneka dravyavat tvāt iti pāṭhe sarva dhana ādeḥ ākṛti gaṇa tvena gaṇa pāṭhāt asya bahuvrīhi pratiṣedhena śatuḥ vidhe draṣṭavyaḥ matu vidhiḥ dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: If the reading is because of being composed of many substances, then, since Sarvadhana and others are included in the class of shapes, the prohibition of the bahuvrīhi compound and the injunction of the śat affix should be seen. The mat affix is seen.

original: anyathā karmadhārayamattvarthīyāt bahuvrīhir lāghaveneṣṭa ity anekaṃ dravyaṃ yasya sa tathā tadbhāvas tasmād iti nirdeśaḥ prāpnoti anekadravyavattvāvyatvā
analyzed: anyathā bahuvrīhiḥ lāghavena iṣṭaḥ iti anekam dravyam yasya sa tathā tad bhāvaḥ tasmāt iti nirdeśaḥ prāpnoti
translated: Otherwise, if the bahuvrīhi compound were accepted for the sake of simplicity, the expression that which has many substances would be understood as that which has that state, and the direction would be because of having many substances.

original: d iti pāṭhe tu na kaścid āyāsaḥ /
analyzed: d iti pāṭhe tu na kaścid āyāsaḥ
translated: But if the reading were because of having many substances, there would be no difficulty at all.

original: yadi anekadravyavattvād anyatarasmād vā upalabdhir vāyāv api sā syāt /
analyzed: yadi mahā tvāt aneka dravyavat tvāt anyatarasmāt vā upalabdhiḥ vāyau api sā syāt
translated: If perception could occur from having many substances or from one of them, it would occur even in non-existence.

analyzed: tad nivṛtti artham uktam rūpāt
translated: To exclude that, it is said from form.

analyzed: durveka anurodhena hetu samanantara ityādi pāṭhaḥ samyak bhāti
translated: The reading from cause, from immediate antecedent and so on shines properly out of regard for Durveka.

original: durvekānurodhena dravyāṇām upalambhakāny āha iti pāṭhaḥ syāt /
analyzed: durveka anurodhena dravyāṇām upalambhakāni āha iti pāṭhaḥ syāt
translated: Out of regard for Durveka, the reading he says that the causes of the perception of substances would be appropriate.

original: nanu cānayopalabdhilakṣaṇaprāptyā yuktasyānupalambhato 'bhāvasiddher anupalabdhis tāval liṅgatvena tair iṣṭaivety āha evaṃ ca / iti
analyzed: nanu ca anayā upalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāptyā yuktasya anupalambhataḥ bhāva siddheḥ anupalabdhiḥ tāvat liṅga tvena taiḥ iṣṭā eva iti āha evam ca iti
translated: But since the non-perception of what is fit to be perceived by the attainment of the characteristic of perception is established as non-existence, they themselves accept non-perception as the logical ground. Thus, he says in this way.

analyzed: anaikāntikī iti ācakṣate te eva naiyāyikāḥ
translated: They say it is inconclusive. Those are the Naiyāyikas themselves.

original: kuto 'naikāntikīty āśaṅkya eva sthitvā āha saty api / iti /
analyzed: kutas na aikāntikī iti āśaṅkya tad mate eva sthitvā āha sati api iti
translated: Suspecting from where it is inconclusive, he says even though it exists, remaining as if doubting.

original: etad eva tanmatyaiva nidarśanenopapādayann āha nahi / iti /
analyzed: etat eva tad matyā eva nidarśanena upapādayan āha nahi iti
translated: The author of the commentary, in order to establish this very [view] by an example, says: No, etc.

analyzed: bhavanti na santi
translated: They do not exist, they are not.

analyzed: bhāṣyakāraḥ prakaraṇāt nyāya bhāṣya kāraḥ pakṣīlasvāmī
translated: The author of the Nyāyabhāṣya is Pakṣīlāsvāmī.

original: anumānata upalabdhim eva tadīyāṃ darśayitum āha indriyatvāt / iti /
analyzed: anumānataḥ upalabdhim eva tadīyām darśayitum āha indriya tvāt iti
translated: In order to show just the inference belonging to him, he says because of being a sense faculty.

original: prāpyakārī / viṣayaṃ prāpya tena saha saṃyujya tatra jñānaṃ janayatīty arthaḥ /
translated: It operates by coming into contact, the meaning is that it produces knowledge there by coming into contact with the object, by uniting with it.

original: cārthakathanam avaseyam na tu anugamānaprayoga eṣa /
analyzed: ca artha kathanam avaseyam na tu anugamāna prayogaḥ eṣa
translated: The mention of the word ca (and) should be supplied, but this is not a complete statement of the inference.

analyzed: pañca avayavasya vākyasya an upadarśanāt
translated: Because a five-membered sentence is not shown.
The statement of the non-exclusiveness of the reason, and the statement of the non-exclusiveness of the example,

original: m evopasaṃharann āha tad evam i /ti /
analyzed: eva upasaṃharan āha tat evam
translated: he concludes by saying thus, etc.

original: p / anaikāntikatvābhidhānaṃ ca teṣāṃ vaiśeṣikasūtre yathāśruti draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: anaikāntika tva abhidhānam ca teṣām vaiśeṣika sūtre yathāśruti draṣṭavyam
translated: And the statement of non-exclusiveness of those should be seen according to the literal meaning in the Vaiśeṣika sūtra,

analyzed: na tu taiḥ yathā vyākhyāyate
translated: but not as they are explained.

original: te hi rūpād ity udbhūtasamākhyātād iti viśeṣya upalabdhiṃ nivartayantīti /
analyzed: te hi rūpāt iti udbhūta samākhyātāt iti viśeṣya na ayana raśmi avayavinaḥ upalabdhim nivartayanti iti
translated: For they say that the qualification from form, etc. excludes the perception that is well-known.
In order to refute that, he says non-apprehension of what is perceptible. In order to refute the inconclusiveness of that.

analyzed: katham tad nirāsa artham iti āha
translated: How is it in order to refute that? He says apprehension.

analyzed: abhyadhāt anyatra iti sāmarthyāt
translated: He says elsewhere by implication.

original: tadupadarśanetipi yadi vyabhicārasaṃbhavaḥ kathaṃ tannirākṛtaṃ bhavatīty āha yadāhī /ti /
analyzed: tad upadarśana itipi yadi vyabhicāra saṃbhavaḥ katham tat nirākṛtam bhavati iti āha
translated: If there is a possibility of error in pointing that out, how is it refuted? He says when.

original: kuto vyabhicārāvakāśa / iti vartamānasyānupalabdhir iti ca prakaraṇāt /
analyzed: kutas vyabhicāra avakāśaḥ iti vartamānasya anupalabdhiḥ iti ca prakaraṇāt
translated: From where is there an opportunity for error? The non-apprehension of the present is from the context.

analyzed: tasyāḥ iti upalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāpta anupalabdheḥ
translated: Of that refers to the non-apprehension of what is perceptible.

original: mūle bhavanti ity eva mudritaṃ kiṃtu na bhavanti ity eva pāṭho 'nuṭīkāgataḥ sādhuḥ /
analyzed: mūle bhavanti iti eva mudritam kiṃtu na bhavanti iti eva pāṭhaḥ nu ṭīkā gataḥ sādhuḥ
translated: They exist in the root is indeed printed, but the reading they do not exist found in the subcommentary is correct.
The refutation of that.

original: nanunaiyaikair yadupalabdhilakṣaṇaprāptiśabdena mahattvādikam ucyate tasyāpy anavadyatvāt
analyzed: nanu naiyaikaiḥ yat upalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāpti śabdena mahat tva ādikam ucyate tasya api anavadya tvāt
translated: But if some say that what is called perceptibility refers to largeness etc., since that is also faultless,

original: saivopalabdhilakṣaṇaprāptir bhavatāpi kasmān nocyate kiṃ punar āhopuruṣikayānyābhidhīyata
analyzed: sā eva upalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāptiḥ bhavatā api kasmāt nā ucyate kim punar āhopuruṣikayā anyā abhidhīyata
translated: why is that very perceptibility not stated by you too? Why is it stated otherwise with arrogance?

analyzed: iti āśaṃkya āha mahat tva ādikam tu
translated: Suspecting this, he says But largeness etc.

original: tam evā āśrayābhāvadvāreṇa pratipādayitum āha nahī /ti /
analyzed: tam āśraya abhāva dvāreṇa pratipādayitum āha
translated: In order to demonstrate that very [substance] through the absence of a basis, he says: For...

analyzed: hiḥ yasmāt
translated: For means because.

analyzed: na rūpa ādi vyatiriktam dravyam sva jñāne pratibhāsate
translated: Substance is not manifested in its own cognition as separate from form, etc.

analyzed: katham na pratībhāti iti āha
translated: How is it not manifested? He says: By a different aspect.

analyzed: rūpa ādi ātmanaḥ nyena ātmanā
translated: By a nature other than the nature of form, etc.

original: kiṃ bhūteneti āha tatpratibhāse /ti tasya rūpādeḥ pratibhāsaḥ pratibhāsata iti kṛtvā svarūpam eva tasya vivekaḥ pracyutis tadvatā /
analyzed: kim bhūtena iti āha tasya rūpa ādeḥ pratibhāsaḥ pratibhāsate iti kṛtvā sva rūpam eva tasya vivekaḥ pracyutiḥ tadvatā
translated: In what does it consist? He says: By the appearance of that. The appearance of that form, etc. is considered to be its own appearance. The distinction of that is the exclusion of that which possesses it.

analyzed: tad bhāva vyavahāra sādhakaḥ darśitaḥ
translated: The means of establishing the usage of its existence is shown.

original: paghaṭapratibhāsane 'pi paṭapratibhāsavyavasthā syād ity atiprasaṅga /s tasmāt /
analyzed: paghaṭa pratibhāsane pi paṭa pratibhāsa vyavasthā syāt iti tasmāt
translated: Even in the appearance of a pot, there would be the establishment of the appearance of a cloth, due to excessive extension. Therefore,

original: idānīṃ dravyam abhyupagamya mahattvādeḥ tadupalambhakatvam apākartṛkāma āha na ce /ti /
analyzed: idānīm dravyam abhyupagamya mahat tva ādeḥ tad upalambhaka tvam apākartṛ kāmaḥ āha na
translated: now, accepting substance, in order to refute the perceptibility of largeness, etc., he says: And even...

analyzed: tad sambandhe api mahat tva saṃbandhe api
translated: Even in the connection with that, even in the connection with largeness,

original: svahetusamudbhūte 'pi tatrāmahati dravyātmani tasyākiñcitkaratvād iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: sva hetu samudbhūte tatra amahati dravya ātmani tasya akiñcitkara tvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: even in the arising from its own cause, in that small substance-self, it is not doing anything, that is the idea.

original: svarūpeṇa mahatas tu kim mahattvena tadbuddher api tata evotpatter iti cābhipretya na ca svarūpeṇāmahata / iti /
analyzed: sva rūpeṇa mahataḥ tu kim mahat tvena tad buddheḥ api tatas eva utpatteḥ iti ca abhipretya na ca sva rūpeṇa amahataḥ iti
translated: But what is the greatness of the great one by its own nature? Because that cognition also arises from that itself. Thinking this, he says, And it is not great by its own nature.

original: ekasminn eva pakṣe sa doṣo darśito 'neneti draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: ekasmin eva pakṣe sa doṣaḥ darśitaḥ nena iti draṣṭavyam
translated: It should be seen that this fault is shown in this [verse] in the case of only one [of the two alternatives].

original: atha tatsaṃbandhe mā bhūd asya svato mahattā kiṃ naś chinnam arthāntarabhūtamahattvarūpeṇāsya grahaṇaṃ bhaviṣyatīty āha / pararūpeṇeti
analyzed: atha tad saṃbandhe mā bhūt asya svatas mahat tā kim naḥ chinnam artha antara bhūta mahā tva rūpeṇa asya grahaṇam bhaviṣyati iti āha  /
translated: Now, if it is not great by itself in relation to that [greatness], what is the harm to us? It will be grasped by means of greatness which is a different entity. He says, By the form of another.

analyzed: parasya tatas nyasya mahat tvasya rūpeṇa
translated: By the form of greatness which is different from that.

analyzed: katham abhrāntam bhrāntam eva
translated: Unmistaken. It is mistaken itself.

analyzed: a tasmin tad graha rūpa tvāt bhrānteḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is mistaken because it has the form of grasping what is not that.

analyzed: upalambhayati iti upalaṃbhakam
translated: That which causes the apprehension is the apprehender.

analyzed: etat ca mahat tvam upetya uktam dūṣaṇam
translated: And this fault is stated having accepted that greatness.

original: na tu ca mahatvātva🔽n nāma kiñcit na cātra satat
analyzed: na tu ca  n nāma kiñcid na ca atra satat
translated: But not because of greatness.

analyzed: kasyācid upalaṃbhakam nāma iti api vaktavyam
translated: And it should also be said that there is no such thing as the apprehender of anything here.

analyzed: rūpam vā dravyasya upalambhakam iti vartate
translated: The form of the substance is the apprehender, it continues.

analyzed: kutas tasya anupalambhaka tvam iti āha
translated: How is it that it is not the apprehender? He says, Of that also.

original: tasya na tathā grāhakatvam i /ti sambandhanīyam /🔽grāhayatīti p / grāhakaṃ tasya bhāvas tattvam iti cārtho draṣtavyaḥ /
analyzed: tasya na tathā grāhaka tvam sambandhanīyam  grāhayati iti p grāhakam tasya bhāvaḥ tattvam iti ca arthaḥ draṣtavyaḥ
translated: The meaning is: It is not like that in the case of the apprehender.🔽The meaning should be seen as: The state of that is its reality.

analyzed: api nyāyataḥ saṃbhāvanām āha  tulya upaka tvam papattim
translated: He states the possibility according to reasoning.

analyzed: vā samuccinnoti
translated: Or he includes the establishment of equal dependence.

original: pareṇākāṃkṣitahetuṃ darśayitum āha svarūpeṇe /ti /🔽svarūpeṇa prātisvikena ātmanā grahaṇe saty anyasyopalabdhau tasyeti pratyāsatteḥ /
analyzed: pareṇa ākāṃkṣita hetum darśayitum āha  sva rūpeṇa prātisvikena ātmanā grahaṇe sati anyasya upalabdhau tasya iti pratyāsatteḥ
translated: In order to show the reason desired by the opponent, he says by its own nature.🔽When there is apprehension by its own individual self, in the perception of another, it is due to the proximity of that.

analyzed: na anyasya a parokṣībhāvaḥ iti dravya ātmanaḥ tyanta parokṣa tvāt
translated: The manifestation of another is not otherwise. Because the self of substance is absolutely imperceptible.

original: ayam asyāśayo rūpaṃ hi gṛhyamāṇam evopalambhakaṃ yuktaṃ / nānyathā /
analyzed: ayam asya āśayaḥ rūpam hi gṛhyamāṇam evā upalambhakam yuktam na anyathā
translated: This is his intention: For form, when being apprehended, is rightly the apprehender, not otherwise.

original: na tac ca dravyarūpeṇa gṛhyate tadgrāhiṇo jñānasya bhrāntatvaprasaṃgāt /
analyzed: na tat ca dravya rūpeṇa gṛhyate tad grāhiṇaḥ jñānasya bhrānta tva prasaṃgāt
translated: And that is not apprehended by the form of substance, because the cognition apprehending that would be erroneous.

analyzed: tatas katham dravyasya upalaṃbhaḥ iti
translated: So how is there the perception of substance?

original: tathāpy asya tathātvam upagacchāmo yadi tato bhedena tatpratibhāsaḥ na caitad astīti pratipādayann āha dravyarūpasye /ti /
analyzed: tathā api asya tathātvam upagacchāmaḥ yadi tatas bhedena tad pratibhāsaḥ syāt na ca etat asti iti pratipādayan āha
translated: Even so, we accept its suchness if there is its appearance as different from that. But this is not so. In order to demonstrate this, he says of the form of substance.

analyzed: dravya rūpasya dravya svarūpasya
translated: Of the substance-form, of the nature of a substance.

analyzed: tad vivekena rūpa svabhāva vivekena anupalakṣaṇāt anupalabdheḥ
translated: Because of the non-apprehension by the discrimination of that, by the discrimination of the nature of form.

original: etac ca dūṣaṇaṃ mahattvepy upalaṃbhe draṣtavyam /
analyzed: etat ca dūṣaṇam mahat tve api upalaṃbhe draṣtavyam
translated: And this fault should be seen even in the apprehension of largeness.

original: atraiva vaktavyāntaraṃ samuccinvann āha na ce /ti /
analyzed: atra eva vaktavya antaram samuccinvan āha na
translated: Here itself, including another statement, he says 'and not'.

original: hetum āha yata / iti /🔽pratilabdhātmakam evotpannam eva sat /
analyzed: hetum āha yatas iti  pratilabdha ātmakam eva utpannam eva sat
translated: He states the reason 'because'.🔽Having obtained its own nature, being produced, existing,

analyzed: tathātām samavāyi kāraṇa tām
translated: that state, the state of being an inherent cause,

original: nirguṇam api dvitīye kṣaṇe saguṇaṃ bhaviṣyatīty āha na ce /ti /
analyzed: nirguṇam api dvitīye kṣaṇe sa guṇam bhaviṣyati iti āha na
translated: even though it is without qualities, it will become with qualities in the second moment. Therefore he says 'and not'.

analyzed: dravyasya  prāktana rūpa yoge api pūrva svarūpa nāśaḥ kṣaṇika tvāt asya iti āśayaḥ
translated: Of its own substance.🔽Even though it is connected with the previous form, the destruction of the previous nature is due to its non-momentariness. This is the intention.

analyzed: yatas pūrva rūpa nāśa rūpa antara āvirbhāvāt
translated: Because, due to the destruction of the previous form and the manifestation of another form,

analyzed: apara rūpeṇa s
translated: with another form,

analyzed: asya s
translated: of this,

original: nanu ca pūrvarūpanāśe tasyaiva nāśād rūpāntarāvirbhāve cānyasyaiva bhāvāt kathaṃ
analyzed: nanu ca pūrva rūpa nāśe tasya eva nāśāt rūpa antara āvirbhāve ca anyasya eva bhāvāt katham
translated: How is it that when the previous form is destroyed, it is destroyed, and when another form manifests, it exists?

original: yad eva mahattvādikaṃ prati prāgapratipannādhārabhāvaṃ tad evādhā yāyād
analyzed: yat eva mahat tva ādikam prati prāk apratipanna ādhāra bhāvam tat yāyāt
translated: If it is argued that the very largeness, etc., which previously did not have the nature of a substratum, would become the substratum,

original: iti ced ayam aparo 'stu doṣo 'syety abhiprāyād adoṣa eṣaḥ /
analyzed: iti ced ayam aparaḥ stu doṣaḥ sya iti abhiprāyāt adoṣaḥ eṣaḥ
translated: if this is thought to be another fault of this, it is not a fault.

original: ihāpi mahattvādikaṃ prati dravyam ādhāro nopapadyata iti darśayann āha na ce /ti /
analyzed: iha api mahat tva ādikam prati dravyam ādhāraḥ na upapadyate iti darśayan āha na
translated: Here also, he shows that a substance cannot be a substratum for largeness, etc. He says: And it is not so.

analyzed: prajanakasya api tathātve tiprasaṃgāt
translated: Because if the producer were also like that, there would be an overextension.

analyzed: sthāpaka tva ādinā prakāra antareṇa ādhāra bhāvasya anyatra niṣiddha tvāt ca iti bhāvaḥ
translated: And because the state of being a substratum in another way, such as by being a supporter, is denied elsewhere. This is the idea.

analyzed: artha akriyā virodhāt anupapatteḥ
translated: Because the performance of a function is incompatible with the non-performance of a function.

original: yathā cākṣaṇikaḥ krameṇākrameṇa vārthakriyām upakalpayituṃ na kalpyate tathoditaṃ purastāt /
analyzed: yathā ca akṣaṇikaḥ krameṇa akrameṇa vā arthakriyām upakalpayitum na kalpyate tathā uditam purastāt
translated: And just as the non-momentary is not considered to perform a function either successively or non-successively, that has been stated earlier.

original: samavāyikāraṇasyeti prakaraṇāt mahattvādikaṃ prati samavāyikāraṇasyāsyopalambhasya dravyasyety artho 'vaseyaḥ /
analyzed: samavāyi kāraṇasya iti prakaraṇāt mahat tva ādikam prati samavāyi kāraṇasya asya upalambhasya dravyasya iti arthaḥ vaseyaḥ
translated: Of the inherent cause, from the context, the meaning should be understood as of this substance, the apprehension, which is the inherent cause for largeness, etc.

original: syād etad yadi nāmānantaroditayā nītyā taṃ prati tasyādhārabhāvo nopapadyate tathāpi tadanādhāra eva tatsamavayikāraṇaṃ kiṃ na bhavatīty āha
analyzed: syāt etat yadi nāma anantara uditayā nītyā tam prati tasya ādhāra bhāvaḥ na upapadyate tathā api tad anādhāraḥ eva tad samavayi kāraṇam kim na bhavati iti āha
translated: This might be said: Even if, by the method just stated, its state of being a substratum for that is not possible, why should that inherent cause not be without a substratum? He says:

analyzed: yatas iti  sva utkalitam sva āśritam sva ārūḍham iti yāvat
translated: Because...🔽Relying on itself means mounted on itself.

analyzed: janayatu tarhi sva utkalitam kāryam
translated: Let it then produce its effect, which is dependent on itself.

original: yatas tathā vyapadeśam aśnata ity āha na ce /ti /
analyzed: yatas tathā vyapadeśam aśnataḥ iti āha na
translated: Because it is designated as such, he says not so.

analyzed: etat iti sva utkalita kārya jananam
translated: This means producing its own effect.

original: ayam asyāśayo labdhātmasattvenaiva hi tathā janayitavyaṃ na tv āgṛhītamahattvādirūpeṇa
analyzed: ayam asya āśayaḥ labdha ātma sattvena eva hi tathā janayitavyam na tu āgṛhīta mahat tva ādi rūpeṇa
translated: His intention is that it should be produced as such only by obtaining its own nature, not by grasping a form with magnitude, etc.

analyzed: tena utpattavyam saha bhuvoḥ kṣaṇika tayā
translated: Therefore, it should arise. Because co-existent things are momentary,

original: tu dvitīyekṣaṇe 'sattvāt na svotkalitakāryajananam iti paścād ādhāra bhāvo
analyzed: tu dvitīya īkṣaṇe sattvāt na sva utkalita kārya jananam iti paścāt
translated: in the second moment, since it does not exist, it does not produce its own effect. Thus, later it is the basis.

analyzed: na ca iti anuvartate
translated: Not so is continued.

analyzed: sva hetu āgatasya tad ādhāra rūpasya avināśāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that because the form that is the basis of that, which has come from its own cause, is not destroyed.

analyzed: ādhāra abhāvaḥ s
translated: The absence of a basis is

original: p / tadabhāvepi katham asaṃbhavīty āha yasmād i /ti /
analyzed: tad abhāve api katham asaṃbhavi iti āha yasmāt
translated: in the absence of that, how is it impossible? He says because.

analyzed: evam aneka dravyavat iti vyapadiśyate
translated: Thus, it is designated as having many substances.

original: dravyābhāvaś ca na hi ityādinā anantaram evopapāditaḥ /
analyzed: dravya abhāvaḥ ca na hi ityādinā anantaram eva upapāditaḥ
translated: And the absence of substance is explained immediately after with not so, etc.

analyzed: tayā upalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāptyā upalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāptasya iti tathābhūta upalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāptimataḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: By the attainment of the characteristic of perception of those two. The meaning is that it has the attainment of the characteristic of perception of that kind.

analyzed: hetau śāstra kāraḥ
translated: Thus is in the sense of cause. The author of the treatise is the author of the commentary, due to the context.

analyzed: abhāva śabdena abhāvaḥ abhāva vyavahāraḥ ca abhipretyata
translated: The word 'non-existence' is intended to refer to both non-existence and the usage of non-existence.

analyzed: iti abhiprāyeṇa āha abhāva vyavahāra hetuḥ
translated: With this intention, he says 'and the cause of the usage of non-existence'.

original: yā tv i /tyādi bruvataś cāyam abhiprāyo yadi vyāpakādyanupalabdhyabhiprāyeṇābhāvavyavahārayetur🔽veti vaktum adhyavasyāha naitad rūpāt abhāvaśabdenāpy abhāvavyavahārasya viṣayeṇa🔽viṣayiṇo nirdeśasambhavena vaktuṃ śakyatvāt bruvan viśiṣṭām evānupalabdhim abipraitīti
analyzed: yā tu bruvataḥ ca ayam abhiprāyaḥ yadi vyāpaka ādi anupalabdhi abhiprāyeṇa abhāva vyavahāra yetuḥ  vā iti vaktum adhyavasya āha na etat rūpāt abhāva śabdena api abhāva vyavahārasya viṣayeṇa  viṣayiṇaḥ nirdeśa sambhavena vaktum śakya tvāt bruvan viśiṣṭām eva anupalabdhim abipraiti iti
translated: And the intention of one who says 'but this' and so on is as follows: If one intends to use the usage of non-existence by the non-apprehension of the pervader, etc.,🔽in order to state that, he says 'this is not so'. Because it is possible to indicate by the word 'non-existence' both the object and the subject of the usage of non-existence,🔽by saying that, he intends a specific non-apprehension.

original: upalabdhilakṣaṇaprāptānupalabdher vyāpāram imaṃ kathayatā ca vārtikakṛtā sāmarthyād
analyzed: upalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāpta anupalabdheḥ vyāpāram imam kathayatā ca vārtika kṛtā sāmarthyāt
translated: And by the author of the Vārtika, who says this about the operation of the non-apprehension of what is perceptible, by implication,

original: yad atropadarśitaṃ anyatra tu sākṣād abhihitam tad api darśayann āha yā tv anupalabdhī /tyādi
analyzed: yat atra upadarśitam anyatra tu sākṣāt abhihitam tat api darśayan āha yā tu
translated: what is shown here, but is stated explicitly elsewhere, is also shown by saying 'but this' and so on.

analyzed: sat vyavahāra pratiṣedha hetuḥ iti avagantavyam
translated: It should be understood that it is the cause of the negation of the usage of the existent.

original: kutaḥ punas tad anyavastuvijñānam evecchantīti jñāyata ity apekṣāyāṃ yojyam vijñānaṃ vānyavastunīti vacanād i /ti /
analyzed: kutas punar tat anya vastu vijñānam eva icchanti iti jñāyate iti apekṣāyām yojyam vijñānam vā anya vastuni iti vacanāt
translated: But how is it known that they desire that very consciousness of another thing? When this is expected, it is connected with the statement or consciousness of another thing.

original: yadā kartṛsthatayā / ity arthaḥ /🔽nanu bhavanmate kim upadhīm upalabdhā🔽kaścid ātmāsti /
analyzed: nanu bhavat mate kim upadhīm upalabdhā  kaścid ātmā asti
translated: When it is in the form of an agent, this is the meaning.🔽But in your view, is there any self that is perceived as the instrument of perception?

original: yenaivam ucyate ity āha upalabhamānaś ce /ti /
analyzed: yena evam ucyate iti āha upalabhamānaḥ
translated: By whom is this said? He says: And the perceiver...

original: co vyaktam etad ity asminn arthe yasmād arthe vā /
analyzed: caḥ vyaktam etat iti asmin arthe yasmāt arthe vā
translated: Cha is for clarity, or because of the reason.

original: atraivāhaṃkārasyopapatter iti bhāvaḥ /🔽nanu upalabdhikriyāyāḥ kartā upalabhamāna ucyate /
analyzed: atra eva ahaṃkārasya upapatteḥ iti bhāvaḥ  nanu upalabdhi kriyāyāḥ kartā upalabhamānaḥ ucyate
translated: The meaning is that the occurrence of egoism is established here.🔽But is the agent of the action of perception called the perceiver?

original: tat kim upalabdhijanakas tathāvidhaupalabhamāna ucyata ity āśaṃkyāha tathāhī /ti /
analyzed: tat kim upalabdhi janakaḥ tathāvidha aupalabhamānaḥ ucyate iti āśaṃkya āha
translated: Then, is one who generates perception called such a perceiver? Suspecting this, he says Thus...

analyzed: kāmam evam ucacya
translated: Let it be said thus,

original: tām kathaṃ tattvam ity āha na ce /ti /
analyzed: tām katham tattvam iti āha na
translated: but how is it true? He says But...

analyzed: ātmanaḥ
translated: Of another means of the self.

original: janakatvam iti prakaraṇāt upalabdhijanakatvam ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: janaka tvam iti prakaraṇāt upalabdhi janaka tvam iti arthaḥ
translated: Causing means, from the context, causing the arising of perception. This is the meaning.

analyzed: ātmanaḥ ātma ākhyasya nitya dravyasya
translated: Of the self means of the eternal substance called the self.

analyzed: tad utpattau upalabdhi utpattau hetūnām
translated: In the arising of that, in the arising of perception, the causes are the instruments.

original: sthitiḥ iyanta eva hetava iti vyavasthābhāvaḥ /
analyzed: sthitiḥ iyantaḥ eva hetavaḥ iti vyavasthā bhāvaḥ
translated: The establishment is that these are the only causes.

original: hetvanavasthitau ca kāryārthino niyatakāraṇopādānaṃ na syād iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: hetu anavasthitau ca kārya arthinaḥ niyata kāraṇa upādānam na syāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: And in the non-establishment of causes, one seeking an effect would not take up a definite cause, this is the idea.

original: āśrayatvāt tarhy asau kartā āha āśrayatvam apī /ti /
analyzed: āśraya tvāt tarhi asau kartā bhaviṣyati iti āha āśraya tvam
translated: But then it is the supporter, so it is the agent. He says: The state of being a supporter is also.

analyzed: tasya nityasya ātmanaḥ janaka tva anupapatteḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that it is not possible for it to be the producer.

original: kṣaṇikatve utpattikṣaṇamātrasattve sati sthiter upādātirekiṇyā abhāvāt / /
analyzed: kṣaṇika tve utpatti kṣaṇa mātra sattve sati sthiteḥ upādā atirekiṇyāḥ abhāvāt
translated: In the case of momentariness, i.e., in the case of existence for just the moment of arising, there is no duration apart from the cause.

original: na pātābhāvas tasyāḥ / patanasyaivāsaṃbhavād iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: na pāta abhāvaḥ tasyāḥ patanasya eva asaṃbhavāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that there is no absence of falling for it, because falling itself is impossible.

original: kuto na patanaṃ tasyā yato na pātābhāvaḥ sthitir ity āha tasyāḥ / iti /
analyzed: kutas na patanam tasyāḥ yatas na pāta abhāvaḥ sthitiḥ iti āha tasyāḥ iti
translated: From what is there no falling for it, from which absence of falling there is duration? He says: Of that.

analyzed: tasyāḥ upalabdheḥ guru tva abhāvāt
translated: Of that apprehension, because it has no heaviness.

original: tadabhāvaś ca buddher guṇarūpatve nirguṇatvāt /🔽nirguṇatvañ ca guṇānāṃ aguṇatvaṃ dravyāśritatvaṃ ceti vacanāt /
analyzed: tad abhāvaḥ ca buddheḥ guṇa rūpa tve nirguṇa tvāt  nirguṇa tvam ca guṇānām aguṇa tvam dravya āśrita tvam ca iti vacanāt
translated: And that absence is because of the absence of heaviness, because of the absence of the form of a quality in cognition.🔽And the absence of qualities is the absence of non-qualities and the dependence on substance, according to the statement.

original: gurutvaṃ ca guṇaḥ gurutvaṃ jalabhūmyoḥ patanakāraṇam iti vacanāc ca gurutvābhāvaḥ /
analyzed: guru tvam ca guṇaḥ guru tvam jala bhūmyoḥ patana kāraṇam iti vacanāt ca guru tva abhāvaḥ
translated: And heaviness is a quality, and because of the statement that heaviness is the cause of falling in water and on the ground, there is the absence of heaviness.

original: mā bhūd gurutvaṃ tasyāḥ patanaṃ tu kiṃ na bhavatīty āha saṃyogābhāva / iti /
analyzed: mā bhūt guru tvam tasyāḥ patanam tu kim na bhavati iti āha       iti
translated: Let there not be heaviness in it, but why is there not falling? He says: due to the absence of conjunction.

original: yadi gurutvād eva patanaṃ bhavet na śākhādau phalānyavatiṣṭheteti saṃyogābhāve satīty uktam saṃyogābhāve / śākhāvṛntādisaṃyogābhāve🔽saṃyogābhāvena S /
analyzed: yadi guru tvāt eva patanam bhavet na tarhi śākhā ādau phalāni avatiṣṭheta iti saṃyoga abhāve sati iti uktam saṃyoga abhāve śākhā vṛnta ādi saṃyoga abhāve  saṃyoga abhāvena
translated: If falling would occur only due to heaviness, then fruits would not remain on branches etc. Therefore, it is said: in the absence of conjunction, in the absence of conjunction with branches, stems etc.🔽The absence of conjunction is made by the absence of conjunction.

original: kṛtāntaḥ / siddhāntaḥ samavāyāt upalabdhes tatra samavāyād ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: kṛtāntaḥ siddhāntaḥ samavāyāt upalabdheḥ tatra samavāyāt iti arthaḥ
translated: The conclusion is from inherence. The meaning is: from inherence there is apprehension there.

analyzed: saḥ pi samavāyaḥ pi
translated: That also, inherence also.

analyzed: kārya kāraṇāṇa
translated: The relation of cause and effect

original: bhāvaviśeṣaḥ ādhāryādhārabhāvaḥ sa cātmano nityasya sa saṃbhavatīti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: bhāva viśeṣaḥ ādhārya ādhāra bhāvaḥ sa ca ātmanaḥ nityasya sa saṃbhavati iti bhāvaḥ
translated: is the relation of the supported and the supporter, and that is possible for the self, which is eternal. This is the meaning.

original: yady apy na pātaḥ sambhavī tathāpy asau kim ādhāro na bhavatīty āśaṅkya pūrvasmin pakṣa eva prativacanaṃ darśayati /
analyzed: yadi api na pātaḥ sambhavī tathā api asau kim ādhāraḥ na bhavati iti āśaṅkya pūrvasmin pakṣe eva prativacanam darśayati
translated: Even though falling is not possible, still the doubt arises: is it not the supporter? Anticipating this, he shows the reply in the previous view itself.

analyzed: na ca a patana dharmikāyāḥ iti
translated: And it is not for that which is not subject to falling.

original: apatanadharmakatvaṃ ca tasyā gurutvābhāvād anantaram eva pratipāditam /
analyzed: apatana dharmaka tvam ca tasyāḥ guru tva abhāvāt anantaram eva pratipāditam
translated: And the non-subjectness to falling is established immediately after due to the absence of heaviness in it.

original: anenaitad darśayati patanadharmaṇo jalādeḥ pātapratibandhakaḥ kaścid ādhāro bhavatu yāvad tatrāpi kaścit ko 'yaṃ pratibandho nāmeti
analyzed: anena etat darśayati patana dharmaṇaḥ jala ādeḥ pāta pratibandhakaḥ kaścid ādhāraḥ bhavatu yāvat tatra api kaścid kaḥ yam pratibandhaḥ nāma iti
translated: By this he shows: Let there be some support for water etc., which have the property of falling, to prevent their falling. But even there, what is this so-called obstruction?

analyzed: na paryanuyuñjīta
translated: One should not inquire further.

original: na tv apatanadharmaṇa iti tad āhaprāmāṇikacakracūḍāmaṇiḥ
analyzed: na tu a patana dharmaṇaḥ iti tat āha prāmāṇika cakra cūḍāmaṇiḥ
translated: But not for those which do not have the property of falling. Thus says the authoritative crest-jewel of the Cakravartins

analyzed: syāt ādhāraḥ jala ādīnām gamana pratibandhataḥ
translated: There may be a support for water etc. due to the obstruction of motion.

analyzed: agatīnām kim ādhāraḥ guṇa sāmānya karmaṇām
translated: But what is the support for those which do not move, for qualities, universals and actions?

analyzed: pramāṇavāḥ iti
translated: The authoritative one says.

analyzed: anyasya api
translated: Of another, even of the self.

analyzed: tad bhāva prasaṅgaḥ tad ādhāra tva prasaṅgaḥ
translated: The consequence of that state, the consequence of being its support.

analyzed: kutas etat iti
translated: From where does this come? Of that.

analyzed: tasya samavāyasya
translated: Of that inherence.

analyzed: samāna tvāt eka tvāt
translated: Because of sameness, because of oneness.

analyzed: atas eva āha eka tvena iti
translated: For this very reason he says by oneness.

original: asya / samavāyasya /🔽prakaraṇe / ciṃtāyāṃ prastāve iti yāvat /
analyzed: asya samavāyasya  prakaraṇe ciṃtāyām prastāve iti yāvat
translated: Of this. Of inherence.🔽In the context. In the consideration, in the discussion, is what is meant.

analyzed: vivakṣitāt śāstra vihitāt
translated: From the intended. From what is prescribed by the treatise.

analyzed: bhakṣyāt bhakṣaṇa arhāt
translated: From the edible. From what is fit to be eaten.
The village cock is different, as it is different from that, from the Brahmin and others.

analyzed: bhakṣyaḥ pi sanna bhakṣyaḥ ucyate iti sambandhanīyam
translated: Even though it is edible, it is said to be inedible. This should be connected.

original: anekena 'rthaḥ sujñāto bhavatīty nidarśanāntaram āha yathā ca / iti /
analyzed: anekena rthaḥ su jñātaḥ bhavati iti nidarśana antaram āha yathā ca iti
translated: The author states another example: Just as, in order to make the meaning of many words well-known.

analyzed: adhikāre prastāve
translated: In the context, in the discussion.

original: tadvad / upadarśitadvayavad viśiṣṭa / uttarapadārthābhāvaviśiṣṭe arthe / tatsadṛśa iti yāvat /
analyzed: tadvat upadarśita dvaya vat viśiṣṭaḥ uttara padārtha abhāva viśiṣṭe arthe tad sadṛśaḥ iti yāvat
translated: In the same way, like what has been shown to be twofold, in a qualified meaning, qualified by the absence of the meaning of the latter word, it is similar to that, that is the extent.

original: tayā naño bhāvaviṣayatā / iti p / yojyam /
analyzed: tayā nañaḥ bhāva viṣaya tā iti p yojyam
translated: The meaning of the negative is the mere negation of the manifestation of the object of existence, this should be connected.

analyzed: tayā iti ittham bhūta lakṣanā ca iyam tṛtīyā pratyeyā
translated: By that, this instrumental should be understood as the characteristic of that which is in such a state.

analyzed: bhāva viṣaya bhāna pratiṣedha mātra viṣaya tā iti arthāt
translated: The object of the manifestation of the mere negation of the object of existence is understood.

original: kiṃbhūtasya naña apekṣāyāṃ yojyam āgṛhīte /ti /🔽tathā vidhisāmānayena samantāt svīkṛṛtottarapadārthapratiṣedhasya kathaṃ punar etat
analyzed: kiṃbhūtasya nañaḥ iti apekṣāyām yojyam  tathā vidhi sāmānayena samantāt svīkṛṛta uttara padārtha pratiṣedhasya katham punar etat
translated: When there is a requirement of what kind of negative, it should be connected as apprehended.

original: jñātavyam ity atrāyaṃ na / / /ttarapadārthapratiṣedhamātravṛttiḥ prasahyavṛttir atra
analyzed: jñātavyam iti atra ayam na ttara padārtha pratiṣedha mātra vṛttiḥ prasahya vṛttiḥ atra
translated: How is this to be known? Here, this is not the case. The mere negation of the meaning of the latter word is the dominant function here.

original: tu uttarapadārthābhāvaviśiṣṭasadṛśavastuvṛttiḥ paryudāsavṛttiḥ ity āśaṅkāyām āha yatra / iti /
analyzed: tu uttara padārtha abhāva viśiṣṭa sadṛśa vastu vṛttiḥ paryudāsa vṛttiḥ iti āśaṅkāyām āha yatra iti
translated: But in this case, the function of exclusion is the function of a thing similar to that qualified by the absence of the meaning of the latter word. When there is doubt about this, the author says where.

original: yatraivam evaṃ tatra paryudāsavṛttitā / iti sambandhaḥ /
analyzed: yatra evam evam tatra paryudāsa vṛtti tā iti sambandhaḥ
translated: Where it is so, there is the function of exclusion, this is the connection.

original: vidheḥ a /bhidheyatayā bhāvarūpaṃ pratipādyata ity arthaḥ /🔽pratiṣedhaḥ / tathābhūtottarapadārthaniṣedhaḥ arthagṛhītaḥ sadṛśavastuvidhānasāmarthyākṣiptaḥ
analyzed: vidheḥ bhāva rūpam pratipādyate iti arthaḥ  pratiṣedhaḥ tathābhūta uttara padārtha niṣedhaḥ artha gṛhītaḥ sadṛśa vastu vidhāna sāmarthya ākṣiptaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the form of existence is taught as the object of the injunction.🔽The prohibition is the negation of the meaning of the subsequent word in that way, implied by the capability of the injunction of a similar thing.

original: vidhibhāgvidhe /r yo 'rthaḥ kṣatriyādiḥ svapadenātmavācakena nocyate paryudāsam
analyzed: yaḥ rthaḥ kṣatriya ādiḥ sva padena ātma vācakena na ucyate paryudāsam
translated: The part of the injunction is the injunction. The meaning of the injunction is the kṣatriya and so on, which is not stated by its own word expressing itself, by the exclusion

original: arthapratipādake vākye iti boddhavyam na tu samāsanimitte anvākhyānavākya iti nityasamāsatvād
analyzed: artha pratipādake vākye iti boddhavyam na tu samāsa nimitte anvākhyāna vākye iti nitya samāsa tvāt
translated: It should be understood that in a sentence expressing meaning, not in a nominal compound sentence, because of the impossibility of this due to its being a permanent compound.

original: asya tadasaṃbhavāt rajñāḥ puruṣamānaya ityādivat kṣatriyānayane vivakṣite
analyzed: asya tad asaṃbhavāt itarathā puruṣam ānaya ityādi vat kṣatriya ānayane vivakṣite
translated: Just as in bring the man of the king, when the bringing of the kṣatriya is intended,

analyzed: na brāhmaṇam ānaya ityādiḥ api prayogaḥ prasajyeta
translated: The usage bring the brāhmaṇa and so on would also not be appropriate.

original: yat tu na brāhmaṇo 'brāhmaṇa ity ucyate tad brāhmaṇo na bhavati prasajyapratiṣedhena mātrayā arthaḥ kathyate /🔽paryudāse prasajyapratiṣedhopy astīti kṛtvā /
analyzed: yat tu na brāhmaṇaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ iti ucyate tat brāhmaṇaḥ na bhavati prasajya pratiṣedhena mātrayā arthaḥ kathyate  paryudāse prasajya pratiṣedhaḥ api asti iti kṛtvā
translated: But when it is said the brāhmaṇa is not a non-brāhmaṇa, the meaning is stated by the negation of the brāhmaṇa by the negation of the brāhmaṇa.🔽Because there is also a negation of the brāhmaṇa by the exclusion.

analyzed: na punar samāsa artham anvākhāna vākyam tat
translated: And again, it is not a nominal compound sentence.

analyzed: kumbham karoti iti kumbhakāraḥ kumbhasya samīpam
translated: He who makes a pot is a potter, because of the proximity of the pot.

analyzed: upakuṃbham ityādi vat iti
translated: Like in the case of 'up to the pot'.

original: yadi svapadena nocyate kathaṃ nāmāsav ucyeta iti cet /
analyzed: yadi sva padena nā ucyate katham nāma asau ucyeta iti ced
translated: If it is not stated by its own word, how is it stated at all?

analyzed: anya śabdena iti brūmaḥ
translated: We say by another word.

original: anyaśabdasyaiva tatra prayogāt ekavākyatā ca tathārthakathane vākye nañarthavācakasyānyaśabdasya suvantenaia padāntareṇābhisambandhāt /
analyzed: anya śabdasya eva tatra prayogāt ekavākya tā ca tathā artha kathane vākye nañ artha vācakasya anya śabdasya pada antareṇa abhisambandhāt
translated: Because only another word is used there, and there is syntactical unity in the statement of that meaning in that sentence, because the word expressing the meaning of negation is connected with another word ending in 'su'.

original: etad sāmānyopadarśitaṃ lakṣaṇaṃ prakṛte yojayann āha vidhiś ce /ti /
analyzed: etat eva sāmānya upadarśitam lakṣaṇam prakṛte yojayan āha  /
translated: Applying this characteristic shown by the general statement to the present case, he says 'and the injunction'.

analyzed: vākyena tathāvidhena iti draṣṭavyam
translated: By the sentence. It should be understood as of that kind.
