original: p / sa tathā tasya yadupalambha upalabhyopalabhamānadharmaḥ sa ātmā yasya / tasmāt /
analyzed: sa tathā tasya yad upalambhaḥ upalabhya upalabhamāna dharmaḥ saḥ ātmā yasya tasmāt
translated: that is so. The nature of that which has the quality of being apprehended by the apprehender is its self. From that.

analyzed: caḥ vyaktam etat iti asya arthe
translated: Cha (and) has the meaning of vyaktam (clearly).

analyzed: yat vā upalambha śabdena jñāna mātrasya abhidhānam
translated: Or, by the word apprehension (upalabdhi), mere knowledge (jñāna-mātra) is indicated.

original: tena tu iti samuccīyate ity evaṃrūpād anupalambhāt /
analyzed: tena tu iti samuccīyate iti evaṃrūpāt anupalambhāt
translated: By that, tu (but) is combined. From such a non-apprehension as this.

original: anyathā vyākhyāne tūpalabdhilakṣaṇaprāptasyety asaṅgataṃ syād iti /
analyzed: anyathā vyākhyāne tu upalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāptasya iti asaṅgatam syāt iti
translated: If it is explained otherwise, of what is fit to be apprehended by the means of valid knowledge would be irrelevant.

original: na tu sāmānyena / anupalambhamātrād ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: na tu sāmānyena anupalambha mātrāt iti arthaḥ
translated: But not in general. The meaning is: from mere non-apprehension.

original: kim evaṃvādino 'pi sambhavati yenaivam ucyata ity āha yathāhuḥ para / iti /
analyzed: kim evaṃvādinaḥ u pi sambhavati yena evam ucyate iti āha yathā āhuḥ pare iti
translated: How is it possible for one who speaks thus to say so? He says: As others say.

original: vastusattāvabodhāryaṃ / yatra vasturūpeṇa pramāṇapañcakaṃ jāyate tatreti / yojyam /
analyzed: na jāyate tatra iti
translated: The object's existence should be understood as the object. Where the five means of valid knowledge arise in the form of an object, that should be connected.

original: pañcāvayavā yasyeti pañcakam /🔽saṃkhyāyātisadattāyā kan ity anena kan /
analyzed: pañca avayavāḥ yasya iti pañcakam  saṃkhyā yāti sadattāyā kan iti anena kan
translated: That which has five parts is the fivefold.🔽The kṛt suffix is added to the number five, which has the sense of existence, by this [rule].

original: pramāṇaṃ ca tat pañcakaṃ ceti paścāt karmadhārayaḥ kāryaḥ pramāṇapañcakaṃ / na jāyata iti ca pañcānāṃ pramāṇānāṃ madhye yatraikam api 🔽na jāyata ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: pramāṇam ca tat pañcakam ca iti paścāt karmadhārayaḥ kāryaḥ pramāṇa pañcakam na jāyate iti ca pañcānām pramāṇānām madhye yatra ekam api  na jāyate iti arthaḥ
translated: And that is a means of valid knowledge, and it is fivefold, so the compound should be made as a tatpuruṣa with the first member in the locative case. The five means of valid knowledge do not arise. The meaning is that among the five means of valid knowledge, not even one arises.

original: sati vastuni tadanudaya eva katham ity āha saty apī /ti /
analyzed: sati vastuni tad anudayaḥ eva katham iti āha sati
translated: When the object exists, how can they not arise? He says: Even when it exists.

analyzed: tad viṣayāyāḥ liṅga tvam api prakaraṇāt
translated: The fact that it is the mark of the apprehension of that [object] is understood from the context.

original: tadabhāvena saha sambandhābhāvasya tulyatvād i /ti yojyam /
analyzed: tad abhāvena saha sambandha abhāvasya tulya tvāt yojyam
translated: It should be connected as follows: because the absence of a relation with that non-existence is the same.

analyzed: upalabdhi rūpa bhāva rūpāyāḥ
translated: The apprehension in the form of existence, which is in the form of existence.

analyzed: anya bhāva rūpāyāḥ s
translated: Of the apprehension in the form of the existence of another.

original: kasmāt sakāśāt pramāṇāntaraṃ pratyakṣādikaṃ nāstīty āha anyabhāvaviṣayopalabdher i /ti /
analyzed: kasmāt sakāśāt pramāṇa antaram pratyakṣa ādikam na asti iti āha anya bhāva viṣaya upalabdheḥ
translated: From what other means of valid knowledge, such as perception, is there none? He says: Because of the apprehension of the object of the existence of another.

analyzed: kim iti sāmānyatas pṛcchati
translated: What is it? He asks in general.

original: punar i /ti viśeṣataḥ so 'nyabhāvo / yosau kevalapradeśalakṣaṇo 'nyabhāvaḥ pratyakṣalakṣaṇene /ndriyajapratyakṣalakṣanena /
analyzed: punar viśeṣataḥ saḥ nyabhāvaḥ yaḥ asau kevala pradeśa lakṣaṇaḥ nyabhāvaḥ
translated: Again, 'that' is the otherness in particular, which is the otherness characterized by the mere place, by the characteristic of perception, by the characteristic of perception arising from the senses.

original: etac ca prāyeṇa loko yasmāt kevalam idaṃ bhūtalaṃ tasmād ghaṭo 'tra nāstīti pratyayamukhena pratipadyata ity abhiprāyeṇoktaṃ draṣṭavyam
analyzed: etat ca prāyeṇa lokaḥ yasmāt kevalam idam bhū talam tasmāt ghaṭaḥ na asti iti pratyaya mukhena pratipadyate iti abhiprāyeṇa uktam draṣṭavyam
translated: And this should be seen as stated with the intention that the world mostly understands this by the means of the cognition 'This ground is merely this, therefore a pot does not exist here.'

original: anupalambhena siddha / iti ca tasyāpi pratyakṣasya tadanupalambharūpatvāt vāstavānuvādo boddhavyo na tu tasyānupalambharūpatāpratipādanam
analyzed: anupalambhena siddhaḥ iti ca tasya api pratyakṣasya tad anupalambha rūpa tvāt vāstava anuvādaḥ boddhavyaḥ na tu tasya anupalambha rūpa tā pratipādanam
translated: And 'is established by non-apprehension' should be understood as a true statement, because that perception also has the form of non-apprehension, but not as an explanation of its form of non-apprehension.

analyzed: idānīm prakṛtam na api upayuktam iti
translated: Now, the main point is not relevant, so it is said 'nor is it useful.'

analyzed: abhāva vyavahāram sādhayet na abhāvam iti arthāt
translated: It would establish the usage of non-existence, not non-existence, is the meaning.

analyzed: tasya eva siddha tvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is already established.

original: nanu anupalabdhyā abhāvavyavahāraḥ sādhanīyo na cāsau pradeśas tathety āha karmasthakriyāpekṣaye /ti /
analyzed: nanu anupalabdhyā abhāva vyavahāraḥ sādhanīyaḥ na ca asau pradeśaḥ tathā iti āha
translated: But if the usage of non-existence is to be established by non-apprehension, and that is not so for the region, he says 'with regard to the action of the object.'

original: upalabdheḥ karmasthatvāpekṣayā tatparyudāsenānyabhāvasya tathātvam ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: upalabdheḥ karma stha tva apekṣayā tad paryudāsena anya bhāvasya tathātvam iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the otherness is so by the exclusion of that, with regard to the object's being the locus of the apprehension.

original: pratyakṣaṇābhāvavyavahāraṃ pravartayitum anīśāno 'sya mate mūḍho vācyas tasya pratipattau
analyzed: pratyakṣaṇa abhāva vyavahāram pravartayitum sya mate mūḍhaḥ vācyaḥ tasya pratipattau
translated: One who is unable to bring about the usage of non-existence should be called deluded in understanding that, in his opinion.

analyzed: ca abhāva vyavahāra eka deśaḥ jñāna lakṣaṇaḥ anuṣṭhāna lakṣaṇaḥ vā vaktavyaḥ
translated: In that understanding, either the characteristic of knowledge or the characteristic of practice should be stated as a part of the usage of non-existence.

original: tasyāṃ sādhyāyāṃ vyavahāraś ca tad itaro draṣṭavyaḥ /
analyzed: tasyām sādhyāyām vyavahāraḥ ca tad itaraḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: When that is to be established, the usage should be seen as different from that.

original: mūḍhaṃ pratipattāraṃ prati taṃ sādhayati nāmūḍham iti ca samudāyārthaḥ /
analyzed: mūḍham pratipattāram prati tam sādhayati na amūḍham iti ca samudāya arthaḥ
translated: The collective meaning is that he establishes that for a deluded understander, not for a non-deluded one.

original: amūḍhasya p / tarhi kiṃ nibandhano 'sadvyavahāra ity āha yas tv i /ti /
analyzed: tarhi kim sat vyavahāraḥ iti āha yaḥ tu
translated: Then, what is the basis for the usage of non-existence for a non-deluded one? He says: But one who is non-deluded...

analyzed: prastāvena alam na kiñcid
translated: By implication. By this occasion, there is no need for anything.

original: tadekākāraniyataṃ paṭīyo 'pi pratyakṣaṃ nābhāvavyavahāraṃ🔽pravartayatum alam adṛṣṭānām api sattvān nityaṃ śaṃkyamānānupalambhavyabhicāro hy abhāvaḥ iti /
analyzed: tat eka ākāra niyatam pratyakṣam na abhāva vyavahāram  pravartayatum alam adṛṣṭānām api sattvāt nityam śaṃkyamāna anupalambha vyabhicāraḥ hi abhāvaḥ iti
translated: Even that perception which is restricted to one form is not able to bring about the usage of non-existence.🔽It is not able to bring about the usage of non-existence, because non-existence is the deviation of non-apprehension, which is always suspected even of unseen beings.

analyzed: dṛśya tva viśeṣaṇa apekṣāyām ca anupalabdhiḥ evā āyātā iti ca abhipraiti
translated: And when there is a need for the qualification of being perceptible, he intends that non-apprehension itself has come.

original: atra tu yathā prativaktavyaṃ tathāsmābhiḥsvayūthyavicāre vicāritaṃ vistareṇeti tata evāpekṣitavyam iti /
analyzed: atra tu yathā prativaktavyam tathā asmābhiḥ sva yūthya vicāre vicāritam vistareṇa iti tatas eva apekṣitavyam iti
translated: But here, as it should be replied, so it has been considered in detail by us in our own discussion. Therefore, it should be sought from there itself.

analyzed: pekṣāyām s
translated: In seeking,

original: yady api bahuprakārānupalabdhis tathāpi mūlabhūtaprakārapradarśanārthaṃ trividhe /ty uktaṃ draṣtavyam /
analyzed: yadi api bahu prakāra anupalabdhiḥ tathā api mūla bhūta prakāra pradarśana artham uktam draṣtavyam
translated: although many kinds are not perceived, still, in order to show the fundamental kinds, it is said to be of three kinds. It should be seen.

original: saviśeṣaṇā / saha viśeṣaṇena upalabdhilakṣaṇaprāptatvalakṣaṇena vartata iti /
analyzed: sa viśeṣaṇā saha viśeṣaṇena upalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāptatva lakṣaṇena vartate iti
translated: With a qualifier. It occurs together with a qualifier, with the characteristic of being perceptible.

original: tathā kāraṇavyāpakānupalabdhilakṣaṇasye /ti kāraṇavyāpakayor yānupalabdhiḥ tadviviktapradeśajñānātmikā tallakṣaṇasyeti /
analyzed: tathā kāraṇa vyāpakayoḥ yā anupalabdhiḥ tad vivikta pradeśa jñāna ātmikā tad lakṣaṇasya iti
translated: Similarly, of the characteristic of the non-apprehension of cause and pervader. The non-apprehension of cause and pervader, which consists of the knowledge of the place devoid of them, is the characteristic of that.

original: siddhasambandhayo /r iti iti mūlagranthasyāpekṣaṇāt saṅgatam idam /
analyzed: iti iti mūla granthasya apekṣaṇāt saṅgatam idam
translated: Of what is related. This is relevant because of the expectation of the root text of what is related.

analyzed: eka darśanena anya darśane tathā eka adarśanena anya darśane pi
translated: In the perception of that state. In the perception of one thing by the perception of another, and in the non-perception of one thing by the perception of another,

original: bhūyas tv aviśeṣaṇatve ca kriyamāṇe lohalekhyatvapārthivatvādinā pratyayavat tallabdhī
analyzed: bhūyas tu aviśeṣaṇa tve ca kriyamāṇe loha lekhya tva pārthiva tva ādinā pratyaya vat tad labdhī
translated: but when non-specificity is being made again, like the cognition by the perception of what is to be incised by iron and what is earthy, etc.,

analyzed: tad vivikta padārtha jñāna ātmike tayoḥ saṃdeha rūpa tvāt
translated: it consists of the knowledge of the thing devoid of that, because of the form of doubt in those two.

original: tadabhāvasya ca tayoḥ kāraṇavyāpakayor abhāvasyaca saṃdigdhalakṣaṇatā vācyā /
analyzed: tad abhāvasya ca tayoḥ kāraṇa vyāpakayoḥ abhāvasya ca saṃdigdha lakṣaṇa tā vācyā
translated: And the absence of those two, which are the cause and the pervader, should be stated to have a doubtful definition.

original: etad eva vidarbhavacanena mātrayā darśayann āha tv i /ti /🔽yadṛcchāsaṃvāda / iti bruvato yathāmalakakaṣāyarasatvādinā saṃskārādinā anyathābhāvasambhave 'pi sāhacaryādarśanasaṃvādas tathā vivakṣite
analyzed: etat eva vidarbha vacanena mātrayā darśayan āha  / puruṣasya tu  yadṛcchā saṃvādaḥ iti bruvataḥ yathā āmalaka kaṣāya rasa tva ādinā saṃskāra ādinā anyathā bhāva sambhave sāhacarya adarśana saṃvādaḥ tathā vivakṣite
translated: Indicating just this by the word but in the verse of Vidarbha, he says but.

analyzed: pi bhaviṣyati iti bhāvaḥ
translated: When one says coincidence by chance, even if the possibility of a different state by means of purification etc. like the astringent taste of myrobalan etc. exists, the coincidence of the observation of concomitance will be so even when intended. This is the idea.

analyzed: pratibandhaḥ sambandhaḥ bhidhātavyaḥ na tad pratibaddha tvam yathā anyatra
translated: The relation, which is the connection, should be stated, not the state of being connected with that, as in another case.

analyzed: sādhya sādhanayoḥ anupapatti prasaṅgāt
translated: Because of the consequence of the non-establishment of statements like between the probandum and the probans.

original: pratibandhe ceṣṭau ca sarveṣāṃ ca sādhyavatāṃ sādhyābhāvavattvena ca sādhanābhāvavatām arthatāṃ draṣṭṛma /
analyzed: pratibandhe ca iṣṭau ca sarveṣām sādhanavat tvena ca sādhyavatām sādhya abhāvavat tvena ca sādhana abhāvavatām arthatām
translated: And when the connection is ascertained, all those possessing the probandum should be seen to have the absence of the probandum, and those possessing the absence of the probans should be seen to have the absence of the probandum.

analyzed: pekṣa tve api vyāptimatoḥ anvaya vyatirekayoḥ niścayaḥ sañjāyate
translated: Even when there is dependence, the ascertainment of the positive and negative concomitance of the pervaded and the pervader arises.

analyzed: sā uyam upānaṭa dharma mātra
translated: This is the mere property of the shoe.

analyzed: pṛthivī ācchādanam nyāyaḥ prāyaḥ prakāraḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: The principle of covering the earth should be seen as mostly of that kind.

analyzed: jarat naiyāyika abhiprāyeṇa asya boddhavyam
translated: The Naiyāyika is to be understood in the sense of the old Naiyāyikas.

original: adhunatanāḥ punar anvayavyatirekiṇaṃ paṃcalakṣaṇam anvayinaṃ vyatirekiṇaṃ caturlakṣaṇalakṣaṇam
analyzed: adhunatanāḥ punar anvaya vyatirekiṇam paṃca lakṣaṇam anvayinam vyatirekiṇam catur lakṣaṇa lakṣaṇam
translated: But the moderns call the anvaya-vyatireki (reason) having five characteristics, and the anvayi and vyatireki (reasons) having four characteristics.

original: ācakṣata iti sāmānyenanaiyāyikagrahaṇe vyākhyāyamāne tanmatāvedanamasyāveditaṃ syād iti /
analyzed: ācakṣate iti sāmānyena naiyāyika grahaṇe vyākhyāyamāne tad mata āvedanam asya āveditam syāt iti
translated: If it is explained in general that the Naiyāyika is grasped, then the knowledge of their doctrine would not be conveyed by this (text).

original: saṃkhyāyā guṇatvena dravyāśritatvāddhetudravyasye /ty āha /🔽ekasaṃkhyānavacchinnāyām ity asyaivārthakathanaṃ p / pratiheturahitāyām / iti /
analyzed: saṃkhyāyāḥ guṇa tvena āha  eka saṃkhyā an avacchinnāyām iti asya eva artha kathanam pratihetu rahitāyām iti
translated: Since number, being a quality, depends on substance, he says: of the cause-substance.🔽The statement of the meaning of this (text) is: in the absence of a counter-reason.

analyzed: sādhya pratipakṣa sādhakaḥ hetuḥ pratihetuḥ tad rahitāyām
translated: A reason that proves the counter-thesis of the probandum is a counter-reason. In the absence of that.

analyzed: na vyabhicarati iti
translated: It does not err.

original: tathā jñātatvaṃ cā /paraṃ rūpam iti prāguktam anuvartate /
analyzed: tathā jñāta tvam rūpam iti prāc uktam anuvartate
translated: And the form of being known is the other form, as stated before. This continues.

analyzed: yathā ukta bādhā pramāṇena sādhya dharma nirākaraṇam tasmin sādhye sati
translated: The refutation of the probandum by the valid cognition that contradicts what was stated, when that probandum does not exist.

analyzed: vatā iti nipātaḥ nu viṣaye
translated: The particle va (in fact) has the sense of restriction.

analyzed: prakaraṇāt ākarṣaka niṣkāṣaka lakṣaṇe yantre vaktavye
translated: The word yantra-dvaya (two machines) should be stated as referring to the machine that attracts and the machine that expels, which are characterized by the context.

original: yathā kila kenacit kutūhalinā kaścit tapasvī strīrūpadhāriṇī tṛtīyāṃ prakṛtiṃ paricaraṇāyogyāṃ
analyzed: yathā kila kenacid kutūhalinā kaścid tapasvī strī rūpa dhāriṇī tṛtīyām prakṛtim paricaraṇa ayogyām
translated: Just as, it is said, a certain curious person, having married a certain ascetic who has taken on the form of a woman, who is not fit to be attended to as a third sex,

original: śabdavācyām udvāhya putraṃ tadarthakriyāṃ vā vyapadeśena prārthyate tena tulyam idaṃ
analyzed: śabda vācyām udvāhya putram tad artha kriyām vā vyapadeśena prārthyate tena tulyam idam
translated: who is expressible by words, requests for the sake of that [ascetic] the performance of the rite for the sake of a son or for the sake of [the ascetic's] purpose by way of designation, this is similar to that.

original: yadavinābhāvavikalaṃ hetum upadarśya dharmiṇi sādhyakathanam iti manvānaḥ paropahāsapūrvakamāhācaryaḥśaṇḍham🔽udvāhye /ti mūlamanūdyasyātvaṃrthaṃ /
analyzed: yat avinābhāva vikalam hetum upadarśya dharmiṇi sādhya kathanam iti manvānaḥ para upahāsa pūrvakam āha ācaryaḥśaṇḍham  mūlam anūdya sya atvam artham
translated: Thinking that this is like that, the master [Dharmakīrti], having shown a reason that is devoid of the relation of invariable concomitance, states the probandum with regard to the subject, and says this, preceded by a derisive remark to the opponent.🔽Having cited the root text having married, he shows the meaning of that.

analyzed: prakṛte yojayan darśayati tasmin
translated: Applying it to the present context, he says in that.

analyzed: tasmin sādhya dharmiṇi sādhya dharma sādhana śakti vikalam sādhya dharma prakāśana śakti viyuktam
translated: With regard to the subject, [the reason] is devoid of the power to prove the probandum property, is devoid of the ability to reveal the probandum property.

analyzed: tad vaikalyam ca tasya tatra tad avinābhāvi tayā aniṣṭeḥ
translated: That deficiency is due to the undesirability of that [reason] there by the relation of invariable concomitance.

analyzed: śabda arthasya etat vyākhyānam praticchāyayā draṣṭavyam
translated: This explanation of the meaning of the word should be seen as a mere shadow.

original: udvāhya / padārthaṃ tathaiva vyācakṣāṇa āha pariṇāyye /ti /
analyzed: udvāhya padārtham tathā eva vyācakṣāṇaḥ āha
translated: Explaining the meaning of the word having married in the same way, he says having taken a wife.

analyzed: pariṇāyya padena ca tad saṃbandha tva upadarśanam tat lakṣitam
translated: And by the word having taken a wife, the indication of the relation to that is characterized by that.

original: putraṃ mṛgyate / prārthyate yācyata iti yāvat /
analyzed: tad lakṣaṇam putram prārthyate yācyate iti yāvat
translated: A son is sought, i.e., requested, implored, etc.

original: nanu cānyatrāvinābhāvyapi hetus tatra sādhyaṃ vibhāvayed iti ko 'yam upahāsa ity āha nahī /ti /
analyzed: nanu ca anyatra avinābhāvī api hetuḥ tatra sādhyam vibhāvayet iti kaḥ yam upahāsaḥ iti āha
translated: But isn't it a joke to say that a reason which is invariably concomitant elsewhere may reveal the probandum there? He says: No, because...

analyzed: yat ambhaḥ tat lavaṇa rasam yathā sāmudram
translated: Whatever is water has a salty taste, like seawater.

original: ambhaś cedaṃ nādeyam iti prayoge caitad ucyata ity avaseyam /
analyzed: ambhaḥ ca idam na ādeyam iti prayoge ca etat ucyate iti avaseyam
translated: And this water is not drinkable - this should be understood as the statement when the reason is presented.

analyzed: lavaṇa tayā lavaṇa rasa tayā
translated: By saltiness, by having a salty taste.

analyzed: mṛgayate s
translated: He seeks.

original: ambhas tv ādiṣu / hetuyopanīteṣu tathā darśanāt /
analyzed: ambhaḥ tu ādiṣu hetuyā upanīteṣu tathā darśanāt
translated: But in water, etc., when the reasons are presented, because it is seen to be so.

analyzed: a bādhita dharmā a bādhita sādhya dharmā
translated: The property that is not contradicted.

analyzed: tad nipatasya bādhaka pramāṇa vṛtti niyatasya
translated: Of that which falls, which is restricted to the occurrence of the contradicting valid cognition.

original: vyāpakābhāve vyāpyasyāpy avaśyam abhāva iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: vyāpaka abhāve vyāpyasya api avaśyam abhāvaḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that in the absence of the pervader, the pervaded must also necessarily be absent.

analyzed: tad bhāvasya sādhya bhāvasya
translated: Of that existence, of the existence of the probandum.

original: ata eve /ti bādhakapramāṇe sati sādhyābhāvād eva /
translated: For this very reason, because of the absence of the probandum when there is a contradicting valid cognition.

original: tadabhāvepi / bādhakapramāṇavṛttyabhāvepi vā bhāvāt sādhyābhāvasyeti prakaraṇāt /
analyzed: tad abhāve api bādhaka pramāṇa vṛtti abhāve api vā bhāvāt sādhya abhāvasya iti prakaraṇāt
translated: Even in its absence, even in the absence of the occurrence of a contradicting valid cognition, because of the existence of the absence of the probandum, from the context.

original: hetoḥ sāmarthyaṃ hetusāmarthyaṃ tatpratipādayann āha paraḥ / /
analyzed: hetoḥ sāmarthyam hetu sāmarthyam tat pratipādayan āha paraḥ
translated: The opponent says, demonstrating the capability of the reason, the capability of the reason, The capability of the reason is...

analyzed: katham hetu sāmarthyam pratipādayati iti apekṣāyām yojyam  /
translated: How does he demonstrate? This should be connected. There, the otherness is...

original: p / darśayann iti / hetau śaturvidhānāt tatrābādhāyā anyathātvapradarśanād ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: darśayan iti hetau śatuḥ vidhānāt tatra ābādhāyāḥ anyathātva pradarśanāt iti arthaḥ
translated: Showing, in the present. Because the optative is used in the present, the meaning is that in that case, otherness is shown by non-obstruction.

analyzed: tad siddhaye sādhya siddhaye
translated: For the establishment of that. For the establishment of what is to be proven.

original: yatrāsau tadartham abhidhānīyaḥ sa hetuprayogasya viṣayaḥ / /
analyzed: yatra asau tad artham abhidhānīyaḥ sa hetu prayogasya viṣayaḥ
translated: Where that is, for that purpose, it should be stated. That is the domain of the use of the reason.

analyzed: tatra anyathā artham iti
translated: There, the meaning of otherness is...

original: vai /śabdo 'kṣamāyāṃ bādhānupalabdhir abādhetyādi yad ucyate tatra kṣamyata ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: kṣamāyām bādhā anupalabdhiḥ abādhā ityādi yat ucyate tatra kṣamyate iti arthaḥ
translated: The word va (indeed) is used in the sense of is acceptable in non-apprehension of obstruction is non-obstruction, and so on. The meaning is is acceptable.

analyzed: kiṃtu nipāta a nipāta samudāyaḥ praśne
translated: But what? In a question.

original: tasyā / itir mātrārthānāṃ bhayahetur apādānam ity apādānatvād apādāne pañcamīyam /
analyzed: tasyāḥ itiḥ mātrā arthānām bhaya hetuḥ apādānam iti apādāna tvāt apādāne pañcamīyam
translated: Of that is the ablative case in the sense of mere, because it is the source of fear, and because it is the ablative.

analyzed: vacana vinyāsaḥ vivakṣitaḥ
translated: Here, the word kāku (hum) is intended to mean the arrangement of words.

original: praśnārthasya kiṃ śabdasyāprayogepi kākur eva śiraḥkampasahitā praśnaṃ prakāśayatīty abhiprāyeṇa pṛcchatī /ti vyācaṣṭe /
analyzed: praśna arthasya kim śabdasya a prayoge api kākuḥ eva śiraḥ kampa sahitā praśnam prakāśayati iti abhiprāyeṇa vyācaṣṭe
translated: Even without the use of the word kiṃ (what), which is the meaning of the question, the hum sound accompanied by a head shake expresses the question. With this intention, he explains asks.

original: bādhānupalabdhir abādheti abhidhānād uktam etad i /ty abhiprāyavān paraḥ prāhoktam iti /
analyzed: bādhā anupalabdhiḥ abādhā iti abhidhānāt uktam etat abhiprāyavān paraḥ prāha uktam iti
translated: The other party, intending that this has been stated by the statement non-apprehension of obstruction is non-obstruction, says stated.

original: kim arthaṃ prayujyate / sa hetur iti sāmarthyāt /
analyzed: kim artham prayujyate sa hetuḥ iti sāmarthyāt
translated: For what purpose is it employed? The reason is by implication.

analyzed: abhāva niścayam sadbhāva niścayam prati
translated: For the ascertainment of non-existence, for the ascertainment of non-existence in the ultimate sense.

analyzed: saṃśayitasya bādhām prati jāta saṃdehasya
translated: For one who is doubtful, for one who has given rise to doubt regarding the contradiction.
By the cessation of knowledge, by the cessation of the contradictory cognition, that is the contradiction of the probandum.

original: ādi /śabdād anumānaviruddhādeḥ saṃgrahaḥ teṣāṃ / pratyakṣaviruddhādīnām upavarṇanaṃ / /
analyzed: anumāna viruddha ādeḥ saṃgrahaḥ teṣām pratyakṣa viruddha ādīnām upavarṇanam
translated: The word ādi includes inference and contradiction, etc. The description of those contradictions with perception, etc.

original: tadbhāvāyogād viṣayatvāyogāt sādhakapramāṇasyānumānasyāvṛtter yad uktaṃ vyastohetor anāśraya iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: tad bhāva ayogāt viṣaya tva ayogāt sādhaka pramāṇasya anumānasya avṛtteḥ yat uktam vyastaḥ hetoḥ anāśrayaḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: Because of the impossibility of its existence, because of the impossibility of being the object, and because of the non-occurrence of the proving cognition, the meaning is that the reason is not the basis of what is to be refuted.

original: kiṃ yathā bādhāvinābhāvayor i /ti pāṭho yuktarūpaḥ /
analyzed: yathā bādhā avinābhāvayoḥ pāṭhaḥ yukta rūpaḥ
translated: Is it as in the case of contradiction and invariable concomitance? This is the appropriate reading.

original: kiṃśabdaviyukte tu pāṭhe saśiraḥkampayākāṃkṣā evaṃvadataḥ praśno 'bhiprāyagato draṣṭavyaḥ /
analyzed: kiṃśabda viyukte tu pāṭhe sa śiraḥkampayā ākāṃkṣā evam vadataḥ praśnaḥ bhiprāya gataḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: But in the reading without the word kiṃ, the question of one who speaks thus with head shaking should be seen as being in the intention.

analyzed: katham yathā bādhā avinābhāvayoḥ
translated: How is it as in the case of contradiction and invariable concomitance?

analyzed: tad lakṣaṇam tasya hetoḥ lakṣaṇam
translated: That characteristic, the characteristic of that reason.

analyzed: anvaya vyatireka ātma avinābhāvaḥ
translated: Invariable concomitance has the nature of positive and negative concomitance.

analyzed: lakṣaṇa śabdasya ca asati bahuvrīhau ajahat liṅga tvāt sva liṅgena nirdeśaḥ
translated: And because of the indeclinability of the word lakṣaṇa in the absence of a bahuvrīhi compound, it is referred to by its own declension.

original: viruddhasyāpi viparyaye samyagdhetutvāt tadabhiprāyeṇa viparyayasya ce /ty uktam /
analyzed: viruddhasya api viparyaye samyak hetu tvāt tad abhiprāyeṇa viparyayasya uktam
translated: Because even a contradictory [reason] is a correct reason in the opposite [of the probandum], it is stated with that intention in and in the opposite of the probandum.
The establishment of existence is the establishment of reality, because that is not possible.

original: vivakṣitaikasaṃkhyatvapratipādita /m iti vivakṣitaikasaṃkhyatvaśabdena pratipāditam ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: iti vivakṣita eka saṃkhya tva śabdena pratipāditam iti arthaḥ
translated: It is stated by the word having the intended single number means it is stated by the word having the intended single number.

analyzed: etat iti asya

analyzed: etat hetu bhāvena viśeṣaṇam

analyzed: saḥ iti saḥ eva iti vivakṣitam

original: nirastapratipakṣatvam eva kuta ity āha tathāvidhe / tathā p / bhūtaviśeṣavati paṭū tathāvidhe sādhye kvacid dharmiṇi /
analyzed: nirasta pratipakṣa tvam eva kutas iti āha   tathā bhūta viśeṣavati tathāvidhe sādhye kvacid dharmiṇi

analyzed: saṃbhavati sati

Of what does not deviate from the probandum.

original: vedaprāmāṇyanirākartṛṣv i /ti pratyakṣādyadhikāropi tenāsaṃvādādītyādiṣv ity abhipretaṃ yad āha vārtike kumārilaḥ
analyzed: veda prāmāṇya nirākartṛṣu pratyakṣa ādi adhikāraḥ api tena asaṃvāda ādi ityādiṣu iti abhipretam yat āha vārtike kumārilaḥ
translated: By that, the author of the Vārtika Kumārila intends to include perception etc. in non-correspondence etc. when he says:

analyzed: svarga yāga ādi sambandha viṣayāḥ codanā mṛṣā
translated: The injunctions whose content is the relation between heaven and sacrifice are false.

original: pratyakṣādyadhikāropi tair arthāṃsaṃgatir yata Ślokavā / / ityādi /

But in the Ślokavārttika, it is said that the truthfulness of perception etc. is like the statement of Buddha etc. of this kind. The subsequent Dharma

analyzed: saugataiḥ pūrvaiḥ iti vivakṣitam
translated: is intended by the earlier ones of the author of the Vārttika, the followers of Buddha.

analyzed: pratihetavaḥ iti ityādayaḥ
translated: The counter-reasons etc.

analyzed: yathā āha kumārilaḥ  codanā janitā buddhiḥ pramāṇam doṣa varjitaiḥ
translated: As Kumārila says:

analyzed: kāraṇaiḥ janyamāna tvāt liṅga āpta ukti akṣa buddhi vat
translated: The cognition produced by the Vedic injunction is a means of valid knowledge, because it is produced by faultless causes,🔽like the cognition produced by inference, the statement of a reliable person, perception, and verbal testimony.

analyzed: ityādi
translated: As in the verse etc.

analyzed: tad nimitta saṃbhavāt a t ā

analyzed: ākrośa mātreṇa vipūrvapakṣe bhāṣikā mātreṇa

original: keṣāṃ na kaściddhetuḥ syād ityāha ekasaṃkhyāvādinām i /ti /
analyzed: keṣām na kaścid hetuḥ syāt iti āha eka saṃkhyā vādinām
translated: To whom no one would have a reason, he says of the proponents of the number one.

analyzed: samyak jñāna viparyaya hetuḥ iṣṭaḥ iti prāktanena ācārya granthena
translated: The cause of the error of right knowledge is accepted. By the previous text of the teacher.

original: a i /ty asyācāryagranthasya sambandhaḥ kārya iti /
analyzed: asya ācārya granthasya sambandhaḥ kāryaḥ iti

original: na kathañcid vyavacchedahetukaṃ / kenāpi prakāreṇa nityānityavyavacchedahetutvam /
analyzed: na kathañcid kena api prakāreṇa nitya anitya vyavaccheda hetu tvam

analyzed: tābhyām asya anvaya vyatara eka asiddheḥ abhiprāyeṇa eva ukte
translated: By those two, because of the non-establishment of sequence and simultaneity, it is said with the intention of the opponent.

analyzed: hetu tvam s
translated: The state of being a cause.

original: bhujam utkṣipya / bāhumūddh / / /vīrkṛtya phūtkurvan / phūtkāraṃ muñcann ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: bhujam utkṣipya phūtkurvan phūtkāram muñcan iti arthaḥ
translated: Raising the arm, having raised the arm, making a hissing sound, emitting a hissing sound, is the meaning.

analyzed: kaiścid
translated: By some, by Īśvarasena, Jinendra, Buddhi, and others.

analyzed: a pracchādanīyam an āvaraṇīyam
translated: Unconcealable, unobstructable.

analyzed: niraṃtarā prītiḥ vācyaḥ
translated: Continuous joy is to be described as heaven or liberation.

analyzed: apavargaḥ tu mokṣaḥ
translated: But liberation is liberation.

analyzed: sa ca darśana bhedāt anekavidhaḥ iṣṭaḥ

analyzed: svarga apavarga yojanam eva vaiyākaraṇa mata āśrayeṇa darśayan āha
translated: Showing the connection between heaven and liberation based on the Mīmāṃsaka view, he says Thus, indeed.

original: mīmāṃsakamatāśrayeṇāthavety anena pakṣāntaram āha vedāntaniṣevaṇāt / ātmatattvaniṣevaṇāt /
analyzed: mīmāṃsaka mata āśrayeṇa athavā iti anena pakṣa antaram āha vedānta niṣevaṇāt ātma tattva niṣevaṇāt
translated: By the Mīmāṃsaka view, he states another view with or by resorting to the Vedānta, by resorting to the truth of the self.

analyzed: prajñā jātīyena praśasta prajñena
translated: By one of excellent wisdom, by one of praiseworthy wisdom.

analyzed: ayam prayogaḥ prakaraṇāt jñātavyaḥ
translated: This application should be known from the context.

original: yad asya sāmarthyam āsīt tat tadupadarśanenotkīlitaṃ p / apanītaṃ / iti
analyzed: yat asya sāmarthyam āsīt tat tad upadarśanena utkīlitam apanītam iti
translated: Whatever power he had, that was removed by showing that, removed. Thus,

original: vyācakṣāṇaś cotkīlitam apanītaṃ sādhanasāmarthyaṃ yasya śrāvaṇatvalakṣaṇasya hetoḥ
analyzed: vyācakṣāṇaḥ ca utkīlitam apanītam sādhana sāmarthyam yasya śrāvaṇa tva lakṣaṇasya hetoḥ
translated: And while explaining, he removes the obstruction, the capacity of the proof, of the reason characterized as being audible,

analyzed: sa tathā uktaḥ mūlagranthaḥ iti darśayati
translated: And while explaining, he shows that the root text is so-called because the power of the proof, which has been dislodged and removed, belongs to the reason characterized as being audible.

original: nanu tāni vastūni te ca puruṣāḥ pratihetunaitadviparītarūpopadarśanadvārā tathābhūtāyāḥ saṃpadaḥ pracyāvyante /
analyzed: nanu tāni vastūni te ca puruṣāḥ prati hetunā etad viparīta rūpa upadarśana dvārā tathābhūtāyāḥ saṃpadaḥ pracyāvyante
translated: Indeed, those things and those persons are dislodged from such a state by the counter-reason, through the door of showing a form contrary to that.

original: na tu tena hetuneti kim ucyate tāni vastūni nityatvasaṃpadaḥ pracyāvya tāṃś ca puruṣāṇ svargāpavarasampada / iti cet /
analyzed: na tu tena hetunā iti kim ucyate tāni vastūni nitya tva saṃpadaḥ pracyāvya tān ca puruṣān svarga apavara sampadaḥ iti ced
translated: But it is said that those things are dislodged from the state of permanence and those persons from the state of heaven and hell by that reason. If so,

original: satyam etat kevalaṃ yasmād asau vidyamāna eva svayaṃ prāpitāyās tathābhūtāyāḥ saṃpadaḥ🔽pracyāvyamānā na samānajātīyena pareṇa vastūni tāṃś ca puruṣāṃs trāyasva trāyasveti
analyzed: satyam etat kevalam yasmāt asau vidyamānaḥ eva svayam prāpitāyāḥ tathābhūtāyāḥ saṃpadaḥ  pracyāvyamānāḥ na samāna jātīyena pareṇa tāni vastūni tān ca puruṣān trāyasva trāyasva iti
translated: it is true, but only because he, while dislodging those things and persons from such a state that has been brought about by himself,

original: phūtkāraṃ viplavam ābhāṣamāṇānīva svajīvitam apekṣamāṇa ivopekṣate /
analyzed: phūtkāram viplavam ābhāṣamāṇāni iva sva jīvitam apekṣamāṇaḥ iva upekṣate
translated: does not pay attention to them as if they were crying out Save me, save me! with a cry of distress, as if expecting his own life.

original: tasmāt pracyāvyā vayaṃ taṃ paraṃ prayuktaṃ ivety abhiprāyād adoṣatraya /
analyzed: tasmāt pracyāvyāḥ vayam tam param prayuktam iva iti abhiprāyāt
translated: Therefore, the intention is that we are dislodged by that other employed as if it were ourselves. Thus, there is no fault.

original: iti cet / sarvañcaitat kiṃ yo vastuto asaṃbhavāt pratihetur ityādidūṣaṇam avādhitaviṣayatve 'pi lakṣaṇe apoddhṛtyābādhapadaṃ 🔽prakṣipya vaktavyaṃ /
analyzed: iti ced sarvam ca etat kim yaḥ vastutas asaṃbhavāt pratihetuḥ ityādi dūṣaṇam lakṣaṇe apoddhṛtya ābādha padam  prakṣipya vaktavyam
translated: If this is so, then all this criticism, beginning with the fact that the reason is not really possible, should be stated by removing the word 'uncontradicted' and inserting 'uncontradicted' even in the definition.

original: ata evasmābhir etann idānam eva kiṃ vastuto 'saṃbhavadbādhatvam abādhitaviṣayatvam abhipretamutāpratibhāsamānabādhatvam api kiṃ tadaiva kiṃ
analyzed: atas eva smābhiḥ etat idānam eva kim vastutas saṃbhavat bādha tvam abādhita viṣayatvam abhipretam uta apratibhāsamāna bādha tvam api kim tadā eva kim
translated: Therefore, we have just now said: Is the uncontradictedness of the subject meant to be the non-existence of contradiction in reality, or the non-appearance of contradiction? Is it only then,

analyzed: vā anyeṣām api
translated: or also for others?

analyzed: tatra api kim tadā eva āhosvit ubhayam vada api
translated: And even there, is it only then, or both?

original: anyeṣām api kiṃ tadaivātha kālāntare 'pītyādi vikalpya sarvatra yathā dūṣaṇam
analyzed: anyeṣām api kim tadā evā atha kāla antare pi ityādi vikalpya sarvatra yathā yogam dūṣaṇam
translated: And for others also, is it only then, or even later? Thus, having considered the alternatives everywhere, the criticism

analyzed: upanayadbhiḥ ātma nirākaraṇe ādhita tvam ātma sādhanasya pratisaṃdhāna lakṣaṇasya
translated: that was brought up by those who refute the self, the qualification of the reason characterized by the recognition of the existence of the self,

analyzed: hetoḥ viśeṣaṇam apahastitam
translated: has been refuted.

original: tato 'nyair api jigīṣubhir abādhitatve viśeṣaṇe sarvatraivānayaiva diśā pratyavastheyam iti /
analyzed: tatas nyaiḥ api jigīṣubhiḥ abādhita tve viśeṣaṇe sarvatra eva anayā eva diśā pratyavastheyam iti
translated: Therefore, even by others who desire victory, the qualification 'uncontradicted' should be refuted everywhere in the same way.

analyzed: tad lakṣaṇam liṅga lakṣaṇam
translated: That definition. The definition of the logical mark.

analyzed: jñānasya eva bhāva pratyayena tvad pratyayena
translated: By the word 'bhāva' (existence) [in the compound 'bhāvapratyayena'], [the word] 'tvad' (your) [is understood].

analyzed: etat eva sādhayan āha
translated: Establishing just this, he says 'tathahi' (thus).

analyzed: svatantraḥ eva vācya vastu nirapekṣaḥ eva
translated: 'Eva' (only) means 'without depending on the expressed object'.

original: anarthapratilambha eva syāt / arthapratilambho na syād evety arthaḥ /
analyzed: anartha pratilambhaḥ eva syāt artha pratilambhaḥ na syāt eva iti arthaḥ
translated: 'Anarthapratilambha eva syāt' means 'there would be only the attainment of non-meaning, there would be no attainment of meaning at all'.

analyzed: asya vikalpa pratibhāsinaḥ sāmānya ākārasya
translated: 'Asya' (of this) refers to the form of the universal that appears in the conceptual cognition.

original: yady evaṃ bāhyasyaiva hetutvam astu tatkim anena prayāsenety āha sādhye /ti /
analyzed: yadi evam bāhyasya eva hetu tvam astu tat kim anena prayāsena iti āha
translated: If it is so, let the external [object] itself be the cause. What is the use of this effort? He says 'sādhye' (in the probandum).

original: kathaṃ tarhi vikalpārūḍhānāṃ sāmānyākārāṇāṃ paramārthato bāhyāṅgāsaṃsparśināṃ saṃpādakatvaṃ sādhyasādhanabhāvaḥ cety 🔽āśaṅkyāha taddharmatām eve /ti /
analyzed: katham tarhi vikalpa ārūḍhānām sāmānya ākārāṇām paramārthataḥ bāhya aṅga asaṃsparśinām saṃpādaka tvam sādhya sādhana bhāvaḥ ca iti  āśaṅkya āha tad dharma tām
translated: How then is there the relation of probandum and probans between the forms of universals that are superimposed on conceptual cognitions, which do not really touch the external parts, and the accomplishment [of the external object]?🔽Fearing such a doubt, he says 'tad-dharmatām eva' (the nature of that [external object] itself).

analyzed: tasya eva tad dharma tām bāhya vastu dharma tām
translated: 'Tad-dharmatām' means the nature of the external object.

analyzed: bāhya gataṃtām
translated: 'Bahirgatām' means 'external'.

analyzed: tad vyāvṛtti rūpa tām iti yāvat
translated: 'Tadvyāvṛttirūpatām' means 'the form of the exclusion of that'.

original: anusaraṃto / bhedāpratipattyā avidyamānanibandhanayādhyavasyanto nānaikavyatirekān / ekasminn apy arthe nānārūpaṃ kṛtakatvānityatvādi /
analyzed: bheda apratipattyā avidyamāna nibandhanayā adhyavasyantaḥ nānā eka vyatirekān ekasmin api arthe nānā rūpam kṛtaka tva anitya tva ādi
translated: 'Anusarat' means 'following' without understanding the difference, i.e. without a basis that does not exist. 'Nānā' means 'various', 'eka' means 'one', and 'vyatireka' means 'difference'. In one object, there are various forms such as being produced and being impermanent.

analyzed: eka tvam sāmānyam anugāmi rūpam
translated: 'Ekatvam' means 'sameness', which is the form that follows.

analyzed: vyatirekam tayoḥ
translated: The difference between them is mutual.

original: dharmiṇaś ca bhedaṃ hetau pradarśanād ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: dharmiṇaḥ ca bhedam hetau śatuḥ vidhānāt pradarśanāt iti arthaḥ
translated: The difference of the substratum is shown in the reason, this is the meaning.

analyzed: sādhya sādhana bhāva samarthana artham etat uktam draṣṭavyam
translated: This should be seen as stated for the purpose of establishing the relation of probandum and probans.

analyzed: āha   iti
translated: For the purpose of establishing the nature of agreement, he says in reality.

analyzed: vastuni sādhye rthe
translated: In reality, in the probandum, the object.

analyzed: paramparayā saṃbaddha saṃbaddha tayā
translated: By means of the connected and the unconnected.
For the purpose of establishing the designation as effect etc.

analyzed: yā āha
translated: He says effect etc.

original: kāryādidarśanadvārāyātatvāt tattvenādhyavasāyāc ca kāryādivyapadeśanibandhanaṃ / ta eva iti prakaraṇāt /
analyzed: kārya ādi darśana dvāra āyāta tvāt tattvena adhyavasāyāt ca   te eva iti prakaraṇāt
translated: Because it comes through the door of seeing the effect etc., and because of the ascertainment as if it were real, it is the basis of the designation as effect etc. Those very ones is understood from the context.

original: tena iti ca vyapadeśa indriyam asthānam etad rājana /
analyzed: tena iti ca vyapadeśaḥ indriyam asthānam etat rājana
translated: By that and designation are not the proper place for the senses, O king.

analyzed: iti nirdeśa vat draṣtavyaḥ
translated: It should be seen like the instruction.

analyzed: anusmaraṃtaḥ
translated: Remembering.

analyzed: kārya ādi liṅga vyapadeśa nibandhanam
translated: The basis of the designation of the inferential mark such as effect is the knowledge.

original: jñānasya bāhyaliṅgarūpatvaṃ nirākṛtya sāmānyākārarūpatvam api nirākurvann āha vikalpāvabhāsī ca / iti /
analyzed: jñānasya bāhya liṅga rūpa tvam nirākṛtya sāmānya ākāra rūpa tvam api nirākurvan āha vikalpa avabhāsī ca iti
translated: Having refuted the external inferential mark form of knowledge, he also refutes the universal form, saying and manifested by conceptualization.

analyzed: tasya vikalpa avabhāsinaḥ
translated: Of that, of the manifested by conceptualization.

analyzed: sāmānya ākārasya ca vyācakṣāṇaḥ līka rūpa tām apohasya abhipraiti
translated: When explaining that the form of the exclusion is of a general nature, he intends that the exclusion has a false form.

original: tadrūpasya / vicārato 'sadrūpasya vikalpapratibimbakasya / iti /🔽vikalpākārād bhedena pratyetum aśakyatvāt pratibimbasyeva pratibimbakasyāpohasya athavā anayā vacanabhaṅgyā buddhayākāro 'pi tathādhyasto 'poho
analyzed: tad rūpasya iti  vikalpa ākārāt bhedena pratyetum aśakya tvāt pratibimbasya iva pratibimbakasya apohasya athavā anayā vacana bhaṅgyā buddhayā ākāraḥ pi tathā adhyastaḥ pohaḥ
translated: Of that form, which is unreal when examined, a mental image.

analyzed: vācyaḥ iti darśitam anena
translated: Because the reflection cannot be cognized as different from the form of the concept, like a reflected image, or rather, by this analysis of the statement, it is shown that the form of the cognition, superimposed in that way, is also to be regarded as the exclusion.

original: kathaṃ tasya sāmānyātmatvavyvasthety āha yasmād i /ti /
analyzed: katham tasya sāmānya ātma tva vyvasthā iti āha yasmāt
translated: How is it established as having the nature of a universal? He says: because...

original: anuyāyitayā /dhya antaroktam anuvartate /🔽evaṃvidhasyāpi kiṃ na vikalpātmatā /
analyzed: anuyāyi tayā antara uktam anuvartate  evaṃvidhasya api kim na vikalpa ātma tā
translated: The previously stated [reason] is continued.🔽Why is it not of the nature of a concept, even if it is of this kind?

original: tathā ca jñānaṃ kiṃ na rūpaṃ liṅgasyety āha tathātve ca / iti /
analyzed: tathā ca jñānam kim na rūpam liṅgasya iti āha tathātve ca iti
translated: And how is the form of the inferential mark not knowledge in that way? He says: And in that case...

analyzed: tathātve anuyāyi tve
translated: In that case, in the case of being a universal.
The nature of being a concept, the nature of being a particular characteristic of a concept.

analyzed: prakṛtāyām prastutāyām
translated: In the present case, in the relevant case.

original: rūpam abhidhīyate / evaṃvidhaṃ liṅgasya rūpam ity abhidhīyate /
analyzed: abhidhīyate evaṃvidham liṅgasya rūpam iti abhidhīyate
translated: The form is stated. Such a form of the inferential mark is stated.

analyzed: saṃpratyayāt
translated: From the cognition, from the understanding.
The wheel of reflections of conceptualization is S.

analyzed: vyavasitasya s  vikalpa rūpa tā
translated: Of the determined is S.🔽The form of conceptualization is S.

analyzed: sva rūpam abhi s
translated: The own nature is S.

analyzed: saṃpratyayāt s
translated: From conviction is S.

analyzed: parama tā apekṣayā pramātuḥ
translated: From the point of view of the highest truth, of the cognizer is I.

analyzed: tathā saṃyoga samavāya ādīnām iti  āloka manaskāra ādīnām iti
translated: Thus, of conjunction, inherence, etc. is I.🔽Of light, attention, etc. is I.

original: vastuvṛttyapekṣayoktam /🔽na hi teṣv asatsv i /ti bruvato 'yaṃ bhāvo yadi tatra sādhyaṃ na bhavet tadā tadavyabhicārivastudarśanapranāḍikayā tatra jñānam eva na
analyzed: vastu vṛtti apekṣayā uktam  na hi teṣu asatsu bruvataḥ yam bhāvaḥ yadi tatra sādhyam na bhavet tadā tad avyabhicāri vastu darśana pranāḍikayā tatra jñānam eva na
translated: It is said with reference to the nature of things.

analyzed: bhavet
translated: For one who says if they do not exist, this is the meaning: if that which is to be established there would not exist, then knowledge of that would not exist at all through the medium of seeing a thing that is invariably concomitant with it.

original: yadi ca liṅge dhūmādau mahattvādisamavāyo na syāt /
analyzed: yadi ca liṅge dhūma ādau mahat tva ādi samavāyaḥ na syāt
translated: And if there were no inherence of largeness, etc. in the inferential mark such as smoke,

analyzed: yadi ca tasya indriyeṇa saṃyogaḥ na bhavet
translated: and if there were contact of that with a sense organ,

original: tadā tadviṣayaṃ pratyakṣam eva na bhavet /
analyzed: tadā tad viṣayam pratyakṣam eva na bhavet
translated: then perception of that would not exist at all.

original: asati ca tasmin na liṅgini vijñānam utpadyeta tathālokā bhāve 'pi tathaiva liṅgijñānānutpattir jñātavyā /
analyzed: asati ca tasmin na liṅgini vijñānam utpadyeta tathā ālokāḥ bhāve tathā eva liṅgi jñāna anutpattiḥ jñātavyā
translated: And if that does not exist, knowledge of the thing to be inferred would not arise. And the non-arising of knowledge of the thing to be inferred should be understood in the same way if light does not exist.

analyzed: tathā asati manaskāre sati
translated: And in the same way, if attention does not exist,

analyzed: manaskāra sādguṇyaḥ iti boddhavyam
translated: the excellence of attention should be understood.

analyzed: pūrvavān liṅgi jñāna anutpattiḥ ca
translated: And the non-arising of knowledge of the thing to be inferred is like before.

original: niścayo 'pīty eva pāṭhaḥ yatra pustake p / niścayo hī /ti pāṭhaḥ /
analyzed: niścayaḥ pi iti eva pāṭhaḥ yatra pustake pāṭhaḥ
translated: The reading niścayo 'pi is where the manuscript reads niścayo hi.

analyzed: tatra hi śabdaḥ u pi śabdasya vā arthe draṣtavyaḥ
translated: The word hi should be seen as the word api.

analyzed: tad viśeṣa tvāt jñāna viśeṣa tvāt
translated: Because of its being a particular of that. Because of being a particular of knowledge.

analyzed: asya niścayasya
translated: Of this. Of the ascertainment.

original: sapakṣe bhāvena / kiṃ bhūtenety āha vipakṣe / iti /
analyzed: sapakṣe bhāvena kim bhūtena iti āha vipakṣe iti
translated: By the presence in a similar instance. In what form? He says: in a dissimilar instance.

original: sarvatra vipakṣe yo 'bhāvaḥ tadviśiṣṭena / kiṃ bhūtena sarvatra vipakṣe yo 'bhāvenety āha sapakṣa / iti /
analyzed: sarvatra vipakṣe yaḥ bhāvaḥ tad viśiṣṭena kim bhūtena sarvatra vipakṣe yaḥ bhāvena iti āha sapakṣaḥ iti
translated: By that which is qualified by the absence in all dissimilar instances. In what form? By that which is qualified by the absence in all dissimilar instances. He says: in a similar instance.

original: tādātmyatadutpattī lakṣaṇe nimitte yasya bhāvasya sa tathā tadviśiṣṭena / /
analyzed: tādātmya tad utpattī lakṣaṇe nimitte yasya bhāvasya sa tathā tad viśiṣṭena
translated: That which has the nature of identity and origination as its cause is qualified by that.

original: nanu ca darśanādarśananibandhanau sapakṣāsapakṣayo bhāvābhāvāv apy anyonyaviśiṣṭāv eva tat ko 'tiśayo 'nenokta ity āśaṅkyāha etad
analyzed: nanu ca darśana adarśana nibandhanau bhāva abhāvau api anyonya viśiṣṭau eva tat kaḥ atiśayaḥ nena uktaḥ iti āśaṅkya āha etat
translated: But the presence and absence in similar and dissimilar instances are based on seeing and not seeing, and they are mutually qualified. What is the superiority stated by this? Suspecting this, he says:

analyzed: uktam
translated: This is said.

analyzed: pratibandha sādhaka pramāṇa vṛttyā tau
translated: The two are ascertained by the operation of the means of knowledge that establishes the relation,

analyzed: na tu darśana adarśanābhyām iti arthāt
translated: but not by seeing and not seeing. This is the meaning.

analyzed: tathāvidhau vyāptimāntau iti arthaḥ
translated: In that way. The meaning is: having the extent of pervasion.

analyzed: niścitau s
translated: The two are ascertained.

analyzed: tādātmya tad utpatti sādhana viṣayam tādātmya tad utpatti siddhi viṣayam
translated: The object of the proof of identity and origination. The object of the proof of identity and origination.

analyzed: tayoḥ eva bhāva abhāvayoḥ eva
translated: Of those two alone. Of existence and non-existence alone.

analyzed: ākṣipyate prakāśyate
translated: Is implied. Is revealed.

original: sattāyā anutpatter yā sattā utpatti /r iti vyācaṣṭe /
analyzed: sattāyāḥ anutpatteḥ yā sattā iti vyācaṣṭe
translated: He explains: The existence that is the origination of existence, because of non-origination.

original: abhāvalakṣaṇasya / pratiyogyapekṣayā tadviviktapadārthalakṣaṇasya paramatāśrayaṇena caivam abhidhānam siddhyanti / vyavahārayogyatām
analyzed: abhāva lakṣaṇasya pratiyogi apekṣayā tad vivikta padārtha lakṣaṇasya paramata āśrayaṇena ca evam abhidhānam siddhi anti vyavahāra yogyatām
translated: Of the characteristic of non-existence. Of the characteristic of the thing distinguished from that, in dependence on the opponent's view, this statement is established. They become suitable for usage.

analyzed: upayānti
translated: They attain.

analyzed: sarvasya iti puṃsaḥ
translated: Of all. Thus of the person.

original: tathā ca ayatnasiddhaḥ sarvaḥ sarvadarśīty āśayaḥ /
analyzed: tathā ca ayatna siddhaḥ sarvaḥ sarva darśī iti āśayaḥ
translated: And the intention is: All are effortlessly accomplished, omniscient at all times.

analyzed: na evam iti sambandhyate
translated: Not so is connected with this.

analyzed: liṅgasya prakṛta tvāt jñāpakasya iti āha
translated: Because the indicative is the subject, the reason.

analyzed: ācāryeṇa iti ācārya diś nāgena
translated: By the teacher. By the teacher Dignāga.

original: sūtrakārīyaniścitagrahaṇasāphalyam upavarṇayatāvārtikakṛtāsvānumatir atra darśitaivety abhiprāyeṇa ācāryavacanam iva kṛtvā iha asmābhiś ca
analyzed: sūtra kārīya niścita grahaṇa sāphalyam upavarṇayatā vārtika kṛtāsu anumatiḥ atra darśitā eva iti abhiprāyeṇa ācārya vacanam iva kṛtvā iha asmābhiḥ ca
translated: The author of the commentary has shown his own agreement here, thinking that the purpose of the word determined in the aphorism is described. With the intention that the words of the teacher are like this, we

analyzed: ityādi
translated: and so on.
The state of being thus is the pervasion and concomitance.

original: sarvatra tadabhāve avaśyam abhāvo neti pūrvakam anuvartanīyam /
analyzed: sarvatra tad abhāve avaśyam abhāvaḥ na iti pūrvakam anuvartanīyam
translated: In all cases, when that is absent, the previous statement must be continued: It is not necessarily non-existent.

analyzed: tasmāt yatas iti ādika vastukaḥ tu
translated: Therefore, the statement beginning with from which is based on reality.

original: anena subodhatvān na vyākhyātaḥ /🔽ayaṃ tv asyārtho 'vaseyo yata evaṃ tasmād / yataḥ pramāṇād anayor bhāvābhāvayor
analyzed: anena su bodha tvāt na vyākhyātaḥ  ayam tu asya arthaḥ vaseyaḥ yatas evam tasmāt yatas pramāṇāt anayoḥ bhāva abhāvayoḥ
translated: This is not explained because it is easily understood.🔽However, this meaning should be ascertained: Since it is so, therefore, from which means of knowledge the ascertainment of these existence and non-existence

original: bhavati niścayas tadadhīnatā tayor bhāvābhāvayoḥ sattā vyavasthety asyārthasya jñāpanārthaṃ
analyzed: bhavati niścayaḥ tad adhīna tā tayoḥ bhāva abhāvayoḥ sattā vyavasthā iti asya arthasya jñāpana artham
translated: occurs, that is the dependence of those existence and non-existence, the establishment of their existence. In order to show the meaning of this,

analyzed: niścita vacanam kṛtam iti
translated: the word ascertained is used.

original: ācāryadignāgakṛtaniścitagrahaṇārthe bhūyaḥ saṃhriyamāṇevartikakāreṇa katham ity ucyata ity āśaṃkyāha asmābhir i /ti /
analyzed: ācārya diś nāga kṛta niścita grahaṇa arthe bhūyas saṃhriyamāṇe vartika kāreṇa katham iti ucyate iti āśaṃkya āha asmābhiḥ
translated: When the treatise-writer is again composing the Ascertainment written by the master Dignāga, he says how? suspecting that it is said. He says by us.

analyzed: ācārya kṛte sūtrakāra ācārya kṛte
translated: In the master's composition, in the composition of the master who wrote the treatise.

original: niścitagrahaṇe / asmākam abhimatatvād i /ti vacanena caivaṃācāryasyābhiprāyaṃ darśayati /
analyzed: niścita grahaṇe asmākam abhimata tvāt vacanena ca evam ācāryasya abhiprāyam darśayati
translated: In the ascertainment, because it is accepted by us. By the statement thus, he shows the intention of the master.

original: tac ced asmākam abhimatam eva tadāsmābhir evoktam iti /
analyzed: tat ced asmākam abhimatam eva tadā asmābhiḥ eva uktam iti
translated: And if that is accepted by us, then it is said by us alone.

original: evaṃ tāvad anena vyākhyātaṃ lakṣyate punar ayam asyārthaḥ p / etad arthaṃ
analyzed: evam tāvat anena vyākhyātam lakṣyate punar ayam asya arthaḥ etat artham
translated: Thus far, this is explained. It is indicated. Again, this is the meaning of this: This is the purpose.

original: mayā ca viniścayādau niścitagrahaṇaṃ kṛtam ity abhipretyācāryavārtikakāreṇāvābhyām
analyzed: sūtrakāreṇa pramāṇasamuccaye mayā ca viniścaya ādau niścita grahaṇam kṛtam iti abhipretya ācārya vārtikakāreṇa āvābhyām
translated: And since I have used the word determined in the sense of decided in the Nītiśāstra, the author of the Ācārya commentary, intending this,

analyzed: iti asmin arthe smābhiḥ iti abhidhāyi iti
translated: says we have used the word 'we' in the sense of 'by us'.

original: dvayor arthayor bahuvacanaṃ kena vacaneneti asmadordvayoś ca ity aneneti brūma iti /
analyzed: dvayoḥ arthayoḥ bahuvacanam kena vacanena iti asmadoḥ dvayoḥ ca iti anena iti brūmaḥ iti
translated: By which word is the plural used for the two meanings? We say by the word 'asmad' for the two 'as' and 'mas'.

original: ato 'pi nyāyāt iti pāṭhoḥ ata eva nyāyāt / iti tu pramādapāṭhaḥ /
analyzed: nyāyāt iti atas eva nyāyāt iti tu pramāda pāṭhaḥ
translated: Therefore, the reading from this reasoning is from this very reasoning. This is a careless reading.

analyzed: pratipanna tvāt jñānasya iti prakaraṇāt
translated: Because it is understood. Of knowledge is from the context.

original: trairūpyāt jñānaṃ / / / / rūpāntaraṃ na bhavatīty anuvartate /
analyzed: trairūpyāt jñānam rūpa antaram na bhavati iti anuvartate
translated: Because of having three forms, knowledge is not a different form. This continues.

original: sapakṣe bhāva ucyata / ity anena ca sādhye saty eva bhāvo lakṣitas tathā abhāvo 'sapakṣa / ity anena asati sādhye abhāva eva vivakṣitaḥ
analyzed: sapakṣe bhāvaḥ ucyate iti anena ca sādhye sati eva bhāvaḥ lakṣitaḥ tathā sapakṣe iti anena asati sādhye abhāvaḥ eva vivakṣitaḥ
translated: The presence in a similar instance is stated. And by this, only the presence when the probandum is present is indicated. Similarly, the absence in a dissimilar instance is stated. By this, only the absence when the probandum is absent is intended.

original: vyāvṛttikṛtaṃ bhedam upādāya / iti tatrābhāvavyāvṛttyā bhāvo vyavasthāpyate /
analyzed: vyāvṛtti kṛtam bhedam upādāya iti tatra abhāva vyāvṛttyā bhāvaḥ vyavasthāpyate
translated: Taking the difference made by exclusion. By the exclusion of absence there, presence is established.

analyzed: tatra bhāvayā āvṛttyā abhāvaḥ iti
translated: By the exclusion of presence there, absence is established.

original: paramārthato bhedo nāsti / iti bhāvaḥ tasmin saty eva bhāvo bhavitṛtvaṃ
analyzed: paramārthataḥ bhedaḥ na asti iti bhāvaḥ tasmin sati eva bhāvaḥ bhavitṛ tvam
translated: In reality, there is no difference. This is the meaning. When that is present, presence is the state of being a producer.

original: tadabhāvo cābhāva evābhavitṛtvaṃ evam eva hetoḥ svagata evāyaṃ dharmo 'ta eva yatrānvayas
analyzed: ca abhāvaḥ eva abhavitṛ tvam evam eva hetoḥ svagataḥ eva ayam te eva yatra anvayaḥ
translated: And the absence of that is just non-existence. In the same way, this property belongs to the reason itself. Therefore, where there is positive concomitance,

original: tatra vyatireka iti svabhāvahetusādhyam etad avatiṣṭhate /🔽na tattvātv arthā
analyzed: tatra vyatirekaḥ iti svabhāva hetu sādhyam etat avatiṣṭhate  na tattvā tu arthā
translated: there is negative concomitance. This is established as the conclusion of the reason based on identity.

analyzed: patti gamyam iti
translated: It is not to be understood through presumption based on reality.

original: nanu ca yady anayoḥ parasparāntarbhāvo na bhavet tarhi katham ekaṃ vākyam ubhayaṃ gamayet /
analyzed: nanu ca yadi anayoḥ paraspara antarbhāvaḥ na bhavet tarhi katham ekam vākyam ubhayam gamayet
translated: But if these two were not mutually inclusive, then how could a single sentence convey both?

analyzed: tathā ca etat pūrva uktam kim rhi iti
translated: And this has been stated before: The two are not different in nature.

original: bhinnalakṣaṇam eva / vyāvṛttito bhinnasvabhāvam eva santaṃ tataś ca bhinnatvāt anayor liṅgarūpatvāc ca pṛthagavayavāntaratvaṃ yuktam
analyzed: bhinna lakṣaṇam eva vyāvṛttitaḥ bhinna svabhāvam eva santam tatas ca bhinna tvāt anayoḥ liṅga rūpa tvāt ca pṛthak avayava antara tvam yuktam
translated: It has different characteristics. It exists as having a different nature due to exclusion. And because of that difference, and because of being a logical reason, it is proper to have a separate intermediate part.

analyzed: iti bhāvaḥ
translated: This is the idea.🔽If one nature...

original: yady ekaḥ svabhā / / / / / / / / / / / / / / /yaduktapūrvaṃ tadavastham evety āha paraspara / ityādi /
analyzed: yadi ekaḥ tad avastham eva iti āha parasparaḥ ityādi
translated: What was said before remains as it is. He says mutually and so on.

analyzed: eka vākyāt eka vākya artha rūpa tvāt
translated: From one sentence. Because of having the form of one sentence meaning...🔽In the similar and dissimilar instances, the presence and absence do not exclude each other. What is the use of this non-rebuttal

original: bhāvābhāvayor aparasparākṣepād iti siddhāntavādinābhihitaṃ kim anena tadapratividhāyakena
analyzed: bhāva abhāvayoḥ a paraspara ākṣepāt iti siddhāntavādinā abhihitam kim anena tad apratividhāyakena
translated: by the proponent of the established doctrine?

original: na tv i /tyādinoktena ity āśaṅkya pūrvapakṣavādimata eva / / / / / / / / / / / / / / /darśayitum
analyzed: na tu iti āśaṅkya pūrvapakṣavādi mate eva darśayitum
translated: In order to show that the view of the opponent himself is the one that is being refuted, beginning with but not this, etc., he says:

analyzed: āha ayam abhiprāyaḥ iti
translated: This is the intention.🔽The absence of that is understood. Otherwise, this statement would not have the purpose of that.

original: tadabhāvo 'bhāvo gamyate anyathā tadarthaivāsyā vākyasya na syād / / / / / / / / /ta iti vartate /
analyzed: tad abhāvaḥ bhāvaḥ gamyate anyathā tad arthā eva asyāḥ vākyasya na syāt iti vartate
translated: The word that continues.

original: pratibandhaś ca / pratibaddhatvañ ca hetor ity arthāt /
analyzed: pratibandhaḥ ca pratibaddha tvam ca hetoḥ iti arthāt
translated: And the connection, and the fact of being connected, of the reason, is understood.

analyzed: tādātmya tad utpattibhyām tādātmyena tad utpattyā vā
translated: By identity and origination from that, by identity or origination from that.

original: tadbhāve bhāvarūpa eve /ti vicārata etad avatiṣṭhate /🔽yata ity abhiprāyeṇoktaṃ ekavākyeneti pīno devadatta ityādinā tata evaikavākyāntarabhāvād i /ti
analyzed: tad bhāve bhāva rūpa vicārataḥ etat avatiṣṭhate  yatas iti abhiprāyeṇa uktam eka vākyena iti pīnaḥ devadattaḥ ityādinā tata
translated: In the existence of that, the form is only existence. This is established by consideration.

analyzed: vākya artha antaraḥ
translated: With the intention that this is so, it is said that it is by a single sentence. By the statement Pīna Devadatta, etc., from that itself, the existence of a different sentence is understood.

analyzed: kadācid pādana kāle dṛṣṭāt iti abhiprāyeṇa uktam
translated: At the time of establishing a different meaning of the sentence, it is seen. With the intention that this is so, it is said that it is by a different meaning of the sentence, which does not depend on the meaning of the single sentence.

analyzed: u iti arthaḥ
translated: This is the meaning.

original: tadantarbhāvamātreṇa / ekavākyārthāntarbhāvamātreṇa niyamavadvākyavyapakṣeyā kadācid dṛṣṭena tadantarbhāvāt /
analyzed: tad antarbhāva mātreṇa eka vākya artha antarbhāva mātreṇa niyamavat vākya vyapakṣeyā kadācid dṛṣṭena tad antarbhāvāt
translated: By mere inclusion in that, by mere inclusion in the meaning of the single sentence, the sentence is sometimes seen to be regulated, because of inclusion in that.

original: ekarūpāntarar bhāvāt tu dvitīyagati /r neti vartate /
analyzed: bhāvāt tu na iti vartate
translated: But the second cognition is not, because of the existence of a different form.

original: bhinnarūpāv eve /ti yathā tayā / / / / / /ta tathā bhinnarūpāv eveti /
analyzed: bhinna rūpau yathā tayā tathā bhinna rūpau eva iti
translated: They are indeed of different forms, just as they are cognized as different.

analyzed: tatas śāstrāt
translated: From that, from the treatise.

analyzed: sarvadā ca atra jñāta tva upalakṣaṇam jñātavyam
translated: And here the word 'jñāna' (knowledge) should always be understood as indicating the state of being known,

analyzed: jñātana śabdena asya eva vivakṣi tvāt
translated: because it is this very thing that is intended by the word 'jñāna'.

analyzed: etat ca purastāt upadarśitam eva
translated: And this has already been shown earlier.

original: syād etat ye tāvat jñātatvaśabdena jñānam evābhidadhate te santūktayā nītyā nirākṛtāḥ /
analyzed: syāt etat ye tāvat jñāta tva śabdena jñānam eva abhidadhate te santu uktayā nītyā nirākṛtāḥ
translated: This may be said: As for those who express knowledge itself by the word 'jñātatva' (knownness), let them be refuted by the stated method.

original: ye tu jñānakarmatvaṃ / / / / / / / / /nirākriyante ity āśaṅkāyām āha tad ayam atra / ityādi /
analyzed: ye tu jñāna karma tvam jñāta tvam nirākriyante iti āśaṅkāyām āha tat ayam atra ityādi
translated: But those who deny the state of being an action of knowledge are refuted, in case of doubt, he says 'this is the meaning here' etc.

analyzed: tad apekṣaḥ pi jñāna apekṣaḥ pi
translated: Even though it depends on that, it depends on knowledge.

original: prakaraṇam upasaṃharann āha tad evam i /ti /
analyzed: prakaraṇam upasaṃharan āha tat evam
translated: Concluding the topic, he says 'thus' etc.

original: trīṇi pakṣadharmānvayavyatirekātmakāni lakṣaṇāni yasya sa tathokta iti sarvam avadātam /
analyzed: trīṇi pakṣa dharma anvaya vyatireka ātmakāni lakṣaṇāni yasya sa tathā uktaḥ iti sarvam avadātam
translated: He who has three characteristics consisting of the property of the subject, positive concomitance, and negative concomitance is said to be so. All is clear.
The Tattvaprakāśikā🔽Commentary, so extensive, is composed for the sake of others, by me, surely some merit

original: ṭīkāṃ paṭīyasīm īdṛśīṃ parārtham uddiśya praṇayatā niyataṃ mayāpi kim api puṇyaṃ
analyzed: ṭīkām paṭīyasīm īdṛśīm para artham uddiśya praṇayatā niyatam mayā api kim api puṇyam
translated: has been acquired by me.

original: upārjitaṃ tad apy ahaṃ parārtham upanayām iti manvāno 'nekajanmābhyastakṛpāyogāt
analyzed: upārjitam tat api aham parārtham upanayām iti manvānaḥ na eka janma abhyasta kṛpā yogāt
translated: Thinking that even what is acquired is for the sake of others, by the yoga of compassion practiced in many lives,

analyzed: sātmībhūta para artha karaṇaḥ yam bhadanta dharma ākara dattaḥ imam ityādi pariṇāmanā ślokena āha
translated: this venerable Dharmakīrti, who has made his own the performance of others' aims, says this with the verse on dedication, beginning with I will illuminate the lamp of the teaching of the Sage...

original: asyāyaṃ samudāyārthaḥ ntanayapradīpam / vivṛtya yat puṇyam upārjitaṃ tat jagato viśuddhiṃ vidheyāt / iti /
analyzed: asya ayam samudāya arthaḥ yat puṇyam upārjitam tat jagataḥ viśuddhim vidheyāt iti
translated: The collective meaning of this is: Whatever merit is acquired by illuminating the lamp of the teaching of the Sage, may it be for the purification of the world.

original: kāyavāṅmanomaunayogān munayaḥ pratyekabuddhādayas teṣāṃ īśaḥ śāstā buddho bhagavān savāsanakleśaparihāṇiyogenāta /
analyzed: kāya vāc manaḥ mauna yogāt munayaḥ pratyekabuddha ādayaḥ teṣām īśaḥ śāstā buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: The sages, such as the Pratyekabuddhas, are those who are engaged in the yoga of bodily, verbal, and mental silence. The Lord of them, the Teacher, is the Buddha, the Blessed One, by virtue of having attained the abandonment of afflictions along with their latent tendencies.

original: bhyas tasya prakarṣaprāptayā tāyitvāt tasya nayo nītiḥ pravacanaṃ tasya rāddhāntaḥ🔽siddhāntas tasya / / / / / / / / / / / /kṣaṇikāḥ sarvasaṃskārā ityādi pravacanārthasyānena
analyzed: tasya prakarṣa prāptayā tāyi tvāt tasya nayaḥ nītiḥ pravacanam tasya rāddhāntaḥ  siddhāntaḥ tasya kṣaṇikāḥ sarva saṃskārāḥ ityādi pravacana arthasya anena
translated: Because he is the protector by attaining the highest degree of that [abandonment], his way is the method, his teaching.🔽His conclusion is the final view.

original: yathāvatprakāśanāt kutsitaḥ pramāṇānupapannārthaprakāśanāt tarko nyāyadarśanādir iti tathā /
analyzed: yathāvat prakāśanāt kutsitaḥ pramāṇa anupapanna artha prakāśanāt tarkaḥ nyāya darśana ādiḥ iti tathā
translated: By this [verse], the meaning of the teaching that all conditioned things are momentary and so on is illuminated as it truly is. Therefore, reasoning, such as the Nyāyamukha, is censured because it illuminates a meaning that is not established by valid cognition. Thus [it is called] censured reasoning.

analyzed: aśeṣaḥ ca asau sa ca iti tathā
translated: And it is complete because it is all of that, and that [i.e., the teaching].

original: tasya mārgaḥ / panthāḥ siddhānta ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: tasya mārgaḥ panthāḥ siddhāntaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: His path is the path, the meaning is the established conclusion.

original: kṣataḥ khaṇḍitaḥ tadvairūpyāpādanād aśeṣaḥ kutarkamārgo yena sa tathā /
analyzed: kṣataḥ khaṇḍitaḥ tad vairūpya āpādanāt aśeṣaḥ kutarka mārgaḥ yena sa tathā
translated: He is so called because he has destroyed all the path of bad reasoning by bringing about its disfigurement.

analyzed: tam vyākhyāya rthāt
translated: Having opened up that,

original: tat puṇyaṃ / kartṛ viśuddhiṃ / vimalacittasaṃtati parāṃ / prakṛṣṭāṃ sarvāvaraṇaprahāṇād iti sarvam anavadyam iti /🔽vitatya S
analyzed: tat puṇyam kartṛ viśuddhim vimala citta saṃtati parām prakṛṣṭām sarva āvaraṇa prahāṇāt iti sarvam anavadyam iti  vitatya s
translated: the merit from that, the agent, purity, the most excellent continuum of the mind, the highest, because of the abandonment of all obscurations, thus all is irreproachable.🔽Having expanded

analyzed: vitatya s
translated: Having expanded

original: p / dāridryaduḥkhād abhiyogamātrād viśuddhabuddher virahād abodhāt /
analyzed: dāridrya duḥkhāt abhiyoga mātrāt viśuddha buddheḥ virahāt abodhāt
translated: From poverty and suffering, from mere application, from the absence of a pure mind, from ignorance,

original: nāstīha sūktaṃ mama yat punaḥ syāt gurorjitāreḥsa khalu prasādaḥ //
analyzed: na asti iha sūktam mama yat punar syāt guroḥ jita areḥ sa khalu prasādaḥ
translated: There is nothing here that I could say again. That is indeed the grace of the teacher Jitāri.

original: kutūhalenaiva yadṛcchayā vā mātsaryato yā vā
analyzed: kutūhalena eva yadṛcchayā vā mātsaryataḥ vā
translated: Out of curiosity or chance, or out of stinginess, or

original: svata eva rūpaṃ vijñāsyate 'syeti na varṇayāmaḥ //
analyzed: svatas eva rūpam vijñāsyate sya iti na varṇayāmaḥ
translated: out of its own accord, its form will be known by itself, thus we do not describe it.

analyzed: kṛtaḥ yam arcaṭā lokaḥ nibandhaḥ bālabāndhavaḥ
translated: This treatise called Arcatāloka has been composed as a friend to the ignorant,

analyzed: yatra mūrtiḥ iva ādarśe dṛśyate sva para sthitiḥ
translated: Where one's own and others' states are seen as if in a mirror.

original: parārtham uddiśya yathārthamarcaṭaṃvivṛṇya puṇyaṃ yadupārjitaṃ mayā /
analyzed: para artham uddiśya yathārtham arcaṭam vivṛṇya puṇyam yat upārjitam mayā
translated: Having explained the Arcatāloka according to its meaning for the sake of others, whatever merit I have acquired,

original: nihantu tenāvaraṇāni vidviṣo janontarāyeṇa vinaiva sarvathā //
analyzed: nihantu tena āvaraṇāni vidviṣaḥ vinā eva sarvathā
translated: May he destroy all obscurations and enemies, without any obstacles whatsoever.

analyzed: samāptaḥ ca ā nibandhaḥ
translated: The treatise is concluded.

analyzed: kṛtiḥ iyam paṇḍita durveka miśrasya iti
translated: This is the work of the scholar Durvekamiśra.
